ListConvolve
ListConvolve[list, ker] forms the convolution of the kernel ker with list.

---

ProgressIndicator
ProgressIndicator[val] represents a comple progress bar indicator.
ProgressIndicator[val, {min,max}] represent a progress bar, that rescales val from min to max

---

Cells
Cells[] returns all cells of the current notebook

---

Cell
Cell[expr_String] is an object that represents a complete cell in a notebook.
Cell[expr, "Input"] represents input cell.
Cell[expr, "Output", "HTML"] represents output HTML cell.
Cell can be used in NotebookWrite, CreateDocument, CellPrint or CreateWindow

---

ExpressionCell
ExpressionCell[expr] represents a cell containing expr.
ExpressionCell can be used in NotebookWrite, CreateDocument or CellPrint

---

TextCell
TextCell[string] represents a text cell.
TextCell can be used in NotebookWrite, CreateDocument or CellPrint

---

NotebookDelete
NotebookDelete[cellObj] deletes provided cell from the notebook or closes a window.

---

NotebookRead
NotebookRead[notebook] reads the current focused cell in a notebook.
NotebookRead[cellObject] reads the current cellObject in a notebook and returns Cell.

---

CreateWindow
CreateWindow[expr] creates a new window displaying expr.
CreateWindow[Cell[string, "Output", "HTML"]] creates a new window displaying string as HTML output.

---

WindowSize
WindowSize->{width, height} is an option used in CreateWindow

---

NotebookLocationSpecifier
NotebookLocationSpecifier[cellObject, pos] specifies a location where to insert a cell, where pos can be "After" or "On" (rewrites the content).
For example NotebookWrite[NotebookLocationSpecifier[NotebookFocusedCell[], "After"], 1+1]

---

CellPrint
CellPrint[expr] prints a cell with expr in a StandardForm
CellPrint[string] prints an output cell with a raw text content
CellPrint[TextCell[string]] prints a markdown cell
CellPrint[Cell[string, "Output", "Markdown"]] prints a markdown cell
CellPrint[string, "Display"->"html"] outputs a cell with HTML content
CellPrint[string, "Display"->"latex"] outputs a latex cell

---

ToTabular
ToTabular[data] converts data to a Tabular object.
ToTabular[data,form] converts from data with structure specified by form.
ToTabular[data,form,assoc] uses directives from the association assoc to give details of the conversion.

---

FromTabular
FromTabular[tab,"form"] converts a Tabular object tab to an object given by "form".
FromTabular[tab,"form",assoc] uses directives from the association assoc to give details of the conversion.

---

InsertColumns
InsertColumns[tab,{col1->cval1,…}] inserts the column cvali with name coli in the tabular object tab.
InsertColumns[cspec] represents an operator form of InsertColumns that can be applied to a tabular object.

---

DeleteColumns
DeleteColumns[tab,cspec] deletes the columns specified by cspec from the tabular data tab.
DeleteColumns[cspec] represents an operator form of DeleteColumns that can be applied to tabular data.

---

RenameColumns
RenameColumns[tab,{col1->newcol1,…}] renames column coli to newcoli in a Tabular object tab.
RenameColumns[tab,{newcol1,newcol2,…}] renames column i to newcoli in tab.
RenameColumns[renamings] represents an operator form of RenameColumns that can be applied to a Tabular object.

---

TransformColumns
TransformColumns[tab,ncol->f] adds a new column with name ncol by transforming the tabular data tab using the function f applied to each row.
TransformColumns[tab,{ncol1->f1,ncol2->f2,…}] adds several new columns ncoli by successively applying the functions fi to each row.
TransformColumns[transfs] represents an operator form of TransformColumns that can be applied to tabular data.

---

ConstructColumns
ConstructColumns[tab,{col1,col2,…}] constructs new tabular data formed by extracting columns coli from the tabular data tab.
ConstructColumns[tab,{ncol1->f1,ncol2->f2,…}] returns new tabular data with columns ncoli constructed by applying the functions fi to each row of tab.
ConstructColumns[cspec] represents an operator form of ConstructColumns that can be applied to tabular data.

---

TabularQ
TabularQ[tab] gives True if tab is a valid Tabular object and False otherwise.

---

TabularColumn
TabularColumn[{v1,v2,…}] gives a vector with elements with values vi with an efficient element type determined automatically.
TabularColumn[{…},etype] uses element type etype.
TabularColumn[{…},etype,method] uses method to convert elements to etype.

---

TabularRow
TabularRow[data] represents a single row of a Tabular object.
TabularRow[data,{key1,key2,…}] sets keyi as the name of column i of the tabular row object.

---

TabularStructure
TabularStructure[tab] gives structural information about the Tabular tab for each column.
TabularStructure[tab,cols] gives structural information for the columns cols.
TabularStructure[tab,cols,props] selects the properties props to report.

---

TabularSchema
TabularSchema[…] represents the schema information associated with a Tabular object.
TabularSchema[tab] extracts the schema information for the tabular object tab.
TabularSchema[schema,"prop"->val] modifies the existing TabularSchema object schema with the new value val for the property "prop".
TabularSchema[schema,<|"prop1"->val1,…|>] modifies multiple properties.

---

TabularStructure
TabularStructure[data] gives structural information about the Tabular tab for each column.

---

Tabular
Tabular[data] creates a tabular object from rectangular data representing a list of rows.
Tabular[data,{key1,key2,…}] sets keyi as the name of column i of the tabular object.

---

CreateDocument
CreateDocument[{expr1, expr2, ...}] creates an empty notebook and populates with the content. 
Use the option Visible->False to create the content and the notebook offscreen

---

NotebookOpen
NotebookOpen[nb] opens programmatically notebook nb given by RemoteNotebook object or a path

---

NotebookWrite
NotebookWrite[nb, expr] write expr as a cell, or group of cells or as normal expression to the notebook nb

---

NotebookClose
NotebookClose[nb] closes opened notebook nb or window

---

NotebookSave
NotebookSave[nb] or NotebookSave[nb, path] saves notebook nb to a file given by path or using the existing temporal path

---

NotebookEvaluate
NotebookEvaluate[nb] evaluates all cells of the notebook.
Not recommended to use, since it breaks the evaluation order. Consider NotebookEvaluateAsync instead

---

Animate
Animate[expr_, {t, tmin, tmax}] animates expr starting from tmin to tmax with a default rate.

---

EvaluationNotebook
EvaluationNotebook[] gives the notebook in which this function is being evaluated. 

---

Let
A With-like construction that allows recursive assignments, like Let* in scheme

---

CreateType
CreateType[type, parent, init, {fields}] create type

---

Button
Button[<i>label</i>,<i>action</i>] represents a button that is labeled with <i>label</i>, and evaluates <i>action</i> whenever it is clicked. 

---

CellularAutomaton
CellularAutomaton[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>,<i>t</i>] generates a list representing the evolution of the cellular automaton with the specified rule from initial condition <i>init</i> for <i>t</i> steps. 

CellularAutomaton[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>] gives the result of evolving <i>init</i> for one step. 

CellularAutomaton[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>,{<i>tspec</i>,<i>xspec</i>,…}] gives only those parts of the evolution specified by <i>tspec</i>, <i>xspec</i>, etc. 

CellularAutomaton[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>,{<i>t</i>,All,…}] includes at each step all cells that could be affected over the course of <i>t</i> steps. 

CellularAutomaton[<i>rule</i>] is an operator form of CellularAutomaton that represents one step of evolution.

---

CreateFrontEndObject
CreateFrontEndObject[expr] uploads expression to frontend storage and creates a reference to it. On output it will try to evaluate it using WLJS Intepreter

---

Riffle
Riffle[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives {<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i>,…}. 

Riffle[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives {<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}. 

Riffle[<i>list</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] yields a list in which every <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> element is <i>x</i>. 

Riffle[<i>list</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>n</i>}] yields a list in which <i>x</i> appears if possible at positions <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>, <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>+<i>n</i>, <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>+2<i>n</i>, … , <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

---

SystemDialogInput
SystemDialogInput["<i>type</i>"] brings up an interactive system dialog and returns the value chosen in the dialog. 

SystemDialogInput["<i>type</i>",<i>init</i>] uses <i>init</i> as the initial setting in the dialog.

---

ChoiceDialog
ChoiceDialog[<i>expr</i>] puts up a standard choice dialog that displays <i>expr</i> together with OK and Cancel buttons, and returns True if OK is clicked and False if Cancel is clicked.

ChoiceDialog[<i>expr</i>,{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] includes buttons with labels <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and returns the corresponding <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for the button clicked.

---

TabView
TabView[{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>, …}] represents an object in which clicking the tab with label <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> displays <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

TabView[{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>i</i>] makes the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> tab be the one currently selected.

TabView[{{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>v</i>] associates values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with successive tabs, and makes the tab with value <i>v</i> be the one currently selected. 

TabView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes the tab labels to be successive integers.

---

StringTake
StringTake["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives a string containing the first <i>n</i> characters in "<i>string</i>". 

StringTake["<i>string</i>",-<i>n</i>] gives the last <i>n</i> characters in "<i>string</i>". 

StringTake["<i>string</i>",{<i>n</i>}] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> character in "<i>string</i>". 

StringTake["<i>string</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives characters <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in "<i>string</i>". 

StringTake["<i>string</i>",{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the substrings specified by the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringTake[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

StringDrop
StringDrop["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives "<i>string</i>" with its first <i>n</i> characters dropped. 

StringDrop["<i>string</i>",-<i>n</i>] gives "<i>string</i>" with its last <i>n</i> characters dropped. 

StringDrop["<i>string</i>",{<i>n</i>}] gives "<i>string</i>" with its <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> character dropped. 

StringDrop["<i>string</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives "<i>string</i>" with characters <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> dropped. 

StringDrop[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AnimatedImage
AnimatedImage[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an animation whose frames are the successive <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

AnimatedImage[<i>file</i>] represents an animated image from <i>file</i>.

---

ByteCount
ByteCount[<i>expr</i>] gives the number of bytes used internally by the Wolfram System to store <i>expr</i>. 

---

Sum
Sum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates the sum ∑+i=1%i<sub>max</sub>f. 

Sum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with <i>i</i>=<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

Sum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>d</i><i>i</i>. 

Sum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Sum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] evaluates the multiple sum ∑+i=i<sub>min</sub>%i<sub>max</sub>∑+j=j<sub>min</sub>%j<sub>max</sub>…f. 

Sum[<i>f</i>,<i>i</i>] gives the indefinite sum ∑+if.

---

Product
Product[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates the product ∏+i=1%i<sub><i>max</i></sub>f. 

Product[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with i=i<sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

Product[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i>. 

Product[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Product[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] evaluates the multiple product ∏+i=i<sub><i>min</i></sub>%i<sub><i>max</i></sub>∏+j=j<sub><i>min</i></sub>%j<sub><i>max</i></sub>… f. 

Product[<i>f</i>,<i>i</i>] gives the indefinite product ∏+if.

---

Differences
Differences[<i>list</i>] gives the successive differences of elements in <i>list</i>. 

Differences[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> differences of <i>list</i>. 

Differences[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the differences of elements step <i>s</i> apart.

Differences[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the successive <i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub><sup>th</sup> differences at level <i>k</i> in a nested list. 

---

Drop
Drop[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives <i>list</i> with its first <i>n</i> elements dropped. 

Drop[<i>list</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives <i>list</i> with its last <i>n</i> elements dropped. 

Drop[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i>}] gives <i>list</i> with its <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> element dropped. 

Drop[<i>list</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives <i>list</i> with elements <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> dropped. 

Drop[<i>list</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>}] gives <i>list</i> with elements <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in steps of <i>s</i> dropped. 

Drop[<i>list</i>,<i>seq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seq</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a nested list in which elements specified by <i>seq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> have been dropped at level <i>i</i> in <i>list</i>. 

---

NotebookDirectory
NotebookDirectory[] gives the directory of the current evaluation notebook. 

NotebookDirectory[<i>nb</i>] gives the directory for the notebook specified by <i>nb</i>. 

---

EvaluationCell
EvaluationCell[] returns a CellObject corresponding to the cell in which this function is being evaluated.

---

SystemOpen
SystemOpen["<i>target</i>"] opens the specified file, URL, or other target with the associated program on your computer system.

---

Annotation
Annotation[<i>expr</i>,<i>data</i>] represents an expression <i>expr</i>, with annotation <i>data</i>.

Annotation[<i>expr</i>,<i>data</i>,"<i>type</i>"] specifies the type of annotation being given.

Annotation[<i>items</i>,<i>key</i><i>value</i>] associates <i>key</i><i>value</i> pairs with <i>items</i> in objects such as Graph, MeshRegion etc. 

---

Integrate
Integrate[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the indefinite integral ∫f dx. 

Integrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the definite integral ∫<sub>x<sub><i>min</i></sub></sub><sup>x<sub><i>max</i></sub></sup> f dx. 

Integrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] gives the multiple integral ∫<sub>x<sub><i>min</i></sub></sub><sup>x<sub><i>max</i></sub></sup>dx∫<sub>y<sub><i>min</i></sub></sub><sup>y<sub><i>max</i></sub></sup>dy … f. 

Integrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>reg</i>] integrates over the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

TableForm
TableForm[<i>list</i>] prints with the elements of <i>list</i> arranged in an array of rectangular cells. 

---

Item
Item[<i>expr</i>,<i>options</i>] represents an item within constructs such as Grid, Overlay, and Manipulate that displays with <i>expr</i> as the content, and with the specified options applied to the region containing <i>expr</i>. 

---

ToExpression
ToExpression[<i>input</i>] gives the expression obtained by interpreting strings or boxes as Wolfram Language input. 

ToExpression[<i>input</i>,<i>form</i>] uses interpretation rules corresponding to the specified form. 

ToExpression[<i>input</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the expression produced before evaluating it. 

---

MakeBoxes
MakeBoxes[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] is the low‐level function used in Wolfram System sessions to convert expressions into boxes. 

MakeBoxes[<i>expr</i>] is the function to convert <i>expr</i> to StandardForm boxes.

---

Transpose
Transpose[<i>list</i>] transposes the first two levels in <i>list</i>. 

Transpose[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] transposes <i>list</i> so that the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> level in <i>list</i> is the <i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub><sup>th</sup> level in the result. 

Transpose[<i>list</i>,<i>m</i><i>n</i>] transposes levels <i>m</i> and <i>n</i> in <i>list</i>, leaving all other levels unchanged.

Transpose[<i>list</i>,<i>k</i>] cycles the levels in <i>list</i> <i>k</i> positions to the right. 

---

Series
Series[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] generates a power series expansion for <i>f</i> about the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub> to order (<i>x</i>-<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>)<sup><i>n</i></sup>, where <i>n</i> is an explicit integer. 

Series[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><i></i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] generates the leading term of a power series expansion for <i>f</i> about the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

Series[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…] successively finds series expansions with respect to <i>x</i>, then <i>y</i>, etc. 

---

AASTriangle
AASTriangle[α,β,<i>a</i>] returns a filled triangle with angles α and β and side length <i>a</i>, where <i>a</i> is adjacent to one angle only.

---

AbelianGroup
AbelianGroup[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the direct product of the cyclic groups of degrees <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

Abort
Abort[] generates an interrupt to abort a computation. 

---

AbortKernels
AbortKernels[] aborts evaluations running in all parallel subkernels.

---

AbortProtect
AbortProtect[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, saving any aborts until the evaluation is complete. 

---

Above
Above is a symbol that represents the region above an object for purposes of placement.

---

Abs
Abs[<i>z</i>] gives the absolute value of the real or complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

AbsArg
AbsArg[<i>z</i>] gives the list {Abs[<i>z</i>],Arg[<i>z</i>]} of the number <i>z</i>.

---

AbsArgPlot
AbsArgPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of Abs[<i>f</i>] colored by Arg[<i>f</i>] as a function of <i>x</i>∈ from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

AbsArgPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions.

AbsArgPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

AbsArgPlot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

AbsoluteCorrelationFunction
AbsoluteCorrelationFunction[<i>data</i>,<i>hspec</i>] estimates the absolute correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> from <i>data</i>.

AbsoluteCorrelationFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>hspec</i>] represents the absolute correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

AbsoluteCorrelationFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the absolute correlation function at times <i>s</i> and <i>t</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

---

AbsoluteCurrentValue
AbsoluteCurrentValue[<i>item</i>] gives the absolute current value of <i>item</i> at a location in the Wolfram System and interface. 

AbsoluteCurrentValue[{<i>item</i>,<i>spec</i>}] gives the absolute current value for the feature of <i>item</i> specified by <i>spec</i>.

AbsoluteCurrentValue[<i>obj</i>,<i>item</i>] gives the absolute current value of <i>item</i> associated with the object <i>obj</i>. 

AbsoluteCurrentValue[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>item</i>] gives a list of the absolute current values associated with each of the <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AbsoluteDashing
AbsoluteDashing[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is a graphics directive which specifies that lines which follow are to be drawn dashed, with successive segments having absolute lengths <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>d</i><sub>2</sub>, … (repeated cyclically). 

AbsoluteDashing[<i>d</i>] is equivalent to AbsoluteDashing[{<i>d</i>,<i>d</i>}]. 

AbsoluteDashing[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>,</i><i>offset</i>] offsets the dashes by <i>offset</i>.

AbsoluteDashing[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>,</i><i>offset</i><i>,</i><i>capform</i>] sets the CapForm for individual dashes to <i>capform</i>. 

---

AbsoluteFileName
AbsoluteFileName["<i>name</i>"] gives the full absolute version of the name for a file in your filesystem.

---

AbsoluteOptions
AbsoluteOptions[<i>obj</i>] gives the absolute settings of options used by the given object.

AbsoluteOptions[<i>obj</i>,<i>name</i>] gives the absolute setting for the option <i>name</i>. 

AbsoluteOptions[<i>obj</i>,{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the absolute settings for the options <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

AbsolutePointSize
AbsolutePointSize[<i>d</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that points which follow are to be shown if possible as circular regions with absolute diameter <i>d</i>. 

---

AbsoluteThickness
AbsoluteThickness[<i>d</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that lines which follow are to be drawn with absolute thickness <i>d</i>. 

---

AbsoluteTime
AbsoluteTime[] gives the total number of seconds since the beginning of January 1, 1900, in your time zone.

AbsoluteTime[<i>date</i>] gives the absolute time specification corresponding to the given <i>date</i> specification.

---

AbsoluteTiming
AbsoluteTiming[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, returning a list of the absolute number of seconds in real time that have elapsed, together with the result obtained. 

---

AcceptanceThreshold
AcceptanceThreshold is an option that specifies the minimum threshold at which a result is considered acceptable.

---

AccountingForm
AccountingForm[<i>expr</i>] prints with all numbers in <i>expr</i> given in standard accounting notation. 

AccountingForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with numbers given to <i>n</i>‐digit precision. 

---

Accumulate
Accumulate[<i>list</i>] gives a list of the successive accumulated totals of elements in <i>list</i>. 

---

Accuracy
Accuracy[<i>x</i>] gives the effective number of digits to the right of the decimal point in the number <i>x</i>. 

---

AccuracyGoal
AccuracyGoal is an option for various numerical operations which specifies how many effective digits of accuracy should be sought in the final result. 

---

Activate
Activate[<i>expr</i>] replaces all instances of Inactive[<i>f</i>] in <i>expr</i> with <i>f</i>.

Activate[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] replaces only instances of Inactive[<i>f</i>] for which <i>f</i> matches the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

ActiveClassification
ActiveClassification[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an object representing the result of active classification obtained by using the function <i>f</i> to determine classes for the example configurations <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ActiveClassification[<i>f</i>,<i>reg</i>] generates configurations within the region specified by <i>reg</i>.

ActiveClassification[<i>f</i>,<i>sampler</i>] generates configurations by applying the function <i>sampler</i>.

ActiveClassification[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>nsampler</i>] applies the function <i>nsampler</i> to successively generate configurations starting from one of the <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ActiveClassificationObject
ActiveClassificationObject[…] represents the result of an ActiveClassification process.

---

ActivePrediction
ActivePrediction[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>, …}] gives an object representing the result of active prediction obtained by using the function <i>f</i> to determine values for the example configurations <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ActivePrediction[<i>f</i>,<i>reg</i>] generates configurations within the region specified by <i>reg</i>.

ActivePrediction[<i>f</i>,<i>sampler</i>] generates configurations by applying the function <i>sampler</i>.

ActivePrediction[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>nsampler</i>] applies the function <i>nsampler</i> to successively generate configurations starting from one of the <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ActivePredictionObject
ActivePredictionObject[…] represents the result of an ActivePrediction process.

---

AddTo
<i>x</i>+=<i>dx</i> adds <i>dx</i> to <i>x</i> and returns the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

AddToSearchIndex
AddToSearchIndex[<i>obj</i>,<i>content</i>] adds the specified content to the existing search index object <i>obj</i>. 

AddToSearchIndex[<i>obj</i>,{<i>content</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] adds all the <i>content</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>obj</i>.

---

AdjacencyGraph
AdjacencyGraph[<i>amat</i>] gives the graph with adjacency matrix <i>amat</i>.

AdjacencyGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>amat</i>] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and adjacency matrix <i>amat</i>.

---

AdjacencyList
AdjacencyList[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a list of vertices adjacent to vertex <i>v</i>.

AdjacencyList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of vertices adjacent to vertices that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

AdjacencyList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>d</i>] gives a list of vertices that are at distance at most <i>d</i>.

AdjacencyList[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

AdjacencyMatrix
AdjacencyMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the vertex–vertex adjacency matrix of the graph <i>g</i>.

AdjacencyMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Adjugate
Adjugate[<i>m</i>] gives the adjugate of a square matrix <i>m</i>.

---

AffineHalfSpace
AffineHalfSpace[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>k+1</i></sub>},<i>w</i>] represents AffineSpace[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>k+1</i></sub>}] extended in the direction <i>w</i>.

AffineHalfSpace[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>},<i>w</i>] represents AffineSpace[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] extended in the direction <i>w</i>.

---

AffineSpace
AffineSpace[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>k+1</i></sub>}] represents the affine space passing through the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AffineSpace[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] represents the affine space passing through <i>p</i> in the directions <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AffineStateSpaceModel
AffineStateSpaceModel[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>},<i>x</i>] represents the affine state-space model x'(t)a(x(t))+b(x(t)).u(t), y(t)=c(x(t))+d(x(t)).u(t).

AffineStateSpaceModel[<i>sys</i>] gives an affine state-space model corresponding to the system model <i>sys</i>.

AffineStateSpaceModel[<i>eqns</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>t</i>] gives the affine state-space model obtained by Taylor input linearization about the dependent variable <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>0</sub></sub> and input <i>u</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> at <i>u</i><sub><i>j</i></sub><sub>0</sub> of the differential equations <i>eqns</i> with outputs <i>g</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and independent variable <i>t</i>.

---

AffineTransform
AffineTransform[<i>m</i>] gives a TransformationFunction that represents an affine transform that maps <i>r</i> to <i>m</i>.<i>r</i>. 

AffineTransform[{<i>m</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives an affine transform that maps <i>r</i> to <i>m</i>.<i>r</i>+<i>v</i>.

---

After
After is a symbol that represents the region after an object for purposes of placement.

---

AggregatedEntityClass
AggregatedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,"<i>prop</i>"<i>f</i>] represents an entity class containing a single entity with the property <i>prop</i> whose value is the result of applying the function <i>f</i> to the whole specified entity class.

AggregatedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs multiple properties <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> obtained by applying <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>class</i>.

AggregatedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>propspec</i>,<i>gprop</i>] forms groups of elements of <i>class</i> according to their values of the property <i>gprop</i>, then generates an entity class with an entity for each of these groups. 

AggregatedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>propspec</i>,"<i>pname</i>"<i>f</i>] forms groups according to the values obtained by applying the entity function <i>f</i>, with the resulting property named <i>pname</i>.

AggregatedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>propspec</i>,{<i>gspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>gspec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] forms groups for which the set of values defined by the <i>gspec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is distinct. 

---

AggregationLayer
AggregationLayer[<i>f</i>] represents a layer that aggregates an array of arbitrary rank into a vector, using the function <i>f</i>.

AggregationLayer[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] aggregates an array at level <i>n</i>.

AggregationLayer[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>;;<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] aggregates an array at levels <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>.

AggregationLayer[<i>f,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}</i>] aggregates an array at levels <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

AiryAi
AiryAi[<i>z</i>] gives the Airy function Ai(z). 

---

AiryAiPrime
AiryAiPrime[<i>z</i>] gives the derivative of the Airy function Ai<sup>′</sup>(z). 

---

AiryAiZero
AiryAiZero[<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero of the Airy function Ai(x).

AiryAiZero[<i>k</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero less than <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

AiryBi
AiryBi[<i>z</i>] gives the Airy function Bi(z). 

---

AiryBiPrime
AiryBiPrime[<i>z</i>] gives the derivative of the Airy function Bi<sup>′</sup>(z). 

---

AiryBiZero
AiryBiZero[<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero of the Airy function Bi(x).

AiryBiZero[<i>k</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero less than <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

AlgebraicIntegerQ
AlgebraicIntegerQ[<i>a</i>] yields True if <i>a</i> is an algebraic integer, and yields False otherwise.

---

AlgebraicNumberDenominator
AlgebraicNumberDenominator[<i>a</i>] gives the smallest positive integer <i>n</i> such that <i>n</i> <i>a</i> is an algebraic integer.

---

AlgebraicNumberNorm
AlgebraicNumberNorm[<i>a</i>] gives the norm of the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

AlgebraicNumberPolynomial
AlgebraicNumberPolynomial[<i>a</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the polynomial in <i>x</i> corresponding to the AlgebraicNumber object <i>a</i>.

---

AlgebraicNumberTrace
AlgebraicNumberTrace[<i>a</i>] gives the trace of the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

AlgebraicRulesData
AlgebraicRulesData is an object returned by AlgebraicRules. Its OutputForm appears to be a list of rules, but the rules will be used algebraically rather than syntactically by Replace and related functions.

---

Algebraics
Algebraics represents the domain of algebraic numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈Algebraics. 

---

AlgebraicUnitQ
AlgebraicUnitQ[<i>a</i>] yields True if <i>a</i> is an algebraic unit, and yields False otherwise.

---

AlignmentPoint
AlignmentPoint is an option which specifies how objects should by default be aligned when they appear in Inset.

---

All
All is a setting used for certain options. In Part and related functions, All specifies all parts at a particular level. 

---

AllowedFrequencyRange
AllowedFrequencyRange is an option for audio and signal processing functions that specifies the range of frequencies of interest.

---

AllowLooseGrammar
AllowLooseGrammar is an option for GrammarRules and related functions that specifies whether grammatical "fluff" should automatically be ignored in applying grammar rules.

---

AllTrue
AllTrue[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>] yields True if <i>test</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True for all of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AllTrue[<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

AllTrue[<i>test</i>] represents an operator form of AllTrue that can be applied to an expression.

---

Alphabet
Alphabet[] gives a list of the lowercase letters a through z in the English alphabet.

Alphabet[<i>type</i>] gives the alphabet for the language or class <i>type</i>.

Alphabet[<i>type</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the alphabet defined by <i>prop</i> for the language or class <i>type </i>.

---

AlphabeticOrder
AlphabeticOrder["<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>"] gives 1 if "<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>" appears before "<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>" in alphabetical order, -1 if it is after, and 0 if it is identical. 

AlphabeticOrder["<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>",<i>lang</i>] uses an ordering suitable for the language <i>lang</i>.

AlphabeticOrder[<i>lang</i>] represents an operator form that compares strings when applied to "<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>", "<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>".

---

AlphabeticSort
AlphabeticSort[<i>list</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> into alphabetical order.

AlphabeticSort[<i>list</i>,<i>lang</i>] sorts using an ordering suitable for the language <i>lang</i>.

---

AlphaChannel
AlphaChannel[<i>color</i>] returns the opacity of <i>color</i>.

AlphaChannel[<i>image</i>] returns the alpha channel of <i>image</i>.

AlphaChannel[<i>video</i>] returns a video containing the alpha channel of the frames in <i>video</i>.

---

AlternateImage
AlternateImage is an option to CDFInformation that specifies an image that should be used if the plugin is not available.

---

AlternatingFactorial
AlternatingFactorial[<i>n</i>] gives the alternating factorial af(n).

---

AlternatingGroup
AlternatingGroup[<i>n</i>] represents the alternating group of degree <i>n</i>.

---

AlternativeHypothesis
AlternativeHypothesis is an option for hypothesis testing functions like LocationTest that specifies the alternative hypothesis.

---

Alternatives
<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>|<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>|… is a pattern object that represents any of the patterns <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

AmbiguityFunction
AmbiguityFunction is an option for SemanticInterpretation, Interpreter, and related functions that specifies how to resolve ambiguities generated during semantic interpretation.

---

AmbiguityList
AmbiguityList[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents possible results derived from an ambiguous semantic interpretation.

AmbiguityList[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>string</i>"] represents possible results from semantic interpretation of an input string.

AmbiguityList[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>string</i>",{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] includes a sequence of associations giving details of the interpretations used to obtain the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Analytic
Analytic is an option for Limit and Series. With Analytic -> True, unrecognized functions are treated as analytic, and processed using Taylor series expansions; with Analytic -> False, Taylor series are not used unless the function is recognized as analytic.

---

AnatomyData
AnatomyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the anatomical structure <i>entity</i>.

AnatomyData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified anatomical structure entities.

AnatomyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

AnatomyPlot3D
AnatomyPlot3D[<i>primitives</i>,<i>options</i>] represents a three-dimensional graphical image that works with anatomical entities as well as standard 3D graphics primitives and directives.

---

AnchoredSearch
AnchoredSearch is an option for Find and FindList that specifies whether the text searched for must be at the beginning of a record. 

---

And
<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>&amp;&amp;<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>&amp;&amp;… is the logical AND function. It evaluates its arguments in order, giving False immediately if any of them are False, and True if they are all True. 

---

AndersonDarlingTest
AndersonDarlingTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Anderson–Darling test.

AndersonDarlingTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Anderson–Darling test.

AndersonDarlingTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

AngerJ
AngerJ[ν,<i>z</i>] gives the Anger function J<sub>ν</sub>(z).

AngerJ[ν,μ,<i>z</i>] gives the associated Anger function J<sub>ν</sub><sup>μ</sup>(z).

---

AngleBisector
AngleBisector[{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i>,<i>q</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the bisector of the interior angle at <i>p</i> formed by the triangle with vertex points <i>p</i>, <i>q</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>q</i><sub>2</sub>.

AngleBisector[{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i>,<i>q</i><sub>2</sub>},"<i>type</i>"] gives the angle bisector of the specified type.

---

AngleBracket
AngleBracket[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as 〈x,y,…〉.

---

AnglePath
AnglePath[{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,θ<sub>3</sub>,…}] gives the list of 2D coordinates corresponding to a path that starts at {0,0}, then takes a series of steps of unit length at successive relative angles θ<sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

AnglePath[{{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>1</sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>3</sub>,θ<sub>3</sub>},…}] takes successive steps of lengths <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

AnglePath[θ<sub>0</sub>,{<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] starts at angle θ<sub>0</sub> with respect to the x axis.

AnglePath[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] starts at the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} with initial angle 0 with respect to the x axis.

AnglePath[{{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},θ<sub>0</sub>},{<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] starts at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} with initial angle θ<sub>0</sub> with respect to the x axis.

AnglePath[{{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>}},{<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes the first step to go from {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to {<i>x</i>+<i>dx</i>,<i>y</i>+<i>dy</i>}.

AnglePath[<i>init</i>,<i>steps</i>,<i>form</i>] returns at each step the data of the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

AnglePath3D
AnglePath3D[{{α<sub>1</sub>,β<sub>1</sub>,γ<sub>1</sub>},{α<sub>2</sub>,β<sub>2</sub>,γ<sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the list of 3D coordinates of a path of an object that starts at {0,0,0}, then takes a series of steps of unit length, each in the direction of the x axis obtained after successive rotation of the object by the Euler angles α<sub><i>i</i></sub>, β<sub><i>i</i></sub>, γ<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AnglePath3D[{{α<sub>1</sub>,β<sub>1</sub>},{α<sub>2</sub>,β<sub>2</sub>},…}] assumes the Euler angles γ<sub><i>i</i></sub> to be 0.

AnglePath3D[{<i>mat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>mat</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes the successive rotations to be specified by the 3D rotation matrices <i>mat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

AnglePath3D[{{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rot</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>rot</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] takes successive steps of length <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with Euler angles or rotation matrices specified by <i>rot</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AnglePath3D[{<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>},<i>steps</i>] starts at the point {<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>}.

AnglePath3D[{<i>rot</i><sub>0</sub>},<i>steps</i>] starts in the x axis direction specified by rotating the object according to Euler angles or rotation matrix <i>rot</i><sub>0</sub>.

AnglePath3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>},<i>rot</i><sub>0</sub>},<i>steps</i>] starts at point {<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>} with the x axis direction specified by <i>rot</i><sub>0</sub>.

AnglePath3D[<i>init</i>,<i>steps</i>,<i>form</i>] returns at each step the data of the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

AngleVector
AngleVector[θ] gives the list representing the 2D unit vector at angle θ relative to the x axis.

AngleVector[{<i>r</i>,θ}] gives the list representing the 2D vector of length <i>r</i> at angle θ.

AngleVector[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},θ] gives the result of starting from the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}, then going a unit distance at angle θ.

AngleVector[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i>,θ}] gives the result of starting from the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}, then going distance <i>r</i> at angle θ.

---

AnimationRate
AnimationRate is an option for Animate and Animator that specifies at what rate an animation should run, in units per second. 

---

AnimationRepetitions
AnimationRepetitions is an option to Animate and related functions that specifies how many times the animation they create runs before stopping.

---

Annuity
Annuity[<i>p</i>,<i>t</i>] represents an annuity of fixed payments <i>p</i> made over <i>t</i> periods.

Annuity[<i>p</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>q</i><i>]</i> represents a series of payments occurring at time intervals <i>q</i>.

Annuity[{<i>p</i>,{<i>p</i><sub><i>initial</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>final</i></sub>}},<i>t</i>,<i>q</i>] represents an annuity with the specified initial and final payments.

---

AnnuityDue
AnnuityDue[<i>p</i>,<i>t</i>] represents an annuity due of fixed payments <i>p</i> made over <i>t</i> periods.

AnnuityDue[<i>p</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>q</i><i>]</i> represents a series of payments occurring at time intervals <i>q</i>.

AnnuityDue[{<i>p</i>,{<i>p</i><sub><i>initial</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>final</i></sub>}},<i>t</i>,<i>q</i>] represents an annuity due with the specified initial and final payments.

---

Annulus
Annulus[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>}] represents an annulus centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} with inner radius <i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub> and outer radius <i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>.

Annulus[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>},{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] represents an annulus from angle θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub>.

---

AnomalyDetection
AnomalyDetection[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an AnomalyDetectorFunction[…] based on the examples given.

AnomalyDetection[LearnedDistribution[…]] generates an anomaly detector based on the given distribution.

AnomalyDetection[True{<i>example</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>12</sub>,…},False{<i>example</i><sub>21</sub>,…}] can be used to indicate which examples should be considered anomalous.

---

AnomalyDetector
AnomalyDetector is an option for functions such as Classify that specifies an anomaly detector for them to include.

---

AnomalyDetectorFunction
AnomalyDetectorFunction[…] represents a function generated by AnomalyDetection for detecting whether data is anomalous or not.

---

Anonymous
Anonymous represents an option or other value that indicates the absence of a name.

---

Antialiasing
Antialiasing is an option that specifies whether antialiasing should be done.

---

Antihermitian
Antihermitian[{1,2}] represents the symmetry of an antihermitian matrix.

---

AntihermitianMatrixQ
AntihermitianMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly antihermitian, and False otherwise.

---

Antisymmetric
Antisymmetric[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the symmetry of a tensor that is antisymmetric in the slots <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AntisymmetricMatrixQ
AntisymmetricMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly antisymmetric, and False otherwise.

---

Antonyms
Antonyms["<i>word</i>"] returns the antonyms associated with the specified word.

---

AnyOrder
AnyOrder[<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is a grammar rules pattern object that represents a sequence of elements matching <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, … in any order.

---

AnySubset
AnySubset[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an element in an interpreter or form that accepts any subset of the choices <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

AnySubset[{<i>lab</i><sub>1</sub><i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lab</i><sub>2</sub><i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] accepts any subset of the <i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, yielding the corresponding <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as results.

AnySubset[EntityClass["<i>type</i>","<i>class</i>"]] accepts any subset of the entities in the specified entity class.

AnySubset[<i>choices</i>,<i>max</i>] allows at most <i>max</i> choices to be selected.

AnySubset[<i>choices</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i><i>}</i>] allows at least <i>min</i> and at most <i>max</i> choices to be selected.

---

AnyTrue
AnyTrue[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>] yields True if <i>test</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True for any of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AnyTrue[<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

AnyTrue[<i>test</i>] represents an operator form of AnyTrue that can be applied to an expression.

---

Apart
Apart[<i>expr</i>] rewrites a rational expression as a sum of terms with minimal denominators. 

Apart[<i>expr</i>,<i>var</i>] treats all variables other than <i>var</i> as constants. 

---

ApartSquareFree
ApartSquareFree[<i>expr</i>] rewrites a rational expression as a sum of terms whose denominators are powers of square-free polynomials. 

ApartSquareFree[<i>expr</i>,<i>var</i>] treats all variables other than <i>var</i> as constants. 

---

APIFunction
APIFunction[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>fun</i>] represents an API with parameters <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that evaluates the function <i>fun</i> whenever it is called. The function <i>fun</i> is applied to <i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…, where the <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are the settings for the parameters, interpreted as being of types <i>type</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

APIFunction[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub><i>default</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>fun</i>] takes the value of the parameter <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to be <i>default</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> if it is not specified when the API is called.

APIFunction[<i>params</i>,<i>fun</i>,<i>fmt</i>] specifies that the result from applying <i>fun</i> should be returned in format <i>fmt</i>.

APIFunction[<i>params</i>,<i>fun</i>,{<i>fmt</i>,<i>rform</i>}] specifies that the result should be returned as a response of the form <i>rform</i>.

APIFunction[<i>params</i>,<i>fun</i>,{<i>fmt</i>,<i>rform</i>,<i>failfmt</i>}] specifies that in the event of failure, the result should be returned in format <i>failfmt</i>.

---

Appearance
Appearance is an option for displayed objects such as Button and Slider that specifies the general type of appearance they should have. 

---

AppearanceElements
AppearanceElements is an option for functions like Manipulate that specifies what elements should be included in the displayed form of the object generated.

---

AppearanceRules
AppearanceRules is an option for form and page generation functions that specifies the overall appearance of the generated object.

---

AppellF1
AppellF1[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>c</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is the Appell hypergeometric function of two variables F<sub>1</sub>(a;b<sub>1</sub>,b<sub>2</sub>;c;x,y). 

---

Append
Append[<i>expr</i>,<i>elem</i>] gives <i>expr</i> with <i>elem</i> appended. 

Append[<i>elem</i>] represents an operator form of Append that can be applied to an expression.

---

AppendLayer
AppendLayer[] represents a net layer that takes an input array and appends another array to it.

---

AppendTo
AppendTo[<i>x</i>,<i>elem</i>] appends <i>elem</i> to the value of <i>x</i>, and resets <i>x</i> to the result. 

---

Application
<i>f</i><i>g</i> or Application[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>] represents the formal application of <i>f</i> to <i>g</i>.

---

Apply
<i>f</i>@@<i>expr</i> or Apply[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] replaces the head of <i>expr</i> by <i>f</i>. 

<i>f</i>@@@<i>expr</i> or Apply[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,{1}] replaces heads at level 1 of <i>expr</i> by <i>f</i>.

Apply[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] replaces heads in parts of <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Apply[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of Apply that can be applied to an expression.

---

ApplyTo
ApplyTo[<i>x</i>,<i>f</i>] or <i>x</i><i>//</i>=<i>f</i> computes <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>] and resets <i>x</i> to the result.

---

ArcCos
ArcCos[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cosine cos<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCosh
ArcCosh[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic cosine cosh<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCot
ArcCot[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cotangent cot<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCoth
ArcCoth[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic cotangent coth<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCsc
ArcCsc[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cosecant csc<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCsch
ArcCsch[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic cosecant csch<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcCurvature
ArcCurvature[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>t</i>] gives the curvature of the parametrized curve whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>t</i>.

ArcCurvature[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>t</i>,<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

ARCHProcess
ARCHProcess[κ,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>q</i></sub>}] represents an autoregressive conditionally heteroscedastic process of order <i>q</i>, driven by a standard white noise.

ARCHProcess[κ,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>q</i></sub>},<i>init</i>] represents an ARCH process with initial data <i>init</i>.

---

ArcLength
ArcLength[<i>reg</i>] gives the length of the one-dimensional region <i>reg</i>.

ArcLength[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the length of the parametrized curve whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>t</i>.

ArcLength[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

ArcSec
ArcSec[<i>z</i>] gives the arc secant sec<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcSech
ArcSech[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic secant sech<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcSin
ArcSin[<i>z</i>] gives the arc sine sin<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcSinDistribution
ArcSinDistribution[{<i><i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub></i>,<i><i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub></i>}] represents the arc sine distribution supported between <i><i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub></i> and <i><i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub></i>.

ArcSinDistribution[] represents the arc sine distribution supported between zero and one.

---

ArcSinh
ArcSinh[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic sine sinh<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

ArcTan
ArcTan[<i>z</i>] gives the arc tangent tan<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

ArcTan[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the arc tangent of y/x, taking into account which quadrant the point (x,y) is in. 

---

ArcTanh
ArcTanh[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse hyperbolic tangent tanh<sup>-1</sup>(z) of the complex number z. 

---

Area
Area[<i>reg</i>] gives the area of the two-dimensional region <i>reg</i>.

Area[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the area of the parametrized surface whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>s</i> and <i>t</i>.

Area[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

Arg
Arg[<i>z</i>] gives the argument of the complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

ArgMax
ArgMax[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a position <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> at which <i>f</i> is maximized.

ArgMax[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position {<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…} at which <i>f</i> is maximized.

ArgMax[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position at which <i>f</i> is maximized subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

ArgMax[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

ArgMax[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

ArgMin
ArgMin[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a position <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> at which <i>f</i> is minimized.

ArgMin[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position {<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…} at which <i>f</i> is minimized.

ArgMin[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position at which <i>f</i> is minimized subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

ArgMin[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

ArgMin[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

ArgumentCountQ
ArgumentCountQ[<i>head</i>, <i>len</i>, <i>min</i>, <i>max</i>] tests whether the number <i>len</i> of arguments of a function <i>head</i> is between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>.

ArgumentCountQ[<i>head</i>,<i>len</i>,{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>m</i><sub>i</sub>}] tests whether the number <i>len</i> of arguments of a function <i>head</i> is one of the <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ArgumentsOptions
ArgumentsOptions[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>n</i>] tries to separate <i>args</i> into a list of <i>n</i> positional arguments followed by a list of valid options for <i>f</i>.

ArgumentsOptions[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] requires the number of positional arguments to be between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>.

ArgumentsOptions[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>spec</i>,<i>assoc</i>] modifies the behavior based on the information in the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

ArithmeticGeometricMean
ArithmeticGeometricMean[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the arithmetic‐geometric mean of <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>. 

---

Around
Around[<i>x</i>,δ] represents an approximate number or quantity with a value around <i>x</i> and an uncertainty δ.

Around[<i>x</i>,{δ<sub>-</sub>,δ<sub>+</sub>}] represents a number or quantity with a value around <i>x</i> and asymmetric uncertainties δ<sub>-</sub>, δ<sub>+</sub>.

Around[<i>dist</i>] gives an approximate number or quantity around the mean of the distribution <i>dist</i>, with an uncertainty corresponding to the standard deviation of the distribution.

Around[<i>list</i>] gives an approximate object around the mean of the elements of <i>list</i> and with an uncertainty corresponding to their standard deviation.

Around[<i>s</i>] gives an approximate object derived from the number, interval or string specification <i>s</i>.

---

AroundReplace
AroundReplace[<i>expr</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>Around[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,δ<sub>1</sub>],<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>Around[<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,δ<sub>2</sub>],…}] propagates uncertainty in <i>expr</i> by replacing all occurrences of <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> by Around[<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,δ<sub><i>i</i></sub>].

AroundReplace[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>n</i>] propagates uncertainty in <i>expr</i> using a series expansion to order <i>n</i>.

---

Array
Array[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a list of length <i>n</i>, with elements <i>f</i>[<i>i</i>]. 

Array[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>] generates a list using the index origin <i>r</i>.

Array[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] generates a list using <i>n</i> values from <i>a</i> to <i>b</i>.

Array[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of nested lists, with elements <i>f</i>[<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…]. 

Array[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a list using the index origins <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> (default 1). 

Array[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] generates a list using <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> values from <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Array[<i>f</i>,<i>dims</i>,<i>origin</i>,<i>h</i>] uses head <i>h</i>, rather than List, for each level of the array. 

---

ArrayComponents
ArrayComponents[<i>array</i>] gives an array in which all identical elements of <i>array</i> are replaced by an integer index representing the component in which the element lies.

ArrayComponents[<i>array</i>,<i>level</i>] finds the identical elements at the specified level in <i>array</i>

ArrayComponents[<i>array</i>,<i>level</i>,<i>rules</i>] uses a rule or a list of rules for specifying the labels.

---

ArrayDepth
ArrayDepth[<i>expr</i>] gives the depth to which <i>expr</i> is a full array, with all the parts at a particular level having the same length.

---

ArrayFilter
ArrayFilter[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,<i>r</i>] applies <i>f</i> to all range-<i>r</i> blocks in the specified array.

ArrayFilter[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to blocks with ranges <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, … in successive dimensions.

ArrayFilter[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,<i>template</i>] applies <i>f</i> over blocks specified by the position of 1s in the array <i>template</i>.

---

ArrayFlatten
ArrayFlatten[{{<i>m</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>m</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] creates a single flattened matrix from a matrix of matrices <i>m</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>. 

ArrayFlatten[<i>a</i>,<i>r</i>] flattens out <i>r</i> pairs of levels in the array <i>a</i>.

---

ArrayPad
ArrayPad[<i>array</i>,<i>m</i>] gives an array with <i>m</i> zeros of padding on every side. 

ArrayPad[<i>array</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>padding</i>] uses the specified padding.

ArrayPad[<i>array</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>},…] pads with <i>m</i> elements at the beginning and <i>n</i> elements at the end. 

ArrayPad[<i>array</i>,{{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>},…},…] pads with <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements at level <i>i</i> in <i>array</i>. 

---

ArrayPlot
ArrayPlot[<i>array</i>] generates a plot in which the values in an array are shown in a discrete array of squares. 

---

ArrayPlot3D
ArrayPlot3D[<i>array</i>] generates a plot in which the values in an array are shown in a discrete array of cubes. 

---

ArrayQ
ArrayQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a full array or a SparseArray object, and gives False otherwise. 

ArrayQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] requires <i>expr</i> to be a full array with a depth that matches the pattern <i>patt</i>. 

ArrayQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>test</i>] requires also that <i>test</i> yield True when applied to each of the array elements in <i>expr</i>. 

---

ArrayReduce
ArrayReduce[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>] reduces dimension <i>n</i> of <i>array</i> by applying <i>f</i>.

ArrayReduce[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>;;<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] reduces dimensions <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>.

ArrayReduce[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reduces dimensions <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

ArrayReduce[<i>f</i>,<i>array</i>,{{<i>n</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] applies <i>f</i> to arrays formed by combining all dimensions <i>n</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to make each dimension <i>i</i>.

---

ArrayResample
ArrayResample[<i>array</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] resamples <i>array</i> to have dimensions {<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

ArrayResample[<i>array</i>,<i>dspec</i>] resamples <i>array</i> according to the dimension specification <i>dspec</i>.

ArrayResample[<i>array</i>,<i>dspec</i>,<i>scheme</i>] specifies resampling <i>scheme</i>, either point or bin based. 

ArrayResample[<i>array</i>,<i>dspec</i>,<i>scheme</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] resamples only the data in the specified subrange {{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}.

---

ArrayReshape
ArrayReshape[<i>list</i>,<i>dims</i>] arranges the elements of <i>list</i> into a rectangular array with dimensions <i>dims</i>.

ArrayReshape[<i>list</i>,<i>dims</i>,<i>padding</i>] uses the specified padding if <i>list</i> does not contain enough elements.

---

ArrayRules
ArrayRules[SparseArray[…]] gives the rules {<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…} specifying elements in a sparse array. 

ArrayRules[<i>list</i>] gives rules for SparseArray[<i>list</i>]. 

---

Arrays
Arrays[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>d</i><sub><i>r</i></sub>}] represents the domain of arrays of rank <i>r</i> and dimensions <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Arrays[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>d</i><sub><i>r</i></sub>},<i>dom</i>] represents the domain of arrays of dimensions <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, with components in the domain <i>dom</i>.

Arrays[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>d</i><sub><i>r</i></sub>},<i>dom</i>,<i>sym</i>] represents the subdomain of arrays with dimensions <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

Arrow
Arrow[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>}] is a graphics primitive that represents an arrow from <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>.

Arrow[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>s</i>] represents an arrow with its ends set back from <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>pt</i><sub>2</sub> by a distance <i>s</i>. 

Arrow[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>}] sets back by <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> from <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub> from <i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>. 

Arrow[<i>curve</i>,…] represents an arrow following the specified <i>curve</i>.

---

Arrowheads
Arrowheads[<i>spec</i>] is a graphics directive specifying that arrows that follow should have arrowheads with sizes, positions, and forms specified by <i>spec</i>. 

---

ASATriangle
ASATriangle[α,<i>c</i>,β] returns a filled triangle with angles α and β and side length <i>c</i>, and <i>c</i> is adjacent to both angles.

---

AspectRatio
AspectRatio is an option for Graphics and related functions that specifies the ratio of height to width for a plot. 

---

Assert
Assert[<i>test</i>] represents the assertion that <i>test</i> is True. If assertions have been enabled, <i>test</i> is evaluated when the assertion is encountered. If <i>test</i> is not True, then an assertion failure is generated.

Assert[<i>test</i>,<i>tag</i>] specifies a tag that will be used to identify the assertion if it fails.

---

AssessmentFunction
AssessmentFunction[<i>key</i>] represents a tool for assessing whether answers are correct according to the <i>key</i>.

AssessmentFunction[<i>key</i>,<i>method</i>] uses the specified answer comparison method.

AssessmentFunction[<i>key</i>,<i>f</i>] uses the function <i>f</i> to compare answers with the key.

AssessmentFunction[<i>key</i>,<i>comp</i>] performs assessment using the custom assessment defined in the Association <i>comp</i>.

AssessmentFunction[<i>obj</i>] represents an assessment function that performs assessment using the CloudObject <i>obj</i>. 

AssessmentFunction[{<i>obj</i>,<i>id</i>}] assesses the specified question within the CloudObject <i>obj</i>.

AssessmentFunction[…][<i>answer</i>] gives an AssessmentResultObject representing the correctness of <i>answer</i>.

---

AssessmentResultObject
AssessmentResultObject[<i>assoc</i>] represents the results of an assessment.

AssessmentResultObject[{<i>aro</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>aro</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of many assessments.

---

AssociateTo
AssociateTo[<i>a</i>,<i>key</i><i>val</i>] changes the association <i>a</i> by adding the key-value pair <i>key</i><i>val</i>.

AssociateTo[<i>a</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] adds all key-value pairs <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Association
Association[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] or <i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,… represents an association between keys and values.

---

AssociationFormat
AssociationFormat is an option to TextString and related functions that determines how associations are formatted.

---

AssociationMap
AssociationMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates the association <i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>],….

AssociationMap[<i>f</i>,<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] creates the association <i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>],….

AssociationMap[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of AssociationMap that can be applied to an expression.

---

AssociationQ
AssociationQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a valid Association object, and False otherwise.

---

AssociationThread
AssociationThread[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the association <i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,….

AssociationThread[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] also gives the association <i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

AssumeDeterministic
AssumeDeterministic is an option for functions such as BayesianMinimization that specifies whether or not the function being considered should be assumed to be deterministic.

---

Assuming
Assuming[<i>assum</i>,<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> with <i>assum</i> appended to $Assumptions, so that <i>assum</i> is included in the default assumptions used by functions such as Refine, Simplify, and Integrate. 

---

Assumptions
Assumptions is an option for functions such as Simplify, Refine, and Integrate that specifies default assumptions to be made about symbolic quantities. 

---

AstronomicalData
AstronomicalData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property of the astronomical object with the specified name.

AstronomicalData["<i>name</i>",{"<i>property</i>",<i>date</i>}] gives the value of a property at a particular date and time.

---

Asymptotic
Asymptotic[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] gives an asymptotic approximation for <i>expr</i> near <i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub></i>.

Asymptotic[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] gives an asymptotic approximation for <i>expr</i> near <i>x</i><sub>0</sub> to order <i>n</i>. 

---

AsymptoticDSolveValue
AsymptoticDSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation to the differential equation <i>eqn</i> for <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>] centered at <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

AsymptoticDSolveValue[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation to a system of differential equations.

AsymptoticDSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,ϵϵ<sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation of <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,ϵ] for the parameter ϵ centered at ϵ<sub>0</sub>.

AsymptoticDSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,…,{ξ,ξ<sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] computes the asymptotic approximation to order <i>n</i>. 

---

AsymptoticEqual
AsymptoticEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)≍g(x) or f(x)∈Θ(g(x)) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)≍g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) or f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)∈Θ(g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)) as {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticEquivalent
AsymptoticEquivalent[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)∼g(x) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticEquivalent[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) ~g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) as {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticExpectation
AsymptoticExpectation[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>,<i>a</i><i>a</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation for the expectation of <i>expr</i> centered at <i>a</i><sub>0</sub>, under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

AsymptoticExpectation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i><i>,</i><i>a</i><i></i><i>a</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation for the expectation of <i>expr</i> centered at <i>a</i><sub>0</sub>, under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

AsymptoticExpectation[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] computes the asymptotic expectation to order <i>n</i>.

---

AsymptoticGreater
AsymptoticGreater[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)≻g(x) or f(x)∈ω(g(x)) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticGreater[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)≻g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) or f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)∈ω(g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)) as {x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticGreaterEqual
AsymptoticGreaterEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)⪰g(x) or f(x)∈Ω(g(x)) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticGreaterEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)⪰g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) or f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)∈Ω(g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)) as {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticLess
AsymptoticLess[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)≺g(x) or f(x)∈o(g(x)) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticLess[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)≺g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) or f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)∈o(g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)) as {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticLessEqual
AsymptoticLessEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives conditions for f(x)⪯g(x) or f(x)∈O(g(x)) as <i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>.

AsymptoticLessEqual[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives conditions for f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)⪯g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>) or f(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)∈O(g(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub>)) as {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}.

---

AsymptoticOutputTracker
AsymptoticOutputTracker[<i>sys</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] gives the state feedback control law that causes the outputs of the affine system <i>sys</i> to track the reference signals <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with decay rates <i>p</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

AsymptoticOutputTracker[{<i>sys</i>,{<i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},…] specifies outputs <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and control inputs <i>in</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to use. 

---

AsymptoticProbability
AsymptoticProbability[<i>pred</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>,<i>a</i><i>a</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation for the probability of <i>pred</i> centered at <i>a</i><sub>0</sub>, under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

AsymptoticProbability[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>,<i>a</i><i>a</i><sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation for the probability of <i>pred</i> centered at <i>a</i><sub>0</sub>, under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

AsymptoticProbability[<i>pred</i><i>,</i><i>vars</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] computes the asymptotic probability to order <i>n</i>.

---

AsymptoticRSolveValue
AsymptoticRSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>∞] computes an asymptotic approximation to the difference equation <i>eqn</i> for <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>] near ∞. 

AsymptoticRSolveValue[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i><i></i> ∞] computes an asymptotic approximation to a system of difference equations.

AsymptoticRSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,ϵϵ<sub>0</sub>] computes an asymptotic approximation of <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,ϵ] for the parameter ϵ centered at ϵ<sub>0</sub>.

AsymptoticRSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>f</i>,…,{ξ,ξ<sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] computes the asymptotic approximation to order <i>n</i>. 

---

AsymptoticSolve
AsymptoticSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>yb</i>,<i>x->a</i>] computes asymptotic approximations of solutions <i>y</i>[<i>x</i>] of the equation <i>eqn</i> passing through {<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}.

AsymptoticSolve[<i>eqn</i>,{<i>y</i>},<i>x->a</i>] computes asymptotic approximations of solutions <i>y</i>[<i>x</i>] of the equation <i>eqn</i> for <i>x</i> near <i>a</i>.

AsymptoticSolve[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes asymptotic approximations of solutions {<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…],<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…],…} of the system of equations <i>eqns</i>.

AsymptoticSolve[<i>eqns</i>,…,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>}] computes the asymptotic approximation to order <i>n</i>. 

AsymptoticSolve[…,Reals] computes only solutions that are real valued for real argument values.

---

Asynchronous
Asynchronous is an option for WolframAlpha that determines whether to use the asynchronous features of the Wolfram|Alpha API.

---

AsynchronousTaskObject
AsynchronousTaskObject["<i>name</i>",<i>id</i>,<i>sessionid</i>] is an object that represents asynchronous evaluations from a particular asynchronous task.

---

AsynchronousTasks
AsynchronousTasks[] returns a list of running asynchronous tasks.

---

Atom
Atom["<i>sym</i>"] represents an atom with atomic symbol "<i>sym</i>".

Atom["<i>sym</i>",<i>name</i><i>value</i><i>,</i><i>…</i>] represents an atom with atomic symbol "<i>sym</i>" and specified properties.

---

AtomCoordinates
AtomCoordinates is an option for Molecule and related functions that specifies the three-dimensional coordinates of the atoms.

---

AtomDiagramCoordinates
AtomDiagramCoordinates is an option for Molecule and related functions that specifies the two-dimensional coordinates of the atoms.

---

AtomLabels
AtomLabels is an option for MoleculePlot and MoleculePlot3D that specifies what labels and label positions should be used for atoms.

---

AtomLabelStyle
AtomLabelStyle is an option for MoleculePlot and MoleculePlot3D that specifies the style to use for atom labels.

---

AtomQ
AtomQ[<i>expr</i>] yields True if <i>expr</i> is an expression which cannot be divided into subexpressions, and yields False otherwise. 

---

AttentionLayer
AttentionLayer[] represents a trainable net layer that learns to pay attention to certain portions of its input. 

AttentionLayer[<i>net</i>] specifies a particular net to give scores for portions of the input.
