AttentionLayer[<i>net</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for weight normalization, masking and other parameters.

---

Attributes
Attributes[<i>symbol</i>] gives the list of attributes for a symbol. 

Attributes["<i>symbol</i>"] gives the attributes for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

Attributes[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the attributes for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Audio
Audio[<i>file</i>] represents audio stored in the given file.

Audio[<i>url</i>] represents audio stored in the given URL.

Audio[<i>data</i>] represents audio with samples given by the array <i>data</i>.

---

AudioAmplify
AudioAmplify[<i>audio</i>,<i>s</i>] multiplies all samples of <i>audio</i> by a factor <i>s</i>. 

AudioAmplify[<i>video</i>,<i>s</i>] amplifies the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioAnnotate
AudioAnnotate[<i>audio</i>,<i>prop</i>] computes the property <i>prop</i> and adds it as an annotation to <i>audio</i>.

AudioAnnotate[<i>audio</i>,<i>name</i><i>spec</i>] adds an annotation with the specified name and values <i>spec</i> to <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioAnnotationLookup
AudioAnnotationLookup[<i>audio</i>] gives all annotations associated to <i>audio</i>.

AudioAnnotationLookup[<i>audio</i>,<i>tags</i>] gives the annotations specified by <i>tags</i>.

AudioAnnotationLookup[<i>audio</i>,<i>tags</i><i>selector</i>] gives a selection of annotations using <i>selector</i>.

AudioAnnotationLookup[<i>audio</i>,<i>tags</i><i>selector</i>,<i>format</i>] formats each annotation element according to <i>format</i>.

---

AudioBlockMap
AudioBlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>audio</i>,<i>dur</i>] applies <i>f</i> to non-overlapping partitions of length <i>dur</i> in <i>audio</i>. 

AudioBlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>audio</i>,{<i>dur</i>,<i>offset</i>}] applies <i>f</i> to partitions with offset <i>offset</i> in <i>audio</i>. 

AudioBlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>audio</i>,{<i>dur</i>,<i>offset</i>,<i>wfun</i>}] applies <i>f</i> after applying <i>wfun</i> to partitions in <i>audio</i>. 

---

AudioChannelAssignment
AudioChannelAssignment is an option for Audio and related functions that specifies a mapping from audio channels to available speakers of the output audio device.

---

AudioChannelCombine
AudioChannelCombine[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a multichannel audio object by combining the sequence of channels in <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AudioChannelMix
AudioChannelMix[<i>audio</i>] mixes channels of <i>audio</i> by averaging and returns a center-panned stereo audio object.

AudioChannelMix[<i>audio</i>,<i>desttype</i>] mixes audio channels into the specified <i>desttype</i>.

AudioChannelMix[<i>video</i>,…] mixes audio channels of <i>video</i>.

---

AudioChannels
AudioChannels[<i>audio</i>] returns the number of channels in the Audio object <i>audio</i>.

AudioChannels[<i>video</i>] returns the number of channels of the first audio track of <i>video</i>.

---

AudioChannelSeparate
AudioChannelSeparate[<i>audio</i>] gives a list of Audio objects, each of which represents one channel of <i>audio</i>.

AudioChannelSeparate[<i>audio</i>,<i>channel</i>] returns the specified <i>channel</i> from <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioData
AudioData[<i>audio</i>] gives an array of audio samples.

AudioData[<i>audio</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives an array of audio samples converted to the specified "<i>type</i>".

---

AudioDelay
AudioDelay[<i>audio</i>,<i>delay</i>] creates audio by adding repeated decaying echos to <i>audio</i> spaced by the specified <i>delay</i>.

AudioDelay[<i>audio</i>,<i>delay</i>,<i>feedback</i>] uses the specified <i>feedback</i> as the amount of signal to preserve during each repetition.

AudioDelay[<i>audio</i>,<i>delay</i>,<i>feedback</i>,<i>mix</i>] uses <i>mix</i> to control the ratio between original and delayed audio.

AudioDelay[<i>video</i>,…] add delay to the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioDelete
AudioDelete[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i>] deletes the first <i>t</i> seconds of audio.

AudioDelete[<i>audio</i>,-<i>t</i>] deletes the last <i>t</i> seconds of audio.

AudioDelete[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] deletes from time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> to time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, returning the remaining audio as a single Audio object.

AudioDelete[<i>audio</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}] deletes multiple time intervals.

---

AudioDevice
AudioDevice is an option for Audio and related functions that specifies the device to use for playback.

---

AudioDistance
AudioDistance[<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>] returns a distance measure between <i>audio</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>.

AudioDistance[<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>] returns a distance measure between the audio tracks of <i>video</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>video</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

AudioEncoding
AudioEncoding is an option for Export and other functions that specifies the audio encoding to use when creating an audio or a video file.

---

AudioFade
AudioFade[<i>audio</i>] returns audio in which the beginning and end of <i>audio</i> are faded.

AudioFade[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i>] fades the first and last <i>t</i> seconds of <i>audio</i>.

AudioFade[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] fades <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> seconds at the beginning and <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> seconds at the end.

AudioFade[<i>video</i>,…] fades the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioFrequencyShift
AudioFrequencyShift[<i>audio</i>,<i>freq</i>] gives audio by shifting the spectrum of <i>audio</i> by <i>freq</i>.

AudioFrequencyShift[<i>audio</i>,<i>freq</i>,<i>mix</i>] uses <i>mix</i> to control the ratio between the original and shifted audio.

AudioFrequencyShift[<i>video</i>,…] shifts the spectrum of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioGenerator
AudioGenerator[<i>model</i>] generates one second of audio of a given <i>model</i>.

AudioGenerator[<i>model</i>,<i>t</i>] generates <i>t</i> seconds of audio.

AudioGenerator[<i>model</i>,<i>t</i>,"<i>type</i>"] generates audio samples of the specified "<i>type</i>".

---

AudioIdentify
AudioIdentify[<i>audio</i>] yields the result of attempting to identify what <i>audio</i> is a recording of.

AudioIdentify[<i>audio</i>,<i>category</i>] restricts the identification to the specified <i>category</i>.

AudioIdentify[<i>audio</i>,<i>category</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of up to <i>n</i> possible identifications.

AudioIdentify[<i>audio</i>,<i>category</i>,<i>n</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the specified property for each identification.

---

AudioInputDevice
AudioInputDevice is an option for AudioCapture that specifies the device to use for audio recording.

---

AudioInsert
AudioInsert[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i><i>new</i>] inserts the audio signal <i>new</i> at time <i>t</i>.

AudioInsert[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>new</i>] inserts the same audio at multiple positions.

AudioInsert[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub><i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] inserts multiple audio signals at different positions.

---

AudioInstanceQ
AudioInstanceQ[<i>audio</i>,<i>obj</i>] gives True if <i>audio</i> sounds to be an instance of the object <i>obj</i>, and gives False otherwise.

AudioInstanceQ[<i>audio</i>,<i>obj</i>,<i>cat</i>] assumes that <i>audio</i> is the sound of something in the category <i>cat</i>.

---

AudioIntervals
AudioIntervals[<i>audio</i>] returns audible intervals of <i>audio</i>.

AudioIntervals[<i>audio</i>,<i>crit</i>] returns intervals of audio for which the criterion <i>crit</i> is satisfied.

AudioIntervals[<i>audio</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>mindur</i>] returns only intervals larger than the given duration <i>mindur</i>.

AudioIntervals[<i>video</i>,…] returns only intervals from the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioJoin
AudioJoin[<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…] or AudioJoin[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] concatenates all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and returns an audio object.

AudioJoin[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>},…] inserts <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> seconds of silence after each <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AudioLabel
AudioLabel is an option for an Audio object that specifies the label to show on the object.

---

AudioLength
AudioLength[<i>audio</i>] returns the number of samples in the Audio object <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioLocalMeasurements
AudioLocalMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>" locally for partitions of <i>audio</i>.

AudioLocalMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes several properties "<i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

AudioLocalMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,"<i>prop</i>",<i>format</i>] returns the measurements in the specified output <i>format</i>.

AudioLocalMeasurements[<i>video</i>,…] computes the measurements from the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioLooping
AudioLooping is an option for AudioStream and related functions to specify the playback looping.

---

AudioLoudness
AudioLoudness[<i>audio</i>] computes the loudness of <i>audio</i> according to the EBU momentary definition.

AudioLoudness[<i>audio</i>,<i>def</i>] computes the loudness according to the definition <i>def</i>.

AudioLoudness[<i>video</i>,…] computes the loudness of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioMeasurements
AudioMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>" for the entire <i>audio</i>.

AudioMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes several properties "<i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

AudioMeasurements[<i>audio</i>,"<i>prop</i>",<i>format</i>] returns the values in the specified output <i>format</i>.

AudioMeasurements[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] returns measurements for all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AudioMeasurements[<i>video</i>,…] returns measurements for the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioNormalize
AudioNormalize[<i>audio</i>] normalizes <i>audio</i> so that the maximum absolute value of its samples is 1.

AudioNormalize[<i>audio</i>,<i>model</i>] normalizes the audio signal based on the specified <i>model</i>.

AudioNormalize[<i>video</i>] normalizes the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioOutputDevice
AudioOutputDevice is an option for Audio and related functions that specifies the device to use for playback.

---

AudioOverlay
AudioOverlay[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns an audio object by overlaying all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AudioPad
AudioPad[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i>] adds <i>t</i> seconds of silence to the end of <i>audio</i>.

AudioPad[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] adds <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> seconds of silence to the beginning and <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> seconds to the end of <i>audio</i>.

AudioPad[<i>audio</i>,<i>tspec</i>,<i>padding</i>] pads using the value or method specified by <i>padding</i>.

---

AudioPan
AudioPan[<i>audio</i>] returns a center-panned stereo audio object from a mono <i>audio</i>. 

AudioPan[<i>audio</i>,<i>pan</i>] returns a stereo audio object after panning left and right channels using the specified <i>pan</i>.

AudioPan[<i>video</i>,…] pans the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioPartition
AudioPartition[<i>audio</i>,<i>dur</i>] partitions an audio object into non-overlapping segments of duration <i>dur</i>.

AudioPartition[<i>audio</i>,<i>dur</i>,<i>offset</i>] generates segments with specified <i>offset</i>.

---

AudioPause
AudioPause[] pauses the playback of all AudioStream objects.

AudioPause[<i>astream</i>] pauses the playback of the AudioStream object <i>astream</i>.

AudioPause[<i>audio</i>] pauses the playback for all streams originated by <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioPitchShift
AudioPitchShift[<i>audio</i>,<i>r</i>] applies pitch shifting to <i>audio</i> by the ratio <i>r</i>, shifting every frequency f to r f.

AudioPitchShift[<i>video</i>,<i>r</i>] applies pitch shifting to the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioPlay
AudioPlay[<i>audio</i>] returns a new AudioStream object from <i>audio</i> and starts the playback.

AudioPlay[<i>astream</i>] starts playing an AudioStream object <i>astream</i>.

---

AudioPlot
AudioPlot[<i>audio</i>] plots the waveform of <i>audio</i>.

AudioPlot[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots waveforms of all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AudioPlot[<i>video</i>] plots the waveform of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioQ
AudioQ[<i>audio</i>] yields True if <i>audio</i> has the form of a valid Audio object, and False otherwise.

---

AudioRecord
AudioRecord[] returns a new AudioStream object and starts to record from the default input audio device.

AudioRecord[<i>inputdev</i>] records from the input audio device <i>inputdev</i>.

AudioRecord[<i>astream</i>] starts recording an AudioStream object <i>astream</i> that is connected to an input device.

---

AudioReplace
AudioReplace[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}<i>new</i>] replaces the audio signal between <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> with the new signal <i>new</i>.

AudioReplace[<i>audio</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}<i>new</i>] replaces multiple intervals with the same audio <i>new</i>.

AudioReplace[<i>audio</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>}<i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] replaces multiple intervals.

AudioReplace[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}<i>new</i>,<i>fitting</i>] uses the specified <i>fitting</i> method.

---

AudioResample
AudioResample[<i>audio</i>,<i>sr</i>] resamples <i>audio</i> to have the sample rate of <i>sr</i>.

AudioResample[<i>video</i>,<i>sr</i>] resamples the first audio track in <i>video</i> to have the sample rate of <i>sr</i>.

---

AudioReverb
AudioReverb[<i>audio</i>] adds reverberation to <i>audio</i>.

AudioReverb[<i>audio</i>,<i>model</i>] adds reverberation following the room <i>model</i>.

AudioReverb[<i>audio</i>,<i>model</i>,<i>mix</i>] controls the <i>mix</i> ratio between original and reverberated audio.

AudioReverb[<i>video</i>,…] adds reverberation to the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioReverse
AudioReverse[<i>audio</i>] reverses <i>audio</i> so that the signal is played backward.

AudioReverse[<i>video</i>] reverses the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioSampleRate
AudioSampleRate[<i>audio</i>] returns the sample rate of the Audio object <i>audio</i>.

AudioSampleRate[<i>video</i>] returns the sample rate of the first audio track of <i>video</i>.

---

AudioSpectralMap
AudioSpectralMap[<i>f</i>,<i>audio</i>] transforms audio by applying the function <i>f</i> to its short-time Fourier transform.

AudioSpectralMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] applies the function <i>f</i> to the list of short-time Fourier transforms of all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AudioSpectralMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] transforms the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioSpectralTransformation
AudioSpectralTransformation[<i>f</i>,<i>audio</i>] returns a modified version of <i>audio</i> by applying a time-frequency transformation <i>f</i> to its short-time Fourier transform.

AudioSpectralTransformation[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] transforms the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioSplit
AudioSplit[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i>] splits <i>audio</i> at time <i>t</i>.

AudioSplit[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] splits <i>audio</i> at times <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

AudioStop
AudioStop[] stops the playback of all AudioStream objects.

AudioStop[<i>astream</i>] stops the playback of the AudioStream object <i>astream</i>.

AudioStop[<i>audio</i>] stops the playback for all streams originated by <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioStream
AudioStream[<i>source</i>] creates a new AudioStream object from <i>source</i>.

AudioStream[<i>id</i>] is an object that represents a unique audio stream.

---

AudioStreams
AudioStreams[] returns all existing streams.

AudioStreams[<i>audio</i>] returns all existing streams that originated from <i>audio</i>.

AudioStreams[<i>audio</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] returns "<i>prop</i>" for all streams that originated from <i>audio</i>.

---

AudioTimeStretch
AudioTimeStretch[<i>audio</i>,<i>r</i>] applies time stretching to <i>audio</i> by the specified factor <i>r</i>.

AudioTimeStretch[<i>video</i>,<i>r</i>] applies time stretching to the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

AudioTrackApply
AudioTrackApply[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the first audio track of the Video object <i>video</i>.

---

AudioTrackSelection
AudioTrackSelection is an option that specifies the audio tracks of interest.

---

AudioTrim
AudioTrim[<i>audio</i>] trims silence from the beginning and end of <i>audio</i>.

AudioTrim[<i>audio</i>,<i>t</i>] returns the first <i>t</i> seconds of <i>audio</i>.

AudioTrim[<i>audio</i>,-<i>t</i>] returns the last <i>t</i> seconds of <i>audio</i>.

AudioTrim[<i>audio</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] returns audio starting at time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> and ending at time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> of <i>audio</i>.

AudioTrim[<i>audio</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}] returns a list of audio for all given intervals {<i>t</i><sub><i>i1</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>i2</i></sub>}.

---

AudioType
AudioType[<i>audio</i>] returns the data type used to represent samples in the Audio object <i>audio</i>.

---

AugmentedPolyhedron
AugmentedPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the augmented polyhedron <i>poly</i> by replacing each face by a pyramid. 

AugmentedPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>,<i>h</i>] gives the augmented polyhedron with a pyramid of height <i>h</i>.

---

AugmentedSymmetricPolynomial
AugmentedSymmetricPolynomial[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a formal augmented symmetric polynomial with exponents <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

AugmentedSymmetricPolynomial[{{<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>1n</i></sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>21</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>2n</i></sub>},…}] represents a multivariate formal augmented symmetric polynomial with exponent vectors {<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>, …, <i>r</i><sub><i>1n</i></sub>}, {<i>r</i><sub>21</sub>, …, <i>r</i><sub><i>2n</i></sub>}, ….

AugmentedSymmetricPolynomial[<i>rspec</i>,<i>data</i>] gives the augmented symmetric polynomial in <i>data</i>.

---

Autocomplete
Autocomplete[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the <i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that can complete <i>string</i>.

Autocomplete[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub><i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub><i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…,"<i>string</i>"] puts the completions in order of decreasing weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Autocomplete[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>string</i>"] uses completions specified by the associations <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Autocomplete[<i>comps</i>,"<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the first at most <i>n</i> completions.

Autocomplete[<i>comps</i>] gives an AutocompletionFunction[…] that can be applied to a string.

---

AutocompletionFunction
AutocompletionFunction[…] represents a function to be applied to a string to generate possible completions. 

---

AutocorrelationTest
AutocorrelationTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the <i>data</i> is autocorrelated.

AutocorrelationTest[<i>data</i>,<i>k</i>] tests whether the <i>data</i> is autocorrelated up to lag <i>k</i>.

AutocorrelationTest[<i>data</i>,<i>k</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>" for a given model.

---

AutoIndent
AutoIndent is an option for Style and Cell that specifies what automatic indentation should be done at the beginning of a new line after an explicit return character has been entered. 

---

AutoItalicWords
AutoItalicWords is an option for Cell that gives a list of words that should automatically be put in italics when they are entered. 

---

AutoloadPath
AutoloadPath is a global option that specifies from which directories packages are automatically loaded when the Wolfram System is started.

---

Automatic
Automatic represents an option or other value that is to be chosen automatically by a built‐in function. 

---

Axes
Axes is an option for graphics functions that specifies whether axes should be drawn. 

---

AxesEdge
AxesEdge is an option for three-dimensional graphics functions that specifies on which edges of the bounding box axes should be drawn. 

---

AxesLabel
AxesLabel is an option for graphics functions that specifies labels for axes. 

---

AxesOrigin
AxesOrigin is an option for graphics functions that specifies where any axes drawn should cross. 

---

AxesStyle
AxesStyle is an option for graphics functions that specifies how axes should be rendered. 

---

AxiomaticTheory
AxiomaticTheory["<i>theory</i>"] gives an axiomatic representation of the specified axiomatic theory.

AxiomaticTheory[{"<i>theory</i>",<i>op</i><sub>1</sub><i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>op</i><sub>2</sub><i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to represent the operator <i>op</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the theory.

AxiomaticTheory[<i>theory</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property of an axiomatic theory.

---

Axis
Axis is a symbol that represents the axis for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

AxisLabel
AxisLabel is an option for AxisObject that specifies a label for the axis.

---

AxisObject
AxisObject[<i>path</i>] is a Graphics primitive that represents an axis with a quantitative scale along the path <i>path</i>.

AxisObject[<i>path</i>,<i>scale</i>] uses the scale specified by <i>scale</i>.

---

AxisStyle
AxisStyle is an option for AxisObject that specifies how to style the path of an axis.

---

BabyMonsterGroupB
BabyMonsterGroupB[] represents the sporadic simple baby monster group B.

---

Back
Back is a symbol that represents the back of a graphic for purposes of placement and alignment.

---

Background
Background is an option that specifies what background color to use. 

---

Backslash
Backslash[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x∖y∖….

---

Backward
Backward is a symbol that represents the backward direction for purposes of motion and animation.

---

Ball
Ball[<i>p</i>] represents the unit ball centered at the point <i>p</i>.

Ball[<i>p</i>,<i>r</i>] represents the ball of radius <i>r</i> centered at the point <i>p</i>.

Ball[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>r</i>] represents a collection of balls of radius <i>r</i>.

---

Band
Band[{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>}] represents the sequence of positions on the diagonal band that starts with {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>} in a sparse array.

Band[{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…}] represents the positions between {<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…} and {<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…}.

Band[{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…},{<i>di</i>,<i>dj</i>,…}] represents positions starting with {<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…} and then moving with step {<i>di</i>,<i>dj</i>,…}.

---

BandpassFilter
BandpassFilter[<i>data</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>}] applies a bandpass filter with cutoff frequencies ω<sub>1</sub> and ω<sub>2</sub> to an array of data.

BandpassFilter[<i>data</i>,{{ω,<i>q</i>}}] uses center frequency ω and quality factor <i>q</i>.

BandpassFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

BandpassFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

BandstopFilter
BandstopFilter[<i>data</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>}] applies a bandstop filter with cutoff frequencies ω<sub>1</sub> and ω<sub>2</sub> to an array of data.

BandstopFilter[<i>data</i>,{{ω,<i>q</i>}}] uses center frequency ω and quality factor <i>q</i>. 

BandstopFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

BandstopFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

BarabasiAlbertGraphDistribution
BarabasiAlbertGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] represents a Barabasi–Albert graph distribution for <i>n</i>-vertex graphs where a new vertex with <i>k</i> edges is added at each step.

---

BarChart
BarChart[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] makes a bar chart with bar lengths <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i> </i><i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

BarChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a bar chart with bar features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

BarChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a bar chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BarChart3D
BarChart3D[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D bar chart with bar lengths <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

BarChart3D[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a 3D bar chart with bar features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

BarChart3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D bar chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BarcodeImage
BarcodeImage["<i>string</i>"] generates a barcode image of "<i>string</i>" in the "QR" format.

BarcodeImage["<i>string</i>",<i>format</i>] generates a barcode image of "<i>string</i>" in the specified <i>format</i>.

BarcodeImage["<i>string</i>",<i>format</i>,<i>size</i>] attempts to generate a barcode image of the specified <i>size</i>.

---

BarcodeRecognize
BarcodeRecognize[<i>image</i>] recognizes a barcode in <i>image</i> and returns it as a string.

BarcodeRecognize[<i>image</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] returns the specified property of the barcode.

BarcodeRecognize[<i>image</i>,"<i>prop</i>",<i>format</i>] recognizes barcodes of the specified <i>format</i> only.

BarcodeRecognize[<i>video</i>,…] recognizes barcodes in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

BaringhausHenzeTest
BaringhausHenzeTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether data follows a MultinormalDistribution using the Baringhaus–Henze test.

BaringhausHenzeTest[<i>data</i>,MultinormalDistribution[μ,Σ]] tests whether data follows the distribution with mean vector μ and covariance matrix Σ.

BaringhausHenzeTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>". 

---

BarLegend
BarLegend[<i>cf</i>] generates a legend that identifies colors from the color function <i>cf</i> with an automatic range of values.

BarLegend[{<i>cf</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}}] generates a legend that identifies colors from the color function <i>cf</i> with the range of values between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>.

BarLegend[<i>cf</i>,<i>contours</i>] generates a legend that identifies color ranges from the color function <i>cf</i> based on the set of contours <i>contours</i>.

---

BarlowProschanImportance
BarlowProschanImportance[<i>rdist</i>] gives the Barlow–Proschan importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i>. 

BarlowProschanImportance[<i>fdist</i>] gives the Barlow–Proschan importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i>.

---

BarnesG
BarnesG[<i>z</i>] gives the Barnes G-function G(z).

---

BarOrigin
BarOrigin is an option to BarChart and related functions that specifies the origin placement for bars. 

---

BarSpacing
BarSpacing is an option to BarChart and related functions that controls the spacing between bars and groups of bars.

---

BartlettHannWindow
BartlettHannWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Bartlett–Hann window function of <i>x</i>.

---

BartlettWindow
BartlettWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Bartlett window function of <i>x</i>.

---

BaseDecode
BaseDecode["<i>string</i>"] decodes the Base64 data contained in a string and returns the result as a byte array.

BaseDecode["<i>string</i>","<i>encoding</i>"] decodes using the string using the specified encoding.

---

BaseEncode
BaseEncode[<i>ba</i>] encodes the byte array <i>ba</i> as a Base64 string.

BaseEncode[<i>ba</i>,"<i>encoding</i>"] encodes using the specified encoding.

---

BaseForm
BaseForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with the numbers in <i>expr</i> given in base <i>n</i>. 

---

Baseline
Baseline is a symbol that represents the baseline for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

BaselinePosition
BaselinePosition is an option that specifies where the baseline of an object is considered to be for purposes of alignment with surrounding text or other expressions. 

---

BasicRecurrentLayer
BasicRecurrentLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a trainable recurrent layer that takes a sequence of vectors and produces a sequence of vectors each of size <i>n</i>.

BasicRecurrentLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial weights and other parameters. 

---

BatchNormalizationLayer
BatchNormalizationLayer[] represents a trainable net layer that normalizes its input data by learning the data mean and variance.

---

BatchSize
BatchSize is an option for NetTrain and related functions that specifies the size of a batch of examples to process together.

---

BatesDistribution
BatesDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents the distribution of a mean of <i>n</i> random variables uniformly distributed from 0 to 1.

BatesDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>{</i><i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents the distribution of a mean of <i>n</i> random variables uniformly distributed from <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>.

---

BattleLemarieWavelet
BattleLemarieWavelet[] represents the Battle–Lemarié wavelet of order 3.

BattleLemarieWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents the Battle–Lemarié wavelet of order <i>n</i> evaluated on equally spaced interval {-10,10}.

BattleLemarieWavelet[<i>n</i>,<i>lim</i>] represents the Battle–Lemarié wavelet of order <i>n</i> evaluated on equally spaced interval {-<i>lim</i><i>,</i><i>lim</i>}. 

---

BayesianMaximization
BayesianMaximization[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an object representing the result of Bayesian maximization over the function <i>f</i> over the configurations <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BayesianMaximization[<i>f</i>,<i>reg</i>] maximizes over the region represented by the region specification <i>reg</i>.

BayesianMaximization[<i>f</i>,<i>sampler</i>] maximizes over configurations obtained by applying the function <i>sampler</i>.

BayesianMaximization[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>nsampler</i>] applies the function <i>nsampler</i> to successively generate configurations starting from the <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

BayesianMaximizationObject
BayesianMaximizationObject[…] represents the result of a Bayesian maximization process.

---

BayesianMinimization
BayesianMinimization[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an object representing the result of Bayesian minimization of the function <i>f</i> over the configurations <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

BayesianMinimization[<i>f</i>,<i>reg</i>] minimizes over the region represented by the region specification <i>reg</i>.

BayesianMinimization[<i>f</i>,<i>sampler</i>] minimizes over configurations obtained by applying the function <i>sampler</i>. 

BayesianMinimization[<i>f</i>,{<i>conf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>conf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>nsampler</i>] applies the function <i>nsampler</i> to successively generate configurations starting from the <i>conf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BayesianMinimizationObject
BayesianMinimizationObject[…] represents the result of a Bayesian minimization process. 

---

Because
Because[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x∵y.

---

BeckmannDistribution
BeckmannDistribution[μ<sub>1</sub>,μ<sub>2</sub>,σ<sub>1</sub>,σ<sub>2</sub>] represents the Beckmann distribution with means μ<sub>1</sub> and μ<sub>2</sub> and standard deviations σ<sub>1</sub> and σ<sub>2</sub>.

BeckmannDistribution[μ<sub>1</sub>,μ<sub>2</sub>,σ<sub>1</sub>,σ<sub>2</sub>,ρ] represents the Beckmann distribution with means μ<sub>1</sub> and μ<sub>2</sub>, standard deviations σ<sub>1</sub> and σ<sub>2</sub>, and correlation ρ.

---

Beep
Beep[] generates an audible beep when evaluated. 

Beep["<i>message</i>"] beeps and populates the Why the Beep dialog with <i>message</i>.

---

Before
Before is a symbol that represents the region before an object for purposes of placement.

---

Begin
Begin["<i>context</i>`"] resets the current context. 

---

BeginDialogPacket
BeginDialogPacket[<i>integer</i>] is a WSTP packet that indicates the start of the Dialog subsession referenced by <i>integer</i>.

---

BellB
BellB[<i>n</i>] gives the Bell number B<sub>n</sub>. 

BellB[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Bell polynomial B<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

BellY
BellY[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n-k+1</i></sub>}] gives the partial Bell polynomial Y<sub>n,k</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n-k+1</sub>).

BellY[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the generalized partial Bell polynomial of a matrix <i>m</i>.

BellY[<i>m</i>] gives the generalized Bell polynomial of a matrix <i>m</i>.

---

Below
Below is a symbol that represents the region below an object for purposes of placement.

---

BenfordDistribution
BenfordDistribution[<i>b</i>] represents a Benford distribution with base parameter <i>b</i>.

---

BeniniDistribution
BeniniDistribution[α,β,σ] represents a Benini distribution with shape parameters α and β and scale parameter σ.

---

BenktanderGibratDistribution
BenktanderGibratDistribution[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a Benktander distribution of type I with parameters <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>.

---

BenktanderWeibullDistribution
BenktanderWeibullDistribution[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a Benktander distribution of type II with parameters <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>.

---

BernoulliB
BernoulliB[<i>n</i>] gives the Bernoulli number B<sub>n</sub>. 

BernoulliB[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Bernoulli polynomial B<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

BernoulliDistribution
BernoulliDistribution[<i>p</i>] represents a Bernoulli distribution with probability parameter <i>p</i>.

---

BernoulliGraphDistribution
BernoulliGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents a Bernoulli graph distribution for <i>n</i>-vertex graphs with edge probability <i>p</i>.

---

BernoulliProcess
BernoulliProcess[<i>p</i>] represents a Bernoulli process with event probability <i>p</i>.

---

BernsteinBasis
BernsteinBasis[<i>d</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] represents the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> Bernstein basis function of degree <i>d</i> at <i>x</i>.

---

BesagL
BesagL[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates Besag's L function L(r) for point data <i>pdata</i> at radius <i>r</i>.

BesagL[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes L(r) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

BesagL[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes L(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

BesagL[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function L that can be applied repeatedly to different radii <i>r</i>.

---

BesselFilterModel
BesselFilterModel[<i>n</i>] designs a lowpass Bessel filter of order <i>n</i> and cutoff frequency 1.

BesselFilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>}] uses the cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>.

BesselFilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

BesselI
BesselI[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the modified Bessel function of the first kind I<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

BesselJ
BesselJ[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Bessel function of the first kind J<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

BesselJZero
BesselJZero[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero of the Bessel function J<sub>n</sub>(x).

BesselJZero[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero greater than <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

BesselK
BesselK[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the modified Bessel function of the second kind K<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

BesselY
BesselY[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Bessel function of the second kind Y<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

BesselYZero
BesselYZero[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero of the Bessel function of the second kind Y<sub>n</sub>(x).

BesselYZero[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero greater than <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

Beta
Beta[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the Euler beta function Β(a,b). 

Beta[<i>z</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the incomplete beta function Β<sub>z</sub>(a,b). 

---

BetaBinomialDistribution
BetaBinomialDistribution[α,β,<i>n</i>] represents a beta binomial mixture distribution with beta distribution parameters α and β, and <i>n</i> binomial trials.

---

BetaDistribution
BetaDistribution[α,β] represents a continuous beta distribution with shape parameters α and β.

---

BetaNegativeBinomialDistribution
BetaNegativeBinomialDistribution[α,β,<i>n</i>] represents a beta negative binomial mixture distribution with beta distribution parameters α and β and <i>n</i> successful trials.

---

BetaPrimeDistribution
BetaPrimeDistribution[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>] represents a beta prime distribution with shape parameters <i>p</i> and <i>q</i>. 

BetaPrimeDistribution[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,β] represents a generalized beta prime distribution with scale parameter β.

BetaPrimeDistribution[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,α,β] represents a generalized beta distribution of the second kind with shape parameter α.

---

BetaRegularized
BetaRegularized[<i>z</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the regularized incomplete beta function I<sub>z</sub>(a,b). 

---

Between
Between[<i>x</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] is equivalent to <i>min</i>≤<i>x</i>≤<i>max</i>.

Between[<i>x</i>,{{<i>min</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>max</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>min</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>max</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] is equivalent to <i>min</i><sub>1</sub>≤<i>x</i>≤<i>max</i><sub>1</sub>||<i>min</i><sub>2</sub>≤<i>x</i>≤<i>max</i><sub>2</sub>||….

Between[<i>range</i>] is an operator form that yields Between[<i>x</i>,<i>range</i>] when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

BetweennessCentrality
BetweennessCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of betweenness centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

BetweennessCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

BeveledPolyhedron
BeveledPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the beveled polyhedron of <i>poly</i>, by beveling each edge. 

BeveledPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>,<i>l</i>] bevels the polyhedron <i>poly</i> by a length ratio <i>l</i> at its edges.

---

BezierCurve
BezierCurve[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is a graphics primitive that represents a Bézier curve with control points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

BezierFunction
BezierFunction[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a Bézier function for a curve defined by the control points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BezierFunction[<i>array</i>] represents a Bézier function for a surface or high-dimensional manifold. 

---

BilateralFilter
BilateralFilter[<i>data</i>,σ,μ] applies a bilateral filter of spatial spread σ and pixel value spread μ to <i>data</i>.

---

BilateralLaplaceTransform
BilateralLaplaceTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the bilateral Laplace transform of <i>expr</i>. 

BilateralLaplaceTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>t</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional bilateral Laplace transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

BilateralZTransform
BilateralZTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the bilateral Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

BilateralZTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>},{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional bilateral Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

Binarize
Binarize[<i>image</i>] creates a binary image from <i>image</i> by replacing all values above a globally determined threshold with 1 and others with 0.

Binarize[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] creates a binary image by replacing all values above <i>t</i> with 1 and others with 0.

Binarize[<i>image</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] creates a binary image by replacing all values in the range <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> with 1 and others with 0.

Binarize[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>] creates a binary image by replacing all channel value lists for which <i>f</i>[<i>v</i>] yields True with 1 and others with 0.

---

BinaryDeserialize
BinaryDeserialize[ByteArray[…]] recovers an expression from a binary representation generated by BinarySerialize.

BinaryDeserialize[ByteArray[…],<i>h</i>] wraps <i>h</i> around the expression produced before returning it.

---

BinaryDistance
BinaryDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the binary distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>, equal to 0 if they are identical and 1 otherwise.

---

BinaryFormat
BinaryFormat is an option for OpenRead and related functions that specifies that a stream should be opened in binary format, so that no textual interpretation of newlines or other data is done.

---

BinaryImageQ
BinaryImageQ[<i>image</i>] yields True if <i>image</i> has the form of a binary Image or Image3D object, and False otherwise.

---

BinaryRead
BinaryRead[<i>stream</i>] reads one byte of raw binary data from an input stream, and returns an integer from 0 to 255. 

BinaryRead[<i>stream</i>,<i>type</i>] reads an object of the specified type. 

BinaryRead[<i>stream</i>,{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads a sequence of objects of the specified types.

---

BinaryReadList
BinaryReadList["<i>file</i>"] reads all remaining bytes from a file, and returns them as a list of integers from 0 to 255. 

BinaryReadList["<i>file</i>",<i>type</i>] reads objects of the specified type from a file, until the end of the file is reached. The list of objects read is returned. 

BinaryReadList["<i>file</i>",{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads objects with a sequence of types, until the end of the file is reached. 

BinaryReadList["<i>file</i>",<i>types</i>,<i>n</i>] reads only the first <i>n</i> objects of the specified types. 

---

BinarySerialize
BinarySerialize[<i>expr</i>] gives a binary representation of any expression <i>expr</i> as a ByteArray object.

---

BinaryWrite
BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,<i>b</i>] writes a byte of data, specified as an integer from 0 to 255. 

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] writes a sequence of bytes. 

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,"<i>string</i>"] writes the raw sequence of characters in a string. 

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,ByteArray[…]] writes the contents of a ByteArray object.

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>type</i>] writes an object of the specified type. 

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>type</i>] writes a sequence of objects of the specified type. 

BinaryWrite[<i>channel</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] writes a sequence of objects with a sequence of types. 

---

BinCounts
BinCounts[<i>data</i>] counts the number of elements of <i>data</i> whose values lie in successive integer bins.

BinCounts[<i>data</i>,<i>binspec</i>] counts the number of elements of <i>data</i> whose values lie in successive bins specified by <i>binspec</i>.

---

BinLists
BinLists[<i>data</i>] gives lists of the elements of <i>data</i> whose values lie in successive integer bins.

BinLists[<i>data</i>,<i>binspec</i>] gives lists of the elements of <i>data</i> whose values lie in successive bins specified by <i>binspec</i>.

BinLists[<i>data</i><i>inds</i>,…] gives the lists of the labels <i>inds</i> specified by the binning of <i>data</i>.

---

BinnedVariogramList
BinnedVariogramList[<i>{</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i>] computes a variogram using binned values. 

BinnedVariogramList[<i>{</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i><i></i><i>{</i><i><i>val</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>val</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i>] generates the same result.

BinnedVariogramList[…,<i>spec</i>] allows binning <i>spec</i> to be specified as given in HistogramList. 

---

Binomial
Binomial[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the binomial coefficient (�).

---

BinomialDistribution
BinomialDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents a binomial distribution with <i>n</i> trials and success probability <i>p</i>.

---

BinomialPointProcess
BinomialPointProcess[<i>n,reg</i>] represents a binomial point process with <i>n</i> points in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

BinomialProcess
BinomialProcess[<i>p</i>] represents a binomial process with event probability <i>p</i>.

---

BioSequenceModify
BioSequenceModify[<i>seq</i>,"<i>mod</i>"] gives the result of applying the modification "<i>mod</i>" to the sequence <i>seq</i>.

BioSequenceModify[<i>seq</i>,{"<i>mod</i>",<i>params</i>}] specifies the parameters <i>params</i> for "<i>mod</i>".

BioSequenceModify[<i>modspec</i>] represents an operator form of BioSequenceModify that can be applied to a biomolecular sequence.

---

BipartiteGraphQ
BipartiteGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a bipartite graph and False otherwise.

---

BiquadraticFilterModel
BiquadraticFilterModel[{ω,<i>q</i>}] creates a lowpass biquadratic filter using the characteristic frequency ω and the quality factor <i>q</i>.

BiquadraticFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}] creates a filter of a given {"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}.

BiquadraticFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

BirnbaumImportance
BirnbaumImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the Birnbaum importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

BirnbaumImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the Birnbaum importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

BirnbaumSaundersDistribution
BirnbaumSaundersDistribution[α,λ] represents the Birnbaum–Saunders distribution with shape parameter α and scale parameter λ.

---

BitAnd
BitAnd[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the bitwise AND of the integers <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BitClear
BitClear[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] sets to 0 the bit corresponding to the coefficient of 2<sup>k</sup> in the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BitGet
BitGet[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gets the bit corresponding to the coefficient of 2<sup>k</sup> in the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BitLength
BitLength[<i>n</i>] gives the number of binary bits necessary to represent the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BitNot
BitNot[<i>n</i>] gives the bitwise NOT of the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BitOr
BitOr[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the bitwise OR of the integers <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BitRate
BitRate is an option that specifies an approximate number of bits per second when creating video and audio files.

---

BitSet
BitSet[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] sets to 1 the bit corresponding to the coefficient of 2<sup>k</sup> in the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BitShiftLeft
BitShiftLeft[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] shifts the binary bits in the integer <i>n</i> to the left by <i>k</i> places, padding with zeros on the right.

BitShiftLeft[<i>n</i>] shifts one bit to the left.

---

BitShiftRight
BitShiftRight[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] shifts the binary bits in the integer <i>n</i> to the right by <i>k</i> places, dropping bits that are shifted past the unit's position on the right. 

BitShiftRight[<i>n</i>] shifts one bit to the right.

---

BitXor
BitXor[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the bitwise XOR of the integers <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BiweightLocation
BiweightLocation[<i>list</i>] gives the value of the biweight location estimator of the elements in <i>list</i>.

BiweightLocation[<i>list</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the value of the biweight location estimator with scaling parameter <i>c</i>.

---

BiweightMidvariance
BiweightMidvariance[<i>list</i>] gives the value of the biweight midvariance of the elements in <i>list</i>.

BiweightMidvariance[<i>list</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the value of the biweight midvariance with scaling parameter <i>c</i>.

---

Black
Black represents the color black in graphics or style specifications. 

---

BlackmanHarrisWindow
BlackmanHarrisWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Blackman–Harris window function of <i>x</i>.

---

BlackmanNuttallWindow
BlackmanNuttallWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Blackman–Nuttall window function of <i>x</i>.

---

BlackmanWindow
BlackmanWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Blackman window function of <i>x</i>.

---

Blank
_ or Blank[] is a pattern object that can stand for any Wolfram Language expression. 

_<i>h</i> or Blank[<i>h</i>] can stand for any expression with head <i>h</i>. 

---

BlankNullSequence
___ (three _ characters) or BlankNullSequence[] is a pattern object that can stand for any sequence of zero or more Wolfram Language expressions. 

___<i>h</i> or BlankNullSequence[<i>h</i>] can stand for any sequence of expressions, all of which have head <i>h</i>. 

---

BlankSequence
__ (two _ characters) or BlankSequence[] is a pattern object that can stand for any sequence of one or more Wolfram Language expressions. 

__<i>h</i> or BlankSequence[<i>h</i>] can stand for any sequence of one or more expressions, all of which have head <i>h</i>. 

---

Blend
Blend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>x</i>] gives a color obtained by blending a fraction 1-x of color <i>col</i><sub>1</sub> and x of color <i>col</i><sub>2</sub>.

Blend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>3</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] linearly interpolates between colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as <i>x</i> varies from 0 to 1.

Blend[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>x</i>] interpolates to give <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Blend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] blends all the <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, using fraction <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of color <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Blend[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] blends pixel values of 2D or 3D images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Block
Block[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…},<i>expr</i>] specifies that <i>expr</i> is to be evaluated with local values for the symbols <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

Block[{<i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] defines initial local values for <i>x</i>, …. 

---

BlockMap
BlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to non-overlapping sublists of length <i>n</i> in <i>list</i>. 

BlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] applies <i>f</i> to sublists with offset <i>d</i> in <i>list</i>. 

BlockMap[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] applies <i>f</i> to blocks of size <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×….

---

BlockRandom
BlockRandom[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> with all pseudorandom generators localized, so that uses of SeedRandom, RandomInteger, and related functions within the evaluation of <i>expr</i> do not affect subsequent pseudorandom sequences.

---

BlomqvistBetaTest
BlomqvistBetaTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

BlomqvistBetaTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

BlomqvistBetaTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Blue
Blue represents the color blue in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Blur
Blur[<i>image</i>] gives a blurred version of <i>image</i>.

Blur[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives a version of <i>image</i> blurred over pixel radius <i>r</i>.

---

BodePlot
BodePlot[<i>lsys</i>] generates a Bode plot of a linear time-invariant system <i>lsys</i>.

BodePlot[<i>lsys</i>,{ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots for the frequency range ω<sub><i>min</i></sub> to ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

BodePlot[<i>expr</i>,{ω,ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots <i>expr</i> using the variable ω.

---

BohmanWindow
BohmanWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Bohman window function of <i>x</i>.

---

Bold
Bold represents a bold font weight.

---

Bond
Bond[{<i>id</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>id</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},<i>type</i>] represents a chemical bond between atoms with indices <i>id</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>id</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> of the specified type.

---

BondLabels
BondLabels is an option for MoleculePlot and MoleculePlot3D that specifies what labels and label positions should be used for bonds.

---

BondLabelStyle
BondLabelStyle is an option for MoleculePlot and MoleculePlot3D that specifies the style to use for bond labels.

---

Bookmarks
Bookmarks is an option for Manipulate and related functions that gives a list of bookmark settings.

---

Boole
Boole[<i>expr</i>] yields 1 if <i>expr</i> is True and 0 if it is False. 

---

BooleanConvert
BooleanConvert[<i>expr</i>] converts the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> to disjunctive normal form.

BooleanConvert[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] converts the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> to the specified form.

BooleanConvert[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>cond</i>] finds an expression in the specified form that is equivalent to <i>expr</i> when <i>cond</i> is true.

---

BooleanCountingFunction
BooleanCountingFunction[<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] represents a Boolean function of <i>n</i> variables that gives True if at most <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> variables are True.

BooleanCountingFunction[{<i>k</i>},<i>n</i>] represents a function of <i>n</i> variables that gives True if exactly <i>k</i> variables are True.

BooleanCountingFunction[{<i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>n</i>] represents a function that gives True if between <i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> variables are True.

BooleanCountingFunction[{{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}},<i>n</i>] represents a function that gives True if exactly <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> variables are True.

BooleanCountingFunction[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the Boolean expression in variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the Boolean counting function specified by <i>spec</i>.

BooleanCountingFunction[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] gives the Boolean expression in the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

BooleanFunction
BooleanFunction[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> Boolean function in <i>n</i> variables.

BooleanFunction[<i>values</i>] represents the Boolean function corresponding to the specified vector of truth values.

BooleanFunction[{{<i>i</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>12</sub>,…}<i>o</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents the Boolean function defined by the specified mapping from inputs to outputs.

BooleanFunction[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the Boolean expression in variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the Boolean function specified by <i>spec</i>.

BooleanFunction[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] gives the Boolean expression in the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

BooleanGraph
BooleanGraph[<i>bfunc</i>,<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] gives the Boolean graph defined by the Boolean function <i>bfunc</i> on the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>g</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

BooleanMaxterms
BooleanMaxterms[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> maxterm in <i>n</i> variables.

BooleanMaxterms[{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] represents the conjunction of the maxterms <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BooleanMaxterms[{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…}] represents the conjunction of maxterms given by the exponent vectors <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, ….

BooleanMaxterms[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the Boolean expression in variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the maxterms function specified by <i>spec</i>.

BooleanMaxterms[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub></sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] gives the Boolean expression in the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

BooleanMinimize
BooleanMinimize[<i>expr</i>] finds a minimal-length disjunctive normal form representation of <i>expr</i>.

BooleanMinimize[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] finds a minimal-length representation for <i>expr</i> in the specified form.

BooleanMinimize[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>cond</i>] finds a minimal-length expression in the specified form that is equivalent to <i>expr</i> when <i>cond</i> is true.

---

BooleanMinterms
BooleanMinterms[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> minterm in <i>n</i> variables.

BooleanMinterms[{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] represents the disjunction of the minterms <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BooleanMinterms[{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…}] represents the disjunction of minterms given by the exponent vectors <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, ….

BooleanMinterms[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the Boolean expression in variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the minterms function specified by <i>spec</i>.

BooleanMinterms[<i>spec</i>,{<i>a</i><sub></sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] gives the Boolean expression in the form specified by <i>form</i>.

---

BooleanQ
BooleanQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is either True or False.

---

BooleanRegion
BooleanRegion[<i>bfunc</i>,{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the Boolean combination <i>bfunc</i> of regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

Booleans
Booleans represents the domain of Booleans, as in <i>x</i>∈Booleans. 

---

BooleanStrings
BooleanStrings is an option to TextString and related functions that determines what strings correspond to the Wolfram Language symbols True and False.

---

BooleanTable
BooleanTable[<i>bf</i>] gives a list of truth values for all possible combinations of variable values supplied to the Boolean function <i>bf</i>.

BooleanTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the truth values of the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> for all possible combinations of values of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BooleanTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…] gives a nested table of truth values of <i>expr</i> with the outermost level giving possible combinations of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

BooleanVariables
BooleanVariables[<i>expr</i>] gives a list of the Boolean variables in the Boolean expression <i>expr</i>.

BooleanVariables[<i>bf</i>] gives the number of Boolean variables in the BooleanFunction object <i>bf</i>.

---

BorderDimensions
BorderDimensions[<i>image</i>] gives the pixel width of uniform borders of <i>image</i> in the form {{<i>left</i>,<i>right</i>},{<i>bottom</i>,<i>top</i>}}.

BorderDimensions[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] finds borders whose pixels vary by an amount less than <i>t</i>.

---

BorelTannerDistribution
BorelTannerDistribution[α,<i>n</i>] represents a Borel–Tanner distribution with shape parameters α and <i>n</i>.

---

Bottom
Bottom is a symbol that represents the bottom for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

BottomHatTransform
BottomHatTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological bottom-hat transform of <i>image</i> with respect to structuring element <i>ker</i>.

BottomHatTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the bottom-hat transform with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

BottomHatTransform[<i>data</i>,…] applies a bottom-hat transform to an array of data.

---

BoundaryDiscretizeGraphics
BoundaryDiscretizeGraphics[<i>g</i>] discretizes a 2D or 3D graphic <i>g</i> into a BoundaryMeshRegion.

BoundaryDiscretizeGraphics[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] discretizes only the elements in <i>g</i> that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

BoundaryDiscretizeRegion
BoundaryDiscretizeRegion[<i>reg</i>] discretizes the region <i>reg</i> into a BoundaryMeshRegion.

BoundaryDiscretizeRegion[<i>reg</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] restricts to the bounds [x<sub>min</sub>,x<sub>max</sub>]×⋯.

---

BoundaryMesh
BoundaryMesh[<i>mreg</i>] gives a BoundaryMeshRegion from a MeshRegion <i>mreg</i>. 

---

BoundaryMeshRegionQ
BoundaryMeshRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] yields True if the region <i>reg</i> is a valid BoundaryMeshRegion object and False otherwise.

---

BoundaryStyle
BoundaryStyle is an option for plotting functions that specifies the style in which boundaries of regions should be drawn. 

---

BoundedRegionQ
BoundedRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] gives True if <i>reg</i> is a bounded region and False otherwise. 

---

BracketingBar
BracketingBar[<i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …] displays as <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,….

---

BrayCurtisDistance
BrayCurtisDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Bray–Curtis distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

BreadthFirstScan
BreadthFirstScan[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs a breadth-first scan (bfs) of the graph <i>g</i> starting at the vertex <i>s</i> and evaluates <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> whenever "<i>event</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" occurs.

BreadthFirstScan[<i>g</i>,{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs a breadth-first scan of the whole graph <i>g</i>.

BreadthFirstScan[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Break
Break[] exits the nearest enclosing Do, For, Until or While. 

---

BridgeData
BridgeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the bridge <i>entity</i>.

BridgeData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified bridge entities.

BridgeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

BrightnessEqualize
BrightnessEqualize[<i>image</i>] adjusts the brightness across <i>image</i>, correcting uneven illumination.

BrightnessEqualize[<i>image</i>,<i>flatfield</i>] uses the correction model given by <i>flatfield</i>, which models the variation in brightness across image.

BrightnessEqualize[<i>image</i>,<i>flatfield</i>,<i>darkfield</i>] uses the dark environment model given by <i>darkfield</i>. 

---

BroadcastStationData
BroadcastStationData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the broadcast station <i>entity</i>.

BroadcastStationData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified broadcast station entities.

BroadcastStationData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Brown
Brown represents the color brown in graphics or style specifications. 

---

BrownianBridgeProcess
BrownianBridgeProcess[σ,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i>}] represents the Brownian bridge process from value <i>a</i> at time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> to value <i>b</i> at time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> with volatility σ.

BrownianBridgeProcess[{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i>}]  represents the standard Brownian bridge process from value <i>a</i> at time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> to value <i>b</i> at time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>.

BrownianBridgeProcess[<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>]  represents the standard Brownian bridge process pinned at 0 at times <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>.

BrownianBridgeProcess[] represents the standard Brownian bridge process pinned at 0 at time 0 and at time 1.

---

BSplineCurve
BSplineCurve[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is a graphics primitive that represents a nonuniform rational B-spline curve with control points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

BSplineFunction
BSplineFunction[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a B-spline function for a curve defined by the control points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BSplineFunction[<i>array</i>] represents a B-spline function for a surface or high-dimensional manifold. 

---

BSplineSurface
BSplineSurface[<i>array</i>] is a graphics primitive that represents a nonuniform rational B-spline surface defined by an array of x,y,z control points.

---

BubbleChart
BubbleChart[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a bubble chart with bubbles at positions {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} with sizes <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BubbleChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},…],…}] makes a bubble chart with bubble features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

BubbleChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a bubble chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BubbleChart3D
BubbleChart3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a 3D bubble chart with bubbles at positions {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} with sizes <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BubbleChart3D[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},…],…}] makes a 3D bubble chart with bubble features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

BubbleChart3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D bubble chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

BubbleScale
BubbleScale is an option to BubbleChart and related functions that specifies how the scale of each bubble should be determined from the value of each data element.

---

BubbleSizes
BubbleSizes is an option to BubbleChart and related functions that specifies the range of sizes used for bubbles. 

---

BuildingData
BuildingData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the building <i>entity</i>.

BuildingData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified building entities.

BuildingData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

BulletGauge
BulletGauge[<i>value</i>,<i>reference</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] draws a bullet gauge showing <i>value</i> and <i>reference</i> in a range of <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>.

BulletGauge[<i>value</i>,<i>reference</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>max</i>}] draws a bullet gauge with performance regions split at the <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

BulletGauge[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] draws a bullet gauge with multiple values <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

BulletGauge[<i>values</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] draws a bullet gauge with multiple references <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

BusinessDayQ
BusinessDayQ[<i>date</i>] returns True if the date is a business day and returns False otherwise.

---

ButterflyGraph
ButterflyGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the order-<i>n</i> butterfly graph. 

ButterflyGraph[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the base-<i>b</i> order-<i>n</i> butterfly graph. 

---

ButterworthFilterModel
ButterworthFilterModel[<i>n</i>] creates a lowpass Butterworth filter of order <i>n</i> and cutoff frequency of 1.

ButterworthFilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>}] uses the cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>.

ButterworthFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}] creates a filter of a given "<i>type</i>" using the specified parameters <i>spec</i>. 

ButterworthFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

Byte
Byte represents a single byte of data in Read. 

---

ByteArray
ByteArray[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs a ByteArray object containing the byte values <i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ByteArray["<i>string</i>"] constructs a ByteArray object by extracting byte values from a Base64-encoded string.

---

ByteArrayFormat
ByteArrayFormat[<i>ba</i>] attempts to determine what ImportByteArray format could be used to import the ByteArray object <i>ba</i>.

---

ByteArrayFormatQ
ByteArrayFormatQ[<i>ba</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] gives True if the ByteArray object <i>ba</i> might be imported as format "<i>fmt</i>" and gives False otherwise.

ByteArrayFormatQ[<i>ba</i>,{<i>fmt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fmt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives True if <i>ba</i> might be imported as one of "<i>fmt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

ByteArrayQ
ByteArrayQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a valid ByteArray object, and False otherwise.

---

ByteArrayToString
ByteArrayToString[<i>ba</i>] returns a string by decoding the data in the byte array <i>ba</i>, assuming UTF-8 encoding.

ByteArrayToString[<i>ba</i>,"<i>encoding</i>"] interprets the data in the specified character encoding.

---

ByteOrdering
ByteOrdering is an option for BinaryRead, BinaryWrite, and related functions that specifies what ordering of bytes should be assumed for your computer system.

---

CalendarConvert
CalendarConvert[<i>date</i>,<i>calendar</i>] converts the date object <i>date</i> to the specified calendar type <i>calendar</i>.

CalendarConvert[<i>date</i>] converts to the default calendar type.

CalendarConvert[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>date</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>calendar</i>] converts <i>date</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>date</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> to the specified <i>calendar</i>.

---

CalendarData
CalendarData[<i>cal</i>] gives the default parameters associated with the date calendar <i>cal</i>.

CalendarData[<i>country</i>] gives available holiday calendars for the stock exchanges in the <i>country</i> entity.

CalendarData[<i>cal</i>,<i>param</i>] gives the value of the specified parameter <i>param</i> for calendar <i>cal</i>.

---

CalendarType
CalendarType is an option that determines the calendar system in which all dates are to be interpreted and output.

---

CallPacket
CallPacket[<i>integer</i>,<i>list</i>] is a WSTP packet encapsulating a request to invoke the external function numbered <i>integer</i> with the arguments contained in <i>list</i>.

---

CanberraDistance
CanberraDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Canberra distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

Cancel
Cancel[<i>expr</i>] cancels out common factors in the numerator and denominator of <i>expr</i>. 

---

CandlestickChart
CandlestickChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>open</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>high</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>low</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>close</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] makes a chart with candles representing open, high, low, and close prices for each date. 

CandlestickChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i><i>}</i>] makes a candlestick chart for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the date range <i>daterange</i>. 

---

CanonicalGraph
CanonicalGraph[<i>g</i>] gives a canonical form of the graph <i>g</i>.

CanonicalGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph.

---

CanonicalizePolygon
CanonicalizePolygon[<i>poly</i>] gives a canonical representation of the polygon <i>poly</i> with shared coordinates and with inner and outer boundaries.

CanonicalizePolygon[<i>poly</i>,"<i>filter</i>"] gives a canonical representation of <i>poly</i> with the specified filter.

---

CanonicalizePolyhedron
CanonicalizePolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives a canonical representation of the polyhedron <i>poly</i> with shared coordinates and with inner and outer boundaries.

---

CanonicalizeRegion
CanonicalizeRegion[<i>reg</i>] gives a canonical representation of the region <i>reg</i>.

---

CanonicalName
CanonicalName[<i>entity</i>] gives the canonical name for the entity specified by <i>entity</i>.

CanonicalName[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the canonical name for <i>entity</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

CanonicalWarpingCorrespondence
CanonicalWarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the canonical time warping (CTW) correspondence between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

CanonicalWarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>warp</i>] uses <i>warp</i> as initial warping correspondence.

CanonicalWarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>warp</i>,<i>win</i>] uses a window <i>win</i> for local search.

---

CanonicalWarpingDistance
CanonicalWarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the canonical time warping (CTW) distance between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

CanonicalWarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>init</i>] uses <i>init</i> as the initial correspondence between the two sequences.

CanonicalWarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>init</i>,<i>win</i>] uses a window <i>win</i> for local search.

---

CantorMesh
CantorMesh[<i>n</i>] gives a mesh region representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Cantor set. 

CantorMesh[<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Cantor set in dimension <i>d</i>.

---

CantorStaircase
CantorStaircase[<i>x</i>] gives the Cantor staircase function F<sub>C</sub>(x).

---

Cap
Cap[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⌢<i>y</i>⌢….

---

CapForm
CapForm[<i>type</i>] is a graphics primitive that specifies what type of caps should be used at the ends of lines, tubes, and related primitives.

---

CapitalDifferentialD
CapitalDifferentialD[<i>x</i>] displays as <i>x</i>.

---

Capitalize
Capitalize[<i>string</i>] yields a string in which the first character has been made uppercase.

Capitalize[<i>string</i>,<i>scheme</i>] gives a string capitalized using the specified capitalization scheme.

---

CapsuleShape
CapsuleShape[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>}},<i>r</i>] represents the filled capsule between points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} and radius <i>r</i>.

---

CarlemanLinearize
CarlemanLinearize[<i>sys</i>,<i>spec</i>] Carleman linearizes the nonlinear state-space model <i>sys</i> according to <i>spec</i>.

---

CarlsonRC
CarlsonRC[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>C</sub>(x,y).

---

CarlsonRD
CarlsonRD[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>D</sub>(x,y,z).

---

CarlsonRE
CarlsonRE[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>E</sub>(x,y).

---

CarlsonRF
CarlsonRF[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>F</sub>(x,y,z).

---

CarlsonRG
CarlsonRG[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>G</sub>(x,y,z).

---

CarlsonRJ
CarlsonRJ[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>,ρ] gives Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>J</sub>(x,y,z,ρ).

---

CarlsonRK
CarlsonRK[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>K</sub>(x,y).

---

CarlsonRM
CarlsonRM[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,ρ] gives Carlson's elliptic integral R<sub>M</sub>(x,y,ρ).

---

CarmichaelLambda
CarmichaelLambda[<i>n</i>] gives the Carmichael function λ(n).

---

CaseOrdering
CaseOrdering is an option for AlphabeticSort and related functions that specifies how upper versus lower case should be sorted.

---

Cases
Cases[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>pattern</i>] gives a list of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that match the pattern. 

Cases[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>pattern</i><i>rhs</i>] gives a list of the values of <i>rhs</i> corresponding to the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that match the pattern. 

Cases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives a list of all parts of <i>expr</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i> that match the pattern. 

Cases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i><i>rhs</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives the values of <i>rhs</i> that match the pattern. 

Cases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> parts in <i>expr</i> that match the pattern. 

Cases[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of Cases that can be applied to an expression.

---

CaseSensitive
CaseSensitive[<i>patt</i>] represents a string pattern that requires matching typographical case, even with the overall option setting IgnoreCase->True.

---

Cashflow
Cashflow[{<i>c</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a series of cash flows occurring at unit time intervals.

Cashflow[{<i>c</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>q</i>] represents cash flows occurring at time intervals <i>q</i>.

Cashflow[{{<i>time</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>time</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents cash flows occurring at the specified times.

---

Casoratian
Casoratian[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] gives the Casoratian determinant for the sequences <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … depending on <i>n</i>.

Casoratian[<i>eqn</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the Casoratian determinant for the basis of the solutions of the linear difference equation <i>eqn</i> involving <i>y</i>[<i>n</i>+<i>m</i>]. 

Casoratian[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] gives the Casoratian determinant for the system of linear difference equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

Catalan
Catalan is Catalan's constant, with numerical value ≃0.915966. 

---

CatalanNumber
CatalanNumber[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> Catalan number C<sub>n</sub>.

---

Catch
