Catch[<i>expr</i>] returns the argument of the first Throw generated in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

Catch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] returns <i>value</i> from the first Throw[<i>value</i>,<i>tag</i>] for which <i>form</i> matches <i>tag</i>. 

Catch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>f</i>] returns <i>f</i>[<i>value</i>,<i>tag</i>]. 

---

CategoricalDistribution
CategoricalDistribution[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a uniform categorical distribution over classes <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

CategoricalDistribution[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a categorical distribution over classes <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CategoricalDistribution[{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] represents a uniform multivariate categorical distribution over domain {<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}×{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…}×….

CategoricalDistribution[<i>domain</i>,<i>weights</i>] uses the array <i>weights</i> to define probabilities over each element of the domain.

---

Catenate
Catenate[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a single list with all elements from the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in order. 

Catenate[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a list of all values in order appearing in the associations <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CatenateLayer
CatenateLayer[] represents a net layer that takes a list of input arrays and catenates them.

CatenateLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a net layer that takes a list of input arrays and catenates them at level <i>n</i>.

---

CauchyDistribution
CauchyDistribution[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a Cauchy distribution with location parameter <i>a</i> and scale parameter <i>b</i>.

CauchyDistribution[] represents a Cauchy distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

CauchyWindow
CauchyWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Cauchy window function of <i>x</i>.

CauchyWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

CayleyGraph
CayleyGraph[<i>group</i>] returns a Cayley graph representation of <i>group</i>.

---

CDFWavelet
CDFWavelet[] represents a Cohen–Daubechies–Feauveau wavelet of type "9/7". 

CDFWavelet["<i>type</i>"] represents a Cohen–Daubechies–Feauveau wavelet of type "<i>type</i>". 

---

Ceiling
Ceiling[<i>x</i>] gives the smallest integer greater than or equal to <i>x</i>. 

Ceiling[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the smallest multiple of <i>a</i> greater than or equal to <i>x</i>. 

---

CensoredDistribution
CensoredDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>dist</i>] represents the distribution of values that come from <i>dist</i> and are censored to be between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

CensoredDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…},<i>dist</i>] represents the distribution of values that come from the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> and are censored to be between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, <i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, etc.

---

Censoring
Censoring[<i>t</i>,<i>c</i>] represents a censored event time <i>t</i> with censoring <i>c</i>.

Censoring[{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>c</i>] represents a vector of censored event times <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with censoring <i>c</i>.

Censoring[{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a vector of event times <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with corresponding censoring <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Center
Center is a symbol that represents the center for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

CenterArray
CenterArray[<i>a</i>,<i>n</i>] creates a list of length <i>n</i> with the elements of <i>a</i> at the center and zeros elsewhere.

CenterArray[<i>a</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array with the array <i>a</i> at the center and zeros elsewhere.

CenterArray[<i>a</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>pad</i>] uses <i>pad</i> instead of zero for the background.

CenterArray[<i>nspec</i>] creates an array with a single 1 at the center and zeros elsewhere.

---

CenterDot
CenterDot[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x·y·….

---

CenteredInterval
CenteredInterval[<i>x</i>,<i>dx</i>] for real numbers <i>x</i> and <i>dx</i> gives a centered interval that contains the real interval {a∈|x-<i>dx</i>≤a≤x+<i>dx</i>}.

CenteredInterval[<i>x</i>+ <i>y</i>,<i>dx</i>+ <i>dy</i>] gives a centered interval that contains the complex rectangle {a+ b∈|x-<i>dx</i>≤a≤x+<i>dx</i>∧y-<i>dy</i>≤b≤y+<i>dy</i>}.

CenteredInterval[<i>c</i>] for an approximate number <i>c</i> gives a centered interval that contains all values within the error bounds of <i>c</i>.

---

CentralFeature
CentralFeature[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the central feature of the elements x<sub>i</sub>.

CentralFeature[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the <i>v<sub>i</sub></i> corresponding to the central feature x<sub>i</sub>.

CentralFeature[<i>data</i>] gives the central feature for several different forms of <i>data</i>.

---

CentralMoment
CentralMoment[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the order <i>r</i> central moment μ&amp;~<sub>r</sub> of <i>data</i>.

CentralMoment[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] gives the order {<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>} multivariate central moment μ&amp;~<sub>r<sub>1</sub>, …, r<sub>m</sub></sub> of <i>data</i>.

CentralMoment[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the central moment of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

CentralMoment[<i>r</i>] represents the order <i>r</i> formal central moment.

---

CentralMomentGeneratingFunction
CentralMomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the central moment-generating function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>t</i>. 

CentralMomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the central moment-generating function for the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variables <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

Cepstrogram
Cepstrogram[<i>data</i>] plots the array of power cepstra computed on each partition of <i>data</i>.

Cepstrogram[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of length <i>n</i>.

Cepstrogram[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

Cepstrogram[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

Cepstrogram[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

---

CepstrogramArray
CepstrogramArray[<i>data</i>] computes an array of cepstra on <i>data</i>.

CepstrogramArray[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of length <i>n</i>.

CepstrogramArray[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

CepstrogramArray[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

CepstrogramArray[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

---

CepstrumArray
CepstrumArray[<i>data</i>] computes the power cepstrum of <i>data</i>.

CepstrumArray[<i>data</i>,<i>type</i>] computes the specified <i>type</i> of cepstrum of <i>data</i>.

---

CForm
CForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a C language version of <i>expr</i>. 

---

ChampernowneNumber
ChampernowneNumber[<i>b</i>] gives the base-<i>b</i> Champernowne number <i>C</i><sub><i>b</i></sub>.

ChampernowneNumber[] gives the base-10 Champernowne number.

---

ChannelBase
ChannelBase is an option specifying the base URL of the server to use for brokering channel communications.

---

ChannelBrokerAction
ChannelBrokerAction is an option specifying the action to execute on the channel broker server in addition to routing a message.

---

ChannelHistoryLength
ChannelHistoryLength is an option to ChannelListen that specifies the maximum number of messages to cache in the channel listener object. 

---

ChannelListen
ChannelListen[<i>channel</i>] starts listening on the specified channel.

ChannelListen[<i>channel</i>,<i>func</i>] applies <i>func</i> to the association corresponding to each message received on the channel.

ChannelListen[<i>channel</i>,None] stores each message received on the channel, without applying any function.

ChannelListen[<i>url</i>] listens on the specified URL, storing messages received, without requiring an explicit channel to exist on the channel broker.

---

ChannelListener
ChannelListener[…] represents a channel listener created by ChannelListen.

---

ChannelListeners
ChannelListeners[] gives a list of currently active channel listeners.

---

ChannelObject
ChannelObject[] gives a new anonymous channel specification.

� represents a channel specified by a given URL.

ChannelObject["<i>relpath</i>"] represents a channel for the currently authenticated user at a relative path.

ChannelObject[<i>"id:�</i>] represents a channel for the user with the specified Wolfram ID at the given path.

ChannelObject[<i>"/�</i>] represents a channel at an absolute path on the channel broker.

---

ChannelReceiverFunction
ChannelReceiverFunction[<i>fun</i>] represents a channel receiver function that applies <i>fun</i> to any channel message it receives.

---

ChannelSend
ChannelSend[<i>channel</i>,<i>msg</i>] sends the specified message <i>msg</i> to the specified channel.

---

ChannelSubscribers
ChannelSubscribers[<i>channel</i>] gives a list of users currently subscribed to the specified channel.

ChannelSubscribers[{<i>channel</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>channel</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of subscribed users for each of the channels <i>channel</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ChanVeseBinarize
ChanVeseBinarize[<i>image</i>] finds a two-level segmentation of <i>image</i> by computing optimal contours around regions of consistent intensity in <i>image</i>.

ChanVeseBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>] uses <i>marker</i> to create an initial contour.

ChanVeseBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>,{μ,ν,λ<sub>1</sub>,λ<sub>2</sub>}] specify the Chan–Vese weights μ, ν, λ<sub>1</sub>, and λ<sub>2</sub>.

---

Character
Character represents a single character in Read. 

---

CharacterCounts
CharacterCounts["<i>string</i>"] gives an association whose keys are the distinct characters in <i>string</i>, and whose values give the number of times those characters appear in <i>string</i>.

CharacterCounts["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives counts of the distinct <i>n</i>-grams consisting of runs of <i>n</i> characters in <i>string</i>.

CharacterCounts[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives the counts for each of the <i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CharacterEncoding
CharacterEncoding is an option for input and output functions which specifies what raw character encoding should be used. 

---

CharacterEncodingsPath
CharacterEncodingsPath is a global option that specifies which directories are searched for character encoding files.

---

CharacteristicFunction
CharacteristicFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the characteristic function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>t</i>.

CharacteristicFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the characteristic function for the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variables <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

CharacteristicPolynomial
CharacteristicPolynomial[<i>m</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the characteristic polynomial for the matrix <i>m</i>. 

CharacteristicPolynomial[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>},<i>x</i>] gives the generalized characteristic polynomial with respect to <i>a</i>. 

---

CharacterName
CharacterName["<i>c</i>"] gives the name of the character <i>c</i>.

CharacterName[<i>n</i>] gives the name of the character with character code <i>n</i>.

CharacterName[<i>c</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives a name of the specified type.

---

CharacterNormalize
CharacterNormalize["<i>text</i>",<i>form</i>] converts the characters in <i>text</i> to the specified normalization form.

---

CharacterRange
CharacterRange[<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>] yields a list of the characters in the range from "<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>" to "<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>". 

CharacterRange[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] yields a list of the characters with character codes in the range <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

Characters
Characters["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the characters in a string. 

---

ChartBaseStyle
ChartBaseStyle is an option for charting functions that specifies the base style for all chart elements.

---

ChartElementFunction
ChartElementFunction is an option for charting functions such as BarChart that gives a function to use to generate the primitives for rendering each chart element.

---

ChartElements
ChartElements is an option to charting functions such as BarChart that specifies the graphics to use as the basis for bars or other chart elements. 

---

ChartLabels
ChartLabels is an option for charting functions that specifies what labels should be used for chart elements.

---

ChartLayout
ChartLayout is an option to charting functions that specifies the overall layout to use.

---

ChartLegends
ChartLegends is an option for charting functions that specifies what legends should be used for chart elements. 

---

ChartStyle
ChartStyle is an option for charting functions that specifies styles in which chart elements should be drawn.

---

Chebyshev1FilterModel
Chebyshev1FilterModel[<i>n</i>] creates a lowpass Chebyshev type 1 filter of order <i>n</i>.

Chebyshev1FilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>}] uses the cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>.

Chebyshev1FilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}] creates a filter of a given "<i>type</i>" using the specified parameters <i>spec</i>. 

Chebyshev1FilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

Chebyshev2FilterModel
Chebyshev2FilterModel[<i>n</i>] creates a lowpass Chebyshev type 2 filter of order <i>n</i>.

Chebyshev2FilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>}] uses the cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>.

Chebyshev2FilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}] uses the full filter specification {"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}.

Chebyshev2FilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

ChebyshevDistance
ChebyshevDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Chebyshev or sup norm distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

ChebyshevT
ChebyshevT[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Chebyshev polynomial of the first kind T<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

ChebyshevU
ChebyshevU[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Chebyshev polynomial of the second kind U<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

Check
Check[<i>expr</i>,<i>failexpr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, and returns the result, unless messages were generated, in which case it evaluates and returns <i>failexpr</i>. 

Check[<i>expr</i>,<i>failexpr</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] checks only for the specified messages. 

Check[<i>expr</i>,<i>failexpr</i>,"<i>name</i>"] checks only for messages in the named message group.

---

CheckAbort
CheckAbort[<i>expr</i>,<i>failexpr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, returning <i>failexpr</i> if an abort occurs. 

---

CheckAll
CheckAll[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>] evaluates expr and returns <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>,HoldComplete[<i>control</i><sub>1</sub>,…]] where the <i>control</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> expressions are aborts, throws, or other flow control commands currently being executed (but stopped by CheckAll).

---

CheckArguments
CheckArguments[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>n</i>] gives True if <i>args</i> consists of exactly <i>n</i> positional arguments followed by valid options for <i>f</i>, and False otherwise.

CheckArguments[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] requires the number of positional arguments to be between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>.

CheckArguments[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>spec</i>,<i>assoc</i>] modifies the behavior based on the information in the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

ChemicalData
ChemicalData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the chemical "<i>name</i>".

ChemicalData["<i>name</i>"] gives a structure diagram for the chemical with the specified name.

ChemicalData["<i>class</i>"] gives a list of available chemicals in the specified class.

---

ChemicalFormula
ChemicalFormula[<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub><i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub><i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] represents a chemical species with <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> atoms of the element <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ChemicalFormula[<i>chem</i>] returns the chemical formula corresponding to the given input.

ChemicalFormula[…,<i>qual</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qual</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub> …|>] represents a species whose qualifiers <i>qual</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> have values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ChemicalReaction
ChemicalReaction[<i>reactants</i><i>products</i>] represents a chemical reaction between the given reactants and products.

---

ChessboardDistance
ChessboardDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the chessboard, Chebyshev, or sup norm distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

ChiDistribution
ChiDistribution[ν] represents a χ distribution with ν degrees of freedom.

---

ChineseRemainder
ChineseRemainder[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the smallest x with x≥0 that satisfies all the integer congruences x mod m<sub>i</sub>r<sub>i</sub>mod m<sub>i</sub>.

ChineseRemainder[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>d</i>] gives the smallest x with x≥d that satisfies all the integer congruences x mod m<sub>i</sub>r<sub>i</sub>mod m<sub>i</sub>.

---

ChiSquareDistribution
ChiSquareDistribution[ν] represents a χ<sup>2</sup> distribution with ν degrees of freedom.

---

CholeskyDecomposition
CholeskyDecomposition[<i>m</i>] gives the Cholesky decomposition of a matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

Chop
Chop[<i>expr</i>] replaces approximate real numbers in <i>expr</i> that are close to zero by the exact integer 0. 

Chop[<i>expr</i>,<i>delta</i>] replaces numbers smaller in absolute magnitude than <i>delta</i> by 0.

---

ChromaticityPlot
ChromaticityPlot[<i>colspace</i>] plots a 2D slice of the color space <i>colspace</i>. 

ChromaticityPlot[<i>color</i>] plots the specific <i>color</i>.

ChromaticityPlot[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots multiple colors and color spaces.

ChromaticityPlot[<i>image</i>] plots the pixels of <i>image</i> as individual colors.

ChromaticityPlot[…,<i>refcolspace</i>] uses the reference color space <i>refcolspace</i>.

---

ChromaticityPlot3D
ChromaticityPlot3D[<i>colspace</i>] returns a 3D gamut of the color space <i>colspace</i>.

ChromaticityPlot3D[<i>color</i>] plots the specific <i>color</i>.

ChromaticityPlot3D[<i>image</i>] plots the pixels of <i>image</i> as individual colors.

ChromaticityPlot3D[{<i>input</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>input</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots multiple colors, color spaces and images.

ChromaticityPlot3D[…,<i>refcolspace</i>] uses the reference color space <i>refcolspace</i>.

---

ChromaticPolynomial
ChromaticPolynomial[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the chromatic polynomial of the graph <i>g</i>.

ChromaticPolynomial[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Circle
Circle[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>r</i>] represents a circle of radius <i>r</i> centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

Circle[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives a circle of radius 1. 

Circle[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>}] gives an axis-aligned ellipse with semiaxes lengths <i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>.

Circle[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},…,{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] gives a circular or ellipse arc from angle θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub>.

---

CircleDot
CircleDot[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⊙y⊙….

---

CircleMinus
CircleMinus[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊖y. 

---

CirclePlus
CirclePlus[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⊕y⊕….

---

CirclePoints
CirclePoints[<i>n</i>] gives the positions of <i>n</i> points equally spaced around the unit circle.

CirclePoints[<i>r</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of <i>n</i> points equally spaced around a circle of radius <i>r</i>.

CirclePoints[{<i>r</i>,θ<sub>1</sub>},<i>n</i>] starts at angle θ<sub>1</sub> with respect to the x axis.

CirclePoints[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>rspec</i>,<i>n</i>] centers the circle at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

---

CircleThrough
CircleThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a circle passing through the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CircleThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>q</i>] represents a circle with center <i>q</i>.

CircleThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>q</i>,<i>r</i>] represents a circle with radius <i>r</i>.

---

CircleTimes
CircleTimes[<i>x</i>] displays as ⊗x.

CircleTimes[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⊗y⊗….

---

CirculantGraph
CirculantGraph[<i>n</i>,<i>j</i>] gives the circulant graph C<sub>n</sub>(j) with <i>n</i> vertices and jump <i>j</i>.

CirculantGraph[<i>n</i>,{<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the circulant graph C<sub>n</sub>(j<sub>1</sub>,j<sub>2</sub>,…) with <i>n</i> vertices and jumps <i>j</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>j</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

CircularOrthogonalMatrixDistribution
CircularOrthogonalMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a circular orthogonal matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>n</i>,<i>n</i>}.

---

CircularQuaternionMatrixDistribution
CircularQuaternionMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a circular quaternion matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>2 n</i>,<i>2 n</i>} over the field of complex numbers.

---

CircularRealMatrixDistribution
CircularRealMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a circular real matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>n</i>,<i>n</i>}.

---

CircularSymplecticMatrixDistribution
CircularSymplecticMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a circular symplectic matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>2 n</i>,<i>2 n</i>} over the field of complex numbers.

---

CircularUnitaryMatrixDistribution
CircularUnitaryMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a circular unitary matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>n</i>,<i>n</i>}.

---

Circumsphere
Circumsphere[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n+1</i></sub>}] gives the sphere that circumscribes the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in <sup>n</sup>.

Circumsphere[<i>poly</i>] gives the circumsphere of a polyhedron or polygon <i>poly</i>.

---

CityData
CityData[<i>name</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the city with the specified name.

CityData[<i>name</i>] gives a list of the full specifications of cities whose names are consistent with <i>name</i>.

---

ClassifierFunction
ClassifierFunction[…] represents a function generated by Classify that classifies data into classes.

---

ClassifierInformation
ClassifierInformation[<i>classifier</i>] generates a report giving information on the classifier function <i>classifier</i>.

ClassifierInformation[<i>classifier</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives information for <i>classifier</i> associated with property <i>prop</i>.

---

ClassifierMeasurements
ClassifierMeasurements[<i>classifier</i>,<i>testset</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives measurements associated with property <i>prop</i> when <i>classifier</i> is evaluated on <i>testset</i>.

ClassifierMeasurements[<i>classifier</i>,<i>testset</i>] yields a measurement report that can be applied to any property.

ClassifierMeasurements[<i>data</i>,…] uses classifications <i>data</i> instead of a classifier.

ClassifierMeasurements[…,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives properties <i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

---

ClassifierMeasurementsObject
ClassifierMeasurementsObject[…] represents an object generated by ClassifierMeasurements that can be applied to properties.

---

Classify
Classify[{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub><i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>in</i><sub>2</sub><i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a ClassifierFunction that attempts to predict <i>class</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the example <i>in</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Classify[<i>data</i>,<i>input</i>] attempts to predict the output associated with <i>input</i> from the training examples given.

Classify[<i>data</i>,<i>input</i><i>,</i><i>prop</i>] computes the specified property <i>prop</i> relative to the prediction.

---

ClassPriors
ClassPriors is an option for Classify and related functions that specifies explicit prior probabilities to assume for output classes, independent of anything deduced from the training set.

---

Clear
Clear[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] clears values and definitions for the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Clear[<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…] clears values and definitions for all symbols whose names textually match any of the arbitrary string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Clear[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] clears values and definitions for any symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ClearAll
ClearAll[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] clears all values, definitions, attributes, defaults, options and messages for the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ClearAll[<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…] clears all symbols whose names textually match any of the arbitrary string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ClearAll[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub></sub>,…}] clears any symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ClearAttributes
ClearAttributes[<i>symbol</i>,<i>attr</i>] removes <i>attr</i> from the list of attributes of the symbol <i>symbol</i>. 

ClearAttributes["<i>symbol</i>",<i>attr</i>] removes <i>attr</i> from the attributes of the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

ClearAttributes[<i>s</i>,{<i>attr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>attr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes several attributes at a time.

ClearAttributes[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>attrs</i>] removes attributes from several symbols at a time.

---

ClearCookies
ClearCookies[<i>domain</i>] clears all persistent and session cookies associated with the specified domain.

ClearCookies[<i>assoc</i>] clears all cookies whose attributes match the specification in the association <i>assoc</i>.

ClearCookies[All] clears all persistent and session cookies for all domains.

---

ClebschGordan
ClebschGordan[{<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>m</i>}] gives the Clebsch–Gordan coefficient for the decomposition of j,m〉 in terms of j<sub>1</sub>,m<sub>1</sub>〉j<sub>2</sub>,m<sub>2</sub>〉. 

---

ClickPane
ClickPane[<i>image</i>,<i>func</i>] represents a clickable pane that displays as <i>image</i> and applies <i>func</i> to the x,y coordinates of each click within the pane.

ClickPane[<i>image</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}},<i>func</i>] specifies the range of coordinates to use.

---

ClickToCopy
ClickToCopy[<i>expr</i>] represents a button that copies <i>expr</i> whenever it is clicked.

ClickToCopy[<i>label</i>,<i>expr</i>] displays with <i>label</i> on the button.

---

ClickToCopyEnabled
ClickToCopyEnabled is an option for Cell that specifies whether to show a click-to-copy overlay when hovering over a cell.

---

Clip
Clip[<i>x</i>] gives <i>x</i> clipped to be between -1 and +1. 

Clip[<i>x</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] gives <i>x</i> for <i>min</i>≤<i>x</i>≤<i>max</i>, <i>min</i> for <i>x</i><<i>min</i> and <i>max</i> for <i>x</i>><i>max</i>. 

Clip[<i>x</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},{<i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives <i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> for <i>x</i><<i>min</i> and <i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> for <i>x</i>><i>max</i>. 

---

ClipFill
ClipFill is an option for plotting functions that specifies what should be shown where curves or surfaces would extend beyond the plot range. 

---

ClippingStyle
ClippingStyle is an option for plotting functions that specifies the style of what should be drawn when curves or surfaces would extend beyond the plot range. 

---

ClipPlanes
ClipPlanes is an option to Graphics3D that specifies a list of clipping planes that can cut away portions of a 3D scene from the resulting view.

---

ClipPlanesStyle
ClipPlanesStyle is an option to Graphics3D that specifies how clipping planes defined with the ClipPlanes option should be rendered.

---

ClipRange
ClipRange is an option to Raster3D that specifies a rectangular region that is cut away from the resulting view.

---

ClockGauge
ClockGauge[] draws an analog clock face showing the local time with hours, minutes, and seconds.

ClockGauge[<i>time</i>] draws an analog clock face showing the time corresponding to an AbsoluteTime, DateObject, or TimeObject specification.

ClockGauge[{<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] draws an analog clock face showing hour <i>h</i>, minute <i>m</i>, and seconds <i>s</i>.

ClockGauge[{<i>y</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] draws an analog clock face showing the time corresponding to the date list in a DateList specification.

ClockGauge["<i>string</i>"] draws an analog clock face showing the time DateList["<i>string</i>"].

---

Close
Close[<i>obj</i>] closes a stream or socket. 

---

CloseKernels
CloseKernels[] terminates all parallel kernels from the list ParallelKernels[].

CloseKernels[<i>k</i>] terminates the kernel <i>k</i>.

CloseKernels[{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] terminates the kernels <i>k</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>k</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

CloseKernels["<i>prop</i>"] terminates kernels that satisfy the given property.

---

ClosenessCentrality
ClosenessCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of closeness centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

ClosenessCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Closing
Closing[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological closing of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

Closing[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the closing with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

Closing[<i>data</i>,…] applies closing to an array of data.

---

ClusterClassify
ClusterClassify[<i>data</i>] generates a ClassifierFunction[…] by partitioning data into clusters of similar elements.

ClusterClassify[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a ClassifierFunction[…] with <i>n</i> clusters.

---

ClusterDissimilarityFunction
ClusterDissimilarityFunction is an option for ClusteringTree and Dendrogram that specifies the intercluster dissimilarity.

---

ClusteringComponents
ClusteringComponents[<i>array</i>] gives an array in which each element at the lowest level of <i>array</i> is replaced by an integer index representing the cluster in which the element lies.

ClusteringComponents[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>] finds <i>n</i> clusters.

ClusteringComponents[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>level</i>] finds clusters at the specified level in <i>array</i>.

ClusteringComponents[<i>image</i>] finds clusters of pixels with similar values in <i>image</i>.

ClusteringComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] finds <i>n</i> clusters in <i>image</i>.

---

ClusteringTree
ClusteringTree[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs a weighted tree from the hierarchical clustering of the elements <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ClusteringTree[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed graph.

ClusteringTree[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed graph.

ClusteringTree[<i>label</i><sub>1</sub><i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>label</i><sub>2</sub><i>e</i><sub><i>2…</i></sub>] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using labels <i>label</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed graph.

ClusteringTree[<i>data</i>,<i>h</i>] constructs a weighted tree from the hierarchical clustering of <i>data</i> by joining subclusters at distance less than <i>h</i>. 

---

CMYKColor
CMYKColor[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>k</i>] represents a color in the CMYK color space with cyan, magenta, yellow and black components.

CMYKColor[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

CMYKColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

CMYKColor[<i>color</i>] returns the CMYK representation of <i>color</i>.

---

Coefficient
Coefficient[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] gives the coefficient of <i>form</i> in the polynomial <i>expr</i>. 

Coefficient[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the coefficient of <i>form</i>^<i>n</i> in <i>expr</i>. 

---

CoefficientArrays
CoefficientArrays[<i>polys</i>,<i>vars</i>] gives the arrays of coefficients of the variables <i>vars</i> in the polynomials <i>polys</i>. 

---

CoefficientList
CoefficientList[<i>poly</i>,<i>var</i>] gives a list of coefficients of powers of <i>var</i> in <i>poly</i>, starting with power 0. 

CoefficientList[<i>poly</i>,{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an array of coefficients of the <i>var</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

CoefficientList[<i>poly</i>,{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>dim</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dim</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an array of dimensions {<i>dim</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dim</i><sub>2</sub>,…}, truncating or padding with zeros as needed.

---

CoefficientRules
CoefficientRules[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list {{<i>e</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>12</sub>,…}<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>e</i><sub>21</sub>,…}<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…} of exponent vectors and coefficients for the monomials in <i>poly</i> with respect to the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CoefficientRules[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>order</i>] gives the result with the monomial ordering specified by <i>order</i>.

---

CoifletWavelet
CoifletWavelet[] represents a Coiflet wavelet of order 2.

CoifletWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents a Coiflet wavelet of order <i>n</i>.

---

Collect
Collect[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] collects together terms involving the same powers of objects matching <i>x</i>. 

Collect[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] successively collects together terms that involve the same powers of objects matching <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, then <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

Collect[<i>expr</i>,<i>var</i>,<i>h</i>] applies <i>h</i> to the expression that forms the coefficient of each term obtained. 

---

CollinearPoints
CollinearPoints[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] tests whether the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> are collinear.

---

Colon
Colon[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x∶y∶….

---

ColonForm
ColonForm[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] prints as <i>a</i>: <i>b</i>.

---

ColorBalance
ColorBalance[<i>image</i>] adjusts the colors in <i>image</i> to achieve a balance that simulates the effect of neutral lighting.

ColorBalance[<i>image</i>,<i>ref</i>] adjusts colors in <i>image</i> so that the reference color specified by <i>ref</i> is mapped to white. 

ColorBalance[<i>image</i>,<i>ref</i><i>target</i>] maps the reference color <i>ref</i> to <i>target</i>.

---

ColorCombine
ColorCombine[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a multichannel image by combining the sequence of channels in the <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ColorCombine[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>colorspace</i>] combines images that represent the color components specified by <i>colorspace</i>.

---

ColorConvert
ColorConvert[<i>color</i>,<i>colspace</i>] converts the color space of a color to the specified color space <i>colspace</i>.

ColorConvert[<i>image</i>,<i>colspace</i>] converts the color space of <i>image</i>.

ColorConvert[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>colspace</i>] converts the color space of a list of colors and images.

---

ColorCoverage
ColorCoverage is an option for DominantColors that specifies the minimum image coverage that each color cluster should have.

---

ColorData
ColorData["<i>scheme</i>"] gives a function that generates colors in the named color scheme when applied to parameter values. 

ColorData["<i>scheme</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property of a color scheme.

ColorData["<i>collection</i>"] gives a list of color schemes in a named collection.

ColorData[] gives a list of named collections of color schemes.

---

ColorDataFunction
ColorDataFunction[<i>range</i>,…] is a function that represents a color scheme. 

---

ColorDetect
ColorDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>cspec</i>] returns a mask image representing regions in <i>image</i> with colors within the specified color region.

---

ColorDistance
ColorDistance[<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the approximate perceptual distance between color directives <i>c</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>.

ColorDistance[<i>list</i>,<i>c</i>] gives color distances between elements of <i>list</i> and <i>c</i>.

ColorDistance[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] gives color distances between corresponding elements of <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ColorDistance[<i>image</i>,<i>c</i>] gives an image whose pixel values are color distance between pixels in <i>image</i> and the color <i>c</i>.

ColorDistance[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] yields an image giving the pixelwise color distance between <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ColorFunction
ColorFunction is an option for graphics functions that specifies a function to apply to determine colors of elements. 

---

ColorFunctionBinning
ColorFunctionBinning is an option for plotting functions that divides values into a limited set of bins for styling.

---

ColorFunctionScaling
ColorFunctionScaling is an option for graphics functions that specifies whether arguments supplied to a color function should be scaled to lie between 0 and 1. 

---

Colorize
Colorize[<i>m</i>] generates an image from an integer matrix <i>m</i>, using colors for positive integers and black for non-positive integers.

Colorize[<i>image</i>] replaces intensity values in <i>image</i> with pseudocolor values.

---

ColorNegate
ColorNegate[<i>color</i>] gives the negative of a color.

ColorNegate[<i>image</i>] gives the negative of <i>image</i>, in which all colors have been negated.

ColorNegate[<i>video</i>] negates every frame of a video.

ColorNegate[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] gives a list of negative images or colors.

---

ColorOutput
ColorOutput is an option for graphics functions that specifies the type of color output to produce. 

---

ColorProfileData
ColorProfileData[<>,"Description""<i>desc</i>","DeviceColorSpace""<i>device</i>","IndependentColorSpace""<i>ics</i>"] represents an ICC color profile that can convert between the independent color space "<i>ics</i>" and the device-dependent color space "<i>device</i>".

---

ColorQ
ColorQ[<i>color</i>] yields True if <i>color</i> is a valid color directive and False otherwise.

---

ColorQuantize
ColorQuantize[<i>image</i>] gives an approximation to <i>image</i> by quantizing to distinct colors.

ColorQuantize[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] uses at most <i>n</i> distinct colors.

ColorQuantize[<i>image</i>,{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an image using only the <i>n</i> specified colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ColorReplace
ColorReplace[<i>image</i>,<i>color</i>] finds regions in <i>image</i> whose pixel values are similar to <i>color</i> and replaces them with transparent pixels.

ColorReplace[<i>image</i>,<i>color</i><i>replacement</i>] replaces all pixels with the specified <i>replacement</i> color.

ColorReplace[<i>image</i>,<i>color</i><i>replacement</i>,<i>d</i>] replaces all pixels whose values are within a distance <i>d</i> from <i>color</i>.

ColorReplace[<i>image</i>,{<i>color</i><sub>1</sub><i>replacement</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] does multiple color replacements.

---

ColorSeparate
ColorSeparate[<i>image</i>] gives a list of single-channel images corresponding to each of the color channels in <i>image</i>.

ColorSeparate[<i>image</i>,<i>colorspace</i>] gives a list of images corresponding to the components of <i>colorspace</i>.

ColorSeparate[<i>image</i>,<i>channel</i>] returns a single-channel image containing the specified <i>channel</i>.

---

ColorsNear
ColorsNear[<i>color</i>] represents a region around <i>color</i>.

ColorsNear[<i>color</i>,<i>d</i>] represents a region with maximum distance <i>d</i> around <i>color</i>.

ColorsNear[<i>color</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>dfun</i>] uses the specified color distance function <i>dfun</i>.

---

ColorSpace
ColorSpace is an option for Image and related functions that specifies the color space to which color values refer.

---

ColorToneMapping
ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>] applies a tone mapping to color values in <i>image</i> so as to make variations of luminance visible even in small intervals of the dynamic range. 

ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>,<i>c</i>] maps colors by compressing the overall range of luminance values by a factor <i>c</i>.

ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>,<i>range</i>] applies a mapping only to colors whose initial luminance lies in the specified range.

ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>,{<i>range</i>,<i>c</i>}] takes the specified range of colors and compresses their overall luminance values by a factor <i>c</i>.

ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>,{{<i>range</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>range</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] uses different compression factors <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for different ranges <i>range</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ColorToneMapping[<i>image</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>s</i>] uses the color compensation factor <i>s</i> to correct for saturation distortion introduced during tone mapping.

---

Column
Column[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is an object that formats with the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> arranged in a column, with <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> above <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

Column[<i>list</i>,<i>alignment</i>] aligns each element horizontally in the specified way. 

Column[<i>list</i>,<i>alignment</i>,<i>spacing</i>] leaves the specified number of <i>x</i>-heights of spacing between successive elements.

---

ColumnForm
ColumnForm[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] prints as a column with <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> above <i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

ColumnForm[<i>list</i>,<i>horiz</i>] specifies the horizontal alignment of each element. 

ColumnForm[<i>list</i>,<i>horiz</i>,<i>vert</i>] also specifies the vertical alignment of the whole column. 

---

CombinatorB
CombinatorB represents the <b>B</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorC
CombinatorC represents the <b>C</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorI
CombinatorI represents the <b>I</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorK
CombinatorK represents the <b>K</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorS
CombinatorS represents the <b>S</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorW
CombinatorW represents the <b>W</b> combinator.

---

CombinatorY
CombinatorY represents the <b>Y</b> combinator.

---

CombinedEntityClass
CombinedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>prop</i>] represents a class of entities obtained by combining the properties of those pairs of entities from <i>class</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>class</i><sub>2</sub> for which the value of the property <i>prop</i> is the same for the two entities in the pair.

CombinedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub><i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>] combines pairs of entities from <i>class</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>class</i><sub>2</sub> for which the value of <i>prop</i><sub>1</sub> of the entity from <i>class</i><sub>1</sub> is the same as the value of <i>prop</i><sub>2</sub> for the entity from <i>class</i><sub>2</sub>. 

CombinedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,{<i>pspec</i><sub><i>a</i></sub>,<i>pspec</i><sub><i>b</i></sub>,…}] combines pairs of entities for which all the property specifications <i>pspec</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> agree.

CombinedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i>] combines pairs of entities for which the application of the entity function <i>f</i> yields True. 

CombinedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>spec</i>,"<i>jspec</i>"] uses "<i>jspec</i>" to determine when to allow entities with missing properties to be included.

---

CombinerFunction
CombinerFunction is an option for template functions that specifies how fragments should be assembled to give the result of applying a template.

---

CometData
CometData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the comet <i>entity</i>.

CometData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified comet entities.

CometData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Commonest
Commonest[<i>list</i>] gives a list of the elements that are the most common in <i>list</i>.

Commonest[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of the <i>n</i> most common elements in <i>list</i>.

---

CommonName
CommonName[<i>entity</i>] gives the common name for the entity specified by <i>entity</i>.

CommonName[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the common name for <i>entity</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

CommonUnits
CommonUnits[{<i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>quantity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] converts <i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>quantity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> to common units across compatible dimensions.

---

CommunityBoundaryStyle
CommunityBoundaryStyle is an option to CommunityGraphPlot that specifies how to style community boundaries.

---

CommunityGraphPlot
CommunityGraphPlot[<i>g</i>] generates a plot showing the community structure of the graph <i>g</i>.

CommunityGraphPlot[<i>g</i>,{{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>2</sub></sub>,…},…}] generates a plot for the graph <i>g</i> with communities {<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>2</sub></sub>,…}, ….

CommunityGraphPlot[<i>g</i>,{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…}],…}] generates a plot with highlighting features defined by the symbol wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

CommunityGraphPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>2</sub></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i><sub>2</sub></sub>,…},…] generates a plot for a graph in which vertex <i>v</i><sub><i>ik</i></sub> is connected to vertex <i>v</i><sub><i>jk</i></sub>.

CommunityGraphPlot[<i>m</i>,…] generates a plot for a graph represented by the adjacency matrix <i>m</i>.

---

CommunityLabels
CommunityLabels is an option to CommunityGraphPlot that controls what labels and placement to use for communities. 

---

CommunityRegionStyle
CommunityRegionStyle is an option to CommunityGraphPlot that specifies how to style community regions.

---

CompanyData
CompanyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the company <i>entity</i>.

CompanyData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified company entities.

CompanyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

CompatibleUnitQ
CompatibleUnitQ[<i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if <i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub> have compatible units, and False otherwise.

---

CompilationOptions
CompilationOptions is an option for Compile that specifies settings for the compilation process. 

---

CompilationTarget
CompilationTarget is an option for Compile that specifies the target runtime for the compiled function. 

---

Compile
Compile[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] creates a compiled function that evaluates <i>expr</i> assuming numerical values of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Compile[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>},…},<i>expr</i>] assumes that <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is of a type that matches <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Compile[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>},…},<i>expr</i>] assumes that <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is a rank <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> array of objects, each of a type that matches <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Compile[<i>vars</i>,<i>expr</i>,{{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>},…}] assumes that subexpressions in <i>expr</i> that match <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are of types that match <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Compiled
Compiled is an option for various numerical and plotting functions which specifies whether the expressions they work with should automatically be compiled. 

---

CompiledCodeFunction
CompiledCodeFunction[…] is a function created by FunctionCompile that contains compiled code that is run when the CompiledCodeFunction is applied to suitable arguments. 

---

CompiledFunction
CompiledFunction[<i>�</i>] represents compiled code for evaluating a compiled function. 

---

CompiledLayer
CompiledLayer[<i>func</i>] represents a net layer whose computation is defined by the compilable function <i>func</i>.

CompiledLayer[<i>func</i>,<i>gradientfunc</i>] specifies a gradient propagating function allowing the layer to be used in NetTrain.

---

CompilerEnvironment
CompilerEnvironment is an option for FunctionCompile and related functions that allows definitions to be included in the compilation. 

---

CompilerEnvironmentAppendTo
CompilerEnvironmentAppendTo[{<i>def</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>def</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] appends declarations to $CompilerEnvironment.

CompilerEnvironmentAppendTo[<i>env</i>,{<i>def</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>def</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] appends declarations to CompilerEnvironmentObject <i>env</i>.

---

CompilerEnvironmentObject
CompilerEnvironmentObject represents a collection of definitions that can be included in compilations by FunctionCompile and related functions.

---

CompilerOptions
CompilerOptions is an option for FunctionCompile and related functions that allows options for the compilation pipeline to be specified.

---

Complement
Complement[<i>e</i><sub><i>all</i></sub>,<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the elements in <i>e</i><sub><i>all</i></sub> that are not in any of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

ComplementedEntityClass
ComplementedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub><i>all</i></sub>,<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,…] represents an entity class containing all the entities in <i>class</i><sub><i>all</i></sub> that are not in any of the <i>class</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CompleteGraph
CompleteGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the complete graph with <i>n</i> vertices K<sub>n</sub>.

CompleteGraph[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives the complete <i>k</i>-partite graph with <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>+<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>+⋯+<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> vertices K<sub>n<sub>1</sub>,n<sub>2</sub>,…,n<sub>k</sub></sub>.

---

CompleteGraphQ
CompleteGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a complete graph, and False otherwise.

CompleteGraphQ[<i>g</i>,<i>vlist</i>] yields True if the subgraph induced by <i>vlist</i> is a complete graph, and False otherwise.

---

CompleteIntegral
CompleteIntegral[<i>pde</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives a complete integral <i>u</i> for the first-order partial differential equation <i>pde</i>, with independent variables {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}. 

---

CompleteKaryTree
CompleteKaryTree[<i>n</i>] gives the complete binary tree with <i>n</i> levels.

CompleteKaryTree[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the complete <i>k</i>-ary tree with <i>n</i> levels.

---

Complex
Complex is the head used for complex numbers. 

---

ComplexArrayPlot
ComplexArrayPlot[<i>array</i>] generates a plot in which complex values <i>z</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> in an array <i>array</i> are shown in a discrete array of squares with Arg[<i>z</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>] indicated by color and Abs[<i>z</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>] by shading.

---

ComplexContourPlot
ComplexContourPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a filled contour plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>z</i>. 

ComplexContourPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates contour lines for <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

ComplexContourPlot[<i>f</i>==<i>g</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots contour lines for which <i>f</i>=<i>g</i>.

ComplexContourPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>==<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>==<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots contour lines for each of <i>f</i><sub>1</sub><i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>=<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

Complexes
Complexes represents the domain of complex numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈Complexes. 

---

ComplexExpand
ComplexExpand[<i>expr</i>] expands <i>expr</i> assuming that all variables are real. 

ComplexExpand[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] expands <i>expr</i> assuming that variables matching any of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are complex. 

---

ComplexInfinity
ComplexInfinity represents a quantity with infinite magnitude, but undetermined complex phase. 

---

ComplexityFunction
ComplexityFunction is an option for Simplify and other functions which gives a function to rank the complexity of different forms of an expression. 

---

ComplexListPlot
ComplexListPlot[{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots complex numbers <i>z</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>z</i><sub>2</sub>, … as points in the complex plane.

ComplexListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ComplexListPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

ComplexPlot
ComplexPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of Arg[<i>f</i>] over the complex rectangle with corners <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

ComplexPlot3D
ComplexPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a 3D plot of Abs[<i>f</i>] colored by Arg[<i>f</i>] over the complex rectangle with corners <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

ComplexRegionPlot
ComplexRegionPlot[<i>pred</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a plot showing the region in the complex plane for which <i>pred</i> is True.

ComplexRegionPlot[{<i>pred</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots regions given by the multiple predicates <i>pred</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ComplexStreamPlot
ComplexStreamPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a streamline plot of the vector field {Re[<i>f</i><i>]</i>,Im[<i>f</i><i>]</i>} over the complex rectangle with corners <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

ComplexVectorPlot
ComplexVectorPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a vector plot of the vector field {Re[<i>f</i><i>]</i>,Im[<i>f</i><i>]</i>} over the complex rectangle with corners <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

ComplexVectorPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several vector fields.

---

ComponentMeasurements
ComponentMeasurements[{<i>image</i>,<i>lmat</i>},"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>" for components of <i>image</i> indicated by the label matrix <i>lmat</i>.

ComponentMeasurements[<i>image</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>" for connected components of <i>image</i>. 

ComponentMeasurements[…,"<i>prop</i>",<i>crit</i>] only returns measurements for components that satisfy the criterion <i>crit</i>.

ComponentMeasurements[…,"<i>prop</i>",<i>crit</i>,<i>format</i>] formats the result according to the output specification <i>format</i>.

---

ComposeList
ComposeList[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] generates a list of the form {<i>x</i>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i>],<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i>]],…}. 

---

ComposeSeries
ComposeSeries[<i>series</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>series</i><sub>2</sub>,…] composes several power series. 

---

CompositeQ
CompositeQ[<i>n</i>] yields True if <i>n</i> is a composite number, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Composition
Composition[<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>3</sub>,…] represents a composition of the functions <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>3</sub>, ….

---

CompoundElement
CompoundElement[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a form or interpreter specification for a list of fields or inputs that gives a list of results.

CompoundElement[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a form or interpreter specification that gives an association of results.

---

CompoundExpression
<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>;<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>;… evaluates the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in turn, giving the last one as the result. 

---

CompoundPoissonDistribution
CompoundPoissonDistribution[λ,<i>dist</i>] represents a compound Poisson distribution with rate parameter λ and jump size distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

CompoundPoissonProcess
CompoundPoissonProcess[λ,<i>jdist</i>] represents a compound Poisson process with rate parameter λ and jump size distribution <i>jdist</i>.

---

CompoundRenewalProcess
CompoundRenewalProcess[<i>rdist</i>,<i>jdist</i>] represents a compound renewal process with renewal-time distribution <i>rdist</i> and jump size distribution <i>jdist</i>.

---

Compress
Compress[<i>expr</i>] gives a compressed representation of <i>expr</i> as a string. 

---

CompressionLevel
CompressionLevel is an option for Export and CreateArchive that specifies the amount of compression to use when compressing data.

---

ComputeUncertainty
ComputeUncertainty is an option for ClassifierMeasurements, LearnedDistribution and other functions to specify if numeric results should be returned along with their uncertainty.

---

ConcaveHullMesh
ConcaveHullMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the concave hull mesh from the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,….

ConcaveHullMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},α] gives the concave hull mesh of the specified parameter α.

ConcaveHullMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},α,<i>d</i>] gives the concave hull mesh of cells of dimension <i>d</i>.

---

Condition
<i>patt</i>/;<i>test</i> is a pattern which matches only if the evaluation of <i>test</i> yields True. 

<i>lhs</i>:><i>rhs</i>/;<i>test</i> represents a rule which applies only if the evaluation of <i>test</i> yields True. 

<i>lhs</i>:=<i>rhs</i>/;<i>test</i> is a definition to be used only if <i>test</i> yields True. 

---

ConditionalExpression
ConditionalExpression[<i>expr</i>,<i>cond</i>] is a symbolic construct that represents the expression <i>expr</i> when the condition <i>cond</i> is True.

---

Conditioned
Conditioned[<i>expr</i>,<i>cond</i>] or <i>expr</i><i>cond</i> represents <i>expr</i> conditioned by the predicate <i>cond</i>.

---

Cone
Cone[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>}},<i>r</i>] represents a cone with a base of radius <i>r</i> centered at (<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>) and a tip at (<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>). 

Cone[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>}}] represents a cone with a base of radius 1.

---

ConfidenceLevel
ConfidenceLevel is an option for LinearModelFit and other fitting functions that specifies the level to use in various confidence and prediction intervals and bands.

---

ConfidenceRange
ConfidenceRange is an option for SurvivalModelFit and other functions that specifies the range over which simultaneous confidence intervals and bands are computed.

---

ConfidenceTransform
ConfidenceTransform is an option for functions such as SurvivalModelFit that specifies the transformation used for confidence intervals and bands.

---

ConfigurationPath
ConfigurationPath is a global option that specifies which directories are searched for systemwide configuration information.

---

Confirm
Confirm[<i>expr</i>] confirms that <i>expr</i> is not considered a failure, otherwise throwing an error to the nearest surrounding Enclose. 

Confirm[<i>expr</i>,<i>info</i>] evaluates <i>info</i> and includes its value in the thrown error if <i>expr</i> is not confirmed.

Confirm[<i>expr</i>,<i>info</i>,<i>tag</i>] uses the specified tag for any thrown errors.

---

ConfirmAssert
ConfirmAssert[<i>test</i>] confirms that <i>test</i> is True, otherwise throwing an error to the nearest surrounding Enclose.

ConfirmAssert[<i>test</i>,<i>info</i>] evaluates <i>info</i> and includes its value in the thrown error if <i>test</i> is not True.

ConfirmAssert[<i>test</i>,<i>info</i>,<i>tag</i>] uses the specified tag for any thrown errors.

---

ConfirmBy
ConfirmBy[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>] confirms that <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] returns True, otherwise throwing an error to the nearest surrounding Enclose.

ConfirmBy[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>info</i>] evaluates <i>info</i> and includes its value in the thrown error if <i>expr</i> is not confirmed.

ConfirmBy[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>info</i>,<i>tag</i>] uses the specified tag for any thrown errors.

---

ConfirmMatch
ConfirmMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] confirms that <i>expr</i> matches the pattern <i>form</i>, otherwise throwing an error to the nearest surrounding Enclose.

ConfirmMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>info</i>] evaluates <i>info</i> and includes its value in the thrown error if <i>expr</i> is not confirmed.

ConfirmMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>info</i>,<i>tag</i>] uses the specified tag for any thrown errors.

---

ConfirmQuiet
ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>] confirms that no messages are generated during the evaluation of <i>expr</i>, otherwise quieting them and throwing an error to the nearest surrounding Enclose.

ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>::<i>t</i>] tests only for the specified message.

ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests only for the specified list of messages.

ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>,"<i>group</i>"] tests only for messages in the named message group.

ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>,<i>mspec</i>,<i>info</i>] evaluates <i>info</i> and includes its value in the thrown error if <i>expr</i> is not confirmed.

ConfirmQuiet[<i>expr</i>,<i>mspec</i>,<i>info</i>,<i>tag</i>] uses the specified tag for any thrown errors.

---

ConformationMethod
ConformationMethod is an option for VideoJoin and others that specifies how to conform frames of different videos.

---

ConformAudio
ConformAudio[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns a list of audio objects where all <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are made to have conforming properties, including duration, data type, and number of channels.

ConformAudio[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>] returns all audio objects of the specified <i>spec</i>.

---

ConformImages
ConformImages[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns a list of images where all <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are made to have conforming properties, including dimensions, data type, color space, and interleaving.

ConformImages[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>] returns all images of the specified <i>spec</i>.

ConformImages[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>,<i>fitting</i>] resizes images using the specified <i>fitting</i> method.

---

Congruent
Congruent[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≡y≡….

---

ConicGradientFilling
ConicGradientFilling[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] is a two-dimensional graphics directive specifying that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using a progressive transition between colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> along a circle.

ConicGradientFilling[{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,…,θ<sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] uses the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at angles θ<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ConicGradientFilling[{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,…,θ<sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] rotates from the center point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

---

ConicHullRegion
ConicHullRegion[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>m+1</i></sub>}] represents the <i>m</i>-dimensional affine hull region passing through points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ConicHullRegion[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents the <i>m</i>-dimensional affine hull region passing through the point <i>p</i> and parallel to <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ConicHullRegion[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>m+1</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>w</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the <i>m</i>-dimensional affine hull plus the conic hull generated by the vectors <i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

ConicHullRegion[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>w</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the <i>m</i>-dimensional affine hull plus the conic hull generated by the vectors <i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

---

ConicOptimization
ConicOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the linear objective <i>f</i> subject to conic constraints <i>cons</i>.

ConicOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

Conjugate
Conjugate[<i>z</i>] or <i>z</i> gives the complex conjugate of the complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

ConjugateTranspose
ConjugateTranspose[<i>m</i>] or m<sup></sup> gives the conjugate transpose of m. 

---

Conjunction
Conjunction[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the conjunction of <i>expr</i> over all choices of the Boolean variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Connect
Connect is a setting for the LinkMode option of LinkOpen.  LinkMode->Connect causes a link to be created that will connect to a link listening on a named port.

---

ConnectedComponents
ConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

ConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

ConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the connected components that include a vertex that matches the pattern <i>patt</i>.

ConnectedComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

ConnectedGraphComponents
ConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

ConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

ConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the connected components that include a vertex that matches the pattern <i>patt</i>.

ConnectedGraphComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

ConnectedGraphQ
ConnectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is connected, and False otherwise.

---

ConnectedMeshComponents
ConnectedMeshComponents[<i>mr</i>] gives a list {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…} of disjoint path connected meshed regions.

---

ConnectedMoleculeQ
ConnectedMoleculeQ[<i>mol</i>] returns True if the atoms in <i>mol</i> form are connected by bonds, and False otherwise.

---

ConnectionSettings
ConnectionSettings is an option for URLRead and related functions to specify advanced connection settings.

---

ConnectLibraryCallbackFunction
ConnectLibraryCallbackFunction[<i>mname</i>,<i>cf</i>] connects a CompiledFunction <i>cf</i> with the library callback manager with name <i>mname</i>.

---

ConnesWindow
ConnesWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Connes window function of <i>x</i>.

ConnesWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

ConservativeConvectionPDETerm
ConservativeConvectionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>α</i>] represents a conservative convection term ∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub>·(-α u) with conservative convection coefficient α and model variables <i>vars</i>.

ConservativeConvectionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>α</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

Constant
Constant is an attribute that indicates zero derivative of a symbol with respect to all parameters. 

---

ConstantArray
ConstantArray[<i>c</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a list of <i>n</i> copies of the element <i>c</i>.

ConstantArray[<i>c</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an n<sub>1</sub>n<sub>2</sub>… array of nested lists containing copies of the element <i>c</i>.

---

ConstantArrayLayer
ConstantArrayLayer[] represents a layer that has no input and produces as output a constant array.

ConstantArrayLayer[<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial value of the array or output size.

---

ConstantImage
ConstantImage[<i>val</i>,<i>size</i>] gives an image of the specified <i>size</i> with constant pixel values of <i>val</i>.

ConstantImage[<i>val</i>,<i>size</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives an image converted to the specified type.

---

ConstantPlusLayer
ConstantPlusLayer[] represents a layer that adds a learnable bias to its input.

ConstantPlusLayer[<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial bias and other parameters. 

---

ConstantRegionQ
ConstantRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] gives True if the <i>reg</i> is a constant region and False otherwise.

---

Constants
Constants is an option for Dt which gives a list of objects to be taken as constants. 

---

ConstantTimesLayer
ConstantTimesLayer[] represents a layer that multiplies its input by a learnable scaling array.

ConstantTimesLayer[<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial scaling and other parameters. 

---

ConstellationData
ConstellationData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the constellation <i>entity</i>.

ConstellationData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified constellation entities.

ConstellationData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Construct
Construct[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>].

Construct[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] gives <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>].

---

Containing
Containing["<i>outer</i>","<i>inner</i>"] represents an object of type <i>outer</i> containing objects of type <i>inner</i>.

---

ContainsAll
ContainsAll[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains all of the elements of <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ContainsAll[<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] is an operator form that yields True when the object to which it is applied contains all of the elements of <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ContainsAny
ContainsAny[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains any of the elements of <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ContainsAny[<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] is an operator form that yields True when the object to which it is applied contains any of the elements in <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ContainsExactly
ContainsExactly[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains exactly the same elements as <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ContainsExactly[<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] is an operator form that yields True when the object to which it is applied contains exactly the same elements as <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ContainsNone
ContainsNone[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains none of the elements in <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ContainsNone[<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] is an operator form that yields True when the object to which it is applied contains none of the elements of <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ContainsOnly
ContainsOnly[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains only elements that appear in <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

ContainsOnly[<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] is an operator form that yields True when the object to which it is applied contains only elements that appear in <i>list</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ContentDetectorFunction
ContentDetectorFunction[…] represents a function generated by TrainImageContentDetector or TrainTextContentDetector that localizes and classifies contents in a piece of text or an image.

---

ContentFieldOptions
ContentFieldOptions is an option for CreateSearchIndex and related functions that allows options to be specified for handling different fields in content that is being indexed.

---

ContentLocationFunction
ContentLocationFunction is an option to CreateSearchIndex and related functions that specifies how to determine locations to be used for hyperlinks and related constructs in the resulting index.

---

ContentObject
ContentObject["<i>string</i>"] gives a content object whose content is <i>string</i>.

ContentObject[File[…]] gives a content object whose content is stored in the specified file.

ContentObject[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a content object with a sequence of fields with names <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ContentPadding
ContentPadding is an option for objects that can be displayed with frames that specifies whether the vertical margins should shrink wrap tightly around the contents.

---

ContentSelectable
ContentSelectable is an option to constructs such as Inset, Graphics, and GraphicsGroup that specifies whether and how content within them should be selectable. 

---

ContentSize
ContentSize is an option for Manipulate and other functions that specifies the size of the content area to use.

---

Context
Context[] gives the current context. 

Context[<i>symbol</i>] gives the context in which a symbol appears. 

Context["<i>symbol</i>"] gives the context in which the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" appears if it exists.

---

Contexts
Contexts[] gives a list of all contexts. 

Contexts["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the contexts that match the string. 

---

ContextToFileName
ContextToFileName["<i>context</i>"] gives the string specifying the file name that is by convention associated with a particular context.

---

Continue
Continue[] goes to the next iteration of the nearest enclosing Do, For, Until or While in a procedural program. 

---

ContinuedFraction
ContinuedFraction[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a list of the first <i>n</i> terms in the continued fraction representation of <i>x</i>. 

ContinuedFraction[<i>x</i>] generates a list of all terms that can be obtained given the precision of <i>x</i>. 

---

ContinuedFractionK
ContinuedFractionK[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents the continued fraction Κ<sub>i=i<sub>min</sub></sub><sup>i<sub>max</sub></sup>f/g.

ContinuedFractionK[<i>g</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents the continued fraction Κ<sub>i=i<sub>min</sub></sub><sup>i<sub>max</sub></sup>1/g.

---

ContinuousAction
ContinuousAction is an option for Manipulate, Slider, and related functions that specifies whether action should be taken continuously while controls are being moved.

---

ContinuousMarkovProcess
ContinuousMarkovProcess[<i>i</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>q</i>] represents a continuous-time finite-state Markov process with transition rate matrix <i>q</i> and initial state <i>i</i><sub>0</sub>.

ContinuousMarkovProcess[<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>q</i>] represents a Markov process with initial state probability vector <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>.

ContinuousMarkovProcess[…,<i>m</i>,μ] represents a Markov process with transition matrix <i>m</i> and transition rates μ.

ContinuousMarkovProcess[…,<i>g</i>] represents a Markov process transition rate matrix from the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

ContinuousTask
ContinuousTask[<i>expr</i>] represents a task in which <i>expr</i> is continuously reevaluated.

ContinuousTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>end</i>] represents a task in which <i>expr</i> is continuously reevaluated until the time specified by <i>end</i>.

ContinuousTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>tspan</i>] represents a task in which <i>expr</i> is continuously reevaluated over the time span <i>tspan</i>.

---

ContinuousTimeModelQ
ContinuousTimeModelQ[<i>lsys</i>] gives True if <i>lsys</i> is a continuous-time systems model, and False otherwise.

---

ContinuousWaveletData
