ContinuousWaveletData[{{<i>oct</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>voc</i><sub>1</sub>}-><i>coef</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>wave</i>] yields a continuous wavelet data object with wavelet coefficients <i>coef</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to octave and voice {<i>oct</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>voc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} and wavelet <i>wave</i>.

---

ContinuousWaveletTransform
ContinuousWaveletTransform[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the continuous wavelet transform of a list of values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the continuous wavelet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

ContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i><i>,</i><i>{</i><i>noct</i>,<i>nvoc</i>}] gives the continuous wavelet transform using <i>noct</i> octaves with <i>nvoc</i> voices per octave.

ContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>sound</i>,…] gives the continuous wavelet transform of sampled sound.

---

ContourDetect
ContourDetect[<i>image</i>] gives a binary image in which white pixels correspond to the zeros and zero crossings in <i>image</i>.

ContourDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>delta</i>] treats values in <i>image</i> that are smaller in absolute value than <i>delta</i> as zero.

ContourDetect[<i>array</i>,…] gives a binary sparse array in which 1 corresponds to zeros and zero crossings in <i>array</i>. 

---

ContourGraphics
ContourGraphics[<i>array</i>] is a representation of a contour plot. 

---

ContourLabels
ContourLabels is an option for contour plots that specifies how to label contours. 

---

ContourLines
ContourLines is an option for contour plots that specifies whether to draw explicit contour lines. 

---

ContourPlot
ContourPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a contour plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>. 

ContourPlot[<i>f</i>==<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots contour lines for which <i>f</i>=<i>g</i>. 

ContourPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>==<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>==<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several contour lines. 

ContourPlot[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

ContourPlot3D
ContourPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] produces a three-dimensional contour plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, and <i>z</i>. 

ContourPlot3D[<i>f</i>==<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots the contour surface for which f=g. 

ContourPlot3D[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

Contours
Contours is an option for contour plots that specifies the contours to draw. 

---

ContourShading
ContourShading is an option for contour plots that specifies how the regions between contour lines should be shaded. 

---

ContourStyle
ContourStyle is an option for contour plots that specifies the style in which contour lines or surfaces should be drawn. 

---

ContraharmonicMean
ContraharmonicMean[<i>list</i>] gives the contraharmonic mean of the values in <i>list</i>.

ContraharmonicMean[<i>list</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the order <i>p</i> Lehmer contraharmonic mean.

---

ContrastiveLossLayer
ContrastiveLossLayer[] represents a loss layer that computes a loss based on a distance metric and a target that specifies whether the distance should be minimized or maximized.

ContrastiveLossLayer[<i>margin</i>] specifies a distance above which the loss is zero for True targets.

---

Control
Control[{<i>u</i>,<i>dom</i>}] represents an interactive control for the variable <i>u</i> in the domain <i>dom</i>, with the type of control chosen to be appropriate for the domain specified.

Control[{{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>init</i></sub>},<i>dom</i>}] represents a control with initial value <i>u</i><sub><i>init</i></sub>.

---

ControlActive
ControlActive[<i>act</i>,<i>norm</i>] evaluates to <i>act</i> if a control that affects <i>act</i> is actively being used, and to <i>norm</i> otherwise.

---

ControllabilityGramian
ControllabilityGramian[<i>ssm</i>] gives the controllability Gramian of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

ControllabilityMatrix
ControllabilityMatrix[<i>ssm</i>] gives the controllability matrix of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

ControllableDecomposition
ControllableDecomposition[<i>sys</i>] yields the controllable subsystem of the state-space model <i>sys</i>.

ControllableDecomposition[<i>sys</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] specifies the new state variables <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ControllableModelQ
ControllableModelQ[<i>sys</i>] yields True if the state-space model <i>sys</i> is controllable, and False otherwise.

ControllableModelQ[{<i>sys</i>,<i>sub</i>}] yields True if the subsystem <i>sub</i> is controllable.

---

ConvectionPDETerm
ConvectionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>β</i>] represents a convection term β·∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub>u with convection coefficient β and model variables <i>vars</i>.

ConvectionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>β</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

Convergents
Convergents[<i>list</i>] gives a list of the convergents corresponding to the continued fraction terms <i>list</i>.

Convergents[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> convergents for a number <i>x</i>.

Convergents[<i>x</i>] gives if possible all convergents leading to the number <i>x</i>.

---

ConversionOptions
ConversionOptions is an option to Import and Export used to pass special options to a particular format.

---

ConversionRules
ConversionRules is an option for Cell that can be set to a list of rules specifying how the contents of the cell are to be converted to external formats. 

---

ConvexHullMesh
ConvexHullMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a BoundaryMeshRegion representing the convex hull from the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ConvexHullMesh[<i>mreg</i>] gives the convex hull of the mesh region <i>mreg</i>.

---

ConvexHullRegion
ConvexHullRegion[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the convex hull from the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ConvexHullRegion[<i>reg</i>] gives the convex hull of the region <i>reg</i>.

---

ConvexOptimization
ConvexOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the convex objective function <i>f</i> subject to convex constraints <i>cons</i>.

ConvexOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

ConvexPolygonQ
ConvexPolygonQ[<i>poly</i>] gives True if the polygon <i>poly</i> is convex, and False otherwise.

---

ConvexPolyhedronQ
ConvexPolyhedronQ[<i>poly</i>] gives True if the polyhedron <i>poly</i> is convex, and False otherwise.

---

ConvexRegionQ
ConvexRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] gives True if <i>reg</i> is a convex region and False otherwise. 

---

ConvolutionLayer
ConvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>] represents a trainable convolutional net layer having <i>n</i> output channels and using kernels of size <i>s</i> to compute the convolution.

ConvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,{<i>s</i>}] represents a layer performing one-dimensional convolutions with kernels of size <i>s</i>.

ConvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>}] represents a layer performing two-dimensional convolutions with kernels of size <i>h</i>×<i>w</i>.

ConvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>,<i>d</i>}] represents a three-dimensional convolutions with kernels of size <i>h</i>×<i>w</i><i>×</i><i>d</i>.

ConvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>kernel</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for padding and other parameters.

---

Convolve
Convolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the convolution with respect to <i>x</i> of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>.

Convolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional convolution.

---

ConwayGroupCo1
ConwayGroupCo1[] represents the sporadic simple Conway group Co<sub>1</sub>.

---

ConwayGroupCo2
ConwayGroupCo2[] represents the sporadic simple Conway group Co<sub>2</sub>.

---

ConwayGroupCo3
ConwayGroupCo3[] represents the sporadic simple Conway group Co<sub>3</sub>.

---

CookieFunction
CookieFunction is an option for URLRead, HTTPRequest, and related functions that gives a function to apply to each cookie received when an HTTP response is received.

---

CoordinateBounds
CoordinateBounds[<i>coords</i>] gives a list {{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…} of the bounds in each dimension of the region defined by <i>coords</i>. 

CoordinateBounds[<i>coords</i>,δ] pads the ranges of coordinates by ±δ in each dimension.

CoordinateBounds[<i>coords</i>,Scaled[<i>s</i>]] pads by the scaled amount <i>s</i> in each dimension.

CoordinateBounds[<i>coords</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads by <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, … in successive dimensions.

CoordinateBounds[<i>coords</i>,{{<i>p</i><sub><i>1min</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>1max</i></sub>},{<i>p</i><sub><i>2min</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>2max</i></sub>},…}] gives {{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>-<i>p</i><sub><i>1min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>+<i>p</i><sub><i>1max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>-<i>p</i><sub><i>2min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>+<i>p</i><sub><i>2max</i></sub>},…}

---

CoordinateBoundsArray
CoordinateBoundsArray[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] generates an array of {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} coordinates with integer steps in each dimension.

CoordinateBoundsArray[{<i>xrange</i>,<i>yrange</i>,…},<i>d</i>] uses step <i>d</i> in each dimension.

CoordinateBoundsArray[{<i>xrange</i>,<i>yrange</i>,…},{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>,…}] uses steps <i>dx</i>, <i>dy</i>, … in successive dimensions.

CoordinateBoundsArray[{<i>xrange</i>,<i>yrange</i>,…},Into[<i>n</i>]] divides into <i>n</i> equal steps in each dimension.

CoordinateBoundsArray[{<i>xrange</i>,<i>yrange</i>,…},<i>steps</i>,<i>offsets</i>] specifies offsets to use for each coordinate point.

CoordinateBoundsArray[{<i>xrange</i>,<i>yrange</i>,…},<i>steps</i>,<i>offsets</i>,<i>k</i>] expands the array by <i>k</i> elements in every direction. 

---

CoordinateChartData
CoordinateChartData[<i>chart</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for <i>chart</i>.

CoordinateChartData[<i>chart</i>,<i>property</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the value of the specified property for <i>chart</i> evaluated at the point {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

---

CoordinatesToolOptions
CoordinatesToolOptions is an option for Graphics that gives values of options associated with the Get Coordinates tool.

---

CoordinateTransform
CoordinateTransform[<i>t</i>,<i>pt</i>] performs the coordinate transformation <i>t</i> on the point <i>pt</i>.

CoordinateTransform[<i>t</i>,{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] transforms several points.

---

CoordinateTransformData
CoordinateTransformData[<i>t</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the coordinate transformation <i>t</i>.

CoordinateTransformData[<i>t</i>,<i>property</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the value of the property evaluated at the point {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

---

CoplanarPoints
CoplanarPoints[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>4</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] tests whether the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>4</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> are coplanar.

---

CoprimeQ
CoprimeQ[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>n</i><sub>2</sub> are relatively prime, and yields False otherwise. 

CoprimeQ[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] yields True if all pairs of the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are relatively prime, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Coproduct
Coproduct[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x∐y∐….

---

CopulaDistribution
CopulaDistribution[<i>ker</i>,{<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a copula distribution with kernel distribution <i>ker</i> and marginal distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

---

CopyDatabin
CopyDatabin[<i>bin</i>] creates a copy of a databin.

CopyDatabin[<i>bin</i>,<i>options</i>] creates a copy with the specified options.

---

CopyDirectory
CopyDirectory[<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>] copies the directory <i>dir</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

CopyToClipboard
CopyToClipboard[<i>expr</i>] replaces the contents of the clipboard with <i>expr</i>.

---

CoreNilpotentDecomposition
CoreNilpotentDecomposition[<i>m</i>] yields the core-nilpotent decomposition of a square matrix <i>m</i>.

CoreNilpotentDecomposition[<i>m</i>,<i>format</i>] returns the core-nilpotent decomposition according to the specified <i>format</i>.

---

CornerFilter
CornerFilter[<i>image</i>] computes a measure for the presence of a corner for each pixel in <i>image</i> and returns the result as an intensity image.

CornerFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] detects corners at a pixel range <i>r</i>.

---

CornerNeighbors
CornerNeighbors is an option for various array and image processing functions that specifies whether diagonally adjacent corners should be considered neighbors of particular elements. 

---

CorrelationDistance
CorrelationDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the correlation coefficient distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

CorrelationFunction
CorrelationFunction[<i>data</i>,<i>hspec</i>] estimates the correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> from <i>data</i>.

CorrelationFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>hspec</i>] represents the correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

CorrelationFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the correlation function at times <i>s</i> and <i>t</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

---

CorrelationTest
CorrelationTest[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] tests whether the correlation coefficient for a bivariate population is zero.

CorrelationTest[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},ρ<sub>0</sub>] tests whether the correlation coefficient is ρ<sub>0</sub>.

CorrelationTest[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] tests whether the correlation coefficients for two populations are equal.

CorrelationTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Cos
Cos[<i>z</i>] gives the cosine of <i>z</i>. 

---

Cosh
Cosh[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic cosine of <i>z</i>. 

---

CoshIntegral
CoshIntegral[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic cosine integral Chi(z).

---

CosineDistance
CosineDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the angular cosine distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

CosineWindow
CosineWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a cosine window function of <i>x</i>.

CosineWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the exponent α.

---

CosIntegral
CosIntegral[<i>z</i>] gives the cosine integral function Ci(z). 

---

Cot
Cot[<i>z</i>] gives the cotangent of <i>z</i>. 

---

Coth
Coth[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic cotangent of <i>z</i>. 

---

CoulombF
CoulombF[<i>l</i>,η,<i>r</i>] gives the regular Coulomb wavefunction F<sub>l</sub>(η,r).

---

CoulombG
CoulombG[<i>l</i>,η,<i>r</i>] gives the irregular Coulomb wavefunction G<sub>l</sub>(η,r).

---

CoulombH1
CoulombH1[<i>l</i>,η,<i>r</i>] gives the outgoing irregular Coulomb wavefunction H<sub>l</sub><sup>(+)</sup>(η,r).

---

CoulombH2
CoulombH2[<i>l</i>,η,<i>r</i>] gives the incoming irregular Coulomb wavefunction H<sub>l</sub><sup>(-)</sup>(η,r).

---

Count
Count[<i>list</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives the number of elements in <i>list</i> that match <i>pattern</i>. 

Count[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives the total number of subexpressions matching <i>pattern</i> that appear at the levels in <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Count[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of Count that can be applied to an expression.

---

CountDistinct
CountDistinct[<i>list</i>] gives the number of distinct elements that appear in <i>list</i>.

CountDistinct[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] applies <i>test</i> to pairs of elements to determine whether they should be considered equivalent.

---

CountDistinctBy
CountDistinctBy[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] gives the number of distinct values of <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] that occur.

CountDistinctBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of CountDistinctBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

CounterAssignments
CounterAssignments is an option for selections that sets the value of a specified counter.

---

CounterFunction
CounterFunction is an option for counters that specifies the symbols used to display the value of the counter.

---

CounterIncrements
CounterIncrements is an option for selections that specifies whether the value of a specified counter is incremented by one.

---

CountRoots
CountRoots[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the number of real roots of the univariate function <i>f</i> in <i>x</i>.

CountRoots[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] gives the number of roots between <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>. 

---

CountryData
CountryData["<i>tag</i>",<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the country, country-like entity, or group of countries specified by "<i>tag</i>".

CountryData["<i>tag</i>",{<i>property</i>,…,<i>dates</i>}] gives time series for certain economic and other properties.

---

Counts
Counts[<i>list</i>] gives an association whose keys are the distinct elements of <i>list</i>, and whose values give the number of times those elements appear in <i>list</i>.

Counts[<i>list</i>,<i>elems</i>] gives an association whose keys are the distinct elements in <i>elems</i>, and whose values give the number of times those elements appear in <i>list</i>.

---

CountsBy
CountsBy[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] gives an association whose keys are the distinct values of the <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>], and whose values give the number of times these <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] values appear.

CountsBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of CountsBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

CovarianceEstimatorFunction
CovarianceEstimatorFunction is an option for generalized linear model fitting functions that specifies the estimator for the parameter covariance matrix.

---

CovarianceFunction
CovarianceFunction[<i>data</i>,<i>hspec</i>] estimates the covariance function at lags <i>hspec</i> from <i>data</i>.

CovarianceFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>hspec</i>] represents the covariance function at lags <i>hspec</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

CovarianceFunction[<i>proc</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the covariance function at times <i>s</i> and <i>t</i> for the random process <i>proc</i>. 

---

CoxianDistribution
CoxianDistribution[{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i><i>-</i>1</sub>},{λ<sub>1</sub>,…,λ<sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represent an <i>m</i>-phase Coxian distribution with phase probabilities α<sub><i>i</i></sub> and rates λ<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CoxIngersollRossProcess
CoxIngersollRossProcess[μ,σ,θ,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents a Cox–Ingersoll–Ross process with long‐term mean μ, volatility σ, speed of adjustment θ, and initial condition <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

CoxModel
CoxModel[…] represents the symbolic proportional hazards model obtained from CoxModelFit.

---

CoxModelFit
CoxModelFit[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>e</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] constructs a model of the baseline hazard h<sub>0</sub>(t) for events times <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CoxModelFit[{{{ξ<sub>11</sub>,…,ξ<sub>1<i>p</i></sub>},…,{<i>ξ<sub>n 1</sub></i>,…,ξ<sub><i>np</i></sub>}},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>e</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}},{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>}] constructs a Cox model of the form h<sub>0</sub>(t) exp(β<sub>1</sub> f<sub>1</sub>+…+β<sub>m</sub> f<sub>m</sub>), where the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> depend on the <i>x</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

---

CramerVonMisesTest
CramerVonMisesTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Cramér–von Mises test.

CramerVonMisesTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Cramér–von Mises test.

CramerVonMisesTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

CreateArchive
CreateArchive[<i>source</i>] creates a compressed archive in the current directory from <i>source</i>.

CreateArchive[<i>source</i>,<i>path</i>] creates a compressed archive in the directory or file specified by <i>path</i>.

---

CreateChannel
CreateChannel[] creates a new channel for channel communication, with a generated name.

CreateChannel["<i>path</i>"] creates a channel with the specified path relative to the home area of the currently authenticated user.

CreateChannel[<i>object</i>] creates a channel based on the given ChannelObject specification.

---

CreateCompilerEnvironment
CreateCompilerEnvironment[] creates a compiler environment that can be used in FunctionCompile and related functions.

---

CreateDatabin
CreateDatabin[] creates a databin in the Wolfram Data Drop and returns the corresponding Databin object.

CreateDatabin[<i>options</i>] creates a databin with the specified options.

---

CreateDataStructure
CreateDataStructure["<i>type</i>",<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] creates a data structure with the specified type.

---

CreateDirectory
CreateDirectory["<i>dir</i>"] creates a directory with name <i>dir</i>. 

CreateDirectory[] creates a directory in the default area for temporary directories on your computer system.

---

CreateFile
CreateFile["<i>file</i>"] creates a file with name <i>file</i>. 

CreateFile[] creates a file in the default area for temporary files on your computer system.

---

CreateIntermediateDirectories
CreateIntermediateDirectories is an option for CreateDirectory and related functions that specifies whether to create intermediate directories in a directory path specified.

---

CreateLicenseEntitlement
CreateLicenseEntitlement[<i>settings</i>] creates an on-demand license entitlement using <i>settings</i>.

CreateLicenseEntitlement[] creates an on-demand license entitlement using the default settings.

---

CreateManagedLibraryExpression
CreateManagedLibraryExpression[<i>mname</i>,<i>f</i>] creates a managed library expression by applying <i>f</i> to a positive integer ID associated with a registered manager with name <i>mname</i>.

---

CreatePacletArchive
CreatePacletArchive[<i>source</i>] creates a paclet archive file from <i>source</i>.

CreatePacletArchive[<i>source</i>,<i>destdir</i>] creates a paclet archive file from <i>source</i> and places it in <i>destdir</i>.

---

CreatePermissionsGroup
CreatePermissionsGroup["<i>name</i>"] creates a permissions group with the specified name.

CreatePermissionsGroup["<i>name</i>",{<i>user</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>user</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a permissions group consisting of the specified initial users.

---

CreateScheduledTask
CreateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>] creates a local scheduled task that will repeatedly evaluate <i>expr</i> once per second.

CreateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>time</i>] creates a task that will repeatedly evaluate <i>expr</i> every <i>time</i> seconds.

CreateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,{<i>time</i>}] creates a task that will evaluate <i>expr</i> once after <i>time</i> seconds.

CreateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,{<i>time</i>,<i>count</i>}] creates a task that will try evaluating <i>expr</i> once every <i>time</i> seconds up to <i>count</i> times total.

CreateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>timespec</i>,<i>start</i>] creates a task that will evaluate <i>expr</i> according to <i>timespec</i> starting at <i>start</i> time.

---

CreateSearchIndex
CreateSearchIndex[<i>dir</i>] creates a search index from all files in the directory <i>dir</i> and its subdirectories.

CreateSearchIndex[{<i>source</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>source</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a search index from all sources <i>source</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CreateSearchIndex[<i>sources</i>,"<i>name</i>"] gives the search index the specified name.

CreateSearchIndex[] creates an empty search index, which can be added to with AddToSearchIndex.

---

CreateTemporary
CreateTemporary[] creates a temporary file with a unique name in the default temporary directory and returns the name of the file.

---

CreateUUID
CreateUUID[] creates a random, universally unique UUID string.

CreateUUID["<i>base</i>"] appends a UUID string to the specified base string.

---

CriterionFunction
CriterionFunction is an option in functions such as ClusterClassify that specifies the criterion to use to select a method.

---

CriticalityFailureImportance
CriticalityFailureImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the criticality failure importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

CriticalityFailureImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the criticality failure importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

CriticalitySuccessImportance
CriticalitySuccessImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the criticality success importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

CriticalitySuccessImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the criticality success importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

CriticalSection
CriticalSection[<i>var</i>,<i>expr</i>] acquires the lock <i>var</i> for parallel computation, evaluates <i>expr</i>, then releases the lock <i>var</i>.

CriticalSection[{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] locks all variables <i>var</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> simultaneously.

---

Cross
Cross[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the vector cross product of <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>. 

---

CrossEntropyLossLayer
CrossEntropyLossLayer["Index"] represents a net layer that computes the cross-entropy loss by comparing input class probability vectors with indices representing the target class.

CrossEntropyLossLayer["Probabilities"] represents a net layer that computes the cross-entropy loss by comparing input class probability vectors with target class probability vectors.

CrossEntropyLossLayer["Binary"] represents a net layer that computes the binary cross-entropy loss by comparing input probability scalars with target probability scalars, where each probability represents a binary choice.

---

CrossingCount
CrossingCount[<i>contour</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a count of the number of times a ray starting from the point <i>p</i> crosses the closed curve <i>contour</i>.

---

CrossingDetect
CrossingDetect[<i>image</i>] gives a binary image in which white pixels correspond to the zero crossings in <i>image</i>.

CrossingDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>delta</i>] treats values in <i>image</i> that are smaller in absolute value than <i>delta</i> as zero.

CrossingDetect[<i>array</i>,…] gives a binary sparse array in which 1 corresponds to zero crossings in <i>array</i>. 

---

CrossingPolygon
CrossingPolygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives a Polygon representing all points for which a ray from the point in any direction in the plane crosses the line segments {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},…,{<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i>-1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>} an odd number of times.

CrossingPolygon[{{<i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>p</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] gives a Polygon from the line segments {<i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>},…,{<i>p</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>22</sub>},….

---

Csc
Csc[<i>z</i>] gives the cosecant of <i>z</i>. 

---

Csch
Csch[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic cosecant of <i>z</i>. 

---

CSGRegion
CSGRegion[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the solid region corresponding to the union of solid regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,….

CSGRegion[<i>"op"</i>,{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the solid region corresponding to the Boolean combination <i>"op"</i> of regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,….

CSGRegion[<i>"op"</i>,{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] represents the solid region defined by regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> transformed by a geometric transformation <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CSGRegionQ
CSGRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] yields True if the region <i>reg</i> is a valid CSGRegion object and False otherwise.

---

CSGRegionTree
CSGRegionTree[<i>reg</i>] gives the tree expression representing the CSG region <i>reg</i>.

---

CTCLossLayer
CTCLossLayer[] represents a net layer that computes the connectionist temporal classification loss by comparing a sequence of class probability vectors with a sequence of indices representing the target classes.

---

Cube
Cube[] represents a regular cube centered at the origin with unit edge length.

Cube[<i>l</i>] represents a cube with edge length <i>l</i>.

Cube[{θ,ϕ},…] represents a cube rotated by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

Cube[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},…] represents a cube centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

CubeRoot
CubeRoot[<i>x</i>] gives the real-valued cube root of <i>x</i>.

---

Cubics
Cubics is an option for functions that involve solving algebraic equations, that specifies whether explicit forms for solutions to cubic equations should be given.

---

Cuboid
Cuboid[<i>p</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>] represents a unit hypercube with its lower corner at <i>p</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>.

Cuboid[<i>p</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] represents an axis-aligned filled cuboid with lower corner <i>p</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and upper corner <i>p</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

Cumulant
Cumulant[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the <i>r</i><sup>th</sup> cumulant κ<sub>r</sub> of <i>data</i>.

Cumulant[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>} ] gives the multivariate cumulant of order {<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>} κ<sub>r<sub>1</sub>, …, r<sub>m</sub></sub> of <i>data</i>.

Cumulant[<i><i>dist</i></i>,<i>r</i>] gives the <i>r</i><sup>th</sup> cumulant of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

Cumulant[<i>r</i>] represents the <i>r</i><sup>th</sup> formal cumulant. 

---

CumulantGeneratingFunction
CumulantGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the cumulant-generating function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>t</i>. 

CumulantGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the cumulant-generating function for the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variables <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, … . 

---

Cup
Cup[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⌣<i>y</i>⌣….

---

CupCap
CupCap[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≍<i>y</i>≍….

---

Curl
Curl[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the curl ∂f<sub>2</sub>/∂x<sub>1</sub>-∂f<sub>1</sub>/∂x<sub>2</sub>.

Curl[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>3</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the curl (∂f<sub>3</sub>/∂x<sub>2</sub>-∂f<sub>2</sub>/∂x<sub>3</sub>,∂f<sub>1</sub>/∂x<sub>3</sub>-∂f<sub>3</sub>/∂x<sub>1</sub>,∂f<sub>2</sub>/∂x<sub>1</sub>-∂f<sub>1</sub>/∂x<sub>2</sub>).

Curl[<i>f</i>,<i>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</i>] gives the curl of the n×n×…×n array <i>f</i> with respect to the n-dimensional vector {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

Curl[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>chart</i>] gives the curl in the coordinates <i>chart</i>.

---

CurrencyConvert
CurrencyConvert[<i>quantity</i>,<i>target</i>] attempts to convert the specified currency <i>quantity</i> to the specified <i>target</i> currency.

CurrencyConvert[<i>quantity</i>,<i>target</i>,<i>date</i>] converts to the target currency for the historical <i>date</i> specification.

---

CurrentDate
CurrentDate[<i>gran</i>] gives the current date of the specified granularity type <i>gran</i>.

CurrentDate[<i>date</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the date of the given granularity that includes the specified date.

CurrentDate[] gives the instant corresponding to the current date.

---

CurrentImage
CurrentImage[] returns the current image captured from a connected camera.

CurrentImage[<i>n</i>] returns <i>n</i> sequential image frames as a list.

---

Curry
Curry[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that Curry[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>].

Curry[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of two arguments so that Curry[<i>f</i>][<i>y</i>][<i>x</i>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>].

Curry[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that Curry[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub></sub>].

Curry[<i>f</i>,<i>k</i>{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a <i>k</i>-arguments operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that Curry[<i>f</i>,<i>k</i>{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub></sub>], with <i>k</i>≥Max[{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}].

---

CurryApplied
CurryApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that CurryApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>].

CurryApplied[<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of CurryApplied that can be applied to a function to represent an operator form with <i>n</i> arguments.

CurryApplied[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that CurryApplied[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub></sub>].

CurryApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>k</i>{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an operator form that takes <i>k</i> arguments.

---

CurvatureFlowFilter
CurvatureFlowFilter[<i>image</i>] applies a mean curvature flow filter to <i>image</i>.

CurvatureFlowFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] specifies the amount of curvature flow time <i>t</i> to be applied.

CurvatureFlowFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>k</i>] applies the curvature flow with a modified conductance term parametrized by <i>k</i>.

---

CurveClosed
CurveClosed is an option for JoinedCurve that specifies whether individual curve components should be closed curves.

---

Cyan
Cyan represents the color cyan in graphics or style specifications. 

---

CycleGraph
CycleGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the cycle graph with <i>n</i> vertices C<sub>n</sub>.

---

CycleIndexPolynomial
CycleIndexPolynomial[<i>perm</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] constructs the cycle index monomial of the permutation <i>perm</i> in the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CycleIndexPolynomial[<i>group</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] constructs the cycle index polynomial of <i>group</i> in the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Cycles
Cycles[{<i>cyc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cyc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a permutation with disjoint cycles <i>cyc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

CyclicGroup
CyclicGroup[<i>n</i>] represents the cyclic group of degree <i>n</i>.

---

Cyclotomic
Cyclotomic[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> cyclotomic polynomial in <i>x</i>. 

---

Cylinder
Cylinder[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>}},<i>r</i>] represents a cylinder of radius <i>r</i> around the line from (<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>) to (<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>). 

Cylinder[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>}}] represents a cylinder of radius 1. 

---

CylindricalDecomposition
CylindricalDecomposition[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a decomposition of the region represented by the statement <i>expr</i> into cylindrical parts whose directions correspond to the successive <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

CylindricalDecomposition[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>op</i>] finds a decomposition of the result of applying the topological operation <i>op</i> to the region represented by the statement <i>expr</i>.

CylindricalDecomposition[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"Function"] represents the result as CylindricalDecompositionFunction[…][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] that can be efficiently used in further computation.

---

CylindricalDecompositionFunction
CylindricalDecompositionFunction[<i>data</i>][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a cylindrical algebraic formula in <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

D
D[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the partial derivative ∂f/∂x. 

D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives the multiple derivative ∂<sup>n</sup>f/∂x<sup>n</sup>.

D[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] gives the partial derivative ⋯ (∂/∂y)(∂/∂x) f.

D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>},{<i>y</i>,<i>m</i>},…] gives the multiple partial derivative ⋯ (∂<sup>m</sup>/∂y<sup>m</sup>)(∂<sup>n</sup>/∂x<sup>n</sup>) f.

D[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] for a scalar <i>f</i> gives the vector derivative (∂f/∂x<sub>1</sub>,∂f/∂x<sub>2</sub>,…). 

D[<i>f</i>,{<i>array</i>}] gives an array derivative.

---

DagumDistribution
DagumDistribution[<i>p</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a Dagum distribution with shape parameters <i>p</i> and <i>a</i> and scale parameter <i>b</i>.

---

DamData
DamData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the dam <i>entity</i>.

DamData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified dam entities.

DamData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

DamerauLevenshteinDistance
DamerauLevenshteinDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Damerau–Levenshtein distance between strings or vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

DamerauLevenshteinDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Damerau–Levenshtein distance between strings, vectors or biomolecular sequences <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

DampingFactor
DampingFactor is an option for FindRoot, which can be used to control convergence behavior. DampingFactor -> <i>n</i> uses a damping factor of <i>n</i> in Newton's method.

---

Darker
Darker[<i>color</i>] represents a darker version of the specified color. 

Darker[<i>color</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a version of the specified color darkened by a fraction <i>f</i>. 

Darker[<i>image</i>,…] gives a darker version of an image.

Darker[<i>video</i>,…] gives a version of a video with darker frames.

---

Dashed
Dashed is a graphics directive specifying that lines that follow should be drawn dashed.

---

Dashing
Dashing[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is a two-dimensional graphics directive specifying that lines that follow are to be drawn dashed, with successive segments of lengths <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, … (repeated cyclically). The <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are given as a fraction of the total width of the graph. 

Dashing[<i>r</i>] is equivalent to Dashing[{<i>r</i>,<i>r</i>}].

Dashing[<i>{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},offset</i>] offsets the dashes by <i>offset</i>.

Dashing[<i>{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},offset,capform</i>] sets the CapForm for individual dashes to <i>capform</i>.

---

DatabaseConnect
DatabaseConnect[<i>db</i>] activates a connection to the database db.

---

DatabaseDisconnect
DatabaseDisconnect[<i>db</i>] deactivates a connection to the database db. 

---

DatabaseReference
DatabaseReference[File["<i>filename</i>"]] represents a reference to a local file-based SQL database.

DatabaseReference[URL["<i>url</i>"]] represents a reference to a server-based SQL database.

DatabaseReference[<i>assoc</i>] represents a fully specified reference to any SQL database.

---

Databin
Databin["<i>id</i>"] represents a databin in the Wolfram Data Drop.

Databin["<i>id</i>",<i>n</i>] represents the first <i>n</i> entries in a databin.

Databin["<i>id</i>",-<i>n</i>] represents the most recent <i>n</i> entries in a databin.

Databin["<i>id</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] represents entries <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in a databin, with negative numbers counting from the end.

Databin["<i>id</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>}] represents entries <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> with step <i>s</i>.

Databin["<i>id</i>",<i>time</i>] represents entries going back for the quantity of time specified by <i>time</i>.

Databin["<i>id</i>",<i>date</i>] represents the entries in a databin from the specified date to now.

Databin["<i>id</i>",{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents the entries in a databin from <i>date</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>date</i><sub>2</sub>.

Databin["<i>id</i>",<i>range</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents only elements with keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> within each entry in a databin.

---

DatabinAdd
DatabinAdd[<i>bin</i>,<i>data</i>] adds the specified data to a databin.

---

DatabinRemove
DatabinRemove[<i>bin</i>,<i>i</i>] removes the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup>entry from a databin.

DatabinRemove[<i>bin</i>,<i>uuid</i>] removes the entry with the specified UUID from a databin.

DatabinRemove[<i>bin</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>}] removes the span of entries with indices from <i>i</i> through <i>j</i>.

---

Databins
Databins[] gives a list of databins associated with the currently connected user.

---

DatabinSubmit
DatabinSubmit[<i>bin</i>,<i>data</i>] submits the specified <i>data</i> to be added to the databin <i>bin</i> asynchronously.

---

DatabinUpload
DatabinUpload[<i>bin</i>,{<i>entry</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entry</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] bulk uploads all the entries <i>entry</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to a databin.

DatabinUpload[<i>bin</i>,EventSeries[…]] bulk uploads all entries in an event series to a databin.

---

DataDistribution
DataDistribution[<i>ddist</i>,<i>…</i>] represents a probability distribution of type <i>ddist</i>, estimated from a set of data.

---

DataRange
DataRange is an option for functions such as ListPlot and ListDensityPlot that specifies what range of actual coordinates the data should be assumed to occupy. 

---

DataReversed
DataReversed is an option for ArrayPlot and related functions that specifies whether data should be plotted in reverse order.

---

Dataset
Dataset[<i>data</i>] represents a structured dataset based on a hierarchy of lists and associations.

---

DatasetTheme
DatasetTheme is an option for Dataset that specifies an overall theme for a dataset and its elements. 

---

DataStructure
DataStructure["<i>type</i>",<i>data</i>] represents a data structure.

---

DataStructureQ
DataStructureQ[<i>ds</i>] yields True if <i>ds</i> is a valid data structure and False otherwise.

DataStructureQ[<i>ds</i>,<i>type</i>] yields True if <i>ds</i> is a valid data structure of the specified type and False otherwise.

---

Date
Date[] gives the current local date and time in the form {<i>year</i>,<i>month</i>,<i>day</i>,<i>hour</i>,<i>minute</i>,<i>second</i>}. 

---

DateBounds
DateBounds[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the earliest and latest of the <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DateBounds[<i>tseries</i>] gives the first and last dates in the time series <i>tseries</i>.

DateBounds[<i>bin</i>] gives the first and last time stamps in the databin <i>bin</i>.

DateBounds[<i>interval</i>] gives the start and end dates of the date interval <i>interval</i>.

DateBounds[<i>interval</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the endpoints of <i>interval</i> in the specified granularity <i>gran</i>.

---

Dated
Dated[<i>obj</i>,<i>year</i>] represents the object <i>obj</i> associated with a particular year.

Dated[<i>obj</i>,<i>date</i>] represents the object <i>obj</i> associated with a date.

Dated[<i>obj</i>,All] represents the object <i>obj</i> for all dates where information is available about it.

---

DateDifference
DateDifference[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the number of days from <i>date</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>date</i><sub>2</sub>.

DateDifference[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,"<i>unit</i>"] gives the difference between <i>date</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>date</i><sub>2</sub> in the specified unit.

DateDifference[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,{"<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] gives the difference as a list with elements corresponding to the successive "<i>unit</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

DatedUnit
DatedUnit[<i>unit</i>,<i>date</i>] represents the specified <i>unit</i> at a specific <i>date</i>.

---

DateFunction
DateFunction is an option for DateListPlot and TemporalData that specifies how dates given as input should be interpreted.

---

DateHistogram
DateHistogram[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a histogram of the dates <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DateHistogram[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>bspec</i>] plots a histogram with bin width specification <i>bspec</i>.

DateHistogram[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a histogram with bin heights computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

DateHistogram[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DateInterval
DateInterval[{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] represents the continuous interval of time between <i>start</i> and <i>end</i>.

DateInterval[{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>},<i>gran</i>] represents an interval of dates with calendar granularity <i>gran</i>.

DateInterval[{{<i>start</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>end</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>start</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>end</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents the union of intervals <i>start</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>end</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>start</i><sub>2</sub> to <i>end</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

DateInterval[<i>gdate</i>] gives the date interval from the initial to final instants of the granular date object <i>gdate</i>.

---

DateList
DateList[] gives the current local date and time in the form {<i>year</i>,<i>month</i>,<i>day</i>,<i>hour</i>,<i>minute</i>,<i>second</i>}. 

DateList[<i>date</i>] gives a date list corresponding to the given <i>date</i> specification.

---

DateListLogPlot
DateListLogPlot[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a log plot with values <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at a sequence of dates.

DateListLogPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>datespec</i>] makes a log plot with dates at equal intervals specified by <i>datespec</i>.

DateListLogPlot[<i>tseries</i>] plots the time series <i>tseries</i>.

DateListLogPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DateListLogPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

DateListPlot
DateListPlot[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…,{<i>date</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] plots points with values <i>y<sub>i</sub></i> at a sequence of dates.

DateListPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>datespec</i>] plots points with dates at equal intervals specified by <i>datespec</i>.

DateListPlot[<i>tseries</i>] plots the time series <i>tseries</i>.

DateListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DateListPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

DateListStepPlot
DateListStepPlot[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots the values <i>y<sub>i</sub></i> in steps at a sequence of dates.

DateListStepPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>datespec</i>] plots the values <i>y<sub>i</sub></i> in steps with dates at equal intervals specified by <i>datespec</i>.

DateListStepPlot[<i>tseries</i>] plots the time series <i>tseries</i>.

DateListStepPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DateListStepPlot[…,<i>step</i>] plots using steps specified by <i>step</i>.

DateListStepPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots data <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

DateObject
DateObject[] gives the current local date.

DateObject[<i>date</i>] gives a date object corresponding to the given <i>date</i> specification.

DateObject[<i>rdate</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the date object of calendar granularity <i>gran</i> that includes the reference date <i>rdate</i>.

---

DateObjectQ
DateObjectQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a DateObject with valid arguments, and False otherwise.

---

DateOverlapsQ
DateOverlapsQ[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if the calendar dates <i>date</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>date</i><sub>2</sub> overlap, and False otherwise.

---

DatePattern
DatePattern[{"<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] represents the characters of a date with elements of type "<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" in StringExpression.

DatePattern[{"<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>",…},<i>sep</i>] allows separators that match the string expression <i>sep</i>.

---

DatePlus
DatePlus[<i>date</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the date <i>n</i> days after <i>date</i>.

DatePlus[<i>date</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>step</i>}] gives the date <i>n</i> calendar steps after <i>date</i>.

DatePlus[<i>date</i>,{{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives a date offset by <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> steps of each specified size. 

DatePlus[<i>n</i>] gives the date <i>n</i> days after the current date.

DatePlus[<i>offset</i>] gives the date with the specified offset from the current date.

---

DateRange
DateRange[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] gives all dates in the range from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i>.

DateRange[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>increment</i>] gives the dates in the range from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i> that are <i>increment</i> apart.

---

DateReduction
DateReduction is an option for DateHistogram that specifies the length for cyclic periods of time.

---

DateScale
DateScale[] represents the canonical mapping of continuous dates and times to a quantitative scale.

---

DateSelect
DateSelect[<i>list</i>,<i>crit</i>] picks out all dates <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of a list for which <i>crit</i>[<i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

DateSelect[<i>int</i>,<i>crit</i>] returns all dates within the DateInterval <i>int</i> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

DateSelect[<i>crit</i>] represents an operator form of DateSelect that can be applied to an expression.

---

DateString
DateString[] gives a string representing the complete current local date and time. 

DateString[<i>date</i>] gives a string corresponding to the given <i>date</i> specification.

DateString[{"<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] concatenates the specified elements in the order given.

DateString[<i>date</i>,<i>fmt</i>] gives elements specified by the date format <i>fmt</i> for the date or time specification <i>date</i>.

---

DateTicksFormat
DateTicksFormat is an option for DateListPlot which specifies how date tick labels should be formatted.

---

DateValue
DateValue["<i>elem</i>"] gives the specified element of the current date and time.

DateValue[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the specified elements of the current date and time.

DateValue[<i>date</i>,<i>elem</i>] gives the specified element of the specified date.

DateValue[<i>date</i>,<i>elem</i>,<i>form</i>] gives the result in the specified form.

---

DateWithinQ
DateWithinQ[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if the calendar date <i>date</i><sub>2</sub> is entirely contained within <i>date</i><sub>1</sub>, and False otherwise.

---

DaubechiesWavelet
DaubechiesWavelet[] represents a Daubechies wavelet of order 2. 

DaubechiesWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents a Daubechies wavelet of order <i>n</i>.

---

DavisDistribution
DavisDistribution[<i>b</i>,<i>n</i>,μ] represents a Davis distribution with scale parameter <i>b</i>, shape parameter <i>n</i>, and location parameter μ.

---

DawsonF
DawsonF[<i>z</i>] gives the Dawson integral F(z).

---

DayCount
DayCount[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the number of days from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i>.

DayCount[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>daytype</i>] gives the number of days of the specified <i>daytype</i> from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i>.

---

DayCountConvention
DayCountConvention is an option that specifies the day count convention used by DateDifference.

---

DayHemisphere
DayHemisphere[] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the half of the Earth that is currently in daylight. 

DayHemisphere[<i>datespec</i>] represents the daylight half of the Earth for the specified date.

---

DaylightQ
DaylightQ[] gives True if it is currently daylight from the user's location.

DaylightQ[<i>datespec</i>] gives True if it is daylight from the user's location on the specified <i>datespec</i>.

DaylightQ[<i>locationspec</i>] gives True if it is currently daylight from the specified <i>locationspec</i>.

DaylightQ[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives True if it is daylight from the specified <i>locationspec</i> on the specified <i>datespec</i>.

DaylightQ[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives True if it is daylight from the specified locations and dates.

DaylightQ[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>inclusionspec</i>] gives True if it is daylight from the specified <i>locationspec</i> on the specified <i>datespec</i> taking <i>inclusionspec</i> into account.

---

DayMatchQ
DayMatchQ[<i>date</i>,<i>daytype</i>] returns True if the date matches the <i>daytype</i> specification and returns False otherwise.

---

DayName
DayName[] gives the current day of the week.

DayName[<i>date</i>] gives the day of the week for the given date.

---

DayNightTerminator
DayNightTerminator[] is a one-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the separation line between the halves of the Earth currently in daytime and nighttime.

DayNightTerminator[<i>datespec</i>] represents the separation line between day and night for the specified date.

---

DayPlus
DayPlus[<i>date</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the date <i>n</i> days away from <i>date</i>.

DayPlus[<i>date</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>daytype</i>] gives the date that is <i>n</i> days of <i>daytype</i> away from <i>date</i>.

---

DayRange
DayRange[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the dates in the range from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i>.

DayRange[<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>daytype</i>] gives the dates in the range from <i>date<sub>1</sub></i> to <i>date<sub>2</sub></i> that are of the specified <i>daytype</i>.

---

DayRound
DayRound[<i>date</i>,<i>daytype</i>] rounds <i>date</i> to the nearest day of <i>daytype</i>,<i> </i>using the next-day rounding convention.

DayRound[<i>date</i>,<i>daytype</i>,<i>rounding</i>] rounds <i>date</i> to the nearest day of <i>daytype</i>, using <i>rounding</i>.

---

DeBruijnGraph
DeBruijnGraph[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>-dimensional De Bruijn graph with <i>m</i> symbols.

DeBruijnGraph[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>type</i>] gives the De Bruijn graph with connectivity given by <i>type</i>.

---

DeBruijnSequence
DeBruijnSequence[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a de Bruijn sequence on the elements in <i>list</i> taken <i>n</i> at a time.

DeBruijnSequence[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a de Bruijn sequence on the elements 0,…,<i>k</i>-1.

DeBruijnSequence["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives a de Bruijn sequence on the characters in "<i>string</i>".

---

Decapitalize
Decapitalize[<i>string</i>] yields a string in which the first character has been made lowercase.

---

DecimalForm
DecimalForm[<i>expr</i>] prints with approximate real numbers in <i>expr</i> always given in decimal form, without scientific notation.

DecimalForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with approximate real numbers given in decimal form to <i>n</i>-digit precision.

DecimalForm[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>f</i>}] prints with approximate real numbers having <i>n</i> digits, with <i>f</i> digits to the right of the decimal point.

---

DeclarePackage
DeclarePackage["<i>context</i>`",{"<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] declares that Needs["<i>context</i>`"] should automatically be executed if a symbol with any of the specified names is ever used. 

---

Decompose
Decompose[<i>poly</i>,<i>x</i>] decomposes a polynomial, if possible, into a composition of simpler polynomials. 

---

DeconvolutionLayer
DeconvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>sz</i>] represents a trainable deconvolutional net layer having <i>n</i> output channels and using kernels of size <i>sz</i> to compute the deconvolution.

DeconvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,{<i>s</i>}] represents a layer performing one-dimensional deconvolutions with kernels of size <i>s</i>.

DeconvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,{<i>h</i>,w}] represents a layer performing two-dimensional deconvolutions with kernels of size <i>h</i>×<i>w</i>.

DeconvolutionLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>kernel</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial kernels and other parameters. 

---

Decrement
<i>x</i>-- decreases the value of <i>x</i> by 1, returning the old value of <i>x</i>. 

---

Decrypt
Decrypt["<i>password</i>",<i>enc</i>] attempts to decrypt the encrypted object <i>enc</i> using the specified password.

Decrypt[<i>keyspec</i>,<i>enc</i>] attempts to decrypt using the cryptographic key specification <i>keyspec</i>.

Decrypt[<i>obj</i>] interactively requests a password with which to try to decrypt <i>obj</i>.

---

DecryptFile
DecryptFile["<i>password</i>",<i>file</i>] generates a decrypted version of a file, using the specified password.

DecryptFile["<i>password</i>",<i>source</i>,<i>target</i>] generates a decrypted version of <i>source</i>, putting the result in <i>target</i>.

DecryptFile[<i>keyspec</i>,<i>source</i>,…] decrypts using the cryptographic key specification <i>keyspec</i>.

---

DedekindEta
DedekindEta[τ] gives the Dedekind eta modular elliptic function η(τ).

---

DeepSpaceProbeData
DeepSpaceProbeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the deep space probe <i>entity</i>.

DeepSpaceProbeData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified deep space probe entities.

DeepSpaceProbeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

DefaultAxesStyle
DefaultAxesStyle is a low-level option for graphics functions that specifies the default style to use in displaying axes and axes-like constructs.

---

DefaultColor
DefaultColor is an option for graphics functions that specifies the default color to use for lines, points, etc. 

---

DefaultDuration
DefaultDuration is an option to Animate and related functions that specifies the default total duration of the animation in seconds.

---

DefaultElement
DefaultElement is an option for Grid and related constructs which specifies what to insert when a new element is interactively created.

---

DefaultFaceGridsStyle
DefaultFaceGridsStyle is a low-level option for 3D graphics functions that specifies the default style to use in rendering face grids.

---

DefaultFieldHintStyle
DefaultFieldHintStyle is a low-level option for InputField that specifies the default style to use for displaying the field hint.

---

DefaultFontProperties
DefaultFontProperties is a global option that allows overriding properties of specified font families.

---

DefaultFrameStyle
DefaultFrameStyle is a low-level option for graphics and related constructs that specifies the default style to use in displaying their frames.

---

DefaultFrameTicksStyle
DefaultFrameTicksStyle is a low-level option for 2D graphics functions that specifies the default style to use in rendering frame ticks.

---

DefaultGridLinesStyle
DefaultGridLinesStyle is a low-level option for 2D graphics functions that specifies the default style to use in rendering grid lines.

---

DefaultNaturalLanguage
DefaultNaturalLanguage is an option for character selections that specifies the language used when checking the spelling of a word in a human natural language selection.

---

DefaultOptions
DefaultOptions is a style option that allows default options to be specified for particular formatting and related constructs. 

---

DefaultPrintPrecision
DefaultPrintPrecision is an option for NumberForm, DecimalForm and related functions that specifies the default number of digits of precision with which to print machine numbers.

---

DefaultStyleDefinitions
DefaultStyleDefinitions is a global option that specifies the default stylesheet for all new notebooks.

---

DefaultTicksStyle
DefaultTicksStyle is a low-level option for graphics functions that specifies the default style to use in rendering ticks.

---

DefaultTooltipStyle
DefaultTooltipStyle is a low-level option for tooltips that specifies the default style to use in displaying their elements.

---

DefaultValues
DefaultValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to default values of <i>f</i>.

DefaultValues["<i>symbol</i>"] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all default values defined for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

---

Defer
Defer[<i>expr</i>] yields an object that displays as the unevaluated form of <i>expr</i>, but that is evaluated if it is explicitly given as Wolfram Language input. 

---

DefineInputStreamMethod
DefineInputStreamMethod["<i>name</i>",{<i>fname</i><sub>1</sub><i>function</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fname</i><sub>2</sub><i>function</i><sub>2</sub>,… }] defines a custom input stream method with the specified name, allowing the Wolfram Language to call the stream functions <i>fname</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for opening and reading from an input stream.

---

DefineOutputStreamMethod
DefineOutputStreamMethod["<i>name</i>",{<i>fname</i><sub>1</sub><i>function</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fname</i><sub>2</sub><i>function</i><sub>2</sub>,… }] defines a custom output stream method with the specified name, allowing the Wolfram Language to call the stream functions for opening and writing to an output stream.

---

DefineResourceFunction
DefineResourceFunction[<i>f</i>] defines a resource function that can be applied to arguments to give the same result as <i>f</i>[…].

DefineResourceFunction[<i>f</i>,<i>name</i>] uses <i>name</i> as the name of the resource function.

---

Definition
Definition[<i>symbol</i>] prints as the definitions given for a symbol.

Definition["<i>symbol</i>"] prints as the definitions given for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

Definition[<i>patt</i>] prints as the definitions given for the symbols whose names textually match the arbitrary string pattern <i>patt</i>.

Definition[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] prints as the definitions given for the symbols that are equal to or or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Degree
Degree gives the number of radians in one degree. It has a numerical value of π/180. 

---

DegreeCentrality
DegreeCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of vertex degrees for the vertices in the underlying simple graph of <i>g</i>.

DegreeCentrality[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives a list of vertex in-degrees.

DegreeCentrality[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives a list of vertex out-degrees.

DegreeCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

DegreeGraphDistribution
DegreeGraphDistribution[<i>dlist</i>] represents a degree graph distribution with vertex degree <i>dlist</i>.

---

DEigensystem
DEigensystem[<i>ℒ</i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x,y,…</i>]],<i>u</i>,<i>{x,y,…}</i>∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> smallest magnitude eigenvalues and eigenfunctions for the linear differential operator <i>ℒ</i> over the region Ω.

DEigensystem[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>{x,y,…}</i>∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the eigenvalues and eigenfunctions for solutions <i>u</i> of the time-dependent differential equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

DEigenvalues
DEigenvalues[<i>ℒ</i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> smallest magnitude eigenvalues for the linear differential operator <i>ℒ</i> over the region Ω.

DEigenvalues[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>t</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the eigenvalues for solutions <i>u</i> of the time-dependent differential equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

Del
Del[<i>x</i>] displays as ∇x.

---

DelaunayMesh
DelaunayMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a MeshRegion representing the Delaunay mesh from the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

Delayed
Delayed[<i>expr</i>] represents an expression whose evaluation is delayed until its value is externally requested.

Delayed[<i>expr</i>,<i>fmt</i>] specifies that the result from evaluating <i>expr</i> should be given in format <i>fmt</i>.

Delayed[<i>expr</i>,{<i>fmt</i>,<i>rform</i>}] specifies that the result should be given as a response of the form <i>rform</i>.

---

Delete
Delete[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] deletes the element at position <i>n</i> in <i>expr</i>. If <i>n</i> is negative, the position is counted from the end. 

Delete[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] deletes the part at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}. 

Delete[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] deletes parts at several positions. 

Delete[<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of Delete that can be applied to an expression.

---

DeleteAnomalies
DeleteAnomalies[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list in which <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that are considered anomalous have been dropped.

DeleteAnomalies[<i>fun</i>,<i>data</i>] drops anomalies in <i>data</i> using the given AnomalyDetectorFunction[…] or LearnedDistribution[…].

---

DeleteBorderComponents
DeleteBorderComponents[<i>image</i>] replaces connected components adjacent to the border in a binary image <i>image</i> with background pixels.

DeleteBorderComponents[<i>m</i>] replaces components adjacent to the border in a label matrix <i>m</i> with 0.

---

DeleteCases
DeleteCases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>] removes all elements of <i>expr</i> that match <i>pattern</i>. 

DeleteCases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] removes all parts of <i>expr</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i> that match <i>pattern</i>. 

DeleteCases[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] removes the first <i>n</i> parts of <i>expr</i> that match <i>pattern</i>. 

DeleteCases[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of DeleteCases that can be applied to an expression.

---

DeleteChannel
DeleteChannel[<i>channel</i>] deletes the specified channel from the channel broker server.

DeleteChannel[{<i>channel</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>channel</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes all the <i>channel</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DeleteChannel[All] deletes all channels owned by the currently authenticated user.

---

DeleteContents
DeleteContents is an option for DeleteDirectory that specifies whether the contents of directories should automatically be deleted.

---

DeleteDirectory
DeleteDirectory["<i>dir</i>"] deletes the specified directory. 

---

DeleteDuplicates
DeleteDuplicates[<i>data</i>] deletes all duplicates from <i>data</i>.

DeleteDuplicates[<i>data</i>,<i>test</i>] applies <i>test</i> to pairs of elements to determine whether they should be considered duplicates. 

---

DeleteDuplicatesBy
DeleteDuplicatesBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>] deletes those <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in <i>data</i> that yield duplicates in the list {<i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>],…}.

DeleteDuplicatesBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of DeleteDuplicatesBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

DeleteFile
DeleteFile["<i>file</i>"] deletes a file. 

DeleteFile[{"<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] deletes a list of files. 

---

DeleteMissing
DeleteMissing[<i>list</i>] drops elements with head Missing from a list.

DeleteMissing[<i>assoc</i>] drops elements whose values have head Missing from the association <i>assoc</i>.

DeleteMissing[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] applies DeleteMissing to any lists or associations that occur within the first <i>n</i> levels of <i>expr</i>.

DeleteMissing[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] considers an element at level <i>n</i> to be missing if Missing occurs within the first <i>d</i> levels of the element.

---

DeleteObject
DeleteObject[<i>obj</i>] deletes the object <i>obj</i>.

DeleteObject[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes all the <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeletePermissionsKey
DeletePermissionsKey[<i>key</i>] deletes a permissions key, rendering it invalid.

DeletePermissionsKey[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes several permissions keys.

---

DeleteSearchIndex
DeleteSearchIndex[<i>obj</i>] deletes the search index represented by the search index object <i>obj</i>.

DeleteSearchIndex["<i>name</i>"] deletes the search index with the specified name in the SearchIndices[] list.

---

DeleteSmallComponents
DeleteSmallComponents[<i>image</i>] replaces small connected components in a binary image <i>image</i> with background pixels.

DeleteSmallComponents[<i>m</i>] replaces positive integers in a label matrix <i>m</i> with 0 if their tally is small.

DeleteSmallComponents[…,<i>n</i>] replaces components consisting of <i>n</i> or fewer elements.

---

DeleteStopwords
DeleteStopwords[<i>list</i>] deletes stopwords from a list of words.

DeleteStopwords["<i>string</i>"] deletes stopwords from a string.

DeleteStopwords[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes stopwords from a list of strings.

---

DelimitedSequence
DelimitedSequence[<i>form</i>] represents a delimited sequence of elements of the specified form in Interpreter and related functions.

DelimitedSequence[<i>form</i>,<i>sep</i>] assumes a separator that matches <i>sep</i>.

DelimitedSequence[<i>form</i>,{<i>left</i>,<i>sep</i>,<i>right</i>}] assumes left and right delimiters matching <i>left</i> and <i>right</i>, respectively.

---

Delimiter
Delimiter represents a delimiter to be displayed in objects such as PopupMenu, Manipulate, and FormObject. 

---

DelimiterMatching
DelimiterMatching is an option for selections that specifies whether an opening delimiter will match only its respective closing delimiter or any closing delimiter.

---

Delimiters
Delimiters is an option to various functions that specifies what delimiters to use or look for.

---

DeliveryFunction
DeliveryFunction is an option that specifies how material such as documents generated by DocumentGenerator should be delivered.

---

Dendrogram
Dendrogram[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs a dendrogram from the hierarchical clustering of the elements <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Dendrogram[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed dendrogram.

Dendrogram[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed dendrogram.

Dendrogram[<i>label</i><sub>1</sub><i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>label</i><sub>2</sub><i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using labels <i>label</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the constructed dendrogram.

Dendrogram[<i>data</i>,<i>orientation</i>] constructs an oriented dendrogram according to <i>orientation</i>.

Dendrogram[<i>tree</i>] constructs the dendrogram corresponding to weighted tree <i>tree</i>. 

---

Denominator
Denominator[<i>expr</i>] gives the denominator of <i>expr</i>. 

---

DensityGraphics
DensityGraphics[<i>array</i>] is a representation of a density plot. 

---

DensityHistogram
DensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a density histogram of the values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

DensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>bspec</i>] plots a density histogram with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

DensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a density histogram with bin densities computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

---

DensityPlot
DensityPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a density plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>. 

DensityPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

DensityPlot3D
DensityPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a density plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, and <i>z</i>.

DensityPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

DependentVariables
DependentVariables is an option for NDSolve and other functions that specifies the list of all objects that should be considered as dependent variables in equations that have been supplied.

---

Depth
Depth[<i>expr</i>] gives the maximum number of indices needed to specify any part of <i>expr</i>, plus 1. 

---

DepthFirstScan
DepthFirstScan[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs a depth-first scan of the graph <i>g</i> starting at the vertex <i>s</i> and evaluates <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> whenever "<i>event</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" occurs.

DepthFirstScan[<i>g</i>,{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs a depth-first scan of the whole graph <i>g</i>.

DepthFirstScan[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Derivative
<i>f</i>' represents the derivative of a function <i>f</i> of one argument. 

Derivative[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…][<i>f</i>] is the general form, representing a function obtained from <i>f</i> by differentiating <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> times with respect to the first argument, <i>n</i><sub>2</sub> times with respect to the second argument, and so on. 

---

DerivativeFilter
DerivativeFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sup>th</sup> derivative of <i>data</i> at level <i>i</i>.

DerivativeFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},σ] computes the derivative at a Gaussian scale of standard deviation σ.

DerivativeFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>der</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>der</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] computes several derivatives <i>der</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>der</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

DerivativePDETerm
DerivativePDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>γ</i>] represents a load derivative term ∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub>·(γ) with load derivative coefficient γ and model variables <i>vars</i>.

DerivativePDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>γ</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

DerivedKey
DerivedKey[<i>assoc</i>] represents a derived key generated by GenerateDerivedKey.

---

DescriptorStateSpace
