DescriptorStateSpace is an option to StateSpaceModel and StateSpaceTransform that specifies whether to use descriptor or standard representation.

---

DesignMatrix
DesignMatrix[{{<i>x</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>12</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>22</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs the design matrix for the linear model β<sub>0</sub>+β<sub>1</sub> <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>+β<sub>2</sub> <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>+….

---

Det
Det[<i>m</i>] gives the determinant of the square matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

DeviceClose
DeviceClose[<i>device</i>] closes the connection to a device and frees related resources.

---

DeviceConfigure
DeviceConfigure[<i>device</i>,<i>config</i>] configures the specified device according to <i>config</i>.

---

DeviceExecute
DeviceExecute[<i>device</i>,"<i>command</i>"] executes the specified command on a device.

DeviceExecute[<i>device</i>,"<i>command</i>",<i>params</i>] executes the command with the parameters <i>params</i>.

---

DeviceExecuteAsynchronous
DeviceExecuteAsynchronous[<i>device</i>,"<i>command</i>",<i>fun</i>] initiates asynchronous execution of the specified command on a device, calling the handler function <i>fun</i> when an event occurs.

DeviceExecuteAsynchronous[<i>device</i>,"<i>command</i>",<i>params</i>,<i>fun</i>] executes the command with the parameters <i>params</i>.

---

DeviceObject
DeviceObject[…] represents a device that can be accessed in a Wolfram Language session.

---

DeviceOpen
DeviceOpen["<i>devclass</i>"] opens a connection to the first available device in the class specified by "<i>devclass</i>".

DeviceOpen["<i>devclass</i>",<i>spec</i>] opens a connection to the particular device defined by <i>spec</i>.

DeviceOpen[<i>device</i>] opens a connection to an existing device specified by a DeviceObject.

---

DeviceRead
DeviceRead[<i>devobj</i>] reads a single default item from the open device corresponding to the specified DeviceObject.

DeviceRead["<i>devclass</i>"] reads from the default device in the class "<i>devclass</i>".

DeviceRead[<i>device</i>,<i>param</i>] reads the parameter <i>param</i> from the specified device.

DeviceRead[<i>device</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads the list of parameters <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the specified device.

---

DeviceReadBuffer
DeviceReadBuffer[<i>device</i>] reads the complete contents of the buffer on a device.

DeviceReadBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>] reads <i>n</i> elements from the buffer.

DeviceReadBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>crit</i>] reads elements from the buffer until the device-specific criterion <i>crit</i> is met.

DeviceReadBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>param</i>] reads elements associated with the parameter <i>param</i>. 

DeviceReadBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>crit</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads elements associated with the <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeviceReadLatest
DeviceReadLatest[<i>device</i>] returns the most recently collected default item from a device.

DeviceReadLatest[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a list of the <i>n</i> most recently collected items.

DeviceReadLatest[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>param</i>] returns the <i>n</i> most recently collected values of <i>param</i>.

DeviceReadLatest[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns a list of the most recently collected values of the <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeviceReadList
DeviceReadList[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>] reads from the specified device <i>n</i> times, returning a list of the results.

DeviceReadList[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>param</i>] reads the parameter <i>param</i>.

DeviceReadList[<i>device</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads the list of parameters <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeviceReadTimeSeries
DeviceReadTimeSeries[<i>device</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>dt</i>}] repeatedly reads default items from the specified device at interval <i>dt</i> for a total time <i>t</i>, returning a time series of the resulting values.

DeviceReadTimeSeries[<i>device</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>dt</i>},<i>param</i>] repeatedly reads the parameter <i>param</i> and returns a time series of its values.

DeviceReadTimeSeries[<i>device</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>dt</i>},{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] repeatedly reads the <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and returns a time series of their values.

---

Devices
Devices[] gives a list of registered devices on a particular system.

Devices[<i>form</i>] gives a list of devices in classes whose names match the string pattern <i>form</i>.

Devices[{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of devices in classes whose names match any of the <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeviceStreams
DeviceStreams[<i>device</i>] gives a list of all open streams associated with a device.

DeviceStreams[<i>device</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of streams whose names match the string pattern <i>patt</i>.

DeviceStreams[<i>device</i>,{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of streams whose names match any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DeviceWrite
DeviceWrite[<i>device</i>,<i>val</i>] writes the value <i>val</i> to the specified device.

DeviceWrite[<i>device</i>,{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] writes the sequence of values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to the specified device.

DeviceWrite[<i>device</i>,<i>param</i><i>val</i>] writes <i>val</i> as the value of the parameter <i>param</i>.

DeviceWrite[<i>device</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] writes values of several parameters.

---

DeviceWriteBuffer
DeviceWriteBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>vals</i>] fills the buffer on a device with the values <i>vals</i>.

DeviceWriteBuffer[<i>device</i>,<i>param</i><i>vals</i>] fills the buffer associated with the parameter <i>param</i> with the values <i>vals</i>.

DeviceWriteBuffer[<i>device</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>vals<sub>1</sub></i>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>vals<sub>2</sub></i>,…}] fills the buffers associated with the <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with the corresponding values <i>v<i>als</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> </i>.

---

DGaussianWavelet
DGaussianWavelet[] represents a derivative of Gaussian wavelet of derivative order 2.

DGaussianWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents a derivative of Gaussian wavelet of derivative order <i>n</i>.

---

DiagonalizableMatrixQ
DiagonalizableMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is diagonalizable, and False otherwise. 

---

Dialog
Dialog[] initiates a dialog. 

Dialog[<i>expr</i>] initiates a dialog with <i>expr</i> as the current value of %. 

---

Diamond
Diamond[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋄<i>y</i>⋄….

---

DiceDissimilarity
DiceDissimilarity[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the Dice dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>.

---

DictionaryLookup
DictionaryLookup[<i>patt</i>] finds all words in an English dictionary that match the string pattern <i>patt</i>.

DictionaryLookup[<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] gives only the first <i>n</i> words found.

DictionaryLookup[{"<i>lang</i>",<i>patt</i>}] finds words in the language specified by <i>lang</i>.

---

DictionaryWordQ
DictionaryWordQ["<i>word</i>"] tests whether "<i>word</i>" is a recognized dictionary word.

---

DifferenceQuotient
DifferenceQuotient[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>h</i>}]  gives the difference quotient (<i>f</i>(<i>x</i>+<i>h</i>)-<i>f</i>(<i>x</i>))/<i>h</i>.

DifferenceQuotient[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>h</i>}] gives a multiple difference quotient with step <i>h</i>.

DifferenceQuotient[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>h</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>h</i><sub>2</sub>},…] computes the partial difference quotient with respect to <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

DifferenceRoot
DifferenceRoot[<i>lde</i>][<i>k</i>] gives the holonomic sequence h(k), specified by the linear difference equation <i>lde</i>[<i>h</i>,<i>k</i>].

DifferenceRoot[<i>lde</i>] represents a pure holonomic sequence h.

---

DifferenceRootReduce
DifferenceRootReduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] attempts to reduce <i>expr</i> to a single DifferenceRoot object as a function of <i>n</i>.

---

DifferentialD
DifferentialD[<i>x</i>] displays as <i>x</i>.

---

DifferentialRoot
DifferentialRoot[<i>lde</i>][<i>x</i>] gives the holonomic function h(x), specified by the linear differential equation <i>lde</i>[<i>h</i>,<i>x</i>].

DifferentialRoot[<i>lde</i>] represents a pure holonomic function h. 

---

DifferentialRootReduce
DifferentialRootReduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] attempts to reduce <i>expr</i> to a single DifferentialRoot object as a function of <i>x</i>.

DifferentialRootReduce[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] takes the initial conditions to be specified at <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

DifferentiatorFilter
DifferentiatorFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>] applies a differentiator filter with a cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub> to an array of data.

DifferentiatorFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

DifferentiatorFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

DiffusionPDETerm
DiffusionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>] represents a diffusion term ∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub>·(-∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i><i>)</i> with model variables <i>vars</i>.

DiffusionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>c</i>] represents a diffusion term ∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub>·(-c∇<sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i><i>)</i> with diffusion coefficient c.

DiffusionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

DigitalSignature
DigitalSignature[<i>assoc</i>] represents a digital signature object.

---

DigitBlock
DigitBlock is an option for NumberForm and related functions that specifies the maximum length of blocks of digits between breaks. 

---

DigitCharacter
DigitCharacter represents a digit character 0–9 in StringExpression. 

---

DigitCount
DigitCount[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the number of <i>d</i> digits in the base-<i>b</i> representation of <i>n</i>. 

DigitCount[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>d</i><i>,</i><i>len</i>] gives the number of <i>d</i> digits in the base-<i>b</i> representation of the last <i>len</i> digits of <i>n</i>. 

DigitCount[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives a list of the numbers of 1, 2, …, b-1, 0 digits in the base-<i>b</i> representation of <i>n</i>. 

DigitCount[<i>n</i>] gives a list of the numbers of 1, 2, …, 9, 0 digits in the base-10 representation of <i>n</i>. 

---

DigitQ
DigitQ[<i>string</i>] yields True if all the characters in the string are digits in the range 0 through 9, and yields False otherwise. 

---

DihedralAngle
DihedralAngle[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>v</i>,<i>w</i>}] gives the angle between two half-planes bounded by the line through <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>2</sub> and extended in the direction <i>v</i> and <i>w</i>. 

---

DihedralGroup
DihedralGroup[<i>n</i>] represents the dihedral group of order <i>2n</i>.

---

Dilation
Dilation[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological dilation of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

Dilation[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the dilation with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

Dilation[<i>data</i>,…] applies dilation to an array of data.

---

DimensionalCombinations
DimensionalCombinations[{<i>pq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pq</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the possible combinations of the list of physical quantities <i>pq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that are dimensionless.

DimensionalCombinations[{<i>pq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pq</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dim</i>] returns the possible combinations of the list of physical quantities <i>pq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that match the dimensions of physical quantity <i>dim</i>.

---

DimensionalMeshComponents
DimensionalMeshComponents[<i>mr</i>] gives a list {<i>r</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…} of regions such that <i>r</i><sub><i>d</i></sub> has dimension <i>d</i> for a mesh region <i>mr</i>.

---

DimensionReduce
DimensionReduce[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] projects the examples <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to a lower-dimensional approximating manifold.

DimensionReduce[<i>examples</i>,<i>n</i>] projects onto an approximating manifold in <i>n</i>-dimensional space. 

---

DimensionReducerFunction
DimensionReducerFunction[…] represents a function generated by DimensionReduction that projects data onto a lower-dimensional approximating manifold.

---

DimensionReduction
DimensionReduction[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a DimensionReducerFunction[…] that projects from the space defined by the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to a lower-dimensional approximating manifold.

DimensionReduction[<i>examples</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a DimensionReducerFunction[…] for an <i>n</i>-dimensional approximating manifold. 

DimensionReduction[<i>examples</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>props</i>] generates the specified properties of the dimensionality reduction. 

---

Dimensions
Dimensions[<i>expr</i>] gives a list of the dimensions of <i>expr</i>. 

Dimensions[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of the dimensions of <i>expr</i> down to level <i>n</i>. 

---

DiracComb
DiracComb[<i>x</i>] represents the Dirac comb function (x) giving a delta function at every integer point. 

DiracComb[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional Dirac comb function (x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…).

---

DiracDelta
DiracDelta[<i>x</i>] represents the Dirac delta function δ(x). 

DiracDelta[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional Dirac delta function δ(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…). 

---

DirectedEdge
DirectedEdge[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] or <i>u</i><i>v</i> represents a directed edge from <i>u</i> to <i>v</i>.

DirectedEdge[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>t</i>] or <i>u</i>&amp;<i>t</i><i>v</i> represents a directed edge from <i>u</i> to <i>v</i> with tag <i>t</i>.

---

DirectedEdges
DirectedEdges is an option for Graph, GraphPlot, and related functions that specifies whether edges should be taken to be directed.

---

DirectedGraph
DirectedGraph[<i>g</i>] gives a directed graph from the undirected graph <i>g</i>.

DirectedGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>conv</i>] gives a directed graph using the conversion <i>conv</i>.

DirectedGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

DirectedGraphQ
DirectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a directed graph and False otherwise.

---

DirectedInfinity
DirectedInfinity[] represents an infinite numerical quantity whose direction in the complex plane is unknown. 

DirectedInfinity[<i>z</i>] represents an infinite numerical quantity that is a positive real multiple of the complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

Direction
Direction is an option for Limit and related functions that specifies the direction in which the limit is taken.

---

DirectionalLight
DirectionalLight[<i>col</i>,<i>pt</i>] is a three–dimensional graphics directive that specifies the directional light of color <i>col</i> from the point <i>pt</i> to the center of the bounding box to use in coloring 3D surfaces.

DirectionalLight[<i>col</i>,{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>}] uses a directional light along the vector from <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

Directive
Directive[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a single graphics directive composed of the directives <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

Directory
Directory[] gives the current working directory. 

---

DirectoryName
DirectoryName["<i>name</i>"] extracts the directory name from the specification for a file. 

---

DirectoryQ
DirectoryQ["<i>name</i>"] gives True if the directory with the specified name exists, and gives False otherwise.

---

DirectoryStack
DirectoryStack[] gives the directory stack that represents the sequence of current directories used. 

---

DirichletBeta
DirichletBeta[<i>s</i>] gives the Dirichlet beta function β(s).

---

DirichletCharacter
DirichletCharacter[<i>k</i>,<i>j</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the Dirichlet character χ<sub>k,j</sub>(n) with modulus <i>k</i> and index <i>j</i>.

---

DirichletCondition
DirichletCondition[<i>beqn</i>,<i>pred</i>] represents a Dirichlet boundary condition given by equation <i>beqn</i>, satisfied on the part of the boundary of the region given to NDSolve and related functions where <i>pred</i> is True.

---

DirichletConvolve
DirichletConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Dirichlet convolution of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>. 

---

DirichletDistribution
DirichletDistribution[{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>k</i>+1</sub>}] represents a Dirichlet distribution of dimension <i>k</i> with shape parameters α<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DirichletEta
DirichletEta[<i>s</i>] gives the Dirichlet eta function η(s).

---

DirichletL
DirichletL[<i>k</i>,<i>j</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the Dirichlet L-function L(χ,s) for the Dirichlet character χ(n) with modulus <i>k</i> and index <i>j</i>.

---

DirichletLambda
DirichletLambda[<i>s</i>] gives the Dirichlet lambda function λ(s).

---

DirichletTransform
DirichletTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the Dirichlet transform of <i>expr</i> with respect to <i>n</i>.

---

DirichletWindow
DirichletWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Dirichlet window function of <i>x</i>.

---

DiscreteAsymptotic
DiscreteAsymptotic[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>∞] gives an asymptotic approximation for <i>expr</i> as <i>n</i> tends to infinity over the integers.

DiscreteAsymptotic[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i>,∞,<i>m</i>}] gives an asymptotic series approximation for <i>expr</i> to order <i>m</i>.

---

DiscreteChirpZTransform
DiscreteChirpZTransform[<i>list</i>] gives the chirp Z transform of <i>list</i>.

DiscreteChirpZTransform[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a length <i>n</i> chirp Z transform.

DiscreteChirpZTransform[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>w</i>] uses a spiral path on the complex z plane defined by <i>w</i>.

DiscreteChirpZTransform[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>w</i>,<i>a</i>] uses <i>a</i> as the complex starting point.

DiscreteChirpZTransform[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional chirp Z transform. 

---

DiscreteConvolve
DiscreteConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the convolution with respect to <i>n</i> of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>. 

DiscreteConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional convolution.

---

DiscreteDelta
DiscreteDelta[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the discrete delta function δ(<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…), equal to 1 if all the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are zero, and 0 otherwise. 

---

DiscreteHadamardTransform
DiscreteHadamardTransform[<i>list</i>] gives the discrete Hadamard transform of <i>list</i>.

---

DiscreteIndicator
DiscreteIndicator[<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields the discrete indicator function, equal to 1 if <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>1</sub> and, otherwise, to 0 if <i>x</i>=<i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for some <i>i</i>.

---

DiscreteLQEstimatorGains
DiscreteLQEstimatorGains[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>},τ] gives the optimal discrete-time estimator gain matrix with sampling period τ for the continuous-time StateSpaceModel <i>ssm</i>, with process and measurement noise covariance matrices <i>w</i> and <i>v</i>.

DiscreteLQEstimatorGains[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>},{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>},τ] specifies <i>sensors</i> as the noisy measurements of <i>ssm</i>.

DiscreteLQEstimatorGains[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>,<i>dinputs</i>},{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>},τ] specifies <i>dinputs</i> as the deterministic inputs of <i>ssm</i>.

---

DiscreteLQRegulatorGains
DiscreteLQRegulatorGains[<i>sspec</i>,<i>wts</i>,τ] gives the discrete-time state feedback gains with sampling period τ for the continuous-time system specification <i>sspec</i> that minimizes a cost function with weights <i>wts</i>.

DiscreteLQRegulatorGains[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

DiscreteLyapunovSolve
DiscreteLyapunovSolve[<i>a</i>,<i>c</i>] finds the numeric solution <i>x</i> of the discrete matrix equation <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>a</i>-<i>x</i><i>c</i>.

DiscreteLyapunovSolve[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>b</i>-<i>x</i><i>c</i>.

DiscreteLyapunovSolve[{<i>a</i>,<i>d</i>},<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>a</i>-<i>d</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>d</i><i>c</i>.

DiscreteLyapunovSolve[{<i>a</i>,<i>d</i>},{<i>b</i>,<i>e</i>},<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>b</i>-<i>d</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>e</i><i>c</i>.

---

DiscreteMarkovProcess
DiscreteMarkovProcess[<i>i</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>m</i>] represents a discrete-time, finite-state Markov process with transition matrix <i>m</i> and initial state <i>i</i><sub>0</sub>.

DiscreteMarkovProcess[<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>m</i>] represents a Markov process with initial state probability vector <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>.

DiscreteMarkovProcess[…,<i>g</i>] represents a Markov process with transition matrix from the graph <i>g</i>.

---

DiscretePlot
DiscretePlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>n</i> when <i>n</i>=1,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DiscretePlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot when <i>n</i> runs from <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DiscretePlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>dn</i>}] uses steps <i>dn</i>. 

DiscretePlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}}] uses the successive values <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>.

DiscretePlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots the values of all the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DiscretePlot3D
DiscretePlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of <i>f</i> when <i>i</i> runs from <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> and <i>j</i> runs from <i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DiscretePlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>dj</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i> and <i>dj</i>.

DiscretePlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}},{<i>j</i>,{<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>j</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] uses successive <i>i</i> values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>j</i><sub><i>m</i></sub> and <i>j</i> values <i>j</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>j</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>. 

DiscretePlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…,…] plots the values of all the <i>f</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

---

DiscreteRatio
DiscreteRatio[<i>f</i>,<i>i</i>] gives the discrete ratio f(i+1)/f(i).

DiscreteRatio[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives the multiple discrete ratio.

DiscreteRatio[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>h</i>}] gives the multiple discrete ratio with step <i>h</i>. 

DiscreteRatio[<i>f</i>,<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…] computes the partial difference ratio with respect to <i>i</i>, <i>j</i>, ….

---

DiscreteTimeModelQ
DiscreteTimeModelQ[<i>lsys</i>] gives True if <i>lsys</i> is a discrete-time systems model, and False otherwise.

---

DiscreteUniformDistribution
DiscreteUniformDistribution[{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents a discrete uniform distribution over the integers from <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DiscreteUniformDistribution[{{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] represents a multivariate discrete uniform distribution over integers within the box {{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}.

---

DiscreteVariables
DiscreteVariables is an option for NDSolve and other functions that specifies variables that only change at discrete times in a temporal integration.

---

DiscreteWaveletData
DiscreteWaveletData[{<i>wind</i><sub>1</sub><i>coef</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>wave</i>,<i>wtrans</i>] yields a discrete wavelet data object with wavelet coefficients <i>coef</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to wavelet index <i>wind</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, wavelet <i>wave</i>, and wavelet transform <i>wtrans</i>.

DiscreteWaveletData[{<i>wind</i><sub>1</sub><i>coef</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>wave</i>,<i>wtrans</i>,{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] yields a discrete wavelet data object assuming data dimensions {<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…}.

---

DiscreteWaveletPacketTransform
DiscreteWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>] gives the discrete wavelet packet transform (DWPT) of an array of <i>data</i>.

DiscreteWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the discrete wavelet packet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

DiscreteWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the discrete wavelet packet transform using <i>r</i> levels of refinement.

---

DiscreteWaveletTransform
DiscreteWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>] gives the discrete wavelet transform (DWT) of an array of <i>data</i>.

DiscreteWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the discrete wavelet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

DiscreteWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the discrete wavelet transform using <i>r</i> levels of refinement.

---

DiscretizeGraphics
DiscretizeGraphics[<i>g</i>] discretizes a 2D or 3D graphic <i>g</i> into a MeshRegion.

DiscretizeGraphics[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] discretizes only the elements in <i>g</i> that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

DiscretizeRegion
DiscretizeRegion[<i>reg</i>] discretizes a region <i>reg</i> into a MeshRegion.

DiscretizeRegion[<i>reg</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] restricts to the bounds [x<sub>min</sub>,x<sub>max</sub>]×⋯.

---

Discriminant
Discriminant[<i>poly</i>,<i>var</i>] computes the discriminant of the polynomial <i>poly</i> with respect to the variable <i>var</i>.

Discriminant[<i>poly</i>,<i>var</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] computes the discriminant modulo p.

---

DisjointQ
DisjointQ[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>list</i><sub>2</sub> do not share any common elements, and False otherwise.

---

Disjunction
Disjunction[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the disjunction of <i>expr</i> over all choices of the Boolean variables <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Disk
Disk[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>r</i>] represents a disk of radius <i>r</i> centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

Disk[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives a disk of radius 1. 

Disk[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>}] gives an axis-aligned elliptical disk with semiaxes lengths <i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>.

Disk[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},…,{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] gives a sector of a disk from angle θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub>.

Disk[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},…] gives multiple identical disks centered at the given coordinates.

---

DiskSegment
DiskSegment[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>r</i>,{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] represents the disk segment from angle θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub> in a disk centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} of radius <i>r</i>.

DiskSegment[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] represents the ellipse segment from angle θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub> in an axis-aligned ellipse with semiaxes lengths <i>r</i><sub><i>x</i></sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>.

---

Dispatch
Dispatch[{<i>lhs</i><sub>1</sub><i>rhs</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lhs</i><sub>2</sub><i>rhs</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an optimized dispatch table representation of a list of rules. The object produced by Dispatch can be used to give the rules in <i>expr</i>/.<i>rules</i>. 

---

DispersionEstimatorFunction
DispersionEstimatorFunction is an option for generalized linear model fitting functions that specifies the estimator for the dispersion parameter.

---

Display
Display[<i>channel</i>,<i>graphics</i>] writes graphics or sound to the specified output channel in PostScript format. 

Display[<i>channel</i>,<i>graphics</i>,"<i>format</i>"] writes graphics or sound in the specified format. 

Display[<i>channel</i>,<i>expr</i>,"<i>format</i>"] writes boxes, cells, or notebook expressions in the specified format. 

---

DisplayAllSteps
DisplayAllSteps is an option to Animate and related functions that specifies whether all frames should be displayed in an animation, even if to do so would slow the animation down.

---

DisplayEndPacket
DisplayEndPacket[] is a WSTP packet that indicates the end of a series of expressions relating to a postscript graphic.

---

DisplayFunction
DisplayFunction is an option for graphics and sound functions that specifies a function to apply to graphics and sound objects before returning them.

---

DisplayPacket
DisplayPacket[] is a WSTP packet that indicates the beginning of a series of expressions related to a PostScript graphic.

---

DisplayString
DisplayString[<i>graphics</i>] generates a string giving graphics or sound in PostScript format. 

DisplayString[<i>graphics</i>,"<i>format</i>"] generates a string giving graphics or sound in the specified format. 

DisplayString[<i>expr</i>,"<i>format</i>"] generates a string giving boxes, cells, or notebook expressions in the specified format. 

---

DistanceFunction
DistanceFunction is an option for functions such as Nearest that specifies the distance value to assume between any two specified points.

---

DistanceMatrix
DistanceMatrix[{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the matrix of distances between each pair of elements <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>u</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>. 

DistanceMatrix[{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the matrix of distances between each pair of elements <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

---

DistanceTransform
DistanceTransform[<i>image</i>] gives the distance transform of <i>image</i>, in which the value of each pixel is replaced by its distance to the nearest background pixel.

DistanceTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

Distribute
Distribute[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…]] distributes <i>f</i> over Plus appearing in any of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Distribute[<i>expr</i>,<i>g</i>] distributes over <i>g</i>. 

Distribute[<i>expr</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>f</i>] performs the distribution only if the head of <i>expr</i> is <i>f</i>. 

---

Distributed
Distributed[<i>x</i>,<i>dist</i>] or <i>x</i><i>dist</i> asserts that the random variable <i>x</i> is distributed according to the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

Distributed[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dist</i>] or {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i> asserts that the random vector {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} is distributed according to the multivariate probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

DistributedContexts
DistributedContexts is an option for various parallel computing functions that specifies which definitions for symbols appearing in an expression should be distributed to all parallel kernels.

---

DistributeDefinitions
DistributeDefinitions[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] distributes all definitions for the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to all parallel kernels.

DistributeDefinitions["<i>context`</i>"] distributes definitions for all symbols in the specified context.

---

DistributionChart
DistributionChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a distribution chart with a distribution symbol for each <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

DistributionChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>data</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a distribution chart with symbol features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

DistributionChart[{{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] makes a distribution chart from multiple groups of datasets {<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

---

DistributionFitTest
DistributionFitTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed. 

DistributionFitTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i>. 

DistributionFitTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

DistributionParameterAssumptions
DistributionParameterAssumptions[<i>dist</i>] gives a logical expression for assumptions on parameters in the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

DistributionParameterQ
DistributionParameterQ[<i>dist</i>] yields True if <i>dist</i> is a valid distribution, and yields False otherwise.

---

Dithering
Dithering is an option for ColorQuantize that specifies whether or not to apply dithering while quantizing the pixel values.

---

Div
Div[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the divergence ∂f<sub>1</sub>/∂x<sub>1</sub>+…+∂f<sub>n</sub>/∂x<sub>n</sub>.

Div[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] gives the divergence in the coordinates <i>chart</i>.

---

Divide
<i>x</i>/<i>y</i> or Divide[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is equivalent to <i>x</i> <i>y</i>^-1. 

---

DivideBy
<i>x</i>/=<i>c</i> divides <i>x</i> by <i>c</i> and returns the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

Dividers
Dividers is an option for Grid and related constructs that specifies where and how to draw divider lines.

---

DivideSides
DivideSides[<i>rel</i>,<i>x</i>] divides each side of the equation or inequality <i>rel</i> by <i>x</i>.

DivideSides[<i>rel</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rel</i><sub>2</sub>] divides the corresponding sides of two equations or inequalities.

DivideSides[<i>rel</i>] divides each side of <i>rel</i> by the right-hand side, producing a 1 right-hand side.

---

Divisible
Divisible[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] yields True if <i>n</i> is divisible by <i>m</i>, and yields False if it is not. 

---

Divisors
Divisors[<i>n</i>] gives a list of the integers that divide <i>n</i>. 

---

DivisorSigma
DivisorSigma[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the divisor function σ<sub>k</sub>(n). 

---

DivisorSum
DivisorSum[<i>n</i>,<i>form</i>] represents the sum of <i>form</i>[<i>i</i>] for all <i>i</i> that divide <i>n</i>.

DivisorSum[<i>n</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>cond</i>] includes only those divisors for which <i>cond</i>[<i>i</i>] gives True.

---

DMSList
DMSList[θ] converts an angle θ given in decimal degrees to a DMS list {<i>degree</i>,<i>minute</i>,<i>second</i>}.

DMSList["<i>dms</i>"] converts a DMS string to a DMS list {<i>degree</i>,<i>minute</i>,<i>second</i>}.

DMSList["<i>latlon</i>"] converts a latitude-longitude string to a pair of DMS lists.

DMSList[GeoPosition[…]] converts GeoPosition data to a pair or array of pairs of DMS lists.

---

DMSString
DMSString[θ] converts an angle θ given in decimal degrees to a degrees-minutes-seconds string.

DMSString[{ϕ,λ}] converts latitude and longitude given in decimal degrees to a DMS latitude-longitude string.

DMSString[{<i>d</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] converts a DMS list to a DMS string.

---

Do
Do[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> <i>n</i> times. 

Do[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates <i>expr</i> with the variable <i>i</i> successively taking on the values 1 through <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> (in steps of 1). 

Do[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with <i>i</i>=<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

Do[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i>. 

Do[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses the successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Do[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] evaluates <i>expr</i> looping over different values of <i>j</i> etc. for each <i>i</i>. 

---

DocumentGenerator
DocumentGenerator[<i>template</i>,<i>timespec</i>] represents a document generator with template <i>template</i> to be evaluated on the schedule defined by <i>timespec</i>.

DocumentGenerator[<i>template</i>,<i>driver</i>,<i>timespec</i>] takes parameters for filling the template from <i>driver</i>.

---

DocumentGeneratorInformation
DocumentGeneratorInformation[<i>cloudobj</i>] returns the properties of the DocumentGenerator <i>cloudobj</i>.

DocumentGeneratorInformation[<i>cloudobj</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the value of the property <i>property</i>.

---

DocumentWeightingRules
DocumentWeightingRules is an option for TextSearch and related functions that allows the specification of weights for documents based on the values of fields in the search index. 

---

Dodecahedron
Dodecahedron[] represents a regular dodecahedron centered at the origin with unit edge length.

Dodecahedron[<i>l</i>] represents a dodecahedron with edge length <i>l</i>.

Dodecahedron[{θ,ϕ},…] represents a dodecahedron rotated by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

Dodecahedron[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},…] represents a dodecahedron centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

DominantColors
DominantColors[<i>image</i>] returns dominant colors in <i>image</i>.

DominantColors[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] returns at most <i>n</i> dominant colors in <i>image</i>.

DominantColors[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property <i>prop</i> for the regions that belong to the same dominant color.

DominantColors[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>format</i>] returns the output in the specified <i>format</i>.

DominantColors[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] returns dominant colors in each <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

DominatorTreeGraph
DominatorTreeGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the dominator tree of the directed graph <i>g</i> from the root vertex <i>r</i>.

---

DominatorVertexList
DominatorVertexList[<i>g</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the list of dominators of the directed graph <i>g</i> from the root vertex <i>r</i>. 

---

DOSTextFormat
DOSTextFormat is an option for OpenRead, OpenWrite, and OpenAppend that specifies whether files should be opened in text mode. With DOSTextFormat -> True, Mathematica uses the normal text format for the type of computer on which Mathematica is running. Text mode typically entails translation of a text file's line-ending characters into the newline character "\n". With DOSTextFormat -> False, files are opened in "binary mode", in which no such translation is performed. On some systems, there is no difference between text mode and binary mode.

---

Dot
<i>a</i>.<i>b</i>.<i>c</i> or Dot[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>] gives products of vectors, matrices, and tensors. 

---

DotDashed
DotDashed is a graphics directive specifying that lines that follow should be drawn dot-dashed.

---

DotEqual
DotEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≐<i>y</i>≐….

---

DotLayer
DotLayer[] represents a net layer that takes the dot product of two or more arrays.

DotLayer[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses given transpose specifications for the respective inputs.

---

DotPlusLayer
DotPlusLayer[<i>n</i>] is equivalent to LinearLayer[<i>n</i>] and should no longer be used. 

---

Dotted
Dotted is a graphics directive specifying that lines that follow should be drawn dotted.

---

DoubleBracketingBar
DoubleBracketingBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,….

---

DoubleDownArrow
DoubleDownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇓<i>�</i>.

---

DoubleLeftArrow
DoubleLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇐<i>y</i>⇐….

---

DoubleLeftRightArrow
DoubleLeftRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇔<i>y</i>⇔….

---

DoubleLeftTee
DoubleLeftTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⫤y.

---

DoubleLongLeftArrow
DoubleLongLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟸<i>y</i>⟸….

---

DoubleLongLeftRightArrow
DoubleLongLeftRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟺<i>y</i>⟺….

---

DoubleLongRightArrow
DoubleLongRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟹<i>y</i>⟹….

---

DoubleRightArrow
DoubleRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇒<i>y</i>⇒….

---

DoubleRightTee
DoubleRightTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊨y.

---

DoubleUpArrow
DoubleUpArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇑<i>y</i>⇑….

---

DoubleUpDownArrow
DoubleUpDownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇕<i>y</i>⇕….

---

DoubleVerticalBar
DoubleVerticalBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∥<i>y</i>∥….

---

DoublyInfinite
DoublyInfinite is an option for LerchPhi. With DoublyInfinite -> True, the summation is taken from -Infinity to Infinity. With DoublyInfinite -> False, the summation is taken from zero to Infinity.

---

DownArrow
DownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↓<i>y</i>↓….

---

DownArrowBar
DownArrowBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⤓<i>y</i>⤓….

---

DownArrowUpArrow
DownArrowUpArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇵<i>y</i>⇵….

---

DownLeftRightVector
DownLeftRightVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥐<i>y</i>⥐….

---

DownLeftTeeVector
DownLeftTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥞<i>y</i>⥞….

---

DownLeftVector
DownLeftVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↽<i>y</i>↽….

---

DownLeftVectorBar
DownLeftVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥖<i>y</i>⥖….

---

DownRightTeeVector
DownRightTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥟<i>y</i>⥟….

---

DownRightVector
DownRightVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇁<i>y</i>⇁….

---

DownRightVectorBar
DownRightVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥗<i>y</i>⥗….

---

Downsample
Downsample[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a downsampled version of the array by sampling every <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> element.

Downsample[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>offset</i>] starts sampling from the element at position <i>offset</i>.

Downsample[<i>image</i>,…] downsamples an image.

---

DownTee
DownTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊤y.

---

DownTeeArrow
DownTeeArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↧<i>y</i>↧….

---

DownValues
DownValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all downvalues (values for <i>f</i>[<i>…</i>]) defined for the symbol <i>f</i>. 

DownValues["<i>symbol</i>"] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all downvalues defined for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

---

DrazinInverse
DrazinInverse[<i>m</i>] finds the Drazin generalized inverse m<sup>D</sup> of a square matrix <i>m</i>.

---

DropoutLayer
DropoutLayer[] represents a net layer that sets its input elements to zero with probability 0.5 during training.

DropoutLayer[<i>p</i>] sets its input elements to zero with probability <i>p</i> during training.

---

DSolve
DSolve[<i>eqn</i>] solves a differential equation <i>eqn</i>.

DSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>x</i>] solves a differential equation for the function <i>u</i>, with independent variable <i>x</i>. 

DSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] solves a differential equation for <i>x</i> between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DSolve[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] solves a list of differential equations. 

DSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] solves a partial differential equation. 

DSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}∈Ω] solves the partial differential equation <i>eqn</i> over the region Ω.

---

DSolveValue
DSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the value of <i>expr</i> determined by a symbolic solution to the ordinary differential equation <i>eqn</i> with independent variable <i>x</i>. 

DSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] uses a symbolic solution for <i>x</i> between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

DSolveValue[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>,…] uses a symbolic solution for a list of differential equations. 

DSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses a solution for the partial differential equation <i>eqn</i>. 

DSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}∈Ω] uses a solution of the partial differential equation <i>eqn</i> over the region Ω.

---

DualPlanarGraph
DualPlanarGraph[<i>g</i>] gives the dual of the planar graph <i>g</i>.

---

DualPolyhedron
DualPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the dual polyhedron of the polyhedron <i>poly</i>.

---

DumpGet
DumpGet[ "<i>filename</i>"] reads in a file saved with DumpSave.

---

DumpSave
DumpSave["<i>file</i>.mx",<i>symbol</i>] writes definitions associated with a symbol to a file in internal Wolfram System format. 

DumpSave["<i>file</i>.mx","<i>context</i>`"] writes out definitions associated with all symbols in the specified context. 

DumpSave["<i>file</i>.mx",{<i>object</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>object</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] writes out definitions for several symbols or contexts. 

DumpSave["<i>package</i>`",<i>objects</i>] chooses the name of the output file based on the computer system used. 

---

DuplicateFreeQ
DuplicateFreeQ[<i>list</i>] gives True if <i>list</i> has no duplicates, and False otherwise.

DuplicateFreeQ[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] applies <i>test</i> to pairs of elements to determine whether they should be considered duplicates.

---

Duration
Duration[<i>expr</i>] returns the duration of <i>expr</i>.

Duration[<i>expr</i>,<i>unit</i>] returns the result in the specified <i>unit</i>.

---

E
E is the exponential constant  (base of natural logarithms), with numerical value ≃2.71828.

---

EarthImpactData
EarthImpactData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the earth impact crater <i>entity</i>.

EarthImpactData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified earth impact crater names.

EarthImpactData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

EarthquakeData
EarthquakeData[<i>loc</i>] gives all earthquake properties for the location corresponding to <i>loc</i>.

EarthquakeData[<i>loc</i>,<i>mag</i>] restricts earthquakes returned to the magnitude range <i>mag</i>. 

EarthquakeData[<i>loc</i>,<i>mag</i>,{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] gives earthquake data within the magnitude range <i>mag</i> during the time interval <i>start</i> to <i>end</i>.

EarthquakeData[<i>loc</i>,<i>mag</i>,{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>},<i>property</i>] gives a time series for the specific earthquake <i>property</i> for earthquakes within the magnitude range <i>mag</i> during the time interval <i>start</i> to <i>end</i>.

EarthquakeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] returns data for a specific earthquake. 

---

EccentricityCentrality
EccentricityCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of eccentricity centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

EccentricityCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Echo
Echo[<i>expr</i>] prints <i>expr</i> and returns <i>expr</i>.

Echo[<i>expr</i>,<i>label</i>] prints <i>expr</i> prepending <i>label</i> and returns <i>expr</i>.

Echo[<i>expr</i>,<i>label</i>,<i>f</i>] prints <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] prepending <i>label</i> and returns <i>expr</i>.

---

EchoEvaluation
EchoEvaluation[<i>expr</i>] prints <i>expr</i> before evaluation, then prints the result after evaluation and returns that result.

EchoEvaluation[<i>expr</i>,<i>label</i>] prepends <i>label</i> when printing <i>expr</i> before and after evaluation.

EchoEvaluation[<i>expr</i>,<i>label</i><sub>1</sub><i>label</i><sub>2</sub>] prepends <i>label</i><sub>1</sub> before evaluation and <i>label</i><sub>2</sub> after evaluation.

EchoEvaluation[<i>expr</i>,<i>labels</i>,<i>f</i>] prints <i>expr</i> before evaluation, then evaluates <i>expr</i> to the result <i>res</i> and prints <i>f</i>[<i>res</i>].

EchoEvaluation[<i>expr</i>,<i>labels</i>,<i>g</i><i>f</i>] prints <i>g</i>[<i>expr</i>] before evaluating <i>expr</i> and then <i>f</i>[<i>res</i>] after evaluation.

---

EchoFunction
EchoFunction[<i>f</i>][<i>expr</i>] prints <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] and returns <i>expr</i>.

EchoFunction[<i>label</i>,<i>f</i>][<i>expr</i>] prints <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] prepending <i>label</i> and returns <i>expr</i>.

---

EchoLabel
EchoLabel[<i>label</i>][<i>expr</i>] prints <i>expr</i> prepending <i>label</i> and returns <i>expr</i>.

---

EchoTiming
EchoTiming[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, prints the time in seconds used and returns the result of the evaluation.

EchoTiming[<i>expr</i>,<i>label</i>] prints the timing, prepending <i>label</i>.

---

EclipseType
EclipseType is an option for SolarEclipse and LunarEclipse that specifies the type of eclipse being queried for.

---

EdgeAdd
EdgeAdd[<i>g</i>,<i>e</i>] makes a graph by adding the edge <i>e</i> to the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeAdd[<i>g</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] adds a collection of edges to <i>g</i>.

EdgeAdd[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeBetweennessCentrality
EdgeBetweennessCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of betweenness centralities for the edges in the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeBetweennessCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeCapacity
EdgeCapacity is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies an edge capacity.

---

EdgeChromaticNumber
EdgeChromaticNumber[<i>g</i>] gives the chromatic number for the edges of the graph <i>g</i>.

---

EdgeConnectivity
EdgeConnectivity[<i>g</i>] gives the edge connectivity of the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeConnectivity[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the <i>s</i>-<i>t</i> edge connectivity of the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeConnectivity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeContract
EdgeContract[<i>g</i>,<i>e</i>] contracts the edge <i>e</i> of the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeContract[<i>g</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] contracts a collection of edges <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,….

EdgeContract[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeCost
EdgeCost is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies an edge cost.

---

EdgeCount
EdgeCount[<i>g</i>] gives a count of the number of edges in the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeCount[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a count of the number of edges that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

EdgeCount[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeCoverQ
EdgeCoverQ[<i>g</i>,<i>elist</i>] yields True if the edge list <i>elist</i> is an edge cover of the graph <i>g</i> and False otherwise.

---

EdgeCycleMatrix
EdgeCycleMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the edge cycle matrix of a graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeCycleMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeDelete
EdgeDelete[<i>g</i>,<i>e</i>] makes a graph by deleting the edge <i>e</i> from the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeDelete[<i>g</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes a collection of edges from <i>g</i>.

EdgeDelete[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] deletes all edges that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

EdgeDelete[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeDetect
EdgeDetect[<i>image</i>] finds edges in <i>image</i> and returns the result as a binary image.

EdgeDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] finds edges at the scale of the specified pixel range <i>r</i>.

EdgeDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>t</i>] uses a threshold <i>t</i> for selecting image edges.

---

EdgeForm
EdgeForm[<i>g</i>] is a graphics directive that specifies that edges of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using the graphics directive or list of directives <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeIndex
EdgeIndex[<i>g</i>,<i>e</i>] gives the integer index for the edge <i>e</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeIndex[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeLabeling
EdgeLabeling is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that specifies whether labeling specified for edges should be displayed by default.

---

EdgeLabels
EdgeLabels is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies what labels and label positions should be used for edges. 

---

EdgeLabelStyle
EdgeLabelStyle is an option and property for Graph and related functions that specifies the style to use for edge labels.

---

EdgeList
EdgeList[<i>g</i>] gives the list of edges for the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of edges that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

EdgeList[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeQ
EdgeQ[<i>g</i>,<i>e</i>] yields True if <i>e</i> is an edge in the graph <i>g</i> and False otherwise.

---

EdgeRenderingFunction
EdgeRenderingFunction is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that gives a function to generate the graphics primitives to use in rendering each edge.

---

EdgeRules
EdgeRules[<i>g</i>] gives the list of edge rules for the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeRules[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

EdgeShapeFunction
EdgeShapeFunction is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies a function to use to generate primitives for rendering each edge. 

---

EdgeStyle
EdgeStyle is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies what style to use for edges. 

---

EdgeTaggedGraph
EdgeTaggedGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> tagged with unique tags.

EdgeTaggedGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> tagged with <i>t</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

EdgeTaggedGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> tagged with <i>t</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

EdgeTaggedGraph[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>],…}{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a graph with vertex and edge annotations defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

---

EdgeTaggedGraphQ
EdgeTaggedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> has edges tagged and False otherwise.

---

EdgeTags
EdgeTags[<i>g</i>] gives the list of tags for all edges in the graph <i>g</i>.

EdgeTags[<i>g</i>,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the list of tags for edges between <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

EdgeTransitiveGraphQ
EdgeTransitiveGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a edge-transitive graph and False otherwise.

---

EdgeValueRange
EdgeValueRange is an option for GeoGraphValuePlot that specifies the range of edge values to include in a plot.

---

EdgeValueSizes
EdgeValueSizes is an option for GeoGraphValuePlot that specifies the thicknesses used to show edge values in a plot.

---

EdgeWeight
EdgeWeight is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies an edge weight.

---

EdgeWeightedGraphQ
EdgeWeightedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is an edge-weighted graph and False otherwise.

---

EditDistance
EditDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the edit or Levenshtein distance between strings or vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

EditDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the edit or Levenshtein distance between strings, vectors or biomolecular sequences <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

EffectiveInterest
EffectiveInterest[<i>r</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the effective interest rate corresponding to interest specification <i>r</i>, compounded at time intervals <i>q</i>.

---

Eigensystem
Eigensystem[<i>m</i>] gives a list {<i>values</i>,<i>vectors</i>} of the eigenvalues and eigenvectors of the square matrix <i>m</i>. 

Eigensystem[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized eigenvalues and eigenvectors of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

Eigensystem[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the eigenvalues and eigenvectors for the first <i>k</i> eigenvalues of <i>m</i>. 

Eigensystem[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>},<i>k</i>] gives the first <i>k</i> generalized eigenvalues and eigenvectors.

---

Eigenvalues
Eigenvalues[<i>m</i>] gives a list of the eigenvalues of the square matrix <i>m</i>. 

Eigenvalues[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized eigenvalues of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

Eigenvalues[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the first <i>k</i> eigenvalues of <i>m</i>. 

Eigenvalues[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>},<i>k</i>] gives the first <i>k</i> generalized eigenvalues.

---

EigenvectorCentrality
EigenvectorCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of eigenvector centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

EigenvectorCentrality[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives a list of in-centralities for a directed graph <i>g</i>.

EigenvectorCentrality[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives a list of out-centralities for a directed graph <i>g</i>.

EigenvectorCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Eigenvectors
Eigenvectors[<i>m</i>] gives a list of the eigenvectors of the square matrix <i>m</i>. 

Eigenvectors[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized eigenvectors of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

Eigenvectors[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the first <i>k</i> eigenvectors of <i>m</i>. 

Eigenvectors[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>},<i>k</i>] gives the first <i>k</i> generalized eigenvectors.

---

Element
Element[<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] or <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i> asserts that <i>x</i> is an element of the domain <i>dom</i>. 

Element[<i>x</i>,<i>reg</i>] or <i>x</i>∈<i>reg</i> asserts that <i>x</i> is an element of the region <i>reg</i>.

Element[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>|<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>|…,<i>dom</i>] asserts that all the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are elements of <i>dom</i>. 

Element[<i>patt</i>,<i>dom</i>] asserts that any expression matching the pattern <i>patt</i> is an element of <i>dom</i>. 

---

ElementwiseLayer
ElementwiseLayer[<i>f</i>] represents a net layer that applies a unary function <i>f</i> to every element of the input array.

ElementwiseLayer["<i>name</i>"] applies the function specified by "<i>name</i>".

---

ElidedForms
ElidedForms is an option to TextString and related functions that specifies which expressions should be elided.

---

Eliminate
Eliminate[<i>eqns</i>,<i>vars</i>] eliminates variables between a set of simultaneous equations. 

---

Ellipsoid
Ellipsoid[<i>p</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents an axis-aligned ellipsoid centered at the point <i>p</i> and with semiaxes lengths <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Ellipsoid[<i>p</i>,Σ] represents an ellipsoid centered at <i>p</i> and weight matrix Σ.

---

EllipticE
EllipticE[<i>m</i>] gives the complete elliptic integral E(m). 

EllipticE[ϕ,<i>m</i>] gives the elliptic integral of the second kind E(ϕm). 

---

EllipticExp
EllipticExp[<i>u</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] is the inverse for EllipticLog. It produces a list {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} such that <i>u</i>==EllipticLog[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}]. 

---

EllipticExpPrime
EllipticExpPrime[<i>u</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] gives the derivative of EllipticExp[<i>u</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] with respect to <i>u</i>.

---

EllipticF
EllipticF[ϕ,<i>m</i>] gives the elliptic integral of the first kind F(ϕm). 

---

EllipticFilterModel
EllipticFilterModel[<i>n</i>] designs a lowpass elliptic filter of order <i>n</i>.

EllipticFilterModel[{<i>n</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>}] uses the cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>.

EllipticFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}] designs an elliptic filter of the specified type "<i>type</i>", using the <i>spec</i>.

EllipticFilterModel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>var</i>] expresses the model in terms of the variable <i>var</i>.

---

EllipticK
EllipticK[<i>m</i>] gives the complete elliptic integral of the first kind K(m). 

---

EllipticLog
EllipticLog[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>}] gives the generalized logarithm associated with the elliptic curve y<sup>2</sup>=x<sup>3</sup>+a x<sup>2</sup>+b x. 

---

EllipticNomeQ
EllipticNomeQ[<i>m</i>] gives the nome <i>q</i> corresponding to the parameter <i>m</i> in an elliptic function. 

---

EllipticPi
EllipticPi[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the complete elliptic integral of the third kind Π(nm). 

EllipticPi[<i>n</i>,ϕ,<i>m</i>] gives the incomplete elliptic integral Π(n;ϕm). 

---

EllipticReducedHalfPeriods
EllipticReducedHalfPeriods[{<i>u</i>, <i>v</i>}] gives a reduced pair of half periods {<i>w</i>, <i>w</i>'} corresponding to the same lattice as that of {<i>u</i>, <i>v</i>}.

---

EllipticTheta
EllipticTheta[<i>a</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the theta function ϑ<sub>a</sub>(u,q) (a=1,…,4).

EllipticTheta[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the theta constant ϑ<sub>a</sub>(q)ϑ<sub>a</sub>(0,q).

---

EmbedCode
EmbedCode[<i>obj</i>] generates the code necessary to embed the object <i>obj</i> on a webpage.

EmbedCode[<i>obj</i>,"<i>dest</i>"] generates code for an external environment or language of type "<i>dest</i>".

EmbedCode[<i>obj</i>,"<i>dest</i>",<i>dir</i>] saves the generated code as files in the directory <i>dir</i>.

EmbedCode[<i>obj</i>,"<i>dest</i>",<i>loc</i>] saves the generated code as a file archive in the file location <i>loc</i>.

---

EmbeddedHTML
EmbeddedHTML["<i>string</i>"] is an object that formats as a web frame containing the HTML content "<i>string</i>". 

EmbeddedHTML[URL["<i>url</i>"]] formats as a rendering of the webpage corresponding to the specified URL.

EmbeddedHTML[CloudObject[…]] formats as a web rendering of the specified cloud object.

---

EmbeddedService
EmbeddedService[<i>service</i>] is an object that formats as a web frame containing content from the specified external service.

---

EmbeddedSQLEntityClass
EmbeddedSQLEntityClass[<i>string</i>,<i>props</i>] represents a verbatim SQL query to be interpreted as an entity class with properties given by <i>props</i>.

EmbeddedSQLEntityClass[<i>template</i>,<i>props</i>,<i>args</i>] represents an SQL query string template with arguments provided by <i>args</i>.

---

EmbeddedSQLExpression
EmbeddedSQLExpression[<i>string</i>] represents an SQL expression to be evaluated verbatim within an EntityFunction object.

EmbeddedSQLExpression[<i>template</i>,<i>args</i>] represents an SQL expression string template with arguments provided by <i>args</i>.

---

EmbeddingLayer
EmbeddingLayer[<i>size</i>,<i>n</i>] represents a trainable net layer that embeds integers between 1 and <i>n</i> into a continuous vector space of dimension <i>size</i>.

EmbeddingLayer[<i>size</i>] leaves the <i>n</i> to be inferred from context.

---

EmitSound
EmitSound[<i>snd</i>] emits the sound <i>snd</i> when evaluated. 

EmitSound[{<i>snd</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>snd</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] emits each of the sounds <i>snd</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in sequence. 

---

EmpiricalDistribution
EmpiricalDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an empirical distribution based on the data values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EmpiricalDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] represents a multivariate empirical distribution based on the data values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…}.

EmpiricalDistribution[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an empirical distribution where data values <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> occur with weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

EmptyGraphQ
EmptyGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if <i>g</i> is an empty graph and False otherwise.

---

EmptyRegion
EmptyRegion[<i>n</i>] represents the empty subset of <sup>n</sup>. 

---

EmptySpaceF
EmptySpaceF[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates the empty space function F(r) for point data <i>pdata</i> at radius <i>r</i>.

EmptySpaceF[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes F(r) for point process <i>pproc</i>.

EmptySpaceF[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes F(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

EmptySpaceF[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function F that can be applied repeatedly to different radii <i>r</i>.

---

Enabled
Enabled is an option for objects such as Slider that specifies whether the objects should be enabled for interactive manipulation. 

---

Enclose
Enclose[<i>expr</i>] attempts to evaluate <i>expr</i> and return the result, but stops if it catches an error and returns a failure object. 

Enclose[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>] applies <i>f</i> to any failure object generated.

Enclose[<i>expr</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the property <i>prop</i> of any failure object generated. 

Enclose[<i>expr</i>,<i>handler</i>,<i>form</i>] only catches errors with explicitly specified tags matching <i>form</i>. 

---

Encode
Encode["<i>source</i>","<i>dest</i>"] writes an encoded version of the file <i>source</i> to the file <i>dest</i>. 

<<<i>dest</i> decodes the file before reading its contents. 

Encode["<i>source</i>","<i>dest</i>","<i>key</i>"] produces an encoded file that must be read in using Get["<i>dest</i>","<i>key</i>"]. 

---

Encrypt
Encrypt["<i>password</i>",<i>expr</i>] encrypts <i>expr</i> using the specified password, to give an encrypted object.

Encrypt[<i>keyspec</i>,<i>expr</i>] encrypts <i>expr</i> using the cryptographic key specification <i>keyspec</i>.

Encrypt[<i>expr</i>] interactively requests a password with which to encrypt <i>expr</i>.

---

EncryptedObject
EncryptedObject[<i>assoc</i>] represents encrypted data generated by Encrypt.

---

EncryptFile
EncryptFile["<i>password</i>",<i>file</i>] generates an encrypted version of a file, using the specified password.

EncryptFile["<i>password</i>",<i>source</i>,<i>target</i>] generates an encrypted version of <i>source</i>, putting the result in <i>target</i>.

EncryptFile[<i>keyspec</i>,<i>source</i>,…] encrypts using the cryptographic key specification <i>keyspec</i>.

---

End
End[] returns the present context, and reverts to the previous one. 

---

EndAdd
EndAdd[ ] returns the present context, and reverts to the previous one, prepending the present context to $ContextPath.

---

EndDialogPacket
EndDialogPacket[<i>integer</i>] is a WSTP packet indicating the end of the Dialog subsession referenced by <i>integer</i>.

---

EndOfBuffer
EndOfBuffer is a symbol that represents the end of currently available data in the buffer for a process or stream.

---

EndOfFile
EndOfFile is a symbol returned by Read when it reaches the end of a file. 

---

EndOfLine
EndOfLine represents the end of a line in a string for purposes of matching in StringExpression.

---

EndOfString
EndOfString represents the end of a string for purposes of matching in StringExpression.

---

EndPackage
EndPackage[] restores $Context and $ContextPath to their values before the preceding BeginPackage, and prepends the current context to the list $ContextPath. 

---

EngineeringForm
EngineeringForm[<i>expr</i>] prints with all real numbers in <i>expr</i> given in engineering notation. 

EngineeringForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with numbers given to <i>n</i>‐digit precision. 

---

EnterExpressionPacket
EnterExpressionPacket[<i>expr</i>] is a WSTP packet that requests the evaluation of <i>expr</i>.

---

EnterTextPacket
EnterTextPacket[<i>string</i>] is a WSTP packet that requests the parsing and evaluation of <i>string</i> as an expression.

---

Entity
Entity["<i>type</i>",<i>name</i>] represents an entity of the specified type, identified by <i>name</i>.

Entity[<i>cspec</i>,<i>name</i>] represents an entity from the computed class, specified by <i>cspec</i>. 

---

EntityClass
EntityClass[<i>type</i>,<i>name</i>] represents a class of entities of the specified type identified by <i>name</i>.

EntityClass[<i>type</i>,{<i>property</i><sub>1</sub><i>vspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>property</i><sub>2</sub><i>vspec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an implicitly defined entity class containing entities of the specified type for which the properties <i>property</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> conform to the value selector <i>vspec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EntityClass[<i>cspec</i>,<i>psel</i>] represents an entity class with members specified by <i>cspec</i>, selected by the property selector <i>psel</i>.

---

EntityClassList
EntityClassList["<i>type</i>"] gives a list of entity classes for the specified type of entity.

---

EntityCopies
EntityCopies[<i>entity</i>,<i>n</i>] represents <i>n</i> copies of <i>entity</i>.

---

EntityFunction
EntityFunction[<i>x</i>,<i>body</i>] is a function with a single formal parameter <i>x</i>, to be used in EntityValue and related functions.

EntityFunction[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>body</i>] is an EntityFunction with a list of formal parameters.

---

EntityGroup
EntityGroup[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a group of entities.

---

EntityInstance
EntityInstance[<i>entity</i>,<i>qual</i><i>val</i>] represents an entity whose qualifier <i>qual</i> has value <i>val</i>.

EntityInstance[<i>entity</i>,{<i>qual</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qual</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an entity whose qualifiers <i>qual</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> have values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EntityInstance[<i>entity</i>,<i>quantity</i>] represents an entity qualified by <i>quantity</i>.

---

EntityList
EntityList[<i>class</i>] gives a list of entities in the specified entity class. 

EntityList["<i>type</i>"] gives a list of entities of the specified type.

EntityList[<i>class,simplify</i>] gives a list of entities; <i>simplify</i> determines whether to reduce entities to the simplest possible type.

---

EntityPrefetch
EntityPrefetch["<i>type</i>"] fetches cacheable values associated with all entities of the specified type.

EntityPrefetch[EntityProperty["<i>type</i>","<i>prop</i>"]] fetches all values for the specified property.

---

EntityProperties
EntityProperties[<i>type</i>] lists properties associated with entity type <i>type</i>.

---

EntityProperty
EntityProperty[<i>type</i>,<i>pname</i>] represents a property identified by <i>pname</i> for use in EntityValue.

EntityProperty[<i>class</i>,<i>pname</i>] represents a property introduced by the computed entity class <i>class</i>.

EntityProperty[<i>type</i>,<i>pname</i>,{<i>qual</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qual</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a property modified by the qualifier rules <i>qual</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

EntityPropertyClass
EntityPropertyClass[<i>type</i>,<i>pcname</i>] represents a class of properties identified by the name <i>pcname</i>.

---

EntityRegister
EntityRegister[<i>estore</i>] registers the entities in the entity store <i>estore</i> so that they can be accessed directly using Entity.

---

EntityStore
EntityStore["<i>type</i>"] represents an empty entity store for entities of type "<i>type</i>".

EntityStore["<i>type</i>"<i>data</i>] represents an entity store for entities of type "<i>type</i>" with properties and values defined by <i>data</i>.

EntityStore[{<i>tspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tspec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an entity store for entities of multiple types.

EntityStore[RelationalDatabase[…]] constructs an entity store from the schema of an external database.

EntityStore[{<i>tspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tspec</i><sub>2</sub>,...},<i>dbspec</i>] constructs an entity store by mapping table names in the database specified by <i>dbspec</i> to types as specified by the <i>tspec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

EntityStores
EntityStores[] gives a list of all registered entity stores that are accessed when Entity is used.

---

EntityTypeName
EntityTypeName[<i>entity</i>] gives the name of the entity type of <i>entity</i>.

EntityTypeName[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the name of the entity type for <i>entity</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>entity</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

EntityUnregister
EntityUnregister["<i>type</i>"] unregisters all entities in the first entity store that defines entities of the specified type.

EntityUnregister[<i>store</i>] unregisters all entities in the specified entity store.

---

EntityValue
EntityValue[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the given entity.

EntityValue[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives the list of values of the specified property for each of the <i>entity</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EntityValue[<i>class</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the list of values of the specified property for all entities in the specified class.

EntityValue[<i>entity</i>,{<i>property</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>property</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list of values of the <i>property</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for the specified entity.

EntityValue[<i>ents</i>,{<i>property</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>property</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list of values of the <i>property</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for each of the entities represented by <i>ents</i>.

---

Entropy
Entropy[<i>list</i>] gives the base  information entropy of the values in <i>list</i>.

Entropy[<i>k</i>,<i>list</i>] gives the base <i>k</i> information entropy.

---

Environment
Environment["<i>var</i>"] gives the value of an operating system environment variable. 

---

Epilog
Epilog is an option for graphics functions that gives a list of graphics primitives to be rendered after the main part of the graphics is rendered. 

---

EpilogFunction
EpilogFunction is an option for DocumentGenerator allowing arbitrary code to be executed after a document is generated.

---

Equal
<i>lhs</i>==<i>rhs</i> returns True if <i>lhs</i> and <i>rhs</i> are identical. 

---

EqualTilde
EqualTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≂y≂….

---

EqualTo
EqualTo[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x</i>==<i>y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>. 

---

EquatedTo
EquatedTo is an option for Roots, which specifies an expression to use in place of the variable in the solution.

---

Equilibrium
Equilibrium[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇌y⇌….

---

EquirippleFilterKernel
EquirippleFilterKernel[{{{ω<sub><i>L1</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>R1</i></sub>},{ω<sub><i>L2</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>R2</i></sub>},…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}},<i>n</i>] creates a finite impulse response (FIR) filter kernel of length <i>n</i> with an equiripple amplitude response, given the specified left and right band edge frequencies {ω<sub><i>Li</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>Ri</i></sub>} and amplitudes <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EquirippleFilterKernel[{{{ω<sub><i>L1</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>R1</i></sub>},{ω<sub><i>L2</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>R2</i></sub>},…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},<i>n</i>] uses relative weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for each frequency band.

EquirippleFilterKernel[{"<i>type</i>",{{{ω<sub><i>L1</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>R1</i></sub>},…},<i>…</i>}},<i>n</i>] creates a filter of the specified "<i>type</i>".

---

Equivalent
Equivalent[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the logical equivalence <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>⇔<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>⇔…, giving True when all of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are the same.

---

Erf
Erf[<i>z</i>] gives the error function erf(z). 

Erf[<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>] gives the generalized error function erf(z<sub>1</sub>)-erf(z<sub>0</sub>). 

---

Erfc
Erfc[<i>z</i>] gives the complementary error function erfc(z). 

---

Erfi
Erfi[<i>z</i>] gives the imaginary error function erf(iz)/i. 

---

ErlangB
ErlangB[<i>c</i>,<i>a</i>] computes the Erlang B loss probability for an M/M/c/c queue.

---

ErlangC
ErlangC[<i>c</i>,<i>a</i>] computes the Erlang C probability for nonzero waiting time in an M/M/c queue.

---

ErlangDistribution
ErlangDistribution[<i>k</i>,λ] represents the Erlang distribution with shape parameter <i>k</i> and rate λ.

---

Erosion
Erosion[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological erosion of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

Erosion[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the erosion with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

Erosion[<i>data</i>,…] applies erosion to an array of data.

---

EscapeRadius
EscapeRadius is an option to MandelbrotSetPlot that specifies the criterion to use to decide that a point is not in the Mandelbrot set.

---

EstimatedBackground
EstimatedBackground[<i>data</i>] estimates the background of <i>data</i>.

EstimatedBackground[<i>data</i>,σ] tries to preserve peaks up to scale σ.

---

EstimatedDistribution
EstimatedDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] estimates the parametric distribution <i>dist</i> from <i>data</i>.

EstimatedDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,<i>{</i><i>{</i><i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] estimates the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, ….

EstimatedDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,<i>idist</i>] estimates distribution <i>dist</i> with starting values taken from the instantiated distribution <i>idist</i>.

---

EstimatedPointProcess
EstimatedPointProcess[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i>] estimates the parametric point process <i>pproc</i> from point data <i>pdata</i>.
