EstimatedPointProcess[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i>,{{<i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] estimates the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, ….

---

EstimatedProcess
EstimatedProcess[<i>data</i>,<i>proc</i>] estimates the parametric process <i>proc</i> from <i>data</i>.

EstimatedProcess[<i>data</i>,<i>proc</i>,{{<i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] estimates the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, ….

EstimatedProcess[<i>data</i>,<i>proc</i>,<i>iproc</i>] estimates process <i>proc</i> with starting values taken from the instantiated process <i>iproc</i>.

---

EstimatedVariogramModel
EstimatedVariogramModel[<i>{</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i>] estimates the best variogram function from values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> given at locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EstimatedVariogramModel[<i>{</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>loc</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i><i></i><i>{</i><i><i>val</i><sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i><i><i>val</i><sub>2</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i>] generates the same result. 

EstimatedVariogramModel[…,"<i>model</i>"] estimates the best parameters of the variogram function specified by "<i>model</i>". 

EstimatedVariogramModel[…,{"<i>model</i>",<i>params</i>}] estimates the non-numeric parameters in <i>params</i>.

---

EstimatorGains
EstimatorGains[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the estimator gain matrix for the StateSpaceModel <i>ssm</i>, such that the poles of the estimator are <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

EstimatorGains[{<i>ssm</i>,{<i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},…] specifies the measured outputs <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to use.

---

EstimatorRegulator
EstimatorRegulator[<i>sspec</i><i>,</i>{<i>l</i>,κ}] gives the output feedback controller with estimator and regulator gains <i>l</i> and κ for the system specification <i>sspec</i>.

EstimatorRegulator[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

EuclideanDistance
EuclideanDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Euclidean distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

EulerAngles
EulerAngles[<i>r</i>] gives Euler angles {α,β,γ} corresponding to the rotation matrix <i>r</i>.

EulerAngles[<i>r</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}] gives Euler angles {α,β,γ} with rotation order {<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}. 

---

EulerCharacteristic
EulerCharacteristic[<i>poly</i>] gives the Euler characteristic of a <i>poly</i>.

---

EulerE
EulerE[<i>n</i>] gives the Euler number E<sub>n</sub>. 

EulerE[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Euler polynomial E<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

EulerGamma
EulerGamma is Euler’s constant γ, with numerical value ≃0.577216. 

---

EulerianGraphQ
EulerianGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is Eulerian, and False otherwise.

---

EulerMatrix
EulerMatrix[{α,β,γ}] gives the Euler 3D rotation matrix formed by rotating by α around the current z axis, then by β around the current y axis, and then by γ around the current z axis. 

EulerMatrix[{α,β,γ},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}] gives the Euler 3D rotation matrix corresponding, first rotating by α around the current <i>a</i> axis, then by β around the current <i>b</i> axis, and finally by γ around the current <i>c</i> axis.

---

EulerPhi
EulerPhi[<i>n</i>] gives the Euler totient function ϕ(n). 

---

Evaluate
Evaluate[<i>expr</i>] causes <i>expr</i> to be evaluated even if it appears as the argument of a function whose attributes specify that it should be held unevaluated. 

---

EvaluatePacket
EvaluatePacket[<i>expr</i>] is a WSTP packet requesting evaluation of <i>expr</i>.

---

EvaluateScheduledTask
EvaluateScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>] triggers immediate local execution of the specified task object.

---

EvaluationData
EvaluationData[<i>expr</i>] gives an association containing the result of evaluating <i>expr</i> and metadata about the process of doing so.

---

EvaluationEnvironment
EvaluationEnvironment is an option for functions such as InitializationValue and InitializationObjects that specifies the environment in which an initialization is intended to be used.

---

EvaluationMonitor
EvaluationMonitor is an option for various numerical computation and plotting functions that gives an expression to evaluate whenever functions derived from the input are evaluated numerically. 

---

EvaluationObject
EvaluationObject[<i>expr</i>,…] represents an expression submitted for evaluation on any available parallel kernel.

---

EvenQ
EvenQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is an even integer, and False otherwise. 

---

EventSeries
EventSeries[{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>}…}] represents a series of events given as time-value pairs {<i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

EventSeries[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>tspec</i>] represents a series of events with values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at times specified by <i>tspec</i>.

---

ExactBlackmanWindow
ExactBlackmanWindow[<i>x</i>] represents an exact Blackman window function of <i>x</i>.

---

ExactNumberQ
ExactNumberQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is an exact real or complex number, and returns False otherwise.

---

ExactRootIsolation
ExactRootIsolation is an option for Root, which specifies whether exact isolating intervals rather than numeric approximations should be used to identify algebraic numbers.

---

ExampleData
ExampleData["<i>type</i>"] gives a list of names of examples of the specified type.

ExampleData[{"<i>type</i>","<i>name</i>"}] gives the default form of the named example of the specified type.

ExampleData[{"<i>type</i>","<i>name</i>"},"<i>elem</i>"] gives the specified element or property of an example.

---

Except
Except[<i>c</i>] is a pattern object which represents any expression except one that matches <i>c</i>. 

Except[<i>c</i>,<i>p</i>] represents any expression that matches <i>p</i> but not <i>c</i>. 

---

ExcludedContexts
ExcludedContexts is an option for FullDefinition, Manipulate and related symbols that gives contexts whose symbols will not have the definitions recursively saved.

---

ExcludedForms
ExcludedForms is an option that gives a list of patterns for expressions that should be excluded from an operation performed by a particular function. 

---

ExcludedLines
ExcludedLines is an option for SemanticImport and related functions that specifies which lines should be ignored for further processing.

---

ExcludedPhysicalQuantities
ExcludedPhysicalQuantities is an option for FormulaLookup that specifies physical quantities that should be not used by the formulas returned.

---

ExcludePods
ExcludePods is an option to WolframAlpha that specifies pod IDs to exclude from the results.

---

Exclusions
Exclusions is an option that specifies where to exclude in regions used by functions like Plot, Plot3D, and NIntegrate.

---

ExclusionsStyle
ExclusionsStyle is an option to plotting functions that specifies how to render subregions excluded according to Exclusions. 

---

Exists
Exists[<i>x</i>,<i>expr</i>] represents the statement that there exists a value of <i>x</i> for which <i>expr</i> is True. 

Exists[<i>x</i>,<i>cond</i>,<i>expr</i>] states that there exists an <i>x</i> satisfying the condition <i>cond</i> for which <i>expr</i> is True. 

Exists[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] states that there exist values for all the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for which <i>expr</i> is True. 

---

Exit
Exit[] terminates a Wolfram Language kernel session. 

---

ExoplanetData
ExoplanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the exoplanet <i>entity</i>.

ExoplanetData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified exoplanet entities.

ExoplanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Exp
Exp[<i>z</i>] gives the exponential of <i>z</i>. 

---

Expand
Expand[<i>expr</i>] expands out products and positive integer powers in <i>expr</i>. 

Expand[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] leaves unexpanded any parts of <i>expr</i> that are free of the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

ExpandAll
ExpandAll[<i>expr</i>] expands out all products and integer powers in any part of <i>expr</i>. 

ExpandAll[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] avoids expanding parts of <i>expr</i> that do not contain terms matching the pattern <i>patt</i>. 

---

ExpandDenominator
ExpandDenominator[<i>expr</i>] expands out products and powers that appear as denominators in <i>expr</i>. 

---

ExpandFileName
ExpandFileName["<i>name</i>"] textually expands <i>name</i> to have the form of an absolute file name for your operating system.

---

ExpandNumerator
ExpandNumerator[<i>expr</i>] expands out products and powers that appear in the numerator of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Expectation
Expectation[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>] gives the expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>. 

Expectation[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>data</i>] gives the expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution given by <i>data</i>.

Expectation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>] gives the expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>. 

Expectation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

Expectation[<i>expr</i><i>pred</i>,…] gives the conditional expectation of <i>expr</i> given <i>pred</i>.

---

ExpectedValue
ExpectedValue[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>] gives the expected value of the pure function <i>f</i> with respect to the values in <i>list</i>. 

ExpectedValue[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the expected value of the function <i>f</i> of <i>x</i> with respect to the values of <i>list</i>.

ExpectedValue[<i>f</i>,<i>dist</i>] gives the expected value of the pure function <i>f</i> with respect to the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

ExpectedValue[<i>f</i>,<i>dist</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the expected value of the function <i>f</i> of <i>x</i> with respect to the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

ExpGammaDistribution
ExpGammaDistribution[κ,θ,μ] represents an exp-gamma distribution with shape parameter κ, scale parameter θ, and location parameter μ.

---

ExpIntegralE
ExpIntegralE[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the exponential integral function E<sub>n</sub>(z).

---

Offload
Use Offload[expr_] to keep expr from evaluation on Kernel

---

ExpIntegralEi
ExpIntegralEi[<i>z</i>] gives the exponential integral function Ei(z). 

---

ExpirationDate
ExpirationDate is an option for various functions that specifies when a persistent value should be treated as expired.

---

Exponent
Exponent[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] gives the maximum power with which <i>form</i> appears in the expanded form of <i>expr</i>. 

Exponent[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>h</i>] applies <i>h</i> to the set of exponents with which <i>form</i> appears in <i>expr</i>. 

---

ExponentFunction
ExponentFunction is an option for NumberForm and related functions that determines the exponent to use in printing approximate real numbers. 

---

ExponentialDistribution
ExponentialDistribution[λ] represents an exponential distribution with scale inversely proportional to parameter λ.

---

ExponentialFamily
ExponentialFamily is an option for GeneralizedLinearModelFit that specifies the exponential family for the model.

---

ExponentialMovingAverage
ExponentialMovingAverage[<i>list</i>,α] gives the exponential moving average of <i>list</i> with smoothing constant α.

---

ExponentialPowerDistribution
ExponentialPowerDistribution[κ,μ,σ] represents an exponential power distribution with shape parameter κ, location parameter μ, and scale parameter σ.

ExponentialPowerDistribution[κ] represents an exponential power distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

ExponentStep
ExponentStep is an option for NumberForm and related functions that determines in what steps exponents are taken to increase when scientific notation is used.

---

Export
Export["<i>dest</i>.<i>ext</i>",<i>expr</i>] exports data to a file, converting it to the format corresponding to the file extension <i>ext</i>. 

Export[<i>dest</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>"fmt"</i>] exports data in the specified format "<i>fmt</i>".

Export[<i>dest</i>,<i>exprs</i>,<i>elements</i>] exports data by treating <i>exprs</i> as <i>elements</i>.

Export[<i>dest</i>,<i>exprs</i>,<i>elements</i>,<i>options</i>] uses the specified options.

---

ExportByteArray
ExportByteArray[<i>expr</i>,"<i>format</i>"] generates a ByteArray object corresponding to <i>expr</i> exported in the specified format. 

ExportByteArray[<i>exprs</i>,<i>elems</i>] generates a ByteArray object by treating <i>exprs</i> as elements specified by <i>elems</i>.

---

ExportForm
ExportForm[<i>expr</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] specifies that <i>expr</i> should be exported in the specified format in functions like CloudDeploy and in external results from APIFunction and FormFunction.

ExportForm[<i>expr</i>,{"<i>fmt</i>","<i>type</i>"}] specifies that when <i>expr</i> is exported, it should be tagged as having the specified MIME type.

---

ExportString
ExportString[<i>expr</i>,"<i>format</i>"] generates a string corresponding to <i>expr</i> exported in the specified format. 

ExportString[<i>rules</i>,{"<i>format</i>","Rules"}] gives explicit rules for different elements of the data to be exported. 

ExportString[<i>exprs</i>,<i>elems</i>] generates a string by treating <i>exprs</i> as elements specified by <i>elems</i>.

---

Expression
Expression is a symbol that represents an ordinary Wolfram Language expression in Read and related functions. 

---

ExpressionGraph
ExpressionGraph[<i>expr</i>] gives the tree graph with different levels at different depths. 

ExpressionGraph[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the tree graph only down to level <i>n</i>.

ExpressionGraph[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a tree graph in which subexpressions that match <i>form</i> are leaves.

---

ExpressionTree
ExpressionTree[<i>expr</i>] gives a Tree object from the structure of the expression <i>expr</i>.

ExpressionTree[<i>expr</i>,<i>struct</i>] gives a Tree object from the expression <i>expr</i> with data and subtrees as specified by <i>struct</i>.

---

ExpToTrig
ExpToTrig[<i>expr</i>] converts exponentials in <i>expr</i> to trigonometric functions. 

---

ExtendedEntityClass
ExtendedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,"<i>name</i>"<i>f</i>] represents an entity class derived from <i>class</i> by adding a new computed property "<i>name</i>" whose value for each entity is obtained by applying the entity function <i>f</i>.

ExtendedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] adds the properties <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> defined by the functions <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ExtendedGCD
ExtendedGCD[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the extended greatest common divisor of the integers <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Extension
Extension is an option for various polynomial and algebraic functions that specifies generators for the algebraic number field to be used. 

---

ExtentElementFunction
ExtentElementFunction is an option to DiscretePlot and DiscretePlot3D that gives a function to use to generate the primitives for rendering each extent element. 

---

ExtentMarkers
ExtentMarkers is an option to DiscretePlot and DiscretePlot3D that specifies markers to draw at extent boundaries. 

---

ExtentSize
ExtentSize is an option to DiscretePlot and DiscretePlot3D that specifies how far to extend out from each plot point. 

---

ExternalBundle
ExternalBundle[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i><i>obj</i><sub>1</sub></i>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a bundle of resources to be externally deployed as named URLs, functions, etc. 

ExternalBundle[{<i>name</i><sub>11</sub>{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>…,…},…}] represents a nested bundle of resources.

---

ExternalDataCharacterEncoding
ExternalDataCharacterEncoding is a global option that specifies the character encoding used in reading and writing plain text data outside of the Wolfram System.

---

ExternalEvaluate
ExternalEvaluate["<i>sys</i>","<i>cmd</i>"] evaluates the command <i>cmd</i> in the external evaluator <i>sys</i>, returning an expression corresponding to the output.

ExternalEvaluate[{"<i>sys</i>",<i>opts</i>},"<i>cmd</i>"] uses the options <i>opts</i> for the external evaluator.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>assoc</i>,"<i>cmd</i>"] evaluates <i>cmd</i> using the external evaluator specified by <i>assoc</i>.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>session</i>,"<i>cmd</i>"] evaluates <i>cmd</i> in the specified running ExternalSessionObject.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>sys</i>"<i>type</i>",…] returns output converted to the specified type. 

ExternalEvaluate[<i>spec</i>,<i>obj</i>] evaluates the content of the specified ExternalObject, ExternalOperation, File, URL or CloudObject.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>spec</i>,<i>assoc</i>] evaluates the command specified by <i>assoc</i>.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>spec</i>,{<i>cmd</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cmd</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] evaluates the list of commands <i>cmd</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ExternalEvaluate[DatabaseReference[<i>ref</i>],"<i>cmd</i>"] evaluates <i>cmd</i> using the database specified by <i>ref</i>.

ExternalEvaluate[<i>spec</i>] represents an operator form of ExternalEvaluate that can be applied to a command or object.

---

ExternalFunction
ExternalFunction[<i>sys</i>,"<i>f</i>"] represents an external function named "<i>f</i>" defined in the external evaluator <i>sys</i>.

ExternalFunction[<i>session</i>,"<i>f</i>"] represents an external function "<i>f</i>" in the specified ExternalSessionObject.

ExternalFunction[<i>sys</i>,"<i>code</i>"] represents an external function defined by the code fragment "<i>code</i>".

ExternalFunction[<i>obj</i>,"<i>method</i>"] represents a method bound to the ExternalObject.

---

ExternalIdentifier
ExternalIdentifier["<i>type</i>",<i>id</i>] represents a resource identified by <i>id</i> in the external identifier system "<i>type</i>".

ExternalIdentifier["<i>type</i>",<i>id</i>,<i>meta</i>] includes the metadata given by the association <i>meta</i> to this instance of the external identifier object.

---

ExternalObject
ExternalObject[…] represents an external object bound to an ExternalSessionObject.

---

ExternalOptions
ExternalOptions is an option for EmbedCode and related functions that gives options specific to the external environment or language used.

---

ExternalSessionObject
ExternalSessionObject[…] represents an external session started by StartExternalSession for use with ExternalEvaluate.

---

ExternalSessions
ExternalSessions[] gives the list of currently active external evaluator sessions.

ExternalSessions[<i>sys</i>] gives the list of sessions associated with the system <i>sys</i>.

---

ExternalStorageBase
ExternalStorageBase is an option for various external storage functions that specifies which external storage service to use.

---

ExternalStorageDownload
ExternalStorageDownload[<i>location</i>] downloads content from the specified <i>location</i>.

ExternalStorageDownload[<i>location</i>,<i>dest</i>] downloads content from the specified <i>location</i> to a local destination file or directory <i>dest</i>.

ExternalStorageDownload[<i>location</i><i>dest</i>] downloads content from the specified locations to a local destination file or directory <i>dest</i>.

ExternalStorageDownload[{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dest</i>] downloads content from the specified locations to local destination <i>dest</i>.

ExternalStorageDownload[{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dest</i>] downloads content from the specified locations to local destination <i>dest</i>.

ExternalStorageDownload[{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub><i>dest</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>location</i><sub>2</sub><i>dest</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] downloads content from the specified locations to local destinations.

---

ExternalStorageGet
ExternalStorageGet[ExternalStorageObject[…]] reads in an expression stored at an external storage specified by the ExternalStorageObject.

ExternalStorageGet[<i>location</i>] reads in an expression stored at <i>location</i> in an external storage specified by $ExternalStorageBase.

---

ExternalStorageObject
ExternalStorageObject[<i>location</i>] represents a file stored in an external <i>location</i>.

ExternalStorageObject[<i>assoc</i>] represents a file stored in an external service specified by the components of the association <i>assoc</i>.

ExternalStorageObject[<i>location</i>,<i>assoc</i>] represents a file stored in an external <i>location</i> with additional elements given by <i>assoc</i>.

---

ExternalStoragePut
ExternalStoragePut[<i>expr</i>] writes <i>expr</i> to an external storage specified by $ExternalStorageBase.

ExternalStoragePut[<i>expr,path</i>] writes <i>expr</i> to a specific <i>path</i> in an external storage specified by $ExternalStorageBase.

ExternalStoragePut[<i>expr</i>,ExternalStorageObject[...]] writes <i>expr</i> to the service and path represented by an ExternalStorageObject. 

---

ExternalStorageUpload
ExternalStorageUpload[<i>file</i>] uploads <i>file</i> to an external storage specified by $ExternalStorageBase.

ExternalStorageUpload[<i>file</i>,<i>dest</i>] uploads <i>file</i> to a specific destination <i>dest</i> for external storage services that support it.

ExternalStorageUpload[<i>file</i><i>dest</i>] uploads <i>file</i> to a specific destination <i>dest</i> for external storage services that support it. 

ExternalStorageUpload[{<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dest</i>] uploads a list of files to a specific destination <i>dest</i> for external storage services that support it.

ExternalStorageUpload[{<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dest</i>] uploads a list of files to a specific destination <i>dest</i> for external storage services that support it.

ExternalStorageUpload[{<i>file</i><sub>1</sub><i>dest</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>file</i><sub>2</sub><i>dest</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uploads a list of files to specific destinations for external storage services that support it.

---

ExternalTypeSignature
ExternalTypeSignature is an option for EmbedCode that gives rules specifying the mapping to external types in an embedded code.

---

ExternalValue
ExternalValue[<i>sys</i>,"<i>sym</i>"] gives the value of "<i>sym</i>" in external evaluator <i>sys</i>. 

ExternalValue[<i>session</i>,"<i>sym</i>"] gives the value of "<i>sym</i>" in the specified external <i>session</i>.

---

Extract
Extract[<i>expr</i>,<i>pos</i>] extracts the part of <i>expr</i> at the position specified by <i>pos</i>. 

Extract[<i>expr</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts a list of parts of <i>expr</i>. 

Extract[<i>expr</i>,<i>pos</i>,<i>h</i>] extracts parts of <i>expr</i>, wrapping each of them with head <i>h</i> before evaluation. 

Extract[<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of Extract that can be applied to an expression.

---

ExtractArchive
ExtractArchive[<i>source</i>] expands an archive <i>file</i>, saving its content into the current directory.

ExtractArchive[<i>source</i>,<i>dir</i>] saves the content of an archive <i>file</i> into directory <i>dir</i>.

ExtractArchive[<i>source</i>,<i>dir</i>,<i>pattern</i>] extracts only files whose names match <i>pattern</i>.

---

ExtractLayer
ExtractLayer[] represents a net layer that takes an array and a position specification as inputs and extracts the specified parts from the array.

---

ExtractPacletArchive
ExtractPacletArchive[<i>file</i>] extracts the contents of the paclet archive <i>file</i> into the directory in which <i>file</i> resides.

ExtractPacletArchive[<i>file</i>,<i>destdir</i>] extracts the contents of the paclet archive <i>file</i> into <i>destdir</i>.

---

ExtremeValueDistribution
ExtremeValueDistribution[α,β] represents an extreme value distribution with location parameter α and scale parameter β.

ExtremeValueDistribution[] represents an extreme value distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

FaceAlign
FaceAlign[<i>image</i>] attempts to find faces in <i>image</i> and align them.

FaceAlign[<i>image</i>,<i>fref</i>] gives aligned faces according to the face reference <i>fref</i>. 

FaceAlign[<i>image</i>,<i>fref</i>,<i>size</i>] gives aligned faces of the specified <i>size</i>.

FaceAlign[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives a list of aligned faces for all <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

FaceForm
FaceForm[<i>g</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using the graphics directive or list of directives <i>g</i>. 

FaceForm[<i>g</i>,<i>gback</i>] specifies that the front faces of three-dimensional polygons should be drawn with directives <i>g</i>, and the backs with directives <i>gback</i>. 

---

FaceGrids
FaceGrids is an option for three-dimensional graphics functions that specifies grid lines to draw on the faces of the bounding box. 

---

FaceGridsStyle
FaceGridsStyle is an option for 3D graphics functions that specifies how face grids should be rendered.

---

FaceRecognize
FaceRecognize[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub><i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub><i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a ClassifierFunction[…] based on the face examples and names given.

FaceRecognize[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] also generates a ClassifierFunction[…] based on the examples and names given.

FaceRecognize[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>{<i>example</i><sub>11</sub>,…},<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>{<i>example</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…] uses an association of names with their examples.

FaceRecognize[<i>training</i>,<i>image</i>] attempts to find faces present in an <i>image</i> and classify them with the given training set. 

FaceRecognize[<i>training</i>,<i>image</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property <i>prop</i>.

---

FacialFeatures
FacialFeatures[<i>image</i>] returns a minimal summary of facial features for all detected faces in <i>image</i>.

FacialFeatures[<i>image</i>,<i>features</i>] returns the specified facial <i>features</i>.

FacialFeatures[<i>video</i>,…] finds faces in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

Factor
Factor[<i>poly</i>] factors a polynomial over the integers. 

Factor[<i>poly</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] factors a polynomial modulo the prime <i>p</i>. 

Factor[<i>poly</i>,Extension{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] factors a polynomial allowing coefficients that are rational combinations of the algebraic numbers <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Factorial
<i>n</i>! gives the factorial of <i>n</i>. 

---

Factorial2
<i>n</i>!! gives the double factorial of <i>n</i>. 

---

FactorialMoment
FactorialMoment[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the order <i>r</i> factorial moment μ&amp;_<sub>r</sub> of <i>data</i>.

FactorialMoment[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] gives the order {<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>} multivariate factorial moment μ&amp;_<sub>r<sub>1</sub>, …, r<sub>m</sub></sub> of <i>data</i>.

FactorialMoment[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the factorial moment of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

FactorialMoment[<i>r</i>] represents the order <i>r</i> formal factorial moment. 

---

FactorialMomentGeneratingFunction
FactorialMomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the factorial moment-generating function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>t</i>. 

FactorialMomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the factorial moment-generating function for the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variables <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

FactorialPower
FactorialPower[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the factorial power x<sup>(n)</sup>. 

FactorialPower[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>h</i>] gives the step-<i>h</i> factorial power x<sup>(n,h)</sup>.

---

FactorInteger
FactorInteger[<i>n</i>] gives a list of the prime factors of the integer <i>n</i>, together with their exponents. 

FactorInteger[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] does partial factorization, pulling out at most <i>k</i> distinct factors.

---

FactorList
FactorList[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of the factors of a polynomial, together with their exponents. 

---

FactorSquareFree
FactorSquareFree[<i>poly</i>] pulls out any multiple factors in a polynomial. 

---

FactorSquareFreeList
FactorSquareFreeList[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of square‐free factors of a polynomial, together with their exponents. 

---

FactorTerms
FactorTerms[<i>poly</i>] pulls out any overall numerical factor in <i>poly</i>. 

FactorTerms[<i>poly</i>,<i>x</i>] pulls out any overall factor in <i>poly</i> that does not depend on <i>x</i>. 

FactorTerms[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pulls out any overall factor in <i>poly</i> that does not depend on any of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

FactorTermsList
FactorTermsList[<i>poly</i>] gives a list in which the first element is the overall numerical factor in <i>poly</i>, and the second element is the polynomial with the overall factor removed.

FactorTermsList[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of factors of <i>poly</i>. The first element in the list is the overall numerical factor. The second element is a factor that does not depend on any of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. Subsequent elements are factors which depend on progressively more of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Failure
Failure["<i>tag</i>",<i>assoc</i>] represents a failure of a type indicated by <i>tag</i>, with details given by the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

FailureAction
FailureAction is an option to Query and related functions that determines what should happen when a failure or message is generated.

---

FailureDistribution
FailureDistribution[<i>bexpr</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents the failure distribution for a system with events <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> having reliability distribution <i>dist</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> where the top event occurs when the Boolean expression <i>bexpr</i> is True and event <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> has occurred when <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is True.

---

FailureQ
FailureQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> has head Failure or is equal to $Failed or $Aborted.

---

False
False is the symbol for the Boolean value false. 

---

FareySequence
FareySequence[<i>n</i>] generates the Farey sequence of order <i>n</i>.

FareySequence[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> element of the Farey sequence of order <i>n</i>.

---

FeatureDistance
FeatureDistance[<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>extractor</i>] gives the distance between <i>example</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>example</i><sub>2</sub> in the feature space defined by <i>extractor</i>.

FeatureDistance[<i>extractor</i>] represents an operator form of FeatureDistance that can be applied to a pair of examples.

---

FeatureExtract
FeatureExtract[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts features for each of the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using a feature extractor trained on all the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FeatureExtract[<i>examples</i>,<i>extractor</i>] extracts features using the specified feature extractor method.

FeatureExtract[<i>examples</i>,{<i>extractor</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>extractor</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts features by applying the <i>extractor</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in sequence.

FeatureExtract[<i>examples</i>,<i>spec</i><i>ext</i>] uses the extractor methods specified by <i>ext</i> on parts of <i>examples</i> specified by <i>spec</i>. 

FeatureExtract[<i>examples</i>,{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub><i>ext</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub><i>ext</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses the extractor methods <i>ext</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> on parts of <i>examples</i> specified by the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

FeatureExtraction
FeatureExtraction[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a FeatureExtractorFunction[…] trained from the examples given.

FeatureExtraction[<i>examples</i>,<i>extractor</i>] uses the specified feature extractor method.

FeatureExtraction[<i>examples</i>,{<i>extractor</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>extractor</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies the <i>extractor</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in sequence to generate a feature extractor.

FeatureExtraction[<i>examples</i>,<i>spec</i><i>ext</i>] uses the extractor methods specified by <i>ext</i> on parts of <i>examples</i> specified by <i>spec</i>. 

FeatureExtraction[<i>examples</i>,{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub><i>ext</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub><i>ext</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses the extractor methods <i>ext</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> on parts of <i>examples</i> specified by the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FeatureExtraction[<i>examples</i>,<i>extractor</i>,<i>props</i>] gives the feature extraction properties specified by <i>props</i>.

---

FeatureExtractor
FeatureExtractor is an option for functions such as Classify that specifies how features should be extracted.

---

FeatureExtractorFunction
FeatureExtractorFunction[…] represents a feature extractor function generated by FeatureExtraction.

---

FeatureNames
FeatureNames is an option for machine learning functions such as Classify or Predict that specifies names to use for elements of input data given.

---

FeatureNearest
FeatureNearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the list of <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest in a computed feature space.

FeatureNearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest.

FeatureNearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the same result.

FeatureNearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>prop</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest.

FeatureNearest[<i>data</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] effectively gives {FeatureNearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>],FeatureNearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>],…}.

FeatureNearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> nearest <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>x</i>.

FeatureNearest[<i>data</i>] generates a NearestFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different <i>x</i>.

---

FeatureSpacePlot
FeatureSpacePlot[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots features extracted from the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as a scatter plot.

---

FeatureSpacePlot3D
FeatureSpacePlot3D[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots features extracted from the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as a scatter 3D plot.

---

FeatureTypes
FeatureTypes is an option for machine learning functions such as Classify or Predict that specifies what feature types to assume for elements of input data given.

---

FeedbackLinearize
FeedbackLinearize[<i>asys</i>] input-output linearizes the AffineStateSpaceModel <i>asys</i> by state transformation and feedback.

FeedbackLinearize[<i>asys</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>v</i>}] specifies the new states <i>z</i> and the new control inputs <i>v</i>.

FeedbackLinearize[<i>asys</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>v</i>},"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

FeedbackSector
FeedbackSector is an option to NyquistPlot that specifies the sector limits of the nonlinearity in the feedback. 

---

FeedbackSectorStyle
FeedbackSectorStyle is an option to NyquistPlot that specifies the style in which graphics of FeedbackSector should be drawn.

---

FeedbackType
FeedbackType is an option for some control system functions that specifies the feedback type.

---

FetalGrowthData
FetalGrowthData[<i>age</i>] returns the values for all properties of fetal development for the specified age of the fetus.

FetalGrowthData[<i>age</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the value for a property of fetal development for the specified age.

FetalGrowthData[<i>age</i>,<i>index</i>] returns the values for all properties of fetal development at the specified age and percentile.

FetalGrowthData[<i>age</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>index</i>] returns the value for a property at the specified age and percentile.

---

Fibonacci
Fibonacci[<i>n</i>] gives the Fibonacci number F<sub>n</sub>. 

Fibonacci[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Fibonacci polynomial F<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

Fibonorial
Fibonorial[<i>n</i>] gives the fibonorial n!<sub>F</sub>.

---

FieldCompletionFunction
FieldCompletionFunction is an option for InputField that specifies a function to apply to the input field's contents to generate a list of completions.

---

FieldHint
FieldHint is an option for InputField that specifies contents to display when the input field is empty.

---

FieldHintStyle
FieldHintStyle is an option for InputField that specifies the style to use for displaying the field hint.

---

FieldMasked
FieldMasked is an option to InputField that determines whether to mask user input.

---

FieldSize
FieldSize is an option for InputField, PopupMenu, and related functions that specifies the size of the field allowed for input or contents. 

---

File
File["<i>path</i>"] is a symbolic representation of a location in the local file system. 

---

FileBaseName
FileBaseName["<i>file</i>"] gives the base name for a file without its extension.

---

FileByteCount
FileByteCount[<i>file</i>] gives the number of bytes in a file. 

---

FileConvert
FileConvert[<i>source</i>"<i>dest</i>.<i>ext</i>"] converts the contents of <i>source</i> to the format defined by the extension <i>ext</i> and writes the result to the file <i>dest</i>.<i>ext</i>. 

FileConvert[<i>source</i>,"<i>format</i>"] writes the result to the filename defined by <i>source</i>, but with an extension defined by the specified format.

FileConvert[<i>source</i>"<i>dest</i>.<i>ext</i>",<i>format</i><sub>1</sub><i>format</i><sub>2</sub>] takes the contents of <i>source</i> to be in the specified format "<i>format</i><sub>1</sub>".

---

FileDate
FileDate["<i>file</i>"] gives the date and time at which a file was last modified. 

FileDate["<i>file</i>","<i>type</i>"] gives information on the specified type of date associated with a file.

---

FileExistsQ
FileExistsQ["<i>name</i>"] gives True if the file with the specified name exists, and gives False otherwise.

---

FileExtension
FileExtension["<i>file</i>"] gives the file extension for a file name.

---

FileFormat
FileFormat[<i>source</i>] attempts to determine what Import format could be used to import the file corresponding to <i>source</i>. 

FileFormat[<i>source</i>,{<i>fmt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fmt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the first "<i>fmt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" that can be used to import <i>source</i>.

---

FileFormatProperties
FileFormatProperties["<i>fmt</i>"] returns an association of properties for the specified format "<i>fmt</i>".

FileFormatProperties["<i>fmt</i>","<i>prop</i>"] returns the property "<i>prop</i>" for the format "<i>fmt</i>".

FileFormatProperties["<i>fmt</i>",{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns multiple properties.

---

FileFormatQ
FileFormatQ[<i>source</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] gives True if the file corresponding to <i>source</i> might be imported as format "<i>fmt</i>" and gives False otherwise.

FileFormatQ[<i>source</i>,{<i>fmt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fmt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives True if <i>source</i> might be imported as one of "<i>fmt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

FileHash
FileHash[<i>file</i>] gives an integer hash code for the contents of the specified file.

FileHash[<i>file</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives an integer hash of the specified type.

FileHash[<i>file</i>,"<i>type</i>","<i>format</i>"] gives a hash code in the specified format.

FileHash[{<i>file</i>,<i>range</i>},…] gives the hash code for the specified range of bytes.

FileHash[{<i>filespec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>filespec</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives the hash codes for a list of files.

---

FileNameDepth
FileNameDepth["<i>name</i>"] gives the number of path elements in the file name "<i>file</i>".

---

FileNameDialogSettings
FileNameDialogSettings is a global option that specifies settings for the Insert File Path dialog box.

---

FileNameDrop
FileNameDrop["<i>name</i>",<i>n</i>] drops the first <i>n</i> path elements in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameDrop["<i>name</i>",-<i>n</i>] drops the last <i>n</i> path elements in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameDrop["<i>name</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] drops elements <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameDrop["<i>name</i>"] drops the last path element in the file name "<i>name</i>".

---

FileNameForms
FileNameForms is an option that specifies the pattern for file names to be selected by a function.

---

FileNameJoin
FileNameJoin[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] joins the <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> together into a file name suitable for your current operating system. 

FileNameJoin[{CloudObject[…],<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] joins the <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to the path in the specified cloud object. 

FileNameJoin[{LocalObject[…],<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] joins the <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to the path in the specified local object.

FileNameJoin[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>, …] is equivalent to FileNameJoin[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}].

---

FileNames
FileNames[] lists all files in the current working directory. 

FileNames[<i>form</i>] lists all files in the current working directory whose names match the string pattern <i>form</i>. 

FileNames[{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] lists all files whose names match any of the <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

FileNames[All,<i>dir</i>] lists all files in the directory <i>dir</i>.

FileNames[<i>forms</i>,{<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] lists files with names matching <i>forms</i> in any of the directories <i>dir</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

FileNames[<i>forms</i>,<i>dirs</i>,<i>n</i>] includes files that are in subdirectories up to <i>n</i> levels down. 

---

FileNameSplit
FileNameSplit["<i>name</i>"] splits a file name into a list of parts.

---

FileNameTake
FileNameTake["<i>name</i>"] gives the last path element in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameTake["<i>name</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> path elements in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameTake["<i>name</i>",-<i>n</i>] gives the last <i>n</i> path elements in the file name "<i>name</i>".

FileNameTake["<i>name</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives elements <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in the file name "<i>name</i>".

---

FileNameToFormatList
FileNameToFormatList[] returns lists of file formats corresponding to all registered file name patterns.

FileNameToFormatList["<i>file</i>"] returns a list of file formats that matches the file name "<i>file</i>".

---

FilePrint
FilePrint["<i>file</i>"] prints out the raw textual contents of <i>file</i>.

FilePrint["<i>file</i>",<i>n</i>] prints out the first <i>n</i> raw textual lines of <i>file</i>.

FilePrint["<i>file</i>",-<i>n</i>] prints out the last <i>n</i> raw textual lines of <i>file</i>.

FilePrint["<i>file</i>",<i>m</i>;;<i>n</i>] prints out lines <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> of <i>file</i>.

FilePrint["<i>file</i>",<i>m</i>;;<i>n</i>;;<i>s</i>] prints out lines <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> of <i>file</i> in steps of <i>s</i>.

---

FileSize
FileSize[<i>file</i>] gives the size of a file as a quantity.

---

FileTemplate
FileTemplate["<i>file</i>"] yields a TemplateObject expression that represents a file template to be applied using functions like TemplateApply.

FileTemplate[<i>src</i>] uses File[…], URL[…], or CloudObject[…] as the specification for the file location.

FileTemplate[<i>form</i>,<i>args</i>] yields a TemplateObject with arguments, suitable for cloud deployment or other evaluation.

---

FileTemplateApply
FileTemplateApply[<i>template</i>] applies a template, evaluating all template elements it contains, and then writes the result to a temporary file, whose name is returned.

FileTemplateApply[<i>template</i>,<i>args</i>] applies a template, using <i>args</i> to fill its slots, and then writes the result to a temporary file.

FileTemplateApply[<i>template</i>,<i>output</i>] applies a template, writing the results to the file represented by <i>output</i>.

FileTemplateApply[<i>template</i>,<i>args</i>,<i>output</i>] applies a template, using <i>args</i> to fill its slots, and then writes the result to the file represented by <i>output</i>.

---

FileType
FileType["<i>file</i>"] gives the type of a file, typically File, Directory, or None. 

---

FilledCurve
FilledCurve[{<i>segment</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>segment</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a filled curve consisting of <i>segment</i><sub>1</sub> followed by <i>segment</i><sub>2</sub> etc. 

FilledCurve[{<i>component</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>component</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a list of separate filled component curves <i>component</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>component</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

---

FilledTorus
FilledTorus[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>}] represents a filled torus centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} with inner radius <i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub> and outer radius <i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>.

---

Filling
Filling is an option for ListPlot, Plot, Plot3D, and related functions that specifies what filling to add under points, curves, and surfaces. 

---

FillingStyle
FillingStyle is an option for ListPlot, Plot, Plot3D, and related functions that specifies the default style of filling to be used. 

---

FillingTransform
FillingTransform[<i>image</i>] gives a version of <i>image</i> with all extended minima filled.

FillingTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>] fills extended minima in regions where at least one corresponding element of marker is nonzero.

FillingTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>h</i>] fills only extended minima of depth <i>h</i> or less.

---

FilteredEntityClass
FilteredEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a class of entities where only entities for which the EntityFunction object <i>f</i> yields True are kept.

FilteredEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>prop</i>] represents a class of entities where only entities for which the property <i>prop</i> is True are kept.

---

FilterRules
FilterRules[<i>rules</i>,<i>patt</i>] filters the list <i>rules</i> by picking out only those rules whose left-hand sides match <i>patt</i>.

FilterRules[<i>rules</i>,{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] picks out rules whose left-hand sides match any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

FinancialBond
FinancialBond[<i>params</i>,<i>ambientparams</i>] gives the value of a financial bond instrument.

FinancialBond[<i>params</i>,<i>ambientparams</i>,<i>prop</i><i>]</i> computes the specified property <i>prop</i>.

---

FinancialData
FinancialData["<i>name</i>"] gives the last known price or value for the financial entity specified by "<i>name</i>".

FinancialData["<i>name</i>",<i>start</i>] gives a list of dates and daily closing values for "<i>name</i>" from <i>start</i> until the current date.

FinancialData["<i>name</i>",{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] gives a list of dates and daily closing values for dates from <i>start</i> to <i>end</i>.

FinancialData["<i>name</i>",{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>,<i>period</i>}] gives a list of dates and prices for the specified periods lying between <i>start</i> and <i>end</i>.

FinancialData["<i>name</i>","<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the financial entity "<i>name</i>". 

FinancialData["<i>name</i>","<i>prop</i>",{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>,…}] gives a list of dates and values of a property for a sequence of dates or periods. 

---

FinancialDerivative
FinancialDerivative[<i>instrument</i>,<i>params</i>,<i>ambientparams</i>] gives the value of the specified financial instrument.

FinancialDerivative[<i>instrument</i>,<i>params</i>,<i>ambientparams</i>,<i>prop</i>] computes the specified property <i>prop</i>.

---

FinancialIndicator
FinancialIndicator["<i>ind</i>",<i>par</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>par</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a financial indicator "<i>ind</i>" with parameters <i>par</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>par</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

---

Find
Find[<i>stream</i>,"<i>text</i>"] finds the first line in an input stream that contains the specified string. 

Find[<i>stream</i>,{"<i>text</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>text</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] finds the first line that contains any of the specified strings. 

---

FindAnomalies
FindAnomalies[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the <i>example</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that are considered anomalous with respect to the other examples.

FindAnomalies[<i>examples</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the specified property related to the anomaly computation.

FindAnomalies[<i>examples</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the properties <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindAnomalies[<i>fun</i>,<i>data</i>] finds anomalies in <i>data</i> using the given AnomalyDetectorFunction[…] or LearnedDistribution[…].

FindAnomalies[<i>fun</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>props</i>] gives properties related to the anomaly computation.

---

FindArgMax
FindArgMax[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the position <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> of a local maximum of <i>f</i>.

FindArgMax[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] gives the position <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> of a local maximum of <i>f</i>, found by a search starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindArgMax[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the position {<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…} of a local maximum of a function of several variables. 

FindArgMax[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the position of a local maximum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindArgMax[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindArgMin
FindArgMin[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the position <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> of a local minimum of <i>f</i>.

FindArgMin[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] gives the position <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> of a local minimum of <i>f</i>, found by a search starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindArgMin[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the position {<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…} of a local minimum of a function of several variables. 

FindArgMin[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the position of a local minimum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindArgMin[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindChannels
FindChannels[] gives a list of channels in your home area on the channel broker server.

FindChannels[None] gives a list of your unnamed channels.

FindChannels[All] gives a list of all channels owned by you.

FindChannels[<i>form</i>] gives a list of channels in your home area whose names match the string pattern <i>form</i>.

FindChannels[<i>"/�</i>] gives a list of channels whose names match the string pattern "/<i>abspath</i>".

FindChannels["mqtts://…"] gives a list of channels whose names match the specified pattern representing a URL.

---

FindClique
FindClique[<i>g</i>] finds a largest clique in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindClique[<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>] finds a clique containing at most <i>n</i> vertices.

FindClique[<i>g</i>,<i>{n}</i>] finds a clique containing exactly <i>n</i> vertices.

FindClique[<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a clique containing between <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> vertices.

FindClique[<i>g</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> cliques.

FindClique[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},…] finds cliques that include the vertex <i>v</i> only.

FindClique[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindClusters
FindClusters[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] partitions the <i><i>e</i><sub>i</sub></i> into clusters of similar elements. 

FindClusters[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the <i>v<sub>i</sub></i> corresponding to the <i><i>e</i><sub>i</sub></i> in each cluster.

FindClusters[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] partitions <i>data</i> into <i>n</i> clusters. 

---

FindCookies
FindCookies[] gives a list of all currently set cookies.

FindCookies[<i>domain</i>] gives a list of cookies associated with the specified domain.

FindCookies[<i>assoc</i>] gives a list of cookies whose attributes match the specification in the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

FindCurvePath
FindCurvePath[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives an ordering of the {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} that corresponds to one or more smooth curves.

---

FindCycle
FindCycle[<i>g</i>] finds a cycle in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindCycle[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds a cycle of length at most <i>k</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindCycle[<i>g</i>,{<i>k</i>}] finds a cycle of length exactly <i>k</i>.

FindCycle[<i>g</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a cycle of length between <i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

FindCycle[<i>g</i>,<i>kspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> cycles.

FindCycle[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},…] finds cycles that include the vertex <i>v</i>.

FindCycle[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindDevices
FindDevices[] searches for available devices on your computer system.

FindDevices[<i>form</i>] gives a list of devices in classes whose names match the string pattern <i>form</i>.

FindDevices[{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of devices in classes whose names match any of the <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindDevices[<i>forms</i>,<i>n</i>] returns at most <i>n</i> devices.

---

FindDistribution
FindDistribution[<i>data</i>] finds a simple functional form to fit the distribution of <i>data</i>.

FindDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] finds up to <i>n</i> best distributions.

FindDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns up to <i>n</i> best distributions associated with property <i>prop</i>.

FindDistribution[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns up to <i>n</i> best distributions associated with properties <i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

---

FindDistributionParameters
FindDistributionParameters[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] finds the parameter estimates for the distribution <i>dist</i> from <i>data</i>.

FindDistributionParameters[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,<i>{</i><i>{</i><i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] finds the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, ….

---

FindDivisions
FindDivisions[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>n</i>] finds a list of about <i>n</i> "nice" numbers that divide the interval around <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> into equally spaced parts. 

FindDivisions[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>dx</i>},<i>n</i>] makes the parts always have lengths that are integer multiples of <i>dx</i>. 

FindDivisions[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds successive subdivisions into about <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>, … parts. 

FindDivisions[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,{<i>dx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dx</i><sub>2</sub>,…}},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses spacings that are forced to be multiples of <i>dx</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dx</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

FindEdgeColoring
FindEdgeColoring[<i>g</i>] finds a coloring with minimal size for the edges in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindEdgeColoring[<i>g</i>,{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a coloring {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>} for the edges in the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindEdgeCover
FindEdgeCover[<i>g</i>] finds an edge cover of the graph <i>g</i> with a minimum number of edges.

FindEdgeCover[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindEdgeCut
FindEdgeCut[<i>g</i>] finds a smallest edge cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindEdgeCut[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds a smallest <i>s</i>-<i>t</i> edge cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindEdgeCut[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindEdgeIndependentPaths
FindEdgeIndependentPaths[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>k</i>] finds at most <i>k</i> edge-independent paths from vertex <i>s</i> to vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindEdgeIndependentPaths[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindEquationalProof
FindEquationalProof[<i>thm</i>,<i>axms</i>] tries to find an equational proof of the symbolic theorem <i>thm</i> using the axioms <i>axms</i>.

FindEquationalProof[<i>thm</i>,"<i>theory</i>"] tries to find a proof of <i>thm</i> using the specified named axiomatic theory.

---

FindEulerianCycle
FindEulerianCycle[<i>g</i>] finds an Eulerian cycle in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindEulerianCycle[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds at most <i>k</i> Eulerian cycles.

FindEulerianCycle[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindExternalEvaluators
FindExternalEvaluators[] finds installed external evaluators that can be used with ExternalEvaluate, returning a dataset of the results found.

FindExternalEvaluators["<i>sys</i>"] finds only external evaluators for language or system <i>sys</i>.

---

FindFile
FindFile[<i>name</i>] finds the file with the specified name that would be loaded by Get[<i>name</i>] and related functions.

---

FindFit
FindFit[<i>data</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds numerical values of the parameters <i>pars</i> that make <i>expr</i> give a best fit to <i>data</i> as a function of <i>vars</i>. 

FindFit[<i>data</i>,{<i>expr</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>pars</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds a best fit subject to the parameter constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindFit[<i>data</i>,<i>exprspec</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>vars</i>,"<i>prop</i>"]  specifies what fit property <i>prop</i> should be returned.

---

FindFormula
FindFormula[<i>data</i>] finds a pure function that approximates <i>data</i>.

FindFormula[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>] finds a symbolic function of the variable <i>x</i> that approximates <i>data</i>.

FindFormula[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] finds up to <i>n</i> functions that approximate <i>data</i>.

FindFormula[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns up to <i>n</i> best functions associated with property <i>prop</i>.

FindFormula[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns up to <i>n</i> best functions associated with properties <i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

---

FindFundamentalCycles
FindFundamentalCycles[<i>g</i>] finds fundamental cycles of the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindGeneratingFunction
FindGeneratingFunction[{<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] attempts to find a simple generating function in <i>x</i> whose <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> series coefficient is <i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

FindGeneratingFunction[{{<i>n</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>},…},<i>x</i>] attempts to find a simple generating function whose <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sup>th</sup> series coefficient is <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

FindGeoLocation
FindGeoLocation[] attempts to find the current geo location of your computer.

FindGeoLocation["<i>ip</i>"] gives an estimate of the geo location associated with the IP address given.

FindGeoLocation["<i>address</i>"] attempts to find the geo location associated with the street address given.

FindGeoLocation[<i>entity</i>] gives the geo location associated with the specified entity.

---

FindGeometricConjectures
FindGeometricConjectures[<i>scene</i>] finds conjectures that appear to hold for the GeometricScene object <i>scene</i> and adds these conjectures to the scene object.

FindGeometricConjectures[{<i>scene</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>scene</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds conjectures that appear to hold for all instances <i>scene</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of a geometric scene and returns a combined scene with the conjectures added.

FindGeometricConjectures[<i>scenes</i>,<i>patt</i>] adds only conjectures that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

FindGeometricConjectures[<i>scenes</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] adds only up to <i>n</i> conjectures.

---

FindGeometricTransform
FindGeometricTransform[<i>pts</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pts</i><sub>2</sub>] finds a geometric transformation that aligns positions specified by <i>pts</i><sub>2</sub> with <i>pts</i><sub>1</sub>, returning the alignment error together with the transformation function.

FindGeometricTransform[<i>ref</i>,{<i>pts</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pts</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds geometric transformations that align each of the <i>pts</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>ref</i>. 

FindGeometricTransform[{<i>pts</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pts</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds geometric transformations that align each of the <i>pts</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>pts</i><sub>1</sub>.

---

FindGraphCommunities
FindGraphCommunities[<i>g</i>] finds communities in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindGraphCommunities[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindGraphIsomorphism
FindGraphIsomorphism[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] finds an isomorphism that maps the graph <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>g</i><sub>2</sub> by renaming vertices.

FindGraphIsomorphism[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i>] finds at most <i>n</i> isomorphisms. 

FindGraphIsomorphism[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindGraphPartition
FindGraphPartition[<i>g</i>] gives a partition of vertices of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindGraphPartition[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a partition of vertices into <i>k</i> approximately equal-size parts.

FindGraphPartition[<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives a partition of vertices into parts with sizes <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

FindGraphPartition[<i>g</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives a partition of vertices into parts with approximate size proportions α<sub>1</sub>, …, α<sub><i>k</i></sub>.

FindGraphPartition[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindHamiltonianCycle
FindHamiltonianCycle[<i>g</i>] finds a Hamiltonian cycle in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindHamiltonianCycle[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds at most <i>k</i> Hamiltonian cycles.

FindHamiltonianCycle[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindHamiltonianPath
FindHamiltonianPath[<i>g</i>] finds a Hamiltonian path in the graph <i>g</i> with the smallest total length.

FindHamiltonianPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds a Hamiltonian path with the smallest total length from <i>s</i> to <i>t</i>.

---

FindHiddenMarkovStates
FindHiddenMarkovStates[<i>data</i>,<i>hmm</i>] finds the most likely hidden states of the HiddenMarkovProcess <i>hmm</i> corresponding to the emissions <i>data</i>.

FindHiddenMarkovStates[<i>data</i>,<i>hmm</i>,<i>crit</i>] uses the given criterion <i>crit</i> to find the hidden states.

---

FindIndependentEdgeSet
FindIndependentEdgeSet[<i>g</i>] finds an independent edge set of the graph <i>g</i> with a maximum number of edges.

FindIndependentEdgeSet[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindIndependentVertexSet
FindIndependentVertexSet[<i>g</i>] finds an independent vertex set of the graph <i>g</i> with a maximum number of vertices.

FindIndependentVertexSet[<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>] finds an independent vertex set with at most <i>n</i> vertices.

FindIndependentVertexSet[<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i>}] finds an independent vertex set with exactly <i>n</i> vertices.

FindIndependentVertexSet[<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds an independent vertex set containing between <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> vertices.

FindIndependentVertexSet[<i>g</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> independent vertex sets.

FindIndependentVertexSet[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},…] finds independent sets that include the vertex <i>v</i> only.

FindIndependentVertexSet[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindInstance
FindInstance[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds an instance of <i>vars</i> that makes the statement <i>expr</i> be True. 

FindInstance[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds an instance over the domain <i>dom</i>. Common choices of <i>dom</i> are Complexes, Reals, Integers, and Booleans. 

FindInstance[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>,<i>n</i>] finds <i>n</i> instances. 

---

FindIntegerNullVector
FindIntegerNullVector[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] finds a list of integers a<sub>i</sub> such that a<sub>1</sub> x<sub>1</sub>+a<sub>2</sub> x<sub>2</sub>+⋯+a<sub>n</sub> x<sub>n</sub>0. 

FindIntegerNullVector[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>d</i>] finds a list of integers a<sub>i</sub> with {a<sub>1</sub>,…,a<sub>n</sub>}≤d such that a<sub>1</sub> x<sub>1</sub>+a<sub>2</sub> x<sub>2</sub>+⋯+a<sub>n</sub> x<sub>n</sub>0. 

---

FindIsomorphicSubgraph
FindIsomorphicSubgraph[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] finds a subgraph of <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> that is isomorphic to <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

FindIsomorphicSubgraph[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i>] finds at most <i>n</i> subgraphs.

---

FindKClan
FindKClan[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds a largest <i>k</i>-clan in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindKClan[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] finds a <i>k</i>-clan containing at most <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKClan[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i>}] finds a <i>k</i>-clan containing exactly <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKClan[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a <i>k</i>-clan containing between <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> vertices.

FindKClan[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> <i>k</i>-clans.

FindKClan[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},<i>k</i>,…] finds <i>k</i>-clans that include the vertex <i>v</i> only.

FindKClan[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindKClique
FindKClique[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds a largest <i>k</i>-clique in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindKClique[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] finds a <i>k</i>-clique containing at most <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKClique[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i>}] finds a <i>k</i>-clique containing exactly <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKClique[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a <i>k</i>-clique containing between <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> vertices.

FindKClique[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> <i>k</i>-cliques.

FindKClique[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},<i>k</i>,…] finds <i>k</i>-cliques that include the vertex <i>v</i> only.

FindKClique[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindKClub
FindKClub[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds a largest <i>k</i>-club in the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindKPlex
FindKPlex[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds a largest <i>k</i>-plex in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindKPlex[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] finds a <i>k</i>-plex containing at most <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKPlex[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i>}] finds a <i>k</i>-plex containing exactly <i>n</i> vertices.

FindKPlex[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a <i>k</i>-plex containing between <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> vertices.

FindKPlex[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>nspec</i>,<i>s</i>] finds at most <i>s</i> <i>k</i>-plexes.

FindKPlex[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},<i>k</i>,…] finds <i>k</i>-plexes that include the vertex <i>v</i> only.

FindKPlex[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindLibrary
FindLibrary[<i>lib</i>] finds a dynamic library that can be loaded by LibraryFunctionLoad.

---

FindLinearRecurrence
FindLinearRecurrence[<i>list</i>] finds if possible the minimal linear recurrence that generates <i>list</i>.

FindLinearRecurrence[<i>list</i>,<i>d</i>] finds if possible the linear recurrence of maximum order <i>d</i> that generates <i>list</i>.

---

FindList
FindList["<i>file</i>","<i>text</i>"] gives a list of lines in the file that contain the specified string. 

FindList["<i>file</i>",{"<i>text</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>text</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] gives a list of all lines that contain any of the specified strings. 

FindList[{"<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>",…},…] gives a list of lines containing the specified strings in any of the <i>file</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

FindList[<i>files</i>,<i>text</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> lines found. 

---

FindMatchingColor
FindMatchingColor[<i>image</i>,<i>color</i>] returns a color similar to the <i>color</i> that is present in <i>image</i>.

FindMatchingColor[<i>image</i>,{<i>color</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>color</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns a list of colors matching each <i>color</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindMatchingColor[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>color</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>color</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns lists of matching colors for all <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

FindMaximum
FindMaximum[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] searches for a local maximum in <i>f</i>, starting from an automatically selected point.

FindMaximum[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] searches for a local maximum in <i>f</i>, starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindMaximum[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a local maximum in a function of several variables. 

FindMaximum[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a local maximum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindMaximum[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindMaximumCut
FindMaximumCut[<i>g</i>] gives the maximum cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindMaximumFlow
FindMaximumFlow[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds the maximum flow between source vertex <i>s</i> and target vertex <i>t</i> in a graph <i>g</i>.

FindMaximumFlow[<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds the maximum flow between vertex indices <i>s</i> and <i>t</i> in a graph with edge capacity matrix <i>m</i>.

FindMaximumFlow[<i>data</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] finds the maximum flow between multi-sources <i>s</i><sub>1</sub>, … and multi-targets <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, ….

FindMaximumFlow[<i>data</i>,<i>source</i>,<i>target</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

FindMaximumFlow[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindMaxValue
FindMaxValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the value at a local maximum of <i>f</i>.

FindMaxValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] gives the value at a local maximum of <i>f</i>, found by a search starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindMaxValue[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the value at a local maximum of a function of several variables. 

FindMaxValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the value at a local maximum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindMaxValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindMeshDefects
FindMeshDefects[<i>mreg</i>] finds defects in the mesh region <i>mreg</i>.

FindMeshDefects[<i>mreg</i>,{<i>def</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] finds only the specified type of defects <i>def</i><sub>1</sub>, ….

FindMeshDefects[<i>mreg</i>,<i>defects</i>,<i>format</i>] formats the results according to <i>format</i> specification.

---

FindMinimum
FindMinimum[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] searches for a local minimum in <i>f</i>, starting from an automatically selected point.

FindMinimum[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] searches for a local minimum in <i>f</i>, starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindMinimum[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a local minimum in a function of several variables. 

FindMinimum[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a local minimum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindMinimum[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindMinimumCostFlow
FindMinimumCostFlow[<i>g</i>,{<i>sd</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>sd</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds the minimum cost flow in the graph <i>g</i> with <i>sd</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>sd</i><sub>2</sub>, … vertex supplies or demands.

FindMinimumCostFlow[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds the minimum cost maximum flow between source vertex <i>s</i> and target vertex <i>t</i> in a graph <i>g</i>.

FindMinimumCostFlow[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>d</i>] finds the minimum cost flow between source <i>s</i> and target <i>t</i>, with the required flow <i>d</i>.

FindMinimumCostFlow[<i>m</i>,…] finds the minimum cost flow in a graph with cost matrix <i>m</i>.

FindMinimumCostFlow[<i>data</i>,…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

FindMinimumCostFlow[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindMinimumCut
FindMinimumCut[<i>g</i>] gives the minimum cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindMinimumCut[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindMinValue
FindMinValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the value at a local minimum of <i>f</i>.

FindMinValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] gives the value at a local minimum of <i>f</i>, found by a search starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. 

FindMinValue[<i>f</i>,{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the value at a local minimum of a function of several variables. 

FindMinValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] gives the value at a local minimum subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

FindMinValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] starts from a point within the region defined by the constraints.

---

FindMoleculeSubstructure
FindMoleculeSubstructure[<i>mol</i>,<i>patt</i>] finds a mapping between the atom indices in <i>mol</i> and an occurrence of <i>patt</i> in <i>mol</i>.

FindMoleculeSubstructure[<i>mol</i>,<i>patt</i>,All] finds all occurrences of <i>patt</i> in <i>mol</i> and returns all mappings.

FindMoleculeSubstructure[<i>mol</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] finds at most <i>n</i> mappings.

---

FindPath
FindPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds a path between vertex <i>s</i> and vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i><i>,</i><i>k</i>] finds a path of length at most <i>k</i> between vertex <i>s</i> and vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,{<i>k</i>}] finds a path of length exactly <i>k</i>.

FindPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a path of length between <i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

FindPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>kspec</i>,<i>n</i>] finds at most <i>n</i> paths.

FindPath[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindPeaks
FindPeaks[<i>list</i>] gives positions and values of the detected peaks in <i>list</i>.

FindPeaks[<i>list</i>,σ] finds peaks that survive Gaussian blurring up to scale σ.

FindPeaks[<i>list</i>,σ,<i>s</i>] finds peaks with minimum sharpness <i>s</i>.

FindPeaks[<i>list</i>,σ,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds only peaks with values greater than <i>t</i>.

FindPeaks[<i>list</i>,σ,{<i>s</i>,σ<sub><i>s</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,σ<sub><i>t</i></sub>}] uses different scales for thresholding sharpness and value.

---

FindPermutation
FindPermutation[<i>expr</i>] gives a permutation that produces <i>expr</i> by permuting Sort[<i>expr</i>].

FindPermutation[<i><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub></i>,<i>expr<sub>2</sub></i>] gives a permutation that converts <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub> for two expressions that differ only in the order of their arguments.

---

FindPlanarColoring
FindPlanarColoring[<i>g</i>] finds a coloring with minimal size for the faces of the planar graph <i>g</i>.

FindPlanarColoring[<i>g</i>,{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a coloring {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>} for the faces in the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindPointProcessParameters
FindPointProcessParameters[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i>] estimates the parameters of the point process <i>pproc</i> from point data <i>pdata</i>.

FindPointProcessParameters[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i>,{{<i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] estimates the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, ….

---

FindPostmanTour
