FindPostmanTour[<i>g</i>] finds a Chinese postman tour in the graph <i>g</i> of minimal length.

FindPostmanTour[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] finds at most <i>k</i> Chinese postman tours. 

FindPostmanTour[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindProcessParameters
FindProcessParameters[<i>data</i>,<i>proc</i>] finds the parameter estimates for the process <i>proc</i> from <i>data</i>.

FindProcessParameters[<i>data</i>,<i>proc</i>,{{<i>p</i>,<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>q</i>,<i>q</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] finds the parameters <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, … with starting values <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>q</i><sub>0</sub>, … .

---

FindRegionTransform
FindRegionTransform[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the transformation function that maps the region <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> to the region <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

FindRepeat
FindRepeat[<i>list</i>] finds the minimal sublist or subarray that repeats to give <i>list</i>.

FindRepeat[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] requires that the sublist be repeated at least <i>n</i> times in <i>list</i>.

FindRepeat[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] requires <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to repeat at level <i>i</i> in <i>list</i>.

FindRepeat["<i>string</i>"] finds the minimal substring that repeats to give <i>string</i>.

FindRepeat["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] requires that the substring be repeated at least <i>n</i> times.

---

FindRoot
FindRoot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] searches for a numerical root of <i>f</i>, starting from the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

FindRoot[<i>lhs</i>==<i>rhs</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>}] searches for a numerical solution to the equation <i>lhs</i>==<i>rhs</i>. 

FindRoot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a simultaneous numerical root of all the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindRoot[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>},…}] searches for a numerical solution to the simultaneous equations <i>eqn</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

FindSequenceFunction
FindSequenceFunction[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>3</sub>,…}] attempts to find a simple function that yields the sequence <i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> when given successive integer arguments.

FindSequenceFunction[{{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] attempts to find a simple function that yields <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when given argument <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindSequenceFunction[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub><i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub><i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a function that yields <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when given argument <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindSequenceFunction[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub><i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub><i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a function that yields <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when given argument <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindSequenceFunction[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the function applied to <i>n</i>.

---

FindShortestPath
FindShortestPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds the shortest path from source vertex <i>s</i> to target vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindShortestPath[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,All] generates a ShortestPathFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different <i>t</i>.

FindShortestPath[<i>g</i>,All,<i>t</i>] generates a ShortestPathFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different <i>s</i>.

FindShortestPath[<i>g</i>,All,All] generates a ShortestPathFunction[…] that can be applied to different <i>s</i> and <i>t</i>.

FindShortestPath[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

FindShortestTour
FindShortestTour[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] attempts to find an ordering of the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that minimizes the total distance on a tour that visits all the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> once.

FindShortestTour[<i>graph</i>] attempts to find an ordering of the vertices in <i>graph</i> that minimizes the total length when visiting each vertex once.

FindShortestTour[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>j</i>,<i>k</i>] finds an ordering of the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that minimizes the total distance on a path from <i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to <i>v</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

FindShortestTour[<i>graph</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds an ordering of the vertices that minimizes the total length on a path from <i>s</i> to <i>t</i>.

FindShortestTour[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

FindShortestTour[<i>data</i><i>prop</i>,…] gives the property <i>prop</i> for <i>data</i>.

---

FindSpanningTree
FindSpanningTree[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] finds a spanning tree that minimizes the total distance between the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FindSpanningTree[<i>g</i>] finds a spanning tree of the graph <i>g</i> that minimizes the total distances between vertices.

FindSpanningTree[{<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>},…] finds a spanning tree of the connected component of <i>g</i> that includes the vertex <i>v</i>. 

FindSpanningTree[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

FindSubgraphIsomorphism
FindSubgraphIsomorphism[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] finds a subgraph isomorphism that maps the graph <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> to a subgraph of <i>g</i><sub>2</sub> by renaming vertices.

FindSubgraphIsomorphism[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i>] finds at most <i>n</i> subgraph isomorphisms.

---

FindTextualAnswer
FindTextualAnswer[<i>text</i>,"<i>question</i>"] gives the substring of <i>text</i> that best appears to answer <i>question</i>.

FindTextualAnswer[<i>text</i>,"<i>question</i>",<i>n</i>] gives a list of up to <i>n</i> answers that appear most probable.

FindTextualAnswer[<i>text</i>,"<i>question</i>",<i>n</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the specified property for each answer.

---

FindThreshold
FindThreshold[<i>image</i>] finds a global threshold value that partitions the intensity values in <i>image</i> into two intervals.

---

FindTransientRepeat
FindTransientRepeat[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a pair of lists {<i>transient</i>,<i>repeat</i>} where the elements of <i>repeat</i> occur successively at least <i>n</i> times after the elements of the <i>transient</i> part of <i>list</i>.

FindTransientRepeat[<i>string</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a pair of strings {<i>transient</i>,<i>repeat</i>}.

---

FindVertexColoring
FindVertexColoring[<i>g</i>] finds a coloring with minimal size for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>. 

FindVertexColoring[<i>g</i>,{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a coloring {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>} for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

---

FindVertexCover
FindVertexCover[<i>g</i>] finds a vertex cover of the graph <i>g</i> with a minimum number of vertices.

FindVertexCover[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

FindVertexCut
FindVertexCut[<i>g</i>] finds a smallest vertex cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindVertexCut[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] finds a smallest <i>s</i>-<i>t</i> vertex cut of the graph <i>g</i>.

FindVertexCut[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

FindVertexIndependentPaths
FindVertexIndependentPaths[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>k</i>] finds at most <i>k</i> vertex-independent paths from vertex <i>s</i> to vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

FindVertexIndependentPaths[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

FiniteAbelianGroupCount
FiniteAbelianGroupCount[<i>n</i>] gives the number of finite Abelian groups of order <i>n</i>.

---

FiniteGroupCount
FiniteGroupCount[<i>n</i>] gives the number of finite groups of order <i>n</i>.

---

FiniteGroupData
FiniteGroupData[<i>name</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the finite group specified by <i>name</i>.

FiniteGroupData["<i>class</i>"] gives a list of finite groups in the specified class.

---

First
First[<i>expr</i>] gives the first element in <i>expr</i>. 

First[<i>expr</i>,<i>def</i>] gives the first element if it exists, or <i>def</i> otherwise.

---

FirstCase
FirstCase[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>pattern</i>] gives the first <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to match <i>pattern</i>, or Missing["NotFound"] if none matching <i>pattern</i> is found. 

FirstCase[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>pattern</i><i>rhs</i>] gives the value of <i>rhs</i> corresponding to the first <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to match <i>pattern</i>.

FirstCase[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>default</i>] gives <i>default</i> if no element matching <i>pattern</i> is found. 

FirstCase[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>default</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] finds only objects that appear on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

FirstCase[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of FirstCase that can be applied to an expression.

---

FirstPassageTimeDistribution
FirstPassageTimeDistribution[<i>mproc</i>,<i>f</i>] represents the distribution of times for the Markov process <i>mproc</i> to pass from the initial state to final states <i>f</i> for the first time. 

---

FirstPosition
FirstPosition[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives the position of the first element in <i>expr</i> that matches <i>pattern</i>, or Missing["NotFound"] if no such element is found.

FirstPosition[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>default</i>] gives <i>default</i> if no element matching <i>pattern</i> is found.

FirstPosition[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>default</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] finds only objects that appear on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

FirstPosition[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of FirstPosition that can be applied to an expression.

---

FischerGroupFi22
FischerGroupFi22[] represents the sporadic simple Fischer group Fi<sub>22</sub>.

---

FischerGroupFi23
FischerGroupFi23[] represents the sporadic simple Fischer group Fi<sub>23</sub>.

---

FischerGroupFi24Prime
FischerGroupFi24Prime[] represents the sporadic simple Fischer group Fi<sub>24</sub><sup>′</sup>.

---

FisherHypergeometricDistribution
FisherHypergeometricDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>succ</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>tot</i></sub>,<i>w</i>] represents a Fisher noncentral hypergeometric distribution.

---

FisherZDistribution
FisherZDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] represents a Fisher z distribution with <i>n</i> numerator and <i>m</i> denominator degrees of freedom.

---

Fit
Fit[<i>data</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] finds a fit <i>a</i><sub>1</sub>⁢<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>+…+<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>⁢<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> to a list of <i>data</i> for functions <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> of variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}. 

Fit[{<i>m</i>,<i>v</i>}] finds a fit vector <i>a</i> that minimizes ||m.a-v|| for a design matrix <i>m</i>.

Fit[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what fit property <i>prop</i> should be returned.

---

FitRegularization
FitRegularization is an option for Fit and FindFit that specifies a regularization for fitting a model.

---

FittedModel
FittedModel[…] represents the symbolic fitted model obtained from functions like LinearModelFit.

---

FixedOrder
FixedOrder[<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is a grammar rules pattern object that represents a sequence of elements matching <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, …, in the fixed order given.

---

FixedPoint
FixedPoint[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] starts with <i>expr</i>, then applies <i>f</i> repeatedly until the result no longer changes.

FixedPoint[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] stops after at most <i>n</i> steps.

---

FixedPointList
FixedPointList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] generates a list giving the results of applying <i>f</i> repeatedly, starting with <i>expr</i>, until the results no longer change.

FixedPointList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] stops after at most <i>n</i> steps.

---

Flat
Flat is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol <i>f</i> to indicate that all expressions involving nested functions <i>f</i> should be flattened out. This property is accounted for in pattern matching. 

---

Flatten
Flatten[<i>list</i>] flattens out nested lists. 

Flatten[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] flattens to level <i>n</i>. 

Flatten[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>h</i>] flattens subexpressions with head <i>h</i>. 

Flatten[<i>list</i>,{{<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>s</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] flattens <i>list</i> by combining all levels <i>s</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to make each level <i>i</i> in the result. 

---

FlattenAt
FlattenAt[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] flattens out a sublist that appears as the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> element of <i>list</i>. If <i>n</i> is negative, the position is counted from the end. 

FlattenAt[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] flattens out the part of <i>expr</i> at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}. 

FlattenAt[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] flattens out parts of <i>expr</i> at several positions.

FlattenAt[<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of FlattenAt that can be applied to an expression.

---

FlattenLayer
FlattenLayer[] represents a net layer that flattens any input array into a vector.

FlattenLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a net layer that flattens its input to level <i>n</i>.

FlattenLayer[{{<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>s</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] represents a net layer that flattens its input by combining all levels <i>s</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to make each level <i>i</i> in the result.

---

FlatTopWindow
FlatTopWindow[<i>x</i>] represents an exact flat top window function of <i>x</i>.

---

FlightData
FlightData[<i>spec</i>,<i>options</i>] returns a subset of properties for a flight or selection of flights with specifications <i>spec</i>.

FlightData[<i>spec</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>options</i>] returns the value of the property <i>prop</i> for specifications <i>spec</i>.

FlightData[<i>spec</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>options</i>] returns the value of the property <i>prop</i> for a specific time or time range <i>datespec</i>.

---

FlipView
FlipView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents an object which flips between displaying <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub> each time it is clicked.

FlipView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] cyclically flips through successive <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FlipView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>i</i>] makes <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> be the object currently displayed.

---

Floor
Floor[<i>x</i>] gives the greatest integer less than or equal to <i>x</i>. 

Floor[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the greatest multiple of <i>a</i> less than or equal to <i>x</i>. 

---

FlowPolynomial
FlowPolynomial[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the flow polynomial of the graph <i>g</i>.

FlowPolynomial[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Fold
Fold[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>list</i>] gives the last element of FoldList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>list</i>].

Fold[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>] is equivalent to Fold[<i>f</i>,First[<i>list</i>],Rest[<i>list</i>]].

Fold[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of Fold that can be applied to expressions. 

---

FoldList
FoldList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,…}] gives {<i>x</i>,<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>],<i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>],<i>b</i>],…}. 

FoldList[<i>f</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,…}] gives {<i>a</i>,<i>f</i>[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>],<i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>],<i>c</i>],…}.

FoldList[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of FoldList that can be applied to expressions. 

---

FoldPair
FoldPair[<i>f</i>,<i><i>y</i><sub>0</sub></i>,<i>list</i>] gives the last element of FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,<i><i>y</i><sub>0</sub></i>,<i>list</i>].

FoldPair[<i>f</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>list</i>,<i>g</i>] gives the last element of FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,<i><i>y</i><sub>0</sub></i>,<i>list</i>,<i>g</i>].

FoldPair[<i>f</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is equivalent to FoldPair[<i>f</i>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}].

---

FoldPairList
FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list of successive <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> obtained by applying <i>f</i> to pairs of the form {<i>y</i><sub><i>i-1</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}, where at each step <i>f</i> returns {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>list</i>,<i>g</i>] gives the list of successive values of <i>g</i>[{<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}].

FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is equivalent to FoldPairList[<i>f</i>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}].

---

FoldWhile
FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>] returns the first expression <i>f</i>[… <i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>]…,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>] to which applying <i>test</i> does not yield True.

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] is equivalent to FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,First[<i>list</i>],Rest[<i>list</i>],<i>test</i>].

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>] supplies the most recent <i>m</i> results as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step.

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,All] supplies all results so far as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step. 

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] returns the result after applying <i>f</i> an extra <i>n</i> times after <i>test</i> fails.

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,-<i>n</i>] returns the result found when <i>f</i> had been applied <i>n</i> fewer times.

FoldWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>test</i>] represents an operator form of FoldWhile that can be applied to expressions.

---

FoldWhileList
FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>] returns {<i>x</i>,<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>],…}, repeatedly applying <i>f</i> with subsequent values <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> until applying <i>test</i> to the result does not yield True.

FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] is equivalent to FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,First[<i>list</i>],Rest[<i>list</i>],<i>test</i>].

FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>] supplies the most recent <i>m</i> results as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step.

FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,All] supplies all results so far as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step.

FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] returns <i>n</i> additional results by applying <i>f</i> an extra <i>n</i> times after <i>test</i> fails.

FoldWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,-<i>n</i>] returns <i>n</i> fewer results.

FoldWhileList[f,test] represents an operator form of FoldWhileList that can be applied to expressions.

---

FollowRedirects
FollowRedirects is an option for URLRead and related functions that specifies whether to follow HTTP redirects when retrieving a URL.

---

FontColor
FontColor is an option for Style, Cell, and related constructs that specifies the default color in which to render text. 

---

FontFamily
FontFamily is an option for Style and Cell that specifies the font family in which text should be rendered. 

---

FontSize
FontSize is an option for Style and Cell that specifies the default size in printer's points of the font in which to render text. 

---

FontSlant
FontSlant is an option for Style, Cell, and related constructs that specifies how slanted characters in text should be. 

---

FontSubstitutions
FontSubstitutions is a global option that gives a list of substitutions to try for font family names. 

---

FontTracking
FontTracking is an option for Style and Cell that specifies how condensed or expanded you want the font in which text is rendered to be. 

---

FontVariations
FontVariations is an option for Style, Cell, and related constructs that specifies what font variations should be used.

---

FontWeight
FontWeight is an option for Style, Cell, and related constructs that specifies how heavy the characters in a font should be. 

---

For
For[<i>start</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>incr</i>,<i>body</i>] executes <i>start</i>, then repeatedly evaluates <i>body</i> and <i>incr</i> until <i>test</i> fails to give True. 

---

ForAll
ForAll[<i>x</i>,<i>expr</i>] represents the statement that <i>expr</i> is True for all values of <i>x</i>. 

ForAll[<i>x</i>,<i>cond</i>,<i>expr</i>] states that <i>expr</i> is True for all <i>x</i> satisfying the condition <i>cond</i>. 

ForAll[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] states that <i>expr</i> is True for all values of all the <i>x</i><sub>i</sub>. 

---

ForceVersionInstall
ForceVersionInstall is an option to PacletInstall and PacletInstallSubmit that specifies whether an older version of a paclet is allowed to be installed if a newer version is already installed.

---

Format
Format[<i>expr</i>] prints as the formatted form of <i>expr</i>. Assigning values to Format[<i>expr</i>] defines print forms for expressions. 

Format[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a format for the specified form of output. 

---

FormatType
FormatType is an option for output streams, graphics, and functions such as Text that specifies the default format type to use when outputting expressions. 

---

FormatValues
FormatValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all printing formats (values for Format[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,…],…], etc.) defined for the symbol <i>f</i>.

---

FormFunction
FormFunction[<i>formspec</i>,<i>func</i>] represents an active form that, when submitted, applies <i>func</i> to the values obtained from the form specified by <i>formspec</i>.

FormFunction[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] represents an active form with fields named <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> interpreted as types <i>type</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormFunction[{{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>label</i><sub>1</sub>}<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] uses <i>label</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the label for the field named <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormFunction[{<i>namespec</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub><i>default</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] uses <i>default</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the default for the field specified by <i>namespec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormFunction[<i>formspec</i>,<i>func</i>,<i>fmt</i>] specifies that in the cloud, the result from applying <i>func</i> should be returned in format <i>fmt</i>.

FormFunction[{<i>formspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>formspec</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>func</i>,…] represents a multipage form, in which the successive <i>formspec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> can be functions that are applied to the values obtained so far.

---

FormLayoutFunction
FormLayoutFunction is an option for FormObject and FormFunction that can be used to specify how to lay out a form.

---

FormObject
FormObject[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a form with fields having names <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that take data of type <i>type</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormObject[{{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>label</i><sub>1</sub>}<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] uses <i>label</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the label for the field named <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormObject[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>obj</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…}] uses full specification <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for a field, and <i>obj</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> as part of the layout of the form.

---

FormPage
FormPage[<i>formspec</i>,<i>func</i>] represents an active page that takes input from a form and generates results on the same page by applying <i>func</i> to the values obtained from the form whose structure is defined by <i>formspec</i>.

FormPage[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] represents an active form page with fields named <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> interpreted as types <i>type</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormPage[{{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>label</i><sub>1</sub>}<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] uses <i>label</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the label for the field named <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormPage[{<i>namespec</i><sub>1</sub><i>type</i><sub>1</sub><i>default</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>func</i>] uses <i>default</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the default for the field specified by <i>namespec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormPage[<i>formspec</i>,<i>func</i>,<i>form</i>] lays out the page according to the layout specification <i>form</i>.

FormPage[<i>formspec</i>,<i>func</i>,<i>initform</i><i>resform</i>] uses <i>initform</i> as the initial layout specification and <i>resform</i> as the layout specification for result pages.

---

FormProtectionMethod
FormProtectionMethod is an option for form generation functions that specifies what method to use for protecting the form against spam and other undesired submissions.

---

FormTheme
FormTheme is an option for FormObject and related functions that specifies an overall theme for a form and its elements.

---

FormulaData
FormulaData[<i>name</i>] gives the equations for the formula <i>name</i>.

FormulaData[<i>name</i>,{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub><i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub><i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] solves or simplifies equations using the specified values <i>quantity</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for the variables <i>var</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FormulaData[<i>name</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the formula <i>name</i>.

---

FormulaLookup
FormulaLookup["<i>query</i>"] gives a list of the full names of formulas whose names are consistent with "<i>query</i>".

FormulaLookup["<i>query</i>",<i>n</i>] returns at most <i>n</i> results.

FormulaLookup["<i>class</i>"] returns the names of all formulas within that <i>class</i>.

---

FortranForm
FortranForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a Fortran language version of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Forward
Forward is a symbol that represents the forward direction for purposes of motion and animation.

---

ForwardBackward
ForwardBackward is a symbol that represents alternate forward and backward motion or animation.

---

ForwardCloudCredentials
ForwardCloudCredentials is an option for remote evaluation and submission functions that specifies whether Wolfram Cloud credentials from the local session should be copied into remote sessions.

---

Fourier
Fourier[<i>list</i>] finds the discrete Fourier transform of a list of complex numbers.

Fourier[<i>list</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the specified positions of the discrete Fourier transform. 

---

FourierCoefficient
FourierCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> coefficient in the Fourier series expansion of <i>expr</i>.

FourierCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a multidimensional Fourier coefficient.

---

FourierCosCoefficient
FourierCosCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> coefficient in the Fourier cosine series expansion of <i>expr</i>.

FourierCosCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a multidimensional Fourier cosine coefficient.

---

FourierCosSeries
FourierCosSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-order Fourier cosine series expansion of <i>expr</i> in <i>t</i>.

FourierCosSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>{</i><i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier cosine series of <i>expr</i>.

---

FourierCosTransform
FourierCosTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,ω] gives the symbolic Fourier cosine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

FourierCosTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier cosine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

FourierDCT
FourierDCT[<i>list</i>] finds the Fourier discrete cosine transform of a list of real numbers.

FourierDCT[<i>list</i>,<i>m</i>] finds the Fourier discrete cosine transform of type <i>m</i>.

---

FourierDCTFilter
FourierDCTFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] reduces noise in <i>image</i> by locally thresholding the discrete cosine transforms of overlapping subimages, using the hard threshold <i>t</i>.

---

FourierDCTMatrix
FourierDCTMatrix[<i>n</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> discrete cosine transform matrix of type 2.

FourierDCTMatrix[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> discrete cosine transform matrix of type <i>m</i>.

---

FourierDST
FourierDST[<i>list</i>] finds the Fourier discrete sine transform of a list of real numbers.

FourierDST[<i>list</i>,<i>m</i>] finds the Fourier discrete sine transform of type m.

---

FourierDSTMatrix
FourierDSTMatrix[<i>n</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> discrete sine transform matrix of type 2.

FourierDSTMatrix[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> discrete sine transform matrix of type <i>m</i>.

---

FourierMatrix
FourierMatrix[<i>n</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Fourier matrix.

---

FourierParameters
FourierParameters is an option to Fourier and related functions that specifies the conventions to use in computing Fourier transforms.

---

FourierSequenceTransform
FourierSequenceTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,ω] gives the Fourier sequence transform of <i>expr</i>.

FourierSequenceTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier sequence transform. 

---

FourierSeries
FourierSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-order Fourier series expansion of <i>expr</i> in <i>t</i>. 

FourierSeries[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier series.

---

FourierSinCoefficient
FourierSinCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> coefficient in the Fourier sine series expansion of <i>expr</i>.

FourierSinCoefficient[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a multidimensional Fourier sine coefficient.

---

FourierSinSeries
FourierSinSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-order Fourier sine series expansion of <i>expr</i> in <i>t</i>.

FourierSinSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>{</i><i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier sine series of <i>expr</i>.

---

FourierSinTransform
FourierSinTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,ω] gives the symbolic Fourier sine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

FourierSinTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier sine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

FourierTransform
FourierTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,ω] gives the symbolic Fourier transform of <i>expr</i>. 

FourierTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

FourierTrigSeries
FourierTrigSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-order Fourier trigonometric series expansion of <i>expr</i> in <i>t</i>.

FourierTrigSeries[<i>expr</i>,<i>{</i><i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Fourier trigonometric series of <i>expr</i>.

---

FoxHReduce
FoxHReduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] attempts to reduce <i>expr</i> to a single FoxH object as a function of <i>x</i>.

---

FractionalBrownianMotionProcess
FractionalBrownianMotionProcess[μ,σ,<i>h</i>] represents fractional Brownian motion process with drift μ, volatility σ, and Hurst index <i>h</i>.

FractionalBrownianMotionProcess[<i>h</i>] represents fractional Brownian motion process with drift 0, volatility 1, and Hurst index <i>h</i>.

---

FractionalGaussianNoiseProcess
FractionalGaussianNoiseProcess[μ,σ,<i>h</i>] represents a fractional Gaussian noise process with drift μ, volatility σ, and Hurst index <i>h</i>.

FractionalGaussianNoiseProcess[<i>h</i>] represents a fractional Gaussian noise process with drift 0, volatility 1, and Hurst index <i>h</i>.

---

FractionalPart
FractionalPart[<i>x</i>] gives the fractional part of <i>x</i>. 

---

FractionLine
FractionLine is an option for fractions that specifies the thickness of the line separating the numerator and denominator.

---

Frame
Frame is an option for Graphics, Grid, and other constructs that specifies whether to include a frame. 

---

Framed
Framed[<i>expr</i>] displays a framed version of <i>expr</i>. 

---

FrameLabel
FrameLabel is an option for Graphics, Manipulate, and related functions that specifies labels to be placed on the edges of a frame. 

---

FrameListVideo
FrameListVideo[{<i>img</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>img</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a video containing frames <i>img</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>img</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

FrameListVideo[<i>files</i>] generates a video from existing image files.

---

FrameMargins
FrameMargins is an option for objects that can be displayed with frames which specifies the absolute margins in printer's points to leave inside the frame. 

---

FrameRate
FrameRate is an option to specify the number of frames per second. 

---

FrameStyle
FrameStyle is an option for Graphics, Grid, and other constructs that specifies the style in which to draw frames.

---

FrameTicks
FrameTicks is an option for 2D graphics functions that specifies tick marks for the edges of a frame. 

---

FrameTicksStyle
FrameTicksStyle is an option for 2D graphics functions that specifies how frame ticks should be rendered.

---

FRatioDistribution
FRatioDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] represents an F-ratio distribution with <i>n</i> numerator and <i>m</i> denominator degrees of freedom.

---

FrechetDistribution
FrechetDistribution[α,β] represents the Fréchet distribution with shape parameter α and scale parameter β.

FrechetDistribution[α,β,μ] represents the Fréchet distribution with shape parameter α, scale parameter β, and location parameter μ.

---

FreeQ
FreeQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] yields True if no subexpression in <i>expr</i> matches <i>form</i>, and yields False otherwise. 

FreeQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] tests only those parts of <i>expr</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

FreeQ[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of FreeQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

FrequencySamplingFilterKernel
FrequencySamplingFilterKernel[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] creates a finite impulse response (FIR) filter kernel using a frequency sampling method from amplitude values <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

FrequencySamplingFilterKernel[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>},<i>m</i>] creates an FIR filter kernel of type <i>m</i>.

---

FresnelC
FresnelC[<i>z</i>] gives the Fresnel integral C(z). 

---

FresnelF
FresnelF[<i>z</i>] gives the Fresnel auxiliary function F(z).

---

FresnelG
FresnelG[<i>z</i>] gives the Fresnel auxiliary function G(z).

---

FresnelS
FresnelS[<i>z</i>] gives the Fresnel integral S(z). 

---

Friday
Friday is a day of the week.

---

FrobeniusNumber
FrobeniusNumber[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Frobenius number of <i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

FrobeniusSolve
FrobeniusSolve[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>b</i>] gives a list of all solutions of the Frobenius equation a<sub>1</sub>x<sub>1</sub>+…+a<sub>n</sub>x<sub>n</sub>b.

FrobeniusSolve[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>b</i>,<i>m</i>] gives at most <i>m</i> solutions.

---

FromAbsoluteTime
FromAbsoluteTime[<i>time</i>] gives a date object corresponding to an absolute time specification as given by AbsoluteTime.

---

FromCharacterCode
FromCharacterCode[<i>n</i>] gives a string consisting of the character with integer code <i>n</i>. 

FromCharacterCode[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a string consisting of the sequence of characters with codes <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

FromCharacterCode[{{<i>n</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…}] gives a list of strings. 

FromCharacterCode[<i>codes</i>,"<i>encoding</i>"] uses the specified character encoding. 

---

FromCoefficientRules
FromCoefficientRules[<i>list</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs a polynomial from a list of rules for exponent vectors and coefficients. 

---

FromContinuedFraction
FromContinuedFraction[<i>list</i>] reconstructs a number from the list of its continued fraction terms. 

---

FromDate
FromDate[<i>date</i>] converts a date of the form {<i>y</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>} to an absolute number of seconds since the beginning of January 1, 1900. 

---

FromDateString
FromDateString["<i>string</i>"] gives a date object corresponding to the date represented by "<i>string</i>".

FromDateString["<i>string</i>",{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the date object obtained by extracting elements "<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" from "<i>string</i>".

FromDateString["<i>string</i>",<i>fmt</i>] gives the date object obtained using the date format <i>fmt</i>.

---

FromDigits
FromDigits[<i>list</i>] constructs an integer from the list of its decimal digits. 

FromDigits[<i>list</i>,<i>b</i>] takes the digits to be given in base <i>b</i>. 

FromDigits[<i>list</i>,MixedRadix[<i>blist</i>]] uses the mixed radix with list of bases <i>blist</i>. 

FromDigits["<i>string</i>"] constructs an integer from a string of digits.

FromDigits["<i>string</i>","Roman"] constructs an integer from Roman numerals.

---

FromDMS
FromDMS[{<i>d</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] converts from degrees, minutes, and seconds to decimal degrees. 

FromDMS["<i>dms</i>"] converts from a DMS string to decimal degrees.

FromDMS["<i>latlon</i>"] converts from a latitude-longitude string to latitude and longitude in decimal degrees.

---

FromEntity
FromEntity[<i>entity</i>] returns a Wolfram Language object corresponding to an entity.

---

FromJulianDate
FromJulianDate[<i>jd</i>] gives a date object corresponding to the Julian date <i>jd</i>.

FromJulianDate["<i>type</i>",<i>jd</i>] gives a date object corresponding to the specified Julian date variant.

---

FromLetterNumber
FromLetterNumber[<i>n</i>] gives the lowercase letter at position <i>n</i> in the English alphabet.

FromLetterNumber[<i>n</i>,<i>alpha</i>] gives the letter at position <i>n</i> in the alphabet specified by <i>alpha</i>.

---

FromPolarCoordinates
FromPolarCoordinates[{<i>r</i>,θ}] gives the {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} Cartesian coordinates corresponding to the polar coordinates {<i>r</i>,θ}. 

FromPolarCoordinates[{<i>r</i>,θ<sub>1</sub>,…,θ<sub><i>n</i>-2</sub>,ϕ}] gives the coordinates corresponding to the hyperspherical coordinates {<i>r</i>,θ<sub>1</sub>,…,θ<sub><i>n</i>-2</sub>,ϕ} 

---

FromRomanNumeral
FromRomanNumeral["<i>string</i>"] gives the integer corresponding to the Roman numeral <i>"string"</i>. 

---

FromSphericalCoordinates
FromSphericalCoordinates[{<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ}] gives the {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} Cartesian coordinates corresponding to the spherical coordinates {<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ}.

---

FromUnixTime
FromUnixTime[<i>time</i>] gives a date object corresponding to a UnixTime specification.

---

Full
Full is a setting used for certain options, typically indicating that a full range of values should be included. 

---

FullAxes
FullAxes[<i>graphics</i>] returns the axes options of a graphics object.

---

FullDefinition
FullDefinition[<i>symbol</i>] prints as the definitions given for <i>symbol</i>, and all symbols on which these depend.

FullDefinition["<i>symbol</i>"] prints as the definitions given for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists, and all symbols on which these depend.

FullDefinition[<i>patt</i>] prints as the definitions given for the symbols whose names textually match the arbitrary string pattern <i>patt</i>, and all symbols on which these depend.

FullDefinition[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] prints as the definitions given for the symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and all symbols on which these depend.

---

FullForm
FullForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as the full form of <i>expr</i>, with no special syntax. 

---

FullGraphics
FullGraphics[<i>g</i>] takes a graphics object, and generates a new one in which objects specified by graphics options are given as explicit lists of graphics primitives. 

---

FullInformationOutputRegulator
FullInformationOutputRegulator[<i>sys</i>,<i>rspec</i>] gives the full state information output regulator for <i>sys</i> using specification <i>rspec</i>. 

FullInformationOutputRegulator[{<i>sys</i>,{<i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},…] specifies the regulated outputs <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and the controlled inputs <i>in</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

---

FullRegion
FullRegion[<i>n</i>] represents the full region <sup>n</sup>.

---

FullSimplify
FullSimplify[<i>expr</i>] tries a wide range of transformations on <i>expr</i> involving elementary and special functions and returns the simplest form it finds. 

FullSimplify[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>] does simplification using assumptions. 

---

Function
<i>body</i>&amp; or Function[<i>body</i>] is a pure (or "anonymous") function. The formal parameters are # (or #1), #2, etc. 

<i>x</i>|-><i>body</i> or <i>x</i><i>body</i> or Function[<i>x</i>,<i>body</i>] is a pure function with a single formal parameter <i>x</i>. 

{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}|-><i>body</i> or <i>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}</i><i>body</i> or Function[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>body</i>] is a pure function with a list of formal parameters. 

Function[<i>params</i>,<i>body</i>,<i>attrs</i>] is a pure function that is treated as having attributes <i>attrs</i> for purposes of evaluation.

---

FunctionAnalytic
FunctionAnalytic[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x) is an analytic function for <i>x</i>∈Reals.

FunctionAnalytic[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether f(x) is an analytic function for <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionAnalytic[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),… are analytic functions for <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionAnalytic[{<i>funs</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i><i>)</i> are analytic functions for <i>xvars</i> in an open set containing the solutions of the constraints <i>cons</i> over the domain <i>dom</i>.

---

FunctionBijective
FunctionBijective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x)y has exactly one solution <i>x</i>∈Reals for each <i>y</i>∈Reals.

FunctionBijective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether f(x)y has exactly one solution <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i> for each <i>y</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionBijective[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>1</sub>,f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>2</sub>,… has exactly one solution <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i> for each <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionBijective[{<i>funs</i>,<i>xcons</i>,<i>ycons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>yvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i>)<i>yvars</i> has exactly one solution with <i>xvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>xcons</i> for each <i>yvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>ycons</i>. 

---

FunctionCompile
FunctionCompile[<i>f</i>] generates a compiled code function from a pure function.

FunctionCompile[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a list of compiled code functions from a list of pure functions.

FunctionCompile[<i>k</i><sub>1</sub><i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub><i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…] generates an association of compiled code functions from an association of Wolfram Language functions.

FunctionCompile[<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>] uses the local auxiliary definitions <i>defs</i>.

---

FunctionCompileExport
FunctionCompileExport["<i>file</i>.<i>ext</i>",<i>fspec</i>] exports a compiled version of functions <i>fspec</i> in the format specified by the file extension <i>ext</i>.

FunctionCompileExport[<i>path</i>,<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>] exports a compiled version of <i>fspec</i> using local auxiliary definitions <i>defs</i>.

FunctionCompileExport[<i>path</i>,<i>fspec</i>,"<i>format</i>"] exports in the specified format.

FunctionCompileExport[<i>path</i>,<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>,"<i>format</i>"] exports a compiled version using local auxiliary definitions.

---

FunctionCompileExportByteArray
FunctionCompileExportByteArray[<i>fspec</i>] gives a byte array of binary LLVM code obtained by compiling the function specification <i>fspec</i>.

FunctionCompileExportByteArray[<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>] uses the auxiliary definitions <i>defs</i> for compilation.

FunctionCompileExportByteArray[<i>fspec</i>,"<i>format</i>"] gives a byte array of binary code in the specified format.

---

FunctionCompileExportLibrary
FunctionCompileExportLibrary[<i>file</i>,<i>fspec</i>] exports a compiled version of function specification <i>fspec</i> as a shared library suitable for external use.

FunctionCompileExportLibrary[<i>file</i>,<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>] uses the auxiliary definitions <i>defs</i> for compilation.

---

FunctionCompileExportString
FunctionCompileExportString[<i>fspec</i>] gives a string of textual LLVM code obtained by compiling the function specification <i>fspec</i>.

FunctionCompileExportString[<i>defs</i>,<i>fspec</i>] uses the auxiliary definitions <i>defs</i> for compilation.

FunctionCompileExportString[<i>fspec</i>,"<i>format</i>"] gives a string of textual code in the specified format.

---

FunctionContinuous
FunctionContinuous[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x) is a real-valued continuous function for <i>x</i>∈Reals.

FunctionContinuous[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether f(x) is a continuous function for <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionContinuous[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),… are continuous functions for <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionContinuous[{<i>funs</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i><i>)</i> are continuous functions for <i>xvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

---

FunctionConvexity
FunctionConvexity[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds the convexity of the function <i>f</i> with variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,… over the reals.

FunctionConvexity[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds the convexity when variables are restricted by the constraints <i>cons</i> representing a convex region.

---

FunctionDeclaration
FunctionDeclaration[<i>name</i>,<i>typedfun</i>] declares <i>name</i> to be a typed function suitable for use in a compiler environment.

---

FunctionDiscontinuities
FunctionDiscontinuities[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] finds the discontinuities of f(x) for <i>x</i>∈Reals. 

FunctionDiscontinuities[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the discontinuities of f(x) for <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionDiscontinuities[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] finds the discontinuities of f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),… for <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

---

FunctionDomain
FunctionDomain[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] finds the largest domain of definition of the real function <i>f</i> of the variable <i>x</i>. 

FunctionDomain[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] considers <i>f</i> to be a function with arguments and values in the domain <i>dom</i>.

FunctionDomain[<i>funs</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the largest domain of definition of the mapping <i>funs</i> of the variables <i>vars</i>. 

FunctionDomain[{<i>funs</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the domain of <i>funs</i> with the values of <i>vars</i> restricted by constraints <i>cons</i>.

---

FunctionExpand
FunctionExpand[<i>expr</i>] tries to expand out special and certain other functions in <i>expr</i>, when possible reducing compound arguments to simpler ones. 

FunctionExpand[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>] expands using assumptions. 

---

FunctionInjective
FunctionInjective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x)y has at most one solution <i>x</i>∈Reals for each <i>y</i>.

FunctionInjective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether f(x)y has at most one solution <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i>. 

FunctionInjective[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>1</sub>,f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>2</sub>,… has at most one solution <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionInjective[{<i>funs</i>,<i>xcons</i>,<i>ycons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>yvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i>)<i>yvars</i> has at most one solution with <i>xvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>xcons</i> for each <i>yvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>ycons</i>. 

---

FunctionInterpolation
FunctionInterpolation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates <i>expr</i> with <i>x</i> running from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> and constructs an InterpolatingFunction object which represents an approximate function corresponding to the result. 

FunctionInterpolation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] constructs an InterpolatingFunction object with several arguments. 

---

FunctionLayer
FunctionLayer[<i>f</i>] represents a net layer that applies function <i>f</i> to its input.

---

FunctionMeromorphic
FunctionMeromorphic[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x) is a meromorphic function of <i>x</i>.

FunctionMeromorphic[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…) is a meromorphic function of <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,….

FunctionMeromorphic[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),… are meromorphic functions for <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,….

FunctionMeromorphic[{<i>funs</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>xvars</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i><i>)</i> are meromorphic functions for <i>xvars</i> in an open set containing the solutions of the constraints <i>cons</i>.

---

FunctionMonotonicity
FunctionMonotonicity[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] finds the monotonicity of the function <i>f</i> with the variable <i>x</i> over the reals.

FunctionMonotonicity[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the monotonicity of <i>f</i> when <i>x</i> is restricted to the domain <i>dom</i>.

FunctionMonotonicity[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] gives the monotonicity of <i>f</i> when <i>x</i> is restricted by the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

---

FunctionPeriod
FunctionPeriod[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a period <i>p</i> of the function <i>f</i> over the reals such that f(x+p)f(x).

FunctionPeriod[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] gives a period with <i>x</i> restricted to the domain <i>dom</i>.

FunctionPeriod[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives periods {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…} for {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} such that f(x<sub>1</sub>+p<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>+p<sub>2</sub>,…)f(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…).

---

FunctionPoles
FunctionPoles[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] finds the poles of the meromorphic function <i>f</i> with the variable <i>x</i>.

FunctionPoles[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>x</i>] gives the poles of <i>f</i> when <i>x</i> is restricted by the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

---

FunctionRange
FunctionRange[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] finds the range of the real function <i>f</i> of the variable <i>x</i> returning the result in terms of <i>y</i>.

FunctionRange[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>dom</i>] considers <i>f</i> to be a function with arguments and values in the domain <i>dom</i>.

FunctionRange[<i>funs</i>,<i>xvars</i>,<i>yvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the range of the mapping <i>funs</i> of the variables <i>xvars</i> returning the result in terms of <i>yvars</i>.

FunctionRange[{<i>funs</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>yvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the range of the mapping <i>funs</i> with the values of <i>xvars</i> restricted by constraints <i>cons</i>.

---

FunctionSign
FunctionSign[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds the real sign of the function <i>f</i> with variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,… over the reals.

FunctionSign[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] finds the real sign with variables restricted to the domain <i>dom</i>. 

FunctionSign[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] gives the sign when variables are restricted by the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

---

FunctionSingularities
FunctionSingularities[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] finds the singularities of f(x) for <i>x</i>∈Reals. 

FunctionSingularities[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] finds the singularities of f(x) for <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionSingularities[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] finds the singularities of f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…),… for <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

---

FunctionSpace
FunctionSpace is an option for FindSequenceFunction and related functions that specifies the space of functions to consider for representations. 

---

FunctionSurjective
FunctionSurjective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] tests whether f(x)y has at least one solution x∈ for each <i>y</i>∈Reals.

FunctionSurjective[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether f(x)y has at least one solution <i>x</i>∈<i>dom</i> for each <i>y</i>∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionSurjective[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] tests whether f<sub>1</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>1</sub>,f<sub>2</sub>(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…)y<sub>2</sub>,… has at least one solution <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i> for each <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…∈<i>dom</i>.

FunctionSurjective[{<i>funs</i>,<i>xcons</i>,<i>ycons</i>},<i>xvars</i>,<i>yvars</i>,<i>dom</i>] tests whether <i>funs</i>(<i>xvars</i>)<i>yvars</i> has at least one solution with <i>xvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>xcons</i> for each <i>yvars</i>∈<i>dom</i> restricted by the constraints <i>ycons</i>. 

---

FussellVeselyImportance
FussellVeselyImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the Fussell–Vesely importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

FussellVeselyImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the Fussell–Vesely importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

GaborFilter
GaborFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>k</i>] filters <i>data</i> by convolving with a Gabor kernel of pixel radius <i>r</i> and wave vector <i>k</i>.

GaborFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>k</i>,ϕ] uses a Gabor kernel with phase shift ϕ.

GaborFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i>,σ},…]  uses a Gabor kernel with radius <i>r </i> and standard deviation σ.

---

GaborWavelet
GaborWavelet[] represents a Gabor wavelet of frequency 6.

GaborWavelet[<i>w</i>] represents a Gabor wavelet of frequency <i>w</i>.

---

GainMargins
GainMargins[<i>lsys</i>] gives the gain margins of the linear time-invariant system <i>lsys</i>.

---

GainPhaseMargins
GainPhaseMargins[<i>lsys</i>] gives the gain and phase margins of the linear time-invariant system <i>lsys</i>.

---

GalaxyData
GalaxyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the galaxy <i>entity</i>.

GalaxyData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified galaxy entities.

GalaxyData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

GalleryView
GalleryView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an object in which the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are displayed in a browsable gallery layout.

GalleryView[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses each of the associations <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to define the display of an item in the gallery.

---

Gamma
Gamma[<i>z</i>] is the Euler gamma function Γ(z). 

Gamma[<i>a</i>,<i>z</i>] is the incomplete gamma function Γ(a,z). 

Gamma[<i>a</i>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>] is the generalized incomplete gamma function Γ(a,z<sub>0</sub>)-Γ(a,z<sub>1</sub>). 

---

GammaDistribution
GammaDistribution[α,β] represents a gamma distribution with shape parameter α and scale parameter β.

GammaDistribution[α,β,γ,μ] represents a generalized gamma distribution with shape parameters α and γ, scale parameter β, and location parameter μ.

---

GammaRegularized
GammaRegularized[<i>a</i>,<i>z</i>] is the regularized incomplete gamma function Q(a,z). 

---

GapPenalty
GapPenalty is an option for SequenceAlignment and related functions that gives the additional cost associated with each gap corresponding to a run of insertions or deletions.

---

GARCHProcess
GARCHProcess[κ,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>q</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>p</i></sub>}] represents a generalized autoregressive conditionally heteroscedastic process of orders <i>p</i> and <i>q</i>, driven by a standard white noise.

GARCHProcess[κ,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>q</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>p</i></sub>},<i>init</i>] represents a GARCH process with initial data <i>init</i>.

---

GatedRecurrentLayer
GatedRecurrentLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a trainable recurrent layer that takes a sequence of vectors and produces a sequence of vectors each of size <i>n</i>.

GatedRecurrentLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial weights and other parameters. 

---

Gather
Gather[<i>list</i>] gathers the elements of <i>list</i> into sublists of identical elements.

Gather[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] applies <i>test</i> to pairs of elements to determine if they should be considered identical.

---

GatherBy
GatherBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gathers into sublists each set of elements in <i>list</i> that gives the same value when <i>f</i> is applied.

GatherBy[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gathers <i>list</i> into nested sublists using <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i>. 

---

GaugeFaceElementFunction
GaugeFaceElementFunction is an option for gauge functions that gives a function to use to generate the primitives for rendering the gauge face.

---

GaugeFaceStyle
GaugeFaceStyle is an option for gauge functions that specifies the style in which the face is to be drawn.

---

GaugeFrameElementFunction
GaugeFrameElementFunction is an option for gauge functions that gives a function to generate the primitives for rendering the gauge frame.

---

GaugeFrameSize
GaugeFrameSize is an option for gauge functions that controls the size of the frame around the gauge.

---

GaugeFrameStyle
GaugeFrameStyle is an option for gauge functions that specifies the style in which the frame is to be drawn.

---

GaugeLabels
GaugeLabels is an option for gauge functions that specifies labels to be placed on the gauge.

---

GaugeMarkers
GaugeMarkers is an option for gauge functions that specifies what markers to draw to mark the values.

---

GaugeStyle
GaugeStyle is an option for gauge functions that specifies styles in which the markers are to be drawn.

---

GaussianIntegers
GaussianIntegers is an option for FactorInteger, PrimeQ, Factor, and related functions that specifies whether factorization should be done over Gaussian integers. 

---

GaussianOrthogonalMatrixDistribution
GaussianOrthogonalMatrixDistribution[σ,<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian orthogonal matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>n</i>,<i>n</i>} and scale parameter σ.

GaussianOrthogonalMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian orthogonal matrix distribution with unit scale parameter.

---

GaussianSymplecticMatrixDistribution
GaussianSymplecticMatrixDistribution[σ,<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian symplectic matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>2 n</i>,<i>2 n</i>} over the field of complex numbers and scale parameter σ.

GaussianSymplecticMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian symplectic matrix distribution with unit scale parameter.

---

GaussianUnitaryMatrixDistribution
GaussianUnitaryMatrixDistribution[σ,<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian unitary matrix distribution with matrix dimensions {<i>n,n</i>} and scale parameter σ.

GaussianUnitaryMatrixDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a Gaussian unitary matrix distribution with unit scale parameter.

---

GaussianWindow
GaussianWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Gaussian window function of <i>x</i>.

GaussianWindow[<i>x</i>,σ] uses standard deviation σ.

---

GCD
GCD[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the greatest common divisor of the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

GegenbauerC
GegenbauerC[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Gegenbauer polynomial C<sub>n</sub><sup>(m)</sup>(x). 

GegenbauerC[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the renormalized form "lim"+m0�/m. 

---

General
General is a symbol to which general system messages are attached. 

---

GenerateAsymmetricKeyPair
GenerateAsymmetricKeyPair[] randomly generates a PrivateKey and corresponding PublicKey object for use with public-key cryptographic functions.

GenerateAsymmetricKeyPair[<i>type</i>] randomly generates private and public keys of the specified type.

GenerateAsymmetricKeyPair[<i>opts</i>] randomly generates keys using the specified options.

---

GenerateConditions
GenerateConditions is an option for Integrate, Sum, and similar functions that specifies whether explicit conditions on parameters should be generated in the result.

---

GeneratedAssetFormat
GeneratedAssetFormat is an option for functions like VideoGenerator that specifies the format of the resulting asset.

---

GeneratedAssetLocation
GeneratedAssetLocation is an option for functions like VideoGenerator that specifies the location of the resulting asset.

---

GeneratedDocumentBinding
GeneratedDocumentBinding is an option for supplying parameters to a DocumentGenerator during manual evaluation.

---

GenerateDerivedKey
GenerateDerivedKey[<i>password</i>] generates a DerivedKey object from the <i>password</i> given.

GenerateDerivedKey[<i>password</i>,<i>salt</i>] generates a DerivedKey object from the <i>password</i> and <i>salt</i> given.

---

GenerateDigitalSignature
GenerateDigitalSignature[<i>expr</i>,<i>key</i>] generates a digital signature for <i>expr</i> using the specified private <i>key</i>.

GenerateDigitalSignature[<i>key</i>] represents an operator form of GenerateDigitalSignature that can be applied to expressions.

---

GeneratedParameters
GeneratedParameters is an option that specifies how parameters generated to represent the results of various symbolic operations should be named. 

---

GeneratedQuantityMagnitudes
GeneratedQuantityMagnitudes is an option that specifies how quantities generated to represent the quantity multiplier results in NondimensionalizationTransform should be named.

---

GenerateFileSignature
GenerateFileSignature["<i>file</i>",<i>key</i>] generates a digital signature of <i>file</i> using the specified private key.

GenerateFileSignature[{"<i>file</i>",<i>range</i>},<i>key</i>] generates a digital signature of the specified <i>range</i> of bytes in the <i>file</i>.

GenerateFileSignature[{{<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>range</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>range</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>key</i>] generates digital signatures for each specified <i>file</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>range</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GenerateFileSignature[<i>key</i>] represents an operator form of GenerateFileSignature that can be applied to files.

---

GenerateSecuredAuthenticationKey
GenerateSecuredAuthenticationKey[] generates a new anonymous SecuredAuthenticationKey owned by the current user ID.

GenerateSecuredAuthenticationKey["<i>name</i>"] generates a new SecuredAuthenticationKey with the specified name owned by the current user ID.

GenerateSecuredAuthenticationKey[SecuredAuthenticationKey[…]] generates a new set of credentials for an existing SecuredAuthenticationKey.

---

GenerateSymmetricKey
GenerateSymmetricKey[] randomly generates a SymmetricKey object suitable for use with cryptographic functions.

GenerateSymmetricKey["<i>password</i>"] derives a SymmetricKey object from the password string given.

GenerateSymmetricKey[<i>bytes</i>] generates a SymmetricKey object using the byte array or list of bytes directly as the key.

GenerateSymmetricKey[DerivedKey[…]] generates a symmetric key object with a key given by the DerivedKey object.

GenerateSymmetricKey[<i>opts</i>] randomly generates a symmetric key using the specified options.

---

GeneratingFunction
GeneratingFunction[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the generating function in <i>x</i> for the sequence whose <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> series coefficient is given by the expression <i>expr</i>.

GeneratingFunction[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional generating function in <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub>m</sub> whose <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,… ,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub> coefficient is given by <i>expr</i>.

---

GeneratorDescription
GeneratorDescription is an option for providing a textual description for a DocumentGenerator.

---

GeneratorHistoryLength
GeneratorHistoryLength is an option for document generators controlling the number of runs archived in the cloud.

---

GeneratorOutputType
GeneratorOutputType is an option controlling the file format of documents produced by a DocumentGenerator.

---

Generic
Generic is a setting for the Mode option of Solve and related functions.

---

GenericCylindricalDecomposition
GenericCylindricalDecomposition[<i>ineqs</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds the full-dimensional part of the decomposition of the region represented by the inequalities <i>ineqs</i> into cylindrical parts whose directions correspond to the successive <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, together with any hypersurfaces containing the rest of the region.

---

GenomeData
GenomeData["<i>gene</i>"] gives the DNA sequence for the specified gene on the reference human genome.

GenomeData["<i>gene</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the human gene <i>gene</i>.

GenomeData[{"<i>chr</i>",{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>}}] gives the sequence from positions <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>n</i><sub>2</sub> on chromosome <i>chr</i> in the reference human genome.

---

GenomeLookup
GenomeLookup["<i>seq</i>"] returns the positions of exact matches for the DNA sequence <i>seq</i> on the reference human genome.

GenomeLookup["<i>seq</i>",<i>n</i>] returns at most <i>n</i> matches.

---

GeoAntipode
GeoAntipode[<i>loc</i>] gives the antipodal position of location <i>loc</i>.

GeoAntipode[<i>g</i>] gives the antipodal primitive of the geo primitive <i>g</i>.

---

GeoArea
GeoArea[<i>g</i>] gives the area of the geo region <i>g</i>.

---

GeoArraySize
GeoArraySize is an option for geographic data functions that determines the dimensions of the array generated.

---

GeoBackground
GeoBackground is an option that specifies the background style of a GeoGraphics object.

---

GeoBoundary
GeoBoundary[<i>g</i>] returns the boundary line of the geo region <i>g</i>.

---

GeoBounds
GeoBounds[<i>g</i>] gives the ranges of latitudes and longitudes in the geo region <i>g</i>.

GeoBounds[<i>g</i>,δ] pads ranges of latitudes and longitudes by ±δ.

GeoBounds[<i>g</i>,Scaled[<i>s</i>]] pads range of latitudes and longitudes by a scaled amount <i>s</i>.

---

GeoBoundsRegion
GeoBoundsRegion[{{<i>lat</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>lat</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>lon</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>lon</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}}] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents a geo region bounded by parallels <i>lat</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>, <i>lat</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> and meridians <i>lon</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>, <i>lon</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> on the surface of the Earth.

GeoBoundsRegion[<i>g</i>] represents the latitude-longitude bounding box of the geo region <i>g</i>.

GeoBoundsRegion[<i>g</i>,δ] pads the ranges of latitudes and longitudes by ±δ.

---

GeoBoundsRegionBoundary
GeoBoundsRegionBoundary[{{<i>lat</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>lat</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>lon</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>lon</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}}] is a one-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the boundary of the region between parallels <i>lat</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>, <i>lat</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> and meridians <i>lon</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>, <i>lon</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> on the surface of the Earth.

GeoBoundsRegionBoundary[<i>g</i>] represents the boundary of the latitude-longitude bounding box of the geo region <i>g</i>.

GeoBoundsRegionBoundary[<i>g</i>,δ] pads the ranges of latitudes and longitudes by ±δ.

---

GeoBubbleChart
GeoBubbleChart[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a geo bubble chart with bubbles centered at the geographic regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with sizes <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoBubbleChart[<i>regions</i><i>values</i>] uses a collection of regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>regions</i> with corresponding sizes <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>values</i>.

GeoBubbleChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoBubbleChart[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

GeoCenter
GeoCenter is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies the coordinates of the point that should appear at the geographic center of the final map.

---

GeoCircle
GeoCircle[<i>loc</i>,<i>r</i>] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents a circle of radius <i>r</i> centered at the location <i>loc</i> on the surface of the Earth.

GeoCircle[<i>loc</i>,<i>r</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,α<sub>2</sub>}] represents a sector of a circle from bearing α<sub>1</sub> to bearing α<sub>2</sub>.

---

GeoContourPlot
GeoContourPlot[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a geo contour plot from values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> defined at specified locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoContourPlot[<i>locs</i><i>vals</i>] uses a collection of locations <i>locs</i> with corresponding values <i>vals</i>.

---

GeoDensityPlot
GeoDensityPlot[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a geo density plot with colors at the location <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> determined by the value <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoDensityPlot[<i>locs</i><i>vals</i>] uses a collection of locations <i>locs</i> with corresponding values <i>vals</i>.

---

GeodesicClosing
GeodesicClosing[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the geodesic closing of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

GeodesicClosing[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the geodesic closing with respect to a range <i>r</i> square.

GeodesicClosing[<i>data</i>,…] applies geodesic closing to an array of data.

---

GeodesicDilation
GeodesicDilation[<i>marker</i>,<i>mask</i>] gives the fixed point of the geodesic dilation of the <i>marker</i> constrained by the <i>mask</i>.

---

GeodesicErosion
GeodesicErosion[<i>marker</i>,<i>mask</i>] gives the fixed point of the geodesic erosion of the <i>marker</i> constrained by the <i>mask</i>.

---

GeodesicOpening
GeodesicOpening[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the geodesic opening of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

GeodesicOpening[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the geodesic opening with respect to a range <i>r</i> square.

GeodesicOpening[<i>data</i>,…] applies geodesic opening to an array of data.

---

GeoDestination
GeoDestination[<i>loc</i>,{<i>d</i>,α}] gives the end position of the geodesic of length <i>d</i> starting from <i>loc</i> with azimuthal direction α.

---

GeodesyData
GeodesyData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for a named geodetic datum or reference ellipsoid.

GeodesyData[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the property for the ellipsoid with semimajor axis <i>a</i> and semiminor axis <i>b</i>.

GeodesyData[<i>obj</i>,{"<i>property</i>",<i>coords</i>}] gives the value of the property at the specified coordinates.

---

GeoDirection
GeoDirection[{<i>lat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>lat</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the azimuthal direction from one latitude-longitude position on the Earth to another.

GeoDirection[<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the azimuthal direction between locations specified by position objects or geographic entities.

---

GeoDisk
GeoDisk[<i>loc</i>,<i>r</i>]  is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents a filled disk of radius <i>r</i> centered at the location <i>loc</i> on the surface of the Earth.

GeoDisk[<i>loc</i>,<i>r</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,α<sub>2</sub>}] gives a sector of a disk from bearing α<sub>1</sub> to bearing α<sub>2</sub>.

---

GeoDisplacement
GeoDisplacement[{<i>dist</i>,α}] represents a geodesic displacement of length <i>dist</i> and initial bearing α from a geo location.

GeoDisplacement[{<i>dist</i>,α},<i>pathtype</i>] represents a displacement of length <i>dist</i> and initial bearing α along a path of type <i>pathtype</i>.

GeoDisplacement[<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>pathtype</i>] returns the displacement needed to reach <i>loc</i><sub>2</sub> from <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> along a path of type <i>pathtype</i>.

---

GeoDistance
GeoDistance[{<i>lat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>lat</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the geodesic distance between latitude-longitude positions on the Earth.

GeoDistance[<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the distance between locations specified by position objects or geographical entities.

GeoDistance[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the total distance from <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> through all the intermediate <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeoDistanceList
GeoDistanceList[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the list of geodesic distances between consecutive pairs of locations.

---

GeoElevationData
GeoElevationData[] gives the elevation above sea level at $GeoLocation.

GeoElevationData[<i>loc</i>] gives the elevation at the geographic location <i>loc</i>.

GeoElevationData[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives an array of elevation values within the bounding box given by {<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>}.

GeoElevationData[GeoPosition[{{<i>lat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>lat</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>2</sub>},…}]] gives the list of elevations at the positions {<i>lat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>lon</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

GeoElevationData[<i>loc</i>,<i>etype</i>] gives the elevation of type <i>etype</i> for the location <i>loc</i>.

GeoElevationData[<i>loc</i>,<i>etype</i>,<i>format</i>] gives the elevation in the specified format.

---

GeoEntities
GeoEntities[<i>reg</i>,<i>enttype</i>] gives a list of the geographic entities of type <i>enttype</i> contained in the extended region <i>reg</i>.

GeoEntities[<i>reg</i>] gives a list of the geographic regions of any type contained in <i>reg</i>.

---

GeoGraphics
GeoGraphics[<i>primitives</i>,<i>options</i>] represents a two-dimensional geographical image.

---

GeoGraphPlot
GeoGraphPlot[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a plot of the geographic graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoGraphPlot[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a plot with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

GeoGraphPlot[{<i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub></i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to specify the graph.

GeoGraphPlot[<i>g</i>] displays the graph <i>g</i> with vertices at geographic locations on a map.

GeoGraphPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

GeoGraphValuePlot
