GeoGraphValuePlot[{{<i>src</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dest</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>flow</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>src</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>dest</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>flow</i><sub>2</sub>},…,{<i>src</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>dest</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>flow</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] plots the flows between geo locations.

GeoGraphValuePlot[{{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots the values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for the edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoGraphValuePlot[<i>g</i>] plots the flow for a graph <i>g</i> with associated edge weights.

---

GeogravityModelData
GeogravityModelData[] returns the gravitational field data for the current location.

GeogravityModelData[<i>locationspec</i>] returns the gravitational field data for a location.

GeogravityModelData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>component</i>] returns the component of the gravitational field.

---

GeoGridDirectionDifference
GeoGridDirectionDifference[<i>proj</i>,<i>loc</i>,β] gives the difference between the angle from north to direction β on the geo grid obtained with projection <i>proj</i> and the actual angle from north to direction β at location <i>loc</i>.

GeoGridDirectionDifference[<i>proj</i>,<i>loc</i>,αβ] gives the difference between projected and unprojected angles from direction α to direction β.

---

GeoGridLines
GeoGridLines is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies what parallels and meridians to show.

---

GeoGridLinesStyle
GeoGridLinesStyle is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies how parallels and meridians should be rendered.

---

GeoGridPosition
GeoGridPosition[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>proj</i>] represents a point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} in a planimetric cartographic grid using the projection <i>proj</i>.

GeoGridPosition[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>h</i>},<i>proj</i>] represents a point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>h</i>} in a cartographic grid with height <i>h</i> with respect to the reference ellipsoid.

GeoGridPosition[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>proj</i>] represents an array of cartographic grid positions.

GeoGridPosition[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>h</i>},<i>proj</i>,<i>datum</i>] represents a point in a cartographic grid obtained by projection from data in the given datum.

GeoGridPosition[<i>entity</i>,<i>proj</i>] returns the cartographic grid position of the specified geographical entity.

---

GeoGridRange
GeoGridRange is an option for geographic functions that specifies the range of projected coordinates to include.

---

GeoGridRangePadding
GeoGridRangePadding is an option for geographic functions that specifies how much to extend the projected coordinate ranges determined by GeoGridRange.

---

GeoGridUnitArea
GeoGridUnitArea[<i>proj</i>,<i>loc</i>] gives the actual geo area corresponding to a unit area on the geo grid obtained with projection <i>proj</i>, evaluated in the limit of small geo regions around location <i>loc</i>.

---

GeoGridUnitDistance
GeoGridUnitDistance[<i>proj</i>,<i>loc</i>,α] gives the actual geo distance corresponding to a unit distance on the geo grid obtained with projection <i>proj</i>, evaluated in the limit of small displacement from location <i>loc</i> in direction α.

---

GeoGridVector
GeoGridVector[<i>loc</i>{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},<i>proj</i>] represents a horizontal two-dimensional vector of components <i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub> in the orthonormal frame of the coordinates of the geo projection <i>proj</i>, at geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoGridVector[<i>loc</i>{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},<i>proj</i>] represents a three-dimensional vector of horizontal components <i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub> and vertical component <i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub> at geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoGridVector[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>proj</i>] represents a collection of vectors <i>vec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at respective geo locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoGridVector[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>proj</i>] represents the same collection of vectors.

GeoGridVector[<i>vec</i>,<i>proj</i>] represents a geo vector whose associated location has been implicitly specified.

---

GeoGroup
GeoGroup[<i>geoobjects</i>] represents a list of geographic objects to be treated as a single object for certain operations.

---

GeoHemisphere
GeoHemisphere[] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the half of the Earth centered at your current geo location.

GeoHemisphere[<i>loc</i>] represents the half of the Earth centered at the location <i>loc</i>.

---

GeoHemisphereBoundary
GeoHemisphereBoundary[] is a one-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the boundary line of a hemisphere of the Earth centered at the current geo location.

GeoHemisphereBoundary[<i>loc</i>] represents the boundary line of a hemisphere centered at the location <i>loc</i>.

---

GeoHistogram
GeoHistogram[<i>locs</i>] plots a density histogram of the geographic locations <i>locs</i>.

GeoHistogram[<i>locs</i>,<i>bspec</i>] plots a density histogram with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

GeoHistogram[<i>locs</i>,<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a density histogram with bin densities computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

---

GeoIdentify
GeoIdentify[<i>enttype</i>] identifies the geographic entities of the type <i>enttype</i> in which the current geo location is contained.

GeoIdentify[<i>enttype</i>,<i>loc</i>] identifies the entities in which the location <i>loc</i> is contained.

GeoIdentify[] identifies the entities of any type in which the current geo location is contained.

---

GeoImage
GeoImage[<i>reg</i>] gives a satellite image of the geo region <i>reg</i>.

GeoImage[<i>reg</i>,<i>mapstyle</i>] gives an image of the geo region <i>reg</i> with style <i>mapstyle</i>.

---

GeoLabels
GeoLabels is an option for GeoListPlot and GeoRegionValuePlot that specifies whether and how to add labels to the locations in the first argument.

---

GeoLength
GeoLength[<i>g</i>] gives the length of the geo path <i>g</i>.

---

GeoListPlot
GeoListPlot[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a map on which the locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are indicated.

GeoListPlot[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…}]  generates a map showing several lists of locations.

---

GeoLocation
GeoLocation is an option for Interpreter and related functions that specifies the location to assume for semantic interpretation.

---

GeologicalPeriodData
GeologicalPeriodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the geological period <i>entity</i>.

GeologicalPeriodData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified period name entities.

GeologicalPeriodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

GeomagneticModelData
GeomagneticModelData[] returns the current magnetic field data for the current location.

GeomagneticModelData[<i>locationspec</i>] returns the current magnetic field data for a location.

GeomagneticModelData[<i>datespec</i>] returns the magnetic field data for the specified time for the current location.

GeomagneticModelData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] returns the magnetic field data for the specified time and location.

GeomagneticModelData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>component</i>] returns the component of the magnetic field for the specified time and location.

---

GeoMarker
GeoMarker[] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents a marker at the current $GeoLocation.

GeoMarker[<i>loc</i>] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents a marker at the location <i>loc</i>.

GeoMarker[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents markers at locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoMarker[<i>loc</i>,<i>marker</i>] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents a custom marker at the location <i>loc</i>.

GeoMarker[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>marker</i>] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents custom markers at locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeometricAssertion
GeometricAssertion[<i>obj</i>,<i>prop</i>] represents the assertion that the geometric object <i>obj</i> satisfies <i>prop</i>.

GeometricAssertion[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>prop</i>] represents the assertion that the <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> satisfy <i>prop</i>.

GeometricAssertion[<i>objs</i>,<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the assertion that <i>objs</i> satisfies each of the <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeometricBrownianMotionProcess
GeometricBrownianMotionProcess[μ,σ,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents a geometric Brownian motion process with drift μ, volatility σ, and initial value <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

GeometricDistribution
GeometricDistribution[<i>p</i>] represents a geometric distribution with probability parameter <i>p</i>. 

---

GeometricMean
GeometricMean[<i>data</i>] gives the geometric mean of the values in <i>data</i>.

---

GeometricScene
GeometricScene[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>hyp</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>hyp</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an abstract 2D geometric scene defined by the hypotheses <i>hyp</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in terms of the symbolic points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeometricScene[{{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}},<i>hyps</i>] represents a scene whose hypotheses depend on the symbolic scalar quantities <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeometricScene[{{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},…},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},<i>hyps</i>] represents a specific instance with explicit values for all points and scalar quantities.

GeometricScene[<i>params</i>,<i>hyps</i>,{<i>con</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>con</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a scene together with some conclusions <i>con</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> about it.

GeometricScene[{{{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},…},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},…},<i>hyps</i>] represents a collection of specific instances of the same scene.

GeometricScene[{<i>scene</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>scene</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] combines several scene instances into one scene object.

---

GeometricStep
GeometricStep[{<i>hyp</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>hyp</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a symbolic representation of a step in the definition of a geometric scene, in which the hypotheses <i>hyp</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are introduced. 

GeometricStep[<i>hyps</i>,<i>label</i>] labels the step with <i>label</i> when displaying an instance of the geometric scene.

---

GeometricTest
GeometricTest[<i>obj</i>,<i>prop</i>] tests whether the geometric object <i>obj</i> satisfies <i>prop</i>.

GeometricTest[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>prop</i>] tests whether the <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> satisfy <i>prop</i>.

GeometricTest[<i>objs</i>,<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…] tests whether <i>objs</i> satisfy each of the <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeometricTransformation
GeometricTransformation[<i>g</i>,<i>tfun</i>] represents the result of applying the transformation function <i>tfun</i> to the geometric objects corresponding to the primitives <i>g</i>.

GeometricTransformation[<i>g</i>,<i>m</i>] transforms geometric objects in <i>g</i> by effectively replacing every point <i>r</i> by <i>m</i>.<i>r</i>. 

GeometricTransformation[<i>g</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>v</i>}] effectively replaces every point <i>r</i> by <i>m</i>.<i>r</i>+<i>v</i>.

GeometricTransformation[<i>g</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents multiple copies of <i>g</i> transformed by a collection of transformations.

---

GeoModel
GeoModel is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies the reference body or model for it for the purposes of geodetic computations and map drawing.

---

GeoNearest
GeoNearest[<i>enttype</i>,<i>loc</i>] returns the geographic entity of type <i>enttype</i> closest to the geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoNearest[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>reg</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>loc</i>] returns the nearest of the <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoNearest[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>reg</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>loc</i>] returns the <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the nearest <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoNearest[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>reg</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>loc</i>] returns the same result.

GeoNearest[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>reg</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}Automatic,<i>loc</i>] takes the <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to be successive integers <i>i</i>. 

GeoNearest[<i>spec</i>,<i>loc</i>,<i>n</i>] returns <i>n</i> nearest values.

GeoNearest[<i>spec</i>,<i>loc</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>}] returns up to <i>n</i> matches within a radius <i>r</i> of <i>loc</i>.

---

GeoOrientationData
GeoOrientationData[<i>date</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the value of the property <i>prop</i> about the orientation of the Earth on the given date.

GeoOrientationData[<i>date</i>,<i>prop</i>,"<i>variant</i>"] gives the specified variant of the property <i>prop</i> on the given date.

---

GeoPath
GeoPath[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>pathtype</i>] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents a path of type <i>pathtype</i> between locations <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>.

GeoPath[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>pathtype</i>] represents a path formed by joining paths of type <i>pathtype</i> between consecutive locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoPath[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i>,α},<i>pathtype</i>] represents a path moving from location <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> a distance <i>d</i> with initial bearing α.

GeoPath[{{<i>loc</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>loc</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…},<i>pathtype</i>] represents a disjoint collection of paths of type <i>pathtype</i>.

---

GeoPolygon
GeoPolygon[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] is a GeoGraphics primitive that represents a filled polygon whose boundary is formed by geodesic segments between locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i>+1</sub>.

GeoPolygon[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>q</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},…}] represents a geo polygon with holes {<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>q</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}, ….

GeoPolygon[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of polygons <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoPolygon[<i>{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…}</i>,<i>sideness</i>] specifies which of the two sides of each boundary <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is in the interior of the geo polygon.

GeoPolygon[<i>polys</i>,<i>sideness</i>,<i>pathtype</i>] represents a geo polygon whose boundary is formed by geo paths of type <i>pathtype</i>.

---

GeoPosition
GeoPosition[{<i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i>}] represents a geodetic position with latitude <i>lat</i> and longitude <i>lon</i>.

GeoPosition[{<i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i>,<i>h</i>}] represents a geodetic position with height <i>h</i> relative to the reference ellipsoid.

GeoPosition[{<i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i>,<i>h</i>},<i>datum</i>] represents a geodetic position referring to the specified datum.

GeoPosition[{{<i>lat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>lat</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lon</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>datum</i>] represents an array of geodetic positions.

GeoPosition[<i>entity</i>] returns the geodetic position of the specified geographical entity.

---

GeoPositionENU
GeoPositionENU[{<i>east</i>,<i>north</i>,<i>up</i>},<i>p</i>]  represents a position with local Cartesian coordinates {<i>east</i>,<i>north</i>,<i>up</i>} in a reference system centered at the position <i>p</i>.

GeoPositionENU[{{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>p</i>] represents an array of positions.

GeoPositionENU[<i>entity</i>,<i>p</i>] returns the Cartesian position with respect to <i>p</i> of the specified geographical entity.

---

GeoPositionXYZ
GeoPositionXYZ[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}] represents a position in a Cartesian geocentric coordinate system.

GeoPositionXYZ[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},<i>datum</i>] represents a point referred to the specified datum.

GeoPositionXYZ[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>datum</i>] represents an array of points in a Cartesian geocentric coordinate system.

GeoPositionXYZ[<i>entity</i>] returns the Cartesian geocentric position of the given geographical entity.

---

GeoProjection
GeoProjection is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies the cartographic projection to use for the map.

---

GeoProjectionData
GeoProjectionData["<i>projection</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the specified cartographic projection.

GeoProjectionData["<i>projection</i>"] gives the complete options for the default form of the specified projection.

---

GeoRange
GeoRange is an option for geographic functions that specifies the range of latitude and longitude to include. 

---

GeoRangePadding
GeoRangePadding is an option for GeoGraphics that specifies what padding to use when extending beyond the original ranges of latitude and longitude.

---

GeoRegionValuePlot
GeoRegionValuePlot[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a plot in which the geographic regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are colored according to the values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoRegionValuePlot[<i>regions</i><i>values</i>] uses a collection of regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>regions</i> with corresponding values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>values</i>.

GeoRegionValuePlot[<i>region</i><i>prop</i>] generates a plot in which the geographic subdivisions in <i>region</i> are colored according to the values EntityValue[…,<i>prop</i>].

GeoRegionValuePlot[<i>data</i>] generates a plot using the data available in <i>data</i>.

---

GeoResolution
GeoResolution is an option for geographic functions that specifies an average distance between neighboring pixels in the resulting map.

---

GeoScaleBar
GeoScaleBar is an option for GeoGraphics that determines what scale to show on the map.

---

GeoServer
GeoServer is an option for GeoGraphics, GeoStyling and GeoImage that specifies the URL address of a geo server and connection parameters to download map tiles and geo elevation data.

---

GeoSmoothHistogram
GeoSmoothHistogram[<i>locs</i>] plots a smooth kernel histogram of the geo locations <i>locs</i>.

GeoSmoothHistogram[<i>locs</i>,<i>espec</i>] plots a smooth kernel histogram with estimator specification <i>espec</i>.

GeoSmoothHistogram[<i>locs</i>,<i>espec</i>,<i>dfun</i>] plots the distribution function <i>dfun</i>.

---

GeoStreamPlot
GeoStreamPlot[<i>vecs</i>] generates a stream plot from the field of geo vectors <i>vecs</i>.

GeoStreamPlot[{<i>vecs</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vecs</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a separate set of streams for each <i>vecs</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeoStyling
GeoStyling[<i>mapstyle</i>] displays faces of polygons and other filled geo objects using <i>mapstyle</i>.

GeoStyling[<i>mapstyle</i>,<i>directive</i>] uses <i>mapstyle</i><i> </i>with the given graphics <i>directive</i><i> </i>applied.

---

GeoStylingImageFunction
GeoStylingImageFunction is an option for specifying an image effect to apply to a geo style.

---

GeoVariant
GeoVariant[<i>obj</i>,<i>qual</i>] represents a geographic object <i>obj</i> with qualifier <i>qual</i>.

---

GeoVector
GeoVector[<i>loc</i>{<i>m</i>,α}] represents a horizontal two-dimensional vector of magnitude <i>m</i> and bearing α at geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoVector[<i>loc</i>{<i>m</i>,α,<i>w</i>}] represents a three-dimensional vector of horizontal modulus <i>m</i>, bearing α and vertical component <i>w</i> at geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoVector[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of vectors <i>vec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at respective geo locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoVector[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the same collection of vectors.

GeoVector[<i>vec</i>] represents a geo vector whose associated location has been implicitly specified.

---

GeoVectorENU
GeoVectorENU[<i>loc</i>{<i>v</i><sub><i>e</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a horizontal two-dimensional vector of components <i>v</i><sub><i>e</i></sub> and <i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> in an orthonormal frame tangent to the Earth at geo location <i>loc</i>.

GeoVectorENU[<i>loc</i>{<i>v</i><sub><i>e</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>u</i></sub>}] represents a three-dimensional vector of horizontal components <i>v</i><sub><i>e</i></sub> and <i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>, and vertical component <i>v</i><sub><i>u</i></sub> at geo location <i>loc</i>. 

GeoVectorENU[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of vectors <i>vec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at respective geo locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoVectorENU[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the same collection of vectors.

GeoVectorENU[<i>vec</i>] represents a geo vector whose associated location has been implicitly specified.

---

GeoVectorPlot
GeoVectorPlot[<i>vecs</i>] generates a vector plot from the field of geo vectors <i>vecs</i>.

GeoVectorPlot[{<i>vecs</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vecs</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a separate set of vectors for each <i>vecs</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeoVectorXYZ
GeoVectorXYZ[<i>loc</i>{<i>v</i><sub><i>X</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>Y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>Z</i></sub>}] represents a three-dimensional vector of Cartesian components <i>v</i><sub><i>X</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>Y</i></sub>, <i>v</i><sub><i>Z</i></sub> in an orthonormal frame parallel to the geocentric frame, at location <i>loc</i>.

GeoVectorXYZ[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of vectors <i>vec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at respective geo locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GeoVectorXYZ[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>vec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>vec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the same collection of vectors.

GeoVectorXYZ[<i>vec</i>] represents a geo vector whose associated location has been implicitly specified.

---

GeoVisibleRegion
GeoVisibleRegion[{<i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i>,<i>h</i>}] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the region on the surface of the Earth visible from the point of coordinates <i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i> and height <i>h</i> above the reference ellipsoid.

GeoVisibleRegion[<i>pos</i>] represents the region visible from the position <i>pos</i>.

GeoVisibleRegion[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the collection of regions visible from the positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeoVisibleRegionBoundary
GeoVisibleRegionBoundary[{<i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i>,<i>h</i>}] is a one-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the boundary of the region on the surface of the Earth visible from the point of coordinates <i>lat</i>,<i>lon</i> and height <i>h</i> above the reference ellipsoid.

GeoVisibleRegionBoundary[<i>pos</i>] represents the boundary of the region visible from the position <i>pos</i>.

GeoVisibleRegionBoundary[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the collection of boundaries of the regions visible from the positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

GeoWithinQ
GeoWithinQ[<i>reg</i>,<i>loc</i>] returns True if the location <i>loc</i> is contained within the region <i>reg</i>, and False otherwise.

GeoWithinQ[<i>reg</i>] represents an operator form of GeoWithinQ that can be applied to a location.

---

GeoZoomLevel
GeoZoomLevel is an option for specifying the resolution at which to render a map.

---

GestureHandler
GestureHandler[<i>expr</i>,{<i>gesture</i><sub>1</sub><i>fun</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>gesture</i><sub>2</sub><i>fun</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] displays as <i>expr</i>, evaluating <i>fun</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>value</i>,<i>velocity</i>] whenever "<i>gesture</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" occurs within the screen space occupied by <i>expr</i>.

GestureHandler[<i>expr</i>,{"<i>gesture</i>"{<i>fun</i>,<i>fun</i><sub><i>end</i></sub>},…}] evaluates <i>fun</i> as updates are received for "<i>gesture</i>", followed by <i>fun</i><sub><i>end</i></sub>[<i>value</i>,<i>velocity</i>] when the gesture ends.

GestureHandler[<i>expr</i>,{"<i>gesture</i>"{<i>fun</i><sub><i>start</i></sub>,<i>fun</i>,<i>fun</i><sub><i>end</i></sub>},…}] also evaluates <i>f</i><sub><i>start</i></sub>[<i>value</i>,<i>velocity</i>] when "<i>gesture</i>" begins.

---

Get
<<<i>name</i> reads in a file, evaluating each expression in it and returning the last one. 

Get[<i>stream</i>] reads from a stream, evaluating each expression in it and returning the last one.

Get["<i>file</i>","<i>key</i>"] reads a file that has been encoded using Encode["<i>source</i>","<i>file</i>","<i>key</i>"].

---

GetContext
GetContext["<i>context`</i>"] loads the file named by ContextToFileName["<i>context`</i>"], which gives the conventional filename for a package that defines "<i>context`</i>".

---

GetEnvironment
GetEnvironment["<i>var</i>"] gives the setting corresponding to the variable "<i>var</i>" in the operating system environment.

GetEnvironment[{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of rules, corresponding to specified environment variables.

GetEnvironment[] gives information about all existing settings in the operating system environment.

---

Glaisher
Glaisher is Glaisher's constant with numerical value ≃1.28243. 

---

GlobalClusteringCoefficient
GlobalClusteringCoefficient[<i>g</i>] gives the global clustering coefficient of the graph <i>g</i>.

GlobalClusteringCoefficient[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Glow
Glow[<i>col</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that surfaces of 3D graphics objects that follow are to be taken to glow with color <i>col</i>. 

Glow[] specifies that there is no glow. 

---

GoldenAngle
GoldenAngle is the golden angle (3-@5) π, with numerical value ≃137.5°.

---

GoldenRatio
GoldenRatio is the golden ratio ϕ1/2 (@5+1), with numerical value ≃1.61803.

---

GompertzMakehamDistribution
GompertzMakehamDistribution[λ,ξ] represents a Gompertz distribution with scale parameter λ and frailty parameter ξ.

GompertzMakehamDistribution[λ,ξ,θ,α] represents a Gompertz–Makeham distribution with parameters λ, ξ, θ, and α.

---

GoochShading
GoochShading[] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that surfaces that follow are to be drawn with a warm color facing toward the light and a cool color facing away.

GoochShading[<i>col</i>] uses cool and warm colors obtained by blending <i>col</i> with slate Blue and Orange.

GoochShading[{<i>ccol</i>,<i>wcol</i>}] uses the cool color <i>ccol</i> and the warm color <i>wcol</i>.

GoochShading[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>}{<i>ccol</i>,<i>wcol</i>}] uses the colors <i>ccol</i> and <i>wcol</i> weighted by the <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GoochShading["<i>scheme</i>"] uses the specified gradient color scheme in ColorData.

---

GoodmanKruskalGammaTest
GoodmanKruskalGammaTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

GoodmanKruskalGammaTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Goto
Goto[<i>tag</i>] scans for Label[<i>tag</i>], and transfers control to that point. 

---

Grad
Grad[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the gradient (∂f/∂x<sub>1</sub>,…,∂f/∂x<sub>n</sub>).

Grad[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] gives the gradient in the coordinates <i>chart</i>.

---

Gradient
Gradient is an option for FindMinimum and related functions that specifies the gradient vector to assume for the function being extremized.

---

GradientFilter
GradientFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the magnitude of the gradient of <i>data</i>, computed using discrete derivatives of a Gaussian of sample radius <i>r</i>.

GradientFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i>,σ}] uses a Gaussian with standard deviation σ.

GradientFilter[<i>data</i>,{{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] uses a Gaussian with radius <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i> in <i>data</i>.

---

GradientFittedMesh
GradientFittedMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a MeshRegion whose gradient best fits the normals at points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

GradientOrientationFilter
GradientOrientationFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the local orientation parallel to the gradient of <i>data</i>, computed using discrete derivatives of a Gaussian of pixel radius <i>r</i>, returning values between -π/2 and π/2.

GradientOrientationFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i>,σ}] uses a Gaussian with standard deviation σ.

---

GrammarApply
GrammarApply[<i>grammar</i>,<i>input</i>] attempts to parse <i>input</i> according to the grammar defined by <i>grammar</i>.

---

GrammarToken
GrammarToken[<i>form</i>] is a grammar rules pattern object that represents any input of the specified form. 

---

Graph
Graph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

Graph[{<i><i>v</i><sub>1</sub></i>,<i><i>v</i><sub>2</sub></i>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>. 

Graph[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] yields a graph with vertex and edge properties defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

Graph[<i>data</i>] yields a graph from <i>data</i>.

---

Graph3D
Graph3D[<i>g</i>] creates a graph with vertices and edges from the graph <i>g</i> and represented as a 3D plot.

Graph3D[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> and represented as a 3D plot.

Graph3D[{<i><i>v</i><sub>1</sub></i>,<i><i>v</i><sub>2</sub></i>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>. 

---

GraphAssortativity
GraphAssortativity[<i>g</i>] gives the assortativity coefficient of a graph <i>g</i> using vertex degrees.

GraphAssortativity[<i>g</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the assortativity coefficient of the graph <i>g</i> using vertex property "<i>prop</i>".

GraphAssortativity[<i>g</i>,{{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>2</sub>,…},…}] gives the assortativity coefficient of the graph <i>g</i> with respect to the vertex partition {{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>2</sub>,…},…}.

GraphAssortativity[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the assortativity coefficient of the graph <i>g</i> using data {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} for vertices {<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

GraphAssortativity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

GraphAutomorphismGroup
GraphAutomorphismGroup[<i>g</i>] gives the automorphism group of a graph <i>g</i>.

GraphAutomorphismGroup[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphCenter
GraphCenter[<i>g</i>] gives the set of vertices with minimum eccentricity in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphCenter[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphComplement
GraphComplement[<i>g</i>] gives the graph complement of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphComplement[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphData
GraphData[<i>name</i>] gives a graph with the specified name.

GraphData[<i>entity</i>] gives the graph corresponding to the graph <i>entity</i>.

GraphData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the <i>property</i> for the specified graph <i>entity</i>.

GraphData[<i>class</i>] gives a list of available named graphs in the specified graph <i>class</i>.

GraphData[<i>n</i>] gives a list of available named graphs with <i>n</i> vertices.

---

GraphDensity
GraphDensity[<i>g</i>] gives the graph density of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDensity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphDiameter
GraphDiameter[<i>g</i>] gives the greatest distance between any pair of vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDiameter[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphDifference
GraphDifference[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph difference of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

GraphDifference[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphDisjointUnion
GraphDisjointUnion[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph disjoint union of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

GraphDisjointUnion[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the disjoint union of <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

GraphDisjointUnion[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphDistance
GraphDistance[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the distance from source vertex <i>s</i> to target vertex <i>t</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDistance[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the distance from <i>s</i> to all vertices of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDistance[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphDistanceMatrix
GraphDistanceMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the matrix of distances between vertices for the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDistanceMatrix[<i>g</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the matrix of distances between vertices of maximal distance <i>d</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphDistanceMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphEmbedding
GraphEmbedding[<i>g</i>] gives coordinates of the vertices of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphEmbedding[<i>g</i>,"<i>emb</i>"] gives coordinates of the vertices of the graph <i>g</i> using the embedding "<i>emb</i>".

GraphEmbedding[<i>g</i>,"<i>emb</i>",<i>dim</i>] gives coordinates in dimension <i>dim</i> of the vertices of the graph <i>g</i> using the embedding "<i>emb</i>".

---

GraphHighlight
GraphHighlight is an option to Graph and related objects that specifies graph elements to highlight. 

---

GraphHighlightStyle
GraphHighlightStyle is an option to Graph and related objects that specifies styles to use for highlighted graph elements. 

---

GraphHub
GraphHub[<i>g</i>] gives the set of vertices with maximum vertex degree in the underlying simple graph of <i>g</i>.

GraphHub[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives the set of vertices with maximum vertex in-degree.

GraphHub[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives the set of vertices with maximum vertex out-degree.

GraphHub[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Graphics
Graphics[<i>primitives</i>,<i>options</i>] represents a two-dimensional graphical image. 

---

Graphics3D
Graphics3D[<i>primitives</i>,<i>options</i>] represents a three-dimensional graphical image. 

---

GraphicsArray
GraphicsArray[{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a row of graphics objects.

GraphicsArray[{{<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…}] represents a two-dimensional array of graphical objects.

---

GraphicsColumn
GraphicsColumn[{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a graphic in which the <i>g</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are laid out in a column, with <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> above <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

GraphicsColumn[<i>list</i>,<i>alignment</i>] aligns each element horizontally in the specified way. 

GraphicsColumn[<i>list</i>,<i>alignment</i>,<i>spacing</i>] leaves the specified spacing between successive elements.

---

GraphicsComplex
GraphicsComplex[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>data</i>] represents a graphics complex in which coordinates given as integers <i>i</i> in graphics primitives in <i>data</i> are taken to be <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

GraphicsGrid
GraphicsGrid[{{<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…}] generates a graphic in which the <i>g</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> are laid out in a two-dimensional grid.

---

GraphicsGroup
GraphicsGroup[{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of graphics objects grouped together for purposes of interactive selection in a notebook. 

---

GraphicsRow
GraphicsRow[{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a graphic in which the <i>g</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are laid out in a row.

GraphicsRow[<i>list</i>,<i>spacing</i>] leaves the specified spacing between successive elements.

---

GraphicsSpacing
GraphicsSpacing is an option for GraphicsArray that specifies the spacing between elements in the array. 

---

GraphIntersection
GraphIntersection[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph intersection of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

GraphIntersection[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the graph intersection of <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

GraphIntersection[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphLayers
GraphLayers is an option for LayeredGraphPlot3D and related functions that specifies layers to draw on the plot.

---

GraphLayerStyle
GraphLayerStyle is an option for LayeredGraphPlot3D and related functions that specifies the style in which to draw a layer on the plot.

---

GraphLayout
GraphLayout is an option to Graph and related functions that specifies what layout to use.

---

GraphLinkEfficiency
GraphLinkEfficiency[<i>g</i>] gives the link efficiency of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphLinkEfficiency[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphPeriphery
GraphPeriphery[<i>g</i>] gives vertices that are maximally distant to at least one vertex in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPeriphery[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphPlot
GraphPlot[<i>g</i>] generates a plot of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPlot[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a plot of the graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GraphPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

GraphPlot[{<i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub></i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>ik</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>jk</i></sub> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPlot[<i>m</i>] uses the adjacency matrix <i>m</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphPlot3D
GraphPlot3D[<i>g</i>] generates a 3D plot of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPlot3D[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a 3D plot of the graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

GraphPlot3D[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i><i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub></i> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

GraphPlot3D[{<i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub></i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>ik</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>jk</i></sub> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPlot3D[<i>m</i>] uses the adjacency matrix <i>m</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphPower
GraphPower[<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the graph-<i>n</i><sup>th</sup> power of the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphPower[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphPropertyDistribution
GraphPropertyDistribution[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>gdist</i>] represents the distribution of the property <i>expr</i> where the random variable <i>x</i> follows the graph distribution <i>gdist</i>.

GraphPropertyDistribution[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>gdist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>gdist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the distribution where <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the graph distributions <i>gdist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>gdist</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

GraphQ
GraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if <i>g</i> is a valid Graph object and False otherwise.

---

GraphRadius
GraphRadius[<i>g</i>] gives the minimum eccentricity of the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

GraphRadius[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphReciprocity
GraphReciprocity[<i>g</i>] gives the reciprocity of a graph <i>g</i>.

GraphReciprocity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

GraphStyle
GraphStyle is an option to Graph and related objects that specifies styles to use for the different graph elements. 

---

GraphTree
GraphTree[<i>g</i>] constructs a tree from the tree graph <i>g</i>.

GraphTree[<i>g</i>,<i>root</i>] specifies what vertex to use as the root.

GraphTree[<i>g</i>,<i>root</i>,<i>h</i>] applies <i>h</i> to each vertex to get the corresponding data and ordering of subtrees.

---

GraphUnion
GraphUnion[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph union of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

GraphUnion[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the graph union of <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

GraphUnion[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Gray
Gray represents the color gray in graphics or style specifications. 

---

GrayLevel
GrayLevel[<i>g</i>] represents a color in the grayscale color space with gray level <i>g</i>.

GrayLevel[<i>g</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

GrayLevel["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

GrayLevel[<i>color</i>] returns the grayscale representation of <i>color</i>.

---

Greater
<i>x</i>><i>y</i> yields True if x is determined to be greater than y. 

<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>><i>x</i><sub>2</sub>><i>x</i><sub>3</sub> yields True if the x<sub>i</sub> form a strictly decreasing sequence. 

---

GreaterEqual
<i>x</i>>=<i>y</i> or <i>x</i>≥<i>y</i> yields True if x is determined to be greater than or equal to y. 

<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>≥<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>≥<i>x</i><sub>3</sub> yields True if the x<sub>i</sub> form a nonincreasing sequence. 

---

GreaterEqualLess
GreaterEqualLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⋛y⋛….

---

GreaterEqualThan
GreaterEqualThan[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x≥y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

GreaterFullEqual
GreaterFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≧y≧….

---

GreaterGreater
GreaterGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≫y≫….

---

GreaterLess
GreaterLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≷y≷….

---

GreaterSlantEqual
GreaterSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⩾y⩾….

---

GreaterThan
GreaterThan[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x</i>><i>y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

GreaterTilde
GreaterTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≳y≳….

---

Green
Green represents the color green in graphics or style specifications. 

---

GreenFunction
GreenFunction[{ℒ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>]],ℬ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>]]},<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>y</i>] gives a Green's function for the linear differential operator ℒ with boundary conditions ℬ in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

GreenFunction[{ℒ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…]],ℬ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…]]},<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}∈Ω,{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a Green's function for the linear partial differential operator ℒ over the region Ω.

GreenFunction[{ℒ[<i>u</i>[<i>x,t</i>]],ℬ[<i>u</i>[<i>x,t</i>]]},<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>t</i>,{<i>y,τ</i>}] gives a Green's function for the linear time-dependent operator ℒ in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

GreenFunction[{ℒ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>t</i>]],ℬ[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i><i>,</i><i>t</i>]]},<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…}∈Ω,<i>t</i>,{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…,τ}] gives a Green's function for the linear time-dependent operator ℒ over the region Ω.

---

Grid
Grid[{{<i>expr</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>expr</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] is an object that formats with the <i>expr</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> arranged in a two-dimensional grid. 

---

GridFrame
GridFrame is an option for grids that specifies whether a surrounding frame is drawn.

---

GridFrameMargins
GridFrameMargins is an option for grids that specifies the spacing between the content of the grid and the frame surrounding it.

---

GridGraph
GridGraph[{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives the grid graph with <i>m</i>×<i>n</i> vertices G<sub>m,n</sub>.

GridGraph[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives the k-dimensional grid graph with <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×⋯×<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> vertices G<sub>n<sub>1</sub>,n<sub>2</sub>,…,n<sub>k</sub></sub>.

---

GridLines
GridLines is an option for two-dimensional graphics functions that specifies grid lines. 

---

GridLinesStyle
GridLinesStyle is an option for 2D graphics functions that specifies how grid lines should be rendered.

---

GridVideo
GridVideo[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a video in which each frame is a grid of frames of all <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the corresponding time.

GridVideo[{{<i>v</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…}] uses the array position of each video <i>v</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to create the video grid.

---

GroebnerBasis
GroebnerBasis[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of polynomials that form a Gröbner basis for the set of polynomials <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

GroebnerBasis[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a Gröbner basis in which the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> have been eliminated. 

---

GroupActionBase
GroupActionBase is an option to specify a base for a group.

---

GroupBy
GroupBy[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] gives an association that groups the <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> into lists associated with distinct keys <i>f</i>[<i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>].

GroupBy[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub><i>k</i></sub><i>f</i><sub><i>v</i></sub>] groups the <i>f</i><sub><i>v</i></sub>[<i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] according to the <i>f</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>[<i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>].

GroupBy[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>fs</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fs</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] groups into nested associations using <i>fs</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i>.

GroupBy[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>,<i>red</i>] applies the function <i>red</i> to reduce lists of values that are generated.

GroupBy[<i>spec</i>] represents an operator form of GroupBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

GroupCentralizer
GroupCentralizer[<i>group</i>,<i>g</i>] returns the centralizer of the element <i>g</i> in <i>group</i>.

---

GroupElementFromWord
GroupElementFromWord[<i>group</i>,<i>w</i>] returns the element of <i>group</i> determined by the word <i>w</i> in the generators of <i>group</i>.

---

GroupElementPosition
GroupElementPosition[<i>group</i>,<i>g</i>] returns the position of the element <i>g</i> in the list of elements of <i>group</i>.

GroupElementPosition[<i>group</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the list of positions of the elements <i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> in <i>group</i>.

---

GroupElementQ
GroupElementQ[<i>group</i>,<i>g</i>] returns True if the object <i>g</i> is an element of <i>group</i> and False otherwise.

---

GroupElements
GroupElements[<i>group</i>] returns the list of all elements of <i>group</i>.

GroupElements[<i>group</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] returns the elements numbered <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> in <i>group</i> in the standard order.

---

GroupElementToWord
GroupElementToWord[<i>group</i>,<i>g</i>] decomposes the group element <i>g</i> as a product of generators of <i>group</i>.

---

GroupGenerators
GroupGenerators[<i>group</i>] returns a list of generators of <i>group</i>. 

---

Groupings
Groupings[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a list of all possible groupings of 1,…,<i>n</i> taken <i>k</i> at a time. 

Groupings[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>k</i>] gives all possible groupings of <i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> taken <i>k</i> at a time.

Groupings[{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…},<i>k</i>] gives the combination of all possible groupings of each of the lists <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,… taken <i>k</i> at a time.

Groupings[<i>aspec</i>,<i>f</i><i>k</i>] gives all possible groupings of <i>aspec</i> taken <i>k</i> at a time with the function <i>f</i> applied at each level. 

Groupings[<i>aspec</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub><i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub><i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives all possible groupings in which the function <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is applied to <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements. 

Groupings[<i>aspec</i>,{{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub><i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>f</i><sub>2</sub><i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] allows at most <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> occurrences in a given grouping of <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> applied to <i>k</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements.

Groupings[<i>aspec</i>,<i>kspec</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the function <i>h</i> around each grouping generated.

---

GroupMultiplicationTable
GroupMultiplicationTable[<i>group</i>] gives the multiplication table of <i>group</i> as an array.

---

GroupOrbits
GroupOrbits[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] returns the orbits of the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> under the action of the elements of <i>group</i>.

GroupOrbits[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] finds the orbits under the group action given by a function <i>f</i>.

---

GroupOrder
GroupOrder[<i>group</i>] returns the number of elements of <i>group</i>.

---

GroupPageBreakWithin
GroupPageBreakWithin is an option for Cell that specifies whether a page break should be allowed within the group of cells if the notebook that contains the group is printed. 

---

GroupSetwiseStabilizer
GroupSetwiseStabilizer[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the subgroup of <i>group</i> for which the images of the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are still in the list {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

GroupSetwiseStabilizer[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>f</i>] returns the setwise stabilizer subgroup under the action given by the function <i>f</i>.

---

GroupStabilizer
GroupStabilizer[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the subgroup of elements of <i>group</i> that move none of the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, …, <i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

GroupStabilizer[<i>group</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>f</i>] returns the stabilizer subgroup under the action given by the function <i>f</i>.

---

GroupStabilizerChain
GroupStabilizerChain[<i>group</i>] returns a list of successive stabilizers in <i>group</i> of the points in a base of <i>group</i>.

---

GrowCutComponents
GrowCutComponents[<i>image</i>,{<i>marker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>marker</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a segmentation from <i>image</i> by growing each <i>marker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

GrowCutComponents[<i>video</i>,…] returns segmentation for each frame in <i>video</i>.

---

Gudermannian
Gudermannian[<i>z</i>] gives the Gudermannian function gd(z).

---

GuidedFilter
GuidedFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>guide</i>,<i>r</i>,ϵ] filters <i>image</i> using the guide image <i>guide</i> over range-<i>r</i> neighborhoods with pixel-value regularizer ϵ.

GuidedFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,ϵ] filters <i>image</i> so as to reduce noise, using <i>image</i> as the guide.

---

GumbelDistribution
GumbelDistribution[α,β] represents a Gumbel distribution with location parameter α and scale parameter β.

GumbelDistribution[] represents a Gumbel distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

HaarWavelet
HaarWavelet[] represents a Haar wavelet. 

---

HadamardMatrix
HadamardMatrix[<i>n</i>] returns an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Hadamard matrix.

---

HalfLine
HalfLine[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents the half-line from the point <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>. 

HalfLine[<i>p</i>,<i>v</i>] represents the half-line from the point <i>p</i> in the direction <i>v</i>. 

---

HalfNormalDistribution
HalfNormalDistribution[θ] represents a half-normal distribution with scale inversely proportional to parameter θ.

---

HalfPlane
HalfPlane[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>w</i>] represents the half-plane bounded by the line through <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>2</sub> and extended in the direction <i>w</i>.

HalfPlane[<i>p</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>w</i>] represents the half-plane bounded by the line through <i>p</i> along <i>v</i> and extended in the direction <i>w</i>. 

---

HalfSpace
HalfSpace[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents the half-space of points x such that n.(x-p)≤0.

HalfSpace[<i>n</i>,<i>c</i>] represents the half-space of points x such that n.x≤c. 

---

HalftoneShading
HalftoneShading[] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that surfaces that follow are to be drawn with a base pattern of dots.

HalftoneShading[<i>d</i>] uses the density <i>d</i> of shading.

HalftoneShading[<i>col</i>] uses dots with the specified color <i>col</i>.

HalftoneShading["<i>shape</i>"] uses the specified "<i>shape</i>" as base pattern. 

HalftoneShading[<i>d</i>,<i>col</i>,"<i>shape</i>"] uses a fixed pattern of "<i>shape</i>" with the specified color <i>col</i> and density <i>d</i>.

---

HamiltonianGraphQ
HamiltonianGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is Hamiltonian, and False otherwise.

---

HammingDistance
HammingDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Hamming distance between strings or vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

HammingDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Hamming distance between strings, vectors or biomolecular sequences <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

HammingWindow
HammingWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Hamming window function of <i>x</i>.

---

HandlerFunctions
HandlerFunctions is an option that specifies functions to apply when events are generated.

---

HandlerFunctionsKeys
HandlerFunctionsKeys is an option that specifies the content of associations to which to apply handler functions. 

---

HankelH1
HankelH1[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Hankel function of the first kind H<sub>n</sub><sup>(1)</sup>(z). 

---

HankelH2
HankelH2[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Hankel function of the second kind H<sub>n</sub><sup>(2)</sup>(z). 

---

HankelMatrix
HankelMatrix[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Hankel matrix with first row and first column being successive integers.

HankelMatrix[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Hankel matrix whose first column consists of entries <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

HankelMatrix[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…, <i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Hankel matrix with entries <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> down the first column, and <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> across the last row.

---

HankelTransform
HankelTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the Hankel transform of order 0 for <i>expr</i>.

HankelTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>s</i>,ν] gives the Hankel transform of order ν for <i>expr</i>.

---

HannPoissonWindow
HannPoissonWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Hann–Poisson window function of <i>x</i>.

HannPoissonWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

HannWindow
HannWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Hann window function of <i>x</i>.

HannWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

HaradaNortonGroupHN
HaradaNortonGroupHN[] represents the sporadic simple Harada–Norton group HN.

---

HararyGraph
HararyGraph[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] generates the minimal <i>k</i>-connected graph on <i>n</i> vertices H<sub>k,n</sub>.

---

HarmonicMean
HarmonicMean[<i>data</i>] gives the harmonic mean of the values in <i>data</i>.

---

HarmonicNumber
HarmonicNumber[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> harmonic number H<sub>n</sub>.

HarmonicNumber[<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the harmonic number H<sub>n</sub><sup>(r)</sup> of order <i>r</i>. 

---

Hash
Hash[<i>expr</i>] gives an integer hash code for the expression <i>expr</i>.

Hash[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>] gives an integer hash digest of the specified type for <i>expr</i>.

Hash[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>,"<i>format</i>"] gives a hash code in the specified format.

---

HatchFilling
HatchFilling[] is a two-dimensional graphics directive that specifies that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using closely spaced parallel lines. 

HatchFilling["<i>name</i>"] uses the specified line hatching "<i>name</i>".

HatchFilling[θ] draws parallel lines with an angle θ.

HatchFilling[θ,<i>r</i>] draws parallel lines with absolute thickness <i>r</i>. 

HatchFilling[θ,<i>r</i>,<i>d</i>] draws parallel lines with gaps of absolute thickness <i>d</i>. 

---

HatchShading
HatchShading[] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that objects that follow are to be drawn with closely spaced parallel lines.

HatchShading[<i>d</i>] uses the density <i>d</i> of shading.

HatchShading[<i>col</i>] uses lines with the specified color <i>col</i>. 

HatchShading[<i>d</i>,<i>col</i>] uses lines with the specified color <i>col</i> and density <i>d</i>.

---

Haversine
Haversine[<i>z</i>] gives the haversine function hav(z).

---

HazardFunction
HazardFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the hazard function for the distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at <i>x</i>.

HazardFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multivariate hazard function for the distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

HazardFunction[<i>dist</i>] gives the hazard function as a pure function.

---

Head
Head[<i>expr</i>] gives the head of <i>expr</i>. 

Head[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the result with <i>h</i>.

---

HeadCompose
HeadCompose[<i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>] gives <i>a</i>[<i>b</i>][<i>c</i>][<i>d</i>].

---

HeaderAlignment
HeaderAlignment is an option for Dataset that specifies how the contents of a header should be aligned within the available area in the header.

---

HeaderBackground
HeaderBackground is an option for Dataset that specifies what background color to use for row and column headers.

---

HeaderDisplayFunction
HeaderDisplayFunction is an option for Dataset that specifies a function to apply to headers before displaying them.

---

HeaderLines
HeaderLines is an option for SemanticImport and related functions that specifies how many of the initial rows should be considered part of a column header.

---

HeaderSize
HeaderSize is an option for Dataset that specifies the widths and heights of headers.

---

HeaderStyle
HeaderStyle is an option for Dataset that specifies the style to use for headers.

---

Heads
Heads is an option for functions which use level specifications that specifies whether heads of expressions should be included. 

---

HeatFluxValue
HeatFluxValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal heat flux boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatFluxValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal heat flux boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatInsulationValue
HeatInsulationValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal insulation boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatInsulationValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal insulation boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatOutflowValue
HeatOutflowValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal outflow boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatOutflowValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal outflow boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatRadiationValue
HeatRadiationValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal radiation boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatRadiationValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal radiation boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatSymmetryValue
HeatSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal symmetry boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal symmetry boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatTemperatureCondition
HeatTemperatureCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal surface boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatTemperatureCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal surface boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeatTransferPDEComponent
HeatTransferPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a heat transfer PDE term with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

HeatTransferValue
HeatTransferValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a thermal transfer boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

HeatTransferValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal transfer boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

HeavisideLambda
HeavisideLambda[<i>x</i>] represents the triangle distribution Λ(x) which is nonzero for x<1.

HeavisideLambda[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional triangle distribution Λ(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…) which is nonzero for x<sub>i</sub><1.

---

HeavisidePi
HeavisidePi[<i>x</i>] represents the box distribution Π(x), equal to 1 for x<1/2 and 0 for x>1/2.

HeavisidePi[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional box distribution Π(x<sub>1</sub>,x<sub>2</sub>,…) which is 1 if all x<sub>i</sub><1/2.

---

HeavisideTheta
HeavisideTheta[<i>x</i>] represents the Heaviside theta function θ(x), equal to 0 for x<0 and 1 for x>0. 

HeavisideTheta[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional Heaviside theta function, which is 1 only if all of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are positive. 

---

HeldGroupHe
HeldGroupHe[] represents the sporadic simple Held group He.

---

HelmholtzPDEComponent
HelmholtzPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a Helmholtz PDE term ∇<sup>2</sup><sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i><i>+</i><i>k</i><sup>2</sup>u with model variables <i>vars</i> and model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

HelpBrowserSettings
HelpBrowserSettings is a global option that specifies settings for the legacy Help Browser.

---

Here
Here represents the current deduced geo location.

---

HermiteDecomposition
HermiteDecomposition[<i>m</i>] gives the Hermite normal form decomposition of an integer matrix <i>m</i>.

---

HermiteH
HermiteH[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Hermite polynomial H<sub>n</sub>(x). 

---

Hermitian
Hermitian[{1,2}] represents the symmetry of a Hermitian matrix.

---

HermitianMatrixQ
HermitianMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly Hermitian, and False otherwise. 

---

HessenbergDecomposition
HessenbergDecomposition[<i>m</i>] gives the Hessenberg decomposition of a numerical matrix <i>m</i>.

---

HeunB
HeunB[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the bi-confluent Heun function. 

---

HeunBPrime
HeunBPrime[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the z-derivative of the HeunB function. 

---

HeunC
HeunC[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the confluent Heun function.

---

HeunCPrime
HeunCPrime[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the z-derivative of the HeunC function. 

---

HeunD
HeunD[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the double-confluent Heun function. 

---

HeunDPrime
HeunDPrime[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the z-derivative of the HeunD function. 

---

HeunG
HeunG[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,α,β,γ,δ,<i>z</i>] gives the general Heun function. 

---

HeunGPrime
HeunGPrime[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,α,β,γ,δ,<i>z</i>] gives the z-derivative of the HeunG function. 

---

HeunT
HeunT[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the tri-confluent Heun function. 

---

HeunTPrime
HeunTPrime[<i>q</i>,α,γ,δ,ϵ,<i>z</i>] gives the z-derivative of the HeunT function. 

---

HexadecimalCharacter
HexadecimalCharacter represents a hexadecimal digit character 0–9, a–f, A–F in StringExpression.

---

Hexahedron
Hexahedron[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub>8</sub>}] represents a filled hexahedron with corners <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, …, <i>p</i><sub>8</sub>.

Hexahedron[{{<i>p</i><sub>1,1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1,2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub>1,8</sub>},{<i>p</i><sub>2,1</sub>,…},…}] represents a collection of hexahedra.

---

HiddenItems
HiddenItems is an option for Dataset that specifies which items to hide.

---

HiddenMarkovProcess
HiddenMarkovProcess[<i>i</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>m</i>,<i>em</i>] represents a discrete-time, finite-state hidden Markov process with transition matrix <i>m</i>, emission matrix <i>em</i>, and initial hidden state <i>i</i><sub>0</sub>.

HiddenMarkovProcess[…,<i>m</i>,{<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents a hidden Markov process with emission distributions <i>dist</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

HiddenMarkovProcess[<i>p</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>m</i>,…] represents a hidden Markov process with initial hidden state probability vector <i>p</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

HiddenSurface
HiddenSurface is an option for SurfaceGraphics which specifies whether hidden surfaces are to be eliminated. 

---

Highlighted
Highlighted[<i>expr</i>] displays a highlighted version of <i>expr</i>.

Highlighted[<i>expr</i>,<i>effect</i>] uses the effect <i>effect</i> to highlight plot elements representing <i>expr</i>.

---

HighlightGraph
HighlightGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] highlights the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that can be vertices, edges, or subgraphs of <i>g</i>.

HighlightGraph[<i>g</i>,{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>a</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>],…}] highlights using the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

HighlightGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

HighlightImage
HighlightImage[<i>image</i>,<i>roi</i>] highlights the specified region of interest <i>roi</i> in <i>image</i>.

HighlightImage[<i>image</i>,{<i>roi</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>roi</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] highlights several regions of interest <i>roi</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

HighlightImage[<i>image</i>,{…,<i>w</i>[<i>roi</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] highlights using a feature defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

HighlightImage[<i>image</i>,<i>fg</i>,<i>bgstyle</i>] applies the styling <i>bgstyle</i> to the complement of all the regions of interest.

---

HighpassFilter
HighpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>] applies a highpass filter with a cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub> to an array of data.

HighpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

HighpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

HigmanSimsGroupHS
HigmanSimsGroupHS[] represents the sporadic simple Higman–Sims group HS.

---

HilbertCurve
HilbertCurve[<i>n</i>] gives the line segments representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Hilbert curve.

HilbertCurve[<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Hilbert curve in dimension <i>d</i>.

---

HilbertFilter
HilbertFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>] applies a Hilbert filter with a cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub> to an array of data.

HilbertFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

HilbertFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

HilbertMatrix
HilbertMatrix[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Hilbert matrix with elements of the form 1/(i+j-1).

HilbertMatrix[{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives the <i>m</i>×<i>n</i> Hilbert matrix.

---

Histogram
Histogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a histogram of the values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Histogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>bspec</i>] plots a histogram with bin width specification <i>bspec</i>.

Histogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a histogram with bin heights computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

Histogram[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Histogram3D
Histogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a 3D histogram of the values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

Histogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>bspec</i>] plots a 3D histogram with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

Histogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a 3D histogram with bin heights computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

Histogram3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots 3D histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

HistogramDistribution
HistogramDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the probability distribution corresponding to a histogram of the data values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

HistogramDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] represents a multivariate histogram distribution based on data values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…}.

HistogramDistribution[…,<i>bspec</i>] represents a histogram distribution with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

---

HistogramList
HistogramList[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of bins and histogram heights of the values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

HistogramList[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] gives a list of bins and histogram heights of the values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…}.

HistogramList[…,<i>bspec</i>] gives a list of bins and histogram heights with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

HistogramList[…,<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] gives a list of bins and histogram heights with bin heights computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

---

HistogramPointDensity
HistogramPointDensity[<i>pdata</i>] estimates the histogram point density function μ(x) for point data <i>pdata</i>. 

HistogramPointDensity[<i>pdata,bspec</i>] estimates the histogram point density function μ(x) with histogram bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

HistogramPointDensity[<i>bdata</i>,…,…] estimates the histogram point density function μ(x) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

HistogramPointDensity[<i>pproc</i>,…,…] computes the histogram point density function μ(x) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

---

HistogramTransform
HistogramTransform[<i>image</i>] transforms pixel values of <i>image</i> so that its histogram is nearly flat.

HistogramTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>ref</i>] modifies pixel values of <i>image</i> so that its histogram would have nearly the same distribution as <i>ref</i>.

HistogramTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>ref</i>,<i>n</i>] uses <i>n</i> equally spaced quantiles.

HistogramTransform[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] transforms values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

HistogramTransformInterpolation
HistogramTransformInterpolation[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] finds a function f so that the transformed values f(x<sub>i</sub>) are distributed nearly uniformly.

HistogramTransformInterpolation[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>ref</i>] finds f so that f(x<sub>i</sub>) are distributed with distribution <i>ref</i>.

HistogramTransformInterpolation[<i>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}</i>,<i>ref</i>,<i>n</i>] finds a function with <i>n</i> equally spaced quantiles.

HistogramTransformInterpolation[<i>image</i>,…] finds a function that reshapes the histogram of <i>image</i>.

---

HistoricalPeriodData
HistoricalPeriodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the historical period <i>entity</i>.

HistoricalPeriodData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified historical period entities.

HistoricalPeriodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

HitMissTransform
HitMissTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the hit-or-miss transform of <i>image</i> with respect to the composite structuring element <i>ker</i>.

HitMissTransform[<i>image</i>,{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the union of the hit-or-miss transforms for all the structuring elements <i>ker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

HitMissTransform[<i>image</i>,{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

HITSCentrality
HITSCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of authority and hub centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

HITSCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

HjorthDistribution
HjorthDistribution[<i>m,s,f</i>] represents the Hjorth distribution with location parameter <i>m</i>, scale parameter <i>s</i>, and shape parameter <i>f</i><i>.</i>

---

HodgeDual
HodgeDual[<i>tensor</i>] gives the Hodge dual of the <i>tensor</i>

HodgeDual[<i>tensor</i>,<i>dim</i>] dualizes <i>tensor</i> in the slots with dimension <i>dim</i>

HodgeDual[<i>tensor</i>,<i>dim</i>,<i>slots</i>] dualizes <i>tensor</i> in the given <i>slots</i>.

---

HoeffdingDTest
HoeffdingDTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

HoeffdingDTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Hold
Hold[<i>expr</i>] maintains <i>expr</i> in an unevaluated form. 

---

HoldAll
HoldAll is an attribute that specifies that all arguments to a function are to be maintained in an unevaluated form. 

---

HoldAllComplete
HoldAllComplete is an attribute which specifies that all arguments to a function are not to be modified or looked at in any way in the process of evaluation. 

---

HoldComplete
HoldComplete[<i>expr</i>] shields <i>expr</i> completely from the standard Wolfram Language evaluation process, preventing even upvalues associated with <i>expr</i> from being used. 

---

HoldFirst
HoldFirst is an attribute that specifies that the first argument to a function is to be maintained in an unevaluated form. 

---

HoldForm
HoldForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as the expression <i>expr</i>, with <i>expr</i> maintained in an unevaluated form. 

---

HoldPattern
HoldPattern[<i>expr</i>] is equivalent to <i>expr</i> for pattern matching, but maintains <i>expr</i> in an unevaluated form. 

---

HoldRest
HoldRest is an attribute which specifies that all but the first argument to a function are to be maintained in an unevaluated form. 

---

HolidayCalendar
HolidayCalendar is an option that specifies the holiday calendar schedule in business day functions.

---

HornerForm
HornerForm[<i>poly</i>] puts the polynomial <i>poly</i> in Horner form.

HornerForm[<i>poly</i>,<i>vars</i>] puts <i>poly</i> in Horner form with respect to the variable or variable list <i>vars</i>.

HornerForm[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>/<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>] puts the rational function <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>/<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> in Horner form by nesting <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>.
