HornerForm[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>/<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>vars</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vars</i><sub>2</sub>] puts <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>/<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> in Horner form using the variables or variable lists <i>vars</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>vars</i><sub>2</sub> for <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>, respectively.

---

HostLookup
HostLookup[<i>name</i>] gives the IP address for the host with the specified name.

HostLookup[<i>address</i>] gives the host name for the host at the specified IP address.

HostLookup[<i>spec</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives a specified property of the host.

HostLookup[<i>spec</i>,All] gives an association of properties found for the host.

---

HotellingTSquareDistribution
HotellingTSquareDistribution[<i>p</i>,<i>m</i>] represents Hotelling's T<sup>2</sup> distribution with dimensionality parameter <i>p</i> and <i>m</i> degrees of freedom.

---

HoytDistribution
HoytDistribution[<i>q</i>,ω] represents a Hoyt distribution with shape parameter <i>q</i> and spread parameter ω.

---

HTTPErrorResponse
HTTPErrorResponse[<i>code</i>] is an object that represents an error response to an HTTP request, with specified error code.

---

HTTPRedirect
HTTPRedirect[<i>uri</i>] represents an HTTP redirect to the specified <i>uri</i>.

HTTPRedirect[<i>uri</i>,<i>metadata</i>] represents an HTTP redirect to <i>uri</i> with the specified metadata.

---

HTTPRequest
HTTPRequest[<i>url</i>] represents an HTTP request for the specified URL.

HTTPRequest[<i>assoc</i>] represents an HTTP request built from the components in the association <i>assoc</i>. 

HTTPRequest[<i>url</i>,<i>assoc</i>] represents an HTTP request for the specified URL with additional elements such as headers given by <i>assoc</i>.

---

HTTPRequestData
HTTPRequestData["<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the specified property of the current HTTP request.

HTTPRequestData[] gives an association with values of properties of the current HTTP request.

---

HTTPResponse
HTTPResponse[<i>body</i>] is an object that represents a successful response to an HTTP request, with the specified body and default metadata.

HTTPResponse[<i>body</i>,<i>metadata</i>] represents a response to an HTTP request, including the specified body and metadata.

---

Hue
Hue[<i>h</i>] represents a color in the HSB color space with hue <i>h</i>. 

Hue[<i>h</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>b</i>] specifies colors in terms of hue, saturation and brightness. 

Hue[<i>h</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

Hue["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

Hue[<i>color</i>] returns the HSB representation of <i>color</i>.

---

HumanGrowthData
HumanGrowthData[<i>spec</i>] returns the range of values within one standard deviation of the mean for all properties of human growth at the specification <i>spec</i>.

HumanGrowthData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the range of values within one standard deviation of the mean of a property for the specification <i>spec</i>.

HumanGrowthData[<i>spec</i>,<i>index</i>] returns the values for all properties of human growth for <i>spec</i> at the specified percentile.

HumanGrowthData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>index</i>] returns the value at a specific index of a property for <i>spec</i> at the specified percentile.

HumanGrowthData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>quantity</i>] returns the percentile and probability density for a specific value <i>quantity</i> of the property at <i>spec</i>.

---

HumpDownHump
HumpDownHump[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≎<i>y</i>≎….

---

HumpEqual
HumpEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≏<i>y</i>≏….

---

HurwitzLerchPhi
HurwitzLerchPhi[<i>z</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the Hurwitz–Lerch transcendent Φ(z,s,a).

---

HurwitzZeta
HurwitzZeta[<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the Hurwitz zeta function ζ(s,a).

---

HyperbolicDistribution
HyperbolicDistribution[α,β,δ,μ] represents a hyperbolic distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameter δ, shape parameter α, and skewness parameter β.

HyperbolicDistribution[λ,α,β,δ,μ] represents a generalized hyperbolic distribution with shape parameter λ.

---

HypercubeGraph
HypercubeGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>-dimensional hypercube graph Q<sub>n</sub>.

---

HyperexponentialDistribution
HyperexponentialDistribution[{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},{λ<sub>1</sub>,…,λ<sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents an <i>m</i>-phase hyperexponential distribution with phase probabilities α<sub><i>i</i></sub> and rates λ<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Hyperfactorial
Hyperfactorial[<i>n</i>] gives the hyperfactorial function H(n).

---

Hypergeometric0F1
Hypergeometric0F1[<i>a</i>,<i>z</i>] is the confluent hypergeometric function <sub>0</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(;a;z). 

---

Hypergeometric0F1Regularized
Hypergeometric0F1Regularized[<i>a</i>,<i>z</i>] is the regularized confluent hypergeometric function <sub>0</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(;a;z)/Γ(a). 

---

Hypergeometric1F1
Hypergeometric1F1[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>z</i>] is the Kummer confluent hypergeometric function <sub>1</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(a;b;z). 

---

Hypergeometric1F1Regularized
Hypergeometric1F1Regularized[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>z</i>] is the regularized confluent hypergeometric function <sub>1</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(a;b;z)/Γ(b). 

---

Hypergeometric2F1
Hypergeometric2F1[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>z</i>] is the hypergeometric function <sub>2</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(a,b;c;z). 

---

Hypergeometric2F1Regularized
Hypergeometric2F1Regularized[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>z</i>] is the regularized hypergeometric function <sub>2</sub>F<sub>1</sub>(a,b;c;z)/Γ(c). 

---

HypergeometricDistribution
HypergeometricDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>succ</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>tot</i></sub>] represents a hypergeometric distribution.

---

HypergeometricPFQ
HypergeometricPFQ[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},<i>z</i>] is the generalized hypergeometric function <sub>p</sub>F<sub>q</sub>(a;b;z). 

---

HypergeometricPFQRegularized
HypergeometricPFQRegularized[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},<i>z</i>] is the regularized generalized hypergeometric function <sub>p</sub>F<sub>q</sub>(a;b;z)/(Γ(b<sub>1</sub>)…Γ(b<sub>q</sub>)). 

---

HypergeometricU
HypergeometricU[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>z</i>] is the Tricomi confluent hypergeometric function U(a,b,z). 

---

Hyperlink
Hyperlink[<i>uri</i>] represents a hyperlink that jumps to the specified URI when clicked. 

Hyperlink[<i>label</i>,<i>uri</i>] represents a hyperlink to be displayed as <i>label</i>. 

---

Hyperplane
Hyperplane[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents the hyperplane with normal <i>n</i> passing through the point <i>p</i>.

Hyperplane[<i>n</i>,<i>c</i>] represents the hyperplane with normal <i>n</i> given by the points x that satisfy n.xc. 

---

Hyphenation
Hyphenation is an option for Cell that specifies whether to allow hyphenation for words of text. 

---

HypoexponentialDistribution
HypoexponentialDistribution[{λ<sub>1</sub>,…,λ<sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents an <i>m</i>-phase hypoexponential distribution with rates λ<sub>1</sub>, …, λ<sub><i>m</i></sub>.

---

HypothesisTestData
HypothesisTestData[…] represents hypothesis test data such as generated by DistributionFitTest, AndersonDarlingTest, etc. 

---

I
I represents the imaginary unit @-1. 

---

IconData
IconData[<i>type</i>,<i>value</i>] generates an icon of the specified type assuming the value given. 

---

Iconize
Iconize[<i>expr</i>] gives an iconized form that can be used to stand in for <i>expr</i> in notebook input.

Iconize[<i>expr</i>,"<i>name</i>"] displays with the specified name in the icon.

---

IconRules
IconRules is an option for CloudObject and related objects that specifies icons to use in different environments to represent an object.

---

Icosahedron
Icosahedron[] represents a regular icosahedron centered at the origin with unit edge length.

Icosahedron[<i>l</i>] represents an icosahedron with edge length <i>l</i>.

Icosahedron[{θ,ϕ},…] represents an icosahedron rotated by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

Icosahedron[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},…] represents an icosahedron centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

Identity
Identity[<i>expr</i>] gives <i>expr</i> (the identity operation). 

---

IdentityMatrix
IdentityMatrix[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><i>n</i> identity matrix. 

IdentityMatrix[{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives the <i>m</i><i>n</i> identity matrix. 

---

If
If[<i>condition</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>f</i>] gives <i>t</i> if <i>condition</i> evaluates to True, and <i>f</i> if it evaluates to False. 

If[<i>condition</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>u</i>] gives <i>u</i> if <i>condition</i> evaluates to neither True nor False. 

---

IgnoreCase
IgnoreCase is an option for string manipulation and searching functions that specifies whether lowercase and uppercase letters should be treated as equivalent. 

---

IgnoreDiacritics
IgnoreDiacritics is an option for string, grammar, and related functions that specifies whether diacritics should be ignored in strings.

---

IgnoreIsotopes
IgnoreIsotopes is an option for MoleculeMatchQ that determines whether isotopes should be ignored for pattern matching.

---

IgnorePunctuation
IgnorePunctuation is an option for AlphabeticSort and related functions that specifies whether to consider punctuation in determining sorting order.

---

IgnoreStereochemistry
IgnoreStereochemistry is an option for MoleculeMatchQ that determines whether stereochemistry should be ignored for pattern matching.

---

IgnoringInactive
IgnoringInactive[<i>patt</i>] is a pattern object that, for purposes of pattern matching, ignores occurrences of Inactive in both <i>patt</i> and the expression being matched.

---

Im
Im[<i>z</i>] gives the imaginary part of the complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

Image
Image[<i>data</i>] represents a raster image with pixel values given by the array <i>data</i>.

Image[<i>graphics</i>] creates a raster image from a graphics object. 

Image[<i>obj</i>,<i>options</i>] gives an image that uses the specified options.

---

Image3D
Image3D[<i>data</i>] represents a 3D image with pixel values given by the array <i>data</i>.

Image3D[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a 3D image from a list of 2D images.

Image3D[<i>obj</i>,"<i>type</i>"] creates a 3D image of the specified data type.

---

Image3DProjection
Image3DProjection[<i>image</i>] takes a 3D image and returns a 2D image of maximum projection onto the x-y plane.

Image3DProjection[<i>image</i>,<i>dir</i>] performs a projection in the direction specified by <i>dir</i>.

Image3DProjection[<i>image</i>,<i>dir</i>,<i>mode</i>] specifies the projection <i>mode</i>.

---

ImageAccumulate
ImageAccumulate[<i>image</i>] gives an image in which each pixel represents a sum of all pixels below and to the left of that pixel in <i>image</i>.

---

ImageAdd
ImageAdd[<i>image</i>,<i>x</i>] adds an amount <i>x</i> to each channel value in <i>image</i>.

ImageAdd[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] gives an image in which each pixel is the sum of the corresponding pixels in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageAdd[<i>image</i>,<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] adds all <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>image</i>, where each <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> can be either an image, a number, or a color value.

---

ImageAdjust
ImageAdjust[<i>image</i>] adjusts the levels in <i>image</i>, rescaling them to cover the range 0 to 1.

ImageAdjust[<i>image</i>,<i>corr</i>] adjusts the image according to the correction specification <i>corr</i>.

ImageAdjust[<i>image</i>,<i>corr</i>,{<i>in</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>in</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] first rescales so that the range of input values <i>in</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>in</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> is mapped to 0 to 1.

ImageAdjust[<i>image</i>,<i>corr</i>,{<i>in</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>in</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>out</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>out</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] rescales so that the range of input values <i>in</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>in</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> is mapped to <i>out</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>out</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

ImageAlign
ImageAlign[<i>ref</i>,<i>image</i>] returns a version of <i>image</i> that is aligned with the reference image <i>ref</i>.

ImageAlign[<i>ref</i>,{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the result of aligning each of the <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with the reference image <i>ref</i>.

ImageAlign[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] uses <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> as the reference image.

---

ImageApply
ImageApply[<i>f</i>,<i>image</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the list of channel values for each pixel in <i>image</i>.

ImageApply[<i>f</i>,{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to the sequence of corresponding pixel values taken from each <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ImageApplyIndexed
ImageApplyIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>image</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the list of channel values for each pixel in <i>image</i>, giving the row and column index of each pixel as a second argument to <i>f</i>.

ImageApplyIndexed[<i>f</i>,{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to the sequence of corresponding pixel values taken from each <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, giving the corresponding row and column index of pixels as the last argument to <i>f</i>.

---

ImageAspectRatio
ImageAspectRatio[<i>image</i>] gives the ratio of height to width for <i>image</i>.

ImageAspectRatio[<i>video</i>] gives the aspect ratio of video frames.

---

ImageAssemble
ImageAssemble[{{<i>im</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>im</i><sub><i>1n</i></sub>},…,{<i>im</i><sub><i>m1</i></sub>,…,<i>im</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] assembles a single image from an array of images.

ImageAssemble[{{<i>im</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>im</i><sub><i>1n</i></sub>},…,{<i>im</i><sub><i>m1</i></sub>,…,<i>im</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}},<i>fitting</i>] assembles images using the <i>fitting</i> method.

---

ImageAugmentationLayer
ImageAugmentationLayer[{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>}] represents a net layer that applies random image transformations to produce images of height <i>h</i> and width <i>w</i>.

---

ImageCapture
ImageCapture[] opens a graphical user interface for capturing images from connected cameras.

---

ImageCaptureFunction
ImageCaptureFunction is an option for ImageCapture that specifies the function to apply to images acquired by the imaging device. 

---

ImageCases
ImageCases[<i>image</i>] gives an association of lists of subimages for each identified category of objects in <i>image</i>.

ImageCases[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>] gives a list of subimages identified as an instance of the specified category.

ImageCases[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i><i>prop</i>] gives the specified property <i>prop</i> for each identified subimage.

ImageCases[<i>image</i>,{<i>category</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>category</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association with lists of subimages identified as being instances of each of the <i>category</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCases[<i>video</i>,…] gives a time series of detected objects in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageChannels
ImageChannels[<i>image</i>] gives the number of channels present in the data for the Image or Image3D object <i>image</i>.

ImageChannels[<i>video</i>] gives the number of channels present in frames of a video.

---

ImageClip
ImageClip[<i>image</i>] clips all channel values in <i>image</i> to lie in the default range.

ImageClip[<i>image</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] clips channel values to lie in the range from <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>.

ImageClip[<i>image</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},{<i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives <i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> for values below <i>min</i> and <i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> for values above <i>max</i>.

---

ImageCollage
ImageCollage[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a collage of images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCollage[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub><i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub><i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a collage of images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> based on their corresponding weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCollage[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub><i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub><i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…] also creates a collage of images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> based on their corresponding weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCollage[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] also creates a collage of images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> based on their corresponding weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCollage[{{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] also creates a collage of images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> based on their corresponding weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageCollage[…,<i>fitting</i>] uses the <i>fitting</i> method to create the collage.

ImageCollage[…,<i>fitting</i>,<i>size</i>] creates a collage of the specified <i>size</i>.

---

ImageColorSpace
ImageColorSpace[<i>image</i>] gives the name of the color space of <i>image</i>.

---

ImageCompose
ImageCompose[<i>image</i>,<i>overlay</i>] gives the result of overlaying <i>overlay</i> onto <i>image</i>. 

ImageCompose[<i>image</i>,{<i>overlay</i>,α}] gives the result of alpha blending <i>overlay</i> into <i>image</i> using blending fraction α.

ImageCompose[<i>image</i>,<i>overlay</i>,<i>pos</i>] places the center of <i>overlay</i> at position <i>pos</i> in <i>image</i>.

ImageCompose[<i>image</i>,<i>overlay</i>,<i>pos</i>,<i>opos</i>] places the point <i>opos</i> in <i>overlay</i> at position <i>pos</i> in <i>image</i>.

ImageCompose[<i>image</i>,<i>overlay</i>,<i>pos</i>,<i>opos</i>,{<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>o</i></sub>,<i>mode</i>}] uses the compositing fractions <i>f</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> and the specified compositing mode.

---

ImageContainsQ
ImageContainsQ[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>] returns True if an instance of the specified category is detected in <i>image</i>.

ImageContainsQ[<i>image</i>,{<i>category</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>category</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns True if at least one instance of each of the <i>category</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is detected in <i>image</i>.

ImageContainsQ[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i><sub>1</sub>|<i>category</i><sub>2</sub>|…] returns True if <i>image</i> contains an instance of at least one of <i>category</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageContainsQ[<i>video</i>,…] returns a time series of Boolean values for every frame of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageContents
ImageContents[<i>image</i>] gives a dataset of identified entities in <i>image</i>.

ImageContents[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>] gives a dataset that only contains entities in the specified category.

ImageContents[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>,<i>prop</i>] includes the properties <i>prop</i> for each identified object.

ImageContents[<i>video</i>,…] gives a time series of detected objects in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageConvolve
ImageConvolve[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the convolution of <i>image</i> with kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

ImageCooccurrence
ImageCooccurrence[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> co-occurrence matrix for <i>image</i>.

ImageCooccurrence[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>ker</i>] computes a co-occurrence matrix for arbitrary spatial relationships specified by a kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

ImageCorners
ImageCorners[<i>image</i>] finds corners in <i>image</i> and returns their coordinates.

ImageCorners[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] finds corners at a pixel range <i>r</i>.

ImageCorners[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>t</i>] uses a threshold <i>t</i> for selecting corners.

ImageCorners[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>d</i>] returns corners that are at least <i>d</i>+1 pixels apart.

ImageCorners[<i>video</i>,…] returns corners in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageCorrelate
ImageCorrelate[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the correlation of <i>image</i> with kernel <i>ker</i>.

ImageCorrelate[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>,<i>f</i>] computes a generalized correlation in which the function <i>f</i> is used in place of Dot.

---

ImageCorrespondingPoints
ImageCorrespondingPoints[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] finds a set of matching interest points in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub> and returns their pixel coordinates.

---

ImageCrop
ImageCrop[<i>image</i>] crops <i>image</i> by removing borders of uniform color. 

ImageCrop[<i>image</i>,<i>size</i>] crops <i>image</i> based on the size specification <i>size</i>.

ImageCrop[<i>image</i>,<i>size</i>,<i>spec</i>] crops <i>image</i> by removing pixels from sides specified by <i>spec</i>.

ImageCrop[<i>video</i>,…] crops frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageData
ImageData[<i>image</i>] gives the array of pixel values in an Image or Image3D object <i>image</i>.

ImageData[<i>image</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives the array of pixel values converted to the specified type.

---

ImageDeconvolve
ImageDeconvolve[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives a deconvolution of <i>image</i> using kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

ImageDemosaic
ImageDemosaic[<i>image</i>,<i>cfa</i>] reconstructs a color image using the specified color filter array <i>cfa</i>.

ImageDemosaic[<i>image</i>,{"<i>cfa</i>",{<i>row</i>,<i>col</i>}}] aligns the top-left pixel of the pattern with the {<i>row</i>,<i>col</i>} pixel of <i>image</i>.

---

ImageDifference
ImageDifference[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] gives an image in which each pixel is the absolute difference of the corresponding pixels in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

ImageDimensions
ImageDimensions[<i>image</i>] gives the pixel dimensions of an Image or Image3D object <i>image</i>.

ImageDimensions[<i>video</i>] gives the pixel dimensions of the first video track of the Video object <i>video</i>.

---

ImageDisplacements
ImageDisplacements[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives estimated horizontal and vertical displacements between consecutive images.

ImageDisplacements[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>flow</i>] uses <i>flow</i> as an initial estimate for displacement between <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ImageDistance
ImageDistance[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] returns a distance measure between <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>. 

ImageDistance[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>pos</i>] places the center of <i>image</i><sub>2</sub> at position <i>pos</i> in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub>.

ImageDistance[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>] places the point <i>pos</i><sub>2</sub> of <i>image</i><sub>2</sub> at position <i>pos</i><sub>1</sub> in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub>.

---

ImageEffect
ImageEffect[<i>image</i>,"<i>effect</i>"] applies the specified image effect to <i>image</i>.

ImageEffect[<i>image</i>,{"<i>effect</i>",<i>params</i>}] uses parameters <i>params</i>.

ImageEffect[<i>video</i>,…] applies the image effect to frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageExposureCombine
ImageExposureCombine[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] combines differently exposed images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of the same scene into a single image with overall good exposure.

ImageExposureCombine[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>mode</i>] creates a low or a high dynamic range image based on the specified <i>mode</i>.

---

ImageFeatureTrack
ImageFeatureTrack[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] tracks features from <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

ImageFeatureTrack[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>image</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>pts</i>] tracks features starting from the initial set of points <i>pts</i> in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub>.

---

ImageFileApply
ImageFileApply[<i>f</i>,<i>inputfile</i>,<i>outputfile</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the list of channel values for each pixel of the image stored in <i>inputfile</i> and stores the result in <i>outputfile</i>.

---

ImageFileFilter
ImageFileFilter[<i>f</i>,<i>inputfile</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>outputfile</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the range <i>r</i> neighborhood of each pixel in each channel of the image stored in <i>inputfile</i> and stores the result in <i>outputfile</i>.

---

ImageFileScan
ImageFileScan[<i>f</i>,<i>inputfile</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the list of channel values for each pixel of the image stored in <i>inputfile</i>.

---

ImageFilter
ImageFilter[<i>f</i>,<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the range-<i>r</i> neighborhood of each pixel in each channel of <i>image</i>.

---

ImageFocusCombine
ImageFocusCombine[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] combines differently focused images <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of the same scene to obtain a single well-focused image. 

---

ImageForestingComponents
ImageForestingComponents[<i>image</i>] finds a segmentation of <i>image</i>, returning an integer matrix in which positive integers label different components.

ImageForestingComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>] tries to find a segmentation into components that include pixels indicated by <i>marker</i>.

ImageForestingComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>,<i>r</i>] finds components that are connected at a pixel scale given by <i>r</i>.

ImageForestingComponents[<i>video</i>,…] computes components for each frame in <i>video</i>.

---

ImageForwardTransformation
ImageForwardTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>] gives an image in which each pixel at position <i>f</i>[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] corresponds to the position {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} in <i>image</i>.

ImageForwardTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>size</i>] gives an image of the specified size.

ImageForwardTransformation[<i>video</i>,…] transforms frames of a video.

---

ImageGraphics
ImageGraphics[<i>image</i>] returns the content of <i>image</i> in the form of scalable vector graphics.

ImageGraphics[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] uses up to <i>n</i> colors for the vector graphics.

ImageGraphics[<i>image</i>,<i>colors</i>] creates vector graphics containing the specified <i>colors</i>.

---

ImageHistogram
ImageHistogram[<i>image</i>] plots a histogram of the pixel levels for each channel in <i>image</i>.

ImageHistogram[<i>image</i>,<i>bspec</i>] uses bin specification <i>bspec</i>.

ImageHistogram[<i>image</i>,<i>bspec</i>,<i>range</i>] plots the histogram of the pixel values in the given <i>range</i>.

---

ImageIdentify
ImageIdentify[<i>image</i>] yields the result of attempting to identify what <i>image</i> is a picture of. 

ImageIdentify[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>] restricts the identification of <i>image</i> to objects within the specified category.

ImageIdentify[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of up to <i>n</i> possible identifications.

ImageIdentify[<i>image</i>,<i>category</i>,<i>n</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the specified property for each identification.

---

ImageInstanceQ
ImageInstanceQ[<i>image</i>,<i>obj</i>] gives True if <i>image</i> appears to be an instance of the object <i>obj</i>, and gives False otherwise.

ImageInstanceQ[<i>image</i>,<i>obj</i>,<i>cat</i>] assumes that the image is of something in the category <i>cat</i>.

---

ImageKeypoints
ImageKeypoints[<i>image</i>] finds key features in <i>image</i> and returns their coordinates.

ImageKeypoints[<i>image</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the specified property <i>prop</i> for each keypoint.

ImageKeypoints[<i>video</i>,…] finds keypoints in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageLabels
ImageLabels is an option for image highlighting that specifies what labels to use for each highlighted feature.

---

ImageLegends
ImageLegends is an option for image highlighting that specifies what legends to use.

---

ImageLevels
ImageLevels[<i>image</i>] gives a list of pixel values and counts for each channel in <i>image</i>. 

ImageLevels[<i>image</i>,<i>bspec</i>] bins pixel values using bin specification <i>bspec</i>.

ImageLevels[<i>image</i>,<i>bspec</i>,<i>range</i>] gives counts for bins in the given <i>range</i>.

---

ImageLines
ImageLines[<i>image</i>] finds line segments in <i>image</i> and returns the coordinates of their endpoints.

ImageLines[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] uses the threshold <i>t</i> for selecting image lines.

ImageLines[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>d</i>] uses the parameter <i>d</i> to control the distinctness of the detected lines.

ImageLines[<i>video</i>,…] finds lines in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageMargins
ImageMargins is an option that specifies the absolute margins to leave around the image displayed for an object. 

---

ImageMarker
ImageMarker[<i>pos</i>] is a HighlightImage specification that represents a marker at position <i>pos</i>.

ImageMarker[<i>pos</i>,<i>marker</i>] represents a custom marker at position <i>pos</i>.

ImageMarker[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] represents multiple marker positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ImageMeasurements
ImageMeasurements[<i>image</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] returns the value of property "<i>prop</i>" for the entire <i>image</i>.

ImageMeasurements[<i>image</i>,"<i>prop</i>",<i>format</i>] returns the values in the specified output <i>format</i>.

ImageMeasurements[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>, …},…] returns measurements for all <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ImageMesh
ImageMesh[<i>image</i>] returns the foreground region in <i>image</i> as a BoundaryMeshRegion object.

---

ImageMultiply
ImageMultiply[<i>image</i>,<i>x</i>] multiplies each channel value in <i>image</i> by a factor <i>x</i>.

ImageMultiply[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] gives an image in which each pixel is the product of the corresponding pixels in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageMultiply[<i>image</i>,<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] multiplies all <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>image</i>, where each <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> can be either an image, a number, or a color value.

---

ImagePad
ImagePad[<i>image</i>,<i>m</i>] pads <i>image</i> on all sides with <i>m</i> background pixels.

ImagePad[<i>image</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>padding</i>] pads <i>image</i> on all sides using the value or method specified by <i>padding</i>.

ImagePad[<i>image</i>,{{<i>left</i>,<i>right</i>},{<i>bottom</i>,<i>top</i>}},…] pads <i>image</i> with the specified numbers of pixels on each side.

ImagePad[<i>image</i>,{{<i>left</i>,<i>right</i>},{<i>front</i>,<i>back</i>},{<i>bottom</i>,<i>top</i>}},…] pads a 3D image with the specified numbers of pixels.

ImagePad[<i>video</i>,…] pads frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImagePadding
ImagePadding is an option for graphics functions that specifies what absolute extra padding should be left for extended objects such as thick lines and annotations such as tick and axis labels.

---

ImagePartition
ImagePartition[<i>image</i>,<i>s</i>] partitions an image into an array of <i>s</i><i>s</i>-pixel subimages.

ImagePartition[<i>image</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>}] partitions an image into an array of subimages of pixel width <i>w</i> and pixel height <i>h</i>.

ImagePartition[<i>image</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>},{<i>dw</i>,<i>dh</i>}] uses pixel offsets <i>dw</i> and <i>dh</i>.

---

ImagePeriodogram
ImagePeriodogram[<i>image</i>] shows the squared magnitude of the discrete Fourier transform (power spectrum) of <i>image</i>.

ImagePeriodogram[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] shows the average of power spectra of non-overlapping partitions of size <i>n</i>×<i>n</i>.

ImagePeriodogram[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

ImagePeriodogram[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

ImagePeriodogram[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

---

ImagePerspectiveTransformation
ImagePerspectiveTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>m</i>] applies a linear fractional transform specified by a matrix <i>m</i> to the positions of each pixel in <i>image</i>.

ImagePerspectiveTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>tf</i>] uses the TransformationFunction given by <i>tf</i>.

ImagePerspectiveTransformation[<i>image</i>,…,<i>size</i>] gives an image of the specified size.

ImagePerspectiveTransformation[<i>video</i>,…] transforms frames of a video.

---

ImagePosition
ImagePosition[<i>image</i>] gives an association of image positions for each identified category of objects in <i>image</i>.

ImagePosition[<i>image</i>,<i>obj</i>] gives a list of image positions for subimages identified as instances of the specified category.

ImagePosition[<i>video</i>,…] gives a time series of detected object positions in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImagePreviewFunction
ImagePreviewFunction is an option for CurrentImage and similar functions that specifies the function to apply to images before being displayed.

---

ImagePyramid
ImagePyramid[<i>image</i>] creates a Gaussian image pyramid formed from <i>image</i>.

ImagePyramid[<i>image</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>] returns a Gaussian or Laplacian pyramid depending of the specified <i>pyrtype</i>.

ImagePyramid[<i>image</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>,<i>n</i>] returns up to <i>n</i> levels of the pyramid.

ImagePyramid[<i>image</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>,{<i>size</i>}] returns pyramid levels down to image dimensions given by <i>size</i>.

ImagePyramid[<i>image</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>s</i>] returns a pyramid with successive levels downsampled by factor <i>s</i>.

---

ImagePyramidApply
ImagePyramidApply[<i>f</i>,<i>pyr</i>] applies <i>f</i> to all images in the ImagePyramid object <i>pyr</i>.

ImagePyramidApply[<i>f</i>,{<i>pyr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pyr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to the sequence of corresponding levels taken from each <i>pyr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ImageQ
ImageQ[<i>image</i>] yields True if <i>image</i> has the form of a valid Image or Image3D object, and False otherwise.

---

ImageRecolor
ImageRecolor[<i>image</i>,<i>region</i><i>color</i>] recolors pixels in <i>image</i> specified by <i>region</i> using the specified <i>color</i>.

ImageRecolor[<i>image</i>,{<i>region</i><sub>1</sub><i>color</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] recolors multiple regions.

ImageRecolor[<i>video</i>,…] recolors frames of a video.

---

ImageReflect
ImageReflect[<i>image</i>] reverses <i>image</i> by top-bottom mirror reflection. 

ImageReflect[<i>image</i>,<i>side</i>] reverses <i>image</i> by reflecting it so that the specified side goes to the opposite side.

ImageReflect[<i>image</i>,<i>side</i><sub>1</sub><i>side</i><sub>2</sub>] reflects <i>image</i> so that <i>side</i><sub>1</sub> is interchanged with <i>side</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageReflect[<i>video</i>,…] reflects frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageResize
ImageResize[<i>image</i>,<i>width</i>] gives a resized version of <i>image</i> that is <i>width</i> pixels wide.

ImageResize[<i>image</i>,{<i>size</i>}] gives a resized version of <i>image</i> with a maximum pixel width or height given by <i>size</i>.

ImageResize[<i>image</i>,{<i>width</i>,<i>height</i>}] gives a resized version of <i>image</i> that has exactly the specified pixel width and height.

ImageResize[<i>video</i>,…] gives a video in which every frame is resized.

ImageResize[<i>image</i>,{<i>width</i>,<i>depth</i>,<i>height</i>}] gives a resized version of a 3D image with the specified dimensions.

---

ImageResolution
ImageResolution is an option for Export, Rasterize, and related functions that specifies at what resolution bitmap images should be rendered. 

---

ImageRestyle
ImageRestyle[<i>image</i>,<i>sample</i>] attempts to restyle <i>image</i> so as to follow the graphical style of <i>sample</i>. 

ImageRestyle[<i>image</i>,<i>w</i><i>sample</i>] uses restyle weighting <i>w</i>. 

ImageRestyle[<i>image</i>,{<i>sample</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] attempts to restyle <i>image</i> using a blend of the graphical styles of the <i>sample</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageRestyle[<i>image</i>,{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub><i>sample</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] uses weightings <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for the <i>sample</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ImageRotate
ImageRotate[<i>image</i>] rotates <i>image</i> by 90° about its center in the x-y plane. 

ImageRotate[<i>image</i>,θ] rotates <i>image</i> by θ radians.

ImageRotate[<i>image</i>,{θ,<i>w</i>}] rotates a 3D image around the 3D vector <i>w</i>.

ImageRotate[<i>image</i>,…,<i>size</i>] gives an image of the specified size.

ImageRotate[<i>video</i>,…] rotate frames of <i>video</i>.

---

ImageRotated
ImageRotated is an option for Export that specifies whether images should be rotated into landscape mode. 

---

ImageSaliencyFilter
ImageSaliencyFilter[<i>image</i>] returns a saliency map for <i>image</i>.

---

ImageScaled
ImageScaled[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives the position of a graphical object in terms of coordinates scaled to run from 0 to 1 across the whole image region in each direction. 

ImageScaled[{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>},{<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>}] gives a position obtained by starting at ordinary coordinates {<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>}, then moving by an image‐scaled offset {<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>}. 

---

ImageScan
ImageScan[<i>f</i>,<i>image</i>] evaluates <i>f</i> applied to each pixel of <i>image</i> in turn.

---

ImageSize
ImageSize is an option that specifies the overall size of an image to display for an object. 

---

ImageSizeAction
ImageSizeAction is an option for Pane and related constructs that specifies what to do if the specified ImageSize setting does not match the size of the contents.

---

ImageSizeMultipliers
ImageSizeMultipliers is an option that specifies how much smaller to render graphics that appear within other constructs.

---

ImageStitch
ImageStitch[{<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a composed image from an unordered list of <i>image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ImageStitch[{{<i>image</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>image</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] returns a stitched image from a matrix of images <i>image</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>, according to their array position.

ImageStitch[<i>images</i>,<i>canvas</i>] projects the stitched image onto the geometry specified by <i>canvas</i>.

---

ImageSubtract
ImageSubtract[<i>image</i>,<i>x</i>] subtracts a constant amount <i>x</i> from each channel value in <i>image</i>.

ImageSubtract[<i>image</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>image</i><sub>2</sub>] gives an image in which each pixel is obtained by subtracting the values of the corresponding pixels in <i>image</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>image</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageSubtract[<i>image</i>,<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] subtracts all <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>image</i>, where each <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> can be either an image, a number, or a color value.

---

ImageTake
ImageTake[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] gives an image consisting of the first <i>n</i> rows of <i>image</i>.

ImageTake[<i>image</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives an image consisting of the last <i>n</i> rows of <i>image</i>.

ImageTake[<i>image</i>,{<i>row</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>row</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives rows <i>row</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>row</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageTake[<i>image</i>,{<i>row</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>row</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the image that spans <i>row</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>row</i><sub>2</sub> and <i>col</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>col</i><sub>2</sub>.

ImageTake[<i>video</i>,…] returns a video in which every frame consists of the specified region of interest.

ImageTake[<i>image3d</i>,{<i>slice</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>slice</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>row</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>row</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the 3D image consisting of the specified slices, rows, and columns.

---

ImageTransformation
ImageTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>] gives an image in which each pixel at position <i>p</i> corresponds to the position <i>f</i>[<i>p</i>] in <i>image</i>.

ImageTransformation[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>size</i>] gives an image of the specified size.

ImageTransformation[<i>video</i>,…] transforms frames of a video.

---

ImageTrim
ImageTrim[<i>image</i>,<i>roi</i>] gives the smallest subimage of <i>image</i> that includes the specified region of interest <i>roi</i>.

ImageTrim[<i>image</i>,<i>roi</i>,<i>r</i>] adds a margin of size <i>r</i> back to the resulting image.

ImageTrim[<i>image</i>,{<i>roi</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>roi</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] extracts multiple subimages specified by <i>roi</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>image</i>.

ImageTrim[<i>video</i>,…] extracts the subimages from <i>video</i>.

---

ImageType
ImageType[<i>image</i>] gives the underlying type of values used for each pixel element in the Image or Image3D object <i>image</i>.

---

ImageValue
ImageValue[<i>image</i>,<i>pos</i>] gives the interpolated value of <i>image</i> at position <i>pos</i>.

ImageValue[<i>image</i>,<i>pos</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives the value converted to the specified type.

---

ImageValuePositions
ImageValuePositions[<i>image</i>,<i>val</i>] returns a list of pixel positions in <i>image</i> that exactly match the value <i>val</i>.

ImageValuePositions[<i>image</i>,<i>val</i>,<i>d</i>] returns all pixel positions that have values within a distance <i>d</i> from <i>val</i>.

---

ImageVectorscopePlot
ImageVectorscopePlot[<i>image</i>] plots the chrominance of <i>image</i>.

---

ImageWaveformPlot
ImageWaveformPlot[<i>image</i>] plots the waveform of <i>image</i>.

ImageWaveformPlot[<i>image</i>,<i>colorspace</i>] plots the waveform of <i>image</i> in <i>colorspace</i>.

ImageWaveformPlot[<i>image</i>,<i>channel</i>] plots the waveform for the specified <i>channel</i>.

---

ImagingDevice
ImagingDevice is an option to specify what device to use for capturing images.

---

ImplicitRegion
ImplicitRegion[<i>cond</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a region in <sup>n</sup> that satisfies the conditions <i>cond</i>. 

ImplicitRegion[<i>cond</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>},…}] represents a region in <sup>n</sup> that satisfies the conditions <i>cond</i> as well as a<sub>1</sub>≤x<sub>1</sub>≤b<sub>1</sub> etc.

---

Implies
Implies[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>] represents the logical implication p⇒q. 

---

Import
Import[<i>source</i>] imports data from <i>source</i>, returning a Wolfram Language representation of it.

Import[<i>source</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] takes the file to be in the specified format "<i>fmt</i>".

Import[<i>source</i>,<i>elements</i>] imports the specified <i>elements</i> from a file.

Import[<i>source</i>,…,<i>options</i>] uses the specified options.

---

ImportByteArray
ImportByteArray[<i>ba</i>,"<i>format</i>"] imports data in the specified format from a ByteArray object.

ImportByteArray[<i>ba</i>,<i>elements</i>] imports the specified elements.

ImportByteArray[<i>ba</i>] attempts to determine the format automatically.

---

ImportedObject
ImportedObject[…] represents a piece of imported data that has no special representation in the Wolfram Language. 

---

ImportOptions
ImportOptions is an option for Interpreter and related functions that specifies what options should be used in importing data.

---

ImportString
ImportString["<i>data</i>","<i>format</i>"] imports data in the specified format from a string. 

ImportString["<i>data</i>",<i>elements</i>] imports the specified elements.

ImportString["<i>data</i>"] attempts to determine the format of the string from its contents.

---

ImprovementImportance
ImprovementImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the improvement importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

ImprovementImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the improvement importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

In
In[<i>n</i>] is a global object that is assigned to have a delayed value of the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> input line. 

---

Inactivate
Inactivate[<i>expr</i>] replaces all instances of <i>f</i> with Inactive[<i>f</i>] for symbols <i>f</i> used as heads in <i>expr</i>.

Inactivate[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] inactivates all symbols in <i>expr</i> that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

Inactive
Inactive[<i>f</i>] is an inactive form of <i>f</i>.

---

IncidenceGraph
IncidenceGraph[<i>m</i>] gives the graph with incidence matrix <i>m</i>.

IncidenceGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>m</i>] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and incidence matrix <i>m</i>.

---

IncidenceList
IncidenceList[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a list of edges incident to vertex <i>v</i>.

IncidenceList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of edges incident to vertices that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

IncidenceList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>d</i>] gives a list of incident edges <i>d</i> steps away.

IncidenceList[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

IncidenceMatrix
IncidenceMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the vertex-edge incidence matrix of the graph <i>g</i>.

IncidenceMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

IncludeAromaticBonds
IncludeAromaticBonds is an option for Molecule that specifies whether aromatic bonds should be detected and labeled.

---

IncludeConstantBasis
IncludeConstantBasis is an option for LinearModelFit and other fitting functions that specifies whether a constant term should be included if not explicitly given in the list of basis functions.

---

IncludedContexts
IncludedContexts is an option for FullDefinition, Manipulate and related symbols that gives contexts whose symbols will have their definitions recursively saved.

---

IncludeDirectories
IncludeDirectories is an option that specifies whether directories are included in evaluations.

---

IncludeGeneratorTasks
IncludeGeneratorTasks is an option controlling the scope of scheduled task listings.

---

IncludeHydrogens
IncludeHydrogens is an option that specifies whether hydrogen atoms should be explicitly included in the results.

---

IncludeInflections
IncludeInflections is an option for linguistic functions that specifies whether inflected forms of words should be included in results.

---

IncludeMetaInformation
IncludeMetaInformation is an option for Import, Thumbnail, and other functions to specify what types of metadata to include.

---

IncludePods
IncludePods is an option for WolframAlpha that determines specific pod IDs to include in the results.

---

IncludeQuantities
IncludeQuantities is an option for DimensionalCombinations for additional quantities to include in the result.

---

IncludeRelatedTables
IncludeRelatedTables is an option for RelationalDatabase that specifies whether to include tables specified in foreign keys.

---

IncludeWindowTimes
IncludeWindowTimes is an option to TimeSeriesWindow that specifies whether the endpoints in the time window should be included.

---

Increment
<i>x</i>++ increases the value of <i>x</i> by 1, returning the old value of <i>x</i>. 

---

IndefiniteMatrixQ
IndefiniteMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly indefinite, and False otherwise. 

---

IndependenceTest
IndependenceTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

IndependenceTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

IndependenceTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

IndependentEdgeSetQ
IndependentEdgeSetQ[<i>g</i>,<i>elist</i>] yields True if the edge list <i>elist</i> is an independent edge set of the graph <i>g</i>, and False otherwise.

---

IndependentPhysicalQuantity
IndependentPhysicalQuantity[<i>string</i>] represents a physical quantity <i>string</i> with no relationship to other physical quantities used in QuantityVariable.

---

IndependentUnit
IndependentUnit[<i>string</i>] represents a unit <i>string</i> with no relationship to other units within a Quantity.

---

IndependentUnitDimension
IndependentUnitDimension[<i>dim</i>] represents the base dimension <i>dim</i> associated with an independent physical quantity or unit.

---

IndependentVertexSetQ
IndependentVertexSetQ[<i>g</i>,<i>vlist</i>] yields True if the vertex list <i>vlist</i> is an independent vertex set in the graph <i>g</i>, and False otherwise.

---

Indeterminate
Indeterminate is a symbol that represents a numerical quantity whose magnitude cannot be determined. 

---

IndeterminateThreshold
IndeterminateThreshold is an option for Classify, Predict, and related functions that specifies below what probability or probability density a result should be considered indeterminate.

---

Indexed
Indexed[<i>expr</i>,<i>i</i>] represents the component of <i>expr</i> with index <i>i</i> and formats as <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Indexed[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] represents the component with indices <i>i</i>, <i>j</i>, … and formats as <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…</sub>.

---

IndexEdgeTaggedGraph
IndexEdgeTaggedGraph[<i>g</i>] sets tags of edges in the graph <i>g</i> to their edge indices.

IndexEdgeTaggedGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>r</i>] sets tags of edges to <i>r</i>,<i>r</i>+1,… 

---

IndexGraph
IndexGraph[<i>g</i>] replaces the vertices of the graph <i>g</i> by its vertex indices.

IndexGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>r</i>] replaces the vertices with integers <i>r</i>, <i> </i><i>r</i>+1, ….

IndexGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Inequality
Inequality represents a sequence of relational statements.

---

InexactNumberQ
InexactNumberQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is an inexact real or complex number, and returns False otherwise.

---

InfiniteFuture
InfiniteFuture returns a DateObject expression representing infinite future in time.

---

InfiniteLine
InfiniteLine[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents the infinite straight line passing through the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>. 

InfiniteLine[<i>p</i>,<i>v</i>] represents the infinite straight line passing through the point <i>p</i> in the direction <i>v</i>. 

---

InfinitePast
InfinitePast returns a DateObject expression representing infinite past in time.

---

InfinitePlane
InfinitePlane[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>}] represents the plane passing through the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, and <i>p</i><sub>3</sub>.

InfinitePlane[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents the plane passing through the point <i>p</i> in the directions <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

Infinity
Infinity or ∞ is a symbol that represents a positive infinite quantity. 

---

Infix
Infix[<i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…]] prints with <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] given in default infix form: <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>~<i>f</i>~<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>~<i>f</i>~<i>e</i><sub>3</sub>…. 

Infix[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] prints with arguments separated by <i>h</i>: <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> <i>h</i> <i>e</i><sub>2</sub> <i>h</i> <i>e</i><sub>3</sub>…. 

---

InflationAdjust
InflationAdjust[<i>quantity</i>,<i>targetdate</i>] attempts to adjust the specified <i>quantity</i> purchasing power to <i>targetdate</i>.

InflationAdjust[<i>quantity</i>] uses the current year as <i>targetdate</i>.

InflationAdjust[<i>quantity</i>,<i>targetunit</i>] converts the currency to <i>targetunit</i><i> </i>after adjusting to the current year.

InflationAdjust[<i>timeseries</i>,<i>targetdate</i>] attempts to adjust the specified <i>timeseries</i> data purchasing power to <i>targetdate</i>.

---

InflationMethod
InflationMethod is an option for InflationAdjust that specifies what time series data is to be used for adjustment in time.

---

Information
Information[<i>expr</i>] gives information about the expression <i>expr</i>. 

Information[<i>expr</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the value of the property <i>prop</i> for <i>expr</i>.

Information[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives information about all of the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

InformationData
InformationData[<i>assoc</i>] is generated by Information[<i>expr</i>] and handle typesetting and element extraction.

---

Inherited
Inherited represents an option value to be inherited from an enclosing style, cell, or notebook. 

---

InhomogeneousPoissonProcess
InhomogeneousPoissonProcess[λ[<i>t</i>],<i>t</i>] represents an inhomogeneous Poisson process with intensity λ[<i>t</i>] given as a function of <i>t</i>.

---

Initialize
Initialize[<i>sym</i>] initializes the symbol <i>sym</i> from persistent values on the default persistence path.

Initialize[<i>sym</i>,{<i>loc</i><sub><i>1</i></sub>,…}] initializes the symbol <i>sym</i> from persistent values on the persistence path {<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}.

Initialize["<i>patt</i>"] initializes all variables matching the string pattern "<i>patt</i>".

---

InitialSeeding
InitialSeeding is an option for NDSolve and other functions that specifies equations that specify initial seeding values for variables that may be used by iterative algorithms.

---

Inner
Inner[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i>] is a generalization of Dot in which <i>f</i> plays the role of multiplication and <i>g</i> of addition. 

---

InnerPolygon
InnerPolygon[<i>poly</i>] gives the inner polygon of the polygon <i>poly</i>.

---

InnerPolyhedron
InnerPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the inner polyhedron of the polyhedron <i>poly</i>.

---

Inpaint
Inpaint[<i>image</i>,<i>region</i>] retouches parts of <i>image</i> that correspond to nonzero elements in <i>region</i>.

---

Input
Input[] interactively reads in one Wolfram Language expression. 

Input[<i>prompt</i>] requests input, displaying <i>prompt</i> as a "prompt".

Input[<i>prompt</i>,<i>init</i>] in a notebook front end uses <i>init</i> as the initial contents of the input field.

---

InputAssumptions
InputAssumptions is an option for WolframAlpha that specifies assumptions for current query input.

---

InputForm
InputForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a version of <i>expr</i> suitable for input to the Wolfram Language. 

---

InputNamePacket
InputNamePacket[<i>string</i>] is a WSTP packet that contains in <i>string</i> the name to be assigned to the next input.

---

InputPacket
InputPacket[] is a WSTP packet that indicates a prompt for input as generated by Input.

---

InputPorts
InputPorts is an option to specify the number, names or shapes of input ports for some neural net layers.

---

InputStream
InputStream["<i>name</i>",<i>n</i>] is an object that represents an input stream for functions such as Read and Find. 

---

InputString
InputString[] interactively reads in a character string. 

InputString[<i>prompt</i>] requests input, displaying <i>prompt</i> as a "prompt". 

InputString[<i>prompt</i>,<i>init</i>] in a notebook front end uses <i>init</i> as the initial contents of the input field.

---

InputStringPacket
InputStringPacket[] is a WSTP packet that requests input in string form.

---

Insert
Insert[<i>list</i>,<i>elem</i>,<i>n</i>] inserts <i>elem</i> at position <i>n</i> in <i>list</i>. If <i>n</i> is negative, the position is counted from the end. 

Insert[<i>expr</i>,<i>elem</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] inserts <i>elem</i> at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…} in <i>expr</i>. 

Insert[<i>expr</i>,<i>elem</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] inserts <i>elem</i> at several positions. 

Insert[<i>elem</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of Insert that can be applied to an expression.

---

InsertionFunction
InsertionFunction is an option for template functions that specifies how expressions are to be processed before they are inserted when the template is applied.

---

InsertLinebreaks
InsertLinebreaks["<i>string</i>"] inserts newline characters into <i>string</i> to make a string in which no line is longer than 78 characters.

InsertLinebreaks["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] inserts newline characters to make no line longer than <i>n</i> characters. 

---

Inset
Inset[<i>obj</i>] represents an object <i>obj</i> inset in a graphic. 

Inset[<i>obj</i>,<i>pos</i>] specifies that the inset should be placed at position <i>pos</i> in the graphic. 

Inset[<i>obj</i>,<i>pos</i>,<i>opos</i>] aligns the inset so that position <i>opos</i> in the object (anchor point)

---

Install
Install["<i>name</i>"] starts a WSTP-compatible external program and installs Wolfram Language definitions to call functions in it. 

---

InstallService
InstallService["<i>url</i>"] installs the web service operations in the WSDL description at the URL given.

InstallService["<i>url</i>", "<i>context`</i>"] installs web service operations, creating functions in the specified context.

---

InstanceNormalizationLayer
InstanceNormalizationLayer[] is equivalent to NormalizationLayer[].

---

InString
InString[<i>n</i>] is a global object that is assigned to be the text of the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> input line. 

---

Integer
Integer is the head used for integers. 

---

IntegerDigits
IntegerDigits[<i>n</i>] gives a list of the decimal digits in the integer <i>n</i>. 

IntegerDigits[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives a list of the base <i>b</i> digits in the integer <i>n</i>. 

IntegerDigits[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>len</i>] pads the list on the left with zeros to give a list of length <i>len</i>. 

IntegerDigits[<i>n</i>,MixedRadix[<i>blist</i>]] uses the mixed radix with list of bases <i>blist</i>.

---

IntegerExponent
IntegerExponent[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the highest power of <i>b</i> that divides <i>n</i>. 

---

IntegerLength
IntegerLength[<i>n</i>] gives the number of digits in the base 10 representation of the integer <i>n</i>.

IntegerLength[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the number of digits in the base <i>b</i> representation of <i>n</i>.

---

IntegerName
IntegerName[<i>n</i>] gives a string containing the full English name of the integer <i>n</i>.

IntegerName[<i>n</i>,<i>qualifier</i>] gives a string conforming to the given qualifications.

---

IntegerPart
IntegerPart[<i>x</i>] gives the integer part of <i>x</i>. 

---

IntegerPartitions
IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>] gives a list of all possible ways to partition the integer <i>n</i> into smaller integers. 

IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives partitions into at most <i>k</i> integers. 

IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>,{<i>k</i>}] gives partitions into exactly <i>k</i> integers. 

IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives partitions into between <i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> integers. 

IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>,<i>kspec</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives partitions involving only the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

IntegerPartitions[<i>n</i>,<i>kspec</i>,<i>sspec</i>,<i>m</i>] limits the result to the first <i>m</i> partitions. 

---

IntegerQ
IntegerQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is an integer, and False otherwise. 

---

IntegerReverse
IntegerReverse[<i>n</i>] gives the integer whose digits are reversed with respect to those of the integer <i>n</i>.

IntegerReverse[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the integer whose digits in base <i>b</i> are reversed with respect to those of <i>n</i>.

IntegerReverse[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>len</i>] gives the integer with reversed digits after padding <i>n</i> with zeros on the left to have <i>len</i> digits.

---

Integers
Integers represents the domain of integers, as in <i>x</i>∈Integers. 

---

IntegerString
IntegerString[<i>n</i>] gives a string consisting of the decimal digits in the integer <i>n</i>. 

IntegerString[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives a string consisting of the base-<i>b</i> digits in the integer <i>n</i>. 

IntegerString[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>len</i>] pads the string on the left with zero digits to give a string of length <i>len</i>. 

IntegerString[<i>n</i>,MixedRadix[<i>blist</i>]] uses the mixed radix with a list of bases <i>blist</i>.

IntegerString[<i>n</i>,<i>"numsys"</i>] gives the numeral form of <i>n</i> based on the numeric system defined by <i>"numsys"</i>.

---

Interactive
Interactive is an option that specifies whether a function should create a user prompt when mimicking an action that would have created a user prompt if invoked manually.

---

InteractiveTradingChart
InteractiveTradingChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>open</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>high</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>low</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>close</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>volume</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] makes a chart showing prices and volume for each date. 

InteractiveTradingChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i><i>}</i>] makes a financial chart for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the <i>daterange</i>. 

InteractiveTradingChart[{…},{<i>ind</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ind</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a financial chart with indicators <i>ind</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>ind</i><sub>2</sub>, … . 

---

InterfaceSwitched
InterfaceSwitched[<|<i>size</i><sub>1</sub><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>size</i><sub>2</sub><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] is a construct that behaves as if it were <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when it is in an interface environment with width <i>size</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

InterfaceSwitched["<i>param</i>",<|<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] behaves as if it were <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when the value of the interface parameter <i>param</i> corresponds to <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Interleaving
Interleaving is an option for Image and related functions that specifies whether data corresponding to different channels in an object such as an image should be interleaved.

---

InternallyBalancedDecomposition
InternallyBalancedDecomposition[<i>ssm</i>] yields the internally balanced decomposition of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

InterpolatingFunction
InterpolatingFunction[<i>domain</i>,<i>table</i>] represents an approximate function whose values are found by interpolation. 

---

InterpolatingPolynomial
InterpolatingPolynomial[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] constructs an interpolating polynomial in <i>x</i> which reproduces the function values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at successive integer values 1, 2, … of <i>x</i>. 

InterpolatingPolynomial[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>x</i>] constructs an interpolating polynomial for the function values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to <i>x</i> values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

InterpolatingPolynomial[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] constructs a multidimensional interpolating polynomial in the variables <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, ….

InterpolatingPolynomial[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>df</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…},{<i>x</i>,…}] constructs an interpolating polynomial that reproduces derivatives as well as function values.

---

Interpolation
Interpolation[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs an interpolation of the function values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, assumed to correspond to <i>x</i> values 1, 2, … . 

Interpolation[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] constructs an interpolation of the function values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to <i>x</i> values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Interpolation[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] constructs an interpolation of multidimensional data.

Interpolation[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>df</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…}] constructs an interpolation that reproduces derivatives as well as function values.

Interpolation[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>] find an interpolation of <i>data</i> at the point <i>x</i>.

---

InterpolationOrder
InterpolationOrder is an option for Interpolation, as well as ListLinePlot, ListPlot3D, ListContourPlot, and related functions, that specifies what order of interpolation to use.

---

InterpolationPoints
InterpolationPoints is an option to SmoothKernelDistribution and FunctionInterpolation that specifies the initial number of interpolation points to use. 

---

Interpretation
Interpretation[<i>e</i>,<i>expr</i>] represents an object that displays as <i>e</i>, but is interpreted as the unevaluated form of <i>expr</i> if supplied as input. 

Interpretation[{<i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i>=<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,…},<i>e</i>,<i>expr</i>] allows local variables <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, … in <i>e</i> and <i>expr</i>.

---

Interpreter
Interpreter[<i>form</i>] represents an interpreter object that can be applied to an input to try to interpret it as an object of the specified form. 

Interpreter[<i>form</i>,<i>test</i>] returns the interpreted object only if applying <i>test</i> to it yields True; otherwise it returns a Failure object.

Interpreter[<i>form</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>fail</i>] returns the result of applying the function <i>fail</i> if the test fails.

---

InterpretTemplate
InterpretTemplate is an experimental function used for interpreting Mathematica input.

---

InterquartileRange
InterquartileRange[<i>data</i>] gives the difference between the upper and lower quartiles q&amp;^<sub>3/4</sub>-q&amp;^<sub>1/4</sub> for the elements in <i>data</i>.

InterquartileRange[<i>data</i>,{{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}}] uses the quantile definition specified by parameters <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>.

InterquartileRange[<i>dist</i>] gives the difference between the upper and lower quartiles q<sub>3/4</sub>-q<sub>1/4</sub> for the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

Interrupt
Interrupt[] generates an interrupt. 

---

IntersectedEntityClass
IntersectedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>class</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents an entity class containing all the entities common to all <i>class</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

IntersectingQ
IntersectingQ[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>list</i><sub>2</sub> have at least one element in common, and False otherwise.

---

Intersection
Intersection[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a sorted list of the elements common to all the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Interval
Interval[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents the range of values between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>. 

Interval[{<i>min</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>max</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>min</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>max</i><sub>2</sub>},…] represents the union of the ranges <i>min</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>max</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>min</i><sub>2</sub> to <i>max</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

IntervalIntersection
IntervalIntersection[<i>interval</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>interval</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the interval representing all points common to each of the <i>interval</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

IntervalMarkers
IntervalMarkers is an option for plotting functions such as ListPlot and BarChart that specifies how to represent uncertainty intervals.

---

IntervalMarkersStyle
IntervalMarkersStyle is an option for plotting functions that specifies styles in which uncertainty intervals are drawn.

---

IntervalMemberQ
IntervalMemberQ[<i>interval</i>,<i>x</i>] gives True if the number <i>x</i> lies within the specified interval, and False otherwise. 

IntervalMemberQ[<i>interval</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>interval</i><sub>2</sub>] gives True if <i>interval</i><sub>2</sub> is completely contained within <i>interval</i><sub>1</sub>. 

IntervalMemberQ[<i>interval</i>] represents an operator form of IntervalMemberQ that can be applied to a number.

---

IntervalUnion
IntervalUnion[<i>interval</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>interval</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives an interval containing the set of all points in any of the <i>interval</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Inverse
Inverse[<i>m</i>] gives the inverse of a square matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

InverseBetaRegularized
InverseBetaRegularized[<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the inverse of the regularized incomplete beta function. 

---

InverseBilateralLaplaceTransform
InverseBilateralLaplaceTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the inverse bilateral Laplace transform of <i>expr</i>. 

InverseBilateralLaplaceTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>t</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional inverse bilateral Laplace transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

InverseBilateralZTransform
InverseBilateralZTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the inverse bilateral Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

InverseBilateralZTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional inverse bilateral Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

InverseCDF
InverseCDF[<i>dist</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the inverse of the cumulative distribution function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>q</i>.

---

InverseChiSquareDistribution
InverseChiSquareDistribution[ν] represents an inverse χ<sup>2</sup> distribution with ν degrees of freedom.

InverseChiSquareDistribution[ν,ξ] represents a scaled inverse χ<sup>2</sup> distribution with ν degrees of freedom and scale ξ.

---

InverseContinuousWaveletTransform
InverseContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>cwd</i>] gives the inverse continuous wavelet transform of a ContinuousWaveletData object <i>cwd</i>. 

InverseContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>cwd,wave</i>] gives the inverse transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

InverseContinuousWaveletTransform[<i>cwd</i><i>,</i><i>wave</i>,<i>octvoc</i>] gives the inverse transform from the wavelet coefficients specified by <i>octvoc</i>.

---

InverseDistanceTransform
InverseDistanceTransform[<i>image</i>] gives the inverse distance transform of <i>image</i>, returning the result as a binary image.

---

InverseEllipticNomeQ
InverseEllipticNomeQ[<i>q</i>] gives the parameter <i>m</i> corresponding to the nome <i>q</i> in an elliptic function. 

---

InverseErf
InverseErf[<i>s</i>] gives the inverse error function obtained as the solution for <i>z</i> in s=erf(z). 

---

InverseErfc
InverseErfc[<i>s</i>] gives the inverse complementary error function obtained as the solution for <i>z</i> in s=erfc(z). 

---

InverseFourier
InverseFourier[<i>list</i>] finds the discrete inverse Fourier transform of a list of complex numbers.

InverseFourier[<i>list</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the specified positions of the discrete inverse Fourier transform. 

---

InverseFourierCosTransform
InverseFourierCosTransform[<i>expr</i>,ω,<i>t</i>] gives the symbolic inverse Fourier cosine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

InverseFourierCosTransform[<i>expr</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional inverse Fourier cosine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

InverseFourierSequenceTransform
InverseFourierSequenceTransform[<i>expr</i>,ω,<i>n</i>] gives the inverse discrete-time Fourier transform of <i>expr</i>.

InverseFourierSequenceTransform[<i>expr</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional inverse Fourier sequence transform.

---

InverseFourierSinTransform
InverseFourierSinTransform[<i>expr</i>,ω,<i>t</i>] gives the symbolic inverse Fourier sine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

InverseFourierSinTransform[<i>expr</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional inverse Fourier sine transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

InverseFourierTransform
InverseFourierTransform[<i>expr</i>,ω,<i>t</i>] gives the symbolic inverse Fourier transform of <i>expr</i>. 

InverseFourierTransform[<i>expr</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional inverse Fourier transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

InverseFunctions
InverseFunctions is an option for Solve and related functions that specifies whether inverse functions should be used. 

---

InverseGammaDistribution
InverseGammaDistribution[α,β] represents an inverse gamma distribution with shape parameter α and scale parameter β.

InverseGammaDistribution[α,β,γ,μ] represents a generalized inverse gamma distribution with shape parameters α and γ, scale parameter β, and location parameter μ.

---

InverseGammaRegularized
InverseGammaRegularized[<i>a</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the inverse of the regularized incomplete gamma function. 

---

InverseGaussianDistribution
InverseGaussianDistribution[μ,λ] represents an inverse Gaussian distribution with mean μ and scale parameter λ.

InverseGaussianDistribution[μ,λ,θ] represents a generalized inverse Gaussian distribution with parameters μ, λ, and θ.

---

InverseGudermannian
InverseGudermannian[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse Gudermannian function gd<sup>-1</sup>(z).

---

InverseHankelTransform
InverseHankelTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the inverse Hankel transform of order 0 for <i>expr</i>.

InverseHankelTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>r</i>,ν] gives the inverse Hankel transform of order ν for <i>expr</i>.

---

InverseHaversine
InverseHaversine[<i>z</i>] gives the inverse haversine function hav<sup>-1</sup>(z).

---

InverseImagePyramid
InverseImagePyramid[<i>pyr</i>] reconstructs an image from an ImagePyramid object <i>pyr</i>.

InverseImagePyramid[<i>pyr</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>] assumes the specified pyramid type <i>pyrtype</i>.

InverseImagePyramid[<i>pyr</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>,<i>n</i>] reconstructs up to pyramid level <i>n</i>.

InverseImagePyramid[<i>pyr</i>,<i>pyrtype</i>,{<i>size</i>}] reconstructs up to the smallest pyramid level larger than the specified <i>size</i>.

---

InverseJacobiCD
InverseJacobiCD[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function cd<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiCN
InverseJacobiCN[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function cn<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiCS
InverseJacobiCS[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function cs<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiDC
InverseJacobiDC[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function dc<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiDN
InverseJacobiDN[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function dn<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiDS
InverseJacobiDS[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function ds<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiNC
InverseJacobiNC[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function nc<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiND
InverseJacobiND[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function nd<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiNS
InverseJacobiNS[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function ns<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiSC
InverseJacobiSC[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function sc<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiSD
InverseJacobiSD[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function sd<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseJacobiSN
InverseJacobiSN[<i>v</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the inverse Jacobi elliptic function sn<sup>-1</sup>(vm).

---

InverseMellinTransform
InverseMellinTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the inverse Mellin transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

InversePermutation
InversePermutation[<i>perm</i>] returns the inverse of permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

InverseRadon
InverseRadon[<i>image</i>] gives the inverse discrete Radon transform of <i>image</i>.

InverseRadon[<i>image</i>,<i>{</i><i>w,h</i>}] specifies the width <i>w</i> and the height <i>h</i> of the resulting image.

---

InverseRadonTransform
InverseRadonTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>p</i>,ϕ},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives the inverse Radon transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

InverseSeries
InverseSeries[<i>s</i>] takes the series <i>s</i>, and gives a series for the inverse of the function represented by <i>s</i>. 

InverseSeries[<i>s</i>,<i>x</i>] uses the variable <i>x</i> in the inverse series.

---

InverseShortTimeFourier
InverseShortTimeFourier[<i>input</i>] reconstructs the signal from short-time Fourier data.

InverseShortTimeFourier[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>] assumes the spectrogram data was computed with partitions of length <i>n</i>.

InverseShortTimeFourier[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] assumes partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

InverseShortTimeFourier[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] assumes a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> was applied to each partition.

---

InverseSpectrogram
InverseSpectrogram[<i>data</i>] reconstructs the signal from the magnitude spectrogram <i>data</i>.

InverseSpectrogram[<i>img</i>] reconstructs the signal, assuming that the image <i>img</i> is the magnitude spectrogram.

InverseSpectrogram[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>] assumes the spectrogram data was computed with partitions of length <i>n</i>.

InverseSpectrogram[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] assumes partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

InverseSpectrogram[<i>input</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] assumes a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> was applied to each partition.

---

InverseSurvivalFunction
InverseSurvivalFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the inverse of the survival function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>q</i>.

---

InverseTransformedRegion
InverseTransformedRegion[<i>reg</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents the inverse transformed region {p∈<sup>n</sup>|f(p)∈reg}, where <i>reg</i> is a region and <i>f</i> is a function. 

---

InverseWaveletTransform
InverseWaveletTransform[<i>dwd</i>] gives the inverse wavelet transform of a DiscreteWaveletData object <i>dwd</i>.

InverseWaveletTransform[<i>dwd</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the inverse transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

InverseWaveletTransform[<i>dwd</i>,<i>wave</i>,<i>wind</i>] gives the inverse transform from the wavelet coefficients specified by <i>wind</i>.

---

InverseWeierstrassP
InverseWeierstrassP[<i>p</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives a value of <i>u</i> for which the Weierstrass function ℘(u;g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>) is equal to <i>p</i>. 

---

InverseWishartMatrixDistribution
InverseWishartMatrixDistribution[<i>ν</i>,Σ] represents an inverse Wishart matrix distribution with ν degrees of freedom and covariance matrix Σ.

---

InverseZTransform
InverseZTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the inverse Z transform of <i>expr</i>.
