InverseZTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub>m</sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub>m</sub>}] gives the multiple inverse Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

Invisible
Invisible[<i>expr</i>] displays as space that is the same size as the formatted version of <i>expr</i>.

---

IPAddress
IPAddress["<i>address</i>"] is a symbolic representation of an IPv4 or IPv6 IP address.

---

IrreduciblePolynomialQ
IrreduciblePolynomialQ[<i>poly</i>] tests whether <i>poly</i> is an irreducible polynomial over the rationals.

IrreduciblePolynomialQ[<i>poly</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] tests whether <i>poly</i> is irreducible modulo a prime <i>p</i>.

IrreduciblePolynomialQ[<i>poly</i>,Extension{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether <i>poly</i> is irreducible over the field extension generated by the algebraic numbers <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

IrreduciblePolynomialQ[<i>poly</i>,ExtensionAll] tests whether <i>poly</i> is absolutely irreducible over the complex numbers.

---

IslandData
IslandData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the island <i>entity</i>.

IslandData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified island entities.

IslandData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

IsolatingInterval
IsolatingInterval[<i>a</i>] gives a rational isolating interval for the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

IsolatingInterval[<i>a</i>,<i>dx</i>] gives an isolating interval of width at most <i>dx</i>.

---

IsomorphicGraphQ
IsomorphicGraphQ[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub> are isomorphic, and False otherwise.

---

IsomorphicSubgraphQ
IsomorphicSubgraphQ[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> is isomorphic to a subgraph of the graph <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

IsotopeData
IsotopeData[{<i>Z</i>,<i>A</i>},"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the isotope with atomic number <i>Z</i> and mass number <i>A</i>.

IsotopeData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the property for the named isotope.

---

Italic
Italic represents an italic font slant.

---

ItoProcess
ItoProcess[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>] represents an Ito process x(t), where x(t)a(t,x(t))t+b(t,x(t)).w(t).

ItoProcess[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>] represents an Ito process y(t)c(t,x(t)), where x(t)a(t,x(t))t+b(t,x(t)).w(t) .

ItoProcess[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub>0</sub>}] uses initial condition x(t<sub>0</sub>)x<sub>0</sub>.

ItoProcess[…,…,…,Σ] uses a Wiener process w(t), with covariance Σ.

ItoProcess[<i>proc</i>] converts <i>proc</i> to a standard Ito process whenever possible. 

ItoProcess[<i>sdeqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>w</i><i>dproc</i>] represents an Ito process specified by a stochastic differential equation <i>sdeqns</i>, output expression <i>expr</i>, with state <i>x</i> and time <i>t</i>, driven by <i>w</i> following the process <i>dproc</i>. 

---

JaccardDissimilarity
JaccardDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Jaccard dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

JacobiAmplitude
JacobiAmplitude[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the amplitude am(um) for Jacobi elliptic functions. 

---

Jacobian
Jacobian is an option for FindRoot. Jacobian -> Automatic attempts symbolic computation of the Jacobian of the system of functions whose root is being sought. A typical setting is Jacobian -> {{2 <i>x</i>, Sign[<i>y</i>]}, {<i>y</i>, <i>x</i>}}.

---

JacobiCD
JacobiCD[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function cd(u|m).

---

JacobiCN
JacobiCN[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function cn(u|m).

---

JacobiCS
JacobiCS[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function cs(u|m).

---

JacobiDC
JacobiDC[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function dc(u|m).

---

JacobiDN
JacobiDN[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function dn(u|m).

---

JacobiDS
JacobiDS[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function ds(u|m).

---

JacobiEpsilon
JacobiEpsilon[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi epsilon function ℰ(um).

---

JacobiNC
JacobiNC[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function nc(u|m).

---

JacobiND
JacobiND[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function nd(u|m).

---

JacobiNS
JacobiNS[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function ns(u|m).

---

JacobiP
JacobiP[<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Jacobi polynomial P<sub>n</sub><sup>(a,b)</sup>(x). 

---

JacobiSC
JacobiSC[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function sc(u|m).

---

JacobiSD
JacobiSD[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function sd(u|m).

---

JacobiSN
JacobiSN[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi elliptic function sn(um).

---

JacobiSymbol
JacobiSymbol[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi symbol (n/m). 

---

JacobiZeta
JacobiZeta[ϕ,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi zeta function Ζ(ϕm). 

---

JacobiZN
JacobiZN[<i>u</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Jacobi zeta function zn(um).

---

JankoGroupJ1
JankoGroupJ1[] represents the sporadic simple Janko group J<sub>1</sub>.

---

JankoGroupJ2
JankoGroupJ2[] represents the sporadic simple Janko group J<sub>2</sub>.

---

JankoGroupJ3
JankoGroupJ3[] represents the sporadic simple Janko group J<sub>3</sub>.

---

JankoGroupJ4
JankoGroupJ4[] represents the sporadic simple Janko group J<sub>4</sub>.

---

JarqueBeraALMTest
JarqueBeraALMTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Jarque–Bera ALM test.

JarqueBeraALMTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

JohnsonDistribution
JohnsonDistribution["SB",γ,δ,μ,σ] represents a bounded Johnson distribution with shape parameters γ, δ, location parameter μ, and scale parameter σ.

JohnsonDistribution["SL",γ,δ,μ,σ] represents a semi-bounded Johnson distribution.

JohnsonDistribution["SU",γ,δ,μ,σ] represents an unbounded Johnson distribution.

JohnsonDistribution["SN",γ,δ,μ,σ] represents a normal Johnson distribution.

---

Join
Join[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…] concatenates lists or other expressions that share the same head.

Join[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i>] joins the objects at level <i>n</i> in each of the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

JoinAcross
JoinAcross[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>key</i>] gives a list of associations obtained by joining those pairs of associations <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> in which the values associated with <i>key</i> are the same. 

JoinAcross[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] joins pairs of associations only when the values associated with all keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are the same.

JoinAcross[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>key</i><sub><i>a</i></sub><i>key</i><sub><i>b</i></sub>] joins pairs of associations <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> in which the values associated with <i>key</i><sub><i>a</i></sub> in the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are the same as those associated with <i>key</i><sub><i>b</i></sub> in the <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

JoinAcross[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>{</i><i>key</i><sub><i>a</i><sub>1</sub></sub><i>key</i><sub><i>b</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…}] joins pairs of associations in which pairs of corresponding values agree.

JoinAcross[<i>alist</i>,<i>blist</i>,<i>keyspec</i>,"<i>joinspec</i>"] uses <i>joinspec</i> to determine when to allow associations that contain missing elements to be generated.

---

Joined
Joined is an option for ListPlot and related functions that specifies whether points in each dataset should be joined into a line, or should be plotted as separate points. 

---

JoinedCurve
JoinedCurve[{<i>segment</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>segment</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a curve consisting of <i>segment</i><sub>1</sub> followed by <i>segment</i><sub>2</sub> etc. 

JoinedCurve[{<i>component</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>component</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a list of separate component curves <i>component</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>component</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

---

JoinForm
JoinForm[<i>type</i>] is a graphics directive that specifies what type of joins should be used to connect segments of lines, tubes, edges, and related primitives.

---

JordanDecomposition
JordanDecomposition[<i>m</i>] yields the Jordan decomposition of a square matrix <i>m</i>. The result is a list {<i>s</i>,<i>j</i>} where <i>s</i> is a similarity matrix and <i>j</i> is the Jordan canonical form of <i>m</i>.

---

JordanModelDecomposition
JordanModelDecomposition[<i>ssm</i>] yields the Jordan decomposition of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>. 

---

JulianDate
JulianDate[] gives the current number of days since noon on November 24, 4714 BCE in the GMT time zone. 

JulianDate[<i>date</i>] gives the number of days for the specified date.

JulianDate["<i>type</i>"] gives the Julian date variant of the specified type.

JulianDate["<i>type</i>",<i>date</i>] gives the variant for the specified date.

---

JuliaSetBoettcher
JuliaSetBoettcher[<i>c</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Böttcher coordinate of <i>z</i> with respect to the quadratic Julia set <i>J</i><sub><i>c</i></sub>.

---

K
K is a default generic name for a summation index in a symbolic sum.

---

KagiChart
KagiChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a Kagi chart with prices <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at date <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

KagiChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i>}] makes a Kagi chart of closing prices for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the date range <i>daterange</i>.

KagiChart[{…},<i>rt</i>] makes a Kagi chart with reversal threshold <i>rt</i>.

---

KaiserBesselWindow
KaiserBesselWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Kaiser–Bessel window function of <i>x</i>.

---

KaiserWindow
KaiserWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Kaiser window function of <i>x</i>.

KaiserWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

KalmanEstimator
KalmanEstimator[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>}] constructs the Kalman estimator for the StateSpaceModel <i>ssm</i> with process and measurement noise covariance matrices <i>w</i> and <i>v</i>. 

KalmanEstimator[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>h</i>}] includes the cross-covariance matrix <i>h</i>.

KalmanEstimator[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>},{…}] specifies <i>sensors</i> as the noisy measurements of <i>ssm</i>.

KalmanEstimator[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>,<i>dinputs</i>},{…}] specifies <i>dinputs</i> as the deterministic inputs of <i>ssm</i>.

---

KalmanFilter
KalmanFilter[<i>tproc</i>,<i>data</i>] filters <i>data</i> using the time series model given by <i>tproc</i>.

---

KarhunenLoeveDecomposition
KarhunenLoeveDecomposition[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the Karhunen–Loeve transform {{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>m</i>} of the numerical arrays {<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}, where <i>m</i>.<i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

KarhunenLoeveDecomposition[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>m</i>] uses the inverse of the matrix <i>m</i> for transforming <i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

KaryTree
KaryTree[<i>n</i>] gives a binary tree with <i>n</i> vertices.

KaryTree[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a <i>k</i>-ary tree with <i>n</i> vertices.

---

KatzCentrality
KatzCentrality[<i>g</i>,α] gives a list of Katz centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i> and weight α.

KatzCentrality[<i>g</i>,α,β] gives a list of Katz centralities using weight α and initial centralities β.

KatzCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

KCoreComponents
KCoreComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-core components of the underlying simple graph of <i>g</i>.

KCoreComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,"In"] gives the <i>k</i>-core components with vertex in-degrees at least <i>k</i>.

KCoreComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,"Out"] gives the <i>k</i>-core components with vertex out-degrees at least <i>k</i>.

KCoreComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

KDistribution
KDistribution[ν,<i>w</i>] represents a K distribution with shape parameters ν and <i>w</i>.

---

KEdgeConnectedComponents
KEdgeConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-edge-connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

KEdgeConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the <i>k</i>-edge-connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

KEdgeConnectedComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

KEdgeConnectedGraphQ
KEdgeConnectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is <i>k</i>-edge-connected and False otherwise.

---

KeepExistingVersion
KeepExistingVersion is an option for PacletInstall and PacletInstallSubmit that specifies whether an older version of a paclet should remain installed when a newer one gets installed. 

---

KelvinBei
KelvinBei[<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function bei(z).

KelvinBei[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function bei<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

KelvinBer
KelvinBer[<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function ber(z).

KelvinBer[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function ber<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

KelvinKei
KelvinKei[<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function kei(z).

KelvinKei[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function kei<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

KelvinKer
KelvinKer[<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function ker(z).

KelvinKer[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Kelvin function ker<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

KendallTauTest
KendallTauTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

KendallTauTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

KendallTauTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

KernelFunction
KernelFunction[<i>f</i>] represents a function to be evaluated in the Wolfram Language kernel, even when called from compiled code.

---

KernelMixtureDistribution
KernelMixtureDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a kernel mixture distribution based on the data values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

KernelMixtureDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] represents a multivariate kernel mixture distribution based on data values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…}.

KernelMixtureDistribution[…,<i>bw</i>] represents a kernel mixture distribution with bandwidth <i>bw</i>.

KernelMixtureDistribution[…,<i>bw</i>,<i>ker</i>] represents a kernel mixture distribution with bandwidth <i>bw</i> and smoothing kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

KernelObject
KernelObject[…] represents a kernel available for parallel computing.

---

Kernels
Kernels[] gives the list of running kernels available for parallel computing.

---

Key
Key[<i>key</i>] represents a key used to access a value in an association or a column in a Tabular object.

Key[<i>key</i>][<i>assoc</i>] extracts the value corresponding to <i>key</i> in the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

KeyCollisionFunction
KeyCollisionFunction is an option for JoinAcross that specifies how to handle pairs of elements that are not being joined but nevertheless have the same key.

---

KeyComplement
KeyComplement[{<i>assoc</i><sub><i>all</i></sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an association in which only elements whose keys appear in <i>assoc</i><sub><i>all</i></sub> but not in any of the <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are retained.

---

KeyDrop
KeyDrop[<i>assoc</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields an association from which elements with keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> have been dropped. 

KeyDrop[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>keys</i>] gives a list of associations.

KeyDrop[<i>keys</i>] represents an operator form of KeyDrop that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyDropFrom
KeyDropFrom[<i>a</i>,<i>key</i>] changes the association <i>a</i> by dropping the element with the specified key.

KeyDropFrom[<i>a</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] drops the elements with keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

KeyExistsQ
KeyExistsQ[<i>assoc</i>,<i>key</i>] returns True if the specified <i>key</i> exists in the association <i>assoc</i>, and False otherwise.

KeyExistsQ[<i>key</i>] represents an operator form of KeyExistsQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyFreeQ
KeyFreeQ[<i>assoc</i>,<i>form</i>] yields True if no key in the association <i>assoc</i> matches <i>form</i>, and yields False otherwise.

KeyFreeQ[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of KeyFreeQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyIntersection
KeyIntersection[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a list of associations in which only elements whose keys appear in all the <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are retained.

---

KeyMap
KeyMap[<i>f</i>,<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] maps <i>f</i> over the keys in an association, giving <i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>]<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>]<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,….

KeyMap[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of KeyMap that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyMemberQ
KeyMemberQ[<i>assoc</i>,<i>form</i>] yields True if a key in the association <i>assoc</i> matches <i>form</i>, and False otherwise.

KeyMemberQ[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of KeyMemberQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeypointStrength
KeypointStrength is an option for ImageKeypoints and related functions to specify a minimum strength of detected keypoints.

---

Keys
Keys[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a list of the keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in an association.

Keys[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in a list of rules.

Keys[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] gives a list of keys in <i>expr</i>, wrapping each of them with head <i>h</i> before evaluation.

---

KeySelect
KeySelect[<i>assoc</i>,<i>crit</i>] selects elements in the association <i>assoc</i> for which <i>crit</i> applied to their keys is True.

KeySelect[<i>crit</i>] represents an operator form of KeySelect that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeySort
KeySort[<i>assoc</i>] orders the elements of an association by sorting its keys.

KeySort[<i>assoc</i>,<i>p</i>] orders the elements of an association using the ordering function <i>p</i>.

---

KeySortBy
KeySortBy[<i>assoc</i>,<i>f</i>] sorts the elements of an association in the order defined by applying <i>f</i> to each of their keys.

KeySortBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of KeySortBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyTake
KeyTake[<i>assoc</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields an association containing only the elements with keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

KeyTake[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>keys</i>] gives a list of associations.

KeyTake[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an operator form of KeyTake that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyUnion
KeyUnion[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a list of associations in which each association has the union of the keys of the <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, padding by inserting values of Missing[…] if necessary.

KeyUnion[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] uses <i>f</i>[<i>key</i>] as the value associated with a missing key. 

---

KeyValueMap
KeyValueMap[<i>f</i>,<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the list {<i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>f</i>[<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>],…}.

KeyValueMap[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of KeyValueMap that can be applied to an expression.

---

KeyValuePattern
KeyValuePattern[{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] is a pattern object that represents an association or list of rules that includes elements matching each of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Khinchin
Khinchin is Khinchin's constant, with numerical value ≃2.68545. 

---

KillProcess
KillProcess[proc] kills the external process represented by the ProcessObject proc.

---

KirchhoffGraph
KirchhoffGraph[<i>kmat</i>] gives the graph with Kirchhoff matrix <i>kmat</i>.

KirchhoffGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>kmat</i>] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and Kirchhoff matrix <i>kmat</i>.

---

KirchhoffMatrix
KirchhoffMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the Kirchhoff matrix of the graph <i>g</i>.

KirchhoffMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

KleinInvariantJ
KleinInvariantJ[τ] gives the Klein invariant modular elliptic function J(τ). 

---

KnapsackSolve
KnapsackSolve[{<i>cost</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cost</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>maxtotalcost</i>] solves the knapsack problem of finding the maximum number of items associated with each of the <i>cost</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, subject to the constraint that the total cost is not larger than <i>maxtotalcost</i>.

KnapsackSolve[{{<i>payoff</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cost</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>payoff</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>cost</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>maxtotalcost</i>] finds a number of items that maximizes the total payoff, while satisfying the constraint on the total cost.

KnapsackSolve[{{<i>payoff</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cost</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>maxcount</i><sub>1</sub>},…},<i>maxtotalcost</i>] allows at most <i>maxcount</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> copies of item <i>i</i>.

KnapsackSolve[<i>items</i>,{<i>maxtotalpayoff</i>,<i>maxtotalcost</i>}] finds a result that gives a total payoff not larger than <i>maxtotalpayoff</i>.

KnapsackSolve[<i>items</i>,{<i>maxtotalpayoff</i>,<i>maxtotalcost</i>,<i>maxtotalcount</i>}] adds the constraint of having no more than <i>maxtotalcount</i> items in total. 

KnapsackSolve[<i>label</i><sub>1</sub><i>itemspec</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>maxtotals</i>] labels each type of item and gives the result as an association.

---

KnightTourGraph
KnightTourGraph[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a Knight's tour graph on an <i>m</i><i>n</i> chessboard.

---

KnotData
KnotData[<i>knot</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property for a knot.

KnotData[<i>knot</i>] gives an image of the knot.

KnotData["<i>class</i>"] gives a list of knots in the specified class.

---

KnownUnitQ
KnownUnitQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a canonical unit, and False otherwise.

KnownUnitQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>dims</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a canonical unit with physical dimensions <i>dims</i>, and False otherwise.

---

KochCurve
KochCurve[<i>n</i>] gives the line segments representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Koch curve.

KochCurve[<i>n</i>,{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,…}] takes a series of steps of unit length at successive relative angles θ<sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

KochCurve[<i>n</i>,{{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>1</sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>},…}] takes successive steps of lengths proportional to <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

KolmogorovSmirnovTest
KolmogorovSmirnovTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Kolmogorov–Smirnov test.

KolmogorovSmirnovTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Kolmogorov–Smirnov test.

KolmogorovSmirnovTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

KroneckerDelta
KroneckerDelta[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the Kronecker delta δ<sub>n<sub>1</sub> n<sub>2</sub> …</sub>, equal to 1 if all the n<sub>i</sub> are equal, and 0 otherwise. 

---

KroneckerModelDecomposition
KroneckerModelDecomposition[<i>ssm</i>] yields the Kronecker decomposition of a descriptor state-space model <i>ssm</i>. 

---

KroneckerProduct
KroneckerProduct[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…] constructs the Kronecker product of the arrays <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

KroneckerSymbol
KroneckerSymbol[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Kronecker symbol (n/m). 

---

KuiperTest
KuiperTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Kuiper test.

KuiperTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Kuiper test.

KuiperTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

KumaraswamyDistribution
KumaraswamyDistribution[α,β] represents a Kumaraswamy distribution with shape parameters α and β.

---

Kurtosis
Kurtosis[<i>data</i>] gives the coefficient of kurtosis for the elements in <i>data</i>.

Kurtosis[<i>dist</i>] gives the coefficient of kurtosis for the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

KuwaharaFilter
KuwaharaFilter[<i>data,r</i><i>]</i> computes for each element <i>p</i> in <i>data</i> the variance of the values in the four (<i>r</i>+1)×(<i>r</i>+1) squares that have <i>p</i> as a corner, and replaces <i>p</i> with the mean of the values of the square with least variance.

---

KVertexConnectedComponents
KVertexConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-vertex-connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

KVertexConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the <i>k</i>-vertex-connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

---

KVertexConnectedGraphQ
KVertexConnectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is <i>k</i>-vertex-connected and False otherwise.

---

LABColor
LABColor[<i>l</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a color in the CIELAB color space with lightness <i>l</i> and color components <i>a</i> and <i>b</i>. 

LABColor[<i>l</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>α</i>] specifies opacity <i>α</i>. 

LABColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

LABColor[<i>color</i>] returns the CIELAB representation of <i>color</i>.

---

Label
Label[<i>tag</i>] represents a point in a compound expression to which control can be transferred using Goto. 

---

Labeled
Labeled[<i>expr</i>,<i>lbl</i>] displays <i>expr</i> labeled with <i>lbl</i>. 

Labeled[<i>expr</i>,<i>lbl</i>,<i>pos</i>] places <i>lbl</i> at a position specified by <i>pos</i>. 

Labeled[<i>expr</i>,{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] places the <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Labeled[<i>expr</i>,{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>3</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>4</sub>},All] places the <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the bottom, left, top, and right, respectively. 

---

LabelingFunction
LabelingFunction is an option for data visualization functions to automatically label elements of a visualization.

---

LabelingSize
LabelingSize is an option to visualization functions that specifies the size to be used for labels and callouts.

---

LabelVisibility
LabelVisibility is an option for Callout and Labeled in plotting functions that determines which labels are shown.

---

LakeData
LakeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the lake <i>entity</i>.

LakeData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified lake entities.

LakeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

LambdaComponents
LambdaComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the lambda components of the graph <i>g</i>.

LambdaComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the lambda components that include at least one of the vertices {<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

LambdaComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

LameC
LameC[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé function <i>Ec<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(zm)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m.

---

LameCPrime
LameCPrime[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the z-derivative of the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé function <i>Ec<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(zm)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m.

---

LameEigenvalueA
LameEigenvalueA[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé eigenvalue <i>a<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(m)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m for the function LameC[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>].

---

LameEigenvalueB
LameEigenvalueB[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé eigenvalue <i>b<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(m)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m for the Lamé function LameS[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>].

---

LameS
LameS[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé function <i>Es<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(zm)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m.

---

LameSPrime
LameSPrime[ν,<i>j</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the z-derivative of the j<sup>th</sup> Lamé function <i>Es<sub>ν</sub><sup>(j)</sup>(zm)</i> of order ν with elliptic parameter m.

---

LaminaData
LaminaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the lamina <i>entity</i>.

LaminaData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified lamina entities.

LaminaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

LanczosWindow
LanczosWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Lanczos window function of <i>x</i>.

---

LandauDistribution
LandauDistribution[μ,σ] represents a Landau distribution with location parameter μ and scale parameter σ.

LandauDistribution[] represents a Landau distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

Language
Language is an option that specifies the language to use.

---

LanguageCategory
LanguageCategory is an option for Cell that determines in what category of language the contents of the cell should be assumed to be for purposes of spell checking and hyphenation. 

---

LanguageData
LanguageData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the language <i>entity</i>.

LanguageData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified language entities.

LanguageData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

LanguageIdentify
LanguageIdentify["<i>string</i>"] attempts to determine what human language text in <i>string</i> is in, predominantly.

LanguageIdentify[<i>audio</i>] performs language identification in audio recording <i>audio</i>.

LanguageIdentify[<i>video</i>] performs language identification of the audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

LaplaceDistribution
LaplaceDistribution[μ,β] represents a Laplace double-exponential distribution with mean μ and scale parameter β.

LaplaceDistribution[] represents a Laplace double-exponential distribution with mean 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

Laplacian
Laplacian[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Laplacian ∂<sup>2</sup>f/∂x<sub>1</sub><sup>2</sup>+…+∂<sup>2</sup>f/∂x<sub>n</sub><sup>2</sup>.

Laplacian[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] gives the Laplacian in the given coordinates <i>chart</i>.

---

LaplacianFilter
LaplacianFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] convolves <i>data</i> with a radius-<i>r</i> Laplacian kernel.

LaplacianFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses radius <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i> in <i>data</i>.

---

LaplacianGaussianFilter
LaplacianGaussianFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] convolves <i>data</i> with a Laplacian of Gaussian kernel of pixel radius <i>r</i>.

LaplacianGaussianFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i>,σ}]  convolves <i>data</i> with a Laplacian of Gaussian kernel of radius <i>r</i> and standard deviation σ.

---

LaplacianPDETerm
LaplacianPDETerm[<i>vars</i>] represents a Laplacian term ∇<sup>2</sup><sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i> with model variables <i>vars</i>.

LaplacianPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

Large
Large is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be large.

---

Larger
Larger is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be larger.

---

Last
Last[<i>expr</i>] gives the last element in <i>expr</i>. 

Last[<i>expr</i>,<i>def</i>] gives the last element if there are any elements, or <i>def</i> otherwise.

---

Latitude
Latitude[<i>pos</i>] gives the latitude in degrees of a geographic position specified by <i>pos</i>.

Latitude[<i>pos</i>,<i>datum</i>] gives the latitude referring to the specified geodetic datum.

---

LatitudeLongitude
LatitudeLongitude[<i>pos</i>] gives a list of the latitude and longitude in degrees of a geographic position specified by <i>pos</i>.

LatitudeLongitude[<i>pos</i>,<i>datum</i>] gives the latitude and longitude referring to the specified geodetic datum.

---

LatticeData
LatticeData[<i>lattice</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property for a lattice.

LatticeData[<i>n</i>] gives a list of named lattices of dimension <i>n</i>.

---

LatticeReduce
LatticeReduce[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a reduced basis for the set of vectors <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Launch
Launch is a setting for the LinkMode option of LinkOpen.  LinkMode->Launch causes a link to be created by launching another program.

---

LaunchKernels
LaunchKernels[] launches all currently configured parallel subkernels.

LaunchKernels[<i>n</i>] launches <i>n</i> local subkernels on the current computer.

LaunchKernels[<i>ker</i>] launches the kernel specified by <i>ker</i>.

LaunchKernels[{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] launches the kernels <i>ker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

LayeredGraphPlot
LayeredGraphPlot[<i>g</i>] generates a layered plot of the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a layered plot of the graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

LayeredGraphPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot[{<i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub></i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>ik</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>jk</i></sub> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot[<i>m</i>] uses the adjacency matrix <i>m</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot[…,<i>v</i><i>pos</i>] places the dominant vertex <i>v</i> in the plot at position <i>pos</i>.

---

LayeredGraphPlot3D
LayeredGraphPlot3D[<i>g</i>] generates a 3D layered plot of the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot3D[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a 3D layered plot of the graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LayeredGraphPlot3D[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>ik</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>jk</i></sub> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot3D[<i>m</i>] uses the adjacency matrix <i>m</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

LayeredGraphPlot3D[…,<i>v</i><i>pos</i>] places the dominant vertex <i>v</i> in the plot at position <i>pos</i>.

---

LayerSizeFunction
LayerSizeFunction is an option for TreePlot that gives a function to specify the relative height to allow for each layer.

---

LCHColor
LCHColor[<i>l</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>h</i>] represents a color in the LCH color space with lightness <i>l</i>, chroma <i>c</i> and hue <i>h</i>.

LCHColor[<i>l</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

LCHColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

LCHColor[<i>color</i>] returns the LCH representation of <i>color</i>.

---

LCM
LCM[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the least common multiple of the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

LeaderSize
LeaderSize is an option for Callout that specifies what sizes to use for leader lines.

---

LeafCount
LeafCount[<i>expr</i>] gives the total number of indivisible subexpressions in <i>expr</i>. 

---

LeapVariant
LeapVariant[<i>n</i>] represents a repeated calendar element caused by a leap period.

---

LeapYearQ
LeapYearQ[<i>date</i>] returns True if the year corresponding to <i>date</i> is a leap year.

---

LearnDistribution
LearnDistribution[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a LearnedDistribution[…] that attempts to represent an underlying distribution for the examples given.

---

LearnedDistribution
LearnedDistribution[…] represents a distribution generated by LearnDistribution.

---

LearningRate
LearningRate is an option for NetTrain that specifies the rate at which to adjust neural net weights in order to minimize the training loss.

---

LearningRateMultipliers
LearningRateMultipliers is an option for net layers and for NetTrain, NetChain, NetGraph that specifies learning rate multipliers to apply during training.

---

LeastSquares
LeastSquares[<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>] finds an <i>x</i> that solves the linear least-squares problem for the matrix equation <i>m</i>.<i>x</i>==<i>b</i>.

LeastSquares[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] finds an <i>x</i> that solves the linear least-squares problem for the array equation <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>==<i>b</i>.

---

LeastSquaresFilterKernel
LeastSquaresFilterKernel[{{ω<sub>1</sub>,…,ω<sub><i>k-1</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}},<i>n</i>] creates a <i>k</i>-band finite impulse response (FIR) filter kernel of length <i>n</i> designed using a least squares method, given the specified frequencies ω<sub><i>i</i></sub> and amplitudes <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LeastSquaresFilterKernel[{"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>},<i>n</i>] uses the full filter specification {"<i>type</i>",<i>spec</i>}.

---

Left
Left is a symbol that represents the left-hand side for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

LeftArrow
LeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>←<i>y</i>←….

---

LeftArrowBar
LeftArrowBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇤<i>y</i>⇤….

---

LeftArrowRightArrow
LeftArrowRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇆<i>y</i>⇆….

---

LeftDownTeeVector
LeftDownTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥡<i>y</i>⥡….

---

LeftDownVector
LeftDownVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇃<i>y</i>⇃….

---

LeftDownVectorBar
LeftDownVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥙<i>y</i>⥙….

---

LeftRightArrow
LeftRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↔<i>y</i>↔….

---

LeftRightVector
LeftRightVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥎<i>y</i>⥎….

---

LeftTee
LeftTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊣y.

---

LeftTeeArrow
LeftTeeArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↤<i>y</i>↤….

---

LeftTeeVector
LeftTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥚<i>y</i>⥚….

---

LeftTriangle
LeftTriangle[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊲<i>y</i>⊲….

---

LeftTriangleBar
LeftTriangleBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⧏<i>y</i>⧏….

---

LeftTriangleEqual
LeftTriangleEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊴<i>y</i>⊴….

---

LeftUpDownVector
LeftUpDownVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥑<i>y</i>⥑….

---

LeftUpTeeVector
LeftUpTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥠<i>y</i>⥠….

---

LeftUpVector
LeftUpVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↿<i>y</i>↿….

---

LeftUpVectorBar
LeftUpVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥘<i>y</i>⥘….

---

LeftVector
LeftVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↼<i>y</i>↼….

---

LeftVectorBar
LeftVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥒<i>y</i>⥒….

---

LegendAppearance
LegendAppearance is an option for charting functions that specifies the appearance of any legends that are generated.

---

Legended
Legended[<i>expr</i>,<i>leg</i>] displays <i>expr</i> with legend <i>leg</i>. 

Legended[<i>expr</i>,<i>lbl</i>] indicates in plotting and charting functions that a legend entry for <i>expr</i> should be created, with label <i>lbl</i>.

---

LegendFunction
LegendFunction is an option for legends that specifies an overall function to apply to the generated legend.

---

LegendLabel
LegendLabel is an option for legends that specifies an overall label for a legend.

---

LegendLayout
LegendLayout is an option for legends that specifies how to format the legend content.

---

LegendMargins
LegendMargins is an option for legends that specifies the margins to leave around the legend.

---

LegendMarkers
LegendMarkers is an option for legends such as PointLegend that specifies markers for each element.

---

LegendMarkerSize
LegendMarkerSize is an option for legends such as PointLegend that specifies the size of marker regions for each element.

---

Length
Length[<i>expr</i>] gives the number of elements in <i>expr</i>. 

---

LengthWhile
LengthWhile[<i>list</i>,<i>crit</i>] gives the number of contiguous elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> starting at the beginning of <i>list</i> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

---

LerchPhi
LerchPhi[<i>z</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the Lerch transcendent Φ(z,s,a). 

---

Less
<i>x</i><<i>y</i> yields True if x is determined to be less than y. 

<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><<i>x</i><sub>3</sub> yields True if the x<sub>i</sub> form a strictly increasing sequence. 

---

LessEqual
<i>x</i><=<i>y</i> or <i>x</i>≤<i>y</i> yields True if <i>x</i> is determined to be less than or equal to <i>y</i>.

<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>≤<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>≤<i>x</i><sub>3</sub> yields True if the x<sub>i</sub> form a nondecreasing sequence. 

---

LessEqualGreater
LessEqualGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⋚y⋚….

---

LessEqualThan
LessEqualThan[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x</i>≤<i>y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

LessFullEqual
LessFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≦y≦….

---

LessGreater
LessGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≶y≶….

---

LessLess
LessLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≪y≪….

---

LessSlantEqual
LessSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⩽y⩽….

---

LessThan
LessThan[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x</i><<i>y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

LessTilde
LessTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x≲y≲….

---

LetterCharacter
LetterCharacter represents a letter character in StringExpression.

---

LetterCounts
LetterCounts["<i>string</i>"] gives an association whose keys are the distinct letters in <i>string</i>, and whose values give the number of times those letters appear in <i>string</i>.

LetterCounts["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives counts of the distinct <i>n</i>-grams consisting of runs of <i>n</i> letters in <i>string</i>.

LetterCounts["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>,{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] allows the characters <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to appear in <i>n</i>-grams, in addition to ordinary letters.

LetterCounts[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives the counts for each of the <i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

LetterNumber
LetterNumber["<i>c</i>"] gives the position of the character <i>c</i> in the English alphabet.

LetterNumber["<i>c</i>",<i>alpha</i>] gives the position of <i>c</i> in the alphabet specified by <i>alpha</i>.

LetterNumber["<i>string</i>",…] gives a list of the positions of characters in <i>string</i>.

---

LetterQ
LetterQ[<i>string</i>] yields True if all the characters in the string are letters, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Level
Level[<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives a list of all subexpressions of <i>expr</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Level[<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>f</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the sequence of subexpressions. 

---

LeviCivitaTensor
LeviCivitaTensor[<i>d</i>] gives the <i>d</i>-dimensional Levi-Civita totally antisymmetric tensor.

---

LevyDistribution
LevyDistribution[μ,σ] represents a Lévy distribution with location parameter μ and dispersion parameter σ.

---

LexicographicOrder
LexicographicOrder[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives Order[<i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] for the first non-coinciding pair <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of elements, and 0 if the lists are identical.

LexicographicOrder[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> to compare <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LexicographicOrder[<i>p</i>] represents an operator form that compares lists when applied to {<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}, {<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

---

LexicographicSort
LexicographicSort[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] sorts the list of expressions <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in lexicographic order.

LexicographicSort[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] compares elements of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> expressions using the ordering function <i>p</i>.

---

LibraryDataType
LibraryDataType[<i>datatype</i>] specifies the data type for a LibraryFunction argument or result to be <i>datatype</i>.

LibraryDataType[<i>datatype</i>,<i>etype</i>] specifies an element type <i>etype</i> for data structures.

LibraryDataType[<i>datatype</i>,<i>etype</i>,<i>d</i>] specifies an array depth <i>d</i> for array data types.

---

LibraryFunction
LibraryFunction[<i>args</i>] represents a function that has been loaded from a Wolfram Library.

---

LibraryFunctionError
LibraryFunctionError[<i>name</i>,<i>code</i>] represents an error returned from a LibraryFunction.

---

LibraryFunctionInformation
LibraryFunctionInformation[<i>fun</i>] returns information about a LibraryFunction.

---

LibraryFunctionLoad
LibraryFunctionLoad[<i>lib</i>,<i>fun</i>,<i>argtype</i>,<i>rettype</i>] loads Wolfram Library <i>lib</i> and makes the library function <i>fun</i> available in the Wolfram Language.

---

LibraryFunctionUnload
LibraryFunctionUnload[<i>fun</i>] unloads a LibraryFunction so that it cannot be used.

---

LibraryUnload
LibraryUnload[<i>lib</i>] unloads all functions that have been loaded from a Wolfram Library, then it unloads the library.

---

LicenseEntitlementObject
LicenseEntitlementObject[<i>…</i>] represents an on-demand license entitlement.

LicenseEntitlementObject[<i>id</i>] gives the entitlement object representing the entitlement specified by <i>id</i>.

---

LicenseEntitlements
LicenseEntitlements[] gives a list of on-demand license entitlements owned by you.

---

LicenseID
LicenseID is an option to Encode which specifies the required value of $LicenseID on the computer that reads the encoded file. If no value is specified, any value of $LicenseID is allowed on the file-reading computer. A setting for LicenseID must be a string.

---

LicensingSettings
LicensingSettings is an option for RemoteBatchSubmit and related functions to configure licensing for remote kernels.

---

LiftingFilterData
LiftingFilterData[…] represents lifting-filter data used to compute forward and inverse lifting wavelet transforms.

---

LiftingWaveletTransform
LiftingWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>] gives the lifting wavelet transform (LWT) of an array of <i>data</i>.

LiftingWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the lifting wavelet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

LiftingWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i><i>,</i><i>r</i>] gives the lifting wavelet transform using <i>r</i> levels of refinement.

---

LightBlue
LightBlue represents a light blue color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightBrown
LightBrown represents a light brown color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightCyan
LightCyan represents a light cyan color in graphics or style specifications.

---

Lighter
Lighter[<i>color</i>] represents a lighter version of the specified color. 

Lighter[<i>color</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a version of the specified color lightened by a fraction <i>f</i>. 

Lighter[<i>image</i>,…] gives a lighter version of an image.

Lighter[<i>video</i>,…] gives a version of a video with lighter frames.

---

LightGray
LightGray represents a light gray color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightGreen
LightGreen represents a light green color in graphics or style specifications.

---

Lighting
Lighting is an option for Graphics3D and related functions that specifies what simulated lighting to use in coloring 3D surfaces. 

---

LightingAngle
LightingAngle is an option for ReliefPlot and related functions that specifies the angle from which simulated illumination is taken to come.

---

LightMagenta
LightMagenta represents a light magenta color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightOrange
LightOrange represents a light orange color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightPink
LightPink represents a light pink color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightPurple
LightPurple represents a light purple color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightRed
LightRed represents a light red color in graphics or style specifications.

---

LightSources
LightSources is an option for Graphics3D and related functions that specifies the properties of point light sources for simulated illumination. 

---

LightYellow
LightYellow represents a light yellow color in graphics or style specifications.

---

Likelihood
Likelihood[<i>dist</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the likelihood function for observations <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … from the distribution <i>dist</i>.

Likelihood[<i>proc</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the likelihood function for the observations <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at time <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the process <i>proc</i>.

Likelihood[<i>proc</i>,{<i>path</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>path</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the likelihood function for observations from <i>path</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>path</i><sub>2</sub>, … from the process <i>proc</i>.

---

Limit
Limit[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives the limit <sub><i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup></sub><i>f(x)</i>. 

Limit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the nested limit +<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>⋯ +<i>x<sub>n</sub></i><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup><i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>). 

Limit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the multivariate limit +{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}<i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>).

---

LimitsPositioningTokens
LimitsPositioningTokens is an option for selections that specifies a set of characters for which the option LimitsPositioning is set to True by default.

---

LindleyDistribution
LindleyDistribution[δ] represents a Lindley distribution with shape parameter δ.

---

Line
Line[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the line segments joining a sequence for points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Line[{{<i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>p</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…}] represents a collection of lines. 

---

LinearFractionalOptimization
LinearFractionalOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the linear fractional objective <i>f</i> subject to linear constraints <i>cons</i>.

LinearFractionalOptimization[{α,β,γ,δ},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><i>}</i>] finds a vector x that minimizes the linear fractional function (α.x+β)/(γ.x+δ) subject to the linear inequality constraints a.x+b⪰0. 

LinearFractionalOptimization[{α,β,γ,δ},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>a</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>}] includes the linear equality constraints a<sub>eq</sub>.x+b<sub>eq</sub>0.

LinearFractionalOptimization[{α,β,γ,δ},…,{<i>dom</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dom</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes x<sub>i</sub> to be in the domain <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, where <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is Integers or Reals. 

LinearFractionalOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

LinearFractionalTransform
LinearFractionalTransform[<i>m</i>] gives a TransformationFunction that represents a linear fractional transformation defined by the homogeneous matrix <i>m</i>. 

LinearFractionalTransform[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}] represents a linear fractional transformation that maps r to (a.r+b)/(c.r+d). 

---

LinearGradientFilling
LinearGradientFilling[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] is a two-dimensional graphics directive specifying that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using a progressive transition between colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> along a straight horizontal line.

LinearGradientFilling[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>pos</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] uses the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the scaled positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LinearGradientFilling[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>pos</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>dir</i>] draws along the straight line with a direction <i>dir</i>.

LinearGradientFilling[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>pos</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>dir</i>,<i>padding</i>] uses the specified padding when drawing beyond the boundary positions <i>pos</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>pos</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>. 

---

LinearGradientImage
LinearGradientImage[<i>gcol</i>] returns an image with values linearly changing from left to right based on gradient color <i>gcol</i>.

LinearGradientImage[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>}<i>gcol</i>] returns an image where the gradient starts at <i>pos</i><sub>1</sub> and ends at <i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>.

LinearGradientImage[…,<i>size</i>] returns a linear gradient image of the specified <i>size</i>.

LinearGradientImage[…,<i>size</i>,<i>"type"</i>] gives an image converted to the specified type.

---

LinearizingTransformationData
LinearizingTransformationData[…] represents data of an AffineStateSpaceModel linearized by functions such as FeedbackLinearize and StateTransformationLinearize using transformation of variables.

---

LinearLayer
LinearLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a trainable, fully connected net layer that computes w.x+b with output vector of size <i>n</i>. 

LinearLayer[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a layer that outputs an array of dimensions <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×….

LinearLayer[] leaves the dimensions of the output array to be inferred from context.

LinearLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for initial weights and other parameters. 

---

LinearModelFit
LinearModelFit[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] constructs a linear model of the form β<sub>0</sub>+β<sub>1</sub>f<sub>1</sub>+β<sub>2</sub>f<sub>2</sub>+… that fits the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for successive <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> values.

LinearModelFit[<i>data</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] constructs a linear model where the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> depend on the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

LinearModelFit[{<i>m</i>,<i>v</i>}] constructs a linear model from the design matrix <i>m</i> and response vector <i>v</i>.

---

LinearOffsetFunction
LinearOffsetFunction is an option for linear and generalized linear model fitting functions that specifies a component for the model that is to be assumed known.

---

LinearOptimization
LinearOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the linear objective <i>f</i> subject to linear constraints <i>cons</i>.

LinearOptimization[<i>c</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><i>}</i>]  finds a real vector <i>x</i> that minimizes the linear objective c.x subject to the linear inequality constraints a.x+b⪰0.

LinearOptimization[<i>c</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>a</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>}] includes the linear equality constraints a<sub>eq</sub>.x+b<sub>eq</sub>0.

LinearOptimization[<i>c</i>,…,{<i>dom</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dom</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to be in the domain <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, where <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is Integers or Reals.

LinearOptimization[<i>…</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

LinearProgramming
LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>] finds a vector <i>x</i> that minimizes the quantity <i>c</i>.<i>x</i> subject to the constraints <i>m</i>.<i>x</i>≥<i>b</i> and <i>x</i>≥0. 

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,{{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] finds a vector <i>x</i> that minimizes <i>c</i>.<i>x</i> subject to <i>x</i>≥0 and linear constraints specified by the matrix <i>m</i> and the pairs {<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. For each row <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>m</i>, the corresponding constraint is <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.<i>x</i>≥<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> if <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>==1, or <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.<i>x</i>==<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> if <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>==0, or <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.<i>x</i>≤<i>b</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> if <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>==-1. 

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>l</i>] minimizes <i>c</i>.<i>x</i> subject to the constraints specified by <i>m</i> and <i>b</i> and <i>x</i>≥<i>l</i>. 

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,{<i>l</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>l</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] minimizes <i>c</i>.<i>x</i> subject to the constraints specified by <i>m</i> and <i>b</i> and <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>≥<i>l</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,{{<i>l</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>l</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] minimizes <i>c</i>.<i>x</i> subject to the constraints specified by <i>m</i> and <i>b</i> and <i>l</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>≤<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>≤<i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>lu</i>,<i>dom</i>] takes the elements of <i>x</i> to be in the domain <i>dom</i>, either Reals or Integers.

LinearProgramming[<i>c</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>lu</i>,{<i>dom</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dom</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to be in the domain <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

LinearSolve
LinearSolve[<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>] finds an <i>x</i> that solves the matrix equation <i>m</i>.<i>x</i>==<i>b</i>. 

LinearSolve[<i>m</i>] generates a LinearSolveFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different <i>b</i>. 

LinearSolve[<i>a,b</i>] finds an <i>x</i> that solves the array equation <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>==<i>b</i>. 

---

LinearSolveFunction
LinearSolveFunction[<i>dimensions</i>,<i>data</i>] represents a function for providing solutions to a matrix equation. 

---

LinebreakAdjustments
LinebreakAdjustments is an option for selections that sets parameters used for calculating where automatic line breaks should be inserted.

---

LineBreakChart
LineBreakChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a line break chart with prices <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at date <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LineBreakChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i>}] makes a line break chart of closing prices for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the date range <i>daterange</i>.

LineBreakChart[{…},<i>n</i>] makes a line break chart where <i>n</i> bars in a row cause a reversal.

---

LineBreakWithin
LineBreakWithin is an option for selections that specifies whether line breaks occur automatically when the end of a line is reached.

---

LineGraph
LineGraph[<i>g</i>] gives the line graph of the graph <i>g</i>.

LineGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

LineIndent
LineIndent is an option for Style and Cell that specifies how many ems of indentation to add at the beginnings of lines for each level of nesting in an expression. 

---

LineIntegralConvolutionPlot
LineIntegralConvolutionPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},<i>image</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a line integral convolution plot of <i>image</i> convolved with the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>.

LineIntegralConvolutionPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a line integral convolution plot of white noise with the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>}.

---

LineIntegralConvolutionScale
LineIntegralConvolutionScale is an option to LineIntegralConvolutionPlot and related functions that determines the scale of the line integral convolution to be used.

---

LineLegend
LineLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] generates a legend that associates color <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with label <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LineLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},Automatic] generates a legend with placeholder labels for the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LineLegend[{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents a legend with inherited colors within visualization functions.

---

LineSpacing
LineSpacing is an option for Style and Cell that specifies the spacing between successive lines of text. 

---

LinkActivate
LinkActivate[<i>lnk</i>] activates a WSTP connection, waiting for the program at the other end to respond.

---

LinkClose
LinkClose[<i>link</i>] closes an open WSTP connection. 

---

LinkConnect
LinkConnect["<i>name</i>"] connects to a WSTP link created by another program. 

---

LinkCreate
LinkCreate["<i>name</i>"] creates a WSTP link with the specified name for another program to connect to. 

LinkCreate[] creates a WSTP link and picks an unused name for the link.

---

LinkError
LinkError[<i>link</i>] returns error information for link in the form { <i>errorNumber</i>, <i>errorExplanation</i> }.

---

LinkFlush
LinkFlush[<i>link</i>] transmits immediately any locally buffered outgoing expressions.

---

LinkFunction
LinkFunction is an option for GeneralizedLinearModelFit that specifies the link function for the generalized linear model.

---

LinkHost
LinkHost is an option for LinkOpen that specifies on what computer a program should be launched or on what computer a listening link will be found.

---

LinkInterrupt
LinkInterrupt[<i>link</i>] sends an interrupt to the program at the other end of the specified WSTP connection. 

---

LinkLaunch
LinkLaunch["<i>prog</i>"] starts the external program <i>prog</i> and opens a WSTP connection to it. 

---

LinkMode
LinkMode is an option for LinkOpen that specifies how the link is to be established and connected.  The possible settings for LinkMode are Launch, Listen, Connect, and Loopback.

---

LinkObject
LinkObject["<i>name</i>",<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] is an object that represents an active WSTP connection for functions such as LinkRead and LinkWrite. 

---

LinkOpen
LinkOpen["prog"] starts the external program prog and opens a MathLink connection to it.

---

LinkPatterns
LinkPatterns[<i>link</i>] gives a list of the patterns for which definitions were set up when the external program associated with the specified WSTP connection was installed. 

---

LinkProtocol
LinkProtocol is an option to LinkLaunch, Install, and related functions that specifies the underlying data transport protocol to use for a new WSTP link. 

---

LinkRankCentrality
LinkRankCentrality[<i>g</i>,α] gives the link-rank centralities for edges in the graph <i>g</i> and weight α.

LinkRankCentrality[<i>g</i>,α,β] gives the link-rank centralities, using weight α and initial vertex page-rank centralities β.

LinkRankCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

LinkRead
LinkRead[<i>link</i>] reads one expression from the specified WSTP connection. 

LinkRead[<i>link</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps <i>h</i> around the expression read before evaluating it. 

---

LinkReadHeld
LinkReadHeld[<i>link</i>] reads an expression via WSTP from <i>link</i> and returns it wrapped in Hold.

---

LinkReadyQ
LinkReadyQ[<i>link</i>] tests whether there is an expression ready to read from the specified WSTP connection. 

LinkReadyQ[<i>link</i>,<i>t</i>] waits for up to <i>t</i> seconds to see if an expression becomes ready to read.

LinkReadyQ[{<i>link</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>link</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>t</i>] tests all the <i>link</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in parallel, returning as soon as any of them are ready to read from.

---

Links
Links[] gives a list of all WSTP connections that are currently open. 

Links[<i>patt</i>] lists only links whose names match the specified string pattern.

---

LinkService
LinkService["service", l] is an object that represents an active connection to the WSTP service.

---

LinkWrite
LinkWrite[<i>link</i>,<i>expr</i>] writes <i>expr</i> to the specified WSTP connection. 

---

LinkWriteHeld
LinkWriteHeld[<i>link</i>, Hold[<i>expr</i>], (<i>flush</i>:True)] writes <i>expr</i> (without the Hold) via WSTP to link (synchronizing unless <i>flush</i> is False).

---

LiouvilleLambda
LiouvilleLambda[<i>n</i>] gives the Liouville function λ(n).

---

List
{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…} is a list of elements. 

---

Listable
Listable is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol f to indicate that the function f should automatically be threaded over lists that appear as its arguments. 

---

ListAnimate
ListAnimate[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates an animation whose frames are images <i>expr_Image</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ListContourPlot
ListContourPlot[{{<i>f</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>f</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] generates a contour plot from an array of values <i>f</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>.

ListContourPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>k</sub>}}] generates a contour plot from values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> specified at points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. 

---

ListContourPlot3D
ListContourPlot3D[<i>farr</i>] generates a contour plot from an array <i>farr</i> with values <i>farr</i>[[<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,<i>k</i>]] at points {<i>k</i>,<i>j</i>,<i>i</i>}.

ListContourPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] generates a contour plot from values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at point {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. 

---

ListCurvePathPlot
ListCurvePathPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a curve that corresponds to a smooth path through the specified points. 

---

ListDeconvolve
ListDeconvolve[<i>ker</i>,<i>list</i>] gives a deconvolution of <i>list</i> using kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

ListDensityPlot
ListDensityPlot[{{<i>f</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>f</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] generates a smooth density plot from an array of values <i>f</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>.

ListDensityPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>k</sub>}}] generates a density plot with values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> defined at specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. 

---

ListDensityPlot3D
ListDensityPlot3D[<i>farr</i>] generates a smooth density plot from an array of values <i>farr</i>. 

ListDensityPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] generates a density plot with values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

---

Listen
Listen is a setting for the LinkMode option of LinkOpen.  LinkMode->Listen causes a link to be created that listens on a named port for an incoming connection request.

---

ListFormat
ListFormat is an option to TextString and related functions that determines how lists are formatted.

---

ListFourierSequenceTransform
ListFourierSequenceTransform[<i>list</i>,ω] gives the discrete-time Fourier transform (DTFT) of a list as a function of the parameter ω.

ListFourierSequenceTransform[<i>list</i>,ω,<i>k</i>] places the first element of <i>list</i> at integer time <i>k</i> on the infinite time axis.

ListFourierSequenceTransform[<i>list</i>,{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional discrete-time Fourier transform

---

ListInterpolation
ListInterpolation[<i>array</i>] constructs an InterpolatingFunction object that represents an approximate function that interpolates the array of values given. 

ListInterpolation[<i>array</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] specifies the domain of the grid from which the values in <i>array</i> are assumed to come. 

---

ListLineIntegralConvolutionPlot
ListLineIntegralConvolutionPlot[{<i>array</i>,<i>image</i>}] generates a line integral convolution plot of <i>image</i> convolved with the vector field defined by an array of vector field values.

ListLineIntegralConvolutionPlot[<i>array</i>] generates a line integral convolution plot of white noise convolved with the vector field defined by <i>array</i>.

ListLineIntegralConvolutionPlot[{{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}},…},<i>image</i>}] generates a line integral convolution plot of <i>image</i> convolved with the vector field defined by vectors {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} at specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListLineIntegralConvolutionPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] generates a line integral convolution plot of white noise convolved with the vector field defined by {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

---

ListLinePlot
ListLinePlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] plots a line through the points {1,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>}, …, {<i>n</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

ListLinePlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] plots a line through the points {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>}, …, {<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

ListLinePlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots lines from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ListLinePlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

ListLinePlot3D
ListLinePlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] plots a curve through the 3D points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListLinePlot3D[{{<i>z</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>12</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>z</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>m</i>2</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] plots each row {<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i>2</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub>i<i>n</i></sub>} as a curve in the x direction, with successive curves stacked in the y direction. 

ListLinePlot3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots curves through multiple sets of {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} points.

---

ListLogLinearPlot
ListLogLinearPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a log-linear plot of the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, assumed to correspond to <i>x</i> coordinates 1, 2, ….

ListLogLinearPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a log-linear plot of the specified list of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> values.

ListLogLinearPlot[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots several lists of values.

ListLogLinearPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>. 

---

ListLogLogPlot
ListLogLogPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a log-log plot of the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, assumed to correspond to <i>x</i> coordinates 1, 2, ….

ListLogLogPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a log-log plot of the specified list of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> values.

ListLogLogPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListLogLogPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>. 

---

ListLogPlot
ListLogPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a log plot of the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, assumed to correspond to <i>x</i> coordinates 1, 2, ….

ListLogPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a log plot of the specified list of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> values.

ListLogPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListLogPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>. 

---

ListPlay
ListPlay[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates an object that plays as a sound whose amplitude is given by the sequence of levels <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

ListPlot
ListPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] plots regularly spaced points {<i>i</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] generates a scatter plot with points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots points from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>. 

---

ListPlot3D
ListPlot3D[{{<i>f</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>f</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] generates a surface with height <i>f</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> at {x,y} position {<i>j</i>,<i>i</i>}. 

ListPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>x</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>k</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>k</sub>}}] generates a surface with height <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at {x,y} position {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. 

ListPlot3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots the surfaces corresponding to each of the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ListPointPlot3D
ListPointPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] generates a 3D scatter plot of points with coordinates {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}. 

ListPointPlot3D[<i>array</i>] generates a 3D scatter plot of points with a 2D array of height values.

ListPointPlot3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots several collections of points, by default in different colors. 

---

ListPolarPlot
ListPolarPlot[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots points equally spaced in angle at radii <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListPolarPlot[{{θ<sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>},{θ<sub>2</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots points at polar coordinates θ<sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListPolarPlot[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots several lists of values.

---

ListQ
ListQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if the head of <i>expr</i> is List, and False otherwise.

---

ListSliceContourPlot3D
ListSliceContourPlot3D[<i>farr</i>,<i>surf</i>] generates a contour plot of the three-dimensional <i>farr</i> of values sliced to the surface <i>surf</i>.
