ListSliceContourPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>surf</i>] generates a slice contour plot for the values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListSliceContourPlot3D[…,{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates slice contour plots over several slices <i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

ListSliceDensityPlot3D
ListSliceDensityPlot3D[<i>farr</i>,<i>surf</i>] generates a density plot of the three-dimensional <i>farr</i> of values sliced to the surface <i>surf</i>.

ListSliceDensityPlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>surf</i>] generates a slice density plot for the values <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListSliceDensityPlot3D[…,{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates slice density plots over several slices <i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

ListSliceVectorPlot3D
ListSliceVectorPlot3D[<i>varr</i>,<i>surf</i>] generates a vector plot from a 3D array <i>varr</i> of vector field values over the slice surface <i>surf</i>.

ListSliceVectorPlot3D[…,{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a slice vector plot over several surfaces <i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

ListStepPlot
ListStepPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots the values <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … in steps at points 1, 2, ….

ListStepPlot[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots the values <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … in steps at points <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ListStepPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ListStepPlot[<i>data</i>,<i>step</i>] plots using steps specified by <i>step</i>.

ListStepPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>. 

---

ListStreamDensityPlot
ListStreamDensityPlot[<i>varr</i>] generates a stream density plot from an array <i>varr</i> of vector and scalar field values {{<i>vx</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>},<i>r</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>}. 

ListStreamDensityPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>},<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] generates a stream density plot from vector and scalar field values {{<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},<i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} given at specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListStreamDensityPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data for several vector and scalar fields. 

---

ListStreamPlot
ListStreamPlot[<i>varr</i>] generates a stream plot from an array <i>varr</i> of vectors.

ListStreamPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] generates a stream plot from vectors {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} given at points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListStreamPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data for several vector fields. 

---

ListStreamPlot3D
ListStreamPlot3D[<i>varr</i>] plots streamlines for the vector field given as an array of vectors.

---

ListSurfacePlot3D
ListSurfacePlot3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a three-dimensional surface constructed to fit the specified points. 

---

ListVectorDensityPlot
ListVectorDensityPlot[<i>varr</i>] generates a vector density plot from an array <i>varr</i> of vector and scalar field values {{<i>vx</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>},<i>r</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>}. 

ListVectorDensityPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>},<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] generates a vector density plot from vector and scalar field values {{<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},<i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} given at specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListVectorDensityPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data for several vector and scalar fields. 

---

ListVectorDisplacementPlot
ListVectorDisplacementPlot[{{{<i>vx</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>11</sub>},…,{<i>vx</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>}},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},…,{<i>vx</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}}] generates a displacement plot from an array of vector displacements {<i>vx</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>}.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}},…,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}}}] generates a displacement plot from displacements {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} at point {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot[{{ {{<i>vx</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>11</sub>},<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>}},…,{ {{<i>vx</i><sub><i>mi</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}}] uses the scalar values <i>s</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to color the displaced <i>region</i>.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot[{ {{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>},<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] uses the scalar values <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at point {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} to color the displaced region.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot[…,<i>reg</i>] plots the displacement over the region <i>reg</i>.

---

ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D
ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D[{{{<i>vx</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>11</sub>},…,{<i>vx</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>}},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},…,{<i>vx</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}}] generates a displacement plot from an array of vector displacements {<i>vx</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>}.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>1</sub>}},…,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}}] generates a displacement plot from displacements {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} at point {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D[{{{{<i>vx</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>11</sub>},<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>}},…,{{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>},…,{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] uses the scalar values <i>s</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> to color the displaced region.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vz</i><sub>1</sub>},<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>}},…,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>vx</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>vz</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}}] uses the scalar values <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at point {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} to color the displaced region.

ListVectorDisplacementPlot3D[…,<i>reg</i>] plots the displacement over the region <i>reg</i>.

---

ListVectorPlot
ListVectorPlot[<i>varr</i>] generates a vector plot from an array <i>varr</i> of vectors.

ListVectorPlot[{{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>vx</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>vy</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] generates a vector plot from vectors {<i>vx</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>vy</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} given at specified points {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

ListVectorPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data for several vector fields. 

---

ListVectorPlot3D
ListVectorPlot3D[<i>varr</i>] generates a 3D vector plot from a 3D array of vector field values.

ListVectorPlot3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data for several vector fields. 

---

ListZTransform
ListZTransform[<i>list</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Z transform of <i>list</i> as a function of <i>z</i>.

ListZTransform[<i>list</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>k</i>] places the first element of <i>list</i> at integer time <i>k</i> on the infinite time axis.

ListZTransform[<i>list</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Z transform.

---

LocalAdaptiveBinarize
LocalAdaptiveBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] creates a binary image from <i>image</i> by replacing values above the mean of the range-<i>r</i> neighborhood with 1 and others with 0.

LocalAdaptiveBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,{α,β,γ}] replaces values above α μ+β σ+γ with 1 and others with 0, where μ and σ are the local mean and standard deviation.

---

LocalClusteringCoefficient
LocalClusteringCoefficient[<i>g</i>] gives the list of local clustering coefficients of all vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

LocalClusteringCoefficient[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the local clustering coefficient of the vertex <i>v</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

LocalClusteringCoefficient[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

LocalizeVariables
LocalizeVariables is an option to Manipulate that determines whether the values of variables associated with controls should be localized.

---

LocalObject
LocalObject[] represents a new anonymous local object.

LocalObject["file:///…"] represents a local object with a given file path.

LocalObject["<i>relpath</i>"] represents a local object with the given relative path.

LocalObject["<i>relpath</i>","<i>lbase</i>"] represents a local object relative to the base <i>lbase</i>.

---

LocalObjects
LocalObjects[] gives a list of local objects in your current local base directory.

LocalObjects[<i>dir</i>] gives a list of local objects in the local directory <i>dir</i>.

---

LocalResponseNormalizationLayer
LocalResponseNormalizationLayer[] represents a net layer that normalizes its input by averaging across neighboring input channels.

---

LocalSubmit
LocalSubmit[<i>expr</i>] submits a task to evaluate <i>expr</i> in a separate kernel.

LocalSubmit[ScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>, <i>spec</i>]] submits a task to evaluate <i>expr</i> in a separate kernel on the schedule defined by <i>spec</i>.

---

LocalSymbol
LocalSymbol["<i>name</i>"] represents a symbol whose value is persistently stored in the local file system.

LocalSymbol[<i>obj</i>] represents a persistent symbol corresponding to the local object <i>obj</i>.

---

LocalTime
LocalTime[] gives a DateObject corresponding to the current local time at the current geo location.

LocalTime[<i>loc</i>] gives the current local time at the geo location specified by <i>loc</i>.

LocalTime[<i>loc</i>,<i>time</i>] gives the local time corresponding to the date object <i>time</i> at the geo location <i>loc</i>.

LocalTime[<i>loc</i>,<i>time</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended geographic regions.

---

LocalTimeZone
LocalTimeZone[] gives the current time zone for the current geo location.

LocalTimeZone[<i>loc</i>] gives the current time zone for the geo location specified by <i>loc</i>.

LocalTimeZone[<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>] gives the time zone for the geo location <i>loc</i> on the specified date.

LocalTimeZone[<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the specified property of the time zone.

---

LocationEquivalenceTest
LocationEquivalenceTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether the means or medians of the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are equal. 

LocationEquivalenceTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,…},"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

LocationTest
LocationTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the mean or median of the <i>data</i> is zero. 

LocationTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the means or medians of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> are equal.

LocationTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests a location measure against μ<sub>0</sub>.

LocationTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

LocatorAutoCreate
LocatorAutoCreate is an option for LocatorPane, Manipulate, and related functions that specifies whether new locators should be created when clicking away from existing locators.

---

LocatorRegion
LocatorRegion is an option for Locator that specifies where the locator object should by default be allowed to go when it is dragged.

---

Locked
Locked is an attribute that, once assigned, prevents modification of any attributes of a symbol. 

---

Log
Log[<i>z</i>] gives the natural logarithm of <i>z</i> (logarithm to base e). 

Log[<i>b</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the logarithm to base <i>b</i>. 

---

Log10
Log10[<i>x</i>] gives the base-10 logarithm of <i>x</i>.

---

Log2
Log2[<i>x</i>] gives the base-2 logarithm of <i>x</i>.

---

LogBarnesG
LogBarnesG[<i>z</i>] gives the logarithm of the Barnes G-function logG(z).

---

LogGamma
LogGamma[<i>z</i>] gives the logarithm of the gamma function log Γ(z). 

---

LogGammaDistribution
LogGammaDistribution[α,β,μ] represents a log-gamma distribution with shape parameters α and β and location parameter μ.

---

LogicalExpand
LogicalExpand[<i>expr</i>] expands out logical combinations of equations, inequalities, and other functions. 

---

LogIntegral
LogIntegral[<i>z</i>] is the logarithmic integral function li(z). 

---

LogisticDistribution
LogisticDistribution[μ,β] represents a logistic distribution with mean μ and scale parameter β.

LogisticDistribution[] represents a logistic distribution with mean 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

LogisticSigmoid
LogisticSigmoid[<i>z</i>] gives the logistic sigmoid function.

---

LogLikelihood
LogLikelihood[<i>dist</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the log‐likelihood function for observations <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … from the distribution <i>dist</i>.

LogLikelihood[<i>proc</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the log-likelihood function for the observations <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at time <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the process <i>proc</i>.

LogLikelihood[<i>proc</i>,{<i>path</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>path</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the log-likelihood function for the observations from <i>path</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>path</i><sub>2</sub>, … from the process <i>proc</i>.

---

LogLinearPlot
LogLinearPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a log-linear plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

LogLinearPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

LogLinearPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LogLinearPlot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

LogLogisticDistribution
LogLogisticDistribution[γ,σ] represents a log-logistic distribution with shape parameter γ and scale parameter σ.

---

LogLogPlot
LogLogPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a log-log plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

LogLogPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

LogLogPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LogLogPlot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

LogMultinormalDistribution
LogMultinormalDistribution[μ,Σ] represents a log-multinormal distribution with parameters μ and Σ.

---

LogNormalDistribution
LogNormalDistribution[μ,σ] represents a lognormal distribution derived from a normal distribution with mean μ and standard deviation σ.

---

LogPlot
LogPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a log plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

LogPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

LogPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LogPlot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

LogRankTest
LogRankTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests for equal hazard rates among the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using a log-rank type test. 

LogRankTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>wspec</i>] performs a weighted log-rank test with weights <i>wspec</i>. 

LogRankTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>wspec</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

LogSeriesDistribution
LogSeriesDistribution[θ] represents a logarithmic series distribution with parameter θ.

---

Longest
Longest[<i>p</i>] is a pattern object that matches the longest sequence consistent with the pattern <i>p</i>. 

---

LongestCommonSequence
LongestCommonSequence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest sequence of contiguous or disjoint elements common to the strings or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

LongestCommonSequence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest sequence of contiguous or disjoint elements common to the strings, lists or biomolecular sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

LongestCommonSequencePositions
LongestCommonSequencePositions[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest sequence of contiguous or disjoint elements common to the strings or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub> and returns their positions.

LongestCommonSequencePositions[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest sequence of contiguous or disjoint elements common to the strings, lists or biomolecular sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub> and returns their positions.

---

LongestCommonSubsequence
LongestCommonSubsequence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest contiguous subsequence of elements common to the strings or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

LongestCommonSubsequence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest contiguous subsequence of elements common to the strings, biomolecular sequences or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

LongestCommonSubsequencePositions
LongestCommonSubsequencePositions[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest contiguous subsequence of elements common to the strings or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub> and returns their positions {<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>} in <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

LongestCommonSubsequencePositions[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds the longest contiguous subsequence of elements common to the strings, biomolecular sequences or lists <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub> and returns their positions {<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>} in <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

LongestMatch
LongestMatch[<i>p</i>] is a string pattern object matching the longest sequence of characters consistent with the string pattern <i>p</i>.

---

LongestOrderedSequence
LongestOrderedSequence[<i>list</i>] finds the longest ordered sequence of contiguous or disjoint elements in <i>list</i>.

LongestOrderedSequence[<i>list</i>,<i>p</i>] finds the longest ordered sequence using the ordering function <i>p</i>.

---

LongForm
LongForm is an option for Information. With LongForm -> True, the full information of a symbol is printed. With LongForm -> False the usage of a symbol is printed.

---

Longitude
Longitude[<i>pos</i>] gives the longitude in degrees of a geographic position specified by <i>pos</i>.

Longitude[<i>pos</i>,<i>datum</i>] gives the longitude referring to the specified geodetic datum.

---

LongLeftArrow
LongLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟵<i>y</i>⟵….

---

LongLeftRightArrow
LongLeftRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟷<i>y</i>⟷….

---

LongRightArrow
LongRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⟶<i>y</i>⟶….

---

LongShortTermMemoryLayer
LongShortTermMemoryLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a trainable recurrent layer that takes a sequence of vectors and produces a sequence of vectors, each of size <i>n</i>.

LongShortTermMemoryLayer[<i>n</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for weights and other parameters. 

---

Lookup
Lookup[<i>assoc</i>,<i>key</i>] looks up the value associated with <i>key</i> in the association <i>assoc</i>; if the key is not present, Missing["KeyAbsent",<i>key</i>] is returned.

Lookup[<i>assoc</i>,{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the values associated with the <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Lookup[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>key</i>] gives a list corresponding to the value of <i>key</i> in each <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Lookup[<i>assoc</i>,<i>key</i>,<i>default</i>] gives <i>default</i> if the <i>key</i> is not present.

Lookup[<i>assoc</i>,<i>keys</i>,<i>default</i>,<i>h</i>] looks up the values associated with <i>keys</i>, wrapping each of them with head <i>h</i> before evaluation.

Lookup[<i>key</i>] represents an operator form of Lookup that can be applied to an expression.

---

Loopback
Loopback is a setting for the LinkMode option of LinkOpen.  LinkMode->Loopback causes a link to be created that is not connected to another program.  Expressions written to the link are read back from the same link.

---

LoopFreeGraphQ
LoopFreeGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> has no self-loops, and False otherwise.

---

Looping
Looping is an option for VideoStream, AudioStream and related functions to specify the playback looping.

---

LossFunction
LossFunction is an option for NetTrain that specifies how to compare actual and requested outputs from a neural net.

---

LowerCaseQ
LowerCaseQ[<i>string</i>] yields True if all the characters in the string are lowercase letters, and yields False otherwise. 

---

LowerLeftArrow
LowerLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↙<i>y</i>↙….

---

LowerRightArrow
LowerRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↘<i>y</i>↘….

---

LowpassFilter
LowpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>] applies a lowpass filter with a cutoff frequency ω<sub><i>c</i></sub> to an array of data.

LowpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] uses a filter kernel of length <i>n</i>.

LowpassFilter[<i>data</i>,ω<sub><i>c</i></sub>,<i>n</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to the filter kernel.

---

LQEstimatorGains
LQEstimatorGains[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the optimal estimator gain matrix for the StateSpaceModel <i>ssm</i>, with process and measurement noise covariance matrices <i>w</i> and <i>v</i>.

LQEstimatorGains[<i>ssm</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>h</i>}] includes the cross-covariance matrix <i>h</i>.

LQEstimatorGains[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>},{…}] specifies <i>sensors</i> as the noisy measurements of <i>ssm</i>.

LQEstimatorGains[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>,<i>dinputs</i>},{…}] specifies <i>dinputs</i> as the deterministic inputs of <i>ssm</i>.

---

LQGRegulator
LQGRegulator[<i>sspec</i>,<i>cvs</i>,<i>wts</i>] gives the optimal output feedback controller for the stochastic system specification <i>sspec</i> with noise covariance matrices <i>cvs</i> that minimizes a cost function with weights <i>wts</i>.

LQGRegulator[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

LQOutputRegulatorGains
LQOutputRegulatorGains[<i>sspec</i>,<i>wts</i>] gives the state feedback gains for the system specification <i>sspec</i> that minimizes an output cost function with weights <i>wts</i>.

LQOutputRegulatorGains[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

LQRegulatorGains
LQRegulatorGains[<i>sspec</i>,<i>wts</i>] gives the state feedback gains for the system specification <i>sspec</i> that minimizes a cost function with weights <i>wts</i>.

LQRegulatorGains[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

LucasL
LucasL[<i>n</i>] gives the Lucas number L<sub>n</sub>.

LucasL[<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Lucas polynomial L<sub>n</sub>(x).

---

LuccioSamiComponents
LuccioSamiComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the Luccio–Sami components of the graph <i>g</i>.

LuccioSamiComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

LuccioSamiComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

LUDecomposition
LUDecomposition[<i>m</i>] generates a representation of the LU decomposition of a square matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

LunarEclipse
LunarEclipse[] gives the time of the next lunar eclipse.

LunarEclipse[<i>datespec</i>] gives the time for the next lunar eclipse after the specified date.

LunarEclipse[<i>propertyspec</i>] gives the specified property value for the next lunar eclipse.

LunarEclipse[<i>datespec</i>,<i>propertyspec</i>] gives the specified property value for the next lunar eclipse after the specified date.

---

LUVColor
LUVColor[<i>l</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] represents a color in the LUV color space with lightness <i>l</i> and color components <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

LUVColor[<i>l</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

LUVColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

LUVColor[<i>color</i>] returns the LUV representation of <i>color</i>.

---

LyapunovSolve
LyapunovSolve[<i>a</i>,<i>c</i>] finds a solution <i>x</i> of the matrix Lyapunov equation <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>+<i>x</i>.<i>a</i><i>c</i>.

LyapunovSolve[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>+<i>x</i>.<i>b</i><i>c</i>.

LyapunovSolve[{<i>a</i>,<i>d</i>},<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>d</i>+<i>d</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>a</i><i>c</i>.

LyapunovSolve[{<i>a</i>,<i>d</i>},{<i>b</i>,<i>e</i>},<i>c</i>] solves <i>a</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>e</i>+<i>d</i>.<i>x</i>.<i>b</i><i>c</i>.

---

LyonsGroupLy
LyonsGroupLy[] represents the sporadic simple Lyons group Ly.

---

MachineID
MachineID is an option to Encode which specifies the required value of $MachineID on the computer that reads the encoded file. If no value is specified, any value of $MachineID is allowed on the file-reading computer. A setting for MachineID must be a string.

---

MachineName
MachineName is an option to Encode which specifies the required value of $MachineName on the computer that reads the encoded file. If no value is specified, any value of $MachineName is allowed on the file-reading computer. A setting for MachineName must be a string.

---

MachineNumberQ
MachineNumberQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a machine‐precision real or complex number, and returns False otherwise. 

---

MachinePrecision
MachinePrecision is a symbol used to indicate machine‐number precision. 

---

Magenta
Magenta represents the color magenta in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Magnification
Magnification is an option for Style and Cell that specifies what magnification to use for display. 

---

Magnify
Magnify[<i>expr</i>,<i>r</i>] represents an object to be displayed with magnification <i>r</i>. 

Magnify[<i>expr</i>] displays with <i>expr</i> magnified by a fixed factor.

---

MailAddressValidation
MailAddressValidation is an option for SendMail that specifies whether and how to validate email addresses.

---

MailExecute
MailExecute[<i>cmd</i>,<i>target</i>] executes the mail command <i>cmd</i> on the <i>target</i> mail server connection, folder, file or item(s).

---

MailFolder
MailFolder[…] represents a mail folder associated with an active mail server connection.

---

MailItem
MailItem[…] represents an item of mail associated with an active mail server connection.

---

MailReceiverFunction
MailReceiverFunction[<i>fun</i>] represents a mail receiver function that applies <i>fun</i> to any mail message it receives.

---

MailResponseFunction
MailResponseFunction is an option for MailReceiverFunction that specifies what function to apply to respond to the sender of mail received by a MailReceiverFunction.

---

MailSearch
MailSearch[<i>folder</i>,<i>assoc</i>] searches the specified mail folder for messages with properties matching elements in <i>assoc</i>.

MailSearch[<i>assoc</i>] searches the current default mail inbox.

MailSearch[] gives the list of unread messages in the current default mail inbox.

---

MailServerConnect
MailServerConnect[] connects to your default incoming mail server.

MailServerConnect["<i>server</i>"] connects to the specified incoming mail server "<i>server</i>".

MailServerConnect["<i>server</i>",<i>userid</i>] connects using the specified user ID <i>userid</i>.

MailServerConnect["<i>server</i>",<i>userid</i>,<i>password</i><i>]</i> connects using <i>userid</i> and <i>password</i>.

---

MailServerConnection
MailServerConnection[…] is a symbolic representation of a connection to an incoming mail server.

---

MailSettings
MailSettings is an option for SendMail and MailServerConnect to specify mail settings.

---

MainSolve
MainSolve[<i>eqns</i>] is the underlying function for transforming systems of equations. Solve and Eliminate call it. The equations must be of the form <i>lhs</i> == <i>rhs</i>. They can be combined using &amp;&amp; and ||. MainSolve returns False if no solutions to the equations exist, and True if all values of variables are solutions. MainSolve rearranges the equations using certain directives. MainSolve[<i>eqns</i>, <i>vars</i>, <i>elim</i>, <i>rest</i>] attempts to rearrange the equations <i>eqns</i> so as to solve for the variables <i>vars</i>, and eliminate the variables <i>elim</i>. The list <i>rest</i> can be included to specify the elimination order for any remaining variables.

---

Majority
Majority[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives True if the majority of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are True, and False if the majority are False.

---

MakeRules
MakeRules is an option to Solve and related functions. With MakeRules -> True, the result is presented as an AlgebraicRulesData object. With MakeRules -> False, the result is presented as a list of rules.

---

ManagedLibraryExpressionID
ManagedLibraryExpressionID[<i>expr</i>] returns the positive integer ID associated with <i>expr</i> if it is a managed library expression and $Failed otherwise.

ManagedLibraryExpressionID[<i>expr</i>,<i>mname</i>] only returns the ID if <i>expr</i> is associated with the registered manager having name <i>mname</i>.

---

ManagedLibraryExpressionQ
ManagedLibraryExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a managed library expression and False otherwise.

ManagedLibraryExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>mname</i>] only returns True if <i>expr</i> is associated with the registered manager having name <i>mname</i>.

---

MandelbrotSetBoettcher
MandelbrotSetBoettcher[<i>z</i>] gives the Böttcher coordinate of <i>z</i> with respect to the Mandelbrot set.

---

MandelbrotSetDistance
MandelbrotSetDistance[<i>c</i>] estimates the distance from <i>c</i> to the nearest point in the Mandelbrot set.

MandelbrotSetDistance[<i>c</i><i>,</i>"Interior"] estimates the distance from <i>c</i> to the nearest point in the complement of the Mandelbrot set.

---

MandelbrotSetIterationCount
MandelbrotSetIterationCount[<i>c</i>] returns the number of iterations of the function f(z)z<sup>2</sup>+c, beginning with z0, that are needed to determine whether <i>c</i> is in the Mandelbrot set.

---

MandelbrotSetMemberQ
MandelbrotSetMemberQ[<i>z</i>] returns True if <i>z</i> is in the Mandelbrot set, and False otherwise.

---

MandelbrotSetPlot
MandelbrotSetPlot[{<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots the portion of the Mandelbrot set inside the rectangle with corners <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

MandelbrotSetPlot[] plots the Mandelbrot set over a default rectangle.

---

MangoldtLambda
MangoldtLambda[<i>n</i>] gives the von Mangoldt function Λ(n).

---

ManhattanDistance
ManhattanDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Manhattan or "city block" distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

Manipulate
Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a version of <i>expr</i> with controls added to allow interactive manipulation of the value of <i>u</i>. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>du</i>}] allows the value of <i>u</i> to vary between <i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> in steps <i>du</i>. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>init</i></sub>},<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…}] takes the initial value of <i>u</i> to be <i>u</i><sub><i>init</i></sub>. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>init</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>lbl</i></sub>},…}] labels the controls for <i>u</i> with <i>u</i><sub><i>lbl</i></sub>. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{<i>u</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] allows <i>u</i> to take on discrete values <i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,{<i>u</i>,…},{<i>v</i>,…},…] provides controls to manipulate each of the <i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,…. 

Manipulate[<i>expr</i>,<i>c</i><sub><i>u</i></sub>{<i>u</i>,…},<i>c</i><sub><i>v</i></sub>{<i>v</i>,…},…] links the controls to the specified controllers on an external device.

---

MannedSpaceMissionData
MannedSpaceMissionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the manned space mission <i>entity</i>.

MannedSpaceMissionData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified manned space mission entities.

MannedSpaceMissionData[<i>name</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

MannWhitneyTest
MannWhitneyTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the medians of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> are equal.

MannWhitneyTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests the median difference against μ<sub>0</sub>.

MannWhitneyTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

MantissaExponent
MantissaExponent[<i>x</i>] gives a list containing the mantissa and exponent of a number <i>x</i>. 

MantissaExponent[<i>x</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the base‐<i>b</i> mantissa and exponent of <i>x</i>. 

---

Manual
Manual represents an option or other value that is to be selected manually, usually by some form of interactive manipulation.

---

Map
Map[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] or <i>f</i>/@<i>expr</i> applies <i>f</i> to each element on the first level in <i>expr</i>. 

Map[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> to parts of <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Map[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of Map that can be applied to an expression.

---

MapAll
MapAll[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] or <i>f</i>//@<i>expr</i> applies <i>f</i> to every subexpression in <i>expr</i>. 

---

MapAt
MapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the element at position <i>n</i> in <i>expr</i>. If <i>n</i> is negative, the position is counted from the end. 

MapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to the part of <i>expr</i> at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}.

MapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] applies <i>f</i> to parts of <i>expr</i> at several positions.

MapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of MapAt that can be applied to an expression.

---

MapIndexed
MapIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the elements of <i>expr</i>, giving the part specification of each element as a second argument to <i>f</i>. 

MapIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> to all parts of <i>expr</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

MapIndexed[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of MapIndexed that can be applied to an expression.

---

MAProcess
MAProcess[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},<i>v</i>] represents a moving-average process of order <i>q</i> with normal white noise variance <i>v</i>.

MAProcess[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},Σ] represents a vector MA process with multinormal white noise covariance matrix Σ.

MAProcess[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},<i>v</i>,<i>init</i>] represents an MA process with initial data <i>init</i>. 

MAProcess[<i>c</i>,…] represents an MA process with a constant <i>c</i>.

---

MapThread
MapThread[<i>f</i>,{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] gives {<i>f</i>[<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…],<i>f</i>[<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…],…}. 

MapThread[<i>f</i>,{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the parts of the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>n</i>.

MapThread[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of MapThread that can be applied to an expression.

---

MarchenkoPasturDistribution
MarchenkoPasturDistribution[λ,σ] represents a Marchenko–Pastur distribution with asymptotic ratio λ and scale parameter σ.

MarchenkoPasturDistribution[λ] represents a Marchenko–Pastur distribution with unit scale parameter.

---

MarcumQ
MarcumQ[<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] gives Marcum's Q function Q<sub>m</sub>(a,b).

MarcumQ[<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>] gives Marcum's Q function Q<sub>m</sub>(a,b<sub>0</sub>)-Q<sub>m</sub>(a,b<sub>1</sub>).

---

MardiaCombinedTest
MardiaCombinedTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> follows a MultinormalDistribution using the Mardia combined test.

MardiaCombinedTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

MardiaKurtosisTest
MardiaKurtosisTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> follows a MultinormalDistribution using the Mardia kurtosis test.

MardiaKurtosisTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

MardiaSkewnessTest
MardiaSkewnessTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> follows a MultinormalDistribution using the Mardia skewness test.

MardiaSkewnessTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

MarginalDistribution
MarginalDistribution[<i>dist</i>,<i>k</i>] represents a univariate marginal distribution of the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> coordinate from the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

MarginalDistribution[<i>dist</i>,{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a multivariate marginal distribution of the {<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…} coordinates.

---

MarkovProcessProperties
MarkovProcessProperties[<i>mproc</i>] gives a summary of properties for the finite state Markov process <i>mproc</i>.

MarkovProcessProperties[<i>mproc</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified "<i>property</i>" for the process <i>mproc</i>.

---

Masking
Masking is an option for various image and signal processing functions that specifies on which regions they should operate.

---

MassConcentrationCondition
MassConcentrationCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass concentration boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassConcentrationCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a thermal surface boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassFluxValue
MassFluxValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass flux boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassFluxValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a mass flux boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassImpermeableBoundaryValue
MassImpermeableBoundaryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass impermeable boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassImpermeableBoundaryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a mass impermeable boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassOutflowValue
MassOutflowValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass outflow boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassOutflowValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a mass outflow boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassSymmetryValue
MassSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass symmetry boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a mass symmetry boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassTransferValue
MassTransferValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a mass transfer boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

MassTransferValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a mass transfer boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

MassTransportPDEComponent
MassTransportPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a mass transport PDE term with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

MatchingDissimilarity
MatchingDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the matching dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

MatchLocalNameQ
MatchLocalNameQ is an internal symbol.

---

MatchLocalNames
MatchLocalNames is an option for Trace and related functions that specifies whether symbols such as <i>x</i> should match symbols with local names of the form <i>x</i>$<i>nnn</i>. 

---

MatchQ
MatchQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> matches the pattern <i>form</i>, and returns False otherwise.

MatchQ[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of MatchQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

MaterialShading
MaterialShading["<i>material</i>"] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that surfaces that follow are to be drawn with the material "<i>material</i>" appearance.

MaterialShading[{"<i>material</i>",<i>col</i>}] uses the specified color <i>col</i> as the base color.

MaterialShading[<i>parm</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>parm</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] uses the specified parameters <i>parms</i>.

---

MathematicalFunctionData
MathematicalFunctionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives data corresponding to <i>property</i> for the mathematical function specified by <i>entity</i>.

MathematicalFunctionData[<i>entprop</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives data corresponding to the given entity or property in the format specified by <i>annotation</i>.

MathematicalFunctionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives data for the given <i>entity</i>-<i>property</i> pair in the format specified by <i>annotation</i>.	

MathematicalFunctionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,{<i>qual</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qual</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives data for the given <i>entity</i>-<i>property</i> pair with property qualifiers <i>qual</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>qual</i><sub>2</sub>, … set to the given values.

MathematicalFunctionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>,{<i>qual</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qual</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives data corresponding to the given <i>entity</i>, <i>property</i> and <i>annotation</i> format, with property qualifiers <i>qual</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>qual</i><sub>2</sub>, … set to the given values.

---

MathieuC
MathieuC[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the even Mathieu function with characteristic value <i>a</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuCharacteristicA
MathieuCharacteristicA[<i>r</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the characteristic value <i>a</i><sub><i>r</i></sub> for even Mathieu functions with characteristic exponent <i>r</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuCharacteristicB
MathieuCharacteristicB[<i>r</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the characteristic value <i>b</i><sub><i>r</i></sub> for odd Mathieu functions with characteristic exponent <i>r</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuCharacteristicExponent
MathieuCharacteristicExponent[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the characteristic exponent <i>r</i> for Mathieu functions with characteristic value <i>a</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuCPrime
MathieuCPrime[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the derivative with respect to <i>z</i> of the even Mathieu function with characteristic value <i>a</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuGroupM11
MathieuGroupM11[] represents the sporadic simple Mathieu group M<sub>11</sub>.

---

MathieuGroupM12
MathieuGroupM12[] represents the sporadic simple Mathieu group M<sub>12</sub>.

---

MathieuGroupM22
MathieuGroupM22[] represents the sporadic simple Mathieu group M<sub>22</sub>.

---

MathieuGroupM23
MathieuGroupM23[] represents the sporadic simple Mathieu group M<sub>23</sub>.

---

MathieuGroupM24
MathieuGroupM24[] represents the sporadic simple Mathieu group M<sub>24</sub>.

---

MathieuS
MathieuS[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the odd Mathieu function with characteristic value <i>a</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathieuSPrime
MathieuSPrime[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the derivative with respect to <i>z</i> of the odd Mathieu function with characteristic value <i>a</i> and parameter <i>q</i>. 

---

MathMLForm
MathMLForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a MathML form of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Matrices
Matrices[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents the domain of matrices of dimensions <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>.

Matrices[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>dom</i>] represents the domain of matrices of dimensions <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>, with components in the domain <i>dom</i>.

Matrices[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>dom</i>,<i>sym</i>] represents the subdomain of matrices <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>d</i><sub>2</sub> with symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

MatrixExp
MatrixExp[<i>m</i>] gives the matrix exponential of <i>m</i>. 

MatrixExp[<i>m</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the matrix exponential of <i>m</i> applied to the vector <i>v</i>.

---

MatrixForm
MatrixForm[<i>list</i>] prints with the elements of <i>list</i> arranged in a regular array. 

---

MatrixFunction
MatrixFunction[<i>f</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the matrix generated by the scalar function <i>f</i> at the matrix argument <i>m</i>.

---

MatrixLog
MatrixLog[<i>m</i>] gives the matrix logarithm of a matrix <i>m</i>.

---

MatrixNormalDistribution
MatrixNormalDistribution[Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub>,Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>] represents zero mean matrix normal distribution with row covariance matrix Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub> and column covariance matrix Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>.

MatrixNormalDistribution[μ,Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub>,Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>] represents matrix normal distribution with mean matrix μ.

---

MatrixPlot
MatrixPlot[<i>m</i>] generates a plot that gives a visual representation of the values of elements in a matrix.

---

MatrixPower
MatrixPower[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> matrix power of the matrix <i>m</i>. 

MatrixPower[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> matrix power of the matrix <i>m</i> applied to the vector <i>v</i>.

---

MatrixPropertyDistribution
MatrixPropertyDistribution[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>mdist</i>] represents the distribution of the matrix property <i>expr</i> where the matrix-valued random variable <i>x</i> follows the matrix distribution <i>mdist</i>.

MatrixPropertyDistribution[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>mdist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>mdist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the distribution where <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the matrix distributions <i>mdist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>mdist</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

MatrixQ
MatrixQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a list of lists or a two-dimensional SparseArray object that can represent a matrix, and gives False otherwise. 

MatrixQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>] gives True only if <i>test</i> yields True when applied to each of the matrix elements in <i>expr</i>. 

---

MatrixRank
MatrixRank[<i>m</i>] gives the rank of the matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

MatrixTDistribution
MatrixTDistribution[Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub>,Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>,ν] represents zero mean matrix t distribution with row covariance matrix Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub>, column covariance matrix Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>, and degrees of freedom parameter ν.

MatrixTDistribution[μ,Σ<sub><i>row</i></sub>,Σ<sub><i>col</i></sub>,ν] represents matrix t distribution with mean matrix μ.

---

Max
Max[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] yields the numerically largest of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Max[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…] yields the largest element of any of the lists. 

---

MaxCellMeasure
MaxCellMeasure is an option for DiscretizeRegion and related functions that specifies the maximum cell measure for the result.

---

MaxColorDistance
MaxColorDistance is an option to specify the maximum distance allowed between colors.

---

MaxDate
MaxDate[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the latest date of the <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

MaxDate[<i>interval</i>] gives the endpoint of the date interval <i>interval</i>.

MaxDate[<i>interval</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the endpoint of <i>interval</i> as specified by granularity <i>gran</i>.

---

MaxDetect
MaxDetect[<i>image</i>] gives a binary image in which white pixels correspond to constant extended maxima in <i>image</i>.

MaxDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>h</i>] finds extended maxima where the range of values is not greater than <i>h</i>.

MaxDetect[<i>data</i>,…] applies maxima detection to an array of data.

---

MaxDuration
MaxDuration is an option that specifies the maximum duration for audio playback or capture.

---

MaxExtraBandwidths
MaxExtraBandwidths is an option to SmoothKernelDistribution that controls the behavior outside that data range.

---

MaxExtraConditions
MaxExtraConditions is an option to Solve and related functions that specifies how many extra equational conditions on continuous parameters to allow in solutions that are given.

---

MaxFeatureDisplacement
MaxFeatureDisplacement is an option that specifies the maximum displacement allowed for any feature.

---

MaxFeatures
MaxFeatures is an option that specifies the maximum number of features that will be returned from feature detection algorithms.

---

MaximalBy
MaximalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>] returns a list of the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> for which the value of <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is maximal.

MaximalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a list of the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> corresponding to the <i>n</i> largest <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>].

MaximalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> for sorting.

MaximalBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of MaximalBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

Maximize
Maximize[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] maximizes <i>f</i> symbolically with respect to <i>x</i>.

Maximize[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] maximizes <i>f</i> symbolically with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

Maximize[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] maximizes <i>f</i> symbolically subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

Maximize[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

Maximize[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

MaxItems
MaxItems is an option that specifies the maximum number of items to be used or shown.

---

MaxIterations
MaxIterations is an option that specifies the maximum number of iterations that should be tried in various built-in functions and algorithms.

---

MaxLimit
MaxLimit[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives the max limit <sub><i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup></sub><i>f(x)</i>. 

MaxLimit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the nested max limit +<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>⋯ +<i>x<sub>n</sub></i><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup><i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>). 

MaxLimit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the multivariate max limit +{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}<i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>).

---

MaxMemoryUsed
MaxMemoryUsed[] gives the maximum number of bytes used to store all data for the current Wolfram System session.

MaxMemoryUsed[<i>expr</i>] gives the maximum number of bytes used during the evaluation of <i>expr</i>.

---

MaxMixtureKernels
MaxMixtureKernels is an option for SmoothKernelDistribution and related functions that specifies the maximum number and location of kernel functions to use in the estimation.

---

MaxOverlapFraction
MaxOverlapFraction is an option that specifies the maximum acceptable overlap between different identifications.

---

MaxPlotPoints
MaxPlotPoints is an option for plotting functions like ArrayPlot and ListPlot3D that specifies the maximum number of points that will explicitly be included in the output. 

---

MaxPoints
MaxPoints is an option for NIntegrate specifying the maximum total number of times to sample the integrand.

---

MaxRecursion
MaxRecursion is an option for functions like NIntegrate and Plot that specifies how many recursive subdivisions can be made. 

---

MaxStableDistribution
MaxStableDistribution[μ,σ,ξ] represents a generalized maximum extreme value distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameter σ, and shape parameter ξ.

---

MaxStepFraction
MaxStepFraction is an option to functions like NDSolve that specifies the maximum fraction of the total range to cover in a single step.

---

MaxSteps
MaxSteps is an option to functions like NDSolve that specifies the maximum number of steps to take in generating a result.

---

MaxStepSize
MaxStepSize is an option to functions like NDSolve that specifies the maximum size of a single step used in generating a result.

---

MaxTrainingRounds
MaxTrainingRounds is an option for NetTrain and related functions that specifies the maximum number of rounds of training to do.

---

MaxValue
MaxValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the maximum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>.

MaxValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the maximum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

MaxValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the maximum value of <i>f</i> subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

MaxValue[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

MaxValue[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

MaxwellDistribution
MaxwellDistribution[σ] represents a Maxwell distribution with scale parameter σ.

---

MaxWordGap
MaxWordGap is an option for SearchAdjustment that specifies the number of words that can occur between the terms of a phrase.

---

McLaughlinGroupMcL
McLaughlinGroupMcL[] represents the sporadic simple McLaughlin group McL.

---

Mean
Mean[<i>data</i>] gives the mean estimate of the elements in <i>data</i>. 

Mean[<i>dist</i>] gives the mean of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

MeanAbsoluteLossLayer
MeanAbsoluteLossLayer[] represents a loss layer that computes the mean absolute loss between the "Input" port and "Target" port.

---

MeanAround
MeanAround[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>3</sub>,…}] gives an Around object describing the mean of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and its uncertainty.

MeanAround[{{<i>x</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…}] gives a VectorAround object describing the means of the vectors <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and their covariance. 

---

MeanClusteringCoefficient
MeanClusteringCoefficient[<i>g</i>] gives the mean clustering coefficient of the graph <i>g</i>.

MeanClusteringCoefficient[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

MeanDegreeConnectivity
MeanDegreeConnectivity[<i>g</i>] gives a list of k-mean degree connectivity for the graph <i>g</i> for successive <i>k</i>=0,1,2… .

MeanDegreeConnectivity[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives a list of k-mean in-degree connectivity for the graph <i>g</i>.

MeanDegreeConnectivity[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives a list of k-mean out-degree connectivity for the graph <i>g</i>.

MeanDegreeConnectivity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

MeanDeviation
MeanDeviation[<i>data</i>] gives the mean absolute deviation from the mean of the elements in <i>data</i>.

---

MeanGraphDistance
MeanGraphDistance[<i>g</i>] gives the mean distance between all pairs of vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

MeanGraphDistance[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

MeanNeighborDegree
MeanNeighborDegree[<i>g</i>] gives a list of mean neighbor degrees of vertices for the graph <i>g</i>.

MeanNeighborDegree[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives a list of mean neighbor in-degrees.

MeanNeighborDegree[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives a list of mean neighbor out-degrees.

MeanNeighborDegree[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

MeanPointDensity
MeanPointDensity[<i>pdata</i>] estimates the mean point density λ from point data <i>pdata</i> in the observation region <i>reg</i>. 

MeanPointDensity[<i>bdata</i>] estimates the mean point density λ from binned data <i>bdata</i>.

MeanPointDensity[<i>pproc</i>] computes the mean point density λ for point process <i>pproc</i>.

---

MeanShift
MeanShift[<i>list</i>,<i>d</i>] replaces each element in <i>list</i> by the mean of the values of all elements that differ by less than <i>d</i>.

MeanShift[<i>list</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns the list where only the specified parts <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are replaced with mean-shifted values.

MeanShift[<i>image</i>,…] mean shift of the pixel values in <i>image</i>.

---

MeanSquaredLossLayer
MeanSquaredLossLayer[] represents a loss layer that computes the mean squared loss between its "Input" port and "Target" port.

---

Median
Median[<i>data</i>] gives the median estimate q&amp;^<sub>1/4</sub> of the elements in <i>data</i>. 

Median[<i>dist</i>] gives the median of the distribution <i>dist</i>. 

---

MedianDeviation
MedianDeviation[<i>data</i>] gives the median absolute deviation from the median q&amp;^<sub>1/2</sub> of the elements in <i>data</i>.

---

MedicalTestData
MedicalTestData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the medical test <i>entity</i>.

MedicalTestData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified medical test entities.

MedicalTestData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Medium
Medium is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be medium sized.

---

MeijerGReduce
MeijerGReduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] attempts to reduce <i>expr</i> to a single MeijerG object as a function of <i>x</i>.

---

MeixnerDistribution
MeixnerDistribution[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>d</i>] represents a Meixner distribution with location parameter <i>m</i>, scale parameter <i>a</i>, skew parameter <i>b</i>, and shape parameter <i>d</i>.

---

MellinConvolve
MellinConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] gives the Mellin convolution with respect to <i>x</i> of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>.

MellinConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Mellin convolution.

---

MellinTransform
MellinTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the Mellin transform of <i>expr</i>.

MellinTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multidimensional Mellin transform of <i>expr</i>. 

---

MemberQ
MemberQ[<i>list</i>,<i>form</i>] returns True if an element of <i>list</i> matches <i>form</i>, and False otherwise. 

MemberQ[<i>list</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] tests all parts of <i>list</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

MemberQ[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of MemberQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

MemoryAvailable
MemoryAvailable[] gives the estimated number of bytes readily available for storing additional data in the current Wolfram Language kernel session.

---

MemoryConstrained
MemoryConstrained[<i>expr</i>,<i>b</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, stopping if more than <i>b</i> bytes of memory are requested. 

MemoryConstrained[<i>expr</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>failexpr</i>] returns <i>failexpr</i> if the memory constraint is not met. 

---

MemoryConstraint
MemoryConstraint is an option for TestReport and VerificationTest that specifies how much memory (in bytes) the test is allowed to use.

---

MemoryInUse
MemoryInUse[] gives the number of bytes currently being used to store all data in the current Wolfram Language kernel session. 

MemoryInUse[$FrontEnd] gives the number of bytes used in the Wolfram System front end.

---

MengerMesh
MengerMesh[<i>n</i>] gives a mesh region representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Menger sponge. 

MengerMesh[<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Menger sponge in dimension <i>d</i>.

---

Merge
Merge[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] merges the associations <i>assoc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, using the function <i>f</i> to combine values with the same key. 

Merge[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] gives an association in which values corresponding to identical keys are combined using <i>f</i>. 

Merge[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of Merge that can be applied to an expression.

---

MergingFunction
MergingFunction is an option for functions such as PersistentSymbol that specifies a function to apply to the list of values found.

---

MersennePrimeExponent
MersennePrimeExponent[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> Mersenne prime exponent.

---

MersennePrimeExponentQ
MersennePrimeExponentQ[<i>n</i>] returns True if <i>n</i> is a Mersenne prime exponent, and False otherwise.

---

Mesh
Mesh is an option for Plot3D, DensityPlot, and other plotting functions that specifies what mesh should be drawn. 

---

MeshCellCentroid
MeshCellCentroid is an annotation of MeshRegion and BoundaryMeshRegion objects that gives the centroids of mesh cells.

---

MeshCellHighlight
MeshCellHighlight is an option and annotation of MeshRegion, BoundaryMeshRegion, and related functions that specifies mesh cells to highlight.

---

MeshCellLabel
MeshCellLabel is an option to MeshRegion, BoundaryMeshRegion and related functions that specifies labels and placements for mesh cells. 

---

MeshCellMarker
MeshCellMarker is an option to MeshRegion and BoundaryMeshRegion that specifies integer markers to associate with mesh cells. 

---

MeshCellMeasure
MeshCellMeasure is an annotation of MeshRegion and BoundaryMeshRegion objects that gives the measures of mesh cells.

---

MeshCellQuality
MeshCellQuality is an annotation of MeshRegion and BoundaryMeshRegion objects that gives a quality measure for mesh cells.

---

MeshCellShapeFunction
MeshCellShapeFunction is an option and annotation for MeshRegion, BoundaryMeshRegion, and related functions that specifies functions to use to generate primitives for rendering mesh cells.

---

MeshCellStyle
MeshCellStyle is an option and annotation of MeshRegion, BoundaryMeshRegion, and related functions that specifies styles to use for mesh cells. 

---

MeshConnectivityGraph
MeshConnectivityGraph[<i>mr</i>,0] gives a graph of points connected by lines.

MeshConnectivityGraph[<i>mr</i>,<i>d</i>] gives a graph between cells of dimension <i>d</i> that share a cell of dimension <i>d</i>-1.

MeshConnectivityGraph[<i>mr</i>,{<i>d</i>,<i>e</i>},<i>r</i>] gives a graph from cells of dimension <i>d</i> to cells of dimension <i>e</i> that share a cell of dimension <i>r</i>.

---

MeshCoordinates
MeshCoordinates[<i>mreg</i>] gives a list of coordinates in the mesh region <i>mreg</i>.

---

MeshFunctions
MeshFunctions is an option for plotting functions that specifies functions to use to determine the placement of mesh divisions. 

---

MeshRefinementFunction
MeshRefinementFunction is an option for DiscretizeRegion and related functions that specifies a function to indicate whether mesh cells should be refined or not.

---

MeshRegionQ
MeshRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] yields True if the region <i>reg</i> is a valid MeshRegion object and False otherwise.

---

MeshShading
MeshShading is an option for plotting functions that gives lists of colors to use for regions between mesh divisions. 

---

MeshStyle
MeshStyle is an option for Plot3D, DensityPlot, and other plotting functions that specifies the style in which to draw a mesh. 

---

Message
Message[<i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i>] prints the message <i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i> unless it has been switched off. 

Message[<i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i>,<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] prints a message, inserting the values of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as needed. 

---

MessageDialog
MessageDialog[<i>expr</i>] puts up a standard message dialog that displays <i>expr</i> together with an OK button.

MessageDialog[<i>expr</i>,{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>:><i>act</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>lbl</i><sub>2</sub>:><i>act</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] includes buttons with labels <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that evaluate the corresponding <i>act</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> if clicked.

---

MessageName
<i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i> is a name for a message. 

---

MessagePacket
MessagePacket[<i>symbol</i>,<i>string</i>] is a WSTP packet containing a Wolfram Language message identifier of the form <i>symbol</i>::<i>string</i>.

---

Messages
Messages[<i>symbol</i>] gives all the messages assigned to a particular symbol. 

---

MetaCharacters
MetaCharacters is an option to StringPosition. With MetaCharacters -> None, no strings have special meanings. MetaCharacters -> {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>3</sub>} specifies the metacharacters for pattern escape, single character matching and multiple character matching. MetaCharacters -> Automatic is equivalent to MetaCharacters -> {"\\", ".", "*"}.

---

MetaInformation
MetaInformation is an option giving metainformation for Image, CloudObject, and other objects.

---

MeteorShowerData
MeteorShowerData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the meteor shower <i>entity</i>.

MeteorShowerData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified meteor shower entities.

MeteorShowerData[<i>name</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Method
Method is an option for various algorithm-intensive functions that specifies what internal methods they should use.

---

MexicanHatWavelet
MexicanHatWavelet[] represents the Mexican hat wavelet of width 1.

MexicanHatWavelet[σ] represents the Mexican hat wavelet of width σ.

---

MeyerWavelet
MeyerWavelet[] represents the Meyer wavelet of order 3.

MeyerWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents the Meyer wavelet of order <i>n</i> evaluated on the equally spaced interval {-10,10}.

MeyerWavelet[<i>n</i>,<i>lim</i>] represents the Meyer wavelet of order <i>n</i> evaluated on the equally spaced interval {-<i>lim</i>,<i>lim</i><i>}</i>. 

---

Midpoint
Midpoint[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the midpoint of the line segment connecting the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>.

Midpoint[Line[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}]] gives the midpoint of a line.

---

MIMETypeToFormatList
MIMETypeToFormatList[] returns lists of file formats corresponding to all registered MIME types.

MIMETypeToFormatList[<i>mime</i>] returns a list of file formats that matches the MIME type <i>mime</i>.

---

Min
Min[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] yields the numerically smallest of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Min[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…] yields the smallest element of any of the lists. 

---

MinColorDistance
MinColorDistance is an option for DominantColors that specifies the minimum distance between returned colors.

---

MinDate
MinDate[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the earliest date of the <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

MinDate[<i>interval</i>] gives the beginning of the date interval <i>interval</i>.

MinDate[<i>interval</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the beginning of <i>interval</i> as specified by granularity <i>gran</i>.

---

MinDetect
MinDetect[<i>image</i>] gives a binary image in which white pixels correspond to constant extended minima in <i>image</i>.

MinDetect[<i>image</i>,<i>h</i>] finds extended minima where the range of values is not greater than <i>h</i>.

MinDetect[<i>data</i>,…] applies minima detection to an array of data.

---

MineralData
MineralData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the mineral <i>entity</i>.

MineralData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified mineral entities.

MineralData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

MinimalBy
MinimalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>] returns a list of the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> for which the value of <i>f</i> is minimal.

MinimalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a list of the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> corresponding to the <i>n</i> smallest <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>].

MinimalBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> for sorting.

MinimalBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of MinimalBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

MinimalPolynomial
MinimalPolynomial[<i>s</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the minimal polynomial in <i>x</i> for which the algebraic number <i>s</i> is a root. 

MinimalPolynomial[<i>u</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the minimal polynomial of the finite field element <i>u</i> over <sub>p</sub>.

MinimalPolynomial[<i>u</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the minimal polynomial of <i>u</i> over the p<sup>k</sup>-element subfield of the ambient field of <i>u</i>.

MinimalPolynomial[<i>u</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>emb</i>] gives the minimal polynomial of <i>u</i> relative to the finite field embedding <i>emb</i>.

---

MinimalStateSpaceModel
MinimalStateSpaceModel[<i>sys</i>] gives the minimal state-space model of the state-space model <i>sys</i>.

MinimalStateSpaceModel[<i>sys</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] specifies the new coordinates <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Minimize
Minimize[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] minimizes <i>f</i> symbolically with respect to <i>x</i>.

Minimize[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] minimizes <i>f</i> symbolically with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

Minimize[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] minimizes <i>f</i> symbolically subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

Minimize[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

Minimize[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

MinimumTimeIncrement
MinimumTimeIncrement[<i>tseries</i>] gives the minimum time increment in the time series <i>tseries</i>.

---

MinIntervalSize
MinIntervalSize is an option for IntervalSlider that specifies the minimum size of the interval during interactive editing.

---

MinkowskiQuestionMark
MinkowskiQuestionMark[<i>x</i>] gives Minkowski's question mark function ?(x).

---

MinLimit
MinLimit[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup>] gives the min limit <sub><i>x</i><i>x</i><sup>*</sup></sub><i>f(x)</i>. 

MinLimit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the nested min limit +<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>⋯ +<i>x<sub>n</sub></i><i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup><i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>). 

MinLimit[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}] gives the multivariate min limit +{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><sup>*</sup>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sup>*</sup>}<i>f</i><i>(</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x<sub>n</sub></i>).

---

MinMax
MinMax[<i>list</i>] gives the list {Min[<i>list</i>],Max[<i>list</i>]}.

MinMax[<i>list</i>,δ] gives {Min[<i>list</i>]-δ, Max[<i>list</i>]+δ}.

MinMax[<i>list</i>,Scaled[<i>s</i>]] gives {Min[<i>list</i>]-δ, Max[<i>list</i>]+δ} where δ=<i>s</i>×(Max[<i>list</i>]-Min[<i>list</i>]).

MinMax[<i>list</i>,{δ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,δ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives {Min[<i>list</i>]-δ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,Max[<i>list</i>]+δ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}.

---

MinorPlanetData
MinorPlanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the minor planet <i>entity</i>.

MinorPlanetData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified minor planet entities.

MinorPlanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Minors
Minors[<i>m</i>] gives the minors of a matrix <i>m</i>. 

Minors[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> minors.

Minors[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>f</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> rather than Det to each of the submatrices picked out. 

---

MinPointSeparation
MinPointSeparation is an option for GeoGraphValuePlot that determines when to merge nearby vertices into a single vertex.

---

MinRecursion
MinRecursion is an option for NIntegrate and other numerical functions that use a recursive algorithm. With MinRecursion -> <i>n</i>, a minimum depth of recursion of <i>n</i> is used before tests for convergence begin.

---

MinStableDistribution
MinStableDistribution[μ,σ,ξ] represents a generalized minimum extreme value distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameter σ, and shape parameter ξ.

---

Minus
-<i>x</i> is the arithmetic negation of <i>x</i>. 

---

MinusPlus
MinusPlus[<i>x</i>] displays as ∓x.

MinusPlus[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x∓y∓….

---

MinValue
MinValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the minimum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>.

MinValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the exact minimum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

MinValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the minimum value of <i>f</i> subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

MinValue[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

MinValue[…,…,<i>dom</i>] constrains variables to the domain <i>dom</i>, typically Reals or Integers.

---

Missing
Missing[] represents data that is missing.

Missing["<i>reason</i>"] specifies a reason for the data's being missing.

Missing["<i>reason</i>",<i>expr</i>] associates the expression <i>expr</i> with the missing data. 

---

MissingBehavior
