MissingBehavior is an option to Query and related functions that specifies how expressions with head Missing should be interpreted in the context of other functions.

---

MissingDataMethod
MissingDataMethod is an option to TemporalData and other functions that controls how to process missing data. 

---

MissingDataRules
MissingDataRules is an option for SemanticImport and related functions that specifies what should be considered "missing" and what to replace it with.

---

MissingQ
MissingQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> has head Missing.

---

MissingString
MissingString is an option for TextString and related functions that indicates how an expression with head Missing should be converted to a string.

---

MissingStyle
MissingStyle is an option for GeoRegionValuePlot that specifies how locations with missing data should be displayed.

---

MissingValuePattern
MissingValuePattern is an option for SynthesizeMissingValues and ToTabular to specify which data elements are considered missing.

---

MissingValueSynthesis
MissingValueSynthesis is an option for functions such as Classify that specifies how missing values should be replaced.

---

MittagLefflerE
MittagLefflerE[α,<i>z</i>] gives the Mittag–Leffler function E<sub>α</sub>(z).

MittagLefflerE[α,β,<i>z</i>] gives the generalized Mittag–Leffler function E<sub>α,β</sub>(z).

---

MixedFractionParts
MixedFractionParts[<i>expr</i>] gives the list {IntegerPart[<i>expr</i>],FractionalPart[<i>expr</i>]}.

---

MixedGraphQ
MixedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a mixed graph and False otherwise. 

---

MixedMagnitude
MixedMagnitude[{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a mixed-magnitude expression consisting of values <i>val</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

MixedRadix
MixedRadix[{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the list of bases of a numerical system in which different digits have different bases.

---

MixedRadixQuantity
MixedRadixQuantity[{<i>value</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>value</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>unit</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] yields a single Quantity expression representing the addition of compatible <i>units</i> with magnitude <i>values</i>.

---

MixedUnit
MixedUnit[{<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>unit</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a mixed-unit expression consisting of units <i>unit</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>unit</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

MixtureDistribution
MixtureDistribution[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>w</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>dist</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a mixture distribution whose CDF is given as a sum of the CDFs of the component distributions <i>dist</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, each with weight <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Mod
Mod[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the remainder on division of <i>m</i> by <i>n</i>. 

Mod[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses an offset <i>d</i>. 

---

Modal
Modal is an option to functions such as CreateDialog that specifies whether the dialog that is created should be modal to the Wolfram System front end.

---

Mode
Mode is an option to Eliminate and related functions that specifies in what sense the equations are to be solved. The possible settings for Mode are Generic, Modular, and Rational.

---

Modular
Modular is a setting for the option Mode in Solve and related functions, which specifies that equations need be satisfied only modulo an integer.

---

ModularInverse
ModularInverse[<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the modular inverse of <i>k</i> modulo <i>n</i>.

---

ModularLambda
ModularLambda[τ] gives the modular lambda elliptic function λ(τ). 

---

Module
Module[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…},<i>expr</i>] specifies that occurrences of the symbols <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, … in <i>expr</i> should be treated as local. 

Module[{<i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] defines initial values for <i>x</i>, …. 

---

Modulus
Modulus<i>n</i> is an option that can be given in certain algebraic functions to specify that integers should be treated modulo <i>n</i>. 

---

MoebiusMu
MoebiusMu[<i>n</i>] gives the Möbius function μ(n). 

---

MoleculeDraw
MoleculeDraw[] displays a window with interactive tools for drawing a Molecule, and returns the result.

MoleculeDraw[<i>mol</i>] displays a window that initially contains the Molecule <i>mol</i>.

---

MoleculeMatchQ
MoleculeMatchQ[<i>mol</i>,<i>patt</i>] returns True if the Molecule matches the given pattern.

MoleculeMatchQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of MoleculeMatchQ that can be applied to a molecule.

---

MoleculeProperty
MoleculeProperty[<i>pname</i>] represents a property identified by <i>pname</i> for use in MoleculeValue.

MoleculeProperty[{<i>pname</i>,<i>item</i>}] represents a property that applies to <i>item</i> within a molecule.

---

MoleculeQ
MoleculeQ[<i>mol</i>] returns True if <i>mol</i> is a valid Molecule expression, and False otherwise.

---

MoleculeSubstructureCount
MoleculeSubstructureCount[<i>mol</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a count of the number of times <i>patt</i> appears as a substructure in <i>mol</i>.

MoleculeSubstructureCount[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of MoleculeSubstructureCount that can be applied to a molecule.

---

Moment
Moment[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the order <i>r</i> moment μ<sub> r</sub> of <i>data</i>.

Moment[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] gives the order {<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>} multivariate moment μ<sub> r<sub>1</sub>, …, r<sub>m</sub></sub> of <i>data</i>.

Moment[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the moment of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

Moment[<i>r</i>] represents the order <i>r</i> formal moment. 

---

MomentConvert
MomentConvert[<i>mexpr</i>,<i>form</i>] converts the moment expression <i>mexpr</i> to the specified form. 

---

MomentEvaluate
MomentEvaluate[<i>mexpr</i>,<i>dist</i>] evaluates formal moments in the moment expression <i>mexpr</i> on the distribution <i>dist</i>.

MomentEvaluate[<i>mexpr</i>,<i>list</i>] evaluates formal moments and formal sample moments in <i>mexpr</i> on the data <i>list</i>. 

MomentEvaluate[<i>mexpr</i>,<i>dist</i>,<i>list</i>] evaluates formal moments on the distribution <i>dist</i> and formal sample moments on the data <i>list</i>. 

---

MomentGeneratingFunction
MomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the moment-generating function for the distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variable <i>t</i>. 

MomentGeneratingFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the moment-generating function for the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> as a function of the variables <i>t</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, … . 

---

MomentOfInertia
MomentOfInertia[<i>reg</i>,<i>pt</i>,<i>v</i>] computes the moment of inertia for the region <i>reg</i> rotating around an axis through the point <i>pt</i> in direction <i>v</i>.

MomentOfInertia[<i>reg</i>] computes the moment of inertia matrix for the region <i>reg</i> relative to the center of mass.

MomentOfInertia[<i>reg</i>,<i>pt</i>] computes the moment of inertia matrix relative to the point <i>pt</i>.

---

Monday
Monday is a day of the week.

---

MonomialList
MonomialList[<i>poly</i>] gives the list of all monomials in the polynomial <i>poly</i>.

MonomialList[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list of monomials with respect to the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in poly.

MonomialList[<i>poly</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>order</i>] puts the monomials in the specified order.

---

MonsterGroupM
MonsterGroupM[] represents the sporadic simple monster group M.

---

MoonPhase
MoonPhase[] gives moon phase fraction of illumination for the current date.

MoonPhase[<i>datespec</i>] gives moon phase fraction of illumination for the specified date.

MoonPhase[<i>property</i>] gives the property of the moon phase for the current date.

MoonPhase[<i>datespec</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the property of the moon phase for the specified date.

---

MoonPosition
MoonPosition[] gives the position of the Moon for the current date and location.

MoonPosition[<i>datespec</i>] gives the position of the Moon for the specified date.

MoonPosition[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the position of the Moon for the specified location.

MoonPosition[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the position of the Moon for the specified date and location.

MoonPosition[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the positions of the Moon for all specified locations on the specified dates.

MoonPosition[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended locations.

---

MorletWavelet
MorletWavelet[] represents a Morlet wavelet. 

---

MorphologicalBinarize
MorphologicalBinarize[<i>image</i><i>,</i>{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] creates a binary image from <i>image</i> by replacing all values above the upper threshold <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> with 1, also including pixels with intensities above the lower threshold <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> that are connected to the foreground.

MorphologicalBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] uses <i>t</i> as the upper threshold, automatically choosing a suitable value for the lower threshold.

MorphologicalBinarize[<i>image</i>] chooses the lower and the upper threshold automatically.

---

MorphologicalBranchPoints
MorphologicalBranchPoints[<i>image</i><i>]</i> gives a version of a binary image <i>image</i> in which white pixels represent the morphological branch points.

---

MorphologicalComponents
MorphologicalComponents[<i>image</i>] gives an array in which each pixel of <i>image</i> is replaced by an integer index representing the connected foreground image component in which the pixel lies.

MorphologicalComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

MorphologicalComponents[<i>video</i>,…] computes connected components in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

MorphologicalEulerNumber
MorphologicalEulerNumber[<i>image</i>] computes the morphological Euler number of regions in a binary image.

MorphologicalEulerNumber[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

MorphologicalGraph
MorphologicalGraph[<i>image</i>] gives a graph object that represents the connectivity of the morphological branch points and endpoints of the objects in <i>image</i> after applying morphological thinning.

---

MorphologicalPerimeter
MorphologicalPerimeter[<i>image</i>] picks out the morphological perimeter of regions of foreground in <i>image</i>.

MorphologicalPerimeter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

MorphologicalTransform
MorphologicalTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>f</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the 3×3 neighborhood of each pixel in a binary image <i>image</i>.

MorphologicalTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>rule</i>] applies a morphological transformation specified by a rule number <i>rule</i>.

MorphologicalTransform[<i>image</i>,"<i>name</i>"] uses a named transformation "<i>name</i>".

MorphologicalTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>transformation</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>n</i> iterations of <i>transformation</i> on <i>image</i>.

---

MortalityData
MortalityData[<i>spec</i>] gives the values of all properties for the specified demographic.

MortalityData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the specified demographic.

---

Most
Most[<i>expr</i>] gives <i>expr</i> with the last element removed. 

---

MountainData
MountainData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the mountain <i>entity</i>.

MountainData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified mountain entities.

MountainData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

MovieData
MovieData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the movie <i>entity</i>.

MovieData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified movie entities.

MovieData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

MovingAverage
MovingAverage[<i>list</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the moving average of <i>list</i>, computed by averaging runs of <i>r</i> elements.

MovingAverage[<i>list</i>,{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>w</i><sub><i>r</i></sub>}] gives the moving average of <i>list</i>, computed with weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

MovingMap
MovingMap[<i>f</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>w</i>] applies <i>f</i> to size <i>w</i> windows in the specified <i>data</i>.

MovingMap[<i>f</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>wspec</i>] uses windows specified by <i>wspec</i>.

MovingMap[<i>f</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>wspec</i>,<i>padding</i>] pads <i>data</i> using <i>padding</i>.

---

MovingMedian
MovingMedian[<i>list</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the moving median of <i>list</i>, computed using spans of <i>r</i> elements.

---

MoyalDistribution
MoyalDistribution[μ,σ] represents a Moyal distribution with location parameter μ and scale parameter σ.

MoyalDistribution[] represents a Moyal distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

MultiaxisArrangement
MultiaxisArrangement is an option to plotting functions that specifies how multiple axes are arranged.

---

Multicolumn
Multicolumn[<i>list</i>,<i>cols</i>] is an object that formats with the elements of <i>list</i> arranged in a grid with the indicated number of columns.

Multicolumn[<i>list</i>,{<i>rows</i>,Automatic}] formats as a grid with the indicated number of rows.

Multicolumn[<i>list</i>,{<i>rows</i>,<i>cols</i>}] formats as a grid with the indicated number of rows and columns.

Multicolumn[<i>list</i>] formats with the elements of <i>list</i> in a roughly square arrangement.

---

MultiedgeStyle
MultiedgeStyle is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that specifies how to draw multiple edges.

---

MultigraphQ
MultigraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a multigraph and False otherwise.

---

MultilaunchWarning
MultilaunchWarning is a global option that specifies whether a warning is given when you try to modify user preferences while running two copies of the Wolfram System simultaneously.

---

Multinomial
Multinomial[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the multinomial coefficient (n<sub>1</sub>+n<sub>2</sub>+…)!/(n<sub>1</sub>! n<sub>2</sub>! …). 

---

MultinomialDistribution
MultinomialDistribution[<i>n</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents a multinomial distribution with <i>n</i> trials and probabilities <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

MultinormalDistribution
MultinormalDistribution[Σ] represents a multivariate normal distribution with zero mean and covariance matrix Σ.

MultinormalDistribution[μ,Σ] represents a multivariate normal (Gaussian) distribution with mean vector μ and covariance matrix Σ.

---

Multiplicity
Multiplicity is an option to Roots. Multiplicity -> <i>n</i> specifies that the multiplicity of each of the roots is <i>n</i> in the final result.

---

MultiplySides
MultiplySides[<i>rel</i>,<i>x</i>] multiplies each side of the equation or inequality <i>rel</i> by <i>x</i>.

MultiplySides[<i>rel</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rel</i><sub>2</sub>] multiplies the corresponding sides of two equations or inequalities.

---

Multiselection
Multiselection is an option to ListPicker that specifies whether multiple values may be selected.

---

MultivariateHypergeometricDistribution
MultivariateHypergeometricDistribution[<i>n</i>,{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>m</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] represents a multivariate hypergeometric distribution with <i>n</i> draws without replacement from a collection containing <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> objects of type <i>i</i>. 

---

MultivariatePoissonDistribution
MultivariatePoissonDistribution[μ<sub>0</sub>,{μ<sub>1</sub>,μ<sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a multivariate Poisson distribution with mean vector {μ<sub>0</sub>+μ<sub>1</sub>,μ<sub>0</sub>+μ<sub>2</sub>,…}.

---

MultivariateTDistribution
MultivariateTDistribution[Σ,ν] represents the multivariate Student t distribution with scale matrix Σ and degrees of freedom parameter ν.

MultivariateTDistribution[μ,Σ,ν] represents the multivariate Student t distribution with location μ, scale matrix Σ, and ν degrees of freedom.

---

N
N[<i>expr</i>] gives the numerical value of <i>expr</i>. 

N[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] attempts to give a result with <i>n</i>‐digit precision. 

---

NakagamiDistribution
NakagamiDistribution[μ,ω] represents a Nakagami distribution with shape parameter μ and spread parameter ω.

---

NameQ
NameQ["<i>string</i>"] yields True if there are any symbols whose names match the string pattern given, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Names
Names["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the names of symbols that match the string. 

Names[<i>patt</i>] gives a list of names matching the arbitrary string pattern <i>patt</i>.

Names[{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of names matching any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Nand
Nand[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is the logical NAND function. It evaluates its arguments in order, giving True immediately if any of them are False, and False if they are all True. 

---

NArgMax
NArgMax[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a position <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally maximized.

NArgMax[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position {<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,…} at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally maximized.

NArgMax[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally maximized subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

NArgMax[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>reg</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

NArgMin
NArgMin[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a position <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally minimized.

NArgMin[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position {<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…} at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally minimized.

NArgMin[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives a position at which <i>f</i> is numerically globally minimized subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

NArgMin[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>reg</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

NBernoulliB
NBernoulliB[<i>n</i>] gives the numerical value of the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> Bernoulli number. 

NBernoulliB[<i>n</i>, <i>d</i>] gives the result to <i>d</i>-digit precision.

---

NBodySimulation
NBodySimulation[<i>law</i>,{<i>state</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>state</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>t</i>] generates a simulation of the motion of a system of <i>n</i> bodies with initial states <i>state</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, governed by the specified potential or force law, over a length of time <i>t</i>.

NBodySimulation[<i>law</i>,<|<i>body</i><sub>1</sub><i>state</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>body</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>state</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>|>,<i>t</i>] generates a simulation of the motion of a system of <i>n</i> bodies with names <i>body</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

NBodySimulationData
NBodySimulationData[<i>�</i>] represents the result of an <i>n</i>-body simulation.

---

NCache
NCache[<i>x</i>,<i>xn</i>] represents a numeric cache object for a quantity with exact value <i>x</i> and approximate numerical value <i>xn</i>.

---

NDEigensystem
NDEigensystem[<i>ℒ</i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…]],<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> smallest magnitude eigenvalues and eigenfunctions for the linear differential operator <i>ℒ</i> over the region Ω.

NDEigensystem[{<i><i>ℒ</i><sub>1</sub></i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>v</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…],<i><i>ℒ</i><sub>2</sub></i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>v</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…],…},{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>]  gives eigenvalues and eigenfunctions for the coupled differential operators {<i>op</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>op</i><sub>2</sub>,…} over the region Ω.

NDEigensystem[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>u</i>,…},<i>t</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the eigenvalues and eigenfunctions in the spatial variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} for solutions <i>u</i>,… of the coupled time-dependent differential equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

NDEigenvalues
NDEigenvalues[<i>ℒ</i>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…]],<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> smallest magnitude eigenvalues for the linear differential operator <i>ℒ</i> over the region Ω.

NDEigenvalues[{<i>ℒ</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>v</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…],<i>ℒ</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>v</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…],…},{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>]  gives eigenvalues for the coupled differential operators {<i>op</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>op</i><sub>2</sub>,…} over the region Ω.

NDEigenvalues[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>u</i>,…},<i>t</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈Ω,<i>n</i>] gives the eigenvalues in the spatial variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} for solutions <i>u</i>,… of the coupled time-dependent differential equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

NDSolve
NDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] finds a numerical solution to the ordinary differential equations <i>eqns</i> for the function <i>u</i> with the independent variable <i>x</i> in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

NDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over a rectangular region.

NDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

NDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω] solves the time-dependent partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

NDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] solves for the functions <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

NDSolveValue
NDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the value of <i>expr</i> with functions determined by a numerical solution to the ordinary differential equations <i>eqns</i> with the independent variable <i>x</i> in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

NDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over a rectangular region.

NDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

NDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω] solves the time-dependent partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

---

Nearest
Nearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the list of <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest. 

Nearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest. 

Nearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the same result. 

Nearest[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>prop</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to which <i>x</i> is nearest.

Nearest[<i>data</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] effectively gives {Nearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>],Nearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>],…}.

Nearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> nearest <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>x</i>. 

Nearest[<i>data</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>}] gives the <i>n</i> or fewer nearest <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>x</i> that are within radius <i>r</i> of <i>x</i>.

Nearest[<i>data</i>] generates a NearestFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different <i>x</i>. 

---

NearestFunction
NearestFunction[<i>data</i>] represents a function whose values give the elements closest to an element that is supplied.

---

NearestNeighborG
NearestNeighborG[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates the nearest neighbor function G(r) at radius <i>r</i> in the point data <i>pdata</i>.

NearestNeighborG[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes G(r) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

NearestNeighborG[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes G(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

NearestNeighborG[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function G that can be applied repeatedly to different radii <i>r</i>.

---

NearestNeighborGraph
NearestNeighborGraph[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a graph with vertices <i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,… and edges connecting each <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to its nearest neighbors.

NearestNeighborGraph[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives a graph connecting each <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to its <i>k</i> nearest neighbors.

NearestNeighborGraph[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>,<i>r</i>}] gives a graph connecting each <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to at most <i>k</i> nearest vertices within radius <i>r</i> of <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NearestNeighborGraph[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{All,<i>r</i>}] gives a graph connecting each <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to all vertices within radius <i>r</i> of <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

NearestTo
NearestTo[<i>x</i>] is an operator form that yields Nearest[<i>elems</i>,<i>x</i>] when applied to a list <i>elems</i>.

NearestTo[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] is an operator form that yields Nearest[<i>elems</i>,<i>x</i><i>,</i><i>n</i>] when applied to a list <i>elems</i>.

NearestTo[<i>x</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>}] is an operator form that yields Nearest[<i>elems</i>,<i>x</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>}] when applied to a list <i>elems</i>.

---

NebulaData
NebulaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the nebula <i>entity</i>.

NebulaData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified nebula entities.

NebulaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

NeedlemanWunschSimilarity
NeedlemanWunschSimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a number representing the Needleman–Wunsch similarity between strings or vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

NeedlemanWunschSimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a number representing the Needleman–Wunsch similarity between strings, vectors or biomolecular sequences <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

Needs
Needs["<i>context</i>`"] loads an appropriate file if the specified context is not already in $Packages. 

Needs["<i>context`</i>""<i>alias`</i>"] loads the given context and establishes <i>alias</i> as a context alias for that context.

Needs["<i>context</i>`","<i>file</i>"] loads <i>file</i> if the specified context is not already in $Packages. 

---

Negative
Negative[<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>x</i> is a negative number. 

---

NegativeBinomialDistribution
NegativeBinomialDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents a negative binomial distribution with parameters <i>n</i> and <i>p</i>.

---

NegativeDefiniteMatrixQ
NegativeDefiniteMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly negative definite, and False otherwise.

---

NegativeIntegers
NegativeIntegers represents the domain of strictly negative integers, as in <i>x</i>∈NegativeIntegers. 

---

NegativelyOrientedPoints
NegativelyOrientedPoints[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] tests whether the sequence of points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> is negatively oriented.

---

NegativeMultinomialDistribution
NegativeMultinomialDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents a negative multinomial distribution with parameter <i>n</i> and failure probability vector <i>p</i>.

---

NegativeRationals
NegativeRationals represents the domain of strictly negative rational numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈NegativeRationals. 

---

NegativeReals
NegativeReals represents the domain of strictly negative real numbers.

---

NegativeSemidefiniteMatrixQ
NegativeSemidefiniteMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly negative semidefinite, and False otherwise.

---

NeighborhoodData
NeighborhoodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the neighborhood <i>entity</i>.

NeighborhoodData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified neighborhood entities.

NeighborhoodData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

NeighborhoodGraph
NeighborhoodGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the graph neighborhood of a vertex <i>v</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

NeighborhoodGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the graph neighborhood of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that can be vertices, edges, or subgraphs of <i>g</i>.

NeighborhoodGraph[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the graph neighborhood of the vertices and edges that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

NeighborhoodGraph[<i>g</i>,…,<i>d</i>] gives the neighborhood up to distance <i>d</i>.

NeighborhoodGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Nest
Nest[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives an expression with <i>f</i> applied <i>n</i> times to <i>expr</i>.

Nest[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of Nest that can be applied to expressions.

---

NestedGreaterGreater
NestedGreaterGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⪢<i>y</i>⪢….

---

NestedLessLess
NestedLessLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⪡<i>y</i>⪡….

---

NestGraph
NestGraph[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the graph obtained by starting with <i>expr</i> and applying <i>f</i> successively <i>n</i> times.

NestGraph[<i>f</i>,{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] gives the graph obtained by applying <i>f</i> to <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

NestGraph[<i>f</i>,<i>graph</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the graph obtained by applying <i>f</i> to the vertices of <i>graph</i> and extending the <i>graph</i>.

---

NestList
NestList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of the results of applying <i>f</i> to <i>expr</i> 0 through <i>n</i> times.

NestList[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of NestList that can be applied to expressions.

---

NestTree
NestTree[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>] adds children to each leaf of <i>tree</i>, with <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] giving the list of data for the new children of a leaf with data <i>expr</i>.

NestTree[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>n</i>] successively applies <i>f</i> to the data of each leaf up to level <i>n</i>, adding at most <i>n</i> levels to each leaf.

NestTree[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>h</i>] additionally applies <i>h</i> to the data of the new subtrees.

NestTree[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,…] constructs a tree by nesting <i>f</i> on the tree leaf with data <i>expr</i>.

---

NestWhile
NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>] starts with <i>expr</i>, then repeatedly applies <i>f</i> until applying <i>test</i> to the result no longer yields True. 

NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>] supplies the most recent <i>m</i> results as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step. 

NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,All] supplies all results so far as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step. 

NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>max</i>] applies <i>f</i> at most <i>max</i> times. 

NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>max</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> an extra <i>n</i> times. 

NestWhile[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>max</i>,-<i>n</i>] returns the result found when <i>f</i> had been applied <i>n</i> fewer times. 

---

NestWhileList
NestWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>] generates a list of the results of applying <i>f</i> repeatedly, starting with <i>expr</i>, and continuing until applying <i>test</i> to the result no longer yields True. 

NestWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>] supplies the most recent <i>m</i> results as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step. 

NestWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,All] supplies all results so far as arguments for <i>test</i> at each step. 

NestWhileList[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>max</i>] applies <i>f</i> at most <i>max</i> times. 

---

NetAppend
NetAppend[<i>net</i>,<i>layer</i>] appends a layer or a net onto a NetChain, a layer or a NetGraph with one output port.

NetAppend[<i>net</i>,"<i>name</i>"<i>layer</i>] appends a layer with a given name.

NetAppend[<i>net</i>,{<i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] appends several layers or nets.

---

NetArray
NetArray[] represents an array in a net.

NetArray["<i>name</i>"] uses "<i>name</i>" as an identifier to share the array in more than one layer.

NetArray[<i>prop</i><i>value</i>] specifies the property <i>prop</i> for the array.

NetArray["Name"<i>name</i>,"Array"<i>array</i>,…] specifies several properties for the array.

---

NetArrayLayer
NetArrayLayer[] represents a layer that has no input and produces as output a constant array.

NetArrayLayer[<i>opts</i>] includes options for the initial value of the array or output size.

---

NetBidirectionalOperator
NetBidirectionalOperator[<i>net</i>] represents a net that applies <i>net</i> to a sequence and to its reverse, concatenating both results into one output sequence.

NetBidirectionalOperator[{<i>fnet</i>,<i>bnet</i>}] uses <i>fnet</i> on the normal input and <i>bnet</i> on the reversed input.

NetBidirectionalOperator[<i>nets</i>,<i>agg</i>] aggregates the two output sequences using the specified aggregation function.

---

NetChain
NetChain[{<i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] specifies a neural net in which the output of <i>layer</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is connected to the input of <i>layer</i><sub><i>i+1</i></sub>.

NetChain[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…] specifies a net consisting of a chain of explicitly named layers. 

---

NetDecoder
NetDecoder[<i>"name"</i>] represents a decoder that takes a net representation and decodes it into an expression of a given form.

NetDecoder[{"<i>name</i>",…}] represents a decoder with additional parameters specified.

---

NetDelete
NetDelete[<i>net</i>,<i>n</i>] deletes the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> layer from a NetChain or NetGraph.

NetDelete[<i>net</i>,"<i>name</i>"] deletes a named layer.

NetDelete[<i>net</i>,{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes several layers simultaneously.

NetDelete[<i>graph</i>,NetPort["<i>name</i>"]] deletes an output or state-input port from a NetGraph.

NetDelete[<i>graph</i>,{NetPort[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>],NetPort[<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>],…}] deletes several output or state-input ports simultaneously.

---

NetDrop
NetDrop[<i>chain</i>,<i>n</i>] removes the first <i>n</i> layers from a NetChain.

NetDrop[<i>chain</i>,-<i>n</i>] removes the last <i>n</i> layers from a NetChain.

NetDrop[<i>chain</i>,{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] drops the layers between <i>start</i> and <i>end</i> in a NetChain.

---

NetEncoder
NetEncoder["<i>name</i>"] represents an encoder that takes a given form of input and encodes it as an array for use in a net.

NetEncoder[{"<i>name</i>",…}] represents an encoder with additional parameters specified.

---

NetEvaluationMode
NetEvaluationMode is an option that can be given when applying neural net functions to input data, specifying whether the net should use training-specific behavior.

---

NetExtract
NetExtract[<i>layer</i>,"<i>param</i>"] extracts the value of a parameter for the specified net layer.

NetExtract[<i>net</i>,<i>lspec</i>] extracts the layer identified by <i>lspec</i> from within the NetGraph or NetChain object <i>net</i>.

NetExtract[<i>net</i>,{<i>lspec</i>,"<i>param</i>"}] extracts the value of the parameter <i>param</i> from the layer identified by <i>lspec</i> in <i>net</i>. 

NetExtract[<i>net</i>,NetArray[<i>spec</i>]] extracts the value of a shared array within a network or layer.

NetExtract[<i>coder</i>,"<i>param</i>"] extracts the value of a parameter for the specified NetEncoder or NetDecoder.

NetExtract[…,{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts a set of elements, where each <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is a list.

---

NetFlatten
NetFlatten[<i>net</i>] collapses nested NetChain and NetGraph objects within <i>net</i>.

NetFlatten[<i>net</i>,<i>n</i>] collapses up to nesting level <i>n</i>.

---

NetFoldOperator
NetFoldOperator[<i>net</i>] represents a net in which <i>net</i> is folded over a sequence of inputs, maintaining a recurrent state.

NetFoldOperator[<i>net</i>,{<i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>in</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents a net in which <i>net</i> is folded over its inputs, maintaining a recurrent state by feeding the <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of each step back to the <i>in</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of the next step.

NetFoldOperator[<i>net</i>,<i>feedback</i>,{<i>const</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>const</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] treats the inputs <i>const</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>net</i> as being constant instead of mapped over.

NetFoldOperator[<i>net</i>,<i>feedback</i>,<i>constants</i>,{<i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] returns the sequence of values for the specific outputs <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

NetGANOperator
NetGANOperator[{<i>generator</i>,<i>discriminator</i>}] represents a network to perform generative adversarial network (GAN) training with a generative net <i>generator</i> and a classification net <i>discriminator</i>.

NetGANOperator[{<i>generator</i>,<i>discriminator</i>},<i>loss</i>] specifies the loss type to be used.

---

NetGraph
NetGraph[{<i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub><i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub><i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] specifies a neural net defined by a graph in which the output of layer <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is given as input to layer <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NetGraph[<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…,{<i>name</i><sub><i>m1</i></sub><i>name</i><sub><i>n1</i></sub>,…}] specifies a net with explicitly named layers.

NetGraph[<i>layer</i>] converts a layer or a NetChain into an equivalent minimal NetGraph.

---

NetInformation
NetInformation[<i>net</i>] gives a report about the neural network <i>net</i>.

NetInformation[<i>net</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of property property "<i>prop</i>" of <i>net</i>.

NetInformation[{<i>net</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>net</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>prop</i>"] gives a list containing the result for each <i>net</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

NetInitialize
NetInitialize[<i>net</i>] gives a net in which all uninitialized learnable parameters in <i>net</i> have been given initial values.

NetInitialize[<i>net</i>,All] gives a net in which all learnable parameters have been given initial values. 

---

NetInsert
NetInsert[<i>chain</i>,<i>layer</i>,<i>i</i>] inserts a layer into a NetChain before the layer at position <i>i</i>.

NetInsert[<i>chain</i>,"<i>name</i>"-><i>layer</i>,"<i>pos</i>"] inserts a named layer into a NetChain before the layer at the given position.

---

NetInsertSharedArrays
NetInsertSharedArrays[<i>net</i>] converts all ordinary arrays in <i>net</i> into NetSharedArray objects.

NetInsertSharedArrays[<i>net</i>,"<i>prefix</i>"] uses a prefix for the names of all newly shared arrays. 

---

NetJoin
NetJoin[<i>net</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>net</i><sub>2</sub>,…] connects a series of NetChain or NetGraph objects to form a single NetChain or NetGraph.

---

NetMapOperator
NetMapOperator[<i>net</i>] represents a net in which <i>net</i> is mapped over a sequence of inputs to give a sequence of outputs.

---

NetMapThreadOperator
NetMapThreadOperator[<i>mapnet</i>] represents a net in which <i>mapnet</i> is mapped over one or more inputs to give one or more outputs.

NetMapThreadOperator[<i>mapnet</i>,<i>n</i>] represents a net in which <i>mapnet</i> is mapped over its inputs at depth <i>n</i>.

NetMapThreadOperator[<i>mapnet</i>,<i>input</i><sub>1</sub><i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>input</i><sub>2</sub><i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a net in which <i>mapnet</i> is mapped over the input named <i>input</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at depth <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and all other inputs are replicated.

---

NetMeasurements
NetMeasurements[<i>net</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>measurement</i>] computes the requested measurement for the net evaluated on <i>data</i>.

NetMeasurements[<i>net</i>,<i>data</i>,{<i>mspec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>mspec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes a list of measurements for the net evaluated on <i>data</i>.

---

NetModel
NetModel["<i>name</i>"] obtains a neural net model with the specified name from the Neural Net Repository. 

NetModel[{"<i>name</i>",<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>setting</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] obtains a specified model from a parameterized family of models.

NetModel[<i>model</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives property <i>prop</i> of the model.

NetModel[] gives a dataset of available pre-trained neural net models.

---

NetNestOperator
NetNestOperator[<i>net</i>,<i>n</i>] represents a net in which <i>net</i> is applied <i>n</i> times to the input.

---

NetPairEmbeddingOperator
NetPairEmbeddingOperator[<i>net</i>] represents a net that takes a pair of arrays, embeds them into a vector space using <i>net</i>, and outputs the distance under the embedding.

NetPairEmbeddingOperator[<i>net,opts</i>] includes options for distance function to use and other parameters.

---

NetPort
NetPort["<i>port</i>"] represents the specified input or output port for a complete net.

NetPort[{<i>n</i>,"<i>port</i>"}] represents the specified port for layer number <i>n</i> in a NetGraph or similar construct.

NetPort[{"<i>name</i>","<i>port</i>"}] represents the specified port for the layer with the specified name.

NetPort[<i>spec</i>,<i>port</i>] is treated as equivalent to NetPort[{<i>spec</i>,<i>port</i>}].

NetPort[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…,"<i>port</i>"}] permits access to the port of nested layers in a NetGraph or a NetChain.

NetPort[All,"States"] represents the set of all states in a net associated with recurrent layers such as LongShortTermMemoryLayer.

---

NetPortGradient
NetPortGradient["<i>port</i>"] represents the gradient of the output of a net with respect to the value of the specified input port. 

NetPortGradient["<i>param</i>"] represents the gradient of the output with respect to a learned parameter named <i>param</i>.

NetPortGradient[{<i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…,"<i>param</i>"}] represents the gradient with respect to a parameter at a specific position in a net.

NetPortGradient[All] represents the gradients with respect to all inputs and parameters.

---

NetPrepend
NetPrepend[<i>net</i>,<i>layer</i>] prepends a layer or a net onto a NetChain, a layer or a NetGraph with one input port.

NetPrepend[<i>net</i>,"<i>name</i>"<i>layer</i>] appends a layer with a given name.

NetPrepend[<i>net</i>,{<i>layer</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>layer</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] prepends several layers or nets.

---

NetRename
NetRename[<i>net</i>,"<i>old</i>""<i>new</i>"] gives a net in which the name <i>old</i> for a layer is replaced with <i>new</i>.

NetRename[<i>net</i>,NetPort["<i>old</i>"]NetPort["<i>new</i>"]] gives a net in which the name <i>old</i> for an input or output port is replaced with <i>new</i>.

NetRename[<i>net</i>,{<i>rule</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rule</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs all renamings specified by the <i>rule</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NetRename[<i>net</i>,<i>f</i>] uses a function <i>f</i> to map existing layer names to new names.

NetRename[<i>net</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] renames layers and ports nested at level <i>levelspec</i>.

---

NetReplace
NetReplace[<i>net</i>,<i>patt</i><i>layer</i>] gives a net in which all layers matching <i>patt</i> are replaced with <i>layer</i>.

NetReplace[<i>net</i>,{<i>rule</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rule</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] performs all replacements specified by the <i>rule</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

NetReplacePart
NetReplacePart[<i>layer</i>,"<i>array</i>"<i>value</i>] replaces an array within a layer, returning a new layer.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,"<i>port</i>"<i>type</i>] returns a new layer or network in which an input or output port has the specified type.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,"<i>input</i>"<i>encoder</i>] attaches a NetEncoder[…] to a specified input port.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,"<i>output</i>"<i>decoder</i>] attaches a NetDecoder[…] to a specified output port.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,<i>lspec</i><i>layer</i>] returns a new NetChain or NetGraph in which the layer identified by <i>lspec</i> has been replaced.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,NetArray[<i>name</i>]<i>value</i>] sets a shared array within a network or layer to a specified value.

NetReplacePart[<i>coder</i>,"<i>param</i>"<i>value</i>] returns a new NetEncoder[…] or NetDecoder[…] in which a parameter has been replaced.

NetReplacePart[<i>net</i>,{<i>lspec</i>,<i>pspec</i>}<i>value</i>] makes a replacement of a part <i>pspec</i> of a layer or coder <i>lspec</i> within a NetGraph or NetChain.

NetReplacePart[…,{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes multiple simultaneous replacements.

---

NetSharedArray
NetSharedArray["<i>name</i>"] represents an array in a net that is shared by more than one layer.

---

NetStateObject
NetStateObject[<i>net</i>] creates an object derived from <i>net</i> that represents a neural net with additional stored state information that is updated when the net is applied to data.

NetStateObject[<i>net</i>,<i>seed</i>] creates an object in which additional stored state information is initialized using <i>seed</i>.

---

NetTake
NetTake[<i>net</i>,<i>end</i>] takes only those layers up to <i>end</i> in a NetChain or NetGraph.

NetTake[<i>net</i>,{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] takes only those layers between <i>start</i> and <i>end</i> in a NetChain or NetGraph.

---

NetTrain
NetTrain[<i>net</i>,{<i>input</i><sub>1</sub><i>output</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>input</i><sub>2</sub><i>output</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] trains the specified neural net by giving the <i>input</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as input and minimizing the discrepancy between the <i>output</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and the actual output of the net, using an automatically chosen loss function.

NetTrain[<i>net</i>,<i>port</i><sub>1</sub>{<i>data</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>12</sub>,…},<i>port</i><sub>2</sub>{…},…] trains the specified net by supplying training data at the specified ports.

NetTrain[<i>net</i>,"<i>dataset</i>"] trains on a named dataset from the Wolfram Data Repository.

NetTrain[<i>net</i>,<i>f</i>] calls the function <i>f</i> during training to produce batches of training data.

NetTrain[<i>net</i>,<i>data</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives data associated with a specific property <i>prop</i> of the training session.

NetTrain[<i>net</i>,<i>data</i>,All] gives a NetTrainResultsObject[…] that summarizes information about the training session.

---

NetTrainResultsObject
NetTrainResultsObject[…] represents an object generated by NetTrain that contains the trained net and other information about the training process.

---

NetUnfold
NetUnfold[<i>fnet</i>] produces the elementary net of the folded net <i>fnet</i>, exposing the recurrent states.

---

NetworkPacketCapture
NetworkPacketCapture[] creates a temporary interactive interface for capturing information on network packets transmitted or received through all network interfaces on your computer.

NetworkPacketCapture[<i>service</i>] captures only packets associated with the specified network service.

NetworkPacketCapture[<i>port</i>] captures only packets associated with the specified port.

NetworkPacketCapture[<i>spec</i>] captures only packets matching the specification <i>spec</i>. 

---

NetworkPacketRecording
NetworkPacketRecording[<i>t</i>] records information on network packets transmitted or received through all network interfaces on your computer for <i>t</i> seconds.

NetworkPacketRecording[<i>t</i>,<i>service</i>] records only packets associated with the specified network service.

NetworkPacketRecording[<i>t</i>,<i>port</i>] records only packets associated with the specified port.

NetworkPacketRecording[<i>t</i>,{<i>port</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>port</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] records only packets associated with any of the ports <i>port</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NetworkPacketRecording[<i>t</i>,<i>spec</i>] records only packets matching the specification <i>spec</i>. 

---

NetworkPacketTrace
NetworkPacketTrace[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> and returns information on network packets transmitted or received through all network interfaces on your computer during the time of the evaluation, together with the result of the evaluation. 

NetworkPacketTrace[<i>expr</i>,<i>service</i>] records only packets associated with the specified network service.

NetworkPacketTrace[<i>expr</i>,<i>port</i>] records only packets associated with the specified port.

NetworkPacketTrace[<i>expr</i>,{<i>port</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>port</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] records only packets associated with any of the ports <i>port</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NetworkPacketTrace[<i>expr</i>,<i>spec</i>] records only packets matching the specification <i>spec</i>. 

---

NeumannValue
NeumannValue[<i>val</i>,<i>pred</i>] represents a Neumann boundary value <i>val</i>, specified on the part of the boundary of the region given to NDSolve and related functions where <i>pred</i> is True.

---

NevilleThetaC
NevilleThetaC[<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Neville theta function ϑ<sub>c</sub> (zm). 

---

NevilleThetaD
NevilleThetaD[<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Neville theta function ϑ<sub>d</sub> (zm). 

---

NevilleThetaN
NevilleThetaN[<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Neville theta function ϑ<sub>n</sub> (zm). 

---

NevilleThetaS
NevilleThetaS[<i>z</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Neville theta function ϑ<sub>s</sub> (zm). 

---

NExpectation
NExpectation[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>] gives the numerical expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

NExpectation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>] gives the numerical expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>. 

NExpectation[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the numerical expectation of <i>expr</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

NExpectation[<i>expr</i><i>pred</i>,…] gives the numerical conditional expectation of <i>expr</i> given <i>pred</i>.

---

NextDate
NextDate[<i>gran</i>] gives the next occurring date of the specified granularity type <i>gran</i>.

NextDate[<i>daytype</i>] gives the next day corresponding to the specified <i>daytype</i>.

NextDate[<i>date</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the next date of the given granularity relative to the specified date.

---

NextPrime
NextPrime[<i>x</i>] gives the smallest prime above <i>x</i>.

NextPrime[<i>x</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup>-next prime above <i>x</i>.

---

NextScheduledTaskTime
NextScheduledTaskTime[<i>obj</i>] gives the next execution time of the scheduled task represented by <i>obj</i>.

---

NHoldAll
NHoldAll is an attribute which specifies that none of the arguments to a function should be affected by N. 

---

NHoldFirst
NHoldFirst is an attribute which specifies that the first argument to a function should not be affected by N. 

---

NHoldRest
NHoldRest is an attribute which specifies that all but the first argument to a function should not be affected by N. 

---

NicholsGridLines
NicholsGridLines is an option to NicholsPlot that specifies contours of constant magnitude and constant phase of the closed-loop system.

---

NicholsPlot
NicholsPlot[<i>lsys</i>] generates a Nichols plot of the transfer function for the system <i>lsys</i>.

NicholsPlot[<i>lsys</i>,{ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots for the frequency range ω<sub><i>min</i></sub> to ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

NicholsPlot[<i>expr</i>,{ω,<i>ω</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots <i>expr</i> using the variable ω.

---

NightHemisphere
NightHemisphere[] is a two-dimensional GeoGraphics primitive that represents the half of the Earth currently in darkness.

NightHemisphere[<i>datespec</i>] represents the night half of the Earth for the specified date.

---

NIntegrate
NIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a numerical approximation to the integral ∫<sub>x<sub>min</sub></sub><sup>x<sub>max</sub></sup> f dx. 

NIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] gives a numerical approximation to the multiple integral ∫<sub>x<sub>min</sub></sub><sup>x<sub>max</sub></sup>dx∫<sub>y<sub>min</sub></sub><sup>y<sub>max</sub></sup>dy … f.

NIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>reg</i>] integrates over the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

NMaximize
NMaximize[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] searches for a global maximum in <i>f</i> numerically with respect to <i>x</i>.

NMaximize[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] searches for a global maximum in <i>f</i> numerically with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

NMaximize[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] searches for a global maximum in <i>f</i> numerically subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

NMaximize[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

---

NMaxValue
NMaxValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the global maximum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>.

NMaxValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the global maximum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

NMaxValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the global maximum value of <i>f</i> subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

NMaxValue[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>reg</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

NMinimize
NMinimize[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] searches for a global minimum in <i>f</i> numerically with respect to <i>x</i>.

NMinimize[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] searches for a global minimum in <i>f</i> numerically with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, ….

NMinimize[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] searches for a global minimum in <i>f</i> numerically subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

NMinimize[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>rdom</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region or domain <i>rdom</i>.

---

NMinValue
NMinValue[<i>f</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the global minimum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>.

NMinValue[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the global minimum value of <i>f</i> with respect to <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …. 

NMinValue[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the global minimum value of <i>f</i> subject to the constraints <i>cons</i>.

NMinValue[…,<i>x</i>∈<i>reg</i>] constrains <i>x</i> to be in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

NominalVariables
NominalVariables is an option for statistical functions such as LinearModelFit that specifies which variables should be treated as having discrete values specified by names.

---

NoncentralBetaDistribution
NoncentralBetaDistribution[α,β,δ] represents a noncentral beta distribution with shape parameters α, β and noncentrality parameter δ.

---

NoncentralChiSquareDistribution
NoncentralChiSquareDistribution[ν,λ] represents a noncentral χ<sup>2</sup> distribution with ν degrees of freedom and noncentrality parameter λ.

---

NoncentralFRatioDistribution
NoncentralFRatioDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,λ] represents a noncentral F-ratio distribution with <i>n</i> numerator degrees of freedom, <i>m</i> denominator degrees of freedom, and numerator noncentrality parameter λ.

NoncentralFRatioDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,λ, η] represents a doubly noncentral F-ratio distribution with numerator noncentrality parameter λ and denominator noncentrality parameter η.

---

NoncentralStudentTDistribution
NoncentralStudentTDistribution[ν,δ] represents a noncentral Student t distribution with ν degrees of freedom and noncentrality parameter δ.

---

NonCommutativeMultiply
<i>a</i>**<i>b</i>**<i>c</i> is a general associative, but non‐commutative, form of multiplication. 

---

NonConstants
NonConstants is an option for D which gives a list of objects to be taken to depend implicitly on the differentiation variables. 

---

NondimensionalizationTransform
NondimensionalizationTransform[<i>eq</i>,<i>ovars</i>,<i>fvars</i>] nondimensionalizes <i>eq</i>, replacing original variables <i>ovars</i> with the variables <i>fvars</i>.

NondimensionalizationTransform[<i>eq</i>,<i>ovars</i>,<i>fvars</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns a property associated with the nondimensionalization of <i>eq</i>.

---

None
None is a setting used for certain options. 

---

NoneTrue
NoneTrue[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>test</i>] yields True if <i>test</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is False for all of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NoneTrue[<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

NoneTrue[<i>test</i>] represents an operator form of NoneTrue that can be applied to an expression.

---

NonlinearModelFit
NonlinearModelFit[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>form</i>,{β<sub>1</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] constructs a nonlinear model with formula <i>form</i> that fits the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for each <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using the free parameters <i>β<sub>i</sub></i>.

NonlinearModelFit[<i>data</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>params</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] constructs a nonlinear model where <i>form</i> depends on the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>. 

NonlinearModelFit[<i>data</i>,{<i>form</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>params</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] constructs a nonlinear model subject to the parameter constraints <i>cons</i>.

---

NonlinearStateSpaceModel
NonlinearStateSpaceModel[{<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>u</i>] represents the model x'(t)f(x(t),u(t)), y(t)g(x(t),u(t)).

NonlinearStateSpaceModel[<i>sys</i>] gives a state-space representation corresponding to the systems model <i>sys</i>. 

NonlinearStateSpaceModel[<i>eqns</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{<i><i>g</i><sub>1</sub></i>,…},<i>t</i>] gives the state-space model of the differential equations <i>eqns</i> with dependent variables <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, input variables <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, operating values <i>x</i><sub><i>i0</i></sub> and <i>u</i><sub><i>i0</i></sub>, outputs <i>g</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and independent variable <i>t</i>.

---

NonlocalMeansFilter
NonlocalMeansFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] applies a nonlocal means filter to <i>image</i> by comparing a range <i>r</i> neighborhood to its nearby neighborhoods.

NonlocalMeansFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>ns</i>] assumes an additive noise power value <i>ns</i> for comparing neighborhoods.

NonlocalMeansFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>ns</i>,<i>w</i>] compares neighborhoods in a range <i>w</i> window.

---

NonNegative
NonNegative[<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>x</i> is a non‐negative number. 

---

NonNegativeIntegers
NonNegativeIntegers represents the domain of non-negative integers, as in <i>x</i>∈NonNegativeIntegers. 

---

NonNegativeRationals
NonNegativeRationals represents the domain of non-negative rational numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈NonNegativeRationals. 

---

NonNegativeReals
NonNegativeReals represents the domain of non-negative real numbers.

---

NonPositive
NonPositive[<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>x</i> is a non‐positive number. 

---

NonPositiveIntegers
NonPositiveIntegers represents the domain of non-positive integers, as in <i>x</i>∈NonPositiveIntegers. 

---

NonPositiveRationals
NonPositiveRationals represents the domain of non-positive rational numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈NonPositiveRationals. 

---

NonPositiveReals
NonPositiveReals represents the domain of non-positive real numbers.

---

Nor
Nor[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is the logical NOR function. It evaluates its arguments in order, giving False immediately if any of them are True, and True if they are all False. 

---

NorlundB
NorlundB[<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>] gives Nørlund polynomials B<sub>n</sub><sup>(a)</sup> of degree <i>n</i> in <i>a</i>.

NorlundB[<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>x</i>] gives generalized Bernoulli polynomials B<sub>n</sub><sup>(a)</sup>(x).

---

Norm
Norm[<i>expr</i>] gives the norm of a number, vector, or matrix. 

Norm[<i>expr</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the <i>p</i>‐norm. 

---

Normal
Normal[<i>expr</i>] converts <i>expr</i> to a normal expression from a variety of special forms. 

Normal[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] converts objects with head <i>h</i> in <i>expr</i> to normal expressions.

Normal[<i>expr</i>,{<i>h</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>h</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] converts objects with head <i>h</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to normal expressions.

---

NormalDistribution
NormalDistribution[μ,σ] represents a normal (Gaussian) distribution with mean μ and standard deviation σ.

NormalDistribution[] represents a normal distribution with zero mean and unit standard deviation.

---

NormalizationLayer
NormalizationLayer[] represents a trainable net layer that normalizes its input data across the second and subsequent dimensions and applies an independent scaling and bias to each component of the first dimension.

NormalizationLayer[<i>aggregationlevels</i>] normalizes data across the specified aggregation levels and applies a learned scaling and bias on the remaining levels.

NormalizationLayer[<i>aggregationlevels</i>,<i>scalinglevels</i>] applies a learned scaling and bias at the specified scaling levels.

---

Normalize
Normalize[<i>v</i>] gives the normalized form of a vector <i>v</i>. 

Normalize[<i>z</i>] gives the normalized form of a complex number <i>z</i>.

Normalize[<i>expr</i>,<i>f</i>] normalizes with respect to the norm function <i>f</i>.

---

Normalized
Normalized is an option that determines whether to test if matrix columns or rows are normalized.

---

NormalizedSquaredEuclideanDistance
NormalizedSquaredEuclideanDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the normalized squared Euclidean distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

NormalMatrixQ
NormalMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is an explicitly normal matrix, and False otherwise.

---

NormalsFunction
NormalsFunction is an option for Plot3D and related functions that specifies a function to apply to determine the effective surface normals at every point.

---

NormFunction
NormFunction is an option for functions such as FindFit and NDSolve which gives a function to be minimized in generating results.

---

Not
!<i>expr</i> is the logical NOT function. It gives False if <i>expr</i> is True, and True if it is False. 

---

NotCongruent
NotCongruent[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≢<i>y</i>≢….

---

NotCupCap
NotCupCap[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≭<i>y</i>≭….

---

NotDoubleVerticalBar
NotDoubleVerticalBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∦<i>y</i>∦….

---

NotElement
NotElement[<i>x</i>,<i>dom</i>] or <i>x</i>∉<i>dom</i> asserts that <i>x</i> is not an element of the domain <i>dom</i>.

NotElement[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>|…|<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>dom</i>] asserts that none of the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are elements of <i>dom</i>.

NotElement[<i>patt</i>,<i>dom</i>] asserts that any expression matching the pattern <i>patt</i> is not an element of the domain <i>dom</i>.

---

NotEqualTilde
NotEqualTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotExists
NotExists[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as ∄<sub><i>x</i></sub><i>y</i>.

---

NotGreater
NotGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≯<i>y</i>≯….

---

NotGreaterEqual
NotGreaterEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≱<i>y</i>≱….

---

NotGreaterFullEqual
NotGreaterFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≩<i>y</i>≩….

---

NotGreaterGreater
NotGreaterGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotGreaterLess
NotGreaterLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≹<i>y</i>≹….

---

NotGreaterSlantEqual
NotGreaterSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotGreaterTilde
NotGreaterTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≵<i>y</i>≵….

---

Nothing
Nothing represents an element of a list that will automatically be removed. 

Nothing[…] gives Nothing.

---

NotHumpDownHump
NotHumpDownHump[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotHumpEqual
NotHumpEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotificationFunction
NotificationFunction is an option that specifies how notifications should be sent from background tasks.

---

NotLeftTriangle
NotLeftTriangle[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋪<i>y</i>⋪….

---

NotLeftTriangleBar
NotLeftTriangleBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotLeftTriangleEqual
NotLeftTriangleEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋬<i>y</i>⋬….

---

NotLess
NotLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≮<i>y</i>≮….

---

NotLessEqual
NotLessEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≰<i>y</i>≰….

---

NotLessFullEqual
NotLessFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≨<i>y</i>≨….

---

NotLessGreater
NotLessGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≸<i>y</i>≸….

---

NotLessLess
NotLessLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotLessSlantEqual
NotLessSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotLessTilde
NotLessTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≴<i>y</i>≴….

---

NotNestedGreaterGreater
NotNestedGreaterGreater[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotNestedLessLess
NotNestedLessLess[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotPrecedes
NotPrecedes[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊀<i>y</i>⊀….

---

NotPrecedesEqual
NotPrecedesEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotPrecedesSlantEqual
NotPrecedesSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋠<i>y</i>⋠….

---

NotPrecedesTilde
NotPrecedesTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋨<i>y</i>⋨….

---

NotReverseElement
NotReverseElement[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∌<i>y</i>∌….

---

NotRightTriangle
NotRightTriangle[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋫<i>y</i>⋫….

---

NotRightTriangleBar
NotRightTriangleBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotRightTriangleEqual
NotRightTriangleEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋭<i>y</i>⋭….

---

NotSquareSubset
NotSquareSubset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotSquareSubsetEqual
NotSquareSubsetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋢<i>y</i>⋢….

---

NotSquareSuperset
NotSquareSuperset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotSquareSupersetEqual
NotSquareSupersetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋣<i>y</i>⋣….

---

NotSubset
NotSubset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊄<i>y</i>⊄….

---

NotSubsetEqual
NotSubsetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊈<i>y</i>⊈….

---

NotSucceeds
NotSucceeds[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊁<i>y</i>⊁….

---

NotSucceedsEqual
NotSucceedsEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

NotSucceedsSlantEqual
NotSucceedsSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋡<i>y</i>⋡….

---

NotSucceedsTilde
NotSucceedsTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋩<i>y</i>⋩….

---

NotSuperset
NotSuperset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊅<i>y</i>⊅….

---

NotSupersetEqual
NotSupersetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊉<i>y</i>⊉….

---

NotTilde
NotTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≁<i>y</i>≁….

---

NotTildeEqual
NotTildeEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≄<i>y</i>≄….

---

NotTildeFullEqual
NotTildeFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≇<i>y</i>≇….

---

NotTildeTilde
NotTildeTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≉<i>y</i>≉….

---

NotVerticalBar
NotVerticalBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

Now
Now gives a DateObject representing the current moment in time.

---

NoWhitespace
NoWhitespace represents the absence of whitespace between elements in a grammar rules pattern.

---

NProbability
NProbability[<i>pred</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>] gives the numerical probability for an event that satisfies the predicate <i>pred</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>. 

NProbability[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>] gives the numerical probability that an event satisfies <i>pred</i> under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>. 

NProbability[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the numerical probability that an event satisfies <i>pred</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

NProbability[<i>pred</i><sub>1</sub><i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the numerical conditional probability of <i>pred</i><sub>1</sub> given <i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

NProduct
NProduct[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a numerical approximation to the product ∏+i=i<sub>min</sub>%i<sub>max</sub>f.

NProduct[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses a step <i>di</i> in the product. 

---

NProductFactors
NProductFactors is an option for NProduct. NProductFactors -> <i>n</i> explicitly includes <i>n</i> factors in the product before extrapolation.

---

NRoots
NRoots[<i>lhs</i>==<i>rhs</i>,<i>var</i>] yields a disjunction of equations which represent numerical approximations to the roots of a polynomial equation. 

---

NSolve
NSolve[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] attempts to find numerical approximations to the solutions of the system <i>expr</i> of equations or inequalities for the variables <i>vars</i>. 

NSolve[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,Reals] finds solutions over the domain of real numbers.

---

NSolveValues
NSolveValues[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] attempts to find numerical approximations to the values of <i>vars</i> determined by the solutions of the system <i>expr</i>.

NSolveValues[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,Reals] finds solutions over the domain of real numbers.

---

NSum
NSum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a numerical approximation to the sum ∑+i=i<sub>min</sub>%i<sub>max</sub>f.

NSum[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses a step <i>di</i> in the sum. 

---

NSumTerms
NSumTerms is an option for NSum. NSumTerms -> <i>n</i> explicitly includes <i>n</i> terms in the sum before extrapolation.

---

NuclearExplosionData
NuclearExplosionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the nuclear explosion <i>entity</i>.

NuclearExplosionData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified nuclear explosion entities.

NuclearExplosionData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

NuclearReactorData
NuclearReactorData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the nuclear reactor <i>entity</i>.

NuclearReactorData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified nuclear reactor entities.

NuclearReactorData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Null
Null is a symbol used to indicate the absence of an expression or a result. When it appears as a complete output expression, no output is printed. 

---

NullRecords
NullRecords is an option for Read and related functions which specifies whether null records should be taken to exist between repeated record separators. 

---

NullSpace
NullSpace[<i>m</i>] gives a list of vectors that forms a basis for the null space of the matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

NullWords
NullWords is an option for Read and related functions which specifies whether null words should be taken to exist between repeated word separators. 

---

Number
Number represents an exact integer or an approximate real number in Read. 

---

NumberCompose
NumberCompose[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the quantity <i>c</i><sub>1</sub> <i>u</i><sub>1</sub>+…+<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> <i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

NumberDecompose
NumberDecompose[<i>x</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns a list of coefficients {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>} of a decomposition of the number <i>x</i> in the basis {<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

---

NumberDigit
NumberDigit[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] returns the digit corresponding to 10<sup><i>n</i></sup> in the real-valued number <i>x</i>.

NumberDigit[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] returns the digit corresponding to <i>b</i><sup><i>n</i></sup>.

---

NumberExpand
NumberExpand[<i>x</i>] gives a list of the decimal digits of <i>x</i> multiplied by their corresponding powers of 10. 

NumberExpand[<i>x</i>,<i>b</i>] expands <i>x</i> in base <i>b</i>.

NumberExpand[<i>x</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>len</i>] gives a list of length <i>len</i>.

---

NumberFieldClassNumber
NumberFieldClassNumber[θ] gives the class number for the algebraic number field [θ] generated by θ.

---

NumberFieldDiscriminant
NumberFieldDiscriminant[<i>a</i>] gives the discriminant of the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldFundamentalUnits
NumberFieldFundamentalUnits[<i>a</i>] gives a list of fundamental units for the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldIntegralBasis
NumberFieldIntegralBasis[<i>a</i>] gives an integral basis for the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldNormRepresentatives
NumberFieldNormRepresentatives[<i>a</i>,<i>m</i>] gives a list of representatives of classes of algebraic integers of norm ±<i>m</i> in the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldRegulator
NumberFieldRegulator[<i>a</i>] gives the regulator of the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldRootsOfUnity
NumberFieldRootsOfUnity[<i>a</i>] gives the roots of unity for the field [a] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberFieldSignature
NumberFieldSignature[<i>a</i>] gives the signature of the field [<i>a</i>] generated by the algebraic number <i>a</i>.

---

NumberForm
NumberForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with approximate real numbers in <i>expr</i> given to <i>n</i>‐digit precision. 

NumberForm[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>f</i>}] prints with approximate real numbers having <i>n</i> digits, with <i>f</i> digits to the right of the decimal point.

NumberForm[<i>expr</i>] prints using the default options of NumberForm.

---

NumberFormat
NumberFormat is an option for NumberForm and related functions that specifies how the mantissa, base, and exponent should be assembled into a final print form. 

---

NumberLinePlot
NumberLinePlot[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots the values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> on a number line.

NumberLinePlot[<i>pred</i>,<i>x</i>] plots a number line illustrating the region <i>pred</i>.

NumberLinePlot[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots the number to extend over the interval from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

NumberLinePlot[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots several number lines.

---

NumberMarks
NumberMarks is an option for InputForm and related functions that specifies whether ` marks should be included in the printed forms of approximate numbers. 

---

NumberMultiplier
NumberMultiplier is an option for NumberForm and related functions which gives the string to use as a multiplication sign in scientific notation. 

---

NumberPadding
NumberPadding is an option for NumberForm and related functions which gives strings to use as padding on the left‐ and right‐hand sides of numbers. 

---

NumberPoint
NumberPoint is an option for NumberForm and related functions that gives the string to use as a decimal point. 

---

NumberQ
NumberQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a number, and False otherwise. 

---

NumberSeparator
NumberSeparator is an option for NumberForm and related functions that gives the string to insert at breaks between digits. 

---

NumberSigns
NumberSigns is an option for NumberForm and related functions which gives strings to use as signs for negative and positive numbers. 

---

NumberString
NumberString represents the characters of a number in StringExpression.

---

Numerator
Numerator[<i>expr</i>] gives the numerator of <i>expr</i>. 

---

NumeratorDenominator
NumeratorDenominator[<i>expr</i>] gives the list {Numerator[<i>expr</i>],Denominator[<i>expr</i>]} of <i>expr</i>.

---

NumericalOrder
