NumericalOrder[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>] gives 1 if <i>e</i><sub>1</sub><<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, -1 if <i>e</i><sub>1</sub>><i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, 0 if <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>e</i><sub>2</sub> are numerically the same, and orders by type or using canonical order if <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>e</i><sub>2</sub> are not numerically comparable.

---

NumericalSort
NumericalSort[<i>list</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> into numerical order.

---

NumericArray
NumericArray[<i>array</i>,<i>type</i>] creates a numeric array of the specified <i>type</i>.

NumericArray[<i>array</i>,<i>type</i>,<i>method</i>] uses <i>method</i> to convert numbers into <i>type</i>.

---

NumericArrayQ
NumericArrayQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a valid NumericArray object, and False otherwise.

NumericArrayQ[<i>expr</i>, <i>tpatt</i>] requires additionally that NumericArrayType[<i>expr</i>] match the pattern <i>tpatt</i>.

NumericArrayQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>tpatt</i>,<i>dpatt</i>] requires additionally that ArrayDepth[<i>expr</i>] match the pattern <i>dpatt</i>.

---

NumericArrayType
NumericArrayType[<i>array</i>] gives the underlying type of values used for each element in the NumericArray object.

---

NumericFunction
NumericFunction is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol <i>f</i> to indicate that f[<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] should be considered a numeric quantity whenever all the <i>arg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are numeric quantities. 

---

NumericQ
NumericQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a numeric quantity, and False otherwise. 

---

NuttallWindow
NuttallWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Nuttall window function of <i>x</i>.

---

NValues
NValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all numerical values (values for N[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,…],…], etc.) defined for the symbol <i>f</i>.

---

NyquistGridLines
NyquistGridLines is an option to NyquistPlot that specifies contours of constant magnitude and phase of a closed-loop system.

---

NyquistPlot
NyquistPlot[<i>lsys</i>] generates a Nyquist plot of the transfer function for the system <i>lsys</i>.

NyquistPlot[<i>lsys</i>,{ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots for the frequency range ω<sub><i>min</i></sub> to ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

NyquistPlot[<i>expr</i>,{ω,ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots <i>expr</i> using the variable ω.

---

O
O[<i>x</i>]^<i>n</i> represents a term of order <i>x</i><sup><i>n</i></sup>. 

O[<i>x</i>]^<i>n</i> is generated to represent omitted higher‐order terms in power series. 

O[<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>]^<i>n</i> represents a term of order (<i>x</i>-<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>)<sup><i>n</i></sup>. 

---

ObjectExistsQ
System`ObjectExistsQ

---

ObservabilityGramian
ObservabilityGramian[<i>ssm</i>] gives the observability Gramian of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

ObservabilityMatrix
ObservabilityMatrix[<i>ssm</i>] gives the observability matrix of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

ObservableDecomposition
ObservableDecomposition[<i>sys</i>] yields the observable subsystem of the system <i>sys</i>.

ObservableDecomposition[<i>sys</i>,{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] specifies the new coordinates <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ObservableModelQ
ObservableModelQ[<i>sys</i>] gives True if the system <i>sys</i> is observable, and False otherwise.

ObservableModelQ[{<i>sys</i>,<i>sub</i>}] gives True if the subsystem <i>sub</i> is observable.

---

OceanData
OceanData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the ocean <i>entity</i>.

OceanData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified ocean entities.

OceanData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Octahedron
Octahedron[] represents a regular octahedron centered at the origin with unit edge length.

Octahedron[<i>l</i>] represents an octahedron with edge length <i>l</i>.

Octahedron[{θ,ϕ},…] represents an octahedron rotated by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

Octahedron[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},…] represents an octahedron centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

OddQ
OddQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is an odd integer, and False otherwise. 

---

Off
Off[<i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i>] switches off a message, so that it is no longer printed. 

Off["<i>name</i>"] switches off a named group of messages.

Off[<i>s</i>] switches off tracing messages associated with the symbol <i>s</i>. 

Off[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…] switches off several messages or message groups. 

---

Offset
Offset[{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>},<i>position</i>] gives the position of a graphical object obtained by starting at the specified position and then moving by absolute offset {<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>}. 

---

On
On[<i>symbol</i>::<i>tag</i>] switches on a message, so that it can be printed. 

On["<i>name</i>"] switches on a named group of messages.

On[<i>s</i>] switches on tracing for the symbol <i>s</i>. 

On[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…] switches on several messages or message groups. 

---

ONanGroupON
ONanGroupON[] represents the sporadic simple O'Nan group O'N.

---

Once
Once[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> once in each Wolfram Language session, always returning the result from the first evaluation.

Once[<i>expr</i>,<i>loc</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> once and caches the result in persistence location <i>loc</i>.

---

OneIdentity
OneIdentity is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol <i>f</i> to indicate that <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>], <i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>]], etc. are all equivalent to <i>x</i> for the purpose of pattern matching. 

---

Opacity
Opacity[<i>a</i>] is a graphics directive that specifies that graphical objects that follow are to be displayed, if possible, with opacity <i>a</i>. 

Opacity[<i>a</i>,<i>color</i>] uses the specified color with opacity <i>a</i>.

---

OpacityFunction
OpacityFunction is an option for graphics functions that specifies a function to apply to determine opacity of elements.

---

OpacityFunctionScaling
OpacityFunctionScaling is an option to visualization functions such as DensityPlot3D that specifies whether arguments supplied to OpacityFunction should be scaled to lie between 0 and 1.

---

OpenAppend
OpenAppend["<i>file</i>"] opens a file to append output to it, and returns an OutputStream object. 

---

OpenerView
OpenerView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents an object which displays as an opener, together with <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> if the opener is closed, and both <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub> if it is open.

OpenerView[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>state</i>] specifies the state of the opener, with False being closed, and True being open.

---

Opening
Opening[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological opening of <i>image</i> with respect to the structuring element <i>ker</i>.

Opening[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the opening with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

Opening[<i>data</i>,…] applies opening to an array of data.

---

OpenRead
OpenRead["<i>file</i>"] opens a file to read data from, and returns an InputStream object.

---

OpenTemporary
OpenTemporary[] opens a temporary file to which output can be written, and returns an OutputStream object. 

---

OpenWrite
OpenWrite["<i>file</i>"] opens a file to write output to it, and returns an OutputStream object. 

OpenWrite[] opens a new file in the default area for temporary files on your computer system.

---

Operate
Operate[<i>p</i>,<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…]] gives <i>p</i>[<i>f</i>][<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…]. 

Operate[<i>p</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>p</i> at level <i>n</i> in the head of <i>expr</i>. 

---

OperatorApplied
OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>].

OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of two arguments so that OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>][<i>y</i>][<i>x</i>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>].

OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an operator form of the function <i>f</i> of <i>n</i> arguments so that OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]…[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub></sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub></sub>].

OperatorApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>k</i>{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents an operator form that takes <i>k</i> arguments.

---

OptimumFlowData
OptimumFlowData[…] represents flow data such as generated by FindMaximumFlow, FindMinimumCostFlow, etc.

---

Optional
<i>patt</i>:<i>def</i> or Optional[<i>patt</i>,<i>def</i>] is a pattern object that represents an expression of the form <i>patt</i>, which, if omitted, should be replaced by the default value <i>def</i>. 

---

OptionalElement
OptionalElement[<i>patt</i>] is a grammar rules pattern object that represents 0 or 1 instances of <i>patt</i>.

OptionalElement[<i>patt</i>,<i>default</i>] uses <i>default</i> if the element is not present. 

---

OptionInspectorSettings
OptionInspectorSettings is a global option that specifies the display of options in the Option Inspector.

---

OptionQ
OptionQ[<i>e</i>] returns True if <i>e</i> can be considered an option or list of options, and False otherwise.

---

Options
Options[<i>symbol</i>] or Options["<i>symbol</i>"] gives the list of default options assigned to a symbol.

Options[<i>expr</i>] gives the options explicitly specified in a particular expression such as a graphics object.

Options[<i>stream</i>] gives options associated with a particular stream.

Options[<i>object</i>] gives options associated with an external object such as an NotebookObject or CloudObject.

Options[<i>obj</i>,<i>name</i>] gives the setting for the option <i>name</i>.

Options[<i>obj</i>,{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the settings for the options <i>name</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

OptionsPattern
OptionsPattern[] is a pattern object that represents a collection of options given as rules, where the values of the options can be accessed using OptionValue.

OptionsPattern[<i>f</i>] takes default option values from Options[<i>f</i>].

OptionsPattern[{<i>opt</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>opt</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses an explicit list of default option values.

---

OptionValue
OptionValue[<i>name</i>] gives the value of <i>name</i> in options matched by OptionsPattern. 

OptionValue[<i>f</i>,<i>name</i>] gives the value of <i>name</i> for options associated with the head <i>f</i>. 

OptionValue[<i>f</i>,<i>opts</i>,<i>name</i>] extracts option values from the explicit list of rules <i>opts</i>.

OptionValue[…,{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts several option values.

---

Or
<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>||<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>||… is the logical OR function. It evaluates its arguments in order, giving True immediately if any of them are True, and False if they are all False. 

---

Orange
Orange represents the color orange in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Order
Order[<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>] gives 1 if <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> is before <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub> in canonical order, and -1 if <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> is after <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub> in canonical order. It gives 0 if <i>expr</i><sub>1</sub> is identical to <i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

OrderDistribution
OrderDistribution[{<i>dist</i>,<i>n</i>},<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup>-order statistics distribution for <i>n</i> observations from the distribution <i>dist</i>.

OrderDistribution[{<i>dist</i>,<i>n</i>},{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the joint (k<sub>1</sub>,k<sub>2</sub>,…)<sup>th</sup>-order statistics distribution from <i>n</i> observations from the distribution <i>dist</i>. 

OrderDistribution[{<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>dist</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},…] represents the order statistics distribution for independent distributions <i>dist</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

OrderDistribution[<i>mdist</i>,…] represents the order statistics distribution for multivariate distribution <i>mdist</i>.

---

OrderedQ
OrderedQ[<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…]] gives True if the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are in canonical order, and False otherwise.

OrderedQ[<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…],<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> to determine whether each pair of elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i>+1</sub> is in order. 

---

Ordering
Ordering[<i>list</i>] gives the positions in <i>list</i> at which each successive element of Sort[<i>list</i>] appears. 

Ordering[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions in <i>list</i> at which the first <i>n</i> elements of Sort[<i>list</i>] appear. 

Ordering[<i>list</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the last <i>n</i> elements of Sort[<i>list</i>]. 

Ordering[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] gives positions in <i>list</i> of elements of Sort[<i>list</i>,<i>p</i>]. 

---

OrderingBy
OrderingBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the positions in <i>list</i> at which each successive element of SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] appears.

OrderingBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions in <i>list</i> at which the first <i>n</i> elements of SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] appear.

OrderingBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the last <i>n</i> elements of SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>].

OrderingBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] gives positions in <i>list</i> of elements of SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>p</i>].

OrderingBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of OrderingBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

OrderingLayer
OrderingLayer[] represents a net layer that effectively applies Ordering to its input. 

OrderingLayer[<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> elements in the ordering of its input.

OrderingLayer[-<i>n</i>] gives the last <i>n</i> elements in the ordering of its input.

---

Orderless
Orderless is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol <i>f</i> to indicate that the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in expressions of the form <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] should automatically be sorted into canonical order. This property is accounted for in pattern matching. 

---

OrderlessPatternSequence
OrderlessPatternSequence[<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is a pattern object that represents a sequence of arguments matching <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,… in any order.

---

OrnsteinUhlenbeckProcess
OrnsteinUhlenbeckProcess[μ,σ,θ] represents a stationary Ornstein–Uhlenbeck process with long-term mean μ, volatility σ, and mean reversion speed θ. 

OrnsteinUhlenbeckProcess[μ,σ,θ,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents an Ornstein–Uhlenbeck process with initial condition <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

Orthogonalize
Orthogonalize[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an orthonormal basis found by orthogonalizing the vectors <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Orthogonalize[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] gives an orthonormal basis found by orthogonalizing the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with respect to the inner product function <i>f</i>.

---

OrthogonalMatrixQ
OrthogonalMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is an explicitly orthogonal matrix, and False otherwise.

---

Out
%<i>n</i> or Out[<i>n</i>] is a global object that is assigned to be the value produced on the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> output line. 

% gives the last result generated. 

%% gives the result before last. %%…% (<i>k</i> times) gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> previous result. 

---

Outer
Outer[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the generalized outer product of the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, forming all possible combinations of the lowest‐level elements in each of them, and feeding them as arguments to <i>f</i>. 

Outer[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i>] treats as separate elements only sublists at level <i>n</i> in the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Outer[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…] treats as separate elements only sublists at level <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the corresponding <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

OuterPolygon
OuterPolygon[<i>poly</i>] gives the outer polygon of the polygon <i>poly</i>.

---

OuterPolyhedron
OuterPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the outer polyhedron of the polyhedron <i>poly</i>.

---

OutputAutoOverwrite
OutputAutoOverwrite is an option for notebooks that specifies whether the output of a command should replace any existing output from a previous evaluation.

---

OutputControllabilityMatrix
OutputControllabilityMatrix[<i>ssm</i>] gives the output controllability matrix of the state-space model <i>ssm</i>.

---

OutputControllableModelQ
OutputControllableModelQ[<i>ssm</i>] gives True if the state-space model <i>ssm</i> is output controllable, and False otherwise.

---

OutputForm
OutputForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a two-dimensional representation of <i>expr</i> using only keyboard characters. 

---

OutputNamePacket
OutputNamePacket[<i>string</i>] is a WSTP packet that contains in <i>string</i> the name assigned to the next output.

---

OutputPorts
OutputPorts is an option to specify the number, names or shapes of output ports for some neural net layers.

---

OutputResponse
OutputResponse[<i>sys</i>,<i>u[t]</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the numeric output response of systems model <i>sys</i> to the input <i>u[t]</i> for <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>≤<i>t</i>≤<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

OutputResponse[<i>sys</i>,{<i>u</i>[0],<i>u</i>[1],…}] gives the output response of the discrete-time system <i>sys</i> to the input sequence <i>u</i>[<i>i</i>].

OutputResponse[<i>sys</i>,<i>u[t]</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the symbolic output response of system <i>sys</i> to the input <i>u[t]</i> as a function of time <i>t</i>.

OutputResponse[<i>sys</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>t</i>],…,<i>u</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>[<i>t</i>]},…] gives the output response for multiple inputs <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>t</i>]. 

---

OutputSizeLimit
OutputSizeLimit is an option for notebooks that specifies the maximum size in bytes of expressions that will automatically be output in their entirety.

---

OutputStream
OutputStream["<i>name</i>",<i>n</i>] is an object that represents an output stream for functions such as Write. 

---

OverBar
OverBar[<i>expr</i>] displays with a bar over <i>expr</i>.

---

OverDot
OverDot[<i>expr</i>] displays with a dot over <i>expr</i>.

OverDot[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with <i>n</i> dots.

---

Overflow
Overflow[] represents a number too large to represent explicitly on your computer system.

---

OverHat
OverHat[<i>expr</i>] displays with a hat over <i>expr</i>.

---

Overlaps
Overlaps is an option to string and sequence functions that specifies how to treat overlapping substrings. 

---

Overlay
Overlay[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] displays as an overlay of all the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Overlay[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] displays as an overlay of <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>expr</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>, ….

Overlay[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…},<i>s</i>] allows selections to be made and controls to be clicked in <i>expr</i><sub><i>s</i></sub>.

---

OverlayVideo
OverlayVideo[<i>background</i>,<i>o</i>] gives the result of overlaying <i>o</i> onto a background video or image <i>background</i>. 

OverlayVideo[<i>background</i>,{<i>o</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>o</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the result of overlaying <i>o</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>o</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

OverlayVideo[background,{<i>interval</i><sub>1</sub><i>o</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] overlays each <i>o</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> during the time interval <i>interval</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Overscript
Overscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i>&amp;<i>y</i>. 

---

OverTilde
OverTilde[<i>expr</i>] displays with a tilde over <i>expr</i>.

---

OverVector
OverVector[<i>expr</i>] displays with a right vector over <i>expr</i>.

---

OverwriteTarget
OverwriteTarget is an option for functions like CopyFile that specifies whether to overwrite if target files already exist.

---

OwenT
OwenT[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>] gives Owen's T function T(x,a).

---

OwnValues
OwnValues[<i>x</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all ownvalues defined for the symbol <i>x</i>.

OwnValues["<i>symbol</i>"] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all ownvalues defined for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

---

PackingMethod
PackingMethod is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that specifies how disconnected components should be packed together in the layout produced.

---

PackPaclet
The experimental function PackPaclet is now obsolete and is superseded by CreatePacletArchive.

---

PacletDataRebuild
PacletDataRebuild[] rescans all the installed paclets to rebuild the internal cache of paclet data.

---

PacletDirectoryAdd
The experimental function PacletDirectoryAdd is now obsolete and is superseded by PacletDirectoryLoad.

---

PacletDirectoryLoad
PacletDirectoryLoad[<i>dir</i>] makes paclets in <i>dir</i> visible in the current session.

PacletDirectoryLoad[{<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>, …}] makes paclets in all the <i>dir</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> visible in the current session.

---

PacletDirectoryRemove
StringTemplate[The experimental function `1` is now obsolete and is superseded by `2`., PacletDirectoryRemove, PacletDirectoryUnload]

---

PacletDirectoryUnload
PacletDirectoryUnload[<i>dir</i>] makes paclets in <i>dir</i> no longer visible in the current session.

PacletDirectoryUnload[{<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>, …}] makes paclets in all the <i>dir</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> no longer visible in the current session.

---

PacletDisable
PacletDisable[<i>paclet</i>] disables an installed paclet.

---

PacletEnable
PacletEnable[<i>paclet</i>] enables a previously disabled paclet.

---

PacletFind
PacletFind["<i>name</i>"] gives a list of installed paclets that match "<i>name</i>".

PacletFind["<i>name</i>""<i>version</i>"] gives a list of installed paclets that match "<i>name</i>" and "<i>version</i>".

PacletFind["<i>name</i>",<|<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] gives a list of installed paclets that match "<i>name</i>" and criteria given by the <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PacletFindRemote
PacletFindRemote["<i>name</i>"] gives a list of paclets that match "<i>name</i>" available on known paclet sites.

PacletFindRemote["<i>name</i>""<i>version</i>"] gives a list of paclets that match "<i>name</i>" and "<i>version</i>" available on known paclet sites.

PacletFindRemote["<i>name</i>",<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a list of paclets that match "<i>name</i>" and criteria given by the <i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> available on known paclet sites.

---

PacletInformation
The experimental function PacletInformation is now obsolete. Use Information[PacletObject["pacletname"]], or property-extraction syntax like PacletObject["pacletname"]["prop"] or PacletObject["pacletname"][All] instead.

---

PacletInstall
PacletInstall[<i>paclet</i>] installs or updates <i>paclet</i>.

PacletInstall[<i>task</i>] waits for completion of the <i>task</i> started by a call to PacletInstallSubmit.

---

PacletInstallSubmit
PacletInstallSubmit[<i>paclet</i>] asynchronously installs or updates <i>paclet</i>.

---

PacletNewerQ
PacletNewerQ[<i>paclet</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>paclet</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if <i><i>paclet</i><sub>1</sub></i> has a higher version number than <i>paclet</i><sub>2</sub>, and False otherwise.

---

PacletObject
PacletObject[...] is the representation of a paclet in the Wolfram Language.

---

PacletObjectQ
PacletObjectQ[expr] returns True or False depending on whether its argument is a PacletObject expression.

---

PacletSite
PacletSite is an option for PacletInstall and PacletInstallSubmit that specifies the URL of a paclet site on which to look for the paclet.

---

PacletSiteObject
PacletSiteObject[<i>assoc</i>] represents a site from which paclets can be automatically downloaded.

---

PacletSiteRegister
PacletSiteRegister[<i>url</i>] registers <i>url</i> as a known paclet site.

PacletSiteRegister[<i>url,name</i>] registers <i>url</i> as a known paclet site with <i>name</i>.

PacletSiteRegister[PacletSiteObject[…]] registers the given PacletSiteObject as a known paclet site.

---

PacletSites
PacletSites[] gives the list of all paclet sites known to your system.

---

PacletSiteUnregister
PacletSiteUnregister[<i>url</i>] removes <i>url</i> from the list of registered paclet sites.

PacletSiteUnregister[<i>name</i>] removes the site named <i>name</i> from the list of registered paclet sites.

PacletSiteUnregister[PacletSiteObject[…]] removes the given PacletSiteObject from the list of registered paclet sites.

---

PacletSiteUpdate
PacletSiteUpdate[<i>site</i>] acquires and caches current information about the available paclets on the given paclet site.

---

PacletSymbol
PacletSymbol[<i>paclet</i>,"<i>sym</i>"] gives the symbol named "<i>sym</i>" in the primary context of <i>paclet</i>.

PacletSymbol[<i>paclet</i>,"<i>sym</i>",<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the symbol before returning it.

---

PacletUninstall
PacletUninstall[<i>paclet</i>] uninstalls a <i>paclet</i>.

---

PacletUpdate
The experimental function PacletUpdate is now obsolete and is superseded by PacletInstall.

---

PaddedForm
PaddedForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with all numbers in <i>expr</i> padded to leave room for a total of <i>n</i> digits. 

PaddedForm[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>f</i>}] prints with approximate real numbers having exactly <i>f</i> digits to the right of the decimal point. 

---

Padding
Padding is an option to various array and image operations that specifies what padding to use when extending beyond the original data specified.

---

PaddingLayer
PaddingLayer[{{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents a net layer that pads an input array with <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements at the beginning and <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements at the end at level <i>i</i> of the array.

---

PaddingSize
PaddingSize is an option in AudioDelay and other functions that specifies the amount of padding.

---

PadeApproximant
PadeApproximant[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}}] gives the Padé approximant to <i>expr</i> about the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>, with numerator order <i>m</i> and denominator order <i>n</i>.

PadeApproximant[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] gives the diagonal Padé approximant to <i>expr</i> about the point <i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub> of order <i>n</i>.

---

PadLeft
PadLeft[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] makes a list of length <i>n</i> by padding <i>list</i> with zeros on the left. 

PadLeft[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] pads by repeating the element <i>x</i>. 

PadLeft[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads by cyclically repeating the elements <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

PadLeft[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>padding</i>,<i>m</i>] leaves a margin of <i>m</i> elements of padding on the right. 

PadLeft[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a nested list with length <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i>. 

PadLeft[<i>list</i>] pads a ragged array <i>list</i> with zeros to make it full. 

---

PadRight
PadRight[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] makes a list of length <i>n</i> by padding <i>list</i> with zeros on the right. 

PadRight[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>x</i>] pads by repeating the element <i>x</i>. 

PadRight[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads by cyclically repeating the elements <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

PadRight[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>padding</i>,<i>m</i>] leaves a margin of <i>m</i> elements of padding on the left. 

PadRight[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a nested list with length <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i>. 

PadRight[<i>list</i>] pads a ragged array <i>list</i> with zeros to make it full. 

---

PageBreakAbove
PageBreakAbove is an option for Cell which specifies whether a page break should be made immediately above the cell if the notebook that contains the cell is printed. 

---

PageBreakBelow
PageBreakBelow is an option for Cell which specifies whether a page break should be made immediately below the cell if the notebook that contains the cell is printed. 

---

PageBreakWithin
PageBreakWithin is an option for Cell which specifies whether a page break should be allowed within the cell if the notebook that contains the cell is printed. 

---

PageFooterLines
PageFooterLines is an option for notebooks that specifies whether a horizontal line is inserted at the bottom of each page when the notebook is printed.

---

PageFooters
PageFooters is an option for notebooks that specifies what should be inserted as the footer of each page of a notebook when it is printed.

---

PageHeaderLines
PageHeaderLines is an option for notebooks that specifies whether a horizontal line is inserted at the top of each page when the notebook is printed.

---

PageHeaders
PageHeaders is an option for notebooks that specifies what should be inserted as the header of each page of a notebook when it is printed.

---

PageRankCentrality
PageRankCentrality[<i>g</i>,α] gives a list of page-rank centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i> and weight α.

PageRankCentrality[<i>g</i>,α,β] gives a list of page-rank centralities, using weight α and initial centralities β.

PageRankCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

PageTheme
PageTheme is an option for FormObject, GalleryView, and related functions that specifies an overall theme for a webpage and its elements.

---

Pagination
Pagination is an option for GalleryView and related functions that specifies how pagination should be done in displayed output.

---

PairCorrelationG
PairCorrelationG[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates the pair correlation function g(r) for point data <i>pdata</i> at radius <i>r</i>.

PairCorrelationG[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes g(r) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

PairCorrelationG[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes g(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

PairCorrelationG[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function g that can be applied repeatedly to different radii <i>r</i>.

---

PairedBarChart
PairedBarChart[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a paired bar chart with bar lengths <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i> </i><i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … and <i>z</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>z</i><sub>2</sub>, …, respectively.

PairedBarChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>z</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a paired bar chart with bar features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

PairedBarChart[{<i>data</i><sub>11</sub>,…},{<i>data</i><sub>21</sub>,…}] makes a paired bar chart from multiple datasets <i><i>data</i><sub>1</sub></i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i><i>data</i><sub>2</sub></i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

---

PairedHistogram
PairedHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a paired histogram of the values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PairedHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}, <i>bspec</i>] plots a paired histogram with bin width specification <i>bspec</i>.

PairedHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>bspec</i>,<i>hspec</i>] plots a paired histogram with bin heights computed according to the specification <i>hspec</i>.

PairedHistogram[{<i>data</i><sub>11</sub>,…},{<i>data</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…] plots paired histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub>1<i>i</i></sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2<i>j</i></sub>.

---

PairedSmoothHistogram
PairedSmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a paired smooth histogram of the values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PairedSmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>espec</i>] plots a paired smooth histogram with estimator specification <i>espec</i>.

PairedSmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>espec</i>,<i>dfun</i>] plots a paired smooth histogram with distribution function <i>dfun</i>.

PairedSmoothHistogram[{<i>data</i><sub>11</sub>,…},{<i>data</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…] plots paired smooth histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub>1<i>i</i></sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2<i>j</i></sub>.

---

PairedTTest
PairedTTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the mean of <i>data</i> is zero. 

PairedTTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the mean of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub>– <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> is zero.

PairedTTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests a location measure against μ<sub>0</sub>.

PairedTTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PairedZTest
PairedZTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the mean of the <i>data</i> is zero. 

PairedZTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the means of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> are equal.

PairedZTest[<i>dspec</i>,σ] tests for zero or equal means assuming a population variance σ.

PairedZTest[<i>dspec</i>,σ,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests the mean against μ<sub>0</sub>.

PairedZTest[<i>dspec</i>,σ,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PalindromeQ
PalindromeQ[<i>list</i>] returns True if the given list is identical to Reverse[<i>list</i>], and False otherwise.

PalindromeQ[<i>n</i>] returns True if the integer <i>n</i> is identical to IntegerReverse[<i>n</i>], and False otherwise.

PalindromeQ[<i>string</i>] returns True if the given string is identical to StringReverse[<i>string</i>], and False otherwise. 

---

Pane
Pane[<i>expr</i>] displays as a pane containing <i>expr</i>. 

Pane[<i>expr</i>,<i>w</i>] makes the pane be <i>w</i> printer's points wide, linewrapping the contents if necessary.

Pane[<i>expr</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>}] makes the pane be <i>w</i> points wide and <i>h</i> points high, shrinking the contents if necessary.

---

Panel
Panel[<i>expr</i>] displays as a panel containing <i>expr</i>. 

Panel[<i>expr</i>,<i>title</i>] gives the panel the specified title. 

Panel[<i>expr</i>,<i>title</i>,<i>pos</i>] places <i>title</i> at a position specified by <i>pos</i>. 

Panel[<i>expr</i>,{<i>title</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>title</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] places <i>title</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at position <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Panel[] displays an empty panel. 

---

Paneled
Paneled is an option for Manipulate and related functions that specifies whether to give the output inside a panel.

---

ParabolicCylinderD
ParabolicCylinderD[ν,<i>z</i>] gives the parabolic cylinder function D<sub>ν</sub>(z). 

---

ParallelArray
ParallelArray[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] generates in parallel a list of length <i>n</i>, with elements <i>f</i>[<i>i</i>], evaluated.

ParallelArray[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates in parallel an n<sub>1</sub>n<sub>2</sub>… array of nested lists, with elements <i>f</i>[<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…]. 

ParallelArray[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates in parallel a list using the index origins <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> (default 1). 

ParallelArray[<i>f</i>,<i>dims</i>,<i>origin</i>,<i>h</i>] uses head <i>h</i>, rather than List, for each level of the array. 

---

ParallelAxisPlot
ParallelAxisPlot[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] generates a parallel axis plot for the points {<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>in</i></sub>} using equally spaced axes.

ParallelAxisPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots several sets of points.

---

ParallelCombine
ParallelCombine[<i>f</i>,<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…],<i>comb</i>] evaluates <i>f</i>[<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…]] in parallel by distributing parts of the computation to all parallel kernels and combining the partial results with <i>comb</i>.

ParallelCombine[<i>f</i>,<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, …]] is equivalent to ParallelCombine[<i>f</i>,<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…],<i>h</i>] if <i>h</i> has attribute Flat, and ParallelCombine[<i>f</i>,<i>h</i>[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…],Join] otherwise.

---

ParallelDo
ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates <i>expr</i> in parallel <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> times. 

ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] evaluates <i>expr</i> in parallel with the variable <i>i</i> successively taking on the values 1 through <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> (in steps of 1). 

ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with <i>i</i>=<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i>. 

ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses the successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ParallelDo[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] evaluates <i>expr</i> looping in parallel over different values of <i>j</i>, etc. for each <i>i</i>. 

---

Parallelepiped
Parallelepiped[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>v</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] represents a parallelepiped with origin <i>p</i> and directions <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ParallelEvaluate
ParallelEvaluate[<i>expr</i>] evaluates the expression <i>expr</i> on all available parallel kernels and returns the list of results obtained.

ParallelEvaluate[<i>expr</i>,<i>kernel</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> on the parallel kernel specified. 

ParallelEvaluate[<i>expr</i>,{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] evaluates <i>expr</i> on the parallel kernels <i>ker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ParallelEvaluate[<i>expr</i>,<i>kernels</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the results before returning them.

---

Parallelization
Parallelization is an option for Compile that specifies whether it should create a compiled function that could run in parallel. 

---

Parallelize
Parallelize[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> using automatic parallelization.

---

ParallelMap
ParallelMap[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] applies <i>f</i> in parallel to each element on the first level in <i>expr</i>.

ParallelMap[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> in parallel to parts of <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

---

ParallelNeeds
ParallelNeeds["<i>context`</i>"] evaluates Needs["<i>context`</i>"] on all available parallel kernels.

---

Parallelogram
Parallelogram[<i>p</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>}] represents a parallelogram with origin <i>p</i> and directions <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ParallelSubmit
ParallelSubmit[<i>expr</i>] submits <i>expr</i> for evaluation on the next available parallel kernel and returns an EvaluationObject expression representing the submitted evaluation.

ParallelSubmit[{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>var</i><sub>2</sub>, …},<i>expr</i>] builds a closure for the variables given before submitting <i>expr</i>.

---

ParallelTable
ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates in parallel a list of <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> copies of <i>expr</i>.

ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates in parallel a list of the values of <i>expr</i> when <i>i</i> runs from 1 to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with <i>i</i>=<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i>. 

ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses the successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ParallelTable[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] gives a nested list. The list associated with <i>i</i> is outermost.

---

ParallelTry
ParallelTry[<i>f</i>,{<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] evaluates <i>f</i>[<i>arg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] in parallel, returning the first result received.

ParallelTry[<i>f</i>,{<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] returns a list of the first <i>k</i> results.

---

ParameterEstimator
ParameterEstimator is an option to EstimatedDistribution and FindDistributionParameters that specifies what parameter estimator to use. 

---

ParameterMixtureDistribution
ParameterMixtureDistribution[<i>dist</i>[θ],θ<i>wdist</i>] represents a parameter mixture distribution where the parameter θ is distributed according to the weight distribution <i>wdist</i>. 

ParameterMixtureDistribution[<i>dist</i>[θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,…],{θ<sub>1</sub><i>wdist</i><sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub><i>wdist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a parameter mixture distribution where the parameter θ<sub>1</sub> has weight distribution <i>wdist</i><sub>1</sub>, θ<sub>2</sub> has weight distribution <i>wdist</i><sub>2</sub>, etc. 

---

ParameterVariables
ParameterVariables is an option for GroebnerBasis and PolynomialReduce. These variables will always be last in the ordering. By default, all variables that are not otherwise classified will become parameter variables. By specifying them explicitly one fixes their relative positions in the overall variable ordering.

---

ParametricConvexOptimization
ParametricConvexOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] gives a ParametricFunction object that finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the convex objective function <i>f</i> subject to convex constraints <i>cons</i> with parameters <i>pars</i>.

ParametricConvexOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned by the ParametricFunction object.

---

ParametricFunction
ParametricFunction[<i>pars</i>,…] represents a function that computes a solution when evaluated with numerical values for the parameters <i>pars</i>. 

---

ParametricNDSolve
ParametricNDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>pars</i>] finds a numerical solution to the ordinary differential equations <i>eqns</i> for the function <i>u</i> with the independent variable <i>x</i> in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> with parameters <i>pars</i>.

ParametricNDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>pars</i>] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over a rectangular region.

ParametricNDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω,<i>pars</i>] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

ParametricNDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω,<i>pars</i>] solves the time-dependent partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

ParametricNDSolve[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] solves for the functions <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

ParametricNDSolveValue
ParametricNDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>pars</i>] gives the value of <i>expr</i> with functions determined by a numerical solution to the ordinary differential equations <i>eqns</i> with the independent variable <i>x</i> in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> with parameters <i>pars</i>.

ParametricNDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>pars</i>] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over a rectangular region.

ParametricNDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω,<i>pars</i>] solves the partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

ParametricNDSolveValue[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈Ω,<i>pars</i>] solves the time-dependent partial differential equations <i>eqns</i> over the region Ω.

---

ParametricPlot
ParametricPlot[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a parametric plot of a curve with <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> coordinates <i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub> and <i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub> as a function of <i>u</i>. 

ParametricPlot[{{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>g</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>g</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several parametric curves. 

ParametricPlot[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>v</i>,<i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots a parametric region. 

ParametricPlot[{{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>g</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>g</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>v</i>,<i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several parametric regions. 

ParametricPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>}],…},…] plots the curve {<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

ParametricPlot[…,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes parameters {<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

ParametricPlot3D
ParametricPlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] produces a three-dimensional space curve parametrized by a variable <i>u</i> which runs from <i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

ParametricPlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>v</i>,<i>v</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] produces a three-dimensional surface parametrized by <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>. 

ParametricPlot3D[{{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>g</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>g</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>g</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},…},…] plots several objects together. 

ParametricPlot3D[…,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes parameters {<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

ParametricRampLayer
ParametricRampLayer[] represents a net layer that computes a leaky ReLU activation with a slope that can be learned.

ParametricRampLayer[<i>levels</i>] specifies the levels on which each dimension has a specific slope.

---

ParametricRegion
ParametricRegion[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents a region in <sup>n</sup> given by the points {<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>} for parameters <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>∈.

ParametricRegion[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>},…}] constrains parameters to an interval <i>a</i><sub>1</sub>≤<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>≤<i>b</i><sub>1</sub> etc. 

ParametricRegion[{{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>cond</i>},…] constrains parameters to satisfy the condition <i>cond</i>.

---

ParentCell
ParentCell[<i>obj</i>] returns the CellObject that contains <i>obj</i>.

---

ParentDirectory
ParentDirectory[] gives the parent of the current working directory. 

ParentDirectory["<i>dir</i>"] gives the parent of the directory <i>dir</i>. 

ParentDirectory["<i>dir</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the directory <i>n</i> levels up from <i>dir</i>.

---

Parenthesize
Parenthesize[ <i>expr</i>, <i>fmt</i>, <i>prec</i>, <i>group</i>] or Parenthesize[ <i>expr</i>, <i>fmt</i>, {<i>prec</i>, <i>group</i><i>}</i>] will represent <i>expr</i> in format <i>fmt</i> and parenthesize it if necessary when it is an operand to an operator of the given precedence and grouping.

Parenthesize[<i>expr</i>,<i>fmt</i>,<i>head</i>] infers <i>prec</i> and <i>group</i> from the operator, if any, used by the symbol <i>head</i> in <i>fmt</i>.

Parenthesize[<i>expr</i>,<i>fmt</i>,<i>prec</i>,<i>group</i>,<i>side</i>] or Parenthesize[<i>expr</i>,<i>fmt</i>,<i>head</i>,<i>side</i>] assume <i>expr</i> appears on the specified side of the operator.

---

ParetoDistribution
ParetoDistribution[<i>k</i>,α] represents a Pareto distribution with minimum value parameter <i>k</i> and shape parameter α.

ParetoDistribution[<i>k</i>,α,μ] represents a Pareto type II distribution with location parameter μ.

ParetoDistribution[<i>k</i>,α,γ,μ] represents a Pareto type IV distribution with shape parameter γ.

---

ParetoPickandsDistribution
ParetoPickandsDistribution[μ,σ,ξ] gives a Pareto–Pickands distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameter σ and shape parameter ξ.

ParetoPickandsDistribution[ξ] gives the standard Pareto–Pickands distribution with zero location and unit scale parameters.

---

ParkData
ParkData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the park <i>entity</i>.

ParkData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified park entities.

ParkData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Part
<i>expr</i>[[<i>i</i>]] or Part[<i>expr</i>,<i>i</i>] gives the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> part of <i>expr</i>. 

<i>expr</i>[[-<i>i</i>]] counts from the end. 

<i>expr</i>[[<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…]] or Part[<i>expr</i>,<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…] is equivalent to <i>expr</i>[[<i>i</i>]][[<i>j</i>]]…. 

<i>expr</i>[[{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}]] gives a list of the parts <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, … of <i>expr</i>. 

<i>expr</i>[[<i>m</i>;;<i>n</i>]] gives parts <i>m</i> through <i>n</i>.

<i>expr</i>[[<i>m</i>;;<i>n</i>;;<i>s</i>]] gives parts <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in steps of <i>s</i>.

<i>expr</i>[["<i>key</i>"]] gives the value associated with the key "<i>key</i>" in an association <i>expr</i>.

<i>expr</i>[[Key[<i>k</i>]]] gives the value associated with an arbitrary key <i>k</i> in the association <i>expr</i>.

---

PartBehavior
PartBehavior is an option to Query and related functions that specifies how nonexistent parts should be resolved.

---

PartialCorrelationFunction
PartialCorrelationFunction[<i>data</i>,<i>hspec</i>] estimates the partial correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> from <i>data</i>.

PartialCorrelationFunction[<i>tproc</i>,<i>hspec</i>] represents the partial correlation function at lags <i>hspec</i> for the time series process <i>tproc</i>. 

---

ParticleAcceleratorData
ParticleAcceleratorData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the particle accelerator <i>entity</i>.

ParticleAcceleratorData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified particle accelerator entities.

ParticleAcceleratorData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

ParticleData
ParticleData[<i>name</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property for a subatomic particle or family of particles with the specified name. 

ParticleData[{<i>name</i>,<i>q</i>},"<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property for a version of the particle with charge <i>q</i>.

---

Partition
Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] partitions <i>list</i> into nonoverlapping sublists of length <i>n</i>. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] generates sublists with offset <i>d</i>. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] partitions a nested list into blocks of size <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×….

Partition[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses offset <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i> in <i>list</i>. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>L</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>R</i></sub>}] specifies that the first element of <i>list</i> should appear at position <i>k</i><sub><i>L</i></sub> in the first sublist, and the last element of <i>list</i> should appear at or after position <i>k</i><sub><i>R</i></sub> in the last sublist. If additional elements are needed, Partition fills them in by treating <i>list</i> as cyclic. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>L</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>R</i></sub>},<i>x</i>] pads if necessary by repeating the element <i>x</i>. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>L</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>R</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads if necessary by cyclically repeating the elements <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>k</i><sub><i>L</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>R</i></sub>},{}] uses no padding, and so can yield sublists of different lengths. 

Partition[<i>list</i>,<i>nlist</i>,<i>dlist</i>,{<i>klist</i><sub><i>L</i></sub>,<i>klist</i><sub><i>R</i></sub>},<i>padlist</i>] specifies alignments and padding in a nested list. 

---

PartitionGranularity
PartitionGranularity is an option for audio analysis functions that specifies the partitioning of the audio.

---

PartitionsP
PartitionsP[<i>n</i>] gives the number <i>p</i>(<i>n</i>) of unrestricted partitions of the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

PartitionsQ
PartitionsQ[<i>n</i>] gives the number <i>q</i>(<i>n</i>) of partitions of the integer <i>n</i> into distinct parts. 

---

PartLayer
PartLayer[<i>i</i>] represents a net layer that gives the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> part of the input.

PartLayer[<i>i</i>;;<i>j</i>] gives parts <i>i</i> through <i>j</i>.

PartLayer[<i>i</i>;;<i>j</i>;;<i>k</i>] gives parts <i>i</i> through <i>j</i> in steps of <i>k</i>.

PartLayer[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes part <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i> in the input.

---

PartOfSpeech
PartOfSpeech["<i>word</i>"] returns the possible parts of speech for the specified word.

---

ParzenWindow
ParzenWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Parzen window function of <i>x</i>.

---

PascalDistribution
PascalDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents a Pascal distribution with parameters <i>n</i> and <i>p</i>.

---

EventHandler
EventHandler[<i>expr</i>,{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub>:><i>action</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub>:><i>action</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] displays as <i>expr</i>, evaluating <i>action</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> whenever "<i>event</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>" occurs in connection with <i>expr</i>. 

---

PassEventsDown
PassEventsDown is an option to EventHandler which specifies whether events handled by a particular event handler should be passed down to event handlers nested inside.

---

PassEventsUp
PassEventsUp is an option to EventHandler that specifies whether events handled by a particular event handler should be passed up to event handlers in outer expressions.

---

Paste
Paste[<i>expr</i>] pastes <i>expr</i> at the current insertion point in the input notebook. 

Paste[<i>notebook</i>,<i>expr</i>] pastes <i>expr</i> to the specified notebook.

Paste[] pastes the contents of the system clipboard in the input notebook. 

Paste[<i>notebook</i>,Automatic] pastes the contents of the system clipboard to <i>notebook</i>.

---

Path
Path is an option for Get and related functions which gives a list of directories to search in attempting to find an external file. 

---

PathGraph
PathGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a path with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges between <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>+<i> </i>1<i> </i></sub>.

PathGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a path with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

PathGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a path with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

PathGraph[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] yields a path with vertex and edge properties defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

PathGraph[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>-><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to specify a path.

---

PathGraphQ
PathGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a path and False otherwise.

---

Pattern
<i>sym</i>:<i>obj</i> or Pattern[<i>sym</i>,<i>obj</i>] represents the pattern object <i>obj</i>, assigned the name <i>sym</i>. 

---

PatternFilling
PatternFilling[<i>obj</i>] is a two-dimensional graphics directive specifying that <i>obj</i> should be used to fill faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects.

PatternFilling["<i>name</i>"] uses the specified pattern "<i>name</i>".

PatternFilling[<i>obj</i>,<i>size</i>] specifies the size of the object <i>obj</i>.

PatternFilling[<i>obj</i>,<i>size</i>,{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>}] moves the object <i>obj</i> by the offset {<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>}.

---

PatternSequence
PatternSequence[<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is a pattern object that represents a sequence of arguments matching <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

PatternTest
<i>p</i>?<i>test</i> is a pattern object that stands for any expression that matches <i>p</i>, and on which the application of <i>test</i> gives True. 

---

PauliMatrix
PauliMatrix[<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> Pauli spin matrix σ<sub>k</sub>.

---

PaulWavelet
PaulWavelet[] represents a Paul wavelet of order 4.

PaulWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents a Paul wavelet of order <i>n</i>.

---

Pause
Pause[<i>n</i>] pauses for at least <i>n</i> seconds. 

---

PDF
PDF[<i>dist</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the probability density function for the distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at <i>x</i>.

PDF[<i>dist</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multivariate probability density function for a distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

PDF[<i>dist</i>] gives the PDF as a pure function.

---

PeakDetect
PeakDetect[<i>list</i>] gives a binary list in which 1s correspond to peak positions in <i>list</i>.

PeakDetect[<i>list</i>,σ] detects peaks that survive Gaussian blurring up to scale σ.

PeakDetect[<i>list</i>,σ,<i>s</i>] detects peaks with minimum sharpness <i>s</i>.

PeakDetect[<i>list</i>,σ,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] detects only peaks with values greater than <i>t</i>.

PeakDetect[<i>list</i>,σ,{<i>s</i>,σ<sub><i>s</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,σ<sub><i>t</i></sub>}] uses different scales for thresholding sharpness and value.

---

PeanoCurve
PeanoCurve[<i>n</i>] gives the line segments representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Peano curve.

---

PearsonChiSquareTest
PearsonChiSquareTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Pearson χ<sup>2</sup> test.

PearsonChiSquareTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Pearson χ<sup>2</sup> test.

PearsonChiSquareTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PearsonCorrelationTest
PearsonCorrelationTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are linearly independent.

PearsonCorrelationTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PearsonDistribution
PearsonDistribution[<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>0</sub>] represents a distribution of the Pearson family with parameters <i>a</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>a</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>b</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>b</i><sub>1</sub>, and <i>b</i><sub>0</sub>.

PearsonDistribution[<i>type</i>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>0</sub>] represents a Pearson distribution of given <i>type</i>. 

---

PercentForm
PercentForm[<i>expr</i>] prints with numbers in <i>expr</i> given as percentages.

PercentForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with approximate real numbers in <i>expr</i> given as percentages to <i>n</i>-digit precision.

---

PerfectNumber
PerfectNumber[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> perfect number.

---

PerfectNumberQ
PerfectNumberQ[<i>n</i>] returns True if <i>n</i> is a perfect number, and False otherwise.

---

PerformanceGoal
PerformanceGoal is an option for various algorithmic and presentational functions that specifies what aspect of performance to try to optimize with Automatic settings for options.

---

Perimeter
Perimeter[<i>reg</i>] gives the perimeter of the two-dimensional region <i>reg</i>.

Perimeter[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the perimeter of the parametrized region whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>s</i> and <i>t</i>.

Perimeter[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

PeriodicBoundaryCondition
PeriodicBoundaryCondition[<i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…],<i>pred</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a periodic boundary condition =u(x<sub>target</sub>)=u(f(x<sub>target</sub>)) for all <i>x</i><sub><i>target</i></sub> on the boundary of the region given to NDSolve where <i>pred</i> is True.

PeriodicBoundaryCondition[<i>a</i>+<i>b</i> <i>u</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…],<i>pred</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a generalized periodic boundary condition a+b u(x<sub>target</sub>)=u(f(x<sub>target</sub>)).

---

Periodogram
Periodogram[<i>list</i>] plots the squared magnitude of the discrete Fourier transform (power spectrum) of <i>list</i>.

Periodogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] plots the mean of power spectra of non-overlapping partitions of length <i>n</i>.

Periodogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

Periodogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

Periodogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

Periodogram[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] plots power spectra of several lists.

Periodogram[<i>audio</i>,…] plots the power spectrum of <i>audio</i>.

Periodogram[<i>video</i>,…] plots the power spectrum of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

Periodogram[{<i>input</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>input</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots the power spectra of all <i>input</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PeriodogramArray
PeriodogramArray[<i>list</i>] returns the squared magnitude of the discrete Fourier transform (power spectrum) of <i>list</i>.

PeriodogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] averages the power spectra of non-overlapping partitions of length <i>n</i>.

PeriodogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

PeriodogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

PeriodogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

PeriodogramArray[<i>image</i>,…] returns the squared power spectrum of <i>image</i>.

PeriodogramArray[<i>audio</i>,…] returns the squared power spectrum of <i>audio</i>.

PeriodogramArray[<i>video</i>,…] returns the squared power spectrum of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

Permanent
Permanent[<i>m</i>] gives the permanent of the square matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

PermissionsGroup
PermissionsGroup["<i>name</i>"] represents a permissions group with the specified name, owned by the current user.

PermissionsGroup[<i>user</i>,"<i>name</i>"] represents a permissions group owned by the specified user.

---

PermissionsGroupMemberQ
PermissionsGroupMemberQ[<i>group</i>,<i>user</i>] returns True if <i>user</i> is a member of the permissions group <i>group</i>, and False otherwise.

---

PermissionsGroups
PermissionsGroups[] gives a list of permissions groups belonging to the current user.

---

PermissionsKeys
PermissionsKeys[] gives a list of all valid permissions keys created by the currently authenticated user.

---

PermutationCycles
PermutationCycles[<i>perm</i>] gives a disjoint cycle representation of permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationCyclesQ
PermutationCyclesQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a permutation in disjoint cyclic form, and False otherwise.

---

PermutationGroup
PermutationGroup[{<i>perm</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>perm</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the group generated by multiplication of the permutations <i>perm</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>perm</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

PermutationLength
PermutationLength[<i>perm</i>] returns the number of integers moved by the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationList
PermutationList[<i>perm</i>] returns a permutation list representation of permutation <i>perm</i>.

PermutationList[<i>perm</i>,<i>len</i>] returns a permutation list of length <i>len</i>.

---

PermutationListQ
PermutationListQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a valid permutation list and False otherwise.

---

PermutationMax
PermutationMax[<i>perm</i>] returns the largest integer moved by the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationMin
PermutationMin[<i>perm</i>] returns the smallest integer moved by the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationOrder
PermutationOrder[<i>perm</i>] gives the order of permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationPower
PermutationPower[<i>perm</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> permutation power of the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

PermutationProduct
PermutationProduct[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the product of permutations <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>.

---

PermutationReplace
PermutationReplace[<i>expr</i>,<i>perm</i>] replaces each part in <i>expr</i> by its image under the permutation <i>perm</i>.

PermutationReplace[<i>expr</i>,<i>gr</i>] returns the list of images of <i>expr</i> under all elements of the permutation group <i>gr</i>.

---

Permutations
Permutations[<i>list</i>] generates a list of all possible permutations of the elements in <i>list</i>. 

Permutations[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives all permutations containing at most <i>n</i> elements.

Permutations[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i>}] gives all permutations containing exactly <i>n</i> elements.

---

PermutationSupport
PermutationSupport[<i>perm</i>] returns the support of the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

Permute
Permute[<i>expr</i>,<i>perm</i>] permutes the positions of the elements of <i>expr</i> according to the permutation <i>perm</i>.

Permute[<i>expr</i>,<i>gr</i>] returns the list of permuted forms of <i>expr</i> under the elements of the permutation group <i>gr</i>.

---

PeronaMalikFilter
PeronaMalikFilter[<i>image</i>] applies a Perona–Malik diffusion filter to <i>image</i>.

PeronaMalikFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] specifies the amount of diffusion time <i>t</i> to be applied. 

PeronaMalikFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>k</i>] uses a conductance parameter <i>k</i>.

PeronaMalikFilter[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>k</i>,σ] applies a Gaussian regularization of width σ to the image gradient in the conductance function.

---

PerpendicularBisector
PerpendicularBisector[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the perpendicular bisector of the line segment connecting <i>p</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>.

PerpendicularBisector[Line[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>}]] gives the perpendicular bisector of a line segment.

---

PersistenceLocation
PersistenceLocation["<i>type</i>"] represents a persistence location of the given type.

PersistenceLocation["<i>type</i>",<i>base</i>] includes the base address for a location type that allows multiple locations.

---

PersistenceTime
PersistenceTime is an option for various functions that specifies when a persistent value should be treated as expired.

---

PersistentObject
PersistentObject["<i>name</i>",<i>loc</i>] represents a persistent object stored at persistence location <i>loc</i>.

---

PersistentObjects
PersistentObjects[] gives all persistent objects in all locations in $PersistencePath.

PersistentObjects[<i>patt</i>] gives all persistent objects whose names match the string pattern <i>patt</i>.

PersistentObjects[<i>patt</i>,<i>loc</i>] gives all matching persistent objects in persistence location <i>loc</i>.

PersistentObjects[<i>patt</i>,{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] gives all matching persistent objects in all the <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PersistentSymbol
PersistentSymbol["<i>name</i>"] represents the persistent symbol associated with the key "<i>name</i>".

PersistentSymbol["<i>name</i>",<i>loc</i>] represents the persistent symbol associated with <i>name</i> stored in persistence location <i>loc</i>. 

PersistentSymbol["<i>name</i>",{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents the persistent symbol associated with <i>name</i> at the first of the locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at which it occurs.

---

PersistentValue
PersistentValue["<i>name</i>"] represents the persistent value associated with the key "<i>name</i>".

PersistentValue["<i>name</i>",<i>loc</i>] represents the persistent value associated with <i>name</i> stored in persistence location <i>loc</i>. 

PersistentValue["<i>name</i>",{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents the persistent value associated with <i>name</i> at the first of the locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at which it occurs.

---

PersonData
PersonData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the person <i>entity</i>.

PersonData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified person entities.

PersonData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

PERTDistribution
PERTDistribution[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},<i>c</i>] represents a PERT distribution with range <i>min</i> to <i>max</i> and mode at <i>c</i>.

PERTDistribution[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},<i>c</i>,λ] represents a modified PERT distribution with shape parameter λ.

---

PetersenGraph
PetersenGraph[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the generalized Petersen graph P<sub>n, k</sub>.

---

PhaseMargins
PhaseMargins[<i>lsys</i>] gives the phase margins of the linear time-invariant system <i>lsys</i>.

---

PhaseRange
PhaseRange is an option to BodePlot and NicholsPlot that specifies the phase range.

---

Pi
Pi is π, with numerical value ≃3.14159. 

---

Pick
Pick[<i>list</i>,<i>sel</i>] picks out those elements of <i>list</i> for which the corresponding element of <i>sel</i> is True. 

Pick[<i>list</i>,<i>sel</i>,<i>patt</i>] picks out those elements of <i>list</i> for which the corresponding element of <i>sel</i> matches <i>patt</i>. 

---

PIDData
PIDData[…] represents PID data generated by PIDTune function.

---

PIDDerivativeFilter
PIDDerivativeFilter is an option to PIDTune that controls the filtering used for derivative terms.

---

PIDFeedforward
PIDFeedforward is an option to PIDTune that controls the reference weights used for the feedforward filter. 

---

PIDTune
PIDTune[<i>sys</i>] gives a feedback PID controller for the system <i>sys</i>. 

PIDTune[<i>sys</i>,"<i>carch</i>"] gives a controller of architecture "<i>carch</i>" ("P", "PI", "PID", etc). 

PIDTune[<i>sys</i>,{"<i>carch</i>","<i>trule</i>"}] gives a controller using the tuning rule "<i>trule</i>". 

PIDTune[<i>sys</i>,…,"<i>prop</i>"] returns the value for the property "<i>prop</i>". 

---

Piecewise
Piecewise[{{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cond</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>cond</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents a piecewise function with values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the regions defined by the conditions <i>cond</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Piecewise[{{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cond</i><sub>1</sub>},…},<i>val</i>] uses default value <i>val</i> if none of the <i>cond</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> apply. The default for <i>val</i> is 0. 

---

PiecewiseExpand
PiecewiseExpand[<i>expr</i>] expands nested piecewise functions in <i>expr</i> to give a single piecewise function. 

PiecewiseExpand[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>] expands piecewise functions using assumptions. 

PiecewiseExpand[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>,<i>dom</i>] does the expansion over the domain <i>dom</i>. 

---

PieChart
PieChart[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] makes a pie chart with sector angle proportional to <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

PieChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a pie chart with sector features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

PieChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a pie chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PieChart3D
PieChart3D[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D pie chart with sector angle proportional to <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

PieChart3D[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] makes a 3D pie chart with sector features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

PieChart3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D pie chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PillaiTrace
PillaiTrace[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] gives Pillai's trace for the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

PillaiTraceTest
PillaiTraceTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

PillaiTraceTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PingTime
PingTime[<i>host</i>] gives the round-trip ping time for the specified network host.

PingTime[<i>host</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of times for <i>n</i> successive pings.

---

Pink
Pink represents the color pink in graphics or style specifications. 

---

PitchRecognize
PitchRecognize[<i>audio</i>] recognizes the main pitch in <i>audio</i>, returning it as a TimeSeries object. 

PitchRecognize[<i>audio</i>,<i>spec</i>] returns the main pitch processed according to the specified <i>spec</i>.

PitchRecognize[<i>video</i>,…] recognizes the main pitch in the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

Pivoting
Pivoting is an option to certain matrix decomposition functions. With Pivoting -> False, no pivoting is done. With Pivoting -> True, column pivoting is carried out and the list of matrices returned is augmented by the appropriate permutation matrix.

---

PixelValue
PixelValue[<i>image</i>,<i>ppos</i>] gives the pixel value of <i>image</i> at position <i>pos</i>.

PixelValue[<i>image</i>,<i>ppos</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives the pixel value converted to the specified type.

---

PixelValuePositions
PixelValuePositions[<i>image</i>,<i>val</i>] returns a list of pixel positions in <i>image</i> that exactly match the value <i>val</i>.

PixelValuePositions[<i>image</i>,<i>val</i>,<i>d</i>] returns all pixel positions that have values within a distance <i>d</i> from <i>val</i>.

---

Placed
Placed[<i>expr</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an expression <i>expr</i> placed at relative position <i>pos</i> in a chart or other display. 

Placed[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>pos</i>] places each of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at a relative position specified by <i>pos</i>.

Placed[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>pos</i>,<i>f</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to each of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> before displaying it.

---

Placeholder
Placeholder[<i>name</i>] represents a placeholder labeled with <i>name</i> that indicates a place to type.

Placeholder[] gives the empty placeholder .

---

PlaceholderLayer
PlaceholderLayer[] represents a net layer whose operation is undefined.

PlaceholderLayer["<i>tag</i>",<i>assoc</i>] indicates a tag and information given by the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

PlaceholderReplace
PlaceholderReplace is an option to Paste that determines whether to replace a selection placeholder with the selected contents.

---

Plain
