Plain represents a font that is not bold, italic, or underlined.

---

PlanarAngle
PlanarAngle[<i>p</i>{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>q</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the angle between the half‐lines from <i>p</i> through <i>q</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>q</i><sub>2</sub>.

PlanarAngle[{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i>,<i>q</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the angle at <i>p</i> formed by the triangle with vertex points <i>p</i>, <i>q</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>q</i><sub>2</sub>.

PlanarAngle[…,"<i>spec</i>"] gives the angle specified by <i>"spec"</i>.

---

PlanarFaceList
PlanarFaceList[<i>g</i>] gives the list of faces of the planar graph <i>g</i>.

---

PlanarGraph
PlanarGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a planar graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

PlanarGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a planar graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

PlanarGraph[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>],…}] yields a planar graph with vertex and edge properties defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

PlanarGraph[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to specify a planar graph.

---

PlanarGraphQ
PlanarGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if <i>g</i> is a planar graph and False otherwise.

---

PlanckRadiationLaw
PlanckRadiationLaw[<i>temperature</i>,λ] returns the spectral radiance for the specified temperature and wavelength λ.

PlanckRadiationLaw[<i>temperature</i>,<i>f</i>] returns the spectral radiance for the specified temperature and frequency <i>f</i>.

PlanckRadiationLaw[<i>temperature</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the value of the property for the specified temperature.

PlanckRadiationLaw[<i>temperature</i>,{λ<sub>1</sub>,λ<sub>2</sub>}] returns the integrated result of the spectral radiance over the wavelength range λ<sub>1</sub> to λ<sub>2</sub>.

PlanckRadiationLaw[<i>temperature</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>}] returns the integrated result of the spectral radiance over the frequency range <i>f</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

PlaneCurveData
PlaneCurveData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the plane curve <i>entity</i>.

PlaneCurveData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified plane curve entities.

PlaneCurveData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

PlanetaryMoonData
PlanetaryMoonData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the moon <i>entity</i> of a planet or minor planet.

PlanetaryMoonData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified moon entities.

PlanetaryMoonData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the property.

---

PlanetData
PlanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the planet <i>entity</i>.

PlanetData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified planet entities.

PlanetData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the property.

---

PlantData
PlantData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the plant <i>entity</i>.

PlantData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified plant entities.

PlantData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the property.

---

Play
Play[<i>f</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] creates an object that plays as a sound whose amplitude is given by <i>f</i> as a function of time <i>t</i> in seconds between <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

---

PlayRange
PlayRange is an option for Play and related functions which specifies what range of sound amplitude levels should be included. 

---

Plot
Plot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

Plot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Plot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

Plot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

Plot3D
Plot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a three-dimensional plot of <i>f</i> as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>. 

Plot3D[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions. 

Plot3D[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

Plot3D[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

PlotDivision
PlotDivision is an option for Plot that specifies the maximum amount of subdivision to be used.

---

PlotJoined
PlotJoined is an option for ListPlot that specifies whether the points plotted should be joined by a line. 

---

PlotLabel
PlotLabel is an option for graphics functions that specifies an overall label for a plot. 

---

PlotLabels
PlotLabels is an option for visualization functions that specifies what labels to use for each data source.

---

PlotLayout
PlotLayout is an option for plotting functions that specifies the layout of multiple components in a plot.

---

PlotLegends
PlotLegends is an option for plot functions that specifies what legends to use. 

---

PlotMarkers
PlotMarkers is an option for graphics functions like ListPlot and ListLinePlot that specifies what markers to draw at the points plotted. 

---

PlotPoints
PlotPoints is an option for plotting functions that specifies how many initial sample points to use. 

---

PlotRange
PlotRange is an option for graphics functions that specifies what range of coordinates to include in a plot. 

---

PlotRangeClipping
PlotRangeClipping is an option for graphics functions that specifies whether graphics objects should be clipped at the edge of the region defined by PlotRange, or should be allowed to extend to the actual edge of the image. 

---

PlotRangePadding
PlotRangePadding is an option for graphics functions that specifies how much further axes etc. should extend beyond the range of coordinates specified by PlotRange. 

---

PlotRegion
PlotRegion is an option for graphics functions that specifies what region of the final display area a plot should fill. 

---

PlotStyle
PlotStyle is an option for plotting and related functions that specifies styles in which objects are to be drawn. 

---

PlotTheme
PlotTheme is an option for plotting and related functions that specifies an overall theme for visualization elements and styles. 

---

Pluralize
Pluralize["<i>noun</i>"] gives the plural form of the English word "noun".

Pluralize["<i>noun</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the inflected form of "<i>noun</i>" for <i>n</i> instances. 

Pluralize[{"<i>singular</i>","<i>plural</i>"},<i>n</i>] inflects using the specified forms.

Pluralize[<i>spec</i>,<i>list</i>] uses the length of <i>list</i> to determine the inflection to use. 

---

Plus
<i>x</i>+<i>y</i>+<i>z</i> represents a sum of terms. 

---

PlusMinus
PlusMinus[<i>x</i>] displays as ±<i>x</i>.

PlusMinus[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>±<i>y</i>±….

---

Pochhammer
Pochhammer[<i>a</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the Pochhammer symbol (a)<sub>n</sub>.

---

PodStates
PodStates is an option for WolframAlpha that determines information about the states of the pods.

---

PodWidth
PodWidth is an option for WolframAlpha that determines the width parameters of the content returned by the Wolfram|Alpha API.

---

Point
Point[<i>p</i>] is a graphics and geometry primitive that represents a point at <i>p</i>. 

Point[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of points. 

---

PointCountDistribution
PointCountDistribution[<i>pproc</i>,<i>reg</i>] represents the distribution of point counts for the point process <i>pproc</i> in the region <i>reg</i>.

PointCountDistribution[<i>pproc</i>,{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>reg</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the joint distribution of point counts in regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

PointDensity
PointDensity[<i>pdata</i>] estimates the point density function μ(x) from point data <i>pdata</i>.

PointDensity[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pmethod</i>] estimates the point density function μ(x) with the partition method <i>pmethod</i>.

PointDensity[<i>bdata</i>,…] estimates the point density function μ(x) from binned data <i>bdata</i>.

PointDensity[<i>pproc</i>,…] computes the density function μ(x) for point process <i>pproc</i>.

---

PointDensityFunction
PointDensityFunction[…] represents a function whose values give the density at a given location.

---

PointFigureChart
PointFigureChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a point and figure chart with prices <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at date <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PointFigureChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i>}] makes a point and figure chart of closing prices for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the date range <i>daterange</i>.

PointFigureChart[{…},<i>s</i>,<i>n</i>] makes a point and figure chart with point and figure height <i>s</i> and <i>n</i> reversals.

---

PointLegend
PointLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] generates a legend that associates points of colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with labels <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PointLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},Automatic] generates a legend with placeholder labels for the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PointLegend[{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents a legend with inherited colors within visualization functions.

---

PointLight
PointLight[<i>col</i>,<i>pt</i>] is a three-dimensional graphics directive that specifies the point light of color <i>col</i> at position <i>pt</i> to use in coloring 3D surfaces.

PointLight[<i>col</i>,<i>pt</i>,<i>att</i>] uses the point light with geometric attenuation <i>att</i>.

---

PointProcessEstimator
PointProcessEstimator[] is an option to EstimatedPointProcess and FindPointProcessParameters that specifies what point process parameter estimator to use. 

---

PointProcessFitTest
PointProcessFitTest[<i>pdata</i>] tests whether the point collection <i>pdata</i> could be modeled by a Poisson point process.

PointProcessFitTest[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i><i>]</i> tests whether the point collection could be modeled by the point process <i>pproc</i>.

PointProcessFitTest[<i>pdata</i>,<i>pproc</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

PointProcessParameterAssumptions
PointProcessParameterAssumptions[<i>proc</i>] gives a logical expression for assumptions on parameters in the point process <i>proc</i>.

---

PointProcessParameterQ
PointProcessParameterQ[<i>proc</i>] yields True if <i>proc</i> is a valid random point process, and yields False otherwise.

---

PointSize
PointSize[<i>d</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that points which follow are to be shown if possible as circular regions with diameter <i>d</i>. The diameter <i>d</i> is given as a fraction of the total width of the plot. 

---

PointStatisticFunction
PointStatisticFunction[…] represents a function whose values give the statistic of a points collection <i>pdata</i> at a supplied radius.

---

PointValuePlot
PointValuePlot[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots the points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> styled according to the values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

PointValuePlot[<i>pts</i><i>vals</i>] uses a collection of points <i>pt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>pts</i> with corresponding values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>val</i>.

PointValuePlot[…,<i>enc</i>] uses the visual encoding <i>enc</i> to represent the values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the plot.

PointValuePlot[<i>data</i>,…] plots the locations and values from <i>data</i>.

---

PoissonConsulDistribution
PoissonConsulDistribution[μ,λ] represents a Poisson–Consul distribution with parameters μ and λ.

---

PoissonDistribution
PoissonDistribution[μ] represents a Poisson distribution with mean μ.

---

PoissonPDEComponent
PoissonPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a Poisson PDE term ∇<sup>2</sup><sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i><i>-</i><i>f</i> with model variables <i>vars</i> and model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

PoissonProcess
PoissonProcess[μ] represents a Poisson process with rate μ.

---

PoissonWindow
PoissonWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Poisson window function of <i>x</i>.

PoissonWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

PolarAxes
PolarAxes is an option for sector charts and polar plots that specifies whether polar axes should be drawn.

---

PolarAxesOrigin
PolarAxesOrigin is an option for sector charts and polar plots that specifies where polar axes should be drawn.

---

PolarGridLines
PolarGridLines is an option for sector charts and polar plots that specifies polar grid lines.

---

PolarPlot
PolarPlot[<i>r</i>,{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a polar plot of a curve with radius <i>r</i> as a function of angle θ.

PolarPlot[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a polar plot of curves with radius functions <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

PolarTicks
PolarTicks is an option for sector charts and polar plots that specifies tick marks for polar axes.

---

PoleZeroMarkers
PoleZeroMarkers is an option for RootLocusPlot that specifies the markers to be drawn on the complex plane at the open-loop poles, closed-loop poles, and open-loop zeros.

---

PolyaAeppliDistribution
PolyaAeppliDistribution[θ,<i>p</i>] represents a Pólya–Aeppli distribution with shape parameters θ and <i>p</i>. 

---

PolyGamma
PolyGamma[<i>z</i>] gives the digamma function ψ(z). 

PolyGamma[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> derivative of the digamma function ψ<sup>(n)</sup>(z). 

---

Polygon
Polygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a filled polygon with points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Polygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>q</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},…}] represents a polygon with holes {<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>q</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},….

Polygon[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of polygons <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Polygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>data</i>] represents a polygon in which coordinates given as integers <i>i</i> in <i>data</i> are taken to be <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PolygonalNumber
PolygonalNumber[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> triangular number T<sub>n</sub>.

PolygonalNumber[<i>r</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> <i>r</i>-gonal number P<sub>n</sub><sup> r</sup>.

---

PolygonAngle
PolygonAngle[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of angles at the vertex points of <i>poly</i>.

PolygonAngle[<i>poly</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the angle at the vertex point <i>p</i> of a polygon <i>poly</i>.

PolygonAngle[<i>poly</i>,<i>i</i>] gives the angle at the point <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>poly</i> in canonical form Polygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>data</i>].

PolygonAngle[…,"<i>spec</i>"] gives the angle specified by "<i>spec</i>".

---

PolygonCoordinates
PolygonCoordinates[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of coordinates in the polygon <i>poly</i>.

---

PolygonDecomposition
PolygonDecomposition[<i>poly</i>] decomposes the polygon <i>poly</i> into a disjoint union of simpler polygons.

PolygonDecomposition[<i>poly</i>,"<i>type</i>"] decomposes into polygons of the specified "<i>type</i>".

---

PolygonIntersections
PolygonIntersections is an option for Graphics3D which specifies whether intersecting polygons should be left unchanged. 

---

Polyhedron
Polyhedron[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a filled polyhedron inside the closed surfaces with polygon faces <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Polyhedron[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>f</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},…}] represents a polyhedron with voids {<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},….

Polyhedron[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a collection of polyhedra <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Polyhedron[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>data</i>] represents a polyhedron in which coordinates given as integers <i>i</i> in <i>data</i> are taken to be <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PolyhedronAngle
PolyhedronAngle[<i>poly</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the solid angle at the point <i>p</i> and spanned by edges with common point <i>p</i>.

PolyhedronAngle[<i>poly</i>,<i>e</i>] gives the dihedral angle between the two faces with common edge <i>e</i>.

---

PolyhedronCoordinates
PolyhedronCoordinates[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of coordinates in the polyhedron <i>poly</i>.

---

PolyhedronData
PolyhedronData[<i>poly</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the polyhedron named <i>poly</i>.

PolyhedronData[<i>poly</i>] gives an image of the polyhedron named <i>poly</i>.

PolyhedronData["<i>class</i>"] gives a list of the polyhedra in the specified class.

---

PolyhedronDecomposition
PolyhedronDecomposition[<i>poly</i>] decomposes the polyhedron <i>poly</i> into a union of simpler polyhedra.

---

PolyhedronGenus
PolyhedronGenus[<i>poly</i>] gives the genus of the polyhedron <i>poly</i>.

---

PolyLog
PolyLog[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the polylogarithm function Li<sub>n</sub>(z).

PolyLog[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Nielsen generalized polylogarithm function S<sub>n,p</sub>(z). 

---

PolynomialExpressionQ
PolynomialExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a polynomial expression in <i>x</i>, and False otherwise.

PolynomialExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a polynomial expression in <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…, and False otherwise.

PolynomialExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…},<i>test</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a polynomial expression in <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,… with coefficients satisfying <i>test</i>, and False otherwise.

---

PolynomialExtendedGCD
PolynomialExtendedGCD[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i>] gives the extended GCD of <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> treated as univariate polynomials in <i>x</i>.

PolynomialExtendedGCD[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] gives the extended GCD over the integers modulo the prime <i>p</i>.

---

PolynomialGCD
PolynomialGCD[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the greatest common divisor of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

PolynomialGCD[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…,Modulus<i>p</i>] evaluates the GCD modulo the prime <i>p</i>. 

---

PolynomialLCM
PolynomialLCM[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the least common multiple of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

PolynomialLCM[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…,Modulus<i>p</i>] evaluates the LCM modulo the prime <i>p</i>. 

---

PolynomialMod
PolynomialMod[<i>poly</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the polynomial <i>poly</i> reduced modulo <i>m</i>. 

PolynomialMod[<i>poly</i>,{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reduces modulo all of the <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

PolynomialQ
PolynomialQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>var</i>] yields True if <i>expr</i> is a polynomial in <i>var</i>, and yields False otherwise. 

PolynomialQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>var</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] tests whether <i>expr</i> is a polynomial in the <i>var</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

PolynomialQuotient
PolynomialQuotient[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the quotient of <i>p</i> and <i>q</i>, treated as polynomials in <i>x</i>, with any remainder dropped. 

---

PolynomialQuotientRemainder
PolynomialQuotientRemainder[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>x</i>] gives a list of the quotient and remainder of <i>p</i> and <i>q</i>, treated as polynomials in <i>x</i>. 

---

PolynomialReduce
PolynomialReduce[<i>poly</i>,{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a list representing a reduction of <i>poly</i> in terms of the <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. The list has the form {{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>b</i>}, where <i>b</i> is minimal and <i>a</i><sub>1</sub> <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>+<i>a</i><sub>2</sub> <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>+…+<i>b</i> is exactly <i>poly</i>. 

---

PolynomialRemainder
PolynomialRemainder[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the remainder from dividing <i>p</i> by <i>q</i>, treated as polynomials in <i>x</i>. 

---

PoolingLayer
PoolingLayer[<i>sz</i>] represents a pooling net layer using kernels of size <i>sz</i>.

PoolingLayer[{<i>w</i>}] represents a layer performing one-dimensional pooling with kernels of size <i>w</i>.

PoolingLayer[{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>}] represents a layer performing two-dimensional pooling with kernels of size <i>h</i>×<i>w</i>.

PoolingLayer[{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>,<i>d</i>}] represents a layer performing three-dimensional pooling with kernels of size <i>h</i>×<i>w</i>×<i>d</i>.

PoolingLayer[<i>kernel</i>,<i>stride</i>] represents a layer that uses <i>stride</i> as the step size between kernel applications.

PoolingLayer[<i>kernel</i>,<i>opts</i>] includes options for other pooling methods, padding and other parameters.

---

PopupWindow
PopupWindow[<i>expr</i>,<i>contents</i>] displays as <i>expr</i>, but pops up a window containing <i>contents</i> when clicked.

---

Position
Position[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives a list of the positions at which objects matching <i>pattern</i> appear in <i>expr</i>. 

Position[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] finds only objects that appear on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Position[<i>expr</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the first <i>n</i> objects found. 

Position[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of Position that can be applied to an expression.

---

PositionIndex
PositionIndex[<i>list</i>] gives an association between unique elements in <i>list</i> and the positions at which they occur.

PositionIndex[<i>assoc</i>] gives an association whose keys are the distinct values in <i>assoc</i>, and whose values are lists of the keys with which they are associated.

---

Positive
Positive[<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>x</i> is a positive number. 

---

PositiveDefiniteMatrixQ
PositiveDefiniteMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly positive definite, and False otherwise. 

---

PositiveIntegers
PositiveIntegers represents the domain of strictly positive integers, as in <i>x</i>∈PositiveIntegers. 

---

PositivelyOrientedPoints
PositivelyOrientedPoints[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>d</i>+1</sub>}] tests whether the sequence of points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>d</i>+1</sub> is positively oriented.

---

PositiveRationals
PositiveRationals represents the domain of strictly positive rational numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈PositiveRationals. 

---

PositiveReals
PositiveReals represents the domain of strictly positive real numbers.

---

PositiveSemidefiniteMatrixQ
PositiveSemidefiniteMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly positive semidefinite, and False otherwise. 

---

PossibleZeroQ
PossibleZeroQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if basic symbolic and numerical methods suggest that <i>expr</i> has value zero, and gives False otherwise. 

---

Postfix
Postfix[<i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>]] prints with <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] given in default postfix form: <i>expr</i>//<i>f</i>. 

Postfix[<i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>],<i>h</i>] prints as <i>exprh</i>. 

---

Power
<i>x</i>^<i>y</i> gives <i>x</i> to the power <i>y</i>.

---

PowerDistribution
PowerDistribution[<i>k</i>,<i>a</i>] represents a power distribution with domain parameter <i>k</i> and shape parameter <i>a</i>.

---

PowerExpand
PowerExpand[<i>expr</i>] expands all powers of products and powers. 

PowerExpand[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] expands only with respect to the variables <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

PowerMod
PowerMod[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>m</i>] gives <i>a</i><sup><i>b</i></sup> mod <i>m</i>. 

PowerMod[<i>a</i>,-1,<i>m</i>] finds the modular inverse of <i>a</i> modulo <i>m</i>.

PowerMod[<i>a</i>,1/<i>r</i>,<i>m</i>] finds a modular <i>r</i><sup>th</sup> root of <i>a</i>.

---

PowerModList
PowerModList[<i>a</i>,<i>s</i>/<i>r</i>,<i>m</i>] gives a list of all x modulo <i>m</i> for which x<sup>r</sup>≡a<sup>s</sup> mod <i>m</i>.

---

PowerRange
PowerRange[<i>b</i>] generates the list {1,10,100,…,<i>max</i>}, where <i>max</i> is the largest power of 10 that does not exceed <i>b</i>.

PowerRange[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] generates the list {<i>a</i>,10<i>a</i>,100<i>a</i>,…,<i>max</i>}, with successive elements increasing by factors of 10. 

PowerRange[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>r</i>] uses factors of <i>r</i> instead of 10.

---

PowerSpectralDensity
PowerSpectralDensity[<i>data</i>,ω] estimates the power spectral density for <i>data</i>.

PowerSpectralDensity[<i>data</i>,ω,<i>sspec</i>] estimates the power spectral density for <i>data</i> with smoothing specification <i>sspec</i>.

PowerSpectralDensity[<i>tproc</i>,ω] represents the power spectral density of a time series process <i>tproc</i>.

---

PowerSymmetricPolynomial
PowerSymmetricPolynomial[<i>r</i>] represents a formal power symmetric polynomial with exponent <i>r</i>.

PowerSymmetricPolynomial[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a multivariate formal power symmetric polynomial with exponents <i>r</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>r</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

PowerSymmetricPolynomial[<i>rspec,data</i>] gives the power symmetric polynomial in <i>data</i>. 

---

Precedence
Precedence[<i>sym</i>] returns the precedence of the output operator associated to the symbol <i>sym</i>.

Precedence[<i>boxes</i>,<i>fmt</i>] returns the precedence of the operator of used in the typeset expression <i>boxes</i>, assuming it was typeset in the format <i>fmt</i>.

---

PrecedenceForm
PrecedenceForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>prec</i>] prints with <i>expr</i> parenthesized as it would be if it contained an operator with precedence <i>prec</i>. 

---

Precedes
Precedes[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≺<i>y</i>≺….

---

PrecedesEqual
PrecedesEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⪯<i>y</i>⪯….

---

PrecedesSlantEqual
PrecedesSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≼<i>y</i>≼….

---

PrecedesTilde
PrecedesTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≾<i>y</i>≾….

---

Precision
Precision[<i>x</i>] gives the effective number of digits of precision in the number <i>x</i>. 

---

PrecisionGoal
PrecisionGoal is an option for various numerical operations which specifies how many effective digits of precision should be sought in the final result. 

---

PreDecrement
--<i>x</i> decreases the value of <i>x</i> by 1, returning the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

Predict
Predict[{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub><i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>in</i><sub>2</sub><i>out</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a PredictorFunction that attempts to predict <i>out</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the example <i>in</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Predict[<i>data</i>,<i>input</i>] attempts to predict the output associated with <i>input</i> from the training examples given.

Predict[<i>data</i>,<i>input</i><i>,</i><i>prop</i>] computes the specified property <i>prop</i> relative to the prediction.

---

PredictorFunction
PredictorFunction[…] represents a function generated by Predict that predicts numerical values from data.

---

PredictorInformation
PredictorInformation[<i>predictor</i>] generates a report giving information on the predictor function <i>predictor</i>.

PredictorInformation[<i>predictor</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives information for <i>predictor</i> associated with property <i>prop</i>.

---

PredictorMeasurements
PredictorMeasurements[<i>predictor</i>,<i>testset</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives measurements associated with the property <i>prop</i> when <i>predictor</i> is evaluated on <i>testset</i>.

PredictorMeasurements[<i>predictor</i>,<i>testset</i>] yields a measurement report that can be applied to any property.

PredictorMeasurements[<i>data</i>,…] use predictions <i>data</i> instead of a predictor.

PredictorMeasurements[…,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives properties <i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

---

PredictorMeasurementsObject
PredictorMeasurementsObject[…] represents an object generated by PredictorMeasurements that can be applied to properties.

---

PreemptProtect
PreemptProtect[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, without any interruption from preemptive evaluations.

---

PreferencesPath
PreferencesPath is a global option that specifies which directories are searched for user-specific settings when the Wolfram System is started.

---

Prefix
Prefix[<i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>]] prints with <i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>] given in default prefix form: <i>f</i>@<i>expr</i>. 

Prefix[<i>f</i>[<i>expr</i>],<i>h</i>] prints as <i>hexpr</i>. 

---

PreIncrement
++<i>x</i> increases the value of <i>x</i> by 1, returning the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

Prepend
Prepend[<i>expr</i>,<i>elem</i>] gives <i>expr</i> with <i>elem</i> prepended. 

Prepend[<i>elem</i>] represents an operator form of Prepend that can be applied to an expression.

---

PrependLayer
PrependLayer[] represents a net layer that takes an input array and prepends another array to it.

---

PrependTo
PrependTo[<i>x</i>,<i>elem</i>] prepends <i>elem</i> to the value of <i>x</i>, and resets <i>x</i> to the result. 

---

PreprocessingRules
PreprocessingRules is an option that specifies how the input should be preprocessed.

---

PreserveColor
PreserveColor is an option for ImageRestyle and related functions that specifies whether to preserve colors in the original image.

---

PreserveImageOptions
PreserveImageOptions is an option to graphics and related functions that specifies whether image size and certain other options should be preserved from the previous version of a graphic if the graphic is replaced by a new one in output.

---

PreviousDate
PreviousDate[<i>gran</i>] gives the previously occurring date of the specified granularity type <i>gran</i>.

PreviousDate[<i>daytype</i>] gives the previous day corresponding to the specified <i>daytype</i>.

PreviousDate[<i>date</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the previous date of the given granularity relative to the specified date.

---

PriceGraphDistribution
PriceGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>a</i>] represents a de Solla Price graph distribution for <i>n</i>-vertex graphs where a new vertex with <i>k</i> edges is added at each step, using attractiveness parameter <i>a</i>.

---

Prime
Prime[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> prime number p<sub>n</sub>.

---

PrimeNu
PrimeNu[<i>n</i>] gives the number of distinct primes ν(n) in <i>n</i>.

---

PrimeOmega
PrimeOmega[<i>n</i>] gives the number of prime factors counting multiplicities Ω(n) in <i>n</i>.

---

PrimePi
PrimePi[<i>x</i>] gives the number of primes π(x) less than or equal to <i>x</i>.

---

PrimePowerQ
PrimePowerQ[<i>expr</i>] yields True if <i>expr</i> is a power of a prime number, and yields False otherwise. 

---

PrimeQ
PrimeQ[<i>n</i>] yields True if <i>n</i> is a prime number, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Primes
Primes represents the domain of prime numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈Primes. 

---

PrimeZetaP
PrimeZetaP[<i>s</i>] gives prime zeta function P(s).

---

PrimitivePolynomialQ
PrimitivePolynomialQ[<i>poly</i>,<i>p</i>] tests whether <i>poly</i> is a primitive polynomial modulo a prime <i>p</i>.

---

PrimitiveRoot
PrimitiveRoot[<i>n</i>] gives a primitive root of <i>n</i>.

PrimitiveRoot[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the smallest primitive root of <i>n</i> greater than or equal to <i>k</i>.

---

PrimitiveRootList
PrimitiveRootList[<i>n</i>] gives a list of primitive roots of <i>n</i>.

---

PrincipalComponents
PrincipalComponents[<i>matrix</i>] transforms elements of <i>matrix</i> into unscaled principal components.

---

PrincipalValue
PrincipalValue is an option for Integrate that specifies whether the Cauchy principal value should be found for a definite integral. 

---

Print
Print[<i>expr</i>] prints <i>expr</i> as output. 

---

PrintableASCIIQ
PrintableASCIIQ[<i>string</i>] yields True if the string contains only printable ASCII characters, and yields False otherwise. 

---

PrintAction
PrintAction is an option for notebooks that specifies the action taken when a Print[] command is evaluated by the kernel.

---

PrintingCopies
PrintingCopies is an option for notebooks that specifies the number of copies of a notebook printed when a print command is given.

---

PrintingOptions
PrintingOptions is an option that specifies settings for printing.

---

PrintingPageRange
PrintingPageRange is an option for notebooks that specifies the range of pages of a notebook to be printed.

---

PrintingStartingPageNumber
PrintingStartingPageNumber is an option for notebooks that specifies what number to assign to the first page of a notebook when printed.

---

PrintingStyleEnvironment
PrintingStyleEnvironment is an option for notebooks that specifies the style environment to be used in printing the notebook on paper. 

---

Printout3D
Printout3D[<i>model</i>] prints out the 3D <i>model</i> using a 3D print previewer.

Printout3D[<i>model</i>,<i>service</i>] prints out the 3D <i>model</i> using the specified 3D printing <i>service</i>.

Printout3D[<i>model</i>,"<i>file</i>.<i>ext</i>"] saves a print-ready form of the model to a file in the format indicated by the file extension <i>ext</i>.

---

Printout3DPreviewer
Printout3DPreviewer is an option for Printout3D that specifies a previewer for generating outputs to print.

---

PrintPrecision
PrintPrecision is an option for selections that specifies the maximum number of digits used for displaying a machine-precision number.

---

Prism
Prism[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub>6</sub>}] represents a filled prism connecting the triangles {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>} and {<i>p</i><sub>4</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>5</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>6</sub>}.

---

PrivateEvaluationOptions
PrivateEvaluationOptions is an option for selections that specifies settings for evaluation-related suboptions.

---

PrivateFontOptions
PrivateFontOptions is an option for selections that specifies settings for various font suboptions.

---

PrivateKey
PrivateKey[<i>assoc</i>] represents the private part of a key pair for a public-key cryptographic system.

---

Probability
Probability[<i>pred</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>] gives the probability for an event that satisfies the predicate <i>pred</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

Probability[<i>pred</i>,<i>x</i><i>data</i>] gives the probability for an event that satisfies the predicate <i>pred</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i> follows the probability distribution given by <i>data</i>.

Probability[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>] gives the probability that an event satisfies <i>pred</i> under the assumption that {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

Probability[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the probability that an event satisfies <i>pred</i> under the assumption that <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Probability[<i>pred</i><sub>1</sub><i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the conditional probability of <i>pred</i><sub>1</sub> given <i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ProbabilityDistribution
ProbabilityDistribution[<i>pdf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents the continuous distribution with PDF <i>pdf</i> in the variable <i>x</i> where the <i>pdf</i> is taken to be zero for x<x<sub><i>min</i></sub> and x>x<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

ProbabilityDistribution[<i>pdf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>1</i>}] represents the discrete distribution with PDF <i>pdf</i> in the variable <i>x</i> where the <i>pdf</i> is taken to be zero for x<x<sub><i>min</i></sub> and x>x<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

ProbabilityDistribution[<i>pdf</i>,{<i>x</i>,…},{<i>y</i>,…},…] represents a multivariate distribution with PDF <i>pdf</i> in the variables <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, …, etc. 

ProbabilityDistribution[{"CDF",<i>cdf</i>},…] represents a probability distribution with CDF given by <i>cdf</i>. 

ProbabilityDistribution[{"SF",<i>sf</i>},…] represents a probability distribution with survival function given by <i>sf</i>. 

ProbabilityDistribution[{"HF",<i>hf</i>},…] represents a probability distribution with hazard function given by <i>hf</i>. 

---

ProbabilityPlot
ProbabilityPlot[<i>list</i>] generates a plot of the CDF of <i>list</i> against the CDF of a normal distribution.

ProbabilityPlot[<i>dist</i>] generates a plot of the CDF of the distribution <i>dist</i> against the CDF of a normal distribution.

ProbabilityPlot[<i>data</i>,<i>rdata</i>] generates a plot of the CDF of <i>data</i> against the CDF of <i>rdata</i>.

ProbabilityPlot[<i>data</i>,<i>rdist</i>] generates a plot of the CDF of <i>data</i> against the CDF of symbolic distribution <i>rdist</i>.

ProbabilityPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>ref</i>] generates a plot of the CDF of <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> against the CDF of a reference distribution <i>ref</i>.

---

ProbabilityScalePlot
ProbabilityScalePlot[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a normal probability plot of the samples <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

ProbabilityScalePlot[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>dist</i>"] generates a probability plot scaled for the distribution "<i>dist</i>".

ProbabilityScalePlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>dist</i>"] generates several scaled probability plots for <i>data</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>data</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

ProcessConnection
ProcessConnection[proc, "stream"] returns the stream object for a given stream.

---

ProcessDirectory
ProcessDirectory is an option specifying the initial working directory to use when executing a process in functions like StartProcess and RunProcess.

---

ProcessEnvironment
ProcessEnvironment is an option specifying the initial settings of environment variables to use when executing a process in functions like StartProcess and RunProcess.

---

Processes
Processes[] returns a list of currently running external processes, started in this Wolfram Language session.

---

ProcessEstimator
ProcessEstimator is an option to EstimatedProcess and FindProcessParameters that specifies what process parameter estimator to use. 

---

ProcessInformation
ProcessInformation[proc] gives information about an external process proc.

ProcessInformation[proc, "prop"] gives information about the property "prop".

---

ProcessObject
ProcessObject[...] is an object that represents a runnable external process.

---

ProcessParameterAssumptions
ProcessParameterAssumptions[<i>proc</i>] gives a logical expression for assumptions on parameters in the random process <i>proc</i>.

---

ProcessParameterQ
ProcessParameterQ[<i>proc</i>] yields True if <i>proc</i> is a valid random process, and yields False otherwise.

---

ProcessStatus
ProcessStatus[proc] gives the current status of the external process represented by the ProcessObject proc.

ProcessStatus[proc, "status"] returns True if the process has the status given, and returns False otherwise.

---

ProductDistribution
ProductDistribution[<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the joint distribution with independent component distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

ProductLog
ProductLog[<i>z</i>] gives the principal solution for <i>w</i> in zwe<sup>w</sup>. 

ProductLog[<i>k</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> solution. 

---

ProgressReporting
ProgressReporting is an option for various algorithmic functions that specifies whether to report the progress of the computation.

---

Projection
Projection[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] finds the projection of the vector <i>u</i> onto the vector <i>v</i>.

Projection[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>f</i>] finds projections with respect to the inner product function <i>f</i>.

---

Prolog
Prolog is an option for graphics functions which gives a list of graphics primitives to be rendered before the main part of the graphics is rendered. 

---

PromptForm
PromptForm[<i>prompt</i>, <i>expr</i>] prints as an output prompt and expression.

---

ProofObject
ProofObject[…] represents a proof object generated by FindEquationalProof.

---

Properties
Properties is an option that allows specification of properties to objects and items of objects.

---

Property
Property[<i>item</i>,<i>name</i><i>value</i>] associates the property <i>name</i><i>value</i> with <i>item</i>.

---

PropertyList
PropertyList[{<i>obj</i>,<i>itemspec</i>}] lists the properties available for <i>itemspec</i> in <i>obj</i>.

---

PropertyValue
PropertyValue[{<i>obj</i>,<i>item</i>},<i>name</i>] gives the property value associated with <i>name</i> for <i>item</i> in <i>obj</i>.

PropertyValue[{<i>obj</i>,<i>itemspec</i>},<i>name</i>] gives the property values associated with <i>name</i> for items indicated by <i>itemspec</i> in <i>obj</i>.

PropertyValue[…,{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of property values associated with <i>name</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>name</i><sub>2</sub>, etc.

---

Proportion
Proportion[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∷<i>y</i>∷….

---

Proportional
Proportional[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∝<i>y</i>∝….

---

Protect
Protect[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] sets the attribute Protected for the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Protect[<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…] protects all symbols whose names textually match any of the arbitrary string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Protect[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] protects any symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Protected
Protected is an attribute that prevents any values associated with a symbol from being modified. 

---

ProteinData
ProteinData[<i>entity</i>] gives the reference amino acid sequence for the protein <i>entity</i>.

ProteinData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the protein <i>entity</i>.

ProteinData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Pruning
Pruning[<i>image</i>] removes the outermost branches of thin objects in <i>image</i> by setting their values to black.

Pruning[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] removes branches that are at most <i>n</i> pixels long.

Pruning[<i>image</i><i>,</i>{<i>n</i>}] removes <i>n</i> pixels from each branch.

Pruning[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

PseudoInverse
PseudoInverse[<i>m</i>] finds the pseudoinverse of a rectangular matrix. 

---

PsychrometricPropertyData
PsychrometricPropertyData[<i>spec</i>] returns the psychrometric properties of moist air for the specified parameters.

PsychrometricPropertyData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the specified property for the given parameters.

---

PublicKey
PublicKey[<i>assoc</i>] represents the public part of a key pair for a public-key cryptographic system.

PublicKey[PrivateKey[…]] creates a matching public key for the given private key.

---

PublisherID
PublisherID is an option for ResourceSubmit that specifies the ID used to submit a resource for publication in the resource system.

---

PulsarData
PulsarData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the pulsar <i>entity</i>.

PulsarData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified pulsar entities.

PulsarData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

PunctuationCharacter
PunctuationCharacter represents a punctuation character in StringExpression.

---

Purple
Purple represents the color purple in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Put
<i>expr</i>>><i>filename</i> writes <i>expr</i> to a file. 

Put[<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…,"<i>filename</i>"] writes a sequence of expressions <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to a file. 

Put["<i>filename</i>"] creates an empty file with the specified name.

---

PutAppend
<i>expr</i>>>><i>filename</i> appends <i>expr</i> to a file. 

PutAppend[<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…,"<i>filename</i>"] appends a sequence of expressions <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to a file. 

---

Pyramid
Pyramid[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub>5</sub>}] represents a filled pyramid with base {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub>4</sub>} and top <i>p</i><sub>5</sub>.

---

QBinomial
QBinomial[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the q-binomial coefficient (�)<sub><i>q</i></sub>.

---

QFactorial
QFactorial[<i>n</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the q-factorial [n]<sub>q</sub>!.

---

QGamma
QGamma[<i>z</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the q-gamma function Γ<sub>q</sub> (z).

---

QHypergeometricPFQ
QHypergeometricPFQ[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>r</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>s</i></sub>},<i>q</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the basic hypergeometric series <sub>r</sub>ϕ<sub>s</sub>(a;b;q;z).

---

QnDispersion
QnDispersion[<i>list</i>] gives the Q<sub>n</sub> statistic of the elements in <i>list</i>.

QnDispersion[<i>list</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the Q<sub>n</sub> statistic with a scaling factor <i>c</i>.

---

QPochhammer
QPochhammer[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the q-Pochhammer symbol (a;q)<sub>n</sub>.

QPochhammer[<i>a</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the q-Pochhammer symbol (a;q)<sub>∞</sub>.

QPochhammer[<i>q</i>] gives the q-Pochhammer symbol (q;q)<sub>∞</sub>.

---

QPolyGamma
QPolyGamma[<i>z</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the q-digamma function ψ<sub>q</sub>(z).

QPolyGamma[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>q</i>] gives the n<sup>th</sup> derivative of the q-digamma function ψ<sub>q</sub><sup>(n)</sup>(z).

---

QRDecomposition
QRDecomposition[<i>m</i>] yields the QR decomposition for a numerical matrix <i>m</i>. The result is a list {<i>q</i>,<i>r</i>}, where <i>q</i> is a unitary matrix and <i>r</i> is an upper‐triangular matrix. 

---

QuadraticIrrationalQ
QuadraticIrrationalQ[<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>x</i> is a quadratic irrational and False otherwise.

---

QuadraticOptimization
QuadraticOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the quadratic objective <i>f</i> subject to linear constraints <i>cons</i>.

QuadraticOptimization[{<i>q</i>,<i>c</i>},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><i>}</i>] finds a vector x that minimizes the quadratic objective 1/2x.q.x+c.x subject to the linear inequality constraints a.x+b⪰0. 

QuadraticOptimization[{<i>q</i>,<i>c</i>},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>a</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>eq</i></sub>}] includes the linear equality constraints a<sub>eq</sub>.x+b<sub>eq</sub>0.

QuadraticOptimization[{<i>q</i>,<i>c</i>},…,{<i>dom</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dom</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes x<sub>i</sub> to be in the domain <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, where <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is Integers or Reals.

QuadraticOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned. 

---

Quantile
Quantile[<i>data</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the estimate of the <i>p</i><sup>th</sup> quantile q&amp;^<sub>p</sub> of <i>data</i>. 

Quantile[<i>data</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of quantiles <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…. 

Quantile[<i>data</i>,<i>p</i>,{{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}}] uses the quantile definition specified by parameters <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>. 

Quantile[<i>dist</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a quantile of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

QuantilePlot
QuantilePlot[<i>list</i>] generates a plot of quantiles of <i>list</i> against the quantiles of a normal distribution.

QuantilePlot[<i>dist</i>] generates a plot of quantiles of the distribution <i>dist</i> against the quantiles of a normal distribution.

QuantilePlot[<i>data</i>,<i>rdata</i>] generates a plot of the quantiles of <i>data</i> against the quantiles of <i>rdata</i>.

QuantilePlot[<i>data</i>,<i>rdist</i>] generates a plot of the quantiles of <i>data</i> against the quantiles of a symbolic distribution <i>rdist</i>.

QuantilePlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>ref</i>] generates a plot of quantiles of <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> against the quantiles of a reference distribution <i>ref</i>.

---

Quantity
Quantity[<i>magnitude</i>,<i>unit</i>] represents a quantity with size <i>magnitude</i> and unit specified by <i>unit</i>.

Quantity[<i>unit</i>] assumes the <i>magnitude</i> of the specified <i>unit</i> to be 1.

---

QuantityArray
QuantityArray[<i>mags</i>,<i>unit</i>] represents an array of quantities with magnitudes <i>mags</i> and common <i>unit</i>.

QuantityArray[<i>mags</i>,{<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an array of lists of quantities with units {<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

QuantityArray[<i>quants</i>] converts an array of Quantity objects into a single QuantityArray object.

---

QuantityDistribution
QuantityDistribution[<i>dist</i>,<i>unit</i>] represents a distribution <i>dist</i> of quantities with unit specified by <i>unit</i>.

QuantityDistribution[<i>dist</i>,{<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a multivariate distribution with units {<i>unit</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>unit</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

---

QuantityForm
QuantityForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] prints <i>expr</i> with all Quantity expressions using the specified unit display form <i>form</i>.

QuantityForm[<i>expr</i>,{<i>forms</i>}] prints <i>expr</i> using the appropriate combination of the specified unit display forms <i>forms</i>.

---

QuantityMagnitude
QuantityMagnitude[<i>quantity</i>] gives the amount of the specified <i>quantity</i>.

QuantityMagnitude[<i>quantity</i>,<i>unit</i>] gives the value corresponding to <i>quantity</i> when converted to <i>unit</i>.

---

QuantityQ
QuantityQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a Quantity with valid arguments, and False otherwise.

QuantityQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>dims</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a Quantity with physical dimensions <i>dims</i>, and False otherwise.

---

QuantityUnit
QuantityUnit[<i>quantity</i>] returns the unit associated with the specified <i>quantity</i>.

---

QuantityVariable
QuantityVariable[<i>var</i>,"<i>pq</i>"] represents a variable with the label <i>var</i> and the corresponding physical quantity "<i>pq</i>".

QuantityVariable["<i>pq</i>"] represents the unlabeled physical quantity "<i>pq</i>".

---

QuantityVariableCanonicalUnit
QuantityVariableCanonicalUnit[<i>quantityvariable</i>] returns the canonical unit associated with the specified <i>quantityvariable</i>.

---

QuantityVariableDimensions
QuantityVariableDimensions[<i>quantityvariable</i>] returns a list of base dimensions associated with the specified <i>quantityvariable</i>.

---

QuantityVariableIdentifier
QuantityVariableIdentifier[<i>quantityvariable</i>] returns the identifier associated with the specified <i>quantityvariable</i>.

---

QuantityVariablePhysicalQuantity
QuantityVariablePhysicalQuantity[<i>var</i>] returns the physical quantity associated with the quantity variable <i>var</i>.

QuantityVariablePhysicalQuantity[<i>var</i>,<i>type</i>] returns the physical quantity using the format <i>type</i>.

---

Quartics
Quartics is an option for functions that involve solving algebraic equations that specifies whether explicit forms for solutions to quartic equations should be given.

---

QuartileDeviation
QuartileDeviation[<i>data</i>] gives the quartile deviation or semi-interquartile range of the elements in <i>data</i>. 

QuartileDeviation[<i>data</i>,{{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}}] uses the quantile definition specified by parameters <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>.

QuartileDeviation[<i>dist</i>] gives the quartile deviation or semi-interquartile range of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

Quartiles
Quartiles[<i>data</i>] gives the {q&amp;^<sub>1/4</sub>,q&amp;^<sub>2/4</sub>,q&amp;^<sub>3/4</sub>} quantile estimates of the elements in <i>data</i>.

Quartiles[<i>data</i>,{{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}}] uses the quantile definition specified by parameters <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>. 

Quartiles[<i>dist</i>] gives the {q<sub>1/4</sub>,q<sub>2/4</sub>,q<sub>3/4</sub>} quantiles of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

QuartileSkewness
QuartileSkewness[<i>data</i>] gives the coefficient of quartile skewness for the elements in <i>list</i>.

QuartileSkewness[<i>data</i>,{{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},{<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}}] uses the quantile definition specified by parameters <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, <i>c</i>, <i>d</i>.

QuartileSkewness[<i>dist</i>] gives the coefficient of quartile skewness for the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

Query
Query[<i>operator</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>operator</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a query that can be applied to a Dataset object, in which the successive <i>operator</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are applied at successively deeper levels. 

---

QuestionInterface
QuestionInterface[<i>type</i>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub><i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub><i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] defines an interface for a QuestionObject using the given <i>type</i> and properties <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with settings <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

QuestionObject
QuestionObject[<i>q</i>,<i>assess</i>] represents the question <i>q</i> and the corresponding assessment <i>assess</i>.

QuestionObject[<i>assess</i>] derives a question from the assessment.

---

QueueingNetworkProcess
QueueingNetworkProcess[γ,<i>r</i>,μ,<i>c</i>] represents an open (Jackson) queueing network process with arrival vector γ, routing probability matrix <i>r</i>, service vector μ, and service channel vector <i>c</i>. 

QueueingNetworkProcess[γ,<i>r</i>,μ,<i>c</i>,<i>k</i>] represents a closed (Gordon–Newell) queueing network process with <i>k</i> jobs in the system.

---

QueueingProcess
QueueingProcess[λ,μ] represents an M/M/1 queue with arrival rate λ and service rate μ.

QueueingProcess[λ,<i>sdist</i>] represents an M/G/1 queue with arrival rate λ and service distribution <i>sdist</i>.

QueueingProcess[<i>adist</i>,μ] represents a G/M/1 queue with arrival distribution <i>adist</i> and service rate μ.

QueueingProcess[<i>adist</i>,<i>sdist</i>] represents a G/G/1 queue with arrival distribution <i>adist</i> and service distribution <i>sdist</i>.

QueueingProcess[…,…,<i>c</i>] represents a queueing process with <i>c</i> service channels.

QueueingProcess[…,…,<i>c</i>,<i>k</i>] represents a queueing process with system capacity <i>k</i>.

QueueingProcess[…,…,<i>c</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>] represents a queueing process with initial state <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>.

---

Quiet
Quiet[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> "quietly", without actually outputting any messages generated.

Quiet[<i>expr</i>,{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>::<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] quietens only the specified messages during the evaluation of <i>expr</i>.

Quiet[<i>expr</i>,"<i>name</i>"] quietens only the named group of messages.

---

QuietEcho
QuietEcho[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> without letting Echo and related functions inside <i>expr</i> print any result.

---

Quit
Quit[] terminates a Wolfram Language kernel session. 

---

Quotient
Quotient[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the integer quotient of <i>m</i> and <i>n</i>. 

Quotient[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses an offset <i>d</i>. 

---

QuotientRemainder
QuotientRemainder[<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of the quotient and remainder from division of <i>m</i> by <i>n</i>.

---

RadialAxisPlot
RadialAxisPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] generates a radial axis plot where the <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are displayed on radial axes equally spaced around the origin.

RadialAxisPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots several datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> on the axes.

---

RadialGradientFilling
RadialGradientFilling[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] is a two-dimensional graphics directive specifying that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn using concentric circles of colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RadialGradientFilling[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] uses the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at radii <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RadialGradientFilling[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] radiates from the center point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

RadialGradientFilling[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>}}] radiates from the center point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} in concentric axis-aligned ellipsoids with semiaxes length proportional to <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RadialGradientFilling[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>col</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>}},<i>padding</i>] uses the specified padding when drawing beyond the boundary radii <i>r</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

RadialGradientImage
RadialGradientImage[<i>gcol</i>] returns an image with values radially changing from center to corners based on gradient color <i>gcol</i>.

RadialGradientImage[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>}<i>gcol</i>] returns an image where the gradient starts at <i>pos</i><sub>1</sub> and ends at <i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>.

RadialGradientImage[…,<i>size</i>] returns a radial gradient image of the specified <i>size</i>.

RadialGradientImage[…,<i>size</i>,<i>"type"</i>] gives an image converted to the specified type.

---

RadialityCentrality
RadialityCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of radiality centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

RadialityCentrality[<i>g</i>,"In"] gives a list of in-centralities for a directed graph <i>g</i>.

RadialityCentrality[<i>g</i>,"Out"] gives a list of out-centralities for a directed graph <i>g</i>.

RadialityCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Radon
Radon[<i>image</i>] gives an image representing the discrete Radon transform of <i>image</i>.

Radon[<i>image</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>}] specifies the width <i>w</i> and the height <i>h</i> of the resulting image.

Radon[<i>image</i>,{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>},{θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>}] computes the Radon transform only for angles from θ<sub>1</sub> to θ<sub>2</sub>.

---

RadonTransform
RadonTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},{<i>p</i>,ϕ}] gives the Radon transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

RamanujanTau
RamanujanTau[<i>n</i>] gives the Ramanujan τ function τ(n).

---

RamanujanTauL
RamanujanTauL[<i>s</i>] gives the Ramanujan tau Dirichlet L-function L(s).

---

RamanujanTauTheta
RamanujanTauTheta[<i>t</i>] gives the Ramanujan tau theta function θ(t).

---

RamanujanTauZ
RamanujanTauZ[<i>t</i>] gives the Ramanujan tau Z-function Z(t).

---

Ramp
Ramp[<i>x</i>] gives <i>x</i> if <i>x</i>≥0 and 0 otherwise.

---

Random
Random[] gives a uniformly distributed pseudorandom Real in the range 0 to 1. 

Random[<i>type</i>,<i>range</i>] gives a pseudorandom number of the specified type, lying in the specified range. Possible types are: Integer, Real and Complex. The default range is 0 to 1. You can give the range {<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>} explicitly; a range specification of <i>max</i> is equivalent to {0,<i>max</i>}. 

---

RandomArrayLayer
RandomArrayLayer[<i>dist</i>] represents a net layer that has no input and produces a random array from the univariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

RandomArrayLayer[<i>dfunc</i>] uses the univariate distribution <i>dfunc</i>[<i>input</i>] for each input value.

---

RandomChoice
RandomChoice[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a pseudorandom choice of one of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

RandomChoice[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom choices. 

RandomChoice[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of pseudorandom choices. 

RandomChoice[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a pseudorandom choice weighted by the <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

RandomChoice[<i>wlist</i><i>elist</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> weighted choices.

RandomChoice[<i>wlist</i><i>elist</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of weighted choices.

---

RandomColor
RandomColor[] gives a pseudorandom color directive in the RGBColor space.

RandomColor[<i>n</i>] gives <i>n</i> pseudorandom colors.

RandomColor[<i>model</i>] gives a color from the specified <i>model</i>.

RandomColor[<i>model</i>,<i>n</i>] gives <i>n</i> colors.

RandomColor[<i>model</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an array of colors.

---

RandomComplex
RandomComplex[] gives a pseudorandom complex number with real and imaginary parts in the range 0 to 1.

RandomComplex[{<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom complex number in the rectangle with corners given by the complex numbers <i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RandomComplex[<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] gives a pseudorandom complex number in the rectangle whose corners are the origin and <i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RandomComplex[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom complex numbers.

RandomComplex[<i>range</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of pseudorandom complex numbers.

---

RandomEntity
RandomEntity[<i>spec</i>] gives a pseudorandom entity with a type determined by the specification <i>spec</i>.

RandomEntity[<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom entities.

---

RandomFunction
RandomFunction[<i>proc</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a pseudorandom function from the process <i>proc</i> from <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

RandomFunction[<i>proc</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>dt</i>}] generates a pseudorandom function from <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> in steps of <i>dt</i>.

RandomFunction[<i>proc</i>,…, <i>n</i>] generates an ensemble of <i>n</i> pseudorandom functions. 

---

RandomGeneratorState
RandomGeneratorState[…] gives a representation of the internal state of a pseudorandom generator.

---

RandomGeoPosition
RandomGeoPosition[] gives a pseudorandom geo position uniformly distributed on the surface of the Earth.

RandomGeoPosition[{{<i>latmin</i>,<i>lonmin</i>},{<i>latmax</i>,<i>lonmax</i>}}] gives a pseudorandom geo position uniformly distributed in the given geo bounding box. 

RandomGeoPosition[<i>g</i>] gives a pseudorandom geo position uniformly distributed in the geo region <i>g</i>.

RandomGeoPosition[<i>g</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom geo positions uniformly distributed in the geo region <i>g</i>.

RandomGeoPosition[<i>g</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i><i>n</i><sub>1</sub></i>×<i> </i><i><i>n</i><sub>2</sub></i>×… pseudorandom geo position array.

---

RandomGraph
RandomGraph[{<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>}] gives a pseudorandom graph with <i>n</i> vertices and <i>m</i> edges.

RandomGraph[{<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>},<i>k</i>] gives a list of <i>k</i> pseudorandom graphs.

RandomGraph[<i>gdist</i>,…] samples from the random graph distribution <i>gdist</i>.

---

RandomImage
RandomImage[<i>max</i>] gives an image with pseudorandom pixel values in the range 0 to <i>max</i>.

RandomImage[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] generates pseudorandom pixel values in the range <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>.

RandomImage[<i>dist</i>] generates pixel values using a symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

RandomImage[…,<i>size</i>] generates a random image of the specified <i>size</i>.

RandomImage[…,<i>size</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives an image converted to the specified type.

---

RandomInstance
RandomInstance[<i>expr</i>] finds a random instance of an expression such as a geometric scene.

RandomInstance[<i>expr</i>] finds a random instance of an expression such as a geometric scene or biomolecular sequence.

RandomInstance[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] finds <i>n</i> instances.

---

RandomInteger
RandomInteger[{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom integer in the range {<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}. 

RandomInteger[<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] gives a pseudorandom integer in the range {0,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}. 

RandomInteger[] pseudorandomly gives 0 or 1. 

RandomInteger[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom integers. 

RandomInteger[<i>range</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of pseudorandom integers. 

---

RandomPermutation
RandomPermutation[<i>gr</i>] gives a pseudorandom permutation in the permutation group <i>gr</i>.

RandomPermutation[<i>gr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom permutations in the permutation group <i>gr</i>.

---

RandomPoint
RandomPoint[<i>reg</i>] gives a pseudorandom point uniformly distributed in the region <i>reg</i>.

RandomPoint[<i>reg</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom points uniformly distributed in the region <i>reg</i>.

RandomPoint[<i>reg</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i><i>n</i><sub>1</sub></i>×<i> </i><i><i>n</i><sub>2</sub></i>×… array of pseudorandom points.

RandomPoint[<i>reg</i>,…,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] restricts to the bounds [<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>]×⋯.

---

RandomPointConfiguration
RandomPointConfiguration[<i>pproc</i>,<i>reg</i>] generates a pseudorandom spatial point configuration from the spatial point process <i>pproc</i> in the observation region <i>reg</i>. 

RandomPointConfiguration[<i>pproc</i>,<i>reg</i>,<i> </i><i>n</i>] generates an ensemble of <i>n</i> spatial point configurations. 

---

RandomPolygon
RandomPolygon[<i>n</i>] gives a pseudorandom simple polygon with <i>n</i> vertex points.

RandomPolygon[<i>spec</i>] gives a pseudorandom polygon with the specified specification <i>spec</i>.

RandomPolygon[<i>spec</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a list of <i>k</i> pseudorandom polygons.

RandomPolygon[<i>d</i><i>spec</i>,…] gives a pseudorandom polygon in dimension <i>d</i>.

---

RandomPolyhedron
RandomPolyhedron[<i>spec</i>] gives a pseudorandom polyhedron with the specified specification <i>spec</i>.

RandomPolyhedron[<i>spec</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a list of <i>k</i> pseudorandom polyhedra.

---

RandomPrime
RandomPrime[{<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom prime number in the range <i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RandomPrime[<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] gives a pseudorandom prime number in the range 2 to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RandomPrime[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom primes.

---

RandomReal
RandomReal[] gives a pseudorandom real number in the range 0 to 1. 

RandomReal[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom real number in the range <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

RandomReal[<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] gives a pseudorandom real number in the range 0 to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RandomReal[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom reals. 

RandomReal[<i>range</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of pseudorandom reals. 

---

RandomSample
RandomSample[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] gives a pseudorandom sample of <i>n</i> of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RandomSample[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>] gives a pseudorandom sample of <i>n</i> of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> chosen using weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RandomSample[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a pseudorandom permutation of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

RandomSeeding
RandomSeeding is an option that specifies what seeding of pseudorandom generators should be done inside the operation of a function.

---

RandomTree
RandomTree[<i>n</i>] gives a pseudorandom tree with <i>n</i> nodes.

RandomTree[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives a list of <i>k</i> pseudorandom trees.

RandomTree[<i>n</i>,{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>k</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a <i>k</i><sub>1</sub>×<i> </i><i>k</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of trees.

---

RandomVariate
RandomVariate[<i>dist</i>] gives a pseudorandom variate from the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

RandomVariate[<i>dist</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom variates from the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

RandomVariate[<i>dist</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an <i><i>n</i><sub>1</sub></i>×<i> </i><i><i>n</i><sub>2</sub></i>×… array of pseudorandom variates from the symbolic distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

RandomWalkProcess
RandomWalkProcess[<i>p</i>] represents a random walk on a line with the probability of a positive unit step <i>p</i> and the probability of a negative unit step 1-<i>p</i>.

RandomWalkProcess[<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>] represents a random walk with the probability of a positive unit step <i>p</i>, the probability of a negative unit step <i>q</i>, and the probability of a zero step 1-<i>p</i>-<i>q</i>.

---

RandomWord
RandomWord[] gives a pseudorandom commonly used word.

RandomWord[<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom words.

RandomWord[<i>type</i>] gives a pseudorandom word of the specified <i>type</i>.

RandomWord[<i>type</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom words of the specified <i>type</i>.

---

Range
Range[<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] generates the list {1,2,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}. 

Range[<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>] generates the list {<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}. 

Range[<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>] uses step <i>di</i>.

---

RankedMax
RankedMax[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> largest element in <i>list</i>.

RankedMax[<i>list</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> smallest element in <i>list</i>.

---

RankedMin
RankedMin[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> smallest element in <i>list</i>.

RankedMin[<i>list</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> largest element in <i>list</i>.

---

RarerProbability
RarerProbability[<i>dist</i>,<i>example</i>] computes the probability for distribution <i>dist</i> to generate a sample that has a lower or equal PDF than <i>example</i>.

RarerProbability[<i>dist</i>,{<i>ex</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ex</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] computes the rarer probability for each <i>ex</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

Raster
Raster[{{<i>a</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…}] is a two-dimensional graphics primitive which represents a rectangular array of gray cells. 

Raster[{{{<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>11</sub>},…},…}] represents an array of RGB color cells. 

Raster[{{{<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>11</sub>,α<sub>11</sub>},…},…}] represents an array of color cells with opacity α<sub><i>ij</i></sub>. 

Raster[{{{<i>a</i><sub>11</sub>,α<sub>11</sub>},…},…}] represents an array of gray cells with the specified opacities. 

---

Raster3D
Raster3D[{{{<i>a</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…},…}] is a three-dimensional graphics primitive that represents a cubical array of gray cells. 

Raster3D[{{{{<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>11</sub>},…},…},…}] represents an array of RGB color cells. 

Raster3D[{{{{<i>r</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>11</sub>,α<sub>11</sub>},…},…},…}] represents an array of color cells with opacity α<sub><i>ij</i></sub>.

Raster3D[<i>array</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}}] represents a three-dimensional graphics primitive by giving the coordinates of opposite corners.

Raster3D[<i>array</i>,<i>coordinates</i>,{<i>a</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents a three-dimensional graphics primitive whose voxel values should be scaled so that <i>a</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> corresponds to 0 and <i>a</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> corresponds to 1.

---

RasterArray
RasterArray[{{<i>g</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>12</sub>,…},…}] is a two-dimensional graphics primitive that represents a rectangular array of cells colored according to the graphics directives <i>g</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>. 

---

Rasterize
Rasterize[<i>expr</i>] returns a rasterized version of the displayed form of <i>expr</i>.

Rasterize[<i>expr</i>,<i>elem</i>] gives the element <i>elem</i> associated with the rasterized form of <i>expr</i>. 

Rasterize[<i>expr</i>,{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the specified <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

RasterSize
RasterSize is an option for Rasterize and related functions that determines the absolute pixel size of the raster generated.

---

Rational
Rational is the head used for rational numbers. 

---

RationalExpressionQ
RationalExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a rational expression in <i>x</i>, and False otherwise.

RationalExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a rational expression in <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…, and False otherwise.

RationalExpressionQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…},<i>test</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is structurally a rational expression in <i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,… with coefficients satisfying <i>test</i>, and False otherwise.

---

Rationalize
Rationalize[<i>x</i>] converts an approximate number <i>x</i> to a nearby rational with small denominator. 

Rationalize[<i>x</i>,<i>dx</i>] yields the rational number with smallest denominator that lies within <i>dx</i> of <i>x</i>.

---

Rationals
Rationals represents the domain of rational numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈Rationals. 

---

Ratios
Ratios[<i>list</i>] gives the successive ratios of elements in <i>list</i>. 

Ratios[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> iterated ratios of <i>list</i>. 

Ratios[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the successive <i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub><sup>th</sup> ratios at level <i>k</i> in a nested list. 

---

RawMedium
RawMedium is an internal symbol.

---

RayleighDistribution
RayleighDistribution[σ] represents the Rayleigh distribution with scale parameter σ.

---

Re
Re[<i>z</i>] gives the real part of the complex number <i>z</i>. 

---

ReactionBalance
ReactionBalance[<i>rxn</i>] returns a version of the reaction <i>rxn</i> in which the stoichiometric coefficients for elements in the reactants and products are balanced.

---

ReactionBalancedQ
ReactionBalancedQ[<i>rxn</i>] returns True if the given chemical reaction is balanced, and False otherwise.

---

ReactionPDETerm
ReactionPDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>a</i>] represents a reaction term a <i>u</i> with reaction coefficient a and with model variables <i>vars</i>.

ReactionPDETerm[{<i>u</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}},<i>a</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

Read
Read[<i>stream</i>] reads one expression from an input stream and returns the expression. 

Read[<i>stream</i>,<i>type</i>] reads one object of the specified type. 

Read[<i>stream</i>,{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads a sequence of objects of the specified types. 

---

ReadByteArray
ReadByteArray[<i>src</i>] gives the contents of <i>src</i> as a ByteArray object.

ReadByteArray[<i>src</i>,<i>n</i>] reads the first <i>n</i> bytes from <i>src</i>.

ReadByteArray[<i>src</i>,<i>term</i>] reads until the termination condition <i>term</i> is satisfied.

---

ReadLine
ReadLine[stream] reads a line of text from a stream and returns it as a string.

ReadLine[proc] reads a line of text generated by an external process and returns it as a string.

---

ReadList
ReadList["<i>file</i>"] reads all the remaining expressions in a file and returns a list of them.
