ReadList["<i>file</i>",<i>type</i>] reads objects of the specified type from a file, until the end of the file is reached. The list of objects read is returned. 

ReadList["<i>file</i>",{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reads objects with a sequence of types, until the end of the file is reached. 

ReadList["<i>file</i>",<i>types</i>,<i>n</i>] reads only the first <i>n</i> objects of the specified types. 

---

ReadProtected
ReadProtected is an attribute that prevents values associated with a symbol from being seen. 

---

ReadString
ReadString["file"] reads the complete contents of a file and returns it as a string.

ReadString[stream] reads everything from a stream and returns it as a string.

ReadString[proc] reads everything generated by an external process and returns it as a string.

ReadString[src,term] reads until the terminator term is encountered.

---

Real
Real is the head used for real (floating‐point) numbers. 

---

RealAbs
RealAbs[<i>x</i>] gives the absolute value of the real number <i>x</i>. 

---

RealBlockDiagonalForm
RealBlockDiagonalForm is an option for SchurDecomposition and related functions which specifies whether 2×2 blocks of real values should be used on matrix diagonals in place of complex values.

---

RealExponent
RealExponent[<i>x</i>] gives log<sub>10</sub>(x).

RealExponent[<i>x</i>,<i>b</i>] gives log<sub>b</sub>(x).

---

Reals
Reals represents the domain of real numbers, as in <i>x</i>∈Reals. 

---

RealSign
RealSign[<i>x</i>] gives -1, 0 or 1 depending on whether <i>x</i> is negative, zero or positive. 

---

Reap
Reap[<i>expr</i>] gives the value of <i>expr</i> together with all expressions to which Sow has been applied during its evaluation. Expressions sown using Sow[<i>e</i>] or Sow[<i>e</i>,<i>tag</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] with different tags are given in different lists. 

Reap[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>] reaps only expressions sown with tags that match <i>patt</i>. 

Reap[<i>expr</i>,{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] puts expressions associated with each of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in a separate list. 

Reap[<i>expr</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>f</i>] returns {<i>expr</i>,{<i>f</i>[<i>tag</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>e</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>12</sub>,…}],…}}. 

---

RebuildPacletData
The experimental function RebuildPacletData is now obsolete and is superseded by PacletDataRebuild.

---

RecalibrationFunction
RecalibrationFunction is an option for Classify, Predict and related functions that specifies how to post-process model predictions.

---

RecognitionPrior
RecognitionPrior is an option for recognition functions that specifies the prior probability or class for recognition.

---

RecognitionThreshold
RecognitionThreshold is an option for ImageInstanceQ and related functions that specifies the minimum estimated probability at which recognition is considered acceptable. 

---

Record
Record represents a record in Read, Find, and related functions. 

---

RecordLists
RecordLists is an option for ReadList that specifies whether objects from separate records should be returned in separate sublists. 

---

RecordSeparators
RecordSeparators is an option for Read, Find, and related functions that specifies the list of strings to be taken as delimiters for records. 

---

Rectangle
Rectangle[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>},{<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] represents an axis-aligned filled rectangle from {<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>} to {<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}.

Rectangle[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>}] corresponds to a unit square with its bottom-left corner at {<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>}.

---

RectangleChart
RectangleChart[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a rectangle chart with bars of width <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and height <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

RectangleChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},…],…}] makes a rectangle chart with bar features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

RectangleChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a rectangle chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

RectangleChart3D
RectangleChart3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a 3D rectangle chart with bars of width <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, depth <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and height <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RectangleChart3D[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},…],…}] makes a 3D rectangle chart with bar features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

RectangleChart3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D rectangle chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

RectangularRepeatingElement
RectangularRepeatingElement[<i>elem</i>] represents a rectangular array of elements of type <i>spec</i> in an interpreter, API or form specification.

RectangularRepeatingElement[<i>elem</i>,{<i>maxrows</i>,<i>maxcolumns</i>}] represents a rectangular array of elements of maximum size <i>maxrows</i>×<i>maxcolums</i>.

RectangularRepeatingElement[<i>elem</i>,{{<i>minrows</i>,<i>maxrows</i>},{<i>mincolumns</i>,<i>maxcolumns</i>}}] represents a rectangular array of elements of dimensions between <i>minrows</i>×<i>mincolumns</i> and <i>maxrows</i>×<i>maxcolums</i>.

---

RecurrenceFilter
RecurrenceFilter[{α,β},<i>x</i>] filters <i>x</i> using a linear recurrence equation with coefficients α and β.

RecurrenceFilter[<i>tf</i>,<i>x</i>] uses a discrete-time filter defined by the TransferFunctionModel <i>tf</i>.

RecurrenceFilter[…,<i>x</i>,{<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>-1</sub>,…}] uses a specified list {<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>-1</sub>,…} as the initial condition.

RecurrenceFilter[…,<i>image</i>] filters <i>image</i>.

RecurrenceFilter[…,<i>sound</i>] filters sampled <i>sound</i> object.

---

RecurrenceTable
RecurrenceTable[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a list of values of <i>expr</i> for successive <i>n</i> based on solving the recurrence equations <i>eqns</i>.

RecurrenceTable[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>nspec</i>] generates a list of values of <i>expr</i> over the range of <i>n</i> values specified by <i>nspec</i>.

RecurrenceTable[<i>eqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] generates an array of values of <i>expr</i> for successive <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

---

Red
Red represents the color red in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Reduce
Reduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] reduces the statement <i>expr</i> by solving equations or inequalities for <i>vars</i> and eliminating quantifiers. 

Reduce[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] does the reduction over the domain <i>dom</i>. Common choices of <i>dom</i> are Reals, Integers, and Complexes. 

---

ReferenceLineStyle
ReferenceLineStyle is an option for QuantilePlot and similar functions that specifies the style used for the reference line. 

---

Refine
Refine[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>] gives the form of <i>expr</i> that would be obtained if symbols in it were replaced by explicit numerical expressions satisfying the assumptions <i>assum</i>. 

Refine[<i>expr</i>] uses default assumptions specified by any enclosing Assuming constructs. 

---

ReflectionMatrix
ReflectionMatrix[<i>v</i>] gives the matrix that represents reflection of points in a mirror normal to the vector <i>v</i>.

---

ReflectionTransform
ReflectionTransform[<i>v</i>] gives a TransformationFunction that represents a reflection in a mirror through the origin, normal to the vector <i>v</i>.

ReflectionTransform[<i>v</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a reflection in a mirror through the point <i>p</i>, normal to the vector <i>v</i>.

---

Refresh
Refresh[<i>expr</i>,<i>interval</i>,<i>opts</i>] represents an object whose value should be refreshed at times specified by the options <i>opts</i>.

---

RefreshRate
RefreshRate is an option to Animate and related functions which specifies the refresh rate for frames in animations.

---

Region
Region[<i>reg</i>] represents a geometric region.

Region[<i>reg</i>,<i>options</i>] gives a region that uses the specified options.

---

RegionBinarize
RegionBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>,<i>d</i>] gives a binary version of <i>image</i> that includes the foreground pixels of <i>marker</i> and also connected regions whose pixel values are within a distance <i>d</i>.

RegionBinarize[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>,<i>d</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] grows regions in <i>marker</i> by adding pixels whose average intensity is also constrained within an interval {<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}.

---

RegionBoundary
RegionBoundary[<i>reg</i>] represents the boundary of the region <i>reg</i>.

---

RegionBoundaryStyle
RegionBoundaryStyle is an option for plotting functions that specifies the boundary style for the region over which the plot is being drawn.

---

RegionBounds
RegionBounds[<i>reg</i>] gives the bounds for the region <i>reg</i>.

RegionBounds[<i>reg</i>,"<i>type</i>"] gives region bounds of the specified "<i>type</i>". 

---

RegionCentroid
RegionCentroid[<i>reg</i>] gives the centroid of the region <i>reg</i>.

---

RegionCongruent
RegionCongruent[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> are congruent.

---

RegionConvert
RegionConvert[<i>reg</i>,<i>form</i>] converts the region representation <i>reg</i> to the specified form.

---

RegionDifference
RegionDifference[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the difference of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

RegionDilation
RegionDilation[<i>reg</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the dilation of the region <i>reg</i> by a disk of radius <i>r</i> centered at the origin.

RegionDilation[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the dilation of the region <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> by the region <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

RegionDilation[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the dilation of <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> scaled by a factor <i>u</i> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> scaled by a factor <i>v</i>.

---

RegionDimension
RegionDimension[<i>reg</i>] gives the geometric dimension of the region <i>reg</i>. 

---

RegionDisjoint
RegionDisjoint[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> are disjoint. 

RegionDisjoint[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>3</sub>,…] returns True if the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>3</sub>, … are pairwise disjoint.

---

RegionDistance
RegionDistance[<i>reg</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the minimum distance from the point <i>p</i> to the region <i>reg</i>.

RegionDistance[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the minimum distance between points in the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

RegionDistance[<i>reg</i>] gives a RegionDistanceFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different points.

---

RegionDistanceFunction
RegionDistanceFunction[<i>reg</i>,…]  represents a function whose values give the distance from a point to the region <i>reg</i>.

---

RegionEmbeddingDimension
RegionEmbeddingDimension[<i>reg</i>] gives the dimension of the space in which the region <i>reg</i> is embedded. 

---

RegionEqual
RegionEqual[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> are equal.

RegionEqual[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>3</sub>,…] returns True if the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>3</sub>, … are all equal.

---

RegionErosion
RegionErosion[<i>reg</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the erosion of the region <i>reg</i> by a disk of radius <i>r</i> centered at the origin.

RegionErosion[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the erosion of the region <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> by the region <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

RegionErosion[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the erosion of <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> scaled by a factor <i>u</i> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> scaled by a factor <i>v</i>.

---

RegionFillingStyle
RegionFillingStyle is an option for plotting functions that specifies the style for the filled region over which the plot is being drawn.

---

RegionFit
RegionFit[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>"model"</i>] finds a geometric region "<i>model</i>" that best fits the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,….

RegionFit[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>model</i>","<i>prop</i>"] specifies what fit property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

RegionFunction
RegionFunction is an option for plotting functions that specifies the region to include in the plot drawn. 

---

RegionImage
RegionImage[<i>reg</i>] returns a rasterized grayscale 2D or 3D image of <i>reg</i>.

RegionImage[<i>reg</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] restricts to the bounds [x<sub>min</sub>,x<sub>max</sub>]×⋯.

---

RegionIntersection
RegionIntersection[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the intersection of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

RegionMeasure
RegionMeasure[<i>reg</i>] gives the measure of the region <i>reg</i>.

RegionMeasure[<i>reg</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the <i>d</i>-dimensional measure of the region <i>reg</i>.

RegionMeasure[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>t</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}}] gives the <i>k</i>-measure of the parametric formula whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>t</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

RegionMeasure[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>t</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

RegionMember
RegionMember[<i>reg</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives True if the numeric point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} is a member of the constant region <i>reg</i> and False otherwise.

RegionMember[<i>reg</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives conditions for the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} to be a member of <i>reg</i>.

RegionMember[<i>reg</i>] returns a RegionMemberFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different points. 

---

RegionMemberFunction
RegionMemberFunction[<i>reg</i>,…]  represents a function whose values give whether a point is in a region <i>reg</i> or not.

---

RegionMoment
RegionMoment[<i>reg</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] computes the polynomial moment ∫<sub>x∈reg</sub>x<sub>1</sub><sup>i<sub>1</sub></sup> x<sub>2</sub><sup>i<sub>2</sub></sup> ⋯ x<sub>n</sub><sup>i<sub>n</sub></sup> for the region <i>reg</i>.

---

RegionNearest
RegionNearest[<i>reg</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a point in the region <i>reg</i> that is nearest the point <i>p</i>. 

RegionNearest[<i>reg</i>] gives a RegionNearestFunction[…] that can be repeatedly applied to points. 

---

RegionNearestFunction
RegionNearestFunction[<i>reg</i>,…]  represents a function whose values give the nearest point in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

RegionPlot
RegionPlot[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a plot showing the region in which <i>pred</i> is True. 

RegionPlot[{<i>pred</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots several regions corresponding to the <i>pred</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RegionPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>pred</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…},…] plots <i>pred</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

RegionPlot3D
RegionPlot3D[<i>pred</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] makes a plot showing the three-dimensional region in which <i>pred</i> is True. 

RegionPlot3D[{<i>pred</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pred</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots several regions corresponding to the <i>pred</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

RegionProduct
RegionProduct[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] represents the Cartesian product of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

RegionProduct[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the Cartesian product of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

RegionQ
RegionQ[<i>reg</i>] gives True if <i>reg</i> is a valid region and False otherwise. 

---

RegionResize
RegionResize[<i>reg</i>,<i>l</i>] resize the region <i>reg</i> to have the first side length <i>l</i> preserving side length ratios. 

RegionResize[<i>reg</i>,{<i>l</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] resize into a box with maximum side length <i>l</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> preserving side length ratios.

RegionResize[<i>reg</i>,{<i>l</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>l</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] resize into a box with side lengths <i>l</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

RegionResize[<i>reg</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1,min</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1,max</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2,min</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2,max</sub>},…}] resize into a box with corners {<i>x</i><sub>1,min</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2,min</sub>,…} and {<i>x</i><sub>1,max</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2,max</sub>,…}.

---

RegionSimilar
RegionSimilar[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> are similar.

---

RegionSize
RegionSize is an option used by Printout3D to specify the overall size of an object to print for a region.

---

RegionSymmetricDifference
RegionSymmetricDifference[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the symmetric difference of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

RegionUnion
RegionUnion[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the union of the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

RegionWithin
RegionWithin[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] returns True if <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub> is contained within <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>.

---

RegisterExternalEvaluator
RegisterExternalEvaluator[<i>sys</i>,<i>evaluator</i>] registers the <i>evaluator</i> for use as an external evaluator with the language or system <i>sys</i>.

RegisterExternalEvaluator[<i>sys</i>,<i>evaluator</i>,<i>name</i>] registers the <i>evaluator</i> using the assigned name <i>name</i>.

---

RegularExpression
RegularExpression["<i>regex</i>"] represents the generalized regular expression specified by the string "<i>regex</i>". 

---

Regularization
Regularization is an option for Sum and Product that specifies what type of regularization to use.

---

RegularlySampledQ
RegularlySampledQ[<i>tseries</i>] gives True if <i>tseries</i> is a regular time series, and False otherwise.

---

RegularPolygon
RegularPolygon[<i>n</i>] gives the regular polygon with <i>n</i> vertices equally spaced around the unit circle.

RegularPolygon[<i>r</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the regular polygon of radius <i>r</i>.

RegularPolygon[{<i>r</i>,θ},<i>n</i>] starts at angle θ with respect to the x axis.

RegularPolygon[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},<i>rspec</i>,<i>n</i>] centers the polygon at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

---

ReIm
ReIm[<i>z</i>] gives the list {Re[<i>z</i>],Im[<i>z</i>]} of the number <i>z</i>.

---

ReImLabels
ReImLabels is an option for ReImPlot that specifies labels to use for the real and imaginary components.

---

ReImPlot
ReImPlot[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of Re[<i>f</i>] and Im[<i>f</i>] as functions of <i>x</i>∈ from <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

ReImPlot[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several functions.

ReImPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…},…] plots <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

ReImPlot[…,{<i>x</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variable <i>x</i> to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

---

ReImStyle
ReImStyle is an option for ReImPlot that specifies styles to use for the real and imaginary components.

---

Reinstall
Reinstall[<i>link</i>] un-installs the specified external package and installs it again.

---

RelationalDatabase
RelationalDatabase[…] represents schema information about a relational database.

RelationalDatabase[<i>db</i>] gives the complete schema of the database referenced by <i>db</i>.

RelationalDatabase[{<i>table</i><sub>1</sub> <i>table</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>db</i>] gives schema information related to the tables <i>table</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

RelationGraph
RelationGraph[<i>f</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges from <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> whenever <i>f</i>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>] is True.

RelationGraph[<i>f</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> and edges from <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> whenever <i>f</i>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>] is True.

---

ReleaseHold
ReleaseHold[<i>expr</i>] removes Hold, HoldForm, HoldPattern, HoldComplete and HoldCompleteForm in <i>expr</i>. 

---

ReliabilityDistribution
ReliabilityDistribution[<i>bexpr</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents the reliability distribution for a system with components <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> having reliability distribution <i>dist</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, where the whole system is working when the Boolean expression <i>bexpr</i> is True, and component <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is working when <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is True.

---

ReliefImage
ReliefImage[<i>array</i>] generates a relief image of an array of height values. 

---

ReliefPlot
ReliefPlot[<i>array</i>] generates a relief plot of an array of height values. 

---

RemoteAuthorizationCaching
RemoteAuthorizationCaching is an option for RemoteConnect and related functions that determines whether caching of authorization information on remote hosts should be used.

---

RemoteBatchJobAbort
RemoteBatchJobAbort[<i>job</i>] aborts a remote batch job.

---

RemoteBatchJobObject
RemoteBatchJobObject[…] represents a remote batch job submitted by RemoteBatchSubmit or RemoteBatchMapSubmit.

---

RemoteBatchJobs
RemoteBatchJobs[<i>env</i>] gives a list of RemoteBatchJobObject expressions representing batch jobs submitted using <i>env</i>.

RemoteBatchJobs[<i>env</i>,<i>type</i>] returns only jobs of given <i>type</i>.

RemoteBatchJobs[] gives a list of jobs submitted using $DefaultRemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment.

---

RemoteBatchMapSubmit
RemoteBatchMapSubmit[<i>env</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>] submits an array batch job in which <i>f</i> is applied to each element on the first level of <i>list</i>, using the remote batch submission environment <i>env</i>.

RemoteBatchMapSubmit[<i>f</i>,<i>list</i>] submits an array job using $DefaultRemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment.

---

RemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment
RemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment["<i>provider</i>",<i>assoc</i>] represents a remote batch job submission environment for <i>provider</i> with properties <i>assoc</i>.

RemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment["<i>provider</i>"] represents a submission environment for <i>provider</i> with default optional properties.

---

RemoteBatchSubmit
RemoteBatchSubmit[<i>env</i>,<i>expr</i>] submits <i>expr</i> for evaluation using the remote batch submission environment <i>env</i>.

RemoteBatchSubmit[<i>expr</i>] submits <i>expr</i> for evaluation using $DefaultRemoteBatchSubmissionEnvironment.

---

RemoteConnect
RemoteConnect["<i>host</i>"] connects to the specified remote host.

RemoteConnect[IPAddress["<i>address</i>"]] connects to the machine with the specified IP address.

RemoteConnect["<i>host</i>",<i>username</i>] connects using the specified username for the remote host.

RemoteConnect["<i>host</i>",<i>username</i>,<i>password</i>] connects using the specified username and password.

---

RemoteConnectionObject
RemoteConnectionObject[…] is an object that represents a remote connection.

---

RemoteEvaluate
RemoteEvaluate[<i>expr</i>] gives the result of evaluating <i>expr</i> using your current default remote Wolfram Language kernel.

RemoteEvaluate[<i>ker, expr</i>] gives the result of evaluating <i>expr</i> using the kernel specified by <i>ker</i>.

RemoteEvaluate[{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] gives a list of the results of evaluating <i>expr</i> using each of the kernels <i>ker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RemoteEvaluate[<i>ker</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the result produced before returning it.

---

RemoteFile
RemoteFile[URL["<i>uri</i>"]] is a symbolic representation of a file on a remote machine.

---

RemoteInputFiles
RemoteInputFiles is an option for RemoteBatchSubmit and RemoteBatchMapSubmit that specifies local files to be uploaded and made available within remote jobs.

---

RemoteKernelObject
RemoteKernelObject[<i>spec</i>] specifies a remote kernel that can be used for RemoteEvaluate or LaunchKernels.

---

RemoteProviderSettings
RemoteProviderSettings is an option for RemoteBatchSubmit and RemoteBatchMapSubmit that specifies provider-specific settings for a batch job.

---

RemoteRun
RemoteRun["<i>host</i>","<i>command</i>"] runs the specified operating system command on the remote host, returning the exit code obtained.

RemoteRun[IPAddress["<i>address</i>"],"<i>command</i>"] runs the command on the machine with the specified IP address.

RemoteRun[<i>obj</i>,"<i>command</i>"] run the command on the remote host specified by the RemoteConnectionObject <i>obj</i>.

---

RemoteRunProcess
RemoteRunProcess["<i>host</i>","<i>command</i>"] runs the specified system command on the remote host, returning information on the outcome.

RemoteRunProcess[IPAddress["<i>address</i>"],"<i>command</i>"] runs the command on the machine with the specified IP address.

RemoteRunProcess[<i>obj</i>,"<i>command</i>"] run the command on the remote host specified by the RemoteConnectionObject <i>obj</i>.

RemoteRunProcess["<i>host</i>",{"<i>command</i>",<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] runs the specified command, with command-line arguments <i>arg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RemoteRunProcess["<i>host</i>", <i>command</i>,<i>"prop"</i>] returns only the specified property.

RemoteRunProcess["<i>host</i>", <i>command</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>input</i>] feeds the specified initial input to the command.

---

RemovalConditions
RemovalConditions is an option for AttachCell that specifies conditions under which to remove the attached cell.

---

Remove
Remove[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] removes the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> completely, so that their names are no longer recognized by the Wolfram Language.

Remove[<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…] removes all symbols whose names textually match any of the arbitrary string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Remove[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes any symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

RemoveAlphaChannel
RemoveAlphaChannel[<i>color</i>] removes opacity from <i>color</i>.

RemoveAlphaChannel[<i>color</i>,<i>bg</i>] removes opacity by blending <i>color</i> with the background color <i>bg</i>.

RemoveAlphaChannel[<i>image</i>,…] removes opacity from all pixels in <i>image</i>.

RemoveAlphaChannel[<i>video</i>,…] removes opacity from frames of <i>video</i>.

---

RemoveAsynchronousTask
RemoveAsynchronousTask[<i>asyncTask</i>] stops asynchronous evaluations and removes <i>asyncTask</i> from the system.

---

RemoveAudioStream
RemoveAudioStream[] deletes all AudioStream objects.

RemoveAudioStream[<i>stream</i>] deletes the AudioStream object <i>stream</i>.

RemoveAudioStream[<i>audio</i>] deletes all the AudioStream objects stemming from <i>audio</i>.

---

RemoveBackground
RemoveBackground[<i>image</i>] returns an image with an alpha channel where the background is transparent. 

RemoveBackground[<i>image</i>,<i>model</i>] uses foreground or background <i>model</i> specification.

RemoveBackground[<i>video</i>,…] performs background removal on frames of <i>video</i>.

---

RemoveChannelListener
RemoveChannelListener[<i>obj</i>] removes <i>obj</i> from the list of currently active channel listeners.

RemoveChannelListener[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes all the <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RemoveChannelListener[] removes all currently active channel listeners.

---

RemoveChannelSubscribers
RemoveChannelSubscribers[<i>channel</i>] removes all subscribers from the specified channel.

RemoveChannelSubscribers[<i>channel</i>,<i>user</i>] removes the specified user from the subscriber list.

RemoveChannelSubscribers[<i>channel</i>,{<i>user</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>user</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes the specified subscribers <i>user</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Removed
Removed[<i>string</i>] is printed to indicate a symbol that has been removed.

---

RemoveDiacritics
RemoveDiacritics[<i>string</i>] replaces characters in <i>string</i> that have diacritics by their base ASCII characters, when possible.

---

RemoveInputStreamMethod
RemoveInputStreamMethod["<i>name</i>"] removes a custom input stream method.

---

RemoveOutputStreamMethod
RemoveOutputStreamMethod["<i>name</i>"] removes a custom output stream method.

---

RemoveProperty
RemoveProperty[{<i>obj</i>,<i>itemspec</i>}] removes all properties associated with <i>itemspec</i> in <i>obj</i>.

RemoveProperty[{<i>obj</i>,<i>itemspec</i>},<i>name</i>] removes the property <i>name</i> associated with <i>itemspec</i> in <i>obj</i>.

---

RemoveUsers
RemoveUsers[<i>group</i>,{<i>user</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] removes the users <i>user</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the permissions group <i>group</i>.

---

RemoveVideoStream
RemoveVideoStream[] deletes all VideoStream objects.

RemoveVideoStream[<i>stream</i>] deletes the VideoStream object <i>stream</i>.

---

RenameDirectory
RenameDirectory[<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>] renames the directory <i>dir</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

RenameFile
RenameFile[<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>] renames <i>file</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>file</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

RenderAll
RenderAll is an option for Graphics3D that specifies whether or not PostScript should be generated for <i>all</i> polygons. 

---

RenderingOptions
RenderingOptions is an option for Style, Cell and related constructs that specifies options related to 3D rendering.

---

RenewalProcess
RenewalProcess[<i>rdist</i>] represents a renewal process with interarrival times distributed according to <i>rdist</i>.

---

RenkoChart
RenkoChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a Renko chart with prices <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at date <i>date</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

RenkoChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i>}] makes a Renko chart of closing prices for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the date range <i>daterange</i>.

RenkoChart[{…},<i>s</i>] makes a Renko chart with brick height of fraction <i>s</i> of the average price.

---

RepairMesh
RepairMesh[<i>mreg</i>] repairs defects in the mesh region <i>mreg</i>.

RepairMesh[<i>mreg</i>,{<i>def</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] repairs only the specified defects <i>def</i><sub>1</sub>,….

---

Repeated
<i>p</i>.. or Repeated[<i>p</i>] is a pattern object that represents a sequence of one or more expressions, each matching <i>p</i>. 

Repeated[<i>p</i>,<i>max</i>] represents from 1 to <i>max</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

Repeated[<i>p</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

Repeated[<i>p</i>,{<i>n</i>}] represents exactly <i>n</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

---

RepeatedNull
<i>p</i>... or RepeatedNull[<i>p</i>] is a pattern object that represents a sequence of zero or more expressions, each matching <i>p</i>. 

RepeatedNull[<i>p</i>,<i>max</i>] represents from 0 to <i>max</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

RepeatedNull[<i>p</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

RepeatedNull[<i>p</i>,{<i>n</i>}] represents exactly <i>n</i> expressions matching <i>p</i>.

---

RepeatedTiming
RepeatedTiming[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> repeatedly and returns a list of the average time in seconds used, together with the result obtained.

RepeatedTiming[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>] does repeated evaluation for at least <i>t</i> seconds. 

---

RepeatingElement
RepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>] represents an arbitrarily repeated type of element in an interpreter, API or form specification.

RepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,<i>max</i>] represents an element that can appear at most <i>max</i> times.

RepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents an element that can appear between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i> times.

RepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,{<i>n</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}}] represents an element that initially appears <i>n</i> times in a form.

RepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,{{<i>i</i>,<i>n</i>},{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}}] represents an element where <i>i</i> takes successive values.

---

Replace
Replace[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>] applies a rule or list of rules in an attempt to transform the entire expression <i>expr</i>. 

Replace[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies rules to parts of <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Replace[<i>rules</i>] represents an operator form of Replace that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReplaceAll
<i>expr</i>/.<i>rules</i> or ReplaceAll[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>] applies a rule or list of rules in an attempt to transform each subpart of an expression <i>expr</i>. 

ReplaceAll[<i>rules</i>] represents an operator form of ReplaceAll that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReplaceImageValue
ReplaceImageValue[<i>image</i>,<i>pos</i><i>val</i>] changes the pixel values at position <i>pos</i> in <i>image</i> to <i>val</i>.

ReplaceImageValue[<i>image</i>,<i>pos</i><i>val</i>,"<i>type</i>"] assumes <i>val</i> to be of the specified type.

---

ReplaceList
ReplaceList[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>] attempts to transform the entire expression <i>expr</i> by applying a rule or list of rules in all possible ways, and returns a list of the results obtained. 

ReplaceList[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of at most <i>n</i> results. 

ReplaceList[<i>rules</i>] is an operator form of ReplaceList that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReplacePart
ReplacePart[<i>expr</i>,<i>i</i><i>new</i>] yields an expression in which the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> part of <i>expr</i> is replaced by <i>new</i>. 

ReplacePart[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub><i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub><i>new</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces parts at positions <i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> by <i>new</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>. 

ReplacePart[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}<i>new</i>] replaces the part at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}. 

ReplacePart[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…}<i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] replaces parts at positions {<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,…} by <i>new</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>. 

ReplacePart[<i>expr</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…}<i>new</i>] replaces all parts at positions {<i>i</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,…} by <i>new</i>. 

ReplacePart[<i>inew</i>] represents an operator form of ReplacePart that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReplacePixelValue
ReplacePixelValue[<i>image</i>,<i>ppos</i><i>val</i>] changes the pixel values at pixel position <i>ppos</i> in <i>image</i> to <i>val</i>.

ReplacePixelValue[<i>image</i>,<i>ppos</i><i>val</i>,"<i>type</i>"] assumes <i>val</i> to be of the specified type.

---

ReplaceRepeated
<i>expr</i>//.<i>rules</i> repeatedly performs replacements until <i>expr</i> no longer changes. 

ReplaceRepeated[<i>rules</i>] represents an operator form of ReplaceRepeated that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReplicateLayer
ReplicateLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a net layer that takes an input of dimensions {<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…} and replicates it <i>n</i> times to produce an output of dimensions {<i>n</i>,<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

ReplicateLayer[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>}] represents a net layer that takes an input of dimensions {<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…} and replicates it to produce an output of dimensions {<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>,<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

ReplicateLayer[<i>dims</i>,<i>m</i>] replicates so that <i>dims</i> appears at position <i>m</i> in the list of output dimensions. 

---

RequiredPhysicalQuantities
RequiredPhysicalQuantities is an option for FormulaLookup that specifies physical quantities that must be used by the formulas returned.

---

Resampling
Resampling is an option that specifies the method to be used for resampling images or arrays.

---

ResamplingAlgorithmData
ResamplingAlgorithmData[<i>rs</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the specified property "<i>prop</i>" for the resampling <i>rs</i>.

---

ResamplingMethod
ResamplingMethod is an option for functions such as TemporalData and MovingMap that specifies how values in between given times should be computed.

---

Rescale
Rescale[<i>x</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] gives <i>x</i> rescaled to run from 0 to 1 over the range <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>. 

Rescale[<i>x</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives <i>x</i> rescaled to run from <i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> over the range <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>. 

Rescale[<i>list</i>] rescales each element of <i>list</i> to run from 0 to 1 over the range Min[<i>list</i>] to Max[<i>list</i>]. 

---

RescalingTransform
RescalingTransform[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…},{{<i>xp</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>xp</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] gives a TransformationFunction that rescales the region with coordinate ranges <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, etc. to the region with coordinate ranges <i>xp</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>xp</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, etc.

RescalingTransform[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] gives a TransformationFunction that rescales to the unit square, cube, etc.

---

ResetDirectory
ResetDirectory[] resets the current working directory to its previous value. 

---

ResetScheduledTask
ResetScheduledTask[<i>obj</i>,<i>timespec</i>]  resets the timing for a scheduled task to <i>timespec</i>.

ResetScheduledTask[<i>obj</i>,<i>timespec</i>,<i>offset</i>] resets the time offset for a scheduled task to <i>offset</i>.

---

ReshapeLayer
ReshapeLayer[<i>spec</i>] represents a net layer that reshapes the input array according to the specification <i>spec</i>.

---

Residue
Residue[<i>expr</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>}] finds the residue of <i>expr</i> at the point <i>z</i>=<i>z</i><sub>0</sub>. 

---

ResizeLayer
ResizeLayer[{<i>d</i>}] represents a layer performing one-dimensional resizing of a two-dimensional array.

ResizeLayer[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>d</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a layer performing <i>n</i>-dimensional resizing of a (<i>n</i>+1)-dimensional array.

---

Resolve
Resolve[<i>expr</i>] attempts to resolve <i>expr</i> into a form that eliminates ForAll and Exists quantifiers. 

Resolve[<i>expr</i>,<i>dom</i>] works over the domain <i>dom</i>. Common choices of <i>dom</i> are Complexes, Reals, and Booleans. 

---

ResolveContextAliases
ResolveContextAliases is an option for Names, Contexts and related functions to control whether to resolve aliases when searching for symbols that match a string pattern.

---

ResourceData
ResourceData[<i>resource</i>] gives the primary content of the specified resource.

ResourceData[<i>resource</i>,<i>elem</i>] gives element <i>elem</i> of the content of the resource. 

---

ResourceFunction
ResourceFunction[<i>resource</i>] represents the function associated with the specified resource.

ResourceFunction[<i>resource</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the specified property of the resource.

---

ResourceObject
ResourceObject["<i>name</i>"] represents a resource with the specified name.

ResourceObject["<i>uuid</i>"] represents a resource with the specified UUID.

ResourceObject[<i>loc</i>] imports a resource from the specified location.

ResourceObject[<i>assoc</i>] gives a resource with content and metadata specified by the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

ResourceRegister
ResourceRegister[<i>resource</i>] creates a persistent cache of a resource object that can be referenced by name.

ResourceRegister[<i>resource, loc</i>] stores the resource in persistence location <i>loc</i>.

ResourceRegister[<i>resource</i><i>,</i><i> </i><i>{</i><i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] stores the resource in multiple persistence locations.

---

ResourceRemove
ResourceRemove[<i>resource</i>] removes the specified resource from the system on which it is run.

---

ResourceSearch
ResourceSearch[<i>form</i>] gives a dataset of resources that contain text matching <i>form</i>.

ResourceSearch[<i>form</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the property <i>prop</i> of the search results.

---

ResourceSubmit
ResourceSubmit[<i>resource</i>] submits the specified resource object to be reviewed for publication.

ResourceSubmit[<i>new</i>,<i>old</i>] submits the resource <i>new</i> as the updated version of the resource <i>old</i>.

---

ResourceUpdate
ResourceUpdate[<i>resource</i>] updates to the latest version of the specified resource object.

ResourceUpdate["<i>name</i>"] updates the resource with the specified name.

---

ResourceVersion
ResourceVersion is an option for ResourceObject, ResourceFunction and related functions for specifying the version of a resource.

---

ResponseForm
ResponseForm[<i>expr</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] represents a response record to be given in a specified format when requested during the execution of a function specified by APIFunction, FormFunction, etc.

ResponseForm[<i>expr</i>,"<i>fmt</i>",{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] includes only the response record elements <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Rest
Rest[<i>expr</i>] gives <i>expr</i> with the first element removed. 

---

RestartInterval
RestartInterval is an option controlling the restart behavior of functions such as ContinuousTask.

---

Restricted
Restricted[<i>form</i>,<i>cond</i>,…] represents a form for Interpreter and related functions restricted according to the conditions <i>cond</i>.

---

Resultant
Resultant[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>] computes the resultant of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> with respect to the variable <i>var</i>. 

Resultant[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] computes the resultant modulo the prime <i>p</i>. 

---

ResumePacket
ResumePacket[] is a WSTP packet used for synchronization with the Wolfram Language kernel.

---

Return
Return[<i>expr</i>] returns the value <i>expr</i> from a function. 

Return[] returns the value Null. 

---

ReturnExpressionPacket
ReturnExpressionPacket[<i>expr</i>] is a WSTP packet that contains the expression <i>expr</i>, the result of an EnterExpressionPacket evaluation.

---

ReturnPacket
ReturnPacket[<i>expr</i>] is a WSTP packet that contains the expression <i>expr</i>, the result of an EvaluatePacket evaluation.

---

ReturnReceiptFunction
ReturnReceiptFunction is an option for MailReceiverFunction that specifies what function to apply if a return receipt is requested for mail received by a MailReceiverFunction.

---

ReturnTextPacket
ReturnTextPacket[<i>string</i>] is a WSTP packet containing <i>string</i>, the result of an EnterTextPacket evaluation.

---

Reverse
Reverse[<i>expr</i>] reverses the order of the elements in <i>expr</i>. 

Reverse[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] reverses elements at level <i>n</i> in <i>expr</i>.

Reverse[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reverses elements at levels <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>, … in <i>expr</i>.

---

ReverseApplied
ReverseApplied[<i>f</i>] represents a form of <i>f</i> that takes arguments in reverse order so that ReverseApplied[<i>f</i>][<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>] is equivalent to <i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>].

ReverseApplied[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents a form of <i>f</i> that reverses the first <i>n</i> arguments before evaluation.

---

ReverseElement
ReverseElement[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x∋y∋….

---

ReverseEquilibrium
ReverseEquilibrium[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇋y⇋….

---

ReverseGraph
ReverseGraph[<i>g</i>] gives the reverse graph of the directed graph <i>g</i>.

ReverseGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

ReverseSort
ReverseSort[<i>list</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> into reverse canonical order. 

ReverseSort[<i>list</i>,<i>p</i>] sorts using the ordering function <i>p</i>. 

---

ReverseSortBy
ReverseSortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> using the reverse canonical order defined by applying <i>f</i> to each of them.

ReverseSortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>p</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> using the function <i>p</i> to compare pairs of results of applying <i>f</i> to each element.

ReverseSortBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of ReverseSortBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

ReverseUpEquilibrium
ReverseUpEquilibrium[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥯y⥯….

---

RevolutionAxis
RevolutionAxis is an option for RevolutionPlot3D which specifies the revolution axis around which the curve should be rotated. 

---

RevolutionPlot3D
RevolutionPlot3D[<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of the surface of revolution with height <i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub> at radius <i>t</i>.

RevolutionPlot3D[<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] takes the azimuthal angle θ to vary between θ<sub><i>min</i></sub> and θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RevolutionPlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a plot of the surface obtained by rotating the parametric curve with <i>x</i>, <i>z</i> coordinates {<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>} around the <i>z</i> axis.

RevolutionPlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] takes the azimuthal angle θ to vary from θ<sub><i>min</i></sub> to θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

RevolutionPlot3D[{<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] plots the surface obtained by rotating the parametric curve with <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, <i>z</i> coordinates {<i>f</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>f</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>}.

---

RGBColor
RGBColor[<i>r</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>b</i>] represents a color in the RGB color space, using red, blue and green components. 

RGBColor[<i>r</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

RGBColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from a hex color or an HTML color name.

RGBColor[<i>color</i>] returns the RGB representation of <i>color</i>.

---

RiceDistribution
RiceDistribution[α,β] represents a Rice distribution with shape parameters α and β.

RiceDistribution[<i>m</i>,α,β] represents a Norton–Rice distribution with parameters <i>m</i>, α, and β.

---

RidgeFilter
RidgeFilter[<i>data</i>] computes a measure for the presence of a ridge at every position of <i>data</i>.

RidgeFilter[<i>data</i>,σ] uses the specified ridge scale σ.

---

RiemannR
RiemannR[<i>x</i>] gives the Riemann prime counting function R(x).

---

RiemannSiegelTheta
RiemannSiegelTheta[<i>t</i>] gives the Riemann–Siegel function ϑ(t). 

---

RiemannSiegelZ
RiemannSiegelZ[<i>t</i>] gives the Riemann–Siegel function Z(t). 

---

RiemannXi
RiemannXi[<i>s</i>] gives the Riemann xi function ξ(s).

---

Right
Right is a symbol that represents the right-hand side for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

RightArrow
RightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x→y→….

---

RightArrowBar
RightArrowBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇥y⇥….

---

RightArrowLeftArrow
RightArrowLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇄y⇄….

---

RightComposition
RightComposition[<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>3</sub>,…] represents a composition on the right of the functions <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>f</i><sub>3</sub>, ….

---

RightCosetRepresentative
RightCosetRepresentative[<i>group</i>,<i>g</i>] returns the smallest element in the right coset of products of the elements of <i>group</i> by <i>g</i>.

---

RightDownTeeVector
RightDownTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥝y⥝….

---

RightDownVector
RightDownVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇂y⇂….

---

RightDownVectorBar
RightDownVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥕y⥕….

---

RightTee
RightTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊢y.

---

RightTeeArrow
RightTeeArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x↦y↦….

---

RightTeeVector
RightTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥛y⥛….

---

RightTriangle
RightTriangle[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⊳y⊳….

---

RightTriangleBar
RightTriangleBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⧐y⧐….

---

RightTriangleEqual
RightTriangleEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⊵y⊵….

---

RightUpDownVector
RightUpDownVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥏y⥏….

---

RightUpTeeVector
RightUpTeeVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥜y⥜….

---

RightUpVector
RightUpVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x↾y↾….

---

RightUpVectorBar
RightUpVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥔y⥔….

---

RightVector
RightVector[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⇀y⇀….

---

RightVectorBar
RightVectorBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as x⥓y⥓….

---

RipleyK
RipleyK[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates Ripley's K function K(r) at radius <i>r</i> for point data <i>pdata</i>.

RipleyK[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes K(r) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

RipleyK[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes K(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

RipleyK[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function K that can be applied repeatedly at different radii <i>r</i>.

---

RipleyRassonRegion
RipleyRassonRegion[<i>pdata</i>] gives an estimated observation based on the point data <i>pdata</i>. 

---

RiskAchievementImportance
RiskAchievementImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the risk achievement importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

RiskAchievementImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the risk achievement importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

RiskReductionImportance
RiskReductionImportance[<i>rdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the risk reduction importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

RiskReductionImportance[<i>fdist</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the risk reduction importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i> at time <i>t</i>.

---

RobustConvexOptimization
RobustConvexOptimization[<i>f</i>,ForAll[<i>pars</i>,<i>pcons</i>,<i>vcons</i>],<i>vars</i>] finds values of <i>vars</i> that give the minimum value of <i>f</i> for <i>vars</i> that satisfy the constraints <i>vcons</i> for all possible values of the parameters <i>pars</i> that satisfy the parametric constraints <i>pcons</i>.

RobustConvexOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

RogersTanimotoDissimilarity
RogersTanimotoDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Rogers–Tanimoto dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

RollPitchYawAngles
RollPitchYawAngles[<i>r</i>] gives the roll-pitch-yaw angles {α,β,γ} corresponding to the rotation matrix <i>r</i>.

RollPitchYawAngles[<i>r</i>,{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}] gives the roll-pitch-yaw angles {α,β,γ} corresponding to rotation order {<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}.

---

RollPitchYawMatrix
RollPitchYawMatrix[{α,β,γ}] gives the 3D rotation matrix formed by rotating by α around the initial z axis, then by β around the initial y axis, and then by γ around the initial x axis. 

RollPitchYawMatrix[{α,β,γ},{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>}] gives the 3D rotation matrix formed by rotating by α around the fixed <i>a</i> axis, then by β around the fixed <i>b</i> axis, and then by γ around the fixed <i>c</i> axis. 

---

RomanNumeral
RomanNumeral[<i>n</i>] gives a string corresponding to the Roman numeral form of the integer <i>n</i>.

---

RootApproximant
RootApproximant[<i>x</i>] converts the number <i>x</i> to one of the "simplest" algebraic numbers that approximates it well.

RootApproximant[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] finds an algebraic number of degree at most <i>n</i> that approximates <i>x</i>.

---

RootIntervals
RootIntervals[{<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of isolating intervals for the real roots of any of the <i>poly</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, together with a list of which polynomials actually have each successive root.

RootIntervals[<i>poly</i>] gives isolating intervals for real roots of a single polynomial. 

RootIntervals[<i>polys</i>,Complexes] gives bounding rectangles for complex roots.

---

RootLocusPlot
RootLocusPlot[<i>lsys</i>,{<i>k</i>,<i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a root locus plot of a linear time-invariant system <i>lsys</i> as the parameter <i>k</i> ranges from <i>k</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>k</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

RootMeanSquare
RootMeanSquare[<i>list</i>] gives the root mean square of values in <i>list</i>.

RootMeanSquare[<i>dist</i>] gives the root mean square of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

RootOfUnityQ
RootOfUnityQ[<i>a</i>] yields True if <i>a</i> is a root of unity, and yields False otherwise.

---

RootReduce
RootReduce[<i>expr</i>] attempts to reduce <i>expr</i> to a single Root object. 

---

Roots
Roots[<i>lhs</i>==<i>rhs</i>,<i>var</i>] yields a disjunction of equations which represent the roots of a polynomial equation. 

---

RootSum
RootSum[<i>f</i>,<i>form</i>] represents the sum of <i>form</i>[<i>x</i>] for all <i>x</i> that satisfy the polynomial equation <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>]==0. 

---

Rotate
Rotate[<i>g</i>,θ] represents 2D graphics primitives or any other objects <i>g</i> rotated counterclockwise by θ radians about the center of their bounding box. 

Rotate[<i>g</i>,θ,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] rotates about the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}. 

Rotate[<i>g</i>,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] rotates around the origin, transforming the 2D or 3D vector <i>u</i> to <i>v</i>.

Rotate[<i>g</i>,θ,<i>w</i>] rotates 3D graphics primitives by θ radians around the 3D vector <i>w</i> anchored at the origin.

Rotate[<i>g</i>,θ,<i>w</i>,<i>p</i>] rotates around the 3D vector <i>w</i> anchored at <i>p</i>.

Rotate[<i>g</i>,θ,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] rotates by angle θ in the plane spanned by 3D vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

RotateLabel
RotateLabel is an option for graphics and related functions that specifies whether labels on vertical frame axes should be rotated to be vertical. 

---

RotateLeft
RotateLeft[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] cycles the elements in <i>expr</i> <i>n</i> positions to the left. 

RotateLeft[<i>expr</i>] cycles one position to the left. 

RotateLeft[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] cycles elements at successive levels <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> positions to the left. 

---

RotateRight
RotateRight[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] cycles the elements in <i>expr</i> <i>n</i> positions to the right. 

RotateRight[<i>expr</i>] cycles one position to the right. 

RotateRight[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] cycles elements at successive levels <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> positions to the right. 

---

RotationAction
RotationAction is an option for three-dimensional graphics functions that specifies how to render 3D objects when they are interactively rotated.

---

RotationMatrix
RotationMatrix[θ] gives the 2D rotation matrix that rotates 2D vectors counterclockwise by θ radians.

RotationMatrix[θ,<i>w</i>] gives the 3D rotation matrix for a counterclockwise rotation around the 3D vector <i>w</i>.

RotationMatrix[{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the matrix that rotates the vector <i>u</i> to the direction of the vector <i>v</i> in any dimension.

RotationMatrix[θ,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives the matrix that rotates by θ radians in the plane spanned by <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

RotationTransform
RotationTransform[θ] gives a TransformationFunction that represents a rotation in 2D by θ radians about the origin.

RotationTransform[θ,<i>p</i>] gives a 2D rotation about the 2D point <i>p</i>.

RotationTransform[θ,<i>w</i>] gives a 3D rotation around the direction of the 3D vector <i>w</i>.

RotationTransform[θ,<i>w</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a 3D rotation around the axis <i>w</i> anchored at the point <i>p</i>.

RotationTransform[{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>}] gives a rotation about the origin that transforms the vector <i>u</i> to the direction of the vector <i>v</i>.

RotationTransform[{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>},<i>p</i>] gives a rotation about the point <i>p</i> that transforms <i>u</i> to the direction of <i>v</i>.

RotationTransform[θ,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>},…] gives a rotation by θ radians in the plane spanned by <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

Round
Round[<i>x</i>] gives the integer closest to <i>x</i>. 

Round[<i>x</i>,<i>a</i>] rounds to the nearest multiple of <i>a</i>. 

---

RoundingRadius
RoundingRadius is an option for Rectangle, Framed and related functions that specifies the radius of the circle to use in rendering rounded corners.

---

Row
Row[{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] is an object that formats with the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> arranged in a row, potentially extending over several lines. 

Row[<i>list</i>,<i>s</i>] inserts <i>s</i> as a separator between successive elements. 

---

RowReduce
RowReduce[<i>m</i>] gives the row‐reduced form of the matrix <i>m</i>. 

---

RSolve
RSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>a</i>[<i>n</i>],<i>n</i>] solves a recurrence equation for <i>a</i>[<i>n</i>]. 

RSolve[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>n</i>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>n</i>],…},<i>n</i>] solves a system of recurrence equations. 

RSolve[<i>eqn</i>,<i>a</i>[<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…],{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] solves a partial recurrence equation. 

---

RSolveValue
RSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the value of <i>expr</i> determined by a symbolic solution to the ordinary difference equation <i>eqn</i> with independent variable <i>n</i>. 

RSolveValue[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>,…] uses a symbolic solution for a list of difference equations. 

RSolveValue[<i>eqn</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] uses a solution for the partial recurrence equation <i>eqn</i>. 

---

RudinShapiro
RudinShapiro[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> term in the Rudin–Shapiro sequence.

---

RudvalisGroupRu
RudvalisGroupRu[] represents the sporadic simple Rudvalis group Ru.

---

Rule
<i>lhs</i>-><i>rhs</i> or <i>lhs</i><i>rhs</i> represents a rule that transforms <i>lhs</i> to <i>rhs</i>. 

---

RuleCondition
RuleCondition is an internal symbol.

---

RuleDelayed
<i>lhs</i>:><i>rhs</i> or <i>lhs</i><i>rhs</i> represents a rule that transforms <i>lhs</i> to <i>rhs</i>, evaluating <i>rhs</i> only after the rule is used. 

---

RulePlot
RulePlot[<i>sys</i>] generates a plot representing the rule for the computational system <i>sys</i>.

RulePlot[<i>sys</i>,<i>init</i>,<i>t</i>] generates a plot of the evolution of the system <i>sys</i> from initial condition <i>init</i> for <i>t</i> steps.

RulePlot[<i>sys</i>,<i>evol</i>] generates a plot of the evolution <i>evol</i> assuming it is derived from a system of the form <i>sys</i>.

---

RulerUnits
RulerUnits is an option for notebooks that specifies the units in the ruler toolbar.

---

RulesTree
RulesTree[<i>data</i>{<i>rule</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rule</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a tree whose root contains <i>data</i> and that has children specified by the <i>rule</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Run
Run["<i>command</i>"] runs <i>command</i> as an external operating system command, returning the exit code obtained.

---

RunProcess
RunProcess["command"] runs the specified external command, returning information on the outcome.

RunProcess[{"command", arg 1, arg 2, …}] runs the specified command, with command-line arguments arg i.

RunProcess[command, "prop"] returns only the specified property.

RunProcess[command, prop, input] feeds the specified initial input to the command.

---

RunScheduledTask
RunScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>] schedules and starts a local scheduled task that will repeatedly evaluate <i>expr</i> once per second.

RunScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>time</i>] schedules and starts a task that will repeatedly evaluate <i>expr</i> every <i>time</i> seconds.

RunScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,{<i>time</i>}] schedules and starts a task that will evaluate <i>expr</i> once after <i>time</i> seconds.

RunScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,{<i>time</i>,<i>count</i>}] schedules and starts a task that will try evaluating <i>expr</i> once every <i>time</i> seconds up to <i>count</i> times.

RunScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>timespec</i>,<i>start</i>] schedules a task that will automatically start at <i>start</i> time.

RunScheduledTask[CloudObject[<i>…</i>]] asynchronously executes an existing cloud task or document generator.

---

RunThrough
RunThrough["<i>command</i>",<i>expr</i>] executes an external command, giving the printed form of <i>expr</i> as input and taking the output, reading it as Wolfram Language input, and returning the result. 

---

RuntimeAttributes
RuntimeAttributes is an option for Compile that specifies attributes for the compiled function it creates.

---

RuntimeOptions
RuntimeOptions is an option for Compile that specifies runtime settings for the compiled function it creates.

---

RussellRaoDissimilarity
RussellRaoDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Russell–Rao dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

SameQ
<i>lhs</i>===<i>rhs</i> yields True if the expression <i>lhs</i> is identical to <i>rhs</i>, and yields False otherwise. 

---

SameTest
SameTest is an option whose setting gives a pairwise comparison function to determine whether expressions should be considered the same.

---

SameTestProperties
SameTestProperties is an option for set operations on entity classes whose setting gives the properties that are used to decide whether two given entities are the same.

---

SampledEntityClass
SampledEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an entity class containing <i>n</i> entities from <i>class</i>.

SampledEntityClass[<i>class</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] represents an entity class containing entities <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> of <i>class</i>.

---

SampleDepth
SampleDepth is an option for sound primitives that specifies how many bits should be used to encode sound amplitude levels. 

---

SampledSoundFunction
SampledSoundFunction[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>] is a sound primitive that represents a sound whose amplitude sampled <i>r</i> times a second is generated by applying the function <i>f</i> to successive integers from 1 to <i>n</i>. 

---

SampledSoundList
SampledSoundList[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>r</i>] is a sound primitive that represents a sound whose amplitude has levels <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> sampled <i>r</i> times a second. 

---

SampleRate
SampleRate is an option that specifies the number of samples per second for sound and signal processing functions.

---

SamplingPeriod
SamplingPeriod is an option to StateSpaceModel etc. that specifies the sampling period.

---

SARIMAProcess
SARIMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},<i>d</i>,{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},δ,{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},<i>v</i>] represents a seasonal integrated autoregressive moving-average process with ARIMA coefficients <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>d</i>, and <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>; seasonal order <i>s</i>; seasonal ARIMA coefficients α<sub><i>i</i></sub>, δ, and β<sub><i>j</i></sub>; seasonal integration order δ; and normal white noise with variance <i>v</i>.

SARIMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},<i>d</i>,{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},δ,{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},Σ] represents a vector SARIMA process with coefficient matrices <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>, α<sub><i>i</i></sub>, and β<sub><i>j</i></sub> and covariance matrix Σ. 

SARIMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{α<sub>1</sub>,…},{δ<sub>1</sub>,…},{β<sub>1</sub>,…}},Σ] represents a vector SARIMA process with multiple integration orders <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, seasonal orders <i>s</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>, and seasonal integration orders δ<sub><i>k</i></sub>. 

SARIMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},<i>d</i>,{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},δ,{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},<i>v</i>,<i>init</i>] represents a SARIMA process with initial data <i>init</i>. 

SARIMAProcess[<i>c</i>,…] represents a SARIMA process with constant <i>c</i>.

---

SARMAProcess
SARMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},<i>v</i>] represents a weakly stationary seasonal autoregressive moving-average process with ARMA coefficients <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>b</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>, seasonal order <i>s</i>, seasonal ARMA coefficients α<sub><i>i</i></sub> and β<sub><i>j</i></sub>, and normal white noise with variance <i>v</i>.

SARMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},Σ]  represents a weakly stationary vector SARMA process driven by normal white noise, with covariance matrix Σ.

SARMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},Σ] represents a weakly stationary vector SARMA process with multiple seasonal orders <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SARMAProcess[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>a</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>b</i><sub><i>q</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,{α<sub>1</sub>,…,α<sub><i>m</i></sub>},{β<sub>1</sub>,…,β<sub><i>r</i></sub>}},<i>v</i>,<i>init</i>]  represents a SARMA process with initial data <i>init</i>. 

SARMAProcess[<i>c</i>,…] represents a SARMA process with a constant <i>c</i>.

---

SASTriangle
SASTriangle[<i>a</i>,γ,<i>b</i>] returns a filled triangle with sides of length <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> and angle γ between them. 

---

SatelliteData
SatelliteData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the satellite <i>entity</i>.

SatelliteData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified satellite entities.

SatelliteData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SatisfiabilityCount
SatisfiabilityCount[<i>bf</i>] counts the number of possible combinations of variable values that yield True when supplied as arguments to the Boolean function <i>bf</i>.

SatisfiabilityCount[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] counts the number of possible combinations of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that make the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> be true.

---

SatisfiabilityInstances
SatisfiabilityInstances[<i>bf</i>] attempts to find a choice of variables that makes the Boolean function <i>bf</i> yield True.

SatisfiabilityInstances[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] attempts to find a choice of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that makes the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> be True.

SatisfiabilityInstances[…,…,<i>m</i>] attempts to find <i>m</i> choices of variables that yield True.

---

SatisfiableQ
SatisfiableQ[<i>bf</i>] gives True if a combination of values of variables exists that makes the Boolean function <i>bf</i> yield True.

SatisfiableQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives True if a combination of values of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> exists that makes the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> yield True.

---

Saturday
Saturday is a day of the week.

---

Save
Save["<i>filename</i>",<i>symbol</i>] appends definitions associated with the specified symbol to a file. 

Save["<i>filename</i>","<i>patt</i>"] appends definitions associated with all symbols whose names match the string pattern "<i>patt</i>". 

Save["<i>filename</i>","<i>context</i>`"] appends definitions associated with all symbols in the specified context. 

Save["<i>filename</i>",{<i>object</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>object</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] appends definitions associated with several objects. 

---

Saveable
Saveable is an option for notebooks that specifies whether a notebook can be saved.

---

SaveConnection
SaveConnection is an option for ServiceConnect that determines whether the connection should be saved in the authenticated user's account.

---

SaveDefinitions
SaveDefinitions is an option to Manipulate and related functions that specifies whether current definitions relevant for the evaluation of the expression being manipulated should automatically be saved.

---

SawtoothWave
SawtoothWave[<i>x</i>] gives a sawtooth wave that varies from 0 to 1 with unit period.

SawtoothWave[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},<i>x</i>] gives a sawtooth wave that varies from <i>min</i> to <i>max</i> with unit period.

---

Scale
Scale[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>] represents graphics primitives <i>g</i> scaled by a factor <i>s</i>. 

Scale[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] scales with the point {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…} kept fixed. 

Scale[<i>g</i>,{<i>s</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,…},…] scales by different factors along different axes. 

---

Scaled
Scaled[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] gives the position of a graphical object in terms of coordinates scaled to run from 0 to 1 across the whole plot range in each direction. 

Scaled[{<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,…}] gives a position obtained by starting at ordinary coordinates {<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,…}, then moving by a scaled offset {<i>dx</i>,<i>dy</i>,…}. 

---

ScaleDivisions
ScaleDivisions is an option for gauge functions that specifies how many tick marks should be drawn on the scale.

---

ScaleOrigin
ScaleOrigin is an option for gauge functions that describes how to position the scale on the gauge.

---

ScalePadding
ScalePadding is an option for gauge functions that specifies how much space to leave around the scale.

---

ScaleRanges
ScaleRanges is an option for gauge functions that describes how to draw sections of the scale.

---

ScaleRangeStyle
ScaleRangeStyle is an option for gauge functions to describe how to style different sections of the scale.

---

ScalingFunctions
ScalingFunctions is an option for ListPlot, BarChart, Histogram, and other plotting functions that specifies what scaling functions should be used. 

---

ScalingMatrix
ScalingMatrix[{<i>s</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,…}] gives the matrix corresponding to scaling by a factor <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> along each coordinate axis.

ScalingMatrix[<i>s</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the matrix corresponding to scaling by a factor <i>s</i> along the direction of the vector <i>v</i>.

---

ScalingTransform
ScalingTransform[{<i>s</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,…}] gives a TransformationFunction that represents scaling by a factor <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> along each coordinate axis from the origin.

ScalingTransform[{<i>s</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,…},<i>p</i>] gives scaling centered at the point <i>p</i>.

ScalingTransform[<i>s</i>,<i>v</i>] gives scaling by a factor <i>s</i> along the direction of the vector <i>v</i>.

ScalingTransform[<i>s</i>,<i>v</i>,<i>p</i>] gives scaling along the direction of <i>v</i>, centered at the point <i>p</i>.

---

Scan
Scan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>f</i> applied to each element of <i>expr</i> in turn. 

Scan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> to parts of <i>expr</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>. 

Scan[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of Scan that can be applied to an expression.

---

ScheduledTask
ScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>timespec</i>] represents a scheduled task to be evaluated on the schedule defined by <i>timespec</i>.

---

ScheduledTaskActiveQ
ScheduledTaskActiveQ[<i>obj</i>] yields True if <i>obj</i> represents an active task, and False otherwise.

---

ScheduledTaskInformation
ScheduledTaskInformation[<i>cloudobj</i>] returns the properties of the ScheduledTask <i>cloudobj</i>.

ScheduledTaskInformation[<i>cloudobj</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the value of the property <i>property</i>.

---

ScheduledTaskObject
ScheduledTaskObject[<i>id</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>spec</i>,…] is a task object specifying future evaluation of <i>expr</i> according to <i>spec</i>.

---

ScheduledTasks
ScheduledTasks[] returns a list of ScheduledTaskObject and CloudObject expressions that represent current tasks.

---

SchurDecomposition
SchurDecomposition[<i>m</i>] yields the Schur decomposition for a numerical matrix <i>m</i>, given as a list {<i>q</i>,<i>t</i>} where <i>q</i> is an orthonormal matrix and <i>t</i> is a block upper‐triangular matrix. 

SchurDecomposition[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized Schur decomposition of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

---

ScientificForm
ScientificForm[<i>expr</i>] prints with all real numbers in <i>expr</i> given in scientific notation. 

ScientificForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints with numbers given to <i>n</i>‐digit precision. 

---

ScientificNotationThreshold
ScientificNotationThreshold is an option for NumberForm and related functions that specifies the threshold between the use of decimal notation and scientific notation to represent real numbers.

---

ScorerGi
ScorerGi[<i>z</i>] gives the Scorer function Gi(z).

---

ScorerGiPrime
ScorerGiPrime[<i>z</i>] gives the derivative of the Scorer function Gi<sup>′</sup>(z).

---

ScorerHi
ScorerHi[<i>z</i>] gives the Scorer function Hi(z).

---

ScorerHiPrime
ScorerHiPrime[<i>z</i>] gives the derivative of the Scorer function Hi<sup>′</sup>(z).

---

ScreenRectangle
ScreenRectangle is a global option that specifies the position of the primary screen by giving the coordinates of two diagonally opposite corners.

---

ScreenStyleEnvironment
ScreenStyleEnvironment is an option for notebooks that specifies the style environment to be used in displaying a notebook on the screen. 

---

ScriptBaselineShifts
ScriptBaselineShifts is an option for Style that specifies the minimum distance in <i>x</i>‐heights to shift subscripts and superscripts. 

---

ScriptLevel
ScriptLevel is an option for selections that is used in determining the font size of modifiers such as subscripts and superscripts in a nested expression.

---

ScriptMinSize
ScriptMinSize is an option for Style which specifies the minimum font size to use in rendering subscripts, etc. 

---

ScriptSizeMultipliers
ScriptSizeMultipliers is an option for Style that specifies how much smaller to render each successive level of subscripts, etc. 

---

Scrollbars
Scrollbars is an option for Pane that specifies whether scrollbars should be displayed.

---

ScrollingOptions
ScrollingOptions is an option for notebooks that specifies settings for scrolling.

---

ScrollPosition
ScrollPosition is an option for Pane that specifies the scroll position of the contents of the pane.

---

SearchAdjustment
SearchAdjustment[<i>query</i>,<i>w</i>] represents a component of a search query that is to be treated as having weight <i>w</i>.

SearchAdjustment[<i>query</i>,…,<i>opts</i>] represents a component of a search query with certain options.

---

SearchIndexObject
SearchIndexObject[<i>loc</i>] represents a search index object, as created by CreateSearchIndex.

SearchIndexObject["<i>name</i>"] represents the search index with the specified name in the SearchIndices[] list.

---

SearchIndices
SearchIndices[] returns a list with all the locally stored instances of SearchIndexObject.

---

SearchQueryString
SearchQueryString["<i>query</i>"] represents a search engine-style query in TextSearch and related functions.

---

SearchResultObject
SearchResultObject[…] represents a result from TextSearch[…] and related functions.

---

Sec
Sec[<i>z</i>] gives the secant of <i>z</i>. 

---

Sech
Sech[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic secant of <i>z</i>. 

---
