SechDistribution
SechDistribution[μ,σ] represents the hyperbolic secant distribution with location parameter μ and scale parameter σ.

SechDistribution[] represents the hyperbolic secant distribution with location parameter 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

SecondOrderConeOptimization
SecondOrderConeOptimization[<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>,<i>vars</i>] finds values of variables <i>vars</i> that minimize the linear objective <i>f</i> subject to second-order cone and/or linear constraints <i>cons</i>.

SecondOrderConeOptimization[<i>c</i>,{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,α<sub>1</sub>,β<sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>a</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,<i>b</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>,α<sub><i>k</i></sub>,β<sub><i>k</i></sub>}}] finds a vector x that minimizes c.x subject to the constraints a<sub>i</sub>.x+b<sub>i</sub>≤α<sub>i</sub>.x+β<sub>i</sub>.

SecondOrderConeOptimization[<i>c</i>,…,{<i>dom</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dom</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] takes x<sub>i</sub> to be in the domain <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, where <i>dom</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is Integers or Reals. 

SecondOrderConeOptimization[…,"<i>prop</i>"] specifies what solution property "<i>prop</i>" should be returned.

---

SectorChart
SectorChart[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a sector chart with sector angles proportional to <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and radii <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SectorChart[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>i</sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>j</sub>},…],…}] makes a sector chart with sector features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

SectorChart[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a sector chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SectorChart3D
SectorChart3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] makes a 3D sector chart with sector angle proportional to <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, radius <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and height <i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SectorChart3D[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>i</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>},…],…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[{<i>x</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>j</sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>},…],…}] makes a 3D sector chart with sector features defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

SectorChart3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a 3D sector chart from multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

SectorOrigin
SectorOrigin is an option to PieChart and related functions that specifies where sectors should start.

---

SectorSpacing
SectorSpacing is an option to PieChart and related functions that specifies radial spacing of sectors. 

---

SecuredAuthenticationKey
SecuredAuthenticationKey[<i>assoc</i>] represents a secured authentication key with credentials and details specified by the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

SecuredAuthenticationKeys
SecuredAuthenticationKeys[] retrieves a list of all instances of SecuredAuthenticationKey owned by the currently connected user. 

SecuredAuthenticationKeys["<i>name</i>"] retrieves a SecuredAuthenticationKey identified by "<i>name</i>" owned by the currently connected user, if it exists.

---

SecurityCertificate
SecurityCertificate[<i>assoc</i>] represents the security certificate issued for a public key.

---

SeedRandom
SeedRandom[<i>s</i>] resets the pseudorandom generator, using <i>s</i> as a seed. 

SeedRandom[] resets the generator, using as a seed the time of day and certain attributes of the current Wolfram System session. 

---

Select
Select[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i>] picks out all elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True. 

Select[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i><i>prop</i>] returns the property <i>prop</i> of the selected elements.

Select[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>n</i>] picks out the first <i>n</i> elements for which <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True. 

Select[<i>crit</i>] represents an operator form of Select that can be applied to an expression. 

---

SelectComponents
SelectComponents[{<i>image</i>,<i>lmat</i>},<i>crit</i>] selects components of <i>image</i> indicated by the label matrix <i>lmat</i> that satisfy <i>crit</i>, replacing other parts with black.

SelectComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>crit</i>] selects connected components of <i>image</i>.

SelectComponents[…,"<i>prop</i>",<i>n</i>] computes the property "<i>prop</i>" and selects the first <i>n</i> in sorted order.

SelectComponents[…,"<i>prop</i>",<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] sorts computed properties using the ordering function <i>p</i>.

---

SelectedCells
SelectedCells[<i>notebook</i>] returns a list of CellObject expressions corresponding to the currently selected cells in <i>notebook</i>.

SelectedCells[] returns the currently selected cells in the notebook in which this function is being evaluated.

---

SelectFirst
SelectFirst[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i>] gives the first <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True, or Missing["NotFound"] if none is found.

SelectFirst[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i><i>prop</i>] returns the property <i>prop</i> of the selected elements.

SelectFirst[<i>data</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>default</i>] gives <i>default</i> if there is no <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>data</i> such that <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

SelectFirst[<i>crit</i>] represents an operator form of SelectFirst that can be applied to an expression.

---

SelfLoopStyle
SelfLoopStyle is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that specifies how to draw self-loops that connect a vertex to itself.

---

SemanticImport
SemanticImport[<i>file</i>] attempts to import a file semantically to give a Dataset object.

SemanticImport[<i>file</i>,<i>type</i>] attempts to interpret all elements in the file as being of the specified type.

SemanticImport[<i>file</i>,{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] attempts to interpret elements in successive columns as being of the specified types. 

SemanticImport[<i>file</i>,<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>-><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>-><i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…] keeps only the columns <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> specified by their positions or names.

SemanticImport[<i>file</i>,<i>typespec</i>,<i>form</i>] puts the result in the specified form.

---

SemanticImportString
SemanticImportString["<i>string</i>"] attempts to import a string semantically to give a Dataset object.

SemanticImportString["<i>string</i>",<i>type</i>] attempts to interpret all elements in the string as being of the specified type.

SemanticImportString["<i>string</i>",{<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] attempts to interpret elements in successive columns as being of the specified types. 

SemanticImportString["<i>string</i>",<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>-><i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>col</i><sub>2</sub>-><i>type</i><sub>2</sub>,…] attempts to interpret elements in the named columns as being of the specified types.

SemanticImportString["<i>string</i>",<i>typespec</i>,<i>form</i>] puts the result in the specified form.

---

SemanticInterpretation
SemanticInterpretation["<i>string</i>"] attempts to give the best semantic interpretation of the specified free-form string as a Wolfram Language expression.

SemanticInterpretation["<i>string</i>",<i>pattern</i>] filters possible semantic interpretations, returning the best one that matches the specified pattern.

SemanticInterpretation["<i>string</i>",<i>pattern</i>,<i>head</i>] returns the semantic interpretation wrapped with the specified head.

---

SemialgebraicComponentInstances
SemialgebraicComponentInstances[<i>ineqs</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives at least one sample point in each connected component of the semialgebraic set defined by the inequalities <i>ineqs</i> in the variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

SendMail
SendMail[<i>body</i>] sends mail consisting of <i>body</i> to the address specified by $CloudUserID.

SendMail[{"<i>subject</i>"}] sends mail with the specified subject and no body.

SendMail[{"<i>subject</i>",<i>body</i>}] sends mail with the specified subject and body.

SendMail[{"<i>subject</i>",<i>body</i>,<i>att</i>}] sends mail with the attachment or attachments <i>att</i>.

SendMail["<i>to</i>",<i>content</i>] sends mail to the specified To: address.

SendMail[{<i>to</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>to</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>content</i>] sends mail to multiple To: addresses.

SendMail[{{<i>to</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>cc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},<i>content</i>] includes the <i>cc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as Cc: addresses.

SendMail[{{<i>to</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>cc</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>bcc</i><sub>1</sub>,…}},<i>content</i>] also includes the <i>bcc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as Bcc: addresses.

SendMail[<i>assoc</i>] sends mail with elements specified in the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

SendMessage
SendMessage[<i>channel</i>,<i>message</i>] sends a message to the specified channel.

SendMessage[<i>channel</i><i>dest</i>,<i>message</i>] sends a message to the destination <i>dest</i> through the specified channel.

---

Sequence
Sequence[<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a sequence of arguments to be spliced automatically into any function. 

---

SequenceAlignment
SequenceAlignment[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] finds an optimal alignment of sequences of elements in the strings, lists or biomolecular sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>, and yields a list of successive matching and differing sequences.

---

SequenceAttentionLayer
SequenceAttentionLayer[] is equivalent to AttentionLayer[] with a single "Input" port instead of ports "Key" and "Value". It should no longer be used.

SequenceAttentionLayer[<i>net</i>] is equivalent to AttentionLayer[<i>net</i>] with a single "Input" port instead of ports "Key" and "Value". It should no longer be used.

---

SequenceCases
SequenceCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the sublists in <i>list</i> that match the sequence pattern <i>patt</i>.

SequenceCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i><i>rhs</i>] gives a list of the values of <i>rhs</i> corresponding to sublists that match <i>patt</i>.

SequenceCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> matches.

---

SequenceCount
SequenceCount[<i>list</i>,<i>sub</i>] gives a count of the number of times <i>sub</i> appears as a sublist of <i>list</i>.

SequenceCount[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the number of sublists in <i>list</i> that match the general sequence pattern <i>patt</i>. 

---

SequenceFold
SequenceFold[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the last element of SequenceFoldList[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}].

SequenceFold[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] applies <i>f</i> to <i>k</i> arguments at each step, with the first <i>n</i> coming from the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> or previous results, and the last <i>k</i>-<i>n</i> coming from the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SequenceFoldList
SequenceFoldList[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>],…}.

SequenceFoldList[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] applies <i>f</i> to <i>k</i> arguments at each step, with the first <i>n</i> coming from the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> or previous results, and the last <i>k</i>-<i>n</i> coming from the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

SequenceForm
SequenceForm[<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] prints as the textual concatenation of the printed forms of the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

SequenceHold
SequenceHold is an attribute that specifies that Sequence objects appearing in the arguments of a function should not automatically be flattened out. 

---

SequenceIndicesLayer
SequenceIndicesLayer[] represents a net layer that produces a list of indices for an input sequence.

---

SequenceLastLayer
SequenceLastLayer[] represents a net that takes a sequence of inputs and returns the last element of the sequence.

---

SequenceMostLayer
SequenceMostLayer[] represents a net that takes a sequence of inputs and removes its last element.

---

SequencePosition
SequencePosition[<i>list</i>,<i>sublist</i>] gives a list of the starting and ending positions at which <i>sublist</i> appears in <i>list</i>.

SequencePosition[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives all positions at which sequences matching <i>patt</i> occur in <i>list</i>.

SequencePosition[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> occurrences of <i>patt</i>.

---

SequencePredict
SequencePredict[{<i>seq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seq</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a SequencePredictorFunction[…] based on the sequences given.

SequencePredict[<i>training</i>,<i>seq</i>] attempts to predict the next element in the sequence <i>seq</i> from the training sequences given.

SequencePredict[<i>training</i>,{<i>seq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seq</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives predictions for each of the sequences <i>seq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SequencePredict["<i>name</i>",<i>seq</i>] uses the built-in sequence predictor represented by "<i>name</i>".

SequencePredict[…,<i>seq</i>,<i>prop</i>] give the specified property of the prediction associated with <i>seq</i>.

---

SequencePredictorFunction
SequencePredictorFunction[…] represents a function generated by SequencePredict that predicts the next elements from a sequence.

---

SequenceReplace
SequenceReplace[<i>list</i>,<i>rules</i>] replaces sequences in <i>list</i> according to the specified rule or list of rules. 

SequenceReplace[<i>list</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>n</i>] does only the first <i>n</i> replacements.

SequenceReplace[<i>rules</i>] represents an operator form of SequenceReplace that can be applied to an expression.

---

SequenceRestLayer
SequenceRestLayer[] represents a net that takes a sequence of inputs and removes its first element.

---

SequenceReverseLayer
SequenceReverseLayer[] represents a net that reverses the order of an input sequence.

---

SequenceSplit
SequenceSplit[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] splits <i>list</i> into sublists separated by sequences that match the sequence pattern <i>patt</i>. 

SequenceSplit[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i><i>rhs</i>] inserts <i>rhs</i> at the position of each matched sequence.

SequenceSplit[<i>list</i>,{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub><i>rhs</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] inserts <i>rhs</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the position of each <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SequenceSplit[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] splits into at most <i>n</i> sublists.

---

SeriesCoefficient
SeriesCoefficient[<i>series</i>,<i>n</i>] finds the coefficient of the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-order term in a power series in the form generated by Series. 

SeriesCoefficient[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i>}] finds the coefficient of (x-x<sub>0</sub>)<sup>n</sup> in the expansion of <i>f</i> about the point x=x<sub>0</sub>.

SeriesCoefficient[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…] finds a coefficient in a multivariate series. 

---

SeriesData
SeriesData[<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,{<i>a</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>den</i>] represents a power series in the variable <i>x</i> about the point <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>. The <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are the coefficients in the power series. The powers of (<i>x</i>-<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>) that appear are <i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>/<i>den</i>, (<i>n</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>+1)/<i>den</i>, …, <i>n</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>/<i>den</i>. 

---

SeriesTermGoal
SeriesTermGoal is an option for Asymptotic, DiscreteAsymptotic and similar functions that specifies the number of desired terms in an asymptotic approximation.

---

ServiceConnect
ServiceConnect["<i>service</i>"] creates a connection to an external service.

ServiceConnect["<i>service</i>",<i>id</i>] uses the specified connection identifier.

---

ServiceDisconnect
ServiceDisconnect[<i>service</i>] disconnects from an external service specified by a ServiceObject.

---

ServiceExecute
ServiceExecute[<i>service</i>,"<i>req</i>"] executes "<i>req</i>" on an external service.

ServiceExecute[<i>service</i>,"<i>req</i>",{<i>par</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] executes "<i>req</i>" with the specified settings for parameters.

ServiceExecute[<i>req</i>] executes ServiceRequest <i>req</i> on an external service.

---

ServiceObject
ServiceObject["<i>service</i>",…] represents an open connection to an external service.

---

ServiceRequest
ServiceRequest[<i>service</i>,"<i>req</i>"] represents a service request built from <i>service</i>, which might be a connected ServiceObject or a valid service name, and request "<i>req</i>".

ServiceRequest[<i>service</i>,"<i>req</i>",<i>param</i>] represents a service request, built from the service <i>service</i>, request "<i>req</i>" and parameters <i>param</i>.

ServiceRequest[<i>assoc</i>] represents a service request, built from association <i>assoc</i>.

---

ServiceSubmit
ServiceSubmit[ServiceRequest[<i>assoc</i>]] submits a request to be executed by an external service specified by <i>assoc</i>.

ServiceSubmit[ScheduledTask[<i>req</i>,<i>spec</i>]] submits a task to evaluate ServiceRequest <i>req</i> on an external service following the schedule defined by <i>spec</i>.

ServiceSubmit[ContinuousTask[<i>req</i>,<i>spec</i>]] submits a task to evaluate ServiceRequest <i>req</i> on an external service; the result of the request is updated whenever available.

---

SessionSubmit
SessionSubmit[<i>expr</i>] submits an asynchronous task to evaluate <i>expr</i> in the current session.

SessionSubmit[ScheduledTask[<i>expr</i>,<i>spec</i>]] submits a task to evaluate <i>expr</i> in the current session on the schedule defined by <i>spec</i>.

---

SessionTime
SessionTime[] gives the total number of seconds of real time that have elapsed since the beginning of your Wolfram System session. 

---

Set
<i>lhs</i>=<i>rhs</i> evaluates <i>rhs</i> and assigns the result to be the value of <i>lhs</i>. From then on, <i>lhs</i> is replaced by <i>rhs</i> whenever it appears. 

{<i>l</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>l</i><sub>2</sub>,…}={<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…} evaluates the <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and assigns the results to be the values of the corresponding <i>l</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

SetAccuracy
SetAccuracy[<i>expr</i>,<i>a</i>] yields a version of <i>expr</i> in which all numbers have been set to have accuracy <i>a</i>. 

---

SetAlphaChannel
SetAlphaChannel[<i>color</i>] adds full opacity to <i>color</i>.

SetAlphaChannel[<i>color</i>,<i>a</i>] adds opacity <i>a</i> to <i>color</i>.

SetAlphaChannel[<i>image</i>,…] adds an alpha channel to <i>image</i>.

SetAlphaChannel[<i>video</i>,…] adds an alpha channel to the frames of <i>video</i>.

---

SetAttributes
SetAttributes[<i>symbol</i>,<i>attr</i>] adds <i>attr</i> to the list of attributes of the symbol <i>symbol</i>. 

SetAttributes["<i>symbol</i>",<i>attr</i>] adds <i>attr</i> to the attributes of the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

SetAttributes[<i>s</i>,{<i>attr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>attr</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] sets several attributes at a time.

SetAttributes[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>attrs</i>] sets attributes of several symbols at a time.

---

SetCookies
SetCookies[<i>assoc</i>] sets cookies with attributes specified by the association <i>assoc</i>, to be used by functions such as URLExecute.

SetCookies[{<i>assoc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>assoc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] sets a list of cookies.

---

SetDelayed
<i>lhs</i>:=<i>rhs</i> assigns <i>rhs</i> to be the delayed value of <i>lhs</i>. <i>rhs</i> is maintained in an unevaluated form. When <i>lhs</i> appears, it is replaced by <i>rhs</i>, evaluated afresh each time. 

---

SetDirectory
SetDirectory["<i>dir</i>"] sets the current working directory to <i>dir</i>. 

SetDirectory[] sets the current working directory to your "home" directory.

---

SetEnvironment
SetEnvironment["<i>var</i>"<i>value</i>] sets the value of an operating system environment variable.

SetEnvironment[{"<i>var</i>"<i>value</i>,…}] sets values for several environment variables.

---

SetFileDate
SetFileDate["<i>file</i>"] sets the modification and access dates for a file to be the current date. 

---

SetFileFormatProperties
SetFileFormatProperties["<i>fmt</i>","<i>prop</i>"<i>val</i>] sets the value of a property "<i>prop</i>" for the specified format "<i>fmt</i>".

SetFileFormatProperties["<i>fmt</i>",{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] sets the value of multiple properties "<i>prop</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

SetOptions
SetOptions[<i>s</i>,<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>value</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>value</i><sub>2</sub>,…] sets the specified default options for a symbol <i>s</i>. 

SetOptions[<i>stream</i>,…] or SetOptions["<i>name</i>",…] sets options associated with a particular stream. 

SetOptions[<i>object</i>,…] sets options associated with an external object such as a NotebookObject or CloudObject. 

---

SetPrecision
SetPrecision[<i>expr</i>,<i>p</i>] yields a version of <i>expr</i> in which all numbers have been set to have precision <i>p</i>. 

---

SetProperty
SetProperty[{<i>obj,itemspec</i><i>}</i>,<i>name</i><i>value</i>] sets the property <i>name</i><i>value</i> for <i>itemspec</i> in <i>obj</i>.

---

SetSharedFunction
SetSharedFunction[<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…] declares the symbols <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as shared functions that are synchronized among all parallel kernels.

---

SetSharedVariable
SetSharedVariable[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] declares the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as shared variables whose values are synchronized among all parallel kernels.

---

SetStreamPosition
SetStreamPosition[<i>stream</i>,<i>n</i>] sets the current point in an open stream. 

---

Shallow
Shallow[<i>expr</i>] prints as a shallow form of <i>expr</i>. 

Shallow[<i>expr</i>,<i>depth</i>] prints with all parts of <i>expr</i> below the specified depth given in skeleton form. 

Shallow[<i>expr</i>,{<i>depth</i>,<i>length</i>}] also gives parts whose lengths are above the specified limit in skeleton form. 

Shallow[<i>expr</i>,{<i>depth</i>,<i>length</i>},<i>form</i>] uses skeleton form for any parts that match the pattern <i>form</i>. 

---

ShannonWavelet
ShannonWavelet[] represents the Shannon wavelet evaluated on the equally spaced interval {-10,10}. 

ShannonWavelet[<i>lim</i>] represents the Shannon wavelet evaluated on the equally spaced interval {-<i>lim</i>,<i>lim</i><i>}</i>. 

---

ShapiroWilkTest
ShapiroWilkTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Shapiro–Wilk test.

ShapiroWilkTest[<i>data</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Share
Share[<i>expr</i>] changes the way <i>expr</i> is stored internally, to try and minimize the amount of memory used. 

Share[] tries to minimize the memory used to store all expressions. 

---

SharingList
SharingList is an option for CloudObject and related constructs that specifies with whom the object has been shared.

---

Sharpen
Sharpen[<i>image</i>] gives a sharpened version of <i>image</i>.

Sharpen[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives a version of <i>image</i> sharpened over pixel radius <i>r</i>.

---

ShearingMatrix
ShearingMatrix[θ,<i>v</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the matrix corresponding to shearing by θ radians along the direction of the vector <i>v</i>, and normal to the vector <i>n</i>. 

---

ShearingTransform
ShearingTransform[θ,<i>v</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a TransformationFunction that represents a shear by θ radians along the direction of the vector <i>v</i>, normal to the vector <i>n</i>, and keeping the origin fixed.

ShearingTransform[θ,<i>v</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] gives a shear that keeps the point <i>p</i> fixed, rather than the origin.

---

ShellRegion
ShellRegion[<i>reg</i>] gives a solid shell of a 3D region <i>reg</i>.

ShellRegion[<i>reg</i>,<i>t</i>] gives a solid shell of <i>reg</i> with minimal thickness <i>t</i>.

---

ShiftedGompertzDistribution
ShiftedGompertzDistribution[λ,ξ] represents a shifted Gompertz distribution with scale parameter λ and shape parameter ξ.

---

ShiftRegisterSequence
ShiftRegisterSequence[<i>n</i>] gives a complete maximum-length sequence for a size <i>n</i> linear-feedback shift register.

ShiftRegisterSequence[{<i>n</i>,{<i>tap</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tap</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] gives the complete sequence for a linear-feedback shift register with size <i>n</i> and taps at positions <i>tap</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ShiftRegisterSequence[<i>poly</i>] gives the sequence for a linear-feedback shift register with feedback polynomial <i>poly</i>.

ShiftRegisterSequence[{<i>n</i>,{<i>tap</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tap</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>}] gives the sequence for a shift register with feedback function <i>f</i>.

ShiftRegisterSequence[<i>spec</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the first <i>s</i> elements of the shift register sequence.

ShiftRegisterSequence[<i>spec</i>,<i>init</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the shift register sequence starting from state <i>init</i>.

---

Short
Short[<i>expr</i>] prints as a short form of <i>expr</i>, less than about one line long. 

Short[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] prints as a form of <i>expr</i> about <i>n</i> lines long. 

---

ShortDownArrow
ShortDownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

Shortest
Shortest[<i>p</i>] is a pattern object that matches the shortest sequence consistent with the pattern <i>p</i>. 

---

ShortestMatch
ShortestMatch[<i>p</i>] is a string pattern object matching the shortest sequence of characters consistent with the string pattern <i>p</i>.

---

ShortestPathFunction
ShortestPathFunction[<i>type</i>,<i>data</i>] represents a function that gives the shortest path from a source vertex <i>s</i> to target vertex <i>t</i> in a graph.

---

ShortLeftArrow
ShortLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

ShortRightArrow
ShortRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

ShortTimeFourier
ShortTimeFourier[<i>data</i>] returns the short-time Fourier transform (STFT) of <i>data</i> as a ShortTimeFourierData object.

ShortTimeFourier[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of length <i>n</i>.

ShortTimeFourier[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

ShortTimeFourier[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

ShortTimeFourier[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

---

ShortTimeFourierData
ShortTimeFourierData[<i>assoc</i>] represents the result and properties of a short-time Fourier transform (STFT) of a signal.

---

ShortUpArrow
ShortUpArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

Show
Show[<i>graphics</i>,<i>options</i>] shows graphics with the specified options added. 

Show[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,…] shows several graphics combined. 

---

ShowAutoSpellCheck
ShowAutoSpellCheck is an option for Cell that specifies whether to highlight misspelled words.

---

ShowAutoStyles
ShowAutoStyles is an option for Cell that specifies whether styles that are specified to be automatically used for various syntactic and other constructs should be shown. 

---

ShowCellBracket
ShowCellBracket is an option for Cell that specifies whether to display the bracket that indicates the extent of the cell. 

---

ShowCursorTracker
ShowCursorTracker is an option for Cell that specifies whether an elliptical spot should appear momentarily to guide the eye if the cursor position jumps. 

---

ShowPageBreaks
ShowPageBreaks is a notebook option that specifies whether to indicate in the on‐screen display of a notebook where page breaks would occur if the notebook were printed. 

---

ShrinkingDelay
ShrinkingDelay is an option for dynamic objects that specifies how long to delay before shrinking the size of the region in which the object is displayed to the actual size of the object. 

---

SiderealTime
SiderealTime[] gives the right ascension of the local meridian for the current date and location.

SiderealTime[<i>date</i>] gives the right ascension of the local meridian for the specified date.

SiderealTime[<i>loc</i>] gives the right ascension of the local meridian for the specified location.

SiderealTime[<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>] gives the right ascension of the local meridian for the specified date and location.

SiderealTime[{{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the right ascensions of the local meridians for all specified locations on the specified dates.

SiderealTime[<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended locations.

SiderealTime["MeanTime",<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>,<i>func</i>] gives the mean sidereal time for the specified date, location and aggregation function.

---

SiegelTheta
SiegelTheta[Ω,<i>s</i>] gives the Siegel theta function Θ (Ω,s) with Riemann modular matrix Ω and vector <i>s</i>.

SiegelTheta[{ν<sub>1</sub>,ν<sub>2</sub>},Ω,<i>s</i>] gives the Siegel theta function Θ [ν<sub>1</sub>,ν<sub>2</sub>]( Ω,s) with characteristics ν<sub>1</sub> and ν<sub>2</sub>.

---

SierpinskiCurve
SierpinskiCurve[<i>n</i>] gives the line segments representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Sierpiński curve.

---

SierpinskiMesh
SierpinskiMesh[<i>n</i>] gives a mesh region representing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Sierpiński triangle. 

SierpinskiMesh[<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup>-step Sierpiński sponge in dimension <i>d</i>.

---

Sign
Sign[<i>x</i>] gives -1, 0, or 1 depending on whether <i>x</i> is negative, zero, or positive. 

---

Signature
Signature[<i>list</i>] gives the signature of the permutation needed to place the elements of <i>list</i> in canonical order. 

---

SignedRankTest
SignedRankTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the median of <i>data</i> is zero. 

SignedRankTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the median of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub>-<i>data</i><sub>2</sub> is zero.

SignedRankTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests a location measure against μ<sub>0</sub>.

SignedRankTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

SignedRegionDistance
SignedRegionDistance[<i>reg</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the minimum distance from the point <i>p</i> to the region <i>reg</i> if <i>p</i> is outside the region and the minimum distance to the complement of <i>reg</i> if <i>p</i> is inside the region.

SignedRegionDistance[<i>reg</i>] gives a RegionDistanceFunction[…] that can be applied repeatedly to different points.

---

SignificanceLevel
SignificanceLevel is an option to VarianceTest and similar functions that controls cutoffs for diagnostic tests as well as test conclusions. 

---

SignPadding
SignPadding is an option for NumberForm and related functions that specifies whether padding should be inserted after signs. 

---

SignTest
SignTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the median of <i>data</i> is zero. 

SignTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the median of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub>– <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> is zero.

SignTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests a location measure against μ<sub>0</sub>.

SignTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

SimilarityRules
SimilarityRules is an option for functions such as SequenceAlignment that gives a list of rules for similarity scores to assume between pairs of elements.

---

SimpleGraph
SimpleGraph[<i>g</i>] gives the underlying simple graph from the graph <i>g</i>.

SimpleGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

SimpleGraphQ
SimpleGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a simple graph and False otherwise.

---

SimplePolygonQ
SimplePolygonQ[<i>poly</i>] gives True if the polygon <i>poly</i> is simple and False otherwise.

---

SimplePolyhedronQ
SimplePolyhedronQ[<i>poly</i>] gives True if the polyhedron <i>poly</i> is simple and False otherwise.

---

Simplex
Simplex[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] represents the simplex spanned by points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Simplify
Simplify[<i>expr</i>] performs a sequence of algebraic and other transformations on <i>expr</i> and returns the simplest form it finds. 

Simplify[<i>expr</i>,<i>assum</i>] does simplification using assumptions. 

---

Sin
Sin[<i>z</i>] gives the sine of <i>z</i>. 

---

Sinc
Sinc[<i>z</i>] gives sinc(z). 

---

SinghMaddalaDistribution
SinghMaddalaDistribution[<i>q</i>,<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>] represents the Singh–Maddala distribution with shape parameters <i>q</i> and <i>a</i> and scale parameter <i>b</i>.

---

SingleLetterItalics
SingleLetterItalics is an option for Cell that specifies whether single‐letter names should be displayed in italics. 

---

SingularValueDecomposition
SingularValueDecomposition[<i>m</i>] gives the singular value decomposition for a numerical matrix <i>m</i> as a list of matrices {<i>u</i>,σ,<i>v</i>}, where σ is a diagonal matrix and <i>m</i> can be written as <i>u</i>.σ.ConjugateTranspose[<i>v</i>].

SingularValueDecomposition[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized singular value decomposition of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

SingularValueDecomposition[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the singular value decomposition associated with the <i>k</i> largest singular values of <i>m</i>. 

SingularValueDecomposition[<i>m</i>,UpTo[<i>k</i>]] gives the decomposition for the <i>k</i> largest singular values, or as many as are available. 

---

SingularValueList
SingularValueList[<i>m</i>] gives a list of the nonzero singular values of a matrix <i>m</i>. 

SingularValueList[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>}] gives the generalized singular values of <i>m</i> with respect to <i>a</i>. 

SingularValueList[<i>m</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i> largest singular values of <i>m</i>. 

SingularValueList[{<i>m</i>,<i>a</i>},<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i> largest generalized singular values of <i>m</i>.

---

SingularValuePlot
SingularValuePlot[<i>lsys</i>] generates a plot of the singular values of the transfer function for the system <i>lsys</i>. 

SingularValuePlot[<i>lsys</i>,{ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots for the frequency range ω<sub><i>min</i></sub> to ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>.

SingularValuePlot[<i>expr</i>,{ω,ω<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ω<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots <i>expr</i> using the variable ω.

---

SingularValues
SingularValues[<i>m</i>] gives the singular value decomposition for a numerical matrix m<i>.</i> The result is a list {u,w,v}, where w is the list of singular values, and m can be written as ConjugateTranspose[<i>u</i>]. DiagonalMatrix[<i>w</i>].<i>v</i>.

---

Sinh
Sinh[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic sine of <i>z</i>. 

---

SinhIntegral
SinhIntegral[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic sine integral function Shi(z). 

---

SinIntegral
SinIntegral[<i>z</i>] gives the sine integral function Si(z)=∫<sub>0</sub><sup>z</sup>sin(t)/t dt. 

---

SixJSymbol
SixJSymbol[{<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>3</sub>},{<i>j</i><sub>4</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>5</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>6</sub>}] gives the values of the Wigner 6‐<i>j</i> symbol. 

---

Skeleton
Skeleton[<i>n</i>] represents a sequence of <i>n</i> omitted elements in an expression printed with Short or Shallow. The standard print form for Skeleton is <i>n</i>. 

---

SkeletonTransform
SkeletonTransform[<i>image</i>] gives the skeleton transform of <i>image</i>, in which the value of each skeleton pixel is its distance to the nearest background pixel.

SkeletonTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

SkellamDistribution
SkellamDistribution[μ<sub>1</sub>,μ<sub>2</sub>] represents a Skellam distribution with shape parameters μ<sub>1</sub> and μ<sub>2</sub>.

---

Skewness
Skewness[<i>data</i>] gives the coefficient of skewness estimate for the elements in <i>data</i>.

Skewness[<i>dist</i>] gives the coefficient of skewness for the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

SkewNormalDistribution
SkewNormalDistribution[μ,σ,α] represents a skew-normal distribution with shape parameter α, location parameter μ, and scale parameter σ.

---

SkinStyle
SkinStyle is an option of AnatomyPlot3D that specifies what style to use for automatically included skin subparts.

---

Skip
Skip[<i>stream</i>,<i>type</i>] skips one object of the specified type in an input stream. 

Skip[<i>stream</i>,<i>type</i>,<i>n</i>] skips <i>n</i> objects of the specified type. 

---

SliceContourPlot3D
SliceContourPlot3D[<i>f</i>,<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a contour plot of <i>f</i> over the slice surface <i>surf</i> as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, and <i>z</i>.

SliceContourPlot3D[<i>f</i>,<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] restricts the surface to be within region <i>reg</i>.

SliceContourPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] generates contour plots over several slices. 

---

SliceDensityPlot3D
SliceDensityPlot3D[<i>f</i>,<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a density plot of <i>f</i> over the slice surface <i>surf</i> as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, and <i>z</i>.

SliceDensityPlot3D[<i>f</i>,<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] restricts the surface to be within region <i>reg</i>.

SliceDensityPlot3D[<i>f</i>,{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] generates density plots over several slices. 

---

SliceDistribution
SliceDistribution[<i>proc</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the distribution of the process state at time <i>t</i>.

SliceDistribution[<i>proc</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>t</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] represents the joint distribution of process states at times <i>t</i><sub>1</sub><⋯<<i>t</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

---

SliceVectorPlot3D
SliceVectorPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a vector plot of the field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>} over the slice surface <i>surf</i>. 

SliceVectorPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},<i>surf</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] restricts the surface <i>surf</i> to be within the region <i>reg</i>.

SliceVectorPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>surf</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>surf</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] generates vector plots over several slice surfaces <i>surf</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Slot
# represents the first argument supplied to a pure function. 

#<i>n</i> represents the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> argument. 

#<i>name</i> represents the value associated with key "<i>name</i>" in an association in the first argument. 

---

Small
Small is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be small.

---

SmallCircle
SmallCircle[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∘<i>y</i>∘….

---

Smaller
Smaller is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be smaller.

---

SmithDecomposition
SmithDecomposition[<i>m</i>] gives the Smith normal form decomposition of an integer matrix <i>m</i>.

---

SmithDelayCompensator
SmithDelayCompensator[<i>sys</i>,<i>con</i>] gives the Smith compensator for the time-delay system <i>sys</i> and the delay-free controller <i>con</i>.

---

SmithWatermanSimilarity
SmithWatermanSimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a number representing the Smith–Waterman similarity between strings or vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

SmithWatermanSimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives a number representing the Smith–Waterman similarity between strings, vectors or bio sequences <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

SmoothDensityHistogram
SmoothDensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a smooth kernel histogram of the values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

SmoothDensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>espec</i>] plots a smooth kernel histogram with estimator specification <i>espec</i>.

SmoothDensityHistogram[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>espec</i>,<i>dfun</i>] plots the distribution function <i>dfun</i>.

---

SmoothHistogram
SmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a smooth kernel histogram for the PDF of the values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>espec</i>] plots a smooth kernel histogram with estimator specification <i>espec</i>.

SmoothHistogram[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>espec</i>,<i>dfun</i>] plots the distribution function <i>dfun</i>. 

SmoothHistogram[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots smooth kernel histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SmoothHistogram3D
SmoothHistogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots a 3D smooth kernel histogram of the values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

SmoothHistogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>espec</i>] plots a 3D smooth kernel histogram with estimator specification <i>espec</i>.

SmoothHistogram3D[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>espec</i>,<i>dfun</i>] plots the distribution function <i>dfun</i>.

SmoothHistogram3D[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots smooth kernel histograms for multiple datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SmoothKernelDistribution
SmoothKernelDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a smooth kernel distribution based on the data values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SmoothKernelDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] represents a multivariate smooth kernel distribution based on the data values {<i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…}.

SmoothKernelDistribution[…,<i>bw</i>] represents a smooth kernel distribution with bandwidth <i>bw</i>.

SmoothKernelDistribution[…,<i>bw</i>,<i>ker</i>] represents a smooth kernel distribution with bandwidth <i>bw</i> and smoothing kernel <i>ker</i>.

---

SmoothPointDensity
SmoothPointDensity[<i>pdata</i>] estimates the point density function μ(x) for point data <i>pdata</i>.

SmoothPointDensity[<i>pdata</i>,<i>bw</i>] estimates the density for point data <i>pdata</i> with bandwidth <i>bw</i>.

SmoothPointDensity[<i>pdata</i>,<i>bw</i>,<i>ker</i>] estimates the density for point data <i>pdata</i> with bandwidth <i>bw</i> and smoothing kernel <i>ker</i>.

SmoothPointDensity[<i>bdata</i>,…] estimates the point density function μ(x) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

SmoothPointDensity[<i>pproc</i>,…] computes the density function μ(x) for point process <i>pproc</i>.

---

SnDispersion
SnDispersion[<i>list</i>] gives the S<sub>n</sub> statistic of the elements in <i>list</i>.

SnDispersion[<i>list</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the S<sub>n</sub> statistic with scaling factor <i>c</i>.

---

Snippet
Snippet[<i>doc</i>] gives a snippet of text from a document or other content object.

Snippet[<i>doc</i>,<i>n</i>] gives about <i>n</i> lines from the beginning. 

Snippet[<i>doc</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives about <i>n</i> lines from the end.

Snippet[<i>doc</i>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>;;<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>] gives a span from lines <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>

Snippet[<i>doc</i>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>;;<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>;;<i>n</i><sub>3</sub>] gives a span from lines <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>n</i><sub>2</sub> in steps of <i>n</i><sub>3</sub>.

Snippet[ContentObject[…],SearchResultObject[…]] gives contextual snippets from a content object based on search results.

---

SnippetsVideo
SnippetsVideo[<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a summary video based on <i>n</i> snippets from <i>video</i>.

SnippetsVideo[<i>video</i>,<i>timespec</i>] returns a summary video based on snippets taken at times specified by <i>timespec</i>.

---

SnubPolyhedron
SnubPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the snub polyhedron of <i>poly</i> by truncating some corners.

---

SocialMediaData
SocialMediaData["<i>name</i>"] gives information about the social media entity "<i>name</i>".

SocialMediaData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specified property for the social media entity "<i>name</i>".

SocialMediaData[{"<i>name</i>",<i>id</i>},"<i>property</i>"] gives the value of a property for the specified identifier <i>id</i>.

---

Socket
Socket is a possible value returned by FileType and related functions.

---

SocketConnect
SocketConnect[<i>address</i>] makes a socket connection to the TCP host at the specified address and returns a SocketObject representing the connection.

SocketConnect[<i>address</i>,"<i>protocol</i>"] makes a connection to the host at <i>address</i> with the specified protocol.

SocketConnect[<i>socket</i>] makes a connection to a local socket opened in the current session.

---

SocketListen
SocketListen[<i>socket</i>,<i>fun</i><i>]</i> starts listening on the specified socket, asynchronously applying <i>fun</i> whenever data is received on the socket.

SocketListen[<i>port</i>,<i>fun</i>] starts listening for active connections on the specified port of 127.0.0.1.

SocketListen[<i>address</i>,<i>fun</i>] starts listening for active connections on the specified address <i>address</i> on the local machine.

SocketListen[<i>spec</i>,<i>opts</i>] starts listening for active connections defined by <i>spec</i> using the options <i>opts</i>.

SocketListen[<i>spec</i><i>]</i> starts listening for active connections defined by <i>spec</i>, but does not set up handler functions, etc.

---

SocketListener
SocketListener[…] represents a socket listener created by SocketListen.

---

SocketObject
SocketObject[…] represents a network socket connection.

---

SocketOpen
SocketOpen[<i>port</i>] opens a socket that accepts TCP connections to localhost:<i>port</i> and returns a SocketObject representing the socket.

SocketOpen[<i>address</i>] opens a socket that accepts TCP connections to the specified local address. 

SocketOpen[<i>address</i>,"<i>protocol</i>"] opens a socket that accepts connections with the specified protocol.

SocketOpen[<i>address</i>,{"<i>protocol</i>","<i>type</i>"}] opens a socket that accepts connections of the specified <i>protocol</i> and <i>type</i>.

---

SocketReadMessage
SocketReadMessage[<i>socket</i>] reads the next available message on the specified socket, returning it as a byte array.

---

SocketReadyQ
SocketReadyQ[<i>socket</i>] tests if there is any data immediately available to read from the specified socket. 

SocketReadyQ[<i>socket</i>,<i>t</i>] waits for up to <i>t</i> seconds to see if data becomes available to read.

---

Sockets
Sockets[] returns all active socket connections initiated by your current Wolfram Language session.

Sockets[All] returns all sockets connected to your current session, including remote sockets originating outside your current session.

Sockets[<i>spec</i>] returns only sockets specified by <i>spec</i>.

---

SocketWaitAll
SocketWaitAll[{<i>socket</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>socket</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] waits until there is data ready to read on all of the <i>socket</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SocketWaitNext
SocketWaitNext[{<i>socket</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>socket</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] waits until there is data ready to read on any of the <i>socket</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, then returns that socket.

---

SoftmaxLayer
SoftmaxLayer[] represents a softmax net layer.

SoftmaxLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a softmax net layer that uses level <i>n</i> as the normalization dimension.

---

SokalSneathDissimilarity
SokalSneathDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Sokal–Sneath dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

SolarEclipse
SolarEclipse[] gives the date of the next solar eclipse.

SolarEclipse[<i>date</i>] gives the date of the next solar eclipse after the specified <i>date</i>.

SolarEclipse[<i>prop</i>] gives the value of property <i>prop</i> for the next solar eclipse.

SolarEclipse[<i>date</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the value of property <i>prop</i> for the next solar eclipse after <i>date</i>.

---

SolarTime
SolarTime[] gives the angle on the celestial equator between the Sun and the local antimeridian for the current location and date.

SolarTime[<i>loc</i>] gives the solar time angle for the specified location and current date.

SolarTime[<i>date</i>] gives the solar time angle for the specified date and current location.

SolarTime[<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>] gives the solar time for the specified location and date.

SolarTime["MeanTime",<i>loc</i>,<i>date</i>] gives the mean solar time for the specified location and date.

---

SolidAngle
SolidAngle[<i>p</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>d</i></sub>}] gives the solid angle at the point <i>p</i> and spanned by the vectors <i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>d</i></sub>.

SolidAngle[<i>p</i>,<i>reg</i>] gives the solid angle subtended by the region <i>reg</i>.

---

SolidBoundaryLoadValue
SolidBoundaryLoadValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a boundary load condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

SolidBoundaryLoadValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkeys</i>] represents a boundary load condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

SolidData
SolidData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the solid <i>entity</i>.

SolidData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified solid entities.

SolidData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SolidDisplacementCondition
SolidDisplacementCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a prescribed displacement on a solid boundary for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

SolidDisplacementCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkeys</i>] represents a prescribed displacement with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

SolidFixedCondition
SolidFixedCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a fully constrained solid boundary for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>. 

---

SolidMechanicsPDEComponent
SolidMechanicsPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields solid mechanics PDE terms with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

SolidMechanicsStrain
SolidMechanicsStrain[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>displ</i>] yields a solid mechanics total strain with variables <i>vars</i>, parameters <i>pars</i> and displacements <i>displ</i>.

---

SolidMechanicsStress
SolidMechanicsStress[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>strain</i>] yields solid mechanics internal stress with variables <i>vars</i>, parameters <i>pars</i> and total strain <i>strain</i>.

SolidMechanicsStress[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>strain</i>,<i>displacement</i>] yields solid mechanics stress for nonlinear material laws.

---

SolidRegionQ
SolidRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] gives True if the 3D region <i>reg</i> is a solid region and False otherwise.

---

Solve
Solve[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] attempts to solve the system <i>expr</i> of equations or inequalities for the variables <i>vars</i>. 

Solve[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] solves over the domain <i>dom</i>. Common choices of <i>dom</i> are Reals, Integers, and Complexes.

---

SolveAlways
SolveAlways[<i>eqns</i>,<i>vars</i>] gives the values of parameters that make the equations <i>eqns</i> valid for all values of the variables <i>vars</i>. 

---

SolveDelayed
SolveDelayed is an obsolete option to NDSolve. The option "EquationSimplification" should be used instead.

---

SolveValues
SolveValues[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] gives the values of <i>vars</i> determined by the solutions of the system <i>expr</i>.

SolveValues[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>dom</i>] uses solutions over the domain <i>dom</i>. Common choices of <i>dom</i> are Reals, Integers and Complexes.

---

Sort
Sort[<i>list</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> into canonical order. 

Sort[<i>list</i>,<i>p</i>] sorts using the ordering function <i>p</i>. 

---

SortBy
SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> in the order defined by applying <i>f</i> to each of them. 

SortBy[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] breaks ties by successively using the values obtained from the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SortBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>p</i>] sorts the elements of <i>list</i> using the function <i>p</i> to compare the results of applying <i>f</i> to each element.

SortBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of SortBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

SortedBy
SortedBy is an option that specifies a function by which to sort the results of a computation.

---

SortedEntityClass
SortedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>prop</i>] represents an entity class derived from <i>class</i> by sorting according to the values of the property <i>prop</i>. 

SortedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>prop</i>"<i>order</i>"] sorts according to <i>prop</i> in the order specified.

SortedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] breaks ties by successively using the values of the property specifications <i>prop</i><sub>i</sub>.

SortedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>sortspec</i>,<i>n</i>] represents the first <i>n</i> entities of <i>class</i> when sorted by <i>sortspec</i>.

SortedEntityClass[<i>class</i>,<i>sortspec</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] represents the entities <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> of <i>class</i> when sorted by <i>sortspec</i>.

---

Sound
Sound[<i>primitives</i>] represents a sound. 

Sound[<i>primitives</i>,<i>t</i>] specifies that the sound should have duration <i>t</i>.

Sound[<i>primitives</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] specifies that the sound should extend from time <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to time <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

SoundNote
SoundNote[<i>pitch</i>] represents a music-like sound note with the specified pitch.

SoundNote[<i>pitch</i>,<i>t</i>] takes the note to have duration <i>t</i>.

SoundNote[<i>pitch</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] takes the note to occupy the time interval <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

SoundNote[<i>pitch</i>,<i>tspec</i>,"<i>style</i>"] takes the note to be in the specified style.

SoundNote[<i>pitch</i>,<i>tspec</i>,"<i>style</i>",<i>opts</i>] uses the specified rendering options for the note.

---

SoundVolume
SoundVolume is an option to Sound and SoundNote and related functions that specifies the relative volume of the sound produced.

---

SourcePDETerm
SourcePDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>f</i>] represents a source term f with source coefficient f and model variables <i>vars</i>.

SourcePDETerm[<i>vars</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>pars</i>] uses model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

Sow
Sow[<i>e</i>] specifies that <i>e</i> should be collected by the nearest enclosing Reap. 

Sow[<i>e</i>,<i>tag</i>] specifies that <i>e</i> should be collected by the nearest enclosing Reap whose pattern matches <i>tag</i>. 

Sow[<i>e</i>,{<i>tag</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tag</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] specifies that <i>e</i> should be collected once for each pattern that matches a <i>tag</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

SpaceCurveData
SpaceCurveData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the space curve <i>entity</i>.

SpaceCurveData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified space curve entities.

SpaceCurveData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SpaceForm
SpaceForm[<i>n</i>] prints as <i>n</i> spaces.

---

Spacer
Spacer[<i>w</i>] displays as a spacer <i>w</i> printer's points wide.

Spacer[{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>}] displays as a spacer <i>w</i> points wide and a total of <i>h</i> points high.

Spacer[{<i>w</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>dh</i>}] makes the spacer extend <i>dh</i> points below the baseline. 

---

Spacings
Spacings is an option to Grid and related constructs that specifies the spacings to leave between successive objects.

---

Span
<i>i</i>;;<i>j</i> represents a span of elements <i>i</i> through <i>j</i>.

<i>i</i>;; represents a span from <i>i</i> to the end.

;;<i>j</i> represents a span from the beginning to <i>j</i>.

;; represents a span that includes all elements.

<i>i</i>;;<i>j</i>;;<i>k</i> represents a span from <i>i</i> through <i>j</i> in steps of <i>k</i>.

<i>i</i>;;;;<i>k</i> represents a span from <i>i</i> to the end in steps of <i>k</i>.

;;<i>j</i>;;<i>k</i> represents a span from the beginning to <i>j</i> in steps of <i>k</i>.

;;;;<i>k</i> represents a span from the beginning to the end in steps of <i>k</i>. 

---

SpanAdjustments
SpanAdjustments is an option for selections that specifies the height and width of spanning characters.

---

SpanCharacterRounding
SpanCharacterRounding is an option for selections that specifies the method used for rounding a spanning character when its size is to be adjusted.

---

SpanFromAbove
SpanFromAbove is a symbol that can appear at a particular position in a Grid or related construct to indicate that the corresponding position is occupied by a spanning element that appears above it.

---

SpanFromBoth
SpanFromBoth is a symbol that can appear at a particular position in a Grid or related construct to indicate that the corresponding position is occupied by a spanning element that appears above and to its left.

---

SpanFromLeft
SpanFromLeft is a symbol that can appear at a particular position in a Grid or related construct to indicate that the corresponding position is occupied by a spanning element that appears to its left.

---

SpanLineThickness
SpanLineThickness is an option for selections that specifies the thickness in printer's points of line-spanning characters such as ∖[VerticalLine] and ∖[HorizontalLine].

---

SpanMaxSize
SpanMaxSize is an option for selections that specifies the maximum size of spanning characters such as parentheses and brackets.

---

SpanMinSize
SpanMinSize is an option for selections that specifies the minimum size of spanning characters such as parentheses and brackets.

---

SpanSymmetric
SpanSymmetric is an option for selections that specifies whether vertically expandable characters are symmetric about the axis of the selection.

---

SparseArray
SparseArray[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub><i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a sparse array with all elements zero except for values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SparseArray[<i>list</i>] yields a sparse array version of <i>list</i>. 

SparseArray[<i>data</i>,{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a sparse array representing a <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>×… array. 

SparseArray[<i>data</i>,<i>dims</i>,<i>val</i>] yields a sparse array in which unspecified elements are taken to have value <i>val</i>. 

---

SparseArrayQ
SparseArrayQ[<i>s</i>] yields True if <i>s</i> is a valid SparseArray object and False otherwise.

---

SpatialBinnedPointData
SpatialBinnedPointData[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> associated with disjoint regions <i>reg</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

SpatialBinnedPointData[{<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the same result. 

SpatialBinnedPointData[…,<i>reg</i>] gives the overall observation region <i>reg</i>. 

---

SpatialBoundaryCorrection
SpatialBoundaryCorrection is an option to various spatial statistics functions that control how to correct for boundary effects of observation regions. 

---

SpatialEstimate
SpatialEstimate[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a spatial prediction from values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> given at locations <i>loc</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

SpatialEstimate[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates the same result. 

---

SpatialEstimatorFunction
SpatialEstimatorFunction[] represents a function generated by SpatialEstimate and predicts spatial field values from locations.

---

SpatialGraphDistribution
SpatialGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>] represents a spatial distribution for graphs with <i>n</i> vertices uniformly distributed over the unit square and edges between vertices that are at distance at most <i>r</i>.

SpatialGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>d</i>] represents a spatial distribution for graphs with vertices uniformly distributed over the <i>d</i>-dimensional unit square.

SpatialGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>dist</i>] represents a spatial distribution for graphs with vertices distributed according to the probability distribution <i>dist</i>.

SpatialGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>reg</i>] represents a spatial distribution for graphs with vertices uniformly distributed in the region <i>reg</i>.

---

SpatialJ
SpatialJ[<i>pdata</i>,<i>r</i>] estimates the J function J(r) for point data <i>pdata</i> at radius <i>r</i>.

SpatialJ[<i>pproc</i>,<i>r</i>] computes J(r) for the point process <i>pproc</i>.

SpatialJ[<i>bdata</i>,<i>r</i>] computes J(r) for binned data <i>bdata</i>. 

SpatialJ[<i>pspec</i>] generates the function J that can be applied repeatedly to different radii <i>r</i>.

---

SpatialMedian
SpatialMedian[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the spatial median of the elements x<sub>i</sub>.

SpatialMedian[<i>data</i>] gives the spatial median for several different forms of <i>data</i>. 

---

SpatialNoiseLevel
SpatialNoiseLevel is an option to SpatialEstimate and other spatial functions that gives the noise variance level in the data.

---

SpatialObservationRegionQ
SpatialObservationRegionQ[<i>reg</i>] tests whether the geometric or geographic region <i>reg</i> can be an observation in spatial statistics. 

---

SpatialPointData
SpatialPointData[<i>points</i>] represents a collection of spatial locations <i>points</i>.

SpatialPointData[<i>points</i>,<i>reg</i>] represents a collection of points within the region <i>reg</i>.

SpatialPointData[<i>points</i><i>vals</i>,…] associates the values <i>vals</i> with the location <i>points</i>.

SpatialPointData[<i>points</i><|<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>vals</i><sub>1</sub>,…|>,…] associates the key-value annotations <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>vals</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SpatialPointData[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub><i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub><i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] represents the spatial point collection {<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…} with associated values {<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

SpatialPointData[{<i>points</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>points</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] represents multiple collections of spatial points.

SpatialPointData[{<i>points</i><sub>1</sub><i>anns</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>points</i><sub>2</sub><i>anns</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] represents multiple collections of spatial points with annotations.

---

SpatialPointSelect
SpatialPointSelect[<i>spdata</i>,<i>crit</i>] selects a subset of the SpatialPointData <i>spdata</i> according to <i>crit</i>.

---

SpatialRandomnessTest
SpatialRandomnessTest[<i>pdata</i>] tests whether the point collection <i>pdata</i> is distributed uniformly over the observation region.

SpatialRandomnessTest[<i>pdata</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

SpatialTransformationLayer
SpatialTransformationLayer[{<i>h</i>,<i>w</i>}] represents a net layer that applies an affine transformation to an input of size <i>c</i>×<i>h</i><sub>0</sub>×<i>w</i><sub>0</sub> and returns an output of size <i>c</i>×<i>h</i>×<i>w</i>.

---

SpatialTrendFunction
SpatialTrendFunction is an option to SpatialEstimate that specifies what global trend model to use for data. 

---

Speak
Speak[<i>expr</i>] speaks a spoken representation of the expression <i>expr</i>.

---

SpeakerMatchQ
SpeakerMatchQ[<i>audio</i>,<i>ref</i>] gives True if speaker features in <i>audio</i> match the one from reference <i>ref</i> and returns False otherwise.

SpeakerMatchQ[{<i>audio</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>audio</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>ref</i>] gives a list of results for each of <i>audio</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SpeakerMatchQ[<i>ref</i>] represents an operator form of SpeakerMatchQ that can be applied to an audio object.

---

SpearmanRankTest
SpearmanRankTest[<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the vectors <i>v</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>v</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

SpearmanRankTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

SpearmanRankTest[…,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

SpeciesData
SpeciesData[<i>name</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the species <i>entity</i>.

SpeciesData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified species entities.

SpeciesData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SpecificityGoal
SpecificityGoal is an option for ImageIdentify and related functions that defines what specificity of object to seek to identify.

---

SpectralLineData
SpectralLineData[<i>entity</i>] gives the values of all known properties for an atomic state or state transition.

SpectralLineData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the given entity.

SpectralLineData[<i>quantity</i>] returns the state transition with the closest wavelength or frequency specified.

SpectralLineData[<i>class</i>,<i>quantity</i>] returns the entity in the specified entity class with the closest wavelength or energy to the specified quantity.

SpectralLineData[<i>spec</i>,{<i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub>}] returns the entities in <i>spec</i> that fall within the range specified between <i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>quantity</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

Spectrogram
Spectrogram[<i>list</i>] plots the spectrogram of <i>list</i>.

Spectrogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of length <i>n</i>.

Spectrogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

Spectrogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

Spectrogram[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

Spectrogram[<i>audio</i>,…] plots the spectrogram of <i>audio</i>.

Spectrogram[<i>video</i>] plots the spectrogram of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

SpectrogramArray
SpectrogramArray[<i>list</i>] returns the spectrogram data of <i>list</i>.

SpectrogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of length <i>n</i>.

SpectrogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

SpectrogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>] applies a smoothing window <i>wfun</i> to each partition.

SpectrogramArray[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>wfun</i>,<i>m</i>] pads partitions with zeros to length <i>m</i> prior to the computation of the transform.

SpectrogramArray[<i>audio</i>,…] returns spectrogram data of <i>audio</i>.

SpectrogramArray[<i>video</i>] returns the spectrogram data of the first audio track in <i>video</i>.

---

Specularity
Specularity[<i>s</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that surfaces of 3D graphics objects which follow are to be taken to have specularity <i>s</i>. 

Specularity[<i>s</i>,<i>n</i>] uses specular exponent <i>n</i>. 

---

SpeechCases
SpeechCases[<i>audio</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a list of cases of text identified as being of type <i>form</i> that appear in the transcription of <i>audio</i>.

SpeechCases[<i>audio</i>,{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association of results for all the types <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

SpeechCases[<i>audio</i>,<i>formspec</i><i>prop</i>] gives the specified property for each result found.

SpeechCases[<i>audio</i>,<i>formspec</i>{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of properties for each result found.

SpeechCases[<i>audio</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> cases found.

---

SpeechInterpreter
SpeechInterpreter[<i>form</i>] represents an interpreter object that can be applied to a speech input to try to interpret it as an object of the specified form. 

SpeechInterpreter[<i>form</i>,<i>test</i>] returns the interpreted object only if applying <i>test</i> to it yields True; otherwise, it returns a Failure object.

SpeechInterpreter[<i>form</i>,<i>test</i>,<i>fail</i>] returns the result of applying the function <i>fail</i> if the test fails.

---

SpeechRecognize
SpeechRecognize[<i>audio</i>] recognizes speech in <i>audio</i> and returns it as a string.

SpeechRecognize[<i>audio</i>,<i>level</i>] returns a list of strings at the specified structural level.

SpeechRecognize[<i>audio</i>,<i>level</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns <i>prop</i> for text at the given level.

---

SpeechSynthesize
SpeechSynthesize[<i>expr</i>] synthesizes the contents of <i>expr</i> as an Audio object. 

SpeechSynthesize[<i>expr</i>,<i>voice</i>] uses the specified <i>voice</i> to synthesize the speech signal.

---

SpellingCorrection
SpellingCorrection is an option for StringMatchQ, Names, and related functions that specifies whether strings should be considered to match even when a small fraction of the characters in them are different. 

---

SpellingCorrectionList
SpellingCorrectionList["<i>word</i>"] gives a list of possible spelling corrections for "<i>word</i>".

---

SpellingDictionaries
SpellingDictionaries is a global option that specifies settings for spell checking.

---

SpellingDictionariesPath
SpellingDictionariesPath is a global option that specifies which directories are searched for spelling dictionaries when the Edit ▶ Check Spelling menu item is used.

---

Sphere
Sphere[<i>p</i>] represents a unit sphere centered at the point <i>p</i>.

Sphere[<i>p</i>,<i>r</i>] represents a sphere of radius <i>r</i> centered at the point <i>p</i>.

Sphere[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>r</i>] represents a collection of spheres of radius <i>r</i>.

---

SpherePoints
SpherePoints[<i>n</i>] gives the positions of <i>n</i> uniformly distributed points on the surface of a unit sphere.

---

SphericalBesselJ
SphericalBesselJ[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the spherical Bessel function of the first kind j<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

SphericalBesselY
SphericalBesselY[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the spherical Bessel function of the second kind y<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

SphericalHankelH1
SphericalHankelH1[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the spherical Hankel function of the first kind h<sub>n</sub><sup>(1)</sup>(z). 

---

SphericalHankelH2
SphericalHankelH2[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the spherical Hankel function of the second kind h<sub>n</sub><sup>(2)</sup>(z). 

---

SphericalHarmonicY
SphericalHarmonicY[<i>l</i>,<i>m</i>,θ,ϕ] gives the spherical harmonic Y<sub>l</sub><sup>m</sup>(θ,ϕ). 

---

SphericalPlot3D
SphericalPlot3D[<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ] generates a 3D plot with a spherical radius <i>r</i> as a function of spherical coordinates θ and ϕ.

SphericalPlot3D[<i>r</i>,{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>},{ϕ,ϕ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ϕ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a 3D spherical plot over the specified ranges of spherical coordinates.

SphericalPlot3D[{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>},{ϕ,ϕ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,ϕ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a 3D spherical plot with multiple surfaces.

---

SphericalRegion
SphericalRegion is an option for three-dimensional graphics functions that specifies whether the final image should be scaled so that a sphere drawn around the three‐dimensional bounding box would fit in the display area specified. 

---

SphericalShell
SphericalShell[<i>c</i>,{<i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>}] represents a filled spherical shell centered at <i>c</i> with inner radius <i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub> and outer radius <i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>.

---

SpheroidalEigenvalue
SpheroidalEigenvalue[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ] gives the spheroidal eigenvalue with degree n and order m.

---

SpheroidalJoiningFactor
SpheroidalJoiningFactor[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ] gives the spheroidal joining factor with degree <i>n</i> and order <i>m</i>.

---

SpheroidalPS
SpheroidalPS[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the angular spheroidal function PS<sub>n,m</sub>(γ,z) of the first kind.

---

SpheroidalPSPrime
SpheroidalPSPrime[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the derivative with respect to z of the angular spheroidal function PS<sub>n,m</sub>(γ,z) of the first kind.

---

SpheroidalQS
SpheroidalQS[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the angular spheroidal function QS<sub>n,m</sub>(γ,z) of the second kind.

---

SpheroidalQSPrime
SpheroidalQSPrime[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the derivative with respect to z of the angular spheroidal function QS<sub>n,m</sub>(γ,z) of the second kind.

---

SpheroidalRadialFactor
SpheroidalRadialFactor[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>c</i>] gives the spheroidal radial factor with degree <i>n</i> and order <i>m</i>.

---

SpheroidalS1
SpheroidalS1[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the radial spheroidal function S<sub>n,m</sub><sup>(1)</sup>(γ,z) of the first kind.

---

SpheroidalS2
SpheroidalS2[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,γ,<i>z</i>] gives the radial spheroidal function S<sub>n,m</sub><sup>(2)</sup>(γ,z) of the second kind.

---

Splice
Splice[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an expression that will automatically be spliced into any list in which it appears as the sequence of elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Splice[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>hpatt</i>] represents an expression that will automatically be spliced into any expression whose head matches the pattern <i>hpatt</i>.

---

SplicedDistribution
SplicedDistribution[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>w</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>c</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>dist</i><sub>1,</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>dist</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the distribution obtained by splicing the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, … truncated on the intervals {<i>c</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>}, {<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>}, … with weights <i>w</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>w</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

---

SplineClosed
SplineClosed is an option for B-spline functions and graphics primitives that specifies whether spline curves or surfaces should be closed. 

---

SplineDegree
SplineDegree is an option for spline functions and graphics primitives that specifies the degree of polynomial basis to use.

---

SplineKnots
SplineKnots is an option for B-spline functions and graphics primitives that specifies the positions of knots.

---

SplineWeights
SplineWeights is an option for B-spline functions and graphics primitives that specifies weights of control points.

---

Split
Split[<i>list</i>] splits <i>list</i> into sublists consisting of runs of identical elements. 

Split[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] treats pairs of adjacent elements as identical whenever applying the function <i>test</i> to them yields True. 

---

SplitBy
SplitBy[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] splits <i>list</i> into sublists consisting of runs of successive elements that give the same value when <i>f</i> is applied.

SplitBy[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] recursively splits <i>list</i> into sublists by testing elements successively with each of the <i>f</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SpokenString
SpokenString[<i>expr</i>] gives a string of text corresponding to a spoken representation of the expression <i>expr</i>.

---

SpotLight
SpotLight[<i>col</i>,<i>pt</i>,α] is a three-dimensional graphics directive to use in coloring 3D surfaces that specifies the spotlight of color <i>col</i> at position <i>pt</i> aimed at the center with half-angle α.

SpotLight[<i>col</i>,{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>},α] uses the spotlight at position <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub> aimed at <i>pt</i><sub>2</sub> with half-angle α.

SpotLight[<i>col</i>,{<i>pt</i>,<i>tar</i>},{α,<i>s</i>},<i>att</i>] uses the spotlight with spot exponent <i>s</i> and attenuation <i>att</i>.

---

Sqrt
Sqrt[<i>z</i>] or @<i>z</i> gives the square root of <i>z</i>. 

---

Square
Square[<i>x</i>] displays as <i>x</i>.

---

SquaredEuclideanDistance
SquaredEuclideanDistance[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the squared Euclidean distance between vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

SquareFreeQ
