SquareFreeQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a square-free polynomial or number, and False otherwise.

SquareFreeQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>vars</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is square free with respect to the variables <i>vars</i>. 

---

SquareIntersection
SquareIntersection[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊓<i>y</i>⊓….

---

SquareMatrixQ
SquareMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is a square matrix, and False otherwise.

---

SquareRepeatingElement
SquareRepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>] represents a square array of elements of type <i>spec</i> in an interpreter, API or form specification.

SquareRepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,<i>max</i>] represents a square array of elements of maximum size <i>max</i>×<i>max</i>.

SquareRepeatingElement[<i>spec</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents a square array of elements of size between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>.

---

SquaresR
SquaresR[<i>d</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the number of ways r<sub>d</sub>(n) to represent the integer <i>n</i> as a sum of <i>d</i> squares.

---

SquareSubset
SquareSubset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊏<i>y</i>⊏….

---

SquareSubsetEqual
SquareSubsetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊑<i>y</i>⊑….

---

SquareSuperset
SquareSuperset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊐<i>y</i>⊐….

---

SquareSupersetEqual
SquareSupersetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊒<i>y</i>⊒….

---

SquareUnion
SquareUnion[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊔<i>y</i>⊔….

---

SquareWave
SquareWave[<i>x</i>] gives a square wave that alternates between +1 and -1 with unit period.

SquareWave[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},<i>x</i>] gives a square wave that alternates between <i>y</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>y</i><sub>2</sub> with unit period. 

---

SSSTriangle
SSSTriangle[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>] returns a filled triangle with sides of lengths <i>a</i>, <i>b</i>, and <i>c</i>.

---

StabilityMargins
StabilityMargins is an option to frequency response plots such as BodePlot, NyquistPlot, and NicholsPlot that specifies the gain and phase margins to be shown on the plot.

---

StabilityMarginsStyle
StabilityMarginsStyle is an option to frequency response plots such as BodePlot, NyquistPlot, and NicholsPlot that specifies the styles in which the gain and phase margins are to be drawn.

---

StableDistribution
StableDistribution[<i>type</i>,α,β,μ,σ] represents the stable distribution <i>S</i><sub><i>type</i></sub> with index of stability α, skewness parameter β, location parameter μ, and scale parameter σ.

---

Stack
Stack[] shows the current evaluation stack, giving a list of the tags associated with evaluations that are currently being done. 

Stack[<i>pattern</i>] gives a list of expressions currently being evaluated which match the pattern. 

---

StackBegin
StackBegin[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, starting a fresh evaluation stack. 

---

StackComplete
StackComplete[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> with intermediate expressions in evaluation chains included on the stack. 

---

StackedDateListPlot
StackedDateListPlot[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] plots points with values <i>y<sub>i</sub></i> at a sequence of dates.

StackedDateListPlot[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>datespec</i>] plots points with dates at equal intervals specified by <i>datespec</i>.

StackedDateListPlot[<i>tseries</i>] plots the time series <i>tseries</i>.

StackedDateListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots data from all the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StackedDateListPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

StackedListPlot
StackedListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots lines for each of the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, with the <i>i</i><sup>th</sup> curve being the accumulation of values in <i>data</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StackedListPlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

---

StackInhibit
StackInhibit[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> without modifying the evaluation stack. 

---

StadiumShape
StadiumShape[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>}},<i>r</i>] represents a stadium of radius <i>r</i> between the points {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>} and {<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>}.

---

StandardAtmosphereData
StandardAtmosphereData[<i>altitude</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the value of the property at the specified geometrical altitude for the chosen model of the standard Earth atmosphere.

StandardAtmosphereData[<i>layer</i>,<i>property</i>] returns a piecewise symbolic approximation with the range of an atmospheric layer for the property.

StandardAtmosphereData["SymbolicApproximation",<i>property</i>] returns the full piecewise symbolic approximation for the property.

---

StandardDeviation
StandardDeviation[<i>data</i>] gives the standard deviation estimate of the elements in <i>data</i>. 

StandardDeviation[<i>dist</i>] gives the standard deviation of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

StandardForm
StandardForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as the standard Wolfram Language two-dimensional representation of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Standardize
Standardize[<i>list</i>] shifts and rescales the elements of <i>list</i> to have zero mean and unit sample variance.

Standardize[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>] shifts the elements in <i>list</i> by <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>list</i>] and rescales them to have unit sample variance.

Standardize[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>] shifts by <i>f</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>list</i>] and scales by <i>f</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>list</i>].

---

Standardized
Standardized is an option that determines whether to standardize the data.

---

StandardOceanData
StandardOceanData[<i>spec</i>] returns the thermodynamic properties of seawater for the specified parameters.

StandardOceanData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the specified property for the given parameters. 

---

Star
Star[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋆<i>y</i>⋆….

---

StarClusterData
StarClusterData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the star cluster <i>entity</i>.

StarClusterData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified star cluster entities.

StarClusterData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

StarData
StarData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified property for the star <i>entity</i>.

StarData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified star entities.

StarData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the property.

---

StarGraph
StarGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the star graph with <i>n</i> vertices S<sub>n</sub>.

---

StartAsynchronousTask
StartAsynchronousTask[<i>task</i>] allows asynchronous evaluations from <i>task</i> after it has been stopped.

---

StartExternalSession
StartExternalSession["<i>sys</i>"] starts an external session using the external evaluator <i>sys</i>, returning an external session object.

StartExternalSession[<i>assoc</i>] starts the external evaluator specified by <i>assoc</i>.

StartExternalSession[{"<i>sys</i>",<i>opts</i>}] uses the options <i>opts</i> for the external evaluator.

StartExternalSession[<i>sys</i><i>type</i>] specifies that output from the external evaluator should be converted to the specified type.

StartExternalSession[DatabaseReference[<i>ref</i>]] uses the database specified by <i>ref</i> to start a database session.

---

StartingStepSize
StartingStepSize is an option to NDSolve and related functions that specifies the initial step size to use in trying to generate results.

---

StartOfLine
StartOfLine represents the start of a line in a string for purposes of matching in StringExpression.

---

StartOfString
StartOfString represents the start of a string for purposes of matching in StringExpression.

---

StartProcess
StartProcess["executable"] executes an external program, yielding a ProcessObject to represent the resulting subprocess.

StartProcess[{"executable", arg 1, arg 2, ...}] executes an external program, passing it the specified arguments arg i.

---

StartWebSession
StartWebSession[] starts a web session and returns a web session object.

StartWebSession["<i>browser</i>"] starts a web session using the specified browser.

---

StateDimensions
StateDimensions is an option to TemporalData that specifies the dimensions of the state space. 

---

StateFeedbackGains
StateFeedbackGains[<i>sspec</i>,{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the state feedback gains for the system specification <i>sspec</i> to place its closed-loop poles at <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StateFeedbackGains[…,"<i>prop</i>"] gives the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

StateOutputEstimator
StateOutputEstimator[<i>ssm</i>,<i>l</i>] constructs an estimator for the StateSpaceModel <i>ssm</i>, with estimator gain matrix <i>l</i>.

StateOutputEstimator[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>},<i>l</i>] uses only <i>sensors</i> as the measurements of <i>ssm</i>.

StateOutputEstimator[{<i>ssm</i>,<i>sensors</i>,<i>dinputs</i>},<i>l</i>] specifies <i>dinputs</i> as the deterministic inputs of <i>ssm</i>.

---

StateResponse
StateResponse[<i>sys</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the numeric state response of the state-space model <i>sys</i> to input <i>u</i> for <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>≤<i>t</i>≤<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

StateResponse[<i>sys</i>,{<i>u</i>[0],<i>u</i>[1],…}] gives the response of the discrete-time state-space model <i>sys</i> to the input sequence <i>u</i>[<i>i</i>].

StateResponse[<i>sys</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the symbolic state response as a function of time <i>t</i>.

StateResponse[<i>sys</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},…] gives the state response for multiple inputs <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StateResponse[{<i>sys</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>10</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>20</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><sub>0</sub>}},…, …] gives the response with initial states <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sub>0</sub>.

---

StateSpaceModel
StateSpaceModel[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>d</i>}] represents the standard state-space model with state matrix <i>a</i>, input matrix <i>b</i>, output matrix <i>c</i>, and transmission matrix <i>d</i>.

StateSpaceModel[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>,<i>d</i><i>,</i><i>e</i>}] represents a descriptor state-space model with descriptor matrix <i>e</i>.

StateSpaceModel[<i>sys</i>] gives a state-space model corresponding to the systems model <i>sys</i>.

StateSpaceModel[<i>eqns</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>10</sub>},…},{<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>τ</i>] gives the state-space model obtained by Taylor linearization about the point <i>(</i><i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sub>0</sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sub>0</sub>) of the differential or difference equations <i>eqns</i> with outputs <i>g</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and independent variable <i>τ</i>.

---

StateSpaceRealization
StateSpaceRealization is an option to StateSpaceModel that specifies its canonical representation.

---

StateSpaceTransform
StateSpaceTransform[<i>sys</i>,{<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>}] transforms the state-space model <i>sys</i> using the matrices <i>p</i> and <i>q</i>. 

StateSpaceTransform[<i>sys</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>p</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>z</i>],…},{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub><i>q</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i>],…}}] transforms using the variable transformations {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>p</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>z</i>],…} and {<i>z</i><sub>1</sub><i>q</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i>],…}.

---

StateTransformationLinearize
StateTransformationLinearize[<i>asys</i>] linearizes the AffineStateSpaceModel <i>asys</i> by state transformation.

StateTransformationLinearize[<i>asys</i>,{<i>z</i>,<i>lform</i>}] specifies the new states <i>z</i> and form of linearization <i>lform</i>. 

StateTransformationLinearize[<i>asys</i>,…,"<i>prop</i>"] computes the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

StationaryDistribution
StationaryDistribution[<i>proc</i>] represents the stationary distribution of the process <i>proc</i>, when it exists. 

---

StationaryWaveletPacketTransform
StationaryWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>] gives the stationary wavelet packet transform (SWPT) of an array of <i>data</i>.

StationaryWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the stationary wavelet packet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

StationaryWaveletPacketTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the stationary wavelet packet transform using <i>r</i> levels of refinement.

---

StationaryWaveletTransform
StationaryWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>] gives the stationary wavelet transform (SWT) of an array of <i>data</i>.

StationaryWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i>] gives the stationary wavelet transform using the wavelet <i>wave</i>.

StationaryWaveletTransform[<i>data</i>,<i>wave</i><i>,</i><i>r</i>] gives the stationary wavelet transform using <i>r</i> levels of refinement.

---

StatusCentrality
StatusCentrality[<i>g</i>] gives a list of status centralities for the vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

StatusCentrality[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

StepMonitor
StepMonitor is an option for iterative numerical computation functions that gives an expression to evaluate whenever a step is taken by the numerical method used. 

---

StereochemistryElements
StereochemistryElements is an option for Molecule that specifies the local stereochemical arrangement of atoms in a molecule.

---

StieltjesGamma
StieltjesGamma[<i>n</i>] gives the Stieltjes constant γ<sub>n</sub>. 

StieltjesGamma[<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the generalized Stieltjes constant γ<sub>n</sub>(a).

---

StippleShading
StippleShading[] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that objects that follow are to be drawn using small dots.

StippleShading[<i>d</i>] uses the density <i>d</i> of shading.

StippleShading[<i>col</i>] uses dots with the specified color <i>col</i>.

StippleShading[<i>d</i>,<i>col</i>] uses dots of color <i>col</i> with the density <i>d</i> of shading.

---

StirlingS1
StirlingS1[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Stirling number of the first kind S<sub>n</sub><sup>(m)</sup>. 

---

StirlingS2
StirlingS2[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the Stirling number of the second kind <sub>n</sub><sup>(m)</sup>. 

---

StopAsynchronousTask
StopAsynchronousTask[<i>task</i>] stops asynchronous evaluations from <i>task</i>.

---

StoppingPowerData
StoppingPowerData[<i>entity</i>,{"Particle"<i>particle</i>,"Energy"<i>quantity</i>},<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specific property for the substance for the specified particle and the energy of that particle.

---

StrataVariables
StrataVariables is an option for fitting functions such as CoxModelFit that specify the variables on which the model should be stratified. 

---

StratonovichProcess
StratonovichProcess[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>] represents a Stratonovich process x(t), where x(t)a(t,x(t))t+b(t,x(t))◦ w(t) .

StratonovichProcess[{<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i>},<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>] represents a Stratonovich process y(t)c(t,x(t)), where x(t)a(t,x(t))t+b(t,x(t))◦ w(t) .

StratonovichProcess[…,…,{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub>0</sub>}] represents a Stratonovich process with initial condition x(t<sub>0</sub>)x<sub>0</sub>.

StratonovichProcess[…,…,…,Σ] uses a Wiener process w(t), with covariance Σ.

StratonovichProcess[<i>proc</i>] converts <i>proc</i> to a standard Stratonovich process whenever possible.

StratonovichProcess[<i>sdeqns</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>w</i><i>dproc</i>] represents a Stratonovich process specified by a stochastic differential equation <i>sdeqns</i>, output expression <i>expr</i>, with state <i>x</i> and time <i>t</i>, driven by <i>w</i> following the process <i>dproc</i>. 

---

StreamColorFunction
StreamColorFunction is an option for StreamPlot and related functions that specifies a function to apply to determine colors along streamlines. 

---

StreamColorFunctionScaling
StreamColorFunctionScaling is an option for graphics functions that specifies whether arguments supplied to a stream color function should be scaled to lie between 0 and 1. 

---

StreamDensityPlot
StreamDensityPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},<i>r</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a stream plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>, superimposed on a background density plot of the scalar field <i>r</i>. 

StreamDensityPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] takes the scalar field to be the norm of the vector field.

StreamDensityPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…,<i>r</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates plots of several vector fields. 

StreamDensityPlot[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

StreamMarkers
StreamMarkers is an option for StreamPlot, ListStreamPlot and related functions that specifies what markers to draw at the field points plotted.

---

StreamPlot
StreamPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a stream plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>. 

StreamPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates plots of several vector fields. 

StreamPlot[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

StreamPlot3D
StreamPlot3D[{<i>v<sub><i>x</i></sub>,v<sub><i>y</i></sub>,v<sub><i>z</i></sub></i><i>}</i><i>,</i>{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots streamlines for the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>} as functions of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i> and <i>z</i>.

StreamPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

StreamPoints
StreamPoints is an option to StreamPlot, ListStreamPlot, and related functions that determines how many streamlines to draw.

---

StreamPosition
StreamPosition[<i>stream</i>] returns an integer that specifies the position of the current point in an open stream. 

---

Streams
Streams[] gives a list of all streams that are currently open. 

Streams["<i>name</i>"] lists only streams with the specified name. 

---

StreamScale
StreamScale is an option to StreamPlot, ListStreamPlot, and related functions that determines the length and arrowhead size of streamlines that are drawn. 

---

StreamStyle
StreamStyle is an option to StreamPlot, StreamDensityPlot, and related functions that determines the style to use for drawing streamlines.

---

StrictInequalities
StrictInequalities is an option to FunctionSign and FunctionMonotonicity, etc. that determines whether strict inequalities should be used in definitions. 

---

String
String is the head of a character string "<i>text</i>". 

---

StringByteCount
StringByteCount["<i>string</i>"] gives the total number of bytes used to store the characters in a string.

---

StringCases
StringCases["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the substrings in "<i>string</i>" that match the string expression <i>patt</i>. 

StringCases["<i>string</i>",<i>lhs</i><i>rhs</i>] gives a list of the values of <i>rhs</i> corresponding to the substrings that match the string expression <i>lhs</i>. 

StringCases["<i>string</i>",<i>p</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> substrings that match. 

StringCases["<i>string</i>",{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives substrings that match any of the <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringCases[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringCases[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringCases that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringContainsQ
StringContainsQ["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] yields True if any substring in "<i>string</i>" matches the string expression <i>patt</i>, and yields False otherwise.

StringContainsQ["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields True if any substring matches any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringContainsQ[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the results for each of the "<i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

StringContainsQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringContainsQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringCount
StringCount["<i>string</i>","<i>sub</i>"] gives a count of the number of times "<i>sub</i>" appears as a substring of "<i>string</i>". 

StringCount["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] gives the number of substrings in "<i>string</i>" that match the general string expression <i>patt</i>. 

StringCount["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] counts the number of occurrences of any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringCount[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

StringDelete
StringDelete["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] yields the string obtained by deleting from <i>string</i> all occurrences of anything matching the string pattern <i>patt</i>.

StringDelete[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringDelete that can be applied to an <i>expression</i>.

---

StringEndsQ
StringEndsQ["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] yields True if the end of "<i>string</i>" matches the string expression <i>patt</i>, and yields False otherwise.

StringEndsQ["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields True if the end of "<i>string</i>" matches any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringEndsQ[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the results for each of the "<i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

StringEndsQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringEndsQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringExpression
<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>~~<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>~~… or StringExpression[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents a sequence of strings and symbolic string objects <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

StringExtract
StringExtract["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] extracts the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> block of characters in <i>string</i>, where blocks of characters are defined as delimited by whitespace.

StringExtract["<i>string</i>",{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts blocks at several positions in <i>string</i>.

StringExtract["<i>string</i>",<i>sep</i><i>pos</i>] takes blocks to be delimited by separators that match <i>sep</i>.

StringExtract["<i>string</i>",<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…] extracts blocks at positions <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, delimiting with whitespace for the lowest level, newlines for the next level, and a successively increasing number of newlines thereafter.

StringExtract["<i>string</i>",<i>sep</i><sub>1</sub><i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>sep</i><sub>2</sub><i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a nested list of blocks, with the <i>sep</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> used as separators for successive levels.

---

StringForm
StringForm["<i>controlstring</i>",<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,…] prints as the text of the <i>controlstring</i>, with the printed forms of the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> embedded. 

---

StringFormat
StringFormat["<i>string</i>"] attempts to determine what ImportString format could be used to import the string "<i>string</i>".

---

StringFormatQ
StringFormatQ[<i>"string"</i>,"<i>fmt</i>"] gives True if the string "<i>string</i>" might be imported as format "<i>fmt</i>" and gives False otherwise.

StringFormatQ[<i>"string"</i>,{<i>fmt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>fmt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives True if <i>"string"</i> might be imported as one of "<i>fmt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

StringFreeQ
StringFreeQ["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] yields True if no substring in "<i>string</i>" matches the string expression <i>patt</i>, and yields False otherwise.

StringFreeQ["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields True if no substring matches any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringFreeQ[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the results for each of the "<i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

StringFreeQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringFreeQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringInsert
StringInsert["<i>string</i>","<i>snew</i>",<i>n</i>] yields a string with "<i>snew</i>" inserted starting at position <i>n</i> in "<i>string</i>". 

StringInsert["<i>string</i>","<i>snew</i>",-<i>n</i>] inserts at position <i>n</i> from the end of "<i>string</i>". 

StringInsert["<i>string</i>","<i>snew</i>",{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] inserts a copy of "<i>snew</i>" at each of the positions <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringInsert[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>snew</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

StringJoin
"<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>"<>"<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>"<>…, StringJoin["<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>",…], or StringJoin[{"<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>",…}] yields a string consisting of a concatenation of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

StringLength
StringLength["<i>string</i>"] gives the number of characters in a string. 

---

StringMatchQ
StringMatchQ["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] tests whether "<i>string</i>" matches the string pattern <i>patt</i>. 

StringMatchQ["<i>string</i>",RegularExpression["<i>regex</i>"]] tests whether "<i>string</i>" matches the specified regular expression. 

StringMatchQ["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] test whether "<i>string</i>" matches any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringMatchQ[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>patt</i>] gives the list of the results for each of the "<i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>". 

StringMatchQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringMatchQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringPadLeft
StringPadLeft["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] makes <i>string</i> be of length <i>n</i>, padding it on the left with spaces or truncating it if necessary. 

StringPadLeft["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>,"<i>padding</i>"] pads by repeating copies of the string <i>padding</i>.

StringPadLeft[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads strings with spaces on the left to make them all the same length.

StringPadLeft[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>,…] pads or truncates to make all strings of length <i>n</i>.

---

StringPadRight
StringPadRight["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] makes <i>string</i> be of length <i>n</i>, padding it on the right with spaces or truncating it if necessary. 

StringPadRight["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>,"<i>padding</i>"] pads by repeating copies of the string <i>padding</i>.

StringPadRight[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] pads strings with spaces on the right to make them all the same length.

StringPadRight[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>n</i>,…] pads or truncates to make all strings of length <i>n</i>.

---

StringPart
StringPart["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> character in "<i>string</i>".

StringPart["<i>string</i>",{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><sup>th</sup> characters in "<i>string</i>".

StringPart["<i>string</i>",<i>m</i>;;<i>n</i>;;<i>s</i>] gives a list of the characters in "<i>string</i>" from the <i>m</i><sup>th</sup> through the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> in steps of <i>s</i>.

StringPart[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>spec</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

StringPartition
StringPartition["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] partitions <i>string</i> into nonoverlapping substrings of length <i>n</i>.

StringPartition["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] generates substrings with offset <i>d</i>.

---

StringPosition
StringPosition["<i>string</i>","<i>sub</i>"] gives a list of the starting and ending character positions at which "<i>sub</i>" appears as a substring of "<i>string</i>". 

StringPosition["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] gives all positions at which substrings matching the general string expression <i>patt</i> appear in "<i>string</i>". 

StringPosition["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> occurrences of <i>patt</i>. 

StringPosition["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives positions of all the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringPosition[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringPosition[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringPosition that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringQ
StringQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a string, and False otherwise.

---

StringRepeat
StringRepeat["<i>str</i>",<i>n</i>] creates a string consisting of "<i>str</i>" repeated <i>n</i> times.

StringRepeat["<i>str</i>",<i>n</i>,<i>max</i>] creates a string consisting of up to <i>n</i> copies of "<i>str</i>", truncated to be of maximum total length at most <i>max</i>.

---

StringReplace
StringReplace["<i>string</i>",<i>s</i><i>sp</i>] replaces the string expression <i>s</i> by <i>sp</i> wherever it appears in "<i>string</i>". 

StringReplace["<i>string</i>",{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub><i>sp</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub><i>sp</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces the string expressions <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> by <i>sp</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> whenever they appear as substrings of "<i>string</i>".

StringReplace["<i>string</i>",<i>srules</i>,<i>n</i>] does only the first <i>n</i> replacements. 

StringReplace[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>srules</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringReplace[<i>srules</i>] represents an operator form of StringReplace that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringReplaceList
StringReplaceList["<i>string</i>",<i>s</i><i>sp</i>] or StringReplaceList["<i>string</i>",{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub><i>sp</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub><i>sp</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the strings obtained by replacing each individual occurrence of substrings in "<i>string</i>" matching the string expressions <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringReplaceList["<i>string</i>",<i>srules</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of the first <i>n</i> results obtained. 

StringReplaceList[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>srules</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

---

StringReplacePart
StringReplacePart["<i>string</i>","<i>snew</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] replaces the characters at positions <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> in "<i>string</i>" by "<i>snew</i>". 

StringReplacePart["<i>string</i>","<i>snew</i>",{{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] inserts copies of "<i>snew</i>" at several positions. 

StringReplacePart["<i>string</i>",{"<i>snew</i><sub>1</sub>","<i>snew</i><sub>2</sub>",…},{{<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] replaces characters at positions <i>m</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> through <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in "<i>string</i>" by "<i>snew</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>". 

StringReplacePart["<i>snew</i>",{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] represents an operator form of StringReplacePart that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringReverse
StringReverse["<i>string</i>"] reverses the order of the characters in "<i>string</i>".

---

StringRiffle
StringRiffle[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>3</sub>,…}] creates a string by concatenating all the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, with spaces inserted between them.

StringRiffle[{{<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>s</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] creates a string by concatenating the <i>s</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>, and inserting spaces at the lowest level and newlines at the higher level.

StringRiffle[<i>list</i>,<i>sep</i>] inserts the separator <i>sep</i> between all elements in <i>list</i>.

StringRiffle[<i>list</i>,{"<i>left</i>","<i>sep</i>","<i>right</i>"}] use <i>left</i> and <i>right</i> as delimiters after concatenation.

StringRiffle[<i>list</i>,<i>sep</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>sep</i><sub>2</sub>,…] inserts separator <i>sep</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> between elements of <i>list</i> at level <i>i</i>.

---

StringRotateLeft
StringRotateLeft[<i>string</i>,<i>n</i>] cycles the characters in <i>string</i> <i>n</i> positions to the left.

StringRotateLeft[<i>string</i>] cycles one position to the left.

---

StringRotateRight
StringRotateRight[<i>string</i>,<i>n</i>] cycles the characters in <i>string</i> <i>n</i> positions to the right.

StringRotateRight[<i>string</i>] cycles one position to the right.

---

StringSkeleton
StringSkeleton[<i>n</i>] represents a sequence of <i>n</i> omitted characters in a string printed with Short. The standard print form for StringSkeleton is an ellipsis. 

---

StringSplit
StringSplit["<i>string</i>"] splits "<i>string</i>" into a list of substrings separated by whitespace. 

StringSplit["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] splits into substrings separated by delimiters matching the string expression <i>patt</i>. 

StringSplit["<i>string</i>",{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] splits at any of the <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringSplit["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i><i>val</i>] inserts <i>val</i> at the position of each delimiter. 

StringSplit["<i>string</i>",{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] inserts <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at the position of each delimiter <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

StringSplit["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] splits into at most <i>n</i> substrings. 

StringSplit[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>p</i>] gives the list of results for each of the <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

StringStartsQ
StringStartsQ["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] yields True if the beginning of "<i>string</i>" matches the string expression <i>patt</i>, and yields False otherwise.

StringStartsQ["<i>string</i>",{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields True if the beginning of "<i>string</i>" matches any of the <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

StringStartsQ[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the results for each of the "<i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

StringStartsQ[<i>patt</i>] represents an operator form of StringStartsQ that can be applied to an expression.

---

StringTakeDrop
StringTakeDrop["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives a pair of strings containing the first <i>n</i> characters in "<i>string</i>" and the remaining characters.

StringTakeDrop["<i>string</i>",<i>seq</i>] gives the pair {StringTake["<i>string</i>",<i>seq</i>],StringDrop["<i>string</i>",<i>seq</i>]}.

---

StringTemplate
StringTemplate["<i>string</i>"] yields a TemplateObject expression that represents a string template to be applied to arguments. 

StringTemplate[<i>src</i>] uses File[…], URL[…] or CloudObject[…] as the source for the string template.

StringTemplate[<i>form</i>,<i>args</i>] yields a TemplateObject with arguments, suitable for cloud deployment or other evaluation.

---

StringToByteArray
StringToByteArray["<i>string</i>"] returns a byte array corresponding to the UTF-8 encoding of the specified string.

StringToByteArray["<i>string</i>","<i>encoding</i>"] uses the specified character encoding.

---

StringToStream
StringToStream["<i>string</i>"] opens an input stream for reading from a string. 

---

StringTrim
StringTrim["<i>string</i>"] trims whitespace from the beginning and end of "<i>string</i>".

StringTrim["<i>string</i>",<i>patt</i>] trims substrings matching <i>patt</i> from the beginning and end.

---

StructuralImportance
StructuralImportance[<i>rdist</i>] gives the structural importances for all components in the ReliabilityDistribution <i>rdist</i>.

StructuralImportance[<i>fdist</i>] gives the structural importances for all components in the FailureDistribution <i>fdist</i>.

StructuralImportance[<i>bexpr</i><i>,</i><i>{</i><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the structural importance for the components <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … in the Boolean expression <i>bexpr</i>.

---

StructuredArray
StructuredArray[<i>st</i>,{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>data</i>] represents a <i>d</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>×… array with structure type <i>st</i> and specific content <i>data</i>. 

---

StructuredSelection
StructuredSelection is an option for Cell that specifies whether to allow only complete subexpressions in the cell to be selected interactively using the front end.

---

StruveH
StruveH[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Struve function H<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

StruveL
StruveL[<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the modified Struve function L<sub>n</sub>(z). 

---

Stub
Stub is an attribute which specifies that if a symbol is ever used, Needs should automatically be called on the context of the symbol. 

---

StudentTDistribution
StudentTDistribution[ν] represents a standard Student t distribution with ν degrees of freedom.

StudentTDistribution[μ,σ,ν] represents a Student t distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameter σ, and ν degrees of freedom.

---

Style
Style[<i>expr</i>,<i>options</i>] displays with <i>expr</i> formatted using the specified option settings. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,"<i>style</i>"] uses the option settings for the specified style in the current notebook. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,<i>color</i>] displays using the specified color. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Bold] displays with fonts made bold. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Italic] displays with fonts made italic. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Underlined] displays with fonts underlined. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Larger] displays with fonts made larger. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Smaller] displays with fonts made smaller. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] displays with font size <i>n</i>. 

Style[<i>expr</i>,Tiny], Style[<i>expr</i>,Small], etc. display with fonts that are tiny, small, etc. 

---

Subdivide
Subdivide[<i>n</i>] generates the list {0,1/<i>n</i>,2/<i>n</i>,…,1}.

Subdivide[<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] generates the list of values obtained by subdividing the interval 0 to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub> into <i>n</i> equal parts.

Subdivide[<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>n</i>] generates the list of values from subdividing the interval <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

---

Subfactorial
Subfactorial[<i>n</i>] gives the number of permutations of <i>n</i> objects that leave no object fixed.

---

Subgraph
Subgraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the subgraph of the graph <i>g</i> generated by the vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Subgraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the subgraph generated by the edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

Subgraph[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the subgraph generated by the vertices and edges that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

Subgraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

SubMinus
SubMinus[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sub>-</sub>.

---

SubPlus
SubPlus[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sub>+</sub>.

---

SubresultantPolynomialRemainders
SubresultantPolynomialRemainders[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>] gives the subresultant polynomial remainder sequence of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> with respect to the variable <i>var</i>.

SubresultantPolynomialRemainders[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] computes the subresultant polynomial remainder sequence modulo the prime <i>p</i>.

---

SubresultantPolynomials
SubresultantPolynomials[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>] generates a list of subresultant polynomials of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> with respect to the variable <i>var</i>.

SubresultantPolynomials[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] computes the subresultant polynomials modulo the prime <i>p</i>.

---

Subresultants
Subresultants[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>] generates a list of the principal subresultant coefficients of the polynomials <i>poly</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>poly</i><sub>2</sub> with respect to the variable <i>var</i>.

Subresultants[<i>poly</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>poly</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>var</i>,Modulus<i>p</i>] computes the principal subresultant coefficients modulo the prime <i>p</i>. 

---

Subscript
Subscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>. 

Subscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…] formats as <i>x</i><sub><i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…</sub>.

---

Subset
Subset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊂<i>y</i>⊂….

---

SubsetCases
SubsetCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of the sublists in <i>list</i> that match the pattern <i>patt</i> in any order.

SubsetCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i><i>rhs</i>] gives a list of the values of <i>rhs</i> corresponding to matching sublists.

SubsetCases[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> matches.

---

SubsetCount
SubsetCount[<i>list</i>,<i>sub</i>] gives a count of the number of times <i>sub</i> appears in any order as a sublist of <i>list</i>.

SubsetCount[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the number of sublists in <i>list</i> that match the general pattern <i>patt</i> in any order.

---

SubsetEqual
SubsetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊆<i>y</i>⊆….

---

SubsetMap
SubsetMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] yields an expression in which the elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>, … in the list {<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…} are replaced with the corresponding elements of the list obtained by evaluating <i>f</i>[{<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…}].

SubsetMap[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces elements of <i>expr</i> at positions <i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

SubsetMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an operator form of SubsetMap that can be applied to an expression.

---

SubsetPosition
SubsetPosition[<i>list</i>,<i>sublist</i>] gives a list of positions at which <i>sublist</i> appears in <i>list</i> in any order.

SubsetPosition[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives all positions at which sublists matching <i>patt</i> in any order appear in <i>list</i>.

SubsetPosition[<i>list</i>,<i>patt</i>,<i>n</i>] includes only the first <i>n</i> positions.

---

SubsetQ
SubsetQ[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>] yields True if <i>list</i><sub>2</sub> is a subset of <i>list</i><sub>1</sub>, and False otherwise.

---

SubsetReplace
SubsetReplace[<i>list</i>,<i>rules</i>] replaces sublists in <i>list</i> according to the specified rule or list of rules.

SubsetReplace[<i>list</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>n</i>] does only the first <i>n</i> replacements.

SubsetReplace[<i>rules</i>] represents an operator form of SubsetReplace that can be applied to an expression.

---

SubStar
SubStar[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sub>*</sub>.

---

Subsuperscript
Subsuperscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i><sub><i>y</i></sub><sup><i>z</i></sup>. 

---

SubtitleEncoding
SubtitleEncoding is an option for Export and other functions that specifies the subtitle encoding to use when creating a video file.

---

SubtitleTrackSelection
SubtitleTrackSelection is an option that specifies the subtitle tracks of interest.

---

Subtract
<i>x</i>-<i>y</i> is equivalent to <i>x</i>+(-1*<i>y</i>). 

---

SubtractFrom
<i>x</i>-=<i>dx</i> subtracts <i>dx</i> from <i>x</i> and returns the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

SubtractSides
SubtractSides[<i>rel</i>,<i>x</i>] subtracts <i>x</i> from each side of the equation or inequality <i>rel</i>.

SubtractSides[<i>rel</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>rel</i><sub>2</sub>] subtracts the corresponding sides of two equations or inequalities.

SubtractSides[<i>rel</i>] subtracts the right-hand side of <i>rel</i> from each side, producing a zero right-hand side.

---

SubValues
SubValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all subvalues (values for <i>f</i>[<i>…</i>][…]…) defined for the symbol <i>f</i>.

SubValues["<i>symbol</i>"] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all subvalues defined for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

---

Succeeds
Succeeds[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≻<i>y</i>≻….

---

SucceedsEqual
SucceedsEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⪰<i>y</i>⪰….

---

SucceedsSlantEqual
SucceedsSlantEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≽<i>y</i>≽….

---

SucceedsTilde
SucceedsTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≿<i>y</i>≿….

---

Success
Success["<i>tag</i>",<i>assoc</i>] represents a success of a type indicated by <i>tag</i>, with details given by the association <i>assoc</i>.

---

SuchThat
SuchThat[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as <i>x</i>∍<i>y</i>.

---

SumConvergence
SumConvergence[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives conditions for the sum ∑+n%∞f to be convergent.

SumConvergence[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives conditions for the multiple sum ∑+n<sub>1</sub>%∞∑+n<sub>2</sub>%∞… f to be convergent.

SumConvergence[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>,∞}] gives conditions for the sum ∑+n=a%∞f to be convergent on the interval [a,∞).

SumConvergence[<i>f</i>,{<i>n</i>,<i>a</i>,∞},…,{<i>m</i>,<i>b</i>,∞}] gives conditions for the multiple sum ∑+n=a%∞…∑+m=b%∞f to be convergent.

---

SummationLayer
SummationLayer[] represents a net layer that sums all of its input elements.

---

Sunday
Sunday is a day of the week.

---

SunPosition
SunPosition[] gives the position of the Sun for the current date and location.

SunPosition[<i>datespec</i>] gives the position of the Sun for the specified date.

SunPosition[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the positions of the Sun for the specified location.

SunPosition[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the position of the Sun for the specified date and location.

SunPosition[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the positions of the Sun for all specified locations on the specified dates.

SunPosition[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended locations.

---

Sunrise
Sunrise[] gives the time of the next sunrise for the current date and location.

Sunrise[<i>datespec</i>] gives the times of the next sunrise for the specified dates.

Sunrise[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the times of the next sunrise for the specified locations.

Sunrise[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the time of the next sunrise for the specified date and location.

Sunrise[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the times of the next sunrise for all specified locations on the specified dates.

Sunrise[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended locations.

---

Sunset
Sunset[] gives the time of the next sunset for the current date and location.

Sunset[<i>datespec</i>] gives the time of the next sunset for the specified dates.

Sunset[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the times of the next sunset for the specified locations.

Sunset[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the time of the next sunset for the specified date and location.

Sunset[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives the times of the next sunset for all specified locations on the specified dates.

Sunset[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>,<i>func</i>] uses <i>func</i> to determine what to return for extended locations.

---

SuperDagger
SuperDagger[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sup>†</sup>.

---

SuperMinus
SuperMinus[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sup>-</sup>.

---

SupernovaData
SupernovaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the supernova <i>entity</i>.

SupernovaData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified supernova entities.

SupernovaData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SuperPlus
SuperPlus[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sup>+</sup>.

---

Superscript
Superscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i><sup><i>y</i></sup>. 

---

Superset
Superset[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊃<i>y</i>⊃….

---

SupersetEqual
SupersetEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊇<i>y</i>⊇….

---

SuperStar
SuperStar[<i>expr</i>] displays as <i>expr</i><sup>*</sup>.

---

Surd
Surd[<i>x</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the real-valued <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> root of <i>x</i>.

---

SurfaceArea
SurfaceArea[<i>reg</i>] gives the surface area of the three-dimensional region <i>reg</i>.

SurfaceArea[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>smax</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the surface area of the parametrized region whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>s</i>, <i>t</i>, <i>u</i>.

SurfaceArea[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>smax</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

SurfaceColor
SurfaceColor[<i>dcol</i>] is a three-dimensional graphics directive which specifies that the surfaces which follow should act as diffuse reflectors of light with a color given by <i>dcol</i>. 

SurfaceColor[<i>dcol</i>,<i>scol</i>] specifies that a specular reflection component should be included, with a color given by <i>scol</i>. 

SurfaceColor[<i>dcol</i>,{<i>scol</i>,<i>n</i>}] specifies that the reflection should occur with specular exponent <i>n</i>. 

SurfaceColor[<i>dcol</i>,<i>scol</i>,<i>gcol</i>] specifies that a color <i>gcol</i> should be added as if there were an intrinsic glow in the polygon. 

---

SurfaceData
SurfaceData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the surface <i>entity</i>.

SurfaceData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified surface entities.

SurfaceData[<i>entity</i>, <i>property</i>, <i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

SurfaceGraphics
SurfaceGraphics[<i>array</i>] is a representation of a three-dimensional plot of a surface, with heights of each point on a grid specified by values in <i>array</i>. 

SurfaceGraphics[<i>array</i>,<i>shades</i>] represents a surface, whose parts are shaded according to the array <i>shades</i>. 

---

SurvivalDistribution
SurvivalDistribution[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a survival distribution with event times <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SurvivalDistribution[{<i>cw</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cw</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a survival distribution where events <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> occur with censor weights <i>cw</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SurvivalFunction
SurvivalFunction[<i>dist</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the survival function for the distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at <i>x</i>.

SurvivalFunction[<i>dist</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the multivariate survival function for the distribution <i>dist</i> evaluated at {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}.

SurvivalFunction[<i>dist</i>] gives the survival function as a pure function.

---

SurvivalModel
SurvivalModel[…] represents the symbolic survival model obtained from functions like SurvivalModelFit.

---

SurvivalModelFit
SurvivalModelFit[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a survival model for event times <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SuspendPacket
SuspendPacket[] is a WSTP packet used for synchronization with the Wolfram Language kernel.

---

SuzukiDistribution
SuzukiDistribution[μ,ν] represents the Suzuki distribution with shape parameters μ and ν.

---

SuzukiGroupSuz
SuzukiGroupSuz[] represents the sporadic simple Suzuki group Suz.

---

SwatchLegend
SwatchLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] generates a legend that associates swatches of colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with labels <i>lbl</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SwatchLegend[{<i>col</i><sub>1</sub>,…},Automatic] generates a legend with placeholder labels for the colors <i>col</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SwatchLegend[{<i>lbl</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents a legend with inherited colors within visualization functions.

---

Switch
Switch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>value</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>value</i><sub>2</sub>,…] evaluates <i>expr</i>, then compares it with each of the <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in turn, evaluating and returning the <i>value</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the first match found. 

---

Symbol
Symbol["<i>name</i>"] refers to a symbol with the specified name. 

---

SymbolName
SymbolName[<i>symbol</i>] gives the name of the specified symbol. 

---

SymletWavelet
SymletWavelet[] represents the Symlet wavelet of order 4.

SymletWavelet[<i>n</i>] represents the Symlet wavelet of order <i>n</i>.

---

Symmetric
Symmetric[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the symmetry of a tensor that is symmetric in the slots <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SymmetricGroup
SymmetricGroup[<i>n</i>] represents the symmetric group of degree <i>n</i>.

---

SymmetricKey
SymmetricKey[<i>assoc</i>] represents all the information needed for encryption, decryption, and other operations in a symmetric cryptographic system.

---

SymmetricMatrixQ
SymmetricMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is explicitly symmetric, and False otherwise. 

---

SymmetricPolynomial
SymmetricPolynomial[<i>k</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> elementary symmetric polynomial in the variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

---

SymmetricReduction
SymmetricReduction[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives a pair of polynomials {p,q} in x<sub>1</sub>,…,x<sub>n</sub> such that f==p+q, where p is the symmetric part and q is the remainder.

SymmetricReduction[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the pair {p,q} with the elementary symmetric polynomials in p replaced by s<sub>1</sub>,…,s<sub>n</sub>.

---

Symmetrize
Symmetrize[<i>tensor</i>,<i>sym</i>] returns the symmetrization of <i>tensor</i> under the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

SymmetrizedArray
SymmetrizedArray[{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dims</i>,<i>sym</i>] yields an array of dimensions <i>dims</i> whose entries are given by those in the rules <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> or through the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

SymmetrizedArray[<i>list</i>] yields a symmetrized array version of <i>list</i>.

---

SymmetrizedArrayRules
SymmetrizedArrayRules[<i>sa</i>] returns a list of rules <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of the symmetrized array <i>sa</i>.

SymmetrizedArrayRules[<i>a</i>,<i>sym</i>] returns a list of rules <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of the array <i>a</i> after being symmetrized with symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

SymmetrizedDependentComponents
SymmetrizedDependentComponents[<i>comp</i>,<i>sym</i>] gives the list of components that are equivalent to the component <i>comp</i> by the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

SymmetrizedIndependentComponents
SymmetrizedIndependentComponents[<i>dims</i>,<i>sym</i>] gives the list of independent components of an array of dimensions <i>dims</i> with the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

SymmetrizedReplacePart
SymmetrizedReplacePart[<i>sa</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces independent values of the symmetrized array <i>sa</i> as given by the rules <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

Synonyms
Synonyms["<i>word</i>"] returns the synonyms associated with the specified word.

---

SyntaxInformation
SyntaxInformation[<i>f</i>] gives information used to generate syntax coloring and other advisories when <i>f</i>[…] is entered as input. 

---

SyntaxLength
SyntaxLength["<i>string</i>"] finds the number of characters starting at the beginning of a string that correspond to syntactically correct input for a single Wolfram Language expression. 

---

SyntaxPacket
SyntaxPacket[<i>integer</i>] is a WSTP packet where <i>integer</i> indicates the position at which a syntax error was detected in the input line.

---

SyntaxQ
SyntaxQ["<i>string</i>"] returns True if the string corresponds to syntactically correct input for a single Wolfram Language expression, and returns False otherwise. 

SyntaxQ["<i>string</i>",<i>form</i>] uses interpretation rules corresponding to the specified form.

---

SynthesizeMissingValues
SynthesizeMissingValues[{<i>example</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>example</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces missing values in each example by generated values.

SynthesizeMissingValues[<i>dist</i>,<i>data</i>] uses the distribution <i>dist</i> to generate values.

---

TabFilling
TabFilling is an option for character selections that specifies how a Tab character is represented on the screen.

---

Table
Table[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] generates a list of <i>n</i> copies of <i>expr</i>. 

Table[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a list of the values of <i>expr</i> when <i>i</i> runs from 1 to <i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>. 

Table[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] starts with <i>i</i>=<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>. 

Table[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>di</i>}] uses steps <i>di</i>. 

Table[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] uses the successive values <i>i</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>i</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

Table[<i>expr</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>i</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>i</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>j</i>,<i>j</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>j</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…] gives a nested list. The list associated with <i>i</i> is outermost.

---

TableAlignments
TableAlignments is an option for TableForm and MatrixForm which specifies how entries in each dimension should be aligned. 

---

TableDepth
TableDepth is an option for TableForm and MatrixForm that specifies the maximum number of levels to be printed in tabular or matrix format. 

---

TableDirections
TableDirections is an option for TableForm and MatrixForm which specifies whether successive dimensions should be arranged as rows or columns. 

---

TableHeadings
TableHeadings is an option for TableForm and MatrixForm that gives the labels to be printed for entries in each dimension of a table or matrix. 

---

TableSpacing
TableSpacing is an option for TableForm and MatrixForm that specifies how many spaces should be left between each successive row or column. 

---

TableView
TableView[{{<i>expr</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>expr</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] displays as a spreadsheet-like table view for editing and viewing <i>expr</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>.

---

TabSpacings
TabSpacings is an option for character selections that specifies the number of spaces in ems that the cursor advances when the Tab key is pressed.

---

TaggingRules
TaggingRules is an option for selections that specifies a list of strings to be associated with a selection.

---

TagSet
<i>f</i>/:<i>lhs</i>=<i>rhs</i> assigns <i>rhs</i> to be the value of <i>lhs</i>, and associates the assignment with the symbol <i>f</i>. 

---

TagSetDelayed
<i>f</i>/:<i>lhs</i>:=<i>rhs</i> assigns <i>rhs</i> to be the delayed value of <i>lhs</i>, and associates the assignment with the symbol <i>f</i>. 

---

TagUnset
<i>f</i>/:<i>lhs</i>=. removes any rules defined for <i>lhs</i>, associated with the symbol <i>f</i>. 

---

Take
Take[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> elements of <i>list</i>. 

Take[<i>list</i>,-<i>n</i>] gives the last <i>n</i> elements of <i>list</i>. 

Take[<i>list</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] gives elements <i>m</i> through <i>n</i> of <i>list</i>. 

Take[<i>list</i>,<i>seq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seq</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a nested list in which elements specified by <i>seq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are taken at level <i>i</i> in <i>list</i>. 

---

TakeDrop
TakeDrop[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the pair {<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>}, where <i>list</i><sub>1</sub> contains the first <i>n</i> elements of <i>list</i> and <i>list</i><sub>2</sub> contains the rest.

TakeDrop[<i>list</i>,<i>seq</i>] gives the pair {Take[<i>list</i>,<i>seq</i>],Drop[<i>list</i>,<i>seq</i>]}.

---

TakeLargest
TakeLargest[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> largest elements of <i>data</i>, sorted in descending order.

TakeLargest[<i>data</i><i>prop</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>n</i> largest elements in <i>data</i>.

TakeLargest[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> for sorting.

TakeLargest[<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of TakeLargest that can be applied to an expression.

---

TakeLargestBy
TakeLargestBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in <i>data</i> for which <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is largest, sorted in descending order.

TakeLargestBy[<i>data</i><i>prop</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>n</i> elements in <i>data</i> for which <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is largest.

TakeLargestBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> for sorting.

TakeLargestBy[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of TakeLargestBy that can be applied to an expression. 

---

TakeList
TakeList[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the list of results obtained by successively taking <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> elements from <i>list</i>.

TakeList[<i>list</i>,{<i>seq</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seq</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] successively uses the sequence specifications <i>seq</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

TakeList[<i>list</i>,<i>seqs</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>seqs</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a nested list in which elements specified by the lists <i>seqs</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are taken at level <i>i</i> in <i>list</i>.

---

TakeSmallest
TakeSmallest[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> smallest elements of <i>data</i>, sorted in ascending order.

TakeSmallest[<i>data</i><i>prop</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>n</i> smallest elements in <i>data</i>.

TakeSmallest[<i>data</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the order function <i>p</i> for sorting.

TakeSmallest[<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of TakeSmallest that can be applied to an expression.

---

TakeSmallestBy
TakeSmallestBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i> elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in <i>data</i> for which <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is smallest, sorted in ascending order.

TakeSmallestBy[<i>data</i><i>prop</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the property <i>prop</i> for the <i>n</i> elements in <i>data</i> for which <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is smallest.

TakeSmallestBy[<i>data</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] uses the ordering function <i>p</i> for sorting.

TakeSmallestBy[<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] represents an operator form of TakeSmallestBy that can be applied to an expression. 

---

TakeWhile
TakeWhile[<i>list</i>,<i>crit</i>] gives elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from the beginning of <i>list</i>, continuing so long as <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

---

Tally
Tally[<i>list</i>] tallies the elements in <i>list</i>, listing all distinct elements together with their multiplicities.

Tally[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] uses <i>test</i> to determine whether pairs of elements should be considered equivalent, and gives a list of the first representatives of each equivalence class, together with their multiplicities.

---

Tan
Tan[<i>z</i>] gives the tangent of <i>z</i>.

---

Tanh
Tanh[<i>z</i>] gives the hyperbolic tangent of <i>z</i>.

---

TargetDevice
TargetDevice is an option for certain functions that specifies on which device the computation should be attempted.

---

TargetFunctions
TargetFunctions is an option for functions such as ComplexExpand and FindDistribution that specifies what functions to attempt to generate in the output. 

---

TargetUnits
TargetUnits is an option used to specify the desired output units for visualization functions operating on Quantity expressions.

---

TaskAbort
TaskAbort[<i>task</i>] generates an interrupt to abort the current execution of a task.

---

TaskExecute
TaskExecute[<i>task</i>] immediately executes an instance of the specified task, independently of any schedule given.

---

TaskObject
TaskObject[<i>spec</i>] is an object that represents a background task.

---

TaskRemove
TaskRemove[<i>task</i>] terminates and removes the specified task.

---

TaskResume
TaskResume[<i>task</i>] resumes execution of the specified task.

---

Tasks
Tasks[<i>type</i>] gives a list of TaskObject expressions representing currently submitted tasks of given <i>type</i>.

---

TaskSuspend
TaskSuspend[<i>task</i>] suspends the execution of the specified task.

---

TaskWait
TaskWait[<i>task</i>] waits for the specified task to be completely finished. 

---

TautologyQ
TautologyQ[<i>bf</i>] gives True if all combinations of values of variables make the Boolean function <i>bf</i> yield True.

TautologyQ[<i>expr</i>,{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives True if all combinations of values of the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> make the Boolean expression <i>expr</i> yield True.

---

TelegraphProcess
TelegraphProcess[μ] represents a telegraph process with rate μ.

---

TemplateApply
TemplateApply[<i>template</i>] applies a template, evaluating all template elements it contains.

TemplateApply[<i>template</i>,<i>args</i>] applies a template, using <i>args</i> to fill slots in the template.

---

TemplateExpression
TemplateExpression[<i>expr</i>] represents an expression held until a template is applied, and then evaluated.

---

TemplateIf
TemplateIf[<i>condition</i>,<i>tclause</i>] represents an element of a template object that inserts <i>tclause</i> if the condition evaluates to True.

TemplateIf[<i>condition</i>,<i>tclause</i>,<i>fclause</i>] inserts <i>fclause</i> if the condition does not evaluate to True.

---

TemplateObject
TemplateObject[<i>expr</i>] represents a template object to be applied using functions like TemplateApply.

TemplateObject[<i>form</i>,<i>args</i>] yields a TemplateObject with arguments, suitable for cloud deployment or other evaluation.

---

TemplateSequence
TemplateSequence[<i>body</i>,<i>list</i>] represents an element of a template object that yields a sequence consisting of <i>body</i> applied to each element in <i>list</i>.

---

TemplateSlot
TemplateSlot[<i>n</i>] represents a template slot to be filled from the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> argument when the template is applied.

TemplateSlot[<i>name</i>] represents a template slot to be filled from an element with key <i>name</i> in an association appearing in the first argument.

---

TemplateWith
TemplateWith["<i>name</i>"<i>value</i>,<i>expr</i>] represents an element of a template object that evaluates <i>expr</i> after replacing TemplateSlot["<i>name</i>"] with <i>value</i>.

TemplateWith[{<i>name</i><sub>1</sub><i>value</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub><i>value</i><sub>2</sub>, …},<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i> with a list of key-value pairs.

---

TemporalData
TemporalData[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>tspec</i>] represents temporal data with values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at times specified by <i>tspec</i>.

TemporalData[{{<i>v</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>v</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…},<i>tspec</i>] represents a temporal data collection with values <i>v</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> at times specified by <i>tspec</i>.

TemporalData[{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>}…}] represents temporal data specified by time-value pairs {<i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

TemporalData[{{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>11</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>12</sub>}…},{{<i>t</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>21</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>22</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>22</sub>},…},…}] represents a temporal data collection given as lists of time-value pairs {<i>t</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub>}.

---

TemporalRegularity
TemporalRegularity is an option for TemporalData, TimeSeries, and EventSeries that controls whether the paths are assumed to be uniformly spaced in time.

---

Temporary
Temporary is an attribute assigned to symbols which are created as local variables by Module. 

---

TensorContract
TensorContract[<i>tensor</i>,{{<i>s</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>12</sub>},{<i>s</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>22</sub>},…}] yields the contraction of <i>tensor</i> in the pairs {<i>s</i><sub><i>i1</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>i2</i></sub>} of slots.

---

TensorDimensions
TensorDimensions[<i>tensor</i>] gives the list of dimensions of <i>tensor</i>.

---

TensorExpand
TensorExpand[<i>texpr</i>] expands out tensor-related products in the symbolic tensor expression <i>texpr</i>.

---

TensorProduct
TensorProduct[<i>tensor</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tensor</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the tensor product of the <i>tensor</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TensorRank
TensorRank[<i>tensor</i>] gives the rank of <i>tensor</i>.

---

TensorReduce
TensorReduce[<i>texpr</i>] attempts to return a canonical form for the symbolic tensor expression <i>texpr</i>.

---

TensorSymmetry
TensorSymmetry[<i>tensor</i>] gives the symmetry of <i>tensor</i> under permutations of its slots.

TensorSymmetry[<i>tensor</i>,<i>slots</i>] gives the symmetry under permutation of the specified list of slots.

---

TensorTranspose
TensorTranspose[<i>tensor</i>,<i>perm</i>] represents the tensor obtained by transposing the slots of <i>tensor</i> as given by the permutation <i>perm</i>.

---

TensorWedge
TensorWedge[<i>tensor</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tensor</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the antisymmetrized tensor product of the <i>tensor</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TestID
TestID is an option to TestCreate, VerificationTest and IntermediateTest that specifies a string used as an identifier for the test.

---

TestReport
TestReport["<i>file</i>"] gives a report of the results of the tests from a file.

TestReport[{<i>test</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>test</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a report of the results of the <i>test</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TestReport[{<i>report</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>report</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a unified report by merging all test reports <i>report</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TestReportObject
TestReportObject[…] gives an object that represents the results of TestReport.

---

TestResultObject
TestResultObject[…] gives an object that represents the results of a VerificationTest.

---

Tetrahedron
Tetrahedron[] represents a regular tetrahedron centered at the origin with unit edge length.

Tetrahedron[<i>l</i>] represents a tetrahedron with edge length <i>l</i>.

Tetrahedron[{θ,ϕ},…] represents a tetrahedron rotated by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

Tetrahedron[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},…] represents a tetrahedron centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

Tetrahedron[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>4</sub>}] represents a general filled tetrahedron with corners <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>3</sub> and <i>p</i><sub>4</sub>.

Tetrahedron[{{<i>p</i><sub>1,1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1,2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1,3</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1,4</sub>},{<i>p</i><sub>2,1</sub>,…},…}] represents a collection of tetrahedra.

---

TeXForm
TeXForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as a TeX version of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Text
Text[<i>expr</i>] displays with <i>expr</i> in plain text format. 

Text[<i>expr</i>,<i>coords</i>] is a graphics primitive that displays the textual form of <i>expr</i> centered at the point specified by <i>coords</i>. 

---

TextAlignment
TextAlignment is an option for Cell, Style and related constructs which specifies how successive lines of text should be aligned. 

---

TextCases
TextCases[<i>text</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a list of all cases of text identified as being of type <i>form</i> that appear in <i>text</i>.

TextCases[<i>text</i>,{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association of results for all the types <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

TextCases[<i>text</i>,<i>formspec</i><i>prop</i>] gives the specified property for each result found.

TextCases[<i>text</i>,<i>formspec</i>{<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of properties for each result found.

TextCases[<i>text</i>,<i>spec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> cases found.

---

TextContents
TextContents[<i>text</i>] gives a dataset of information about entities, dates, quantities and other content-related elements found in <i>text</i>.

TextContents[<i>text</i>,<i>form</i>] searches for cases of the type <i>form</i>.

TextContents[<i>text</i>,{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] searches for cases of types <i>form</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>form</i><sub>2</sub>, …

TextContents[<i>text</i>,<i>forms</i>,<i>props</i>] includes the property <i>props</i> for each object in the dataset produced.

---

TextElement
TextElement[<i>text</i>,<i>props</i>] represents an element of text with the specified properties.

TextElement[{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>props</i>] represents text formed from a sequence of elements.

TextElement[<i>elems</i>] represents text where no properties are specified. 

---

TextGrid
TextGrid[{{<i>expr</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>expr</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] is an object that formats <i>expr</i><sub><i>ij</i></sub> textually and arranged in a two-dimensional grid. 

---

TextJustification
TextJustification is an option for Cell and Inset which specifies how much lines of text can be stretched in order to make them be the same length. 

---

TextPosition
TextPosition[<i>text</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a list of the starting and ending positions at which instances of <i>form</i> occur in <i>text</i>.

TextPosition[<i>text</i>,{<i>form</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>form</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association of results for all the types <i>form</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TextPosition[<i>text</i>,<i>formspec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the first <i>n</i> cases found.

---

TextRecognize
TextRecognize[<i>image</i>] recognizes text in <i>image</i> and returns it as a string.

TextRecognize[<i>image</i>,<i>level</i>] returns a list of strings at the specified structural level.

TextRecognize[<i>image</i>,<i>level</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns <i>prop</i> for text at the given level.

TextRecognize[<i>video</i>,…] recognizes text in frames of <i>video</i>.

---

TextSearch
TextSearch[<i>source</i>,<i>form</i>] searches for files referenced by <i>source</i> that contain text matching <i>form</i>.

TextSearch[<i>source</i>,<i>form</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] returns the property <i>prop</i> for each result.

---

TextSearchReport
TextSearchReport[<i>source</i>,<i>form</i>] gives a structured report of files referenced by <i>source</i> that contain text matching <i>form</i>.

---

TextSentences
TextSentences["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the runs of characters identified as sentences in <i>string</i>.

TextSentences["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> sentences in <i>string</i>.

---

TextString
TextString[<i>expr</i>] gives a human-readable string representation of <i>expr</i>.

---

TextStructure
TextStructure["<i>text</i>"] generates a nested collection of TextElement objects representing the grammatical structure of natural language text.

TextStructure["<i>text</i>",<i>form</i>] generates a representation of the type specified by <i>form</i> of the grammatical structure of text.

---

TextStyle
