TextStyle is an option for graphics functions and for Text which specifies the default style and font options with which text should be rendered. 

---

TextTranslation
TextTranslation["<i>text</i>"] translates <i>text</i> into the current default language. 

TextTranslation["<i>text</i>",<i>lang</i>] translates <i>text</i> into the language specified by <i>lang</i>.

TextTranslation["<i>text</i>",<i>lang</i><sub>1</sub><i>lang</i><sub>2</sub>] translates <i>text</i> from language <i>lang</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>lang</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

Texture
Texture[<i>obj</i>] is a graphics directive that specifies that <i>obj</i> should be used as a texture on faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects. 

Texture[<i>obj</i>,<i>map</i>] specifies the projection mapping <i>map</i> to assign to vertices of 3D graphics objects.

---

TextureCoordinateFunction
TextureCoordinateFunction is an option to Plot3D and similar functions that specifies a function that computes texture coordinates.

---

TextureCoordinateScaling
TextureCoordinateScaling is an option to Plot3D and similar functions that specifies whether arguments supplied to a texture coordinate function should be scaled to lie between 0 and 1.

---

TextWords
TextWords["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the runs of characters identified as words in <i>string</i>.

TextWords["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> words in <i>string</i>.

---

Therefore
Therefore[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as <i>x</i>∴<i>y</i>.

---

ThermodynamicData
ThermodynamicData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the value of the specific property for the substance "<i>name</i>".

ThermodynamicData["<i>name</i>","<i>property</i>",{<i>parameter</i><sub>1</sub><i>quantity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>parameter</i><sub>2</sub><i>quantity</i>}] gives the value of the specific property for the substance "<i>name</i>" at the specified parameters.

---

Thick
Thick is a graphics directive that specifies that lines which follow should be drawn thick.

---

Thickness
Thickness[<i>r</i>] is a graphics directive which specifies that lines which follow are to be drawn with thickness <i>r</i>. The thickness <i>r</i> is given as a fraction of the horizontal plot range. 

---

Thin
Thin is a graphics directive that specifies that lines which follow should be drawn thin.

---

Thinning
Thinning[<i>image</i>] finds the skeletons of foreground regions in <i>image</i> by applying morphological thinning until convergence.

Thinning[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>] performs <i>n</i> iterations of morphological thinning.

Thinning[<i>image</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>t</i>] treats values above <i>t</i> as foreground.

---

ThisLink
ThisLink is used in patterns for external packages to distinguish between several instances of the same package.

---

ThompsonGroupTh
ThompsonGroupTh[] represents the sporadic simple Thompson group Th.

---

Thread
Thread[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>]] "threads" <i>f</i> over any lists that appear in <i>args</i>. 

Thread[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>h</i>] threads <i>f</i> over any objects with head <i>h</i> that appear in <i>args</i>. 

Thread[<i>f</i>[<i>args</i>],<i>h</i>,<i>n</i>] threads <i>f</i> over objects with head <i>h</i> that appear in the first <i>n</i> <i>args</i>. 

---

ThreadingLayer
ThreadingLayer[<i>f</i>] represents a net layer that takes several input arrays and applies a function <i>f</i> to corresponding array elements.

ThreadingLayer[<i>f</i>,<i>bspec</i>] allows array shapes to be conformed according to broadcasting specification <i>bspec</i>.

---

ThreeJSymbol
ThreeJSymbol[{<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},{<i>j</i><sub>3</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the values of the Wigner 3‐j symbol. 

---

Threshold
Threshold[<i>data</i>] thresholds <i>data</i> by replacing values close to zero by zero.

Threshold[<i>data</i>,<i>tspec</i>] thresholds <i>data</i> using threshold specification <i>tspec</i>.

Threshold[<i>image</i>,…] replaces small values of <i>image</i> by zero. 

Threshold[<i>sound</i>,…] replaces small values of <i>sound</i> by zero. 

---

Through
Through[<i>p</i>[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,…][<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…]] gives <i>p</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>g</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…]. 

Through[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] performs the transformation wherever <i>h</i> occurs in the head of <i>expr</i>. 

---

Throw
Throw[<i>value</i>] stops evaluation and returns <i>value</i> as the value of the nearest enclosing Catch.

Throw[<i>value</i>,<i>tag</i>] is caught only by Catch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>], where <i>tag</i> matches <i>form</i>.

Throw[<i>value</i>,<i>tag</i>,<i>f</i>] returns <i>f</i>[<i>value</i>,<i>tag</i>] as the top-level value if no appropriate Catch is found.

---

ThueMorse
ThueMorse[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> term in the Thue–Morse sequence.

---

Thumbnail
Thumbnail[<i>image</i>] gives a thumbnail version of an image.

Thumbnail[<i>file</i>] gives a thumbnail of an image stored in a file.

Thumbnail[<i>url</i>] gives a thumbnail of an image stored at a URL.

Thumbnail[<i>spec</i>,<i>size</i>] gives a thumbnail with the specified maximum pixel size.

---

Thursday
Thursday is a day of the week.

---

TickDirection
TickDirection is an option for AxisObject that specifies where the ticks are drawn relative to the axis.

---

TickLabelOrientation
TickLabelOrientation is an option for AxisObject that specifies how the tick labels should be oriented relative to the axis.

---

TickLabelPositioning
TickLabelPositioning is an option for AxisObject that specifies how the tick labels should be positioned relative to the ticks.

---

TickLabels
TickLabels is an option for AxisObject that specifies how the tick marks should be labeled.

---

TickLengths
TickLengths is an option for AxisObject that specifies the lengths of the tick marks.

---

TickPositions
TickPositions is an option for AxisObject that specifies where the tick marks should be positioned.

---

Ticks
Ticks is an option for graphics functions that specifies tick marks for axes. 

---

TicksStyle
TicksStyle is an option for graphics functions which specifies how ticks should be rendered.

---

TideData
TideData[<i>spec</i>] returns the tidal properties for a location or a set of tidal parameters.

TideData[<i>spec</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property for the location or tidal parameters indicated.

TideData[<i>spec</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>datespec</i>] returns the value of a specified property for a date or set of dates.

---

Tilde
Tilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>∼<i>y</i>∼….

---

TildeEqual
TildeEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≃<i>y</i>≃….

---

TildeFullEqual
TildeFullEqual[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≅<i>y</i>≅….

---

TildeTilde
TildeTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≈<i>y</i>≈….

---

TimeConstrained
TimeConstrained[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, stopping after <i>t</i> seconds. 

TimeConstrained[<i>expr</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>failexpr</i>] returns <i>failexpr</i> if the time constraint is not met. 

---

TimeConstraint
TimeConstraint is an option for various functions that specifies the maximum time to spend doing a particular operation. 

---

TimeDirection
TimeDirection is an option for Sunrise, Sunset, and related functions that specifies whether the next or last event should be returned.

---

TimeGoal
TimeGoal is an option for various functions that specifies how long to spend doing a particular operation.

---

TimelinePlot
TimelinePlot[{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a timeline plot with dates <i>date</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>date</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

TimelinePlot[{<i>event</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>event</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a timeline plot with events <i>event</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>event</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

TimelinePlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a timeline plot from multiple event datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TimeObject
TimeObject[] represents the current time.

TimeObject[{<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] represents a time object of standard normalized form.

TimeObject[<i>date</i>] gives the time component of the specified date representation.

TimeObject[<i>rtime</i>,<i>gran</i>] gives the time object of granularity <i>gran</i> that includes the reference time <i>rtime</i>.

---

TimeObjectQ
TimeObjectQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a TimeObject with valid arguments, and False otherwise.

---

TimeRemaining
TimeRemaining[] gives the number of seconds remaining until the earliest enclosing TimeConstrained will request the current computation to stop.

---

Times
<i>x</i>*<i>y</i>*<i>z</i>, <i>x</i>×<i>y</i>×<i>z</i>, or <i>x</i> <i>y</i> <i>z</i> represents a product of terms. 

---

TimesBy
<i>x</i>*=<i>c</i> multiplies <i>x</i> by <i>c</i> and returns the new value of <i>x</i>. 

---

TimeSeries
TimeSeries[{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>}…}] represents a time series specified by time-value pairs {<i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>}.

TimeSeries[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>tspec</i>] represents a time series with values <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at times specified by <i>tspec</i>.

---

TimeSeriesAggregate
TimeSeriesAggregate[<i>tseries</i>,<i>dt</i>] computes the mean value of <i>tseries</i> over non-overlapping windows of width <i>dt</i>.

TimeSeriesAggregate[<i>tseries</i>,<i>dt</i>,<i>f</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the values of <i>tseries</i> in non-overlapping windows of width <i>dt</i>.

---

TimeSeriesForecast
TimeSeriesForecast[<i>tproc</i>,<i>data</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-step-ahead forecast beyond <i>data</i> according to the time series process <i>tproc</i>.

TimeSeriesForecast[<i>tsmod</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-step-ahead forecast for TimeSeriesModel <i>tsmod</i>. 

---

TimeSeriesInsert
TimeSeriesInsert[<i>tseries</i>,{<i>t</i>,<i>v</i>}] inserts a value <i>v</i> at time <i>t</i> in the time series <i>tseries</i>.

TimeSeriesInsert[<i>tseries</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tseries</i><sub>2</sub>] inserts the time-value pairs from <i>tseries</i><sub>2</sub> into <i>tseries</i><sub>1</sub>.

---

TimeSeriesInvertibility
TimeSeriesInvertibility[<i>tproc</i>] gives conditions for the time series process <i>tproc</i> to be invertible. 

---

TimeSeriesMap
TimeSeriesMap[<i>f</i>,<i>tseries</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the values in <i>tseries</i>.

---

TimeSeriesMapThread
TimeSeriesMapThread[<i>f</i>,<i>tseries</i>] gives {{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>]},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>]},…} for the time series <i>tseries</i>.

TimeSeriesMapThread[<i>f</i>,<i>tseries</i>,{{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] gives {{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,…]},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>f</i>[<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,…]},…} for the time series <i>tseries</i>.

---

TimeSeriesModel
TimeSeriesModel[…] represents the symbolic time series model obtained from TimeSeriesModelFit.

---

TimeSeriesModelFit
TimeSeriesModelFit[<i>data</i>] constructs a time series model for <i>data</i> from an automatically selected model family.

TimeSeriesModelFit[<i>data</i>,<i>mspec</i>] constructs a time series model for <i>data</i> from a model family specified by <i>mspec</i>.

---

TimeSeriesResample
TimeSeriesResample[<i>tseries</i>] uniformly resamples <i>tseries</i> according to its minimum time increment.

TimeSeriesResample[<i>tseries</i>,<i>rspec</i>] resamples <i>tseries</i> according to <i>rspec</i>.

---

TimeSeriesRescale
TimeSeriesRescale[<i>tseries</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] rescales the times in time series <i>tseries</i> to run from <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> to <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

TimeSeriesRescale[<i>tseries</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>u</i></sub>}] rescales times in units of <i>t</i><sub><i>u</i></sub> including "Month", "Quarter", or "Year".

---

TimeSeriesShift
TimeSeriesShift[<i>tseries</i>,<i>shift</i>] shifts the time series <i>tseries</i> to the left or right according to <i>shift</i>.

---

TimeSeriesThread
TimeSeriesThread[<i>f</i>,{<i>tseries</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>tseries</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] combines the <i>tseries</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> using the function <i>f</i>.

---

TimeSeriesWindow
TimeSeriesWindow[<i>tseries</i>,{<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the elements of the time series <i>tseries</i> that fall between <i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

TimeSeriesWindow[<i>tseries</i>,<i>windowspec</i>] gives the elements of the time series <i>tseries</i> that satisfy the window specification <i>windowspec</i>.

---

TimeValue
TimeValue[<i>s</i>,<i>i</i>,<i>t</i>] calculates the time value of a security <i>s</i> at time <i>t</i> for an interest specified by <i>i</i>.

---

TimeWarpingCorrespondence
TimeWarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the time warping (DTW) similarity path between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

TimeWarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>r</i>] uses a window of radius <i>r</i> for local search.

---

TimeWarpingDistance
TimeWarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the dynamic time warping (DTW) distance between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

TimeWarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>r</i>] uses a window of radius <i>r</i> for local search.

---

TimeZone
TimeZone is an option for DateObject, DateString, and related functions that specifies the time zone to use for dates and times. 

---

TimeZoneConvert
TimeZoneConvert[<i>time</i>,<i>timezone</i>] converts the date or time object <i>time</i> to the specified time zone <i>timezone</i>.

TimeZoneConvert[<i>time</i>] converts to the current $TimeZone value.

TimeZoneConvert[{<i>time</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>time</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>timezone</i>] converts <i>time</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>time</i><sub><i>n</i></sub> to the specified <i>timezone</i>.

---

TimeZoneOffset
TimeZoneOffset[<i>tz</i>] gives the numeric offset between the time zone <i>tz</i> and GMT on the current date.

TimeZoneOffset[<i>loc</i>] gives the numeric offset between the time zone for the location <i>loc</i> and GMT.

TimeZoneOffset[<i>tz</i>,<i>base</i>] gives the numeric offset between <i>tz</i> and the specified <i>base</i> time zone.

TimeZoneOffset[<i>tz</i>,<i>date</i>] gets a list of possible time zone offsets for <i>tz</i> at the given date list.

TimeZoneOffset[<i>tz</i>,<i>base</i>,<i>date</i>] gives the numeric offset between <i>tz</i> and <i>base</i> on the specified <i>date</i>.

---

Timing
Timing[<i>expr</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, and returns a list of the time in seconds used, together with the result obtained. 

---

Tiny
Tiny is a style or option setting that specifies that objects should be tiny.

---

TitsGroupT
TitsGroupT[] represents the simple Tits group T.

---

ToCharacterCode
ToCharacterCode["<i>string</i>"] gives a list of the integer codes corresponding to the characters in a string. 

ToCharacterCode["<i>string</i>","<i>encoding</i>"] gives integer codes according to the specified encoding. 

---

ToColor
ToColor[<i>color</i>, <i>form</i>] converts <i>color</i> to <i>form</i> if <i>form</i> is GrayLevel, RGBColor or CMYKColor. Otherwise <i>form</i>[<i>color</i>] is evaluated and the result is expected to be a valid color directive.

---

ToContinuousTimeModel
ToContinuousTimeModel[<i>lsys</i>] gives the continuous-time approximation of the discrete-time systems models <i>lsys</i>.

ToContinuousTimeModel[<i>tfm</i>,<i>s</i>] specifies the transform variable <i>s</i>.

---

ToDate
ToDate[<i>time</i>] converts an absolute time in seconds since the beginning of January 1, 1900 to a date of the form {<i>y</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}. 

---

Today
Today gives a DateObject representing the current day.

---

ToDiscreteTimeModel
ToDiscreteTimeModel[<i>lsys</i>,τ] gives the discrete-time approximation, with sampling period τ, of the continuous-time systems models <i>lsys</i>.

ToDiscreteTimeModel[<i>tfm</i>,τ,<i>z</i>] specifies the transform variable <i>z</i>.

---

ToEntity
ToEntity[<i>expr</i>] returns an entity object corresponding to the given expression.

ToEntity[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>] returns an entity object of the specified <i>type</i> corresponding to <i>expr</i>.

---

ToeplitzMatrix
ToeplitzMatrix[<i>n</i>] gives the <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Toeplitz matrix with first row and first column being successive integers.

ToeplitzMatrix[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Toeplitz matrix whose first column consists of entries <i>c</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>c</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ToeplitzMatrix[{<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>c</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…, <i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the Toeplitz matrix with entries <i>c</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> down the first column, and <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> across the first row.

---

ToFileName
ToFileName["<i>directory</i>","<i>name</i>"] assembles a full file name from a directory name and a file name. 

ToFileName[{<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>name</i>] assembles a full file name from a hierarchy of directory names. 

ToFileName[{<i>dir</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dir</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] assembles a single directory name from a hierarchy of directory names. 

---

Together
Together[<i>expr</i>] puts terms in a sum over a common denominator, and cancels factors in the result. 

---

ToInvertibleTimeSeries
ToInvertibleTimeSeries[<i>tproc</i>] returns an invertible version of a time series process <i>tproc</i>.

---

TokenWords
TokenWords is an option for Read and related functions which gives a list of token words to be used to delimit words. 

---

Tolerance
Tolerance is an option for various numerical options which specifies the tolerance that should be allowed in computing results.

---

ToLowerCase
ToLowerCase[<i>string</i>] yields a string in which all letters have been converted to lowercase. 

---

Tomorrow
Tomorrow gives a DateObject representing the following day.

---

ToNumberField
ToNumberField[<i>a</i>,θ] expresses the algebraic number <i>a</i> in the number field generated by θ. 

ToNumberField[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…},θ] expresses the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the field generated by θ.

ToNumberField[{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] expresses the <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in a common extension field generated by a single algebraic number.

---

TooBig
TooBig is an internal symbol.

---

ToonShading
ToonShading[] is a three-dimensional graphics directive specifying that surfaces that follow are to be drawn to emulate two-dimensional flat objects.

ToonShading[<i>col</i>] uses the color <i>col</i> as base color.

ToonShading[{<i>dcol</i>,<i>bcol</i>,<i>hcol</i>}] uses the dark color <i>dcol</i>, the base color <i>bcol</i> and highlight color <i>hcol</i>.

ToonShading[{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>3</sub>}{<i>dcol</i>,<i>bcol</i>,<i>hcol</i>}] uses the colors <i>dcol</i>, <i>bcol</i> and <i>hcol</i> weighted by the <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

ToonShading["<i>scheme</i>"] uses the specified discrete color scheme in ColorData.

---

Top
Top is a symbol that represents the top for purposes of alignment and positioning. 

---

TopHatTransform
TopHatTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>ker</i>] gives the morphological top-hat transform of <i>image</i> with respect to structuring element <i>ker</i>.

TopHatTransform[<i>image</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the top-hat transform with respect to a range-<i>r</i> square.

TopHatTransform[<i>data</i>,…] applies top-hat transform to an array of data.

---

ToPolarCoordinates
ToPolarCoordinates[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives the {<i>r</i>,θ} polar coordinates corresponding to the Cartesian coordinates {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}.

ToPolarCoordinates[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the hyperspherical coordinates corresponding to the Cartesian coordinates {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}.

---

TopologicalSort
TopologicalSort[<i>g</i>] gives a list of vertices of <i>g</i> in topologically sorted order for a directed acyclic graph <i>g</i>.

TopologicalSort[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

ToRadicals
ToRadicals[<i>expr</i>] attempts to express all Root objects in <i>expr</i> in terms of radicals. 

---

ToRules
ToRules[<i>eqns</i>] takes logical combinations of equations, in the form generated by Roots and Reduce, and converts them to lists of rules, of the form produced by Solve. 

---

Torus
Torus[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},{<i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>}] represents a torus centered at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} with inner radius <i>r</i><sub><i>inner</i></sub> and outer radius <i>r</i><sub><i>outer</i></sub>.

---

ToSphericalCoordinates
ToSphericalCoordinates[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}] gives the {<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ} spherical coordinates corresponding to the Cartesian coordinates {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

ToString
ToString[<i>expr</i>] gives a string corresponding to the printed form of <i>expr</i> in OutputForm. 

ToString[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] gives the string corresponding to output in the specified form. 

---

Total
Total[<i>list</i>] gives the total of the elements in <i>list</i>. 

Total[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] totals all elements down to level <i>n</i>. 

Total[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i>}] totals elements at level <i>n</i>. 

Total[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>}] totals elements at levels <i>n</i><sub>1</sub> through <i>n</i><sub>2</sub>. 

---

TotalLayer
TotalLayer[] represents a net layer taking a list of input arrays and performing elementwise addition on them.

---

TotalVariationFilter
TotalVariationFilter[<i>data</i>] iteratively reduces noise while preserving rapid transitions in <i>data</i>.

TotalVariationFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>param</i>] assumes a regularization parameter value <i>param</i>.

---

TotalWidth
TotalWidth is an option that can be set for output streams to specify the maximum total number of characters of text that should be printed for each output expression. Short forms of expressions are given if the number of characters needed to print the whole expression is too large. 

---

TouchscreenAutoZoom
TouchscreenAutoZoom is an option for Manipulate and Graphics3D that determines whether the interface zooms to full-screen when it is activated by touching it on supported touch screen platforms.

---

TouchscreenControlPlacement
TouchscreenControlPlacement is an option for Manipulate that determines the placement of the slide-out control panel on supported touchscreen platforms.

---

ToUpperCase
ToUpperCase[<i>string</i>] yields a string in which all letters have been converted to uppercase. 

---

TourVideo
TourVideo[<i>input</i>,{<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a video by taking a tour at steps <i>step</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> around <i>graphics</i>.

TourVideo[<i>input</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>step</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] takes a tour with steps <i>step</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at times <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> around <i>graphics</i>.

TourVideo[<i>input</i>,<i>func</i>] samples the function <i>func</i> to generate step specifications for each frame.

---

Tr
Tr[<i>list</i>] finds the trace of the matrix or tensor <i>list</i>. 

Tr[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] finds a generalized trace, combining terms with <i>f</i> instead of Plus. 

Tr[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>,<i>n</i>] goes down to level <i>n</i> in <i>list</i>. 

---

Trace
Trace[<i>expr</i>] generates a list of all expressions used in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

Trace[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] includes only those expressions that match <i>form</i>. 

Trace[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>] includes all evaluations that use transformation rules associated with the symbol <i>s</i>. 

---

TraceAbove
TraceAbove is an option for Trace and related functions which specifies whether to include evaluation chains which contain the evaluation chain containing the pattern <i>form</i> sought. 

---

TraceAction
TraceAction is an option for TracePrint and TraceDialog that specifies the function to be applied to each expression they trace.

---

TraceBackward
TraceBackward is an option for Trace and related functions that specifies whether to include preceding expressions on the evaluation chain that contains the pattern <i>form</i> sought. 

---

TraceDepth
TraceDepth is an option for Trace and related functions which specifies the maximum nesting of evaluation chains that are to be included. 

---

TraceDialog
TraceDialog[<i>expr</i>] initiates a dialog for every expression used in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

TraceDialog[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] initiates a dialog only for expressions which match <i>form</i>. 

TraceDialog[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>] initiates dialogs only for expressions whose evaluations use transformation rules associated with the symbol <i>s</i>. 

---

TraceForward
TraceForward is an option for Trace and related functions which specifies whether to include later expressions on the evaluation chain that contains the pattern <i>form</i> sought. 

---

TraceInternal
TraceInternal is an option for Trace and related functions which, if True or False, specifies whether to trace evaluations of expressions generated internally by Mathematica. The intermediate Automatic setting traces a selected set of internal evaluations including Messages and sets or unsets of visible symbols.

---

TraceLevel
TraceLevel[] returns the level currently being traced when it appears within Trace and related functions.

---

TraceOff
TraceOff is an option for Trace and related functions which specifies forms inside which tracing should be switched off. 

---

TraceOn
TraceOn is an option for Trace and related functions which specifies when tracing should be switched on. 

---

TraceOriginal
TraceOriginal is an option for Trace that specifies whether to test the form of each expression before its head and arguments are evaluated. 

---

TracePrint
TracePrint[<i>expr</i>] prints all expressions used in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

TracePrint[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] includes only those expressions which match <i>form</i>. 

TracePrint[<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>] includes all evaluations which use transformation rules associated with the symbol <i>s</i>. 

---

TraceScan
TraceScan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] applies <i>f</i> to all expressions used in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

TraceScan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>] includes only those expressions which match <i>form</i>. 

TraceScan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>s</i>] includes all evaluations which use transformation rules associated with the symbol <i>s</i>. 

TraceScan[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>fp</i>] applies <i>f</i> before evaluation and <i>fp</i> after evaluation to expressions used in the evaluation of <i>expr</i>. 

---

TrackedSymbols
TrackedSymbols is an option to Refresh, Manipulate, and related functions that specifies which symbols should trigger updates when their values are changed.

---

TrackingFunction
TrackingFunction is an option for Manipulate controls that specifies functions to use during interactive changing or editing.

---

TracyWidomDistribution
TracyWidomDistribution[β] represents a Tracy–Widom distribution with Dyson index β.

---

TradingChart
TradingChart[{{<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>,{<i>open</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>high</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>low</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>close</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>volume</i><sub>1</sub>}},…}] makes a chart showing prices and volume for each date. 

TradingChart[{"<i>name</i>",<i>daterange</i>}] makes a financial chart for the financial entity "<i>name</i>" over the <i>daterange</i>. 

TradingChart[{…},{<i>ind</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ind</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] makes a financial chart with indicators <i>ind</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>ind</i><sub>2</sub>, …. 

---

TraditionalForm
TraditionalForm[<i>expr</i>] prints as an approximation to the traditional mathematical notation for <i>expr</i>. 

---

TraditionalFunctionNotation
TraditionalFunctionNotation is an option for selections that specifies whether input of the form <i>f</i>(<i>x</i>) is interpreted by the kernel as a function or as a product.

---

TrainingProgressCheckpointing
TrainingProgressCheckpointing is an option for NetTrain that specifies how to save copies of the net during training.

---

TrainingProgressFunction
TrainingProgressFunction is an option for NetTrain that specifies a function to run periodically during training.

---

TrainingProgressMeasurements
TrainingProgressMeasurements is an option for NetTrain that specifies measurements to make while training is in progress.

---

TrainingProgressReporting
TrainingProgressReporting is an option for NetTrain and related functions that specifies how to report the progress of training.

---

TrainingStoppingCriterion
TrainingStoppingCriterion is an option for NetTrain that specifies a criterion for stopping training early in order to prevent overfitting.

---

TrainingUpdateSchedule
TrainingUpdateSchedule is an option for NetTrain that specifies which arrays of the network can be updated at each step of the optimization process.

---

TrainTextContentDetector
TrainTextContentDetector[{<i>text</i><sub>1</sub>{<i>span</i><sub>1</sub><i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,…},…}] trains a ContentDetectorFunction[…] based on the examples given.

---

TransferFunctionCancel
TransferFunctionCancel[<i>tfm</i>] cancels common poles and zeros in the TransferFunctionModel <i>tfm</i>.

TransferFunctionCancel[<i>tfm</i>,<i>crit</i>] cancels only common pole-zero pairs <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

---

TransferFunctionExpand
TransferFunctionExpand[<i>tfm</i>] expands polynomial terms in the numerators and denominators of the TransferFunctionModel <i>tfm</i>.

---

TransferFunctionFactor
TransferFunctionFactor[<i>tfm</i>] factors the polynomial terms in the numerators and denominators of the TransferFunctionModel <i>tfm</i>.

---

TransferFunctionModel
TransferFunctionModel[<i>g[s]</i>,<i>s</i>] represents the model of the transfer-function matrix <i>g</i>[<i>s</i>] with complex variable <i>s</i>.

TransferFunctionModel[{<i>n[s]</i>,<i>d[s]</i>},<i>s</i>] specifies the numerator <i>n[s]</i> and denominator <i>d[s]</i> of a transfer-function model.

TransferFunctionModel[{<i>z</i>,<i>p</i>,<i>g</i>},<i>s</i>] specifies the zeros <i>z</i>, poles <i>p</i>, and gain <i>g</i> of a transfer-function model.

TransferFunctionModel[<i>sys</i>] gives the transfer-function model of the systems model <i>sys</i>.

---

TransferFunctionPoles
TransferFunctionPoles[<i>tfm</i>] gives a matrix of roots of the denominators in the TransferFunctionModel <i>tfm</i>.

TransferFunctionPoles[<i>tfm</i>,<i>reg</i>] only gives the roots inside the region <i>reg</i> on the complex plane.

---

TransferFunctionTransform
TransferFunctionTransform[<i>f</i>,<i>tf</i>] transforms the TransferFunctionModel object <i>tf</i> using the transformation function <i>f</i>.

---

TransferFunctionZeros
TransferFunctionZeros[<i>tfm</i>] gives a matrix of roots of the numerators in the TransferFunctionModel <i>tfm</i>.

TransferFunctionZeros[<i>tfm</i>,<i>reg</i>] only gives the roots inside the region <i>reg</i> on the complex plane.

---

TransformationClass
TransformationClass is an option that specifies the class of geometric transformations to be used.

---

TransformationFunction
TransformationFunction[<i>data</i>] represents a transformation function that applies geometric and other transformations.

---

TransformationFunctions
TransformationFunctions is an option for Simplify and FullSimplify which gives the list of functions to apply to try to transform parts of an expression. 

---

TransformationMatrix
TransformationMatrix[<i>tfun</i>] gives the homogeneous matrix associated with a TransformationFunction object.

---

TransformedDistribution
TransformedDistribution[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>dist</i>] represents the transformed distribution of <i>expr</i> where the random variable <i>x</i> follows the distribution <i>dist</i>.

TransformedDistribution[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>dist</i>] represents the transformed distribution of <i>expr</i> where {<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…} follows the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

TransformedDistribution[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>proc</i>] represents the transformed distribution where <i>expr</i> contains expressions of the form <i>x</i>[<i>t</i>], referring the value at time <i>t</i> from the random process <i>proc</i>.

TransformedDistribution[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>dist</i><sub>2</sub> ,…}] represents a transformed distribution where <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the distributions <i>dist</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dist</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

TransformedField
TransformedField[<i>t</i>,<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] uses the coordinate transformation <i>t</i> to transform the scalar, vector, or tensor field <i>f</i> from coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to <i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TransformedProcess
TransformedProcess[<i>expr</i>,<i>x</i><i>proc</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the transformed process of <i>expr</i> where the variable <i>x</i> follows the random process <i>proc</i> and <i>t</i> denotes the time.

TransformedProcess[<i>expr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub><i>proc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub><i>proc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>t</i>] represents a transformed process where <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … are independent and follow the processes <i>proc</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>proc</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

TransformedRegion
TransformedRegion[<i>reg</i>,<i>f</i>] represents the transformed region {f(p)|p∈reg}, where <i>reg</i> is a region and <i>f</i> is a function.

---

TransitionDirection
TransitionDirection is an option for PaneSelector that specifies the direction in which a transition moves.

---

TransitionDuration
TransitionDuration is an option for PaneSelector that specifies the duration in seconds that a transition effect should last.

---

TransitionEffect
TransitionEffect is an option for PaneSelector that specifies the visual effect used when transitioning between states.

---

TransitiveClosureGraph
TransitiveClosureGraph[<i>g</i>] gives the transitive closure of the graph <i>g</i>.

TransitiveClosureGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

TransitiveReductionGraph
TransitiveReductionGraph[<i>g</i>] gives a transitive reduction of the graph <i>g</i>.

TransitiveReductionGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

Translate
Translate[<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] represents graphics primitives <i>g</i> translated by the vector {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}. 

Translate[<i>g</i>,{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…}, …}] represents multiple copies of <i>g</i> translated by a collection of vectors.

---

TranslationOptions
TranslationOptions{<i>opt</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>opt</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…} is an option for Style and Cell that controls how code translations are displayed.

---

TranslationTransform
TranslationTransform[<i>v</i>] gives a TransformationFunction that represents translation of points by a vector <i>v</i>.

---

Transliterate
Transliterate["<i>string</i>"] attempts to transliterate <i>string</i> into plain ASCII.

Transliterate["<i>string</i>",<i>script</i>] attempts to transliterate <i>string</i> into the specified writing script <i>script</i>.

Transliterate["<i>string</i>",<i>script</i><sub>1</sub><i>script</i><sub>2</sub>] attempts to transliterate <i>string</i> from <i>script</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>script</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

Transparent
Transparent represents perfect transparency in graphics or style specifications. 

---

TravelDirections
TravelDirections[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates directions for travel from <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

TravelDirections[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…},"<i>prop</i>"] gives the property <i>prop</i> of travel directions.

---

TravelDirectionsData
TravelDirectionsData[…] represents travel directions generated by TravelDirections.

---

TravelDistance
TravelDistance[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the estimated distance for travel from <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

TravelDistanceList
TravelDistanceList[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] returns the list {TravelDistance[<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>],…,TravelDistance[<i>loc</i><sub><i>n-1</i></sub>,<i>loc</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>]}.

---

TravelMethod
TravelMethod is an option for TravelDirections and related functions that specifies the mode of transportation to assume.

---

TravelTime
TravelTime[{<i>loc</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the estimated time to travel from <i>loc</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>loc</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

Tree
Tree[{<i>subtree</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>subtree</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a tree with a list of child subtrees <i>subtree</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Tree[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>subtree</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>subtree</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] specifies the children as an association with keys <i>key</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Tree[<i>data</i>,<i>subtrees</i>] represents a tree containing <i>data</i> in its root, with children given by <i>subtrees</i>.

---

TreeCases
TreeCases[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives a list of subtrees of <i>tree</i> with data matching <i>pattern</i>.

TreeCases[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives a list of all subtrees of <i>tree</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i> with data that matches the pattern.

TreeCases[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the first <i>n</i> subtrees in <i>tree</i> with data that matches the pattern.

TreeCases[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of TreeCases that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeChildren
TreeChildren[<i>tree</i>] extracts the children of the root of the Tree object <i>tree</i>.

---

TreeCount
TreeCount[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives the number of subtrees of <i>tree</i> whose data matches <i>pattern</i>.

TreeCount[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives the total number of subtrees with data matching <i>pattern</i> that appear at the levels in <i>tree</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeCount[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of TreeCount that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeData
TreeData[<i>tree</i>] extracts the data in the root of the Tree object <i>tree</i>.

---

TreeDelete
TreeDelete[<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i>] deletes the subtree of <i>tree</i> at the position specified by <i>pos</i>.

TreeDelete[<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes subtrees at several positions.

TreeDelete[<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of TreeDelete that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeDepth
TreeDepth[<i>tree</i>] gives the maximum level of <i>tree</i>.

TreeDepth[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives the maximum level of the subtree with data matching <i>pattern</i>.

---

TreeElementLabel
TreeElementLabel is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies what labels should be used for subtree elements.

---

TreeElementStyle
TreeElementStyle is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies what styles should be used for subtree elements.

---

TreeExpression
TreeExpression[<i>tree</i>] gives an expression from the structure of the Tree object <i>tree</i>.

TreeExpression[<i>tree</i>,<i>struct</i>] gives an expression with data and subtrees of <i>tree</i> interpreted as specified by <i>struct</i>.

---

TreeExtract
TreeExtract[<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i>] extracts the subtree of <i>tree</i> at the position specified by <i>pos</i>.

TreeExtract[<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] extracts a list of subtrees of <i>tree</i>.

TreeExtract[<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i>,<i>h</i>] extracts subtrees of <i>tree</i>, applying <i>h</i> to each subtree.

TreeExtract[<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of TreeExtract that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeForm
TreeForm[<i>expr</i>] displays <i>expr</i> as a tree with different levels at different depths. 

TreeForm[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>] displays <i>expr</i> as a tree only down to level <i>n</i>.

---

TreeGraph
TreeGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a tree where <i>u</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> is the predecessor of <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TreeGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a tree with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

TreeGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] yields a tree with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

TreeGraph[{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>[<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…],…},{…,<i>w</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>[<i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…],…}] yields a tree with vertex and edge properties defined by the symbolic wrappers <i>w</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>.

TreeGraph[{<i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> to specify a tree.

---

TreeGraphQ
TreeGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a tree and False otherwise.

---

TreeInsert
TreeInsert[<i>tree</i>,<i>child</i>,<i>pos</i>] inserts <i>child</i> at the position specified by <i>pos</i> in <i>tree</i>.

TreeInsert[<i>tree</i>,<i>child</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] inserts <i>child</i> at several positions.

TreeInsert[<i>child</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of TreeInsert that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeLayout
TreeLayout is an option to Tree and related functions that specifies what layout to use.

---

TreeLeafQ
TreeLeafQ[<i>tree</i>] gives True if <i>tree</i> is a Tree object with no children, and gives False otherwise.

---

TreeLeaves
TreeLeaves[<i>tree</i>] returns the list of leaves of the tree <i>tree</i>.

---

TreeLevel
TreeLevel[<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] gives a list of all subtrees of <i>tree</i> on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeLevel[<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i><i>elem</i>] gives a list of the element <i>elem</i> of subtrees on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeLevel[<i>levelspec</i>] represents an operator form of TreeLevel that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeMap
TreeMap[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the data of each subtree of <i>tree</i>.

TreeMap[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the data of subtrees on levels of <i>tree</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeMap[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i><i>elems</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the elements <i>elems</i> of subtrees on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeMap[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of TreeMap that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeMapAt
TreeMapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the data at the position specified by <i>pos</i> in <i>tree</i>.

TreeMapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] applies <i>f</i> to the data at several positions.

TreeMapAt[<i>f</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of TreeMapAt that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeOutline
TreeOutline[<i>tree</i>] gives an outline of the data in <i>tree</i> as a nested OpenerView.

TreeOutline[<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i>] gives an outline of the data in <i>tree</i> initially opened to the subtree at the position specified by <i>pos</i>.

TreeOutline[<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] opens the outline to several positions.

---

TreePlot
TreePlot[<i>g</i>] generates a tree plot of the graph <i>g</i>.

TreePlot[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates a tree plot of the graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub>.

TreePlot[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] plots <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

TreePlot[{<i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub></i>,…}] uses rules <i><i>v</i><sub><i>i</i>1</sub></i><i><i>v</i><sub><i>j</i>1</sub></i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

TreePlot[<i>m</i>] generates a tree plot of the graph represented by the adjacency matrix <i>m</i>.

TreePlot[…,<i>v</i><i>pos</i>] places the root <i>v</i> in the plot at position <i>pos</i>.

---

TreePosition
TreePosition[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>] gives a list of the positions of subtrees of <i>tree</i> whose data matches <i>pattern</i>.

TreePosition[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] finds only matches that appear on levels of <i>tree</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreePosition[<i>tree</i>,<i>pattern</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the first <i>n</i> matches found.

TreePosition[<i>pattern</i>] represents an operator form of TreePosition that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeQ
TreeQ[<i>tree</i>] yields True if <i>tree</i> is a valid Tree object and False otherwise.

---

TreeReplacePart
TreeReplacePart[<i>tree</i>,<i>pos</i><i>new</i>] gives a tree in which the subtree of <i>tree</i> at the position specified by <i>pos</i> is replaced with <i>new</i>.

TreeReplacePart[<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub><i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub><i>new</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces subtrees at positions specified by <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>new</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TreeReplacePart[<i>tree</i>,{<i>pos</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>new</i>] replaces all subtrees at positions specified by <i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with <i>new</i>.

TreeReplacePart[<i>tree</i>,{{<i>pos</i><sub>1,1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub>1,2</sub>,…}<i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] replaces subtrees at positions specified by {<i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i>,1</sub>,<i>pos</i><sub><i>i</i>,2</sub>,…} with <i>new</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TreeReplacePart[<i>pos</i><i>new</i>] represents an operator form of TreeReplacePart that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeRules
TreeRules[<i>tree</i>] returns the rules associated with the Tree object <i>tree</i>.

---

TreeScan
TreeScan[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>] evaluates <i>f</i> applied to the data of each subtree of <i>tree</i> in turn.

TreeScan[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the data of subtrees on levels of <i>tree</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeScan[<i>f</i>,<i>tree</i>,<i>levelspec</i><i>elems</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the elements <i>elems</i> of subtrees on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeScan[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of TreeScan that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeSelect
TreeSelect[<i>tree</i>,<i>crit</i>] picks out all subtrees <i>tree</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of <i>tree</i> for which <i>crit</i>[<i>tree</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

TreeSelect[<i>tree</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>n</i>] picks out the first <i>n</i> subtrees for which <i>crit</i>[<i>tree</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] is True.

TreeSelect[<i>tree</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>levelspec</i>,<i>n</i>] picks out subtrees on levels specified by <i>levelspec</i>.

TreeSelect[<i>crit</i>] represents an operator form of TreeSelect that can be applied to a tree.

---

TreeSize
TreeSize[<i>tree</i>] gives the number of subtrees of <i>tree</i>.

---

TreeTraversalOrder
TreeTraversalOrder is an option for TreeMap and related functions that specifies the order to visit subtrees.

---

TrendStyle
TrendStyle is an option to CandlestickChart, RenkoChart, and other financial charting functions that specifies how to style price trends. 

---

Triangle
Triangle[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>3</sub>}] represents a filled triangle with corner points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, and <i>p</i><sub>3</sub>.

Triangle[{{<i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>13</sub>},…}] represents a collection of triangles. 

---

TriangleCenter
TriangleCenter[<i>tri</i>,<i>type</i>] gives the specified type of center for the triangle <i>tri</i>.

TriangleCenter[<i>tri</i>] gives the centroid of the triangle.

---

TriangleConstruct
TriangleConstruct[<i>tri</i>,<i>type</i>] gives the specified type of construct for the triangle <i>tri</i>.

---

TriangleMeasurement
TriangleMeasurement[<i>tri</i>,<i>type</i>] gives the specified type of measurement for the triangle <i>tri</i>.

---

TriangleWave
TriangleWave[<i>x</i>] gives a triangle wave that varies between -1 and +1 with unit period.

TriangleWave[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},<i>x</i>] gives a triangle wave that varies between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i> with unit period.

---

TriangularDistribution
TriangularDistribution[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents a symmetric triangular statistical distribution giving values between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>. 

TriangularDistribution[] represents a symmetric triangular statistical distribution giving values between 0 and 1.

TriangularDistribution[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>},<i>c</i>] represents a triangular distribution with mode at <i>c</i>.

---

TriangulateMesh
TriangulateMesh[<i>mr</i>] generates a triangulation of the mesh region <i>mr</i>.

---

Trig
Trig is an option for various polynomial manipulation functions that specifies whether trigonometric functions should be treated like polynomial elements.

---

TrigExpand
TrigExpand[<i>expr</i>] expands out trigonometric functions in <i>expr</i>. 

---

TrigFactor
TrigFactor[<i>expr</i>] factors trigonometric functions in <i>expr</i>. 

---

TrigFactorList
TrigFactorList[<i>expr</i>] factors trigonometric functions in <i>expr</i>, yielding a list of lists containing trigonometric monomials and exponents. 

---

TrigReduce
TrigReduce[<i>expr</i>] rewrites products and powers of trigonometric functions in <i>expr</i> in terms of trigonometric functions with combined arguments. 

---

TrigToExp
TrigToExp[<i>expr</i>] converts trigonometric functions in <i>expr</i> to exponentials. 

---

TrimmedMean
TrimmedMean[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the mean of the elements in <i>list</i> after dropping a fraction <i>f</i> of the smallest and largest elements.

TrimmedMean[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the mean when a fraction <i>f</i><sub>1</sub> of the smallest elements and a fraction <i>f</i><sub>2</sub> of the largest elements are removed.

TrimmedMean[<i>list</i>] gives the 5% trimmed mean TrimmedMean[<i>list</i>,0.05].

TrimmedMean[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the trimmed mean of a univariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

TrimmedVariance
TrimmedVariance[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the variance of the elements in <i>list</i> after dropping a fraction <i>f</i> of the smallest and largest elements.

TrimmedVariance[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the variance when a fraction <i>f</i><sub>1</sub> of the smallest elements and a fraction <i>f</i><sub>2</sub> of the largest elements are removed.

TrimmedVariance[<i>list</i>] gives the 5% trimmed variance TrimmedVariance[<i>list</i>,0.05].

TrimmedVariance[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the trimmed variance of a univariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

TropicalStormData
TropicalStormData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the tropical storm <i>entity</i>.

TropicalStormData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified tropical storm entities.

TropicalStormData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

True
True is the symbol for the Boolean value true. 

---

TrueQ
TrueQ[<i>expr</i>] yields True if <i>expr</i> is True, and yields False otherwise. 

---

TruncatedDistribution
TruncatedDistribution[{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>dist</i>] represents the distribution obtained by truncating the values of <i>dist</i> to lie between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>.

TruncatedDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…},<i>dist</i>] represents the distribution obtained by truncating the values of the multivariate distribution <i>dist</i> to lie between <i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, <i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub> and <i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>, etc.

---

TruncatedPolyhedron
TruncatedPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>] gives the truncated polyhedron of <i>poly</i> by truncating all vertices. 

TruncatedPolyhedron[<i>poly</i>,<i>l</i>] truncates the polyhedron <i>poly</i> by a length ratio <i>l</i> at its vertices.

---

TsallisQExponentialDistribution
TsallisQExponentialDistribution[λ,<i>q</i>] represents a Tsallis q-exponential distribution with scale inversely proportional to parameter λ.

---

TsallisQGaussianDistribution
TsallisQGaussianDistribution[μ,β,<i>q</i>] represents a Tsallis q-Gaussian distribution with mean μ, scale parameter β, and deformation parameter <i>q</i>.

TsallisQGaussianDistribution[<i>q</i>] represents a Tsallis q-Gaussian distribution with mean 0 and scale parameter 1.

---

TTest
TTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether the mean of <i>data</i> is zero. 

TTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>}] tests whether the means of <i>data</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>data</i><sub>2</sub> are equal.

TTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>] tests the mean against μ<sub>0</sub>.

TTest[<i>dspec</i>,μ<sub>0</sub>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

Tube
Tube[{{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>z</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] represents a 3D tube around the line joining a sequence of points.

Tube[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>r</i>] represents a tube of radius <i>r</i>.

Tube[{{<i>pt</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>pt</i><sub>21</sub>,…},…},…] represents a collection of tubes.

Tube[<i>curve</i>,…] represents a tube around the specified 3D curve.

---

Tuesday
Tuesday is a day of the week.

---

TukeyLambdaDistribution
TukeyLambdaDistribution[λ] represents Tukey's lambda distribution with shape parameter λ.

TukeyLambdaDistribution[λ,μ,σ] represents Tukey's lambda distribution with location parameter μ and scale parameter σ.

TukeyLambdaDistribution[{λ<sub>1</sub>,λ<sub>2</sub>},μ,{σ<sub>1</sub>,σ<sub>2</sub>}] represents the generalized Tukey's lambda distribution with location parameter μ, scale parameters σ<sub>1</sub> and σ<sub>2</sub>, and shape parameters λ<sub>1</sub> and λ<sub>2</sub>.

---

TukeyWindow
TukeyWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Tukey window function of <i>x</i>.

TukeyWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

TunnelData
TunnelData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the tunnel <i>entity</i>.

TunnelData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified tunnel entities.

TunnelData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

TuranGraph
TuranGraph[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>k</i>-partite Turán graph with <i>n</i> vertices T<sub>n,k</sub>.

---

TuringMachine
TuringMachine[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>,<i>t</i>] generates a list representing the evolution of the Turing machine with the specified rule from initial condition <i>init</i> for <i>t</i> steps. 

TuringMachine[<i>rule</i>,<i>init</i>] gives the result of evolving <i>init</i> for one step. 

TuringMachine[<i>rule</i>] is an operator form of TuringMachine that corresponds to one step of evolution.

---

TuttePolynomial
TuttePolynomial[<i>g</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] gives the Tutte polynomial of the graph <i>g</i>.

TuttePolynomial[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

TwoWayRule
<i>x</i><-><i>y</i> or <i>x</i><i>y</i> represents a two-way rule expressing exchange or correspondence of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>.

---

Typed
Typed[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>] represents an expression that should be assumed to be of a specified type for compilation and other purposes.

---

TypeSpecifier
TypeSpecifier[<i>cons</i>] represents a type.

TypeSpecifier[<i>cons</i>][<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…] or <i>cons</i>::[<i>type</i><sub>1</sub>,…] represents a compound type.

---

UnateQ
UnateQ[<i>bexpr</i>,{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether the Boolean expression <i>bexpr</i> is positive unate in the variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

UnateQ[<i>bexpr</i>,{¬<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,¬<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether the Boolean expression <i>bexpr</i> is negative unate in the variables <i>x</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>x</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

---

Uncompress
Uncompress["<i>string</i>"] recovers an expression from a compressed string representation generated by Compress.

Uncompress["<i>string</i>",<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the expression produced before evaluating it. 

---

UnconstrainedParameters
UnconstrainedParameters is an option to functions like GeometricScene that specifies what parameters should be treated as unconstrained, so that they can take on any possible value.

---

Undefined
Undefined is a symbol that represents a quantity with no defined value.

---

UnderBar
UnderBar[<i>expr</i>] displays with a bar under <i>expr</i>.

---

Underflow
Underflow[] represents a number too small to represent explicitly on your computer system.

---

Underlined
Underlined represents an underlined font.

---

Underoverscript
Underoverscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i>+<i>y</i>%<i>z</i>. 

---

Underscript
Underscript[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is an object that formats as <i>x</i>+<i>y</i>. 

---

UnderseaFeatureData
UnderseaFeatureData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the undersea feature <i>entity</i>.

UnderseaFeatureData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified undersea feature entities.

UnderseaFeatureData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

UndirectedGraph
UndirectedGraph[<i>g</i>] gives an undirected graph from the directed graph <i>g</i>.

UndirectedGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

UndirectedGraphQ
UndirectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is an undirected graph and False otherwise.

---

Unequal
<i>lhs</i>!=<i>rhs</i> or <i>lhs</i>≠<i>rhs</i> returns False if <i>lhs</i> and <i>rhs</i> are identical. 

---

UnequalTo
UnequalTo[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x≠y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

Unevaluated
Unevaluated[<i>expr</i>] represents the unevaluated form of <i>expr</i> when it appears as the argument to a function. 

---

UniformDistribution
UniformDistribution[{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents a continuous uniform statistical distribution giving values between <i>min</i> and <i>max</i>. 

UniformDistribution[] represents a uniform distribution giving values between 0 and 1.

UniformDistribution[{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] represents a multivariate uniform distribution over the region {{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}.

UniformDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents a multivariate uniform distribution over the standard <i>n</i> dimensional unit hypercube. 

---

UniformGraphDistribution
UniformGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] represents a uniform graph distribution on <i>n</i>-vertex, <i>m</i>-edge graphs.

---

UniformPolyhedron
UniformPolyhedron["<i>name</i>"] gives the uniform polyhedron with the given <i>name</i>.

UniformPolyhedron[{<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>}] gives the uniform polyhedron with <i>n</i> sides of each face and <i>m</i> faces meeting at each vertex point.

UniformPolyhedron[{<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ},…] rescales the uniform polyhedron by a factor <i>r</i> and rotates by an angle θ with respect to the <i>z</i> axis and angle ϕ with respect to the <i>y</i> axis.

UniformPolyhedron[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>},{<i>r</i>,θ,ϕ},…] centers the uniform polyhedron at {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}.

---

UniformSumDistribution
UniformSumDistribution[<i>n</i>] represents the distribution of a sum of <i>n</i> random variables uniformly distributed from 0 to 1.

UniformSumDistribution[<i>n</i>,{<i>min</i>,<i>max</i>}] represents the distribution of a sum of <i>n</i> random variables uniformly distributed from <i>min</i> to <i>max</i>.

---

Uninstall
Uninstall[<i>link</i>] terminates an external program started by Install, and removes Wolfram Language definitions set up by it. 

---

Union
Union[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a sorted list of all the distinct elements that appear in any of the <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

Union[<i>list</i>] gives a sorted version of a list, in which all duplicated elements have been dropped. 

---

UnionedEntityClass
UnionedEntityClass[<i>class</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>] represents an entity class containing all the distinct entities in all the <i>class</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

UnionPlus
UnionPlus[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⊎<i>y</i>⊎….

---

Unique
Unique[] generates a new symbol, whose name is of the form $<i>nnn</i>. 

Unique[<i>x</i>] generates a new symbol, with a name of the form <i>x</i>$<i>nnn</i>. 

Unique[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}] generates a list of new symbols. 

Unique["<i>xxx</i>"] generates a new symbol, with a name of the form <i>xxxnnn</i>. 

---

UnitaryMatrixQ
UnitaryMatrixQ[<i>m</i>] gives True if <i>m</i> is a unitary matrix, and False otherwise.

---

UnitConvert
UnitConvert[<i>quantity</i>,<i>targetunit</i>] attempts to convert the specified <i>quantity</i> to the specified <i>targetunit</i>.

UnitConvert[<i>quantity</i>] converts the specified <i>quantity</i> to SI base units.

---

UnitDimensions
UnitDimensions[<i>unit</i>] returns a list of base dimensions associated with the specified <i>unit</i>.

UnitDimensions[<i>quantity</i>] returns a list of base dimensions associated with the unit of the specified <i>quantity</i>.

---

Unitize
Unitize[<i>x</i>] gives 0 when <i>x</i> is zero, and 1 when <i>x</i> has any other numerical value.

---

UnitRootTest
UnitRootTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether data came from an autoregressive time series process with unit root.

UnitRootTest[<i>data</i>,<i>model</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>" for a given model.

---

UnitSimplify
UnitSimplify[<i>quantity</i>] attempts to simplify the units of the specified <i>quantity</i>.

---

UnitStep
UnitStep[<i>x</i>] represents the unit step function, equal to 0 for x<0 and 1 for x≥0. 

UnitStep[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional unit step function which is 1 only if none of the x<sub>i</sub> are negative. 

---

UnitTriangle
UnitTriangle[<i>x</i>] represents the unit triangle function on the interval x≤1 .

UnitTriangle[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the multidimensional unit triangle function on the interval x<sub>i</sub>≤1.

---

UnitVector
UnitVector[<i>k</i>] gives the two-dimensional unit vector in the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> direction.

UnitVector[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the <i>n</i>-dimensional unit vector in the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> direction.

---

UnitVectorLayer
UnitVectorLayer[<i>n</i>] represents a net layer that transforms integers between 1 and <i>n</i> into <i>n</i>-dimensional unit vectors. 

UnitVectorLayer[] leaves the <i>n</i> to be inferred from context.

---

UnityDimensions
UnityDimensions is an option for UnitSimplify that specifies which UnitDimensions should be factored out.

---

UniverseModelData
UniverseModelData[<i>spec</i>] returns properties of the universe based on the default model at specification defined by the time after the Big Bang, the distance to the comoving object, or the redshift of such an object.

UniverseModelData[<i>spec</i>,<i>model</i>] returns properties of universe <i>model</i> at <i>spec</i>.

UniverseModelData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>] returns the specified property at the time or distance <i>spec</i>.

UniverseModelData[<i>spec</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>model</i>] returns the specified property at the time or distance <i>spec</i> for the universe <i>model</i>.

---

UniversityData
UniversityData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the university <i>entity</i>.

UniversityData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified university entities.

UniversityData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

UnixTime
UnixTime[] gives the total number of seconds since the beginning of January 1, 1970, in the GMT time zone.

UnixTime[{<i>y</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>h</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>s</i>}] gives the Unix time specification corresponding to a date list.

UnixTime[<i>date</i>] gives the Unix time specification corresponding to a DateObject.

UnixTime["<i>string</i>"] gives the Unix time specification corresponding to a date string.

UnixTime[{"<i>string</i>",{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}}] takes the date string to contain the elements "<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>".

---

Unprotect
Unprotect[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] removes the attribute Protected for the symbols <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Unprotect[<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub>,…] unprotects all symbols whose names textually match any of the arbitrary string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

Unprotect[{<i>spec</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>spec</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] unprotects any symbols that are equal to or whose names match any of the <i>spec</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

UnregisterExternalEvaluator
UnregisterExternalEvaluator[<i>sys</i>,<i>evaluator</i>] unregisters the external evaluator referenced by <i>evaluator</i> for system <i>sys</i> so that it is not used by ExternalEvaluate and related functions.

---

UnsameQ
<i>lhs</i>=!=<i>rhs</i> yields True if the expression <i>lhs</i> is not identical to <i>rhs</i>, and yields False otherwise. 

---

Unset
<i>lhs</i>=. removes any rules defined for <i>lhs</i>. 

---

UnsetShared
UnsetShared[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,…] stops the sharing of the variables or functions <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> among parallel kernels.

UnsetShared[<i>patt</i>] stops the sharing of all variables and functions whose names match the string pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

UpArrow
UpArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↑<i>y</i>↑….

---

UpArrowBar
UpArrowBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⤒<i>y</i>⤒….

---

UpArrowDownArrow
UpArrowDownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⇅<i>y</i>⇅….

---

Update
Update[<i>symbol</i>] tells the Wolfram Language that hidden changes have been made that could affect values associated with a symbol. 

Update[] specifies that the value of any symbol could be affected. 

---

UpdatePacletSites
UpdatePacletSites is an option to PacletInstall and PacletInstallSubmit that specifies whether to first update the local cache of information about available paclets.

---

UpdateSearchIndex
UpdateSearchIndex[<i>obj</i>] updates the given search index object.

UpdateSearchIndex[<i>"name"</i>] updates the search index with the specified name in the SearchIndices[] list.

---

UpDownArrow
UpDownArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↕<i>y</i>↕….

---

UpEquilibrium
UpEquilibrium[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⥮<i>y</i>⥮….

---

UpperCaseQ
UpperCaseQ[<i>string</i>] yields True if all the characters in the string are uppercase letters, and yields False otherwise. 

---

UpperLeftArrow
UpperLeftArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↖<i>y</i>↖….

---

UpperRightArrow
UpperRightArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↗<i>y</i>↗….

---

Upsample
Upsample[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>] returns an upsampled version of the array by inserting n-1 zeros between array elements.

Upsample[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>offset</i>] shifts <i>array</i> so that its first element moves to the position <i>offset</i> in the resulting array.

Upsample[<i>array</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>offset</i>,<i>val</i>] inserts n-1 elements of value <i>val</i> between array elements.

Upsample[<i>image</i>,…] upsamples an image.

---

UpSet
<i>lhs</i>^=<i>rhs</i> assigns <i>rhs</i> to be the value of <i>lhs</i>, and associates the assignment with symbols that occur at level one in <i>lhs</i>. 

---

UpSetDelayed
<i>lhs</i>^:=<i>rhs</i> assigns <i>rhs</i> to be the delayed value of <i>lhs</i>, and associates the assignment with symbols that occur at level one in <i>lhs</i>. 

---

UpTee
UpTee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] displays as x⊥y.

---

UpTeeArrow
UpTeeArrow[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>↥<i>y</i>↥….

---

UpTo
UpTo[<i>n</i>] is a symbolic specification that represents up to <i>n</i> objects or positions. If <i>n</i> objects or positions are available, all are used. If fewer are available, only those available are used.

---

UpValues
UpValues[<i>f</i>] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all upvalues (values for <i>g</i>[…,<i>f</i>[…],…]) defined for the symbol <i>f</i>. 

UpValues["<i>symbol</i>"] gives a list of transformation rules corresponding to all upvalues defined for the symbol named "<i>symbol</i>" if it exists.

---

URL
URL["<i>url</i>"] is a symbolic representation of a URL.

---

URLBuild
URLBuild["<i>path</i>",{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] builds a URL with the specified path and query parameters and values <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

URLBuild[{<i>path</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>path</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] builds a URL from the path components <i>path</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

URLBuild[<i>path</i>,<i>params</i>] builds a URL from a specification of a path and query parameters.

URLBuild[<i>assoc</i>] builds a URL from an association of components.

URLBuild[<i>assoc</i>,<i>params</i>] builds a URL from an association of components, plus query parameters and values.

---

URLDecode
URLDecode["<i>string</i>"] decodes a URL-style percent-encoded string.

---

URLDispatcher
URLDispatcher[{<i>patt</i><sub>1</sub><i>content</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>patt</i><sub>2</sub><i>content</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a dispatcher for deployed URLs that specifies that URLs with relative paths matching the string patterns <i>patt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> should give content represented by <i>content</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

URLDownload
URLDownload[<i>url</i>] downloads the content of the specified URL to a local temporary file.

URLDownload[{<i>url</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>url</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] downloads the contents of the specified URLs to files in a local temporary directory.

URLDownload[<i>url</i>,<i>file</i>] downloads to a specified file.

URLDownload[{<i>url</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>url</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dir</i>] downloads to a specified directory.

URLDownload[HTTPRequest[…],…] downloads the result of the specified HTTP request.

URLDownload[{<i>req</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>req</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] downloads the results of the list of HTTP requests.

URLDownload[<i>req</i>,<i>loc</i>,"<i>elem</i>"] returns only the element <i>elem</i> from the response.

URLDownload[<i>req</i>,<i>loc</i>,"<i>elem</i>"] returns only the element <i>elem</i> from the response.

URLDownload[<i>req</i>,<i>loc</i>,{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns an association of the values of the elements <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

URLDownloadSubmit
URLDownloadSubmit[<i>url</i>, <i>file</i>] submits the specified URL to be downloaded asynchronously to the file given.

URLDownloadSubmit[<i>url</i>,<i>file</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] submits the specified URL, adding elements with names <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

URLDownloadSubmit[<i>obj</i>,…] submits the cloud object <i>obj</i>.

URLDownloadSubmit[HTTPRequest[…],…] submits the specified HTTP request.

---

URLEncode
URLEncode["<i>string</i>"] converts "<i>string</i>" into a URL-style, percent-encoded ASCII string. 

---

URLExecute
URLExecute[<i>url</i>] executes the specified URL, importing whatever result is generated.

URLExecute[<i>url</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] executes the specified URL, adding elements with names <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

URLExecute[<i>url</i>,<i>params</i>,<i>format</i>] imports the result using the specified format.

URLExecute[CloudObject[…],…] executes a cloud object with current authentication settings. 

URLExecute[HTTPRequest[…],…] executes the specified HTTP request.

---

URLExpand
URLExpand["<i>url</i>"] expands a shortened "<i>url</i>".

---

URLFetch
URLFetch[<i>url</i>] returns the contents of a URL as a string.

URLFetch[<i>url</i>,<i>elements</i>] returns the specified elements from a URL.

---

URLFetchAsynchronous
URLFetchAsynchronous[<i>url</i>,<i>func</i>] performs a connection in the background, calling <i>func</i> when an event is raised.

---

URLParse
URLParse["<i>url</i>"] takes a well-formed URL and gives an association whose values correspond to the components of the URL.

URLParse["<i>url</i>","<i>component</i>"] returns only the specified component.

URLParse["<i>url</i>",{<i>component</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>component</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns only the specified component list.

---

URLQueryDecode
URLQueryDecode["<i>string</i>"] decodes a URL-style query string into a list of key-value rules. 

---

URLQueryEncode
URLQueryEncode[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] creates a URL-style query string from an association of keys and values. 

URLQueryEncode[{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] creates a query string from a list of rules.

---

URLRead
URLRead[<i>url</i>] sends a request to a URL and reads back the response, returning it as a response object.

URLRead[<i>assoc</i>] sends a request to a URL built from an association of components and metadata elements.

URLRead[HTTPRequest[…]] sends a request specified by a symbolic HTTPRequest object.

URLRead[<i>req</i>,"<i>elem</i>"] returns only the element <i>elem</i> from the response.

URLRead[<i>req</i>,{<i>elem</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>elem</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] returns an association of the values of the elements <i>elem</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

URLRead[{<i>req</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>req</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] sends the requests <i>req</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in parallel, giving a list of the results obtained.

---

URLResponseTime
URLResponseTime[<i>url</i>] gives the total number of seconds to request one byte from the specified URL.

URLResponseTime[<i>url</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the specified timing.

---

URLSave
URLSave["<i>url</i>"] saves the content of the URL to a file in $TemporaryDirectory.

URLSave["<i>url</i>","<i>file</i>"] saves the content of the URL to a file.

URLSave["<i>url</i>","<i>file</i>",<i>elements</i>] returns the specified elements from a URL.

---

URLSaveAsynchronous
URLSaveAsynchronous["<i>url</i>","<i>file</i>",<i>func</i>] performs a download to "<i>file</i>" in the background, calling <i>func</i> when an event is raised.

---

URLShorten
URLShorten["<i>url</i>"] creates a shortened URL that redirects to "<i>url</i>".

URLShorten[CloudObject[…]] creates a shortened URL that redirects to the URL for the specified cloud object.

---

URLSubmit
URLSubmit[<i>url</i>] submits the specified URL to be executed asynchronously.

URLSubmit[<i>url</i>,{<i>param</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>param</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] submits the specified URL, adding elements with names <i>param</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

URLSubmit[<i>obj</i>,…] submits the cloud object <i>obj</i>.

URLSubmit[HTTPRequest[…],…] submits the specified HTTP request.

---

UseEmbeddedLibrary
UseEmbeddedLibrary is an option of FunctionCompile that embeds a shared library in a CompiledCodeFunction.

---

Using
Using is an option to Roots that specifies any subsidiary equations that are to be used.

---

UtilityFunction
UtilityFunction is an option for Predict, Classify, and related functions that specifies the utility value to assign to each possible pairing of actual and predicted values.

---

V2Get
V2Get[<i>name</i>] reads in a file written by the V2.x versions.

---

ValenceFilling
ValenceFilling is an option for Molecule that specifies whether to fill open valences with hydrogen atoms.

---

ValidationLength
ValidationLength is an option to FindSequenceFunction and related functions that specifies the number of elements in the input sequence that should be used to validate a potential representation found.

---

ValidationSet
ValidationSet is an option for Predict, Classify, NetTrain, and related functions that specifies the validation set to be used during the training phase.

---

ValueDimensions
ValueDimensions is an option to TemporalData, TimeSeries, and EventSeries that specifies the dimension of the value space. 

---

ValueForm
ValueForm is an internal symbol.

---

ValuePreprocessingFunction
ValuePreprocessingFunction is an option for functions such as PersistentSymbol and InitializationValue that specifies a function to apply to a new value that is being assigned.

---

ValueQ
ValueQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if a value has been defined for <i>expr</i>, and gives False otherwise. 

---

Values
Values[<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives a list of the values <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in an association.
