Values[{<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a list of the <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in a list of rules.

Values[<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] gives a list of values in <i>expr</i>, wrapping each of them with head <i>h</i> before evaluation. 

---

Variables
Variables[<i>poly</i>] gives a list of all independent variables in a polynomial. 

---

Variance
Variance[<i>data</i>] gives the variance estimate of the elements in <i>data</i>. 

Variance[<i>dist</i>] gives the variance of the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

VarianceEquivalenceTest
VarianceEquivalenceTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] tests whether the variances of the <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are equal. 

VarianceEquivalenceTest[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,…}<i>,</i>"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

VarianceEstimatorFunction
VarianceEstimatorFunction is an option for LinearModelFit and NonlinearModelFit which specifies the variance estimator to use.

---

VarianceGammaDistribution
VarianceGammaDistribution[λ,α,β,μ] represents a variance‐gamma distribution with location parameter μ, skewness parameter β, and shape parameters λ and α.

---

VariogramFunction
VariogramFunction is an option to SpatialEstimate that specifies the local variation model to use. 

---

VariogramModel
VariogramModel["<i>model</i>",{<i>params</i>}] represents the function for the variogram model specified by "<i>model</i>".

---

VectorAngle
VectorAngle[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the angle between the vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

VectorAround
VectorAround[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{δ<sub>1</sub>,δ<sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a vector of uncorrelated approximate numbers or quantities with values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and uncertainties δ<sub><i>i</i></sub>.

VectorAround[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{Δ<sub>11</sub>,Δ<sub>12</sub>,…},{Δ<sub>12</sub>,Δ<sub>22</sub>,…},…}] represents a vector of approximate numbers or quantities with values <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and covariance matrix Δ.

VectorAround[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>},{{δ<sub>1</sub>,δ<sub>2</sub>},ρ}] represents a pair of approximate numbers or quantities with uncertainties δ<sub>1</sub>, δ<sub>2</sub> and correlation factor ρ.

VectorAround[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{δ<sub>1</sub>,δ<sub>2</sub>,…},{{1,<i>R</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>R</i><sub>12</sub>,1,…},…}}] represents a vector of approximate numbers or quantities with uncertainties δ<sub><i>i</i></sub> and correlation matrix <i>R</i>.

---

VectorAspectRatio
VectorAspectRatio is an option setting for VectorPlot and related functions that determines the relative width and length of the arrow markers in the plot.

---

VectorColorFunction
VectorColorFunction is an option for VectorPlot and related functions that specifies a function to apply to determine colors of field vectors drawn. 

---

VectorColorFunctionScaling
VectorColorFunctionScaling is an option for graphics functions which specifies whether arguments supplied to a vector color function should be scaled to lie between 0 and 1. 

---

VectorDensityPlot
VectorDensityPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},<i>r</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a vector plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>, superimposed on a density plot of the scalar field <i>r</i>. 

VectorDensityPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] takes the scalar field to be the norm of the vector field.

VectorDensityPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…,<i>r</i>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several vector fields. 

VectorDensityPlot[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

VectorDisplacementPlot
VectorDisplacementPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a displacement plot for the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>.

VectorDisplacementPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] plots the displacement over the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

VectorDisplacementPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},<i>s</i>},…] uses the scalar field <i>s</i> to style the displacement.

---

VectorDisplacementPlot3D
VectorDisplacementPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a displacement plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i> and <i>z</i>.

VectorDisplacementPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] plots the displacement over the geometric region <i>reg</i>.

VectorDisplacementPlot3D[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},<i>s</i>},…] uses the scalar field <i>s</i> to style the displacement.

---

VectorGreater
<i>x</i><i>y</i> or VectorGreater[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] yields True for vectors of length <i>n</i> if <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>><i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for all components 1≤i≤n.

<i>x</i><sub>κ</sub><i>y</i> or VectorGreater[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},κ] yields True for <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> if x-y∈interior(κ), where κ is a proper convex cone.

---

VectorGreaterEqual
<i>x</i><i>y</i> or VectorGreaterEqual[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] yields True for vectors of length <i>n</i> if <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>≥y<sub><i>i</i></sub> for all components 1≤i≤n.

<i>x</i><sub>κ</sub><i>y</i> or VectorGreaterEqual[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},κ] yields True for <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> if <i>x</i>-<i>y</i>∈κ, where κ is a proper convex cone.

---

VectorLess
<i>x</i><i>y</i> or VectorLess[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] yields True for vectors of length <i>n</i> if <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for all components 1≤i≤n.

<i>x</i><sub>κ</sub><i>y</i> or VectorLess[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},κ] yields True for <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> if y-x∈interior(κ), where κ is a proper convex cone.

---

VectorLessEqual
<i>x</i><i>y</i> or VectorLessEqual[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}] yields True for vectors of length <i>n</i> if <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>≤<i>y</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for all components 1≤i≤n.

<i>x</i><sub>κ</sub><i>y</i> or VectorLessEqual[{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>},κ] yields True for <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> if <i>y</i>-<i>x</i>∈κ, where κ is a proper convex cone.

---

VectorMarkers
VectorMarkers is an option for graphics functions like VectorPlot, ListVectorPlot and related functions that specifies what markers to draw at the field points plotted. 

---

VectorPlot
VectorPlot[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a vector plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i> and <i>y</i>. 

VectorPlot[{{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},{<i>w</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>},…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several vector fields. 

VectorPlot[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

VectorPlot3D
VectorPlot3D[{<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] generates a 3D vector plot of the vector field {<i>v</i><sub><i>x</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>y</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>z</i></sub>} as a function of <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, and <i>z</i>.

VectorPlot3D[{<i>field</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>field</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>y</i>,<i>y</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>y</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>z</i>,<i>z</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>z</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] plots several vector fields.

VectorPlot3D[…,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>}∈<i>reg</i>] takes the variables {<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>} to be in the geometric region <i>reg</i>. 

---

VectorPoints
VectorPoints is an option to VectorPlot, ListVectorPlot, and related functions that determines where to draw arrows.

---

VectorQ
VectorQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a list or a one‐dimensional SparseArray object, none of whose elements are themselves lists, and gives False otherwise. 

VectorQ[<i>expr</i>,<i>test</i>] gives True only if <i>test</i> yields True when applied to each of the elements in <i>expr</i>. 

---

VectorRange
VectorRange is an option for VectorPlot and related functions that specifies the range of vector magnitudes to include in a plot.

---

Vectors
Vectors[<i>d</i>] represents the domain of vectors of dimension <i>d</i>.

Vectors[<i>d</i>,<i>dom</i>] represents the domain of vectors of dimension <i>d</i>, with components in the domain <i>dom</i>.

---

VectorScale
VectorScale is an option to VectorPlot, ListVectorPlot, and related functions that determines the length and arrowhead size of field vectors that are drawn. 

---

VectorScaling
VectorScaling is an option for VectorPlot and related functions that determines how the magnitudes of vectors are scaled for visualization.

---

VectorSizes
VectorSizes is an option for VectorPlot and related functions that specifies the range of sizes used for arrows.

---

VectorStyle
VectorStyle is an option to VectorPlot, ListVectorPlot, and related functions that determines the style to use for drawing field vectors.

---

Vee
Vee[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋁<i>y</i>⋁….

---

Verbatim
Verbatim[<i>expr</i>] represents <i>expr</i> in pattern matching, requiring that <i>expr</i> be matched exactly as it appears, with no substitutions for blanks or other transformations. 

---

VerificationTest
VerificationTest[<i>input</i>] runs a verification test to determine whether <i>input</i> evaluates to True.

VerificationTest[<i>input</i>,<i>expected</i>] tests whether <i>input</i> evaluates to <i>expected</i>, without issuing messages.

VerificationTest[<i>input</i>,<i>expected</i>,<i>messages</i>] tests whether <i>input</i> evaluates to <i>expected</i>, generating the list of message names <i>messages</i>.

---

VerifyConvergence
VerifyConvergence is an option to Sum, NSum, and similar functions that specifies whether convergence checking should be done.

---

VerifyDerivedKey
VerifyDerivedKey[<i>key</i>,<i>password</i>] verifies that <i>password</i> matches the password used to generate the derived <i>key</i>.

---

VerifyDigitalSignature
VerifyDigitalSignature[{<i>expr</i>,<i>sig</i><i>}</i>,<i>key</i>] verifies the digital signature <i>sig</i> for <i>expr</i> using the specified public key.

VerifyDigitalSignature[{{<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>sig</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>sig</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>key</i>] verifies the digital signatures <i>sig</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for each of the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, all using the specified public key.

VerifyDigitalSignature[<i>key</i>] is an operator form of VerifyDigitalSignature, suitable for application to {<i>expr</i>,<i>sig</i>} or a list of such pairs.

---

VerifyFileSignature
VerifyFileSignature[{"<i>file</i>",<i>sig</i>},<i>key</i>] verifies the digital signature <i>sig</i> for <i>file</i> using the specified public key.

VerifyFileSignature[{"<i>file</i>",<i>range</i>,<i>sig</i>},<i>key</i>] verifies the digital signature <i>sig</i> for the specified <i>range</i> of bytes in the <i>file</i>.

VerifyFileSignature[{{<i>file</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>range</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>sig</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>file</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>range</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>sig</i><sub>2</sub>},…},<i>key</i>] verifies the digital signatures <i>sig</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> for each of <i>range</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> of bytes in the <i>file</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, all using the specified public key.

VerifyFileSignature[<i>key</i>] represents an operator form of VerifyFileSignature that can be applied to files.

---

VerifyInterpretation
VerifyInterpretation is an option for TextCases, TextPosition and TextContents that verifies that results can be interpreted using Interpreter and related functions and drops those that cannot. 

---

VerifySecurityCertificates
VerifySecurityCertificates is an option for URLRead and related functions that specifies whether to verify security certificates when making an HTTPS connection.

---

VerifySolutions
VerifySolutions is an option to Solve and related functions that controls whether to verify solutions. 

---

VerifyTestAssumptions
VerifyTestAssumptions is an option to LocationTest and similar functions that controls which assumptions to verify through diagnostic tests.

---

VertexAdd
VertexAdd[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] makes a graph by adding the vertex <i>v</i> to the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexAdd[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] adds a collection of vertices to <i>g</i>.

VertexAdd[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexCapacity
VertexCapacity is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies a vertex capacity.

---

VertexChromaticNumber
VertexChromaticNumber[<i>g</i>] gives the chromatic number for the vertices of the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexColors
VertexColors is an option for graphics primitives which specifies the colors to assign to vertices.

---

VertexComponent
VertexComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the vertices in the graph <i>g</i> that have a path to at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

VertexComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives the vertices with a path to at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … of at most length <i>k</i>.

VertexComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>}] gives the vertices at length exactly <i>k</i>.

VertexComponent[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexConnectivity
VertexConnectivity[<i>g</i>] gives the vertex connectivity of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexConnectivity[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the <i>s</i>-<i>t</i> vertex connectivity of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexConnectivity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexContract
VertexContract[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] contracts a collection of vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … into a single vertex of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexContract[<i>g</i>,{{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] contracts several collections of vertices. 

VertexContract[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexCoordinateRules
VertexCoordinateRules is an option for GraphPlot and related functions which specifies rules for determining the coordinates at which vertices should be placed.

---

VertexCoordinates
VertexCoordinates is an option to Graph and related functions that specifies the coordinates to use to place the center of vertices.

---

VertexCorrelationSimilarity
VertexCorrelationSimilarity[<i>g</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the correlation similarity between vertices <i>u</i> and <i>v</i> of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexCorrelationSimilarity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexCosineSimilarity
VertexCosineSimilarity[<i>g</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the cosine similarity between vertices <i>u</i> and <i>v</i> of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexCosineSimilarity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexCount
VertexCount[<i>g</i>] gives a count of the number of vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexCount[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a count of the number of vertices that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

VertexCount[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexCoverQ
VertexCoverQ[<i>g</i>,<i>vlist</i>] yields True if the vertex list <i>vlist</i> is a vertex cover of the graph <i>g</i>, and False otherwise.

---

VertexDataCoordinates
VertexDataCoordinates is an option to Raster3D that determines how to map data to the displayed range.

---

VertexDegree
VertexDegree[<i>g</i>] gives the list of vertex degrees for all vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexDegree[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the vertex degree for the vertex <i>v</i>.

VertexDegree[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexDelete
VertexDelete[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] makes a graph by deleting the vertex ν and all edges connected to <i>v</i> from the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexDelete[<i>g</i>,<i>{</i><i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] deletes a collection of vertices from <i>g</i>.

VertexDelete[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] deletes all vertices that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

VertexDelete[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexDiceSimilarity
VertexDiceSimilarity[<i>g</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Dice similarity between vertices <i>u</i> and <i>v</i> of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexDiceSimilarity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexEccentricity
VertexEccentricity[<i>g</i>,<i>s</i>] gives the length of the longest shortest path from the source <i>s</i> to every other vertex in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexEccentricity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexInComponent
VertexInComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives the vertices with a directed path to at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … of at most length <i>k</i>.

VertexInComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>}] gives the vertices at length exactly <i>k</i>.

VertexInComponent[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexInComponentGraph
VertexInComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the subgraph of the graph <i>g</i> generated by the vertices that have a directed path to at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,….

VertexInComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives the subgraph of <i>g</i> generated by vertices with a directed path of at most length <i>k</i> to at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,….

VertexInComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>}] gives the subgraph of <i>g</i> generated by vertices of length exactly <i>k</i>.

VertexInComponentGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexInDegree
VertexInDegree[<i>g</i>] gives the list of vertex in-degrees for all vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexInDegree[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the vertex in-degree for the vertex <i>v</i>.

VertexInDegree[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexIndex
VertexIndex[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the integer index for the vertex <i>v</i> in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexIndex[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexJaccardSimilarity
VertexJaccardSimilarity[<i>g</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Jaccard similarity between vertices <i>u</i> and <i>v</i> of the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexJaccardSimilarity[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexLabeling
VertexLabeling is an option for GraphPlot and related functions which specifies whether labeling should be included by default for vertices in graphs.

---

VertexLabels
VertexLabels is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies what labels and label positions should be used for vertices.

---

VertexLabelStyle
VertexLabelStyle is an option and property for Graph and related functions that specifies the style to use for vertex labels.

---

VertexList
VertexList[<i>g</i>] gives the list of vertices for the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexList[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives a list of vertices that match the pattern <i>patt</i>.

VertexList[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexNormals
VertexNormals is an option for graphics primitives which specifies the normal directions to assign to 3D vertices.

---

VertexOutComponent
VertexOutComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the vertices in the graph <i>g</i> that have a directed path from at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

VertexOutComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives the vertices with a directed path from at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … of at most length <i>k</i>.

VertexOutComponent[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>}] gives the vertices at length exactly <i>k</i>.

VertexOutComponent[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexOutComponentGraph
VertexOutComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the subgraph of the graph <i>g</i> generated by the vertices that have a directed path from at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,….

VertexOutComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>k</i>] gives the subgraph of <i>g</i> generated by vertices with a directed path of at most length <i>k</i> from at least one of <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,….

VertexOutComponentGraph[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>k</i>}] gives the subgraph of <i>g</i> generated by vertices of length exactly <i>k</i>.

VertexOutComponentGraph[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>.

---

VertexOutDegree
VertexOutDegree[<i>g</i>] gives the list of vertex out-degrees for all vertices in the graph <i>g</i>.

VertexOutDegree[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the vertex out-degree for the vertex <i>v</i>.

VertexOutDegree[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexQ
VertexQ[<i>g</i>,<i>v</i>] yields True if <i>v</i> is a vertex in the graph <i>g</i> and False otherwise.

---

VertexRenderingFunction
VertexRenderingFunction is an option for GraphPlot and related functions that gives a function to generate the graphics primitives to use in rendering each vertex.

---

VertexReplace
VertexReplace[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub><i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub><i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] replaces each vertex <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in the graph <i>g</i> by <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

VertexReplace[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

VertexShape
VertexShape is an option and property for Graph and related functions that specifies the graphics used for vertices.

---

VertexShapeFunction
VertexShapeFunction is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies a function to use to generate primitives for rendering each vertex. 

---

VertexSize
VertexSize is an option and property for Graph and related functions that specifies the size used for vertices. 

---

VertexStyle
VertexStyle is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies what style to use for vertices. 

---

VertexTextureCoordinates
VertexTextureCoordinates is an option for graphics primitives that specifies the texture coordinates to assign to vertices.

---

VertexTransitiveGraphQ
VertexTransitiveGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a vertex–transitive graph and False otherwise.

---

VertexWeight
VertexWeight is an option and annotation for Graph and related functions that specifies a vertex weight.

---

VertexWeightedGraphQ
VertexWeightedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a vertex-weighted graph, and False otherwise.

---

VerticalBar
VerticalBar[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i><i>y</i>….

---

VerticalTilde
VerticalTilde[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>≀<i>y</i>≀….

---

Video
Video[<i>file</i>] represents video stored in the given file.

Video[<i>url</i>] represents video stored in the given URL.

---

VideoCombine
VideoCombine[{<i>obj</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>obj</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a multi-track video by combining all audio, video and subtitle tracks in all <i>obj</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoDelete
VideoDelete[<i>video</i>,<i>t</i>] deletes the first <i>t</i> seconds of video.

VideoDelete[<i>video</i>,-<i>t</i>] deletes the last <i>t</i> seconds of video.

VideoDelete[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] deletes from time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> to time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub>, returning the remaining video as a single Video object.

VideoDelete[<i>video</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}] deletes multiple time intervals.

---

VideoEncoding
VideoEncoding is an option for Export and other functions that specifies the video encoding to use when creating a video file.

---

VideoExtractFrames
VideoExtractFrames[<i>video</i>,<i>t</i>] extracts a frame at time <i>t</i> from <i>video</i>.

VideoExtractFrames[<i>video</i>,<i>tspec</i>] extracts video frames at time specification <i>tspec</i>.

---

VideoFrameList
VideoFrameList[<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> images extracted from <i>video</i>.

VideoFrameList[<i>video</i>,<i>spec</i>] gives a list of frames extracted based on <i>spec</i>.

---

VideoFrameMap
VideoFrameMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] applies <i>f</i> to each frame of the Video object <i>video</i>, returning a new Video object.

VideoFrameMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to overlapping partitions of <i>n</i> video frames.

VideoFrameMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] applies <i>f</i> to partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

VideoFrameMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] applies <i>f</i> to a list of inputs extracted from each <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoGenerator
VideoGenerator[<i>imagespec</i>] generates a video with frames generated from <i>imagespec</i>.

VideoGenerator[<|"Image"<i>imagespec</i>,"Audio"<i>audiospec</i>|>] returns a video with audio data generated from <i>audioexpr</i>.

VideoGenerator[…,<i>dur</i>] generates a video of duration <i>dur</i>.

---

VideoInsert
VideoInsert[<i>video</i>,<i>t</i><i>new</i>] inserts the video <i>new</i> at time <i>t</i>.

VideoInsert[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>new</i>] inserts the same video at multiple positions.

VideoInsert[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub><i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] inserts multiple videos at different positions.

---

VideoIntervals
VideoIntervals[<i>video</i>,<i>crit</i>] returns time intervals of video for which the criterion <i>crit</i> is satisfied.

VideoIntervals[<i>video</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>n</i>] evaluates criterion <i>crit</i> on partitions of <i>n</i> video frames.

VideoIntervals[<i>video</i>,<i>crit</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] evaluates <i>crit</i> on partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

VideoIntervals[{<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>crit</i>,…] applies <i>crit</i> to a list of inputs extracted from each <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoJoin
VideoJoin[<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…] concatenates all <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and returns a video object.

---

VideoMap
VideoMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] applies <i>f</i> to partial video and audio data corresponding to one frame of <i>video</i>, returning a new video.

VideoMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to data corresponding to overlapping partitions of <i>n</i> video frames.

VideoMap[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] applies <i>f</i> to partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

VideoMap[<i>f</i>,{<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] applies <i>f</i> to a list of inputs extracted from each <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoMapList
VideoMapList[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] applies <i>f</i> to a chunk of data corresponding to one frame from the Video object <i>video</i>, returning a list of results.

VideoMapList[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to overlapping partitions corresponding to <i>n</i> video frames.

VideoMapList[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] applies <i>f</i> to partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

VideoMapList[<i>f</i>,{<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] applies <i>f</i> to a list of inputs extracted from each <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoMapTimeSeries
VideoMapTimeSeries[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] applies <i>f</i> to each frame of the Video object <i>video</i>, returning a time series.

VideoMapTimeSeries[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] applies <i>f</i> to overlapping partitions of <i>n</i> video frames.

VideoMapTimeSeries[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] applies <i>f</i> to partitions with offset <i>d</i>.

VideoMapTimeSeries[<i>f</i>,{<i>video</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>video</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] applies <i>f</i> to a list of inputs extracted from each <i>video</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoPause
VideoPause[] pauses the playback of all VideoStream objects.

VideoPause[<i>vstream</i>] pauses the playback of the VideoStream object <i>vstream</i>.

---

VideoPlay
VideoPlay[<i>video</i>] returns a new VideoStream object from <i>video</i> and starts the playback.

VideoPlay[<i>vstream</i>] starts playing a VideoStream object <i>vstream</i>.

---

VideoQ
VideoQ[<i>video</i>] yields True if <i>video</i> has the form of a valid Video object, and False otherwise.

---

VideoRecord
VideoRecord[<i>source</i>] creates a VideoStream object and records from <i>source</i>.

VideoRecord[<i>vstream</i>] starts recording a VideoStream object <i>vstream</i> that is connected to an imaging device, a screen or a notebook.

---

VideoReplace
VideoReplace[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}<i>new</i>] replaces the video between <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> with the new video <i>new</i>.

VideoReplace[<i>video</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}<i>new</i>] replaces multiple intervals with the same video <i>new</i>.

VideoReplace[<i>video</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>}<i>new</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] replaces multiple intervals.

VideoReplace[<i>video</i>,…,<i>durfitting</i>] uses the specified <i>durfitting</i> method to replace an interval of a different duration.

---

VideoSplit
VideoSplit[<i>video</i>,<i>t</i>] splits <i>video</i> at time <i>t</i>.

VideoSplit[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] splits <i>video</i> at times <i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

VideoStop
VideoStop[] stops the playback of all VideoStream objects.

VideoStop[<i>vstream</i>] stops the playback of the VideoStream object <i>vstream</i>.

---

VideoStream
VideoStream[<i>source</i>] creates a new VideoStream object from source.

VideoStream[<i>id</i>] is an object that represents a unique video stream.

---

VideoStreams
VideoStreams[] returns all existing video streams.

---

VideoTimeStretch
VideoTimeStretch[<i>video</i>,<i>spec</i>] applies time stretching to <i>video</i> using the specified <i>spec</i>.

---

VideoTrackSelection
VideoTrackSelection is an option that specifies the video tracks of interest.

---

VideoTranscode
VideoTranscode[<i>video</i>,"<i>format</i>"] converts <i>video</i> to the specified format.

VideoTranscode[<i>video</i>,<i>service</i>] converts <i>video</i> to the specification recommended by the specified <i>service</i>.

VideoTranscode[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] converts all <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> videos to have conforming properties with respect to the given specification.

---

VideoTrim
VideoTrim[<i>video</i>,<i>t</i>] returns the first <i>t</i> seconds of <i>video</i>.

VideoTrim[<i>video</i>,-<i>t</i>] returns the last <i>t</i> seconds of <i>video</i>.

VideoTrim[<i>video</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>}] returns video starting at time <i>t</i><sub>1</sub> and ending at time <i>t</i><sub>2</sub> of <i>video</i>.

VideoTrim[<i>video</i>,{{<i>t</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>12</sub>},…}] returns a list of video objects for all given intervals {<i>t</i><sub><i>i1</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>i2</i></sub>}.

---

ViewAngle
ViewAngle is an option for Graphics3D and related functions that gives the opening angle for a simulated camera used to view the three-dimensional scene. 

---

ViewCenter
ViewCenter is an option for Graphics3D and related functions which gives the scaled coordinates of the point which should appear at the center of the final image. 

---

ViewMatrix
ViewMatrix is an option for Graphics3D and related functions that can be used to specify a pair of explicit homogeneous transformation and projection matrices for 3D coordinates.

---

ViewPoint
ViewPoint is an option for Graphics3D and related functions which gives the point in space from which three‐dimensional objects are to be viewed. 

---

ViewProjection
ViewProjection is an option for three-dimensional graphics that specifies the projection to use for the graphic.

---

ViewRange
ViewRange is an option for Graphics3D and related functions which specifies the range of distances from the view point to be included in displaying a three-dimensional scene. 

---

ViewVector
ViewVector is an option for Graphics3D and related functions which specifies the position and direction of a simulated camera used to view three-dimensional objects. 

---

ViewVertical
ViewVertical is an option for Graphics3D and related functions which specifies what direction in scaled coordinates should be vertical in the final image. 

---

VoiceStyleData
VoiceStyleData[] gives the list of available voices for speech synthesis.

VoiceStyleData[<i>voice</i>] returns all properties for the specified <i>voice</i>.

VoiceStyleData[<i>voice</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property <i>prop</i> for <i>voice</i>.

---

VoigtDistribution
VoigtDistribution[δ,σ] represents Voigt distribution with parameters δ and σ.

---

VolcanoData
VolcanoData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the volcano <i>entity</i>.

VolcanoData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified volcano entities.

VolcanoData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Volume
Volume[<i>reg</i>] gives the volume of the three-dimensional region <i>reg</i>.

Volume[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives the volume of the parametrized region whose Cartesian coordinates <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are functions of <i>s</i>, <i>t</i>, <i>u</i>.

Volume[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>s</i>,<i>s</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>s</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>t</i>,<i>t</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},{<i>u</i>,<i>u</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>u</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},<i>chart</i>] interprets the <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as coordinates in the specified coordinate chart.

---

VonMisesDistribution
VonMisesDistribution[μ,κ] represents a von Mises distribution with mean μ and concentration κ.

---

VoronoiMesh
VoronoiMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives a MeshRegion representing the Voronoi mesh from the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

VoronoiMesh[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{{<i>x</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>x</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>},…}] clips the mesh to the bounds [x<sub>min</sub>,x<sub>max</sub>]×⋯.

---

WaitAll
WaitAll[<i>expr</i>] waits for all concurrent evaluations represented by EvaluationObject expressions in <i>expr</i> to finish, then returns the resulting expression obtained.

---

WaitAsynchronousTask
WaitAsynchronousTask[<i>task</i>] waits for <i>task</i> to complete.

---

WaitNext
WaitNext[{<i>eid</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eid</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] waits until the first evaluation represented by any of the <i>eid</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> finishes, then returns its result, the corresponding <i>eid</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>, and the list of remaining <i>eid</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>. 

WaitNext[{<i>eid</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eid</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the result before returning it.

---

WakebyDistribution
WakebyDistribution[α,β,γ,δ,μ] represents Wakeby distribution with shape parameters β and δ, scale parameters α and γ, and location parameter μ.

---

WalleniusHypergeometricDistribution
WalleniusHypergeometricDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>n</i><sub><i>succ</i></sub>,<i>n</i><sub><i>tot</i></sub>,<i>w</i>] represents a Wallenius noncentral hypergeometric distribution.

---

WaringYuleDistribution
WaringYuleDistribution[α] represents the Yule distribution with shape parameter α.

WaringYuleDistribution[α,β] represents the Waring distribution with shape parameters α and β.

---

WarpingCorrespondence
WarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the time warping (DTW) similarity path between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

WarpingCorrespondence[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>win</i>] uses a window specified by <i>win</i> for local search.

---

WarpingDistance
WarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the dynamic time warping (DTW) distance between sequences <i>s</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>s</i><sub>2</sub>.

WarpingDistance[<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>win</i>] uses a window specified by <i>win</i> for local search.

---

WatershedComponents
WatershedComponents[<i>image</i>] computes the watershed transform of <i>image</i>, returning the result as an array in which positive integers label the catchment basins.

WatershedComponents[<i>image</i>,<i>marker</i>] uses a binary image <i>marker</i> to indicate regions where basins may be created.

WatershedComponents[<i>video</i>,…] computes watershed segmentation on frames of <i>video</i>.

---

WatsonUSquareTest
WatsonUSquareTest[<i>data</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is normally distributed using the Watson <i>U</i><sup>2</sup> test.

WatsonUSquareTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>] tests whether <i>data</i> is distributed according to <i>dist</i> using the Watson <i>U</i><sup>2</sup> test.

WatsonUSquareTest[<i>data</i>,<i>dist</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

WattsStrogatzGraphDistribution
WattsStrogatzGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>] represents the Watts–Strogatz graph distribution for <i>n</i>-vertex graphs with rewiring probability <i>p</i>.

WattsStrogatzGraphDistribution[<i>n</i>,<i>p</i>,<i>k</i>] represents the Watts–Strogatz graph distribution for <i>n</i>-vertex graphs with rewiring probability <i>p</i> starting from a 2<i>k</i>-regular graph.

---

WaveletBestBasis
WaveletBestBasis[<i>dwd</i>] computes a best basis representation in the DiscreteWaveletData object <i>dwd</i>.

WaveletBestBasis[<i>dwd</i>,<i>cspec</i>] computes a best basis representation using the cost specification <i>cspec</i>.

---

WaveletFilterCoefficients
WaveletFilterCoefficients[<i>wave</i>,<i>filt</i>] gives the filter coefficients for the symbolic wavelet <i>wave</i> of type <i>filt</i>. 

---

WaveletImagePlot
WaveletImagePlot[<i>dwd</i>] plots the basis tree of wavelet image coefficients in the DiscreteWaveletData <i>dwd</i>.

WaveletImagePlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>r</i>] plots coefficients up to refinement level <i>r</i>.

WaveletImagePlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>ifunc</i>] applies the image function <i>ifunc</i> to coefficients and wavelet indexes before plotting.

---

WaveletListPlot
WaveletListPlot[<i>dwd</i>] plots wavelet transform coefficients in the DiscreteWaveletData <i>dwd</i>.

WaveletListPlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>wind</i>] plots wavelet transform coefficients corresponding to the wavelet index specification <i>wind</i>.

WaveletListPlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>wind</i>,<i>func</i>] applies <i>func</i> to coefficients before plotting. 

WaveletListPlot[{<i>dwd</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>dwd</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] plots wavelet transform coefficients from several DiscreteWaveletData objects <i>dwd</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>dwd</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

WaveletMapIndexed
WaveletMapIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>wd</i>] applies the function <i>f</i> to the arrays of coefficients and indices of a ContinuousWaveletData or DiscreteWaveletData object.

WaveletMapIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>dwd</i>,<i>wind</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the DiscreteWaveletData coefficients specified by <i>wind</i>.

WaveletMapIndexed[<i>f</i>,<i>cwd</i>,<i>octvoc</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the ContinuousWaveletData coefficients specified by <i>octvoc</i>.

---

WaveletMatrixPlot
WaveletMatrixPlot[<i>dwd</i>] plots the basis tree of wavelet matrix coefficients in the DiscreteWaveletData <i>dwd</i>.

WaveletMatrixPlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>r</i>] plots coefficients up to refinement level <i>r</i>.

WaveletMatrixPlot[<i>dwd</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>func</i>] applies <i>func</i> to coefficients before plotting. 

---

WaveletPhi
WaveletPhi[<i>wave</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the scaling function ϕ(x) for the symbolic wavelet <i>wave</i> evaluated at <i>x</i>.

WaveletPhi[<i>wave</i>] gives the scaling function as a pure function.

---

WaveletPsi
WaveletPsi[<i>wave</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the wavelet function ψ(x) for the symbolic wavelet <i>wave</i> evaluated at <i>x</i>.

WaveletPsi[<i>wave</i>] gives the wavelet function as a pure function.

---

WaveletScale
WaveletScale is an option for ContinuousWaveletTransform and related constructs used to specify the smallest resolvable scale. 

---

WaveletScalogram
WaveletScalogram[<i>wd</i>] plots wavelet vector coefficients in a DiscreteWaveletData or ContinuousWaveletData object <i>wd</i>.

WaveletScalogram[<i>wd</i>,<i>wind</i>] plots wavelet coefficients corresponding to the wavelet index specification <i>wind</i>.

WaveletScalogram[<i>wd</i>,<i>wind</i>,<i>func</i>] applies <i>func</i> to coefficients before plotting. 

---

WaveletThreshold
WaveletThreshold[<i>dwd</i>] thresholds the detail wavelet coefficients in the DiscreteWaveletData object <i>dwd</i>.

WaveletThreshold[<i>dwd</i>,<i>tspec</i>] thresholds the coefficients using the thresholding specification <i>tspec</i>.

WaveletThreshold[<i>dwd</i>,<i>tspec</i>,<i>wind</i>] thresholds the wavelet coefficients given by the wavelet indices <i>wind</i>.

---

WavePDEComponent
WavePDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a wave equation PDE term ∂u<sup>2</sup>/∂t<sup>2</sup>-c<sup>2</sup>∇<sup>2</sup><sub>{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>…</i>,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</sub><i>u</i> with model variables <i>vars</i> and model parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

WeaklyConnectedComponents
WeaklyConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the weakly connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

WeaklyConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the weakly connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

WeaklyConnectedComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the connected components that include a vertex that matches the pattern <i>patt</i>.

WeaklyConnectedComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

WeaklyConnectedGraphComponents
WeaklyConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>] gives the weakly connected components of the graph <i>g</i>.

WeaklyConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>,{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the weakly connected components that include at least one of the vertices <i>v</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>v</i><sub>2</sub>, … .

WeaklyConnectedGraphComponents[<i>g</i>,<i>patt</i>] gives the connected components that include a vertex that matches the pattern <i>patt</i>.

WeaklyConnectedGraphComponents[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…},…] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

WeaklyConnectedGraphQ
WeaklyConnectedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is weakly connected, and False otherwise.

---

WeakStationarity
WeakStationarity[<i>proc</i>] gives conditions for the process <i>proc</i> to be weakly stationary. 

---

WeatherData
WeatherData[<i>loc</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives the most recent measurement for the specified weather property at the location corresponding to <i>loc</i>.

WeatherData[<i>loc</i>,"<i>property</i>",<i>date</i>] gives all measurements during the specified date.

WeatherData[<i>loc</i>,"<i>property</i>",{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>}] gives a list of dates and measurements for the time interval <i>start</i> to <i>end</i>.

WeatherData[<i>loc</i>,"<i>property</i>",{<i>start</i>,<i>end</i>,<i>step</i>}] gives measurements aggregated over the time period represented by <i>step</i>.

---

WeatherForecastData
WeatherForecastData[<i>loc</i>] gives the most recent forecast for all weather forecast properties for the specified location.

WeatherForecastData[<i>prop</i>] gives the forecast for the specified property for the current location.

WeatherForecastData[<i>date</i>] gives the forecast at the time or times specified by <i>date</i> for all properties at the current location.

WeatherForecastData[<i>loc</i>,<i>prop</i>] gives the forecast for the property at the specified location.

WeatherForecastData[<i>loc</i>,<i>prop</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the forecast at the time or times specified by <i>datespec</i> for the property at the location.

---

WebAudioSearch
WebAudioSearch["<i>string</i>"] gives a dataset of the top web audio search results for the specified literal string.

WebAudioSearch[<i>query</i>] performs a web audio search using the specified <i>query</i>.

WebAudioSearch[<i>query</i>,<i>format</i>] gives the elements of the web audio search specified by <i>format</i>.

WebAudioSearch[<i>query</i>,<i>format</i>,<i>crit</i>] returns only audio results that satisfy <i>crit</i>.

---

WebColumn
WebColumn[{<i><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub></i>,<i><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub></i>,…}] represents an HTML column containing the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WebColumn[<i>expr</i>,<i>options</i>] displays with <i>expr</i> formatted using the specified option settings. 

---

WebElementObject
WebElementObject[…] represents an element of an open webpage operated on by WebExecute.

---

WeberE
WeberE[ν,<i>z</i>] gives the Weber function E<sub>ν</sub>(z).

WeberE[ν,μ,<i>z</i>] gives the associated Weber function E<sub>ν</sub><sup>μ</sup>(z).

---

WebExecute
WebExecute[<i>cmd</i>] executes the command <i>cmd</i> in a web browser. 

WebExecute[{<i>cmd</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cmd</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] executes a list of commands in sequence.

WebExecute[<i>session</i>,<i>cmds</i>] executes <i>cmds</i> in the specified web session.

---

WebImage
WebImage[<i>url</i>] gives an image of the webpage specified by <i>url</i>.

WebImage[<i>list</i>] gives images specified by URLs in <i>list</i>.

---

WebImageSearch
WebImageSearch[<i>"string"</i>] gives a list of thumbnails of the top web image search results for the specified literal string.

WebImageSearch[<i>form</i>] gives the top results obtained by doing the web image search specified by <i>form</i>.

WebImageSearch[<i>form</i>, <i>n</i>] picks out the first <i>n</i> top results obtained by doing the web image search specified by <i>form</i>.

WebImageSearch[<i>form</i>,<i>elems</i>] gives the elements of the web image search specified by <i>elems</i>.

WebImageSearch[<i>form</i>, <i>elems</i>, <i>n</i>] picks out the first <i>n</i> elements of the web image search specified by <i>elems</i>.

---

WebItem
WebItem[<i>expr</i>] represents an HTML element containing <i>expr</i>.

WebItem[<i>expr</i>,<i>options</i>] represents an HTML element formatted using the specified option settings. 

WebItem[XMLElement[<i>expr</i>,…],<i>options</i>] represents an XMLElement formatted using <i>options</i>.

---

WebRow
WebRow[{<i><i>expr</i><sub>1</sub></i>, <i><i>expr</i><sub>2</sub></i>, …}] represents an HTML row containing the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WebRow[<i>expr</i>,<i>options</i>] displays with <i>expr</i> formatted using the specified option settings.

---

WebSearch
WebSearch["<i>string</i>"] gives a dataset of the top web search results for the specified literal string.

WebSearch[<i>form</i>] gives the top results obtained by doing the web search specified by <i>form</i>.

WebSearch[<i>form</i>,<i>elems</i>] gives the elements of the web search specified by <i>elems</i>.

---

WebSessionObject
WebSessionObject[…] represents a web browser session started by StartWebSession for use with WebExecute.

---

WebSessions
WebSessions[] gives the list of all active web sessions.

---

WebWindowObject
WebWindowObject[…] represents an open window or tab in a web browser.

---

Wedge
Wedge[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] displays as <i>x</i>⋀<i>y</i>⋀….

---

Wednesday
Wednesday is a day of the week.

---

WeibullDistribution
WeibullDistribution[α,β] represents a Weibull distribution with shape parameter α and scale parameter β.

WeibullDistribution[α,β,μ] represents a Weibull distribution with shape parameter α, scale parameter β, and location parameter μ.

---

WeierstrassE1
WeierstrassE1[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> of the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘ at the half-period ω<sub>1</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassE2
WeierstrassE2[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value <i>e</i><sub>2</sub> of the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘ at the half-period ω<sub>2</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassE3
WeierstrassE3[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value <i>e</i><sub>3</sub> of the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘ at the half-period ω<sub>3</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassEta1
WeierstrassEta1[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value η<sub>1</sub> of the Weierstrass zeta function ζ at the half-period ω<sub>1</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassEta2
WeierstrassEta2[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value η<sub>2</sub> of the Weierstrass zeta function ζ at the half-period ω<sub>2</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassEta3
WeierstrassEta3[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the value η<sub>3</sub> of the Weierstrass zeta function ζ at the half-period ω<sub>3</sub>(g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>).

---

WeierstrassHalfPeriods
WeierstrassHalfPeriods[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the half‐periods {ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>3</sub>} for Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the invariants {<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}.

---

WeierstrassHalfPeriodW1
WeierstrassHalfPeriodW1[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the half-period ω<sub>1</sub> for Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the invariants {<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}.

---

WeierstrassHalfPeriodW2
WeierstrassHalfPeriodW2[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the half-period ω<sub>2</sub> for the Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the invariants {<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}.

---

WeierstrassHalfPeriodW3
WeierstrassHalfPeriodW3[{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the half-period ω<sub>3</sub> for the Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the invariants {<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}.

---

WeierstrassInvariantG2
WeierstrassInvariantG2[{ω,ω<sup>′</sup>}] gives the invariant g<sub>2</sub> for the Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the half‐periods {ω,ω<sup>′</sup>}.

---

WeierstrassInvariantG3
WeierstrassInvariantG3[{ω,ω<sup>′</sup>}] gives the invariant <i>g</i><sub>3</sub> for the Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the half‐periods {ω,ω<sup>′</sup>}.

---

WeierstrassInvariants
WeierstrassInvariants[{ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>3</sub>}] gives the invariants {<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>} for Weierstrass elliptic functions corresponding to the half‐periods {ω<sub>1</sub>,ω<sub>3</sub>}. 

---

WeierstrassP
WeierstrassP[<i>u</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘(u;g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>). 

---

WeierstrassPPrime
WeierstrassPPrime[<i>u</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the derivative of the Weierstrass elliptic function ℘(u;g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>). 

---

WeierstrassSigma
WeierstrassSigma[<i>u</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the Weierstrass sigma function σ(u;g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>). 

---

WeierstrassZeta
WeierstrassZeta[<i>u</i>,{<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>3</sub>}] gives the Weierstrass zeta function ζ(u;g<sub>2</sub>,g<sub>3</sub>). 

---

WeightedAdjacencyGraph
WeightedAdjacencyGraph[<i>wmat</i>] gives the graph with weighted adjacency matrix <i>wmat</i>.

WeightedAdjacencyGraph[{<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>wmat</i>] gives the graph with vertices <i>v</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and weighted adjacency matrix <i>wmat</i>.

---

WeightedAdjacencyMatrix
WeightedAdjacencyMatrix[<i>g</i>] gives the adjacency matrix of edge weights of the graph <i>g</i>.

WeightedAdjacencyMatrix[{<i>v</i><i>w</i>,…}] uses rules <i>v</i><i>w</i> to specify the graph <i>g</i>. 

---

WeightedData
WeightedData[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents observations <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with weights <i>w</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WeightedData[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>fn</i>] represents observations <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with weighting function <i>fn</i>.

---

WeightedGraphQ
WeightedGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is a weighted graph and False otherwise.

---

Weights
Weights is an option for various fitting and other functions which specifies weights to associate with data elements.

---

WelchWindow
WelchWindow[<i>x</i>] represents a Welch window function of <i>x</i>.

WelchWindow[<i>x</i>,α] uses the parameter α.

---

WheelGraph
WheelGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the wheel graph with <i>n</i> vertices W<sub>n</sub>.

---

WhenEvent
WhenEvent[<i>event</i>,<i>action</i>] specifies an <i>action</i> that occurs when the <i>event</i> triggers it for equations in NDSolve and related functions. 

---

Which
Which[<i>test</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>value</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>test</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>value</i><sub>2</sub>,…] evaluates each of the <i>test</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in turn, returning the value of the <i>value</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> corresponding to the first one that yields True. 

---

While
While[<i>test</i>,<i>body</i>] evaluates <i>test</i>, then <i>body</i>, repetitively, until <i>test</i> first fails to give True. 

---

White
White represents the color white in graphics or style specifications. 

---

WhiteNoiseProcess
WhiteNoiseProcess[] represents a Gaussian white noise process with mean 0 and standard deviation 1.

WhiteNoiseProcess[σ] represents a Gaussian white noise process with mean 0 and standard deviation σ.

WhiteNoiseProcess[<i>dist</i>] represents a white noise process based on the distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

WhitePoint
WhitePoint is an option for ColorConvert, ChromaticityPlot and other functions to specify the white point.

---

Whitespace
Whitespace represents a sequence of whitespace characters in StringExpression.

---

WhitespaceCharacter
WhitespaceCharacter represents a single whitespace character in StringExpression.

---

WhittakerM
WhittakerM[<i>k</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Whittaker function M<sub>k,m</sub>(z). 

---

WhittakerW
WhittakerW[<i>k</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Whittaker function W<sub>k,m</sub>(z). 

---

WienerFilter
WienerFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>] removes noise from <i>data</i> by applying a range-<i>r</i> Wiener filter.

WienerFilter[<i>data</i>,<i>r</i>,<i>ns</i><i>]</i> assumes an additive noise power value <i>ns</i>.

WienerFilter[<i>data</i>,{<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] uses radius <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> at level <i>i</i> in data.

---

WienerProcess
WienerProcess[μ,σ] represents a Wiener process with a drift μ and volatility σ.

WienerProcess[] represents a standard Wiener process with drift 0 and volatility 1.

---

WignerD
WignerD[{<i>j</i>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},ψ,θ,ϕ] gives the Wigner D-function D<sub>m<sub>1</sub>,m<sub>2</sub></sub><sup>j</sup>(ψ,θ,ϕ).

WignerD[{<i>j</i>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},θ,ϕ] gives the Wigner D-function D<sub>m<sub>1</sub>,m<sub>2</sub></sub><sup>j</sup>(0,θ,ϕ).

WignerD[{<i>j</i>,<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>},θ] gives the Wigner D-function D<sub>m<sub>1</sub>,m<sub>2</sub></sub><sup>j</sup>(0,θ,0).

---

WignerSemicircleDistribution
WignerSemicircleDistribution[<i>r</i>] represents a Wigner semicircle distribution with radius <i>r</i> centered at the origin.

WignerSemicircleDistribution[<i>a</i>,<i>r</i>] represents a Wigner semicircle distribution with radius <i>r</i> centered at <i>a</i>.

---

WikidataData
WikidataData[<i>item</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the values of the specified property for the given item.

WikidataData[{<i>item</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>item</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives values for each of the <i>item</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WikidataData[<i>item</i>,{<i>property</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>property</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives values for each of the <i>property</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WikidataData[<i>items</i>,<i>properties</i>] gives values for each of the properties for each of the items.

---

WikidataSearch
WikidataSearch["<i>keywords</i>"] returns a list of Wikidata items whose labels include the given keywords.

WikidataSearch["<i>type</i>""<i>keywords</i>"] returns a list of Wikidata identifiers of the specified type.

---

WikipediaData
WikipediaData[<i>article</i>] gives the plain text of the specified Wikipedia article.

WikipediaData[{<i>article</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>article</i><sub>2</sub>,...}] gives the texts for each of the articles.

WikipediaData[<i>article</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>options</i>] gives the value of the specified property, modified by optional parameters, for the given Wikipedia article.

WikipediaData["Category"<i>category</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>options</i>] gives the value of the specified property, modified by optional parameters, for the given Wikipedia category.

WikipediaData["PageID"<i>pageid</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>options</i>] gives the value of the specified property, modified by optional parameters, for the article corresponding to the given numerical Wikipedia page ID.

---

WikipediaSearch
WikipediaSearch[<i>keywords</i>] returns a list of Wikipedia articles whose titles include the given keywords.

WikipediaSearch["Title"<i>keywords</i>,<i>options</i>] returns a list of Wikipedia articles whose titles include the given keywords.

WikipediaSearch["Category"<i>keywords</i>,<i>options</i>] returns a list of Wikipedia categories whose titles include the given keywords.

WikipediaSearch["Content"<i>keywords</i>] returns a list of Wikipedia articles whose content includes the given keywords.

WikipediaSearch[<i>loc</i>] returns a list of Wikipedia articles whose associated coordinates are near the given location.

---

WilksW
WilksW[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] gives Wilks's  for the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

WilksWTest
WilksWTest[<i>m</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>m</i><sub>2</sub>] tests whether the matrices <i>m</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>m</i><sub>2</sub> are independent.

WilksWTest[<i>…</i>,"<i>property</i>"] returns the value of "<i>property</i>".

---

WindDirectionData
WindDirectionData[] gives the most recent measurement for wind direction near the current location.

WindDirectionData[<i>datespec</i>] gives the wind direction value for the specified time near the current location.

WindDirectionData[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the most recent measurement for wind direction near the specified location.

WindDirectionData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the value or values for the specified date and location.

WindDirectionData[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives values for all specified locations on the specified dates.

---

WindingCount
WindingCount[<i>contour</i>,<i>p</i>] gives the count of the number of times a closed curve winds around a point <i>p</i>.

---

WindingPolygon
WindingPolygon[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives a polygon representing all points for which the closed contour <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>p</i><sub>1</sub> winds around at least once. 

WindingPolygon[{{<i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>,…},{<i>p</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>22</sub>,…},…}] gives a polygon from the closed contours <i>p</i><sub>11</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>12</sub>,… and <i>p</i><sub>21</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>22</sub>,….

WindingPolygon[…,"<i>wrule</i>"] uses the specified winding rule "<i>wrule</i>" to define the polygon.

---

WindowTitle
WindowTitle is an option that specifies the title to give for a window. 

---

WindSpeedData
WindSpeedData[] gives the most recent measurement for wind speed near the current location.

WindSpeedData[<i>datespec</i>] gives the wind speed value for the specified time near the current location.

WindSpeedData[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the most recent measurement for wind speed near the specified location.

WindSpeedData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the value or values for the specified date and location.

WindSpeedData[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives values for all specified locations on the specified dates.

---

WindVectorData
WindVectorData[] gives the most recent weather station measurement for wind vector near the current location.

WindVectorData[<i>datespec</i>] gives the wind vector value for the specified time near the current location.

WindVectorData[<i>locationspec</i>] gives the most recent measurement for wind vector near the specified location.

WindVectorData[<i>locationspec</i>,<i>datespec</i>] gives the value or values for the specified date and location.

WindVectorData[{{<i>location</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>location</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>date</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] gives values for all specified locations on the specified dates.

---

WinsorizedMean
WinsorizedMean[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the mean of the elements in <i>list</i> after replacing the fraction <i>f</i> of the smallest and largest elements by the remaining extreme values.

WinsorizedMean[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the mean when the fraction <i>f</i><sub>1</sub> of the smallest elements and the fraction <i>f</i><sub>2</sub> of the largest elements are replaced by the remaining extreme values.

WinsorizedMean[<i>list</i>] gives the 5% winsorized mean WinsorizedMean[<i>list</i>,0.05].

WinsorizedMean[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the winsorized mean of a univariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

WinsorizedVariance
WinsorizedVariance[<i>list</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the variance of the elements in <i>list</i> after replacing the fraction <i>f</i> of the smallest and largest elements by the remaining extreme values.

WinsorizedVariance[<i>list</i>,{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>}] gives the variance when the fraction <i>f</i><sub>1</sub> of the smallest elements and the fraction <i>f</i><sub>2</sub> of the largest elements are replaced by the remaining extreme values.

WinsorizedVariance[<i>list</i>] gives the 5% winsorized variance WinsorizedVariance[<i>list</i>,0.05].

WinsorizedVariance[<i>dist</i>,…] gives the winsorized variance of a univariate distribution <i>dist</i>.

---

WishartMatrixDistribution
WishartMatrixDistribution[<i>ν</i>,Σ] represents a Wishart matrix distribution with <i>ν</i> degrees of freedom and covariance matrix Σ.

---

With
With[{<i>x</i>=<i>x</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>y</i>=<i>y</i><sub>0</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] specifies that all occurrences of the symbols <i>x</i>, <i>y</i>, … in <i>expr</i> should be replaced by <i>x</i><sub>0</sub>, <i>y</i><sub>0</sub>, …. 

---

WithCleanup
WithCleanup[<i>expr</i>,<i>cleanup</i>] evaluates <i>expr</i>, running <i>cleanup</i> before returning the result, even if an abort, throw, etc. was generated during the evaluation of <i>expr</i>.

WithCleanup[<i>init</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>cleanup</i>] evaluates <i>init</i> before evaluating <i>expr</i>, blocking aborts, throws, etc. in both <i>init</i> and <i>cleanup</i>.

---

WithLock
WithLock[File["<i>path</i>"],<i>expr</i>] locks the file <i>path</i>, evaluates <i>expr</i>, then releases the file.

WithLock[LocalSymbol["<i>name</i>"],<i>expr</i>] locks the local symbol <i>name</i>, evaluates <i>expr</i>, then releases the local symbol.

WithLock[<i>var</i>,<i>expr</i>] locks the shared variable <i>var</i>, evaluates <i>expr</i>, then releases the shared variable.

---

WolframAlpha
WolframAlpha["<i>query</i>"] sends <i>query</i> to Wolfram|Alpha and imports the output.

WolframAlpha["<i>query</i>",<i>format</i>] imports the output according to the specified format.

---

WolframLanguageData
WolframLanguageData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the Wolfram Language symbol <i>entity</i>.

WolframLanguageData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified Wolfram Language symbol entities.

WolframLanguageData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

Word
Word represents a word in Read, Find, and related functions. 

---

WordBoundary
WordBoundary represents a boundary between words for purposes of matching in StringExpression.

---

WordCharacter
WordCharacter represents a letter or digit character in StringExpression.

---

WordCount
WordCount["<i>string</i>"] gives the total number of words in <i>string</i>.

---

WordCounts
WordCounts["<i>string</i>"] gives an association whose keys are the distinct words identified in <i>string</i>, and whose values give the number of times those words appear in <i>string</i>.

WordCounts["<i>string</i>",<i>n</i>] gives counts of the distinct <i>n</i>-grams consisting of runs of <i>n</i> words in <i>string</i>.

WordCounts[{<i>string</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>string</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…] gives the counts for each of the <i>string</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

WordData
WordData["<i>word</i>","<i>property</i>"] gives the specified property for the English word "<i>word</i>".

WordData["<i>word</i>"] gives a list of full word specifications representing possible uses and senses of "<i>word</i>".

WordData[<i>wordspec</i>,"<i>property</i>"] gives a property for a particular word specification.

---

WordDefinition
WordDefinition["<i>word</i>"] gives the dictionary definitions available for "<i>word</i>".

---

WordFrequency
WordFrequency[<i>text</i>,<i>word</i>] gives the frequency of <i>word</i> in <i>text</i>.

WordFrequency[<i>text</i>,{<i>word</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>word</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association of the frequencies of each of the <i>word</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

WordFrequencyData
WordFrequencyData[<i>word</i>] gives the frequency of <i>word</i> in typical published English text.

WordFrequencyData[{<i>word</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>word</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives an association of frequencies of the <i>word</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

WordFrequencyData[<i>word</i>,"TimeSeries"] gives a time series for the frequency of <i>word</i> in typical published English text.

WordFrequencyData[<i>word</i>,"TimeSeries",<i>datespec</i>] gives a time series for dates specified by <i>datespec</i>.

WordFrequencyData[<i>word</i>,"<i>prop</i>"] gives property <i>prop</i> of the word frequency.

---

WordList
WordList[] gives a list of common words.

WordList[<i>type</i>] gives a list of words of the specified type.

---

WordOrientation
WordOrientation is an option for WordCloud that specifies the orientations in which words appear.

---

WordSearch
WordSearch is an option for Find and FindList that specifies whether the text searched for must appear as a word. 

---

WordSelectionFunction
WordSelectionFunction is an option for WordCloud and other functions that specifies which words to use.

---

WordSeparators
WordSeparators is an option for Read, Find, and related functions that specifies the list of strings to be taken as delimiters for words. 

---

WordSpacings
WordSpacings is an option for WordCloud that specifies the empty space to be added around each word. 

---

WordStem
WordStem["<i>word</i>"] gives a stemmed form of <i>word</i>, removing plurals, inflections, etc.

---

WordTranslation
WordTranslation["<i>word</i>",<i>lang</i>] gives translations for <i>word</i> into the language <i>lang</i>.

WordTranslation["<i>word</i>",<i>lang</i><sub>1</sub><i>lang</i><sub>2</sub>] gives translations for <i>word</i> from <i>lang</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>lang</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

WorkingPrecision
WorkingPrecision is an option for various numerical operations that specifies how many digits of precision should be maintained in internal computations. 

---

Write
Write[<i>channel</i>,<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] writes the expressions <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in sequence, followed by a newline, to the specified output channel.

---

WriteLine
WriteLine[stream, "string"] writes "string", followed by a newline, to the specified output stream.

WriteLine[proc, "string"] writes "string" to an external process proc.

---

WriteString
WriteString["<i>file</i>","<i>string</i>"] writes "<i>string</i>" to a file.

WriteString[<i>channel</i>,"<i>string</i>"] writes "<i>string</i>" to a stream or process.

WriteString[<i>channel</i>,<i>expr</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i><sub>2</sub>,…] converts the <i>expr</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to strings, and then writes them in sequence to the specified output channel. 

---

Wronskian
Wronskian[{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the Wronskian determinant for the functions <i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,… depending on <i>x</i>.

Wronskian[<i>eqn</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>x</i>] gives the Wronskian determinant for the basis of the solutions of the linear differential equation <i>eqn</i> with dependent variable <i>y</i> and independent variable <i>x</i>. 

Wronskian[<i>eqns</i>,{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>y</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives the Wronskian determinant for the system of linear differential equations <i>eqns</i>.

---

XMLElement
XMLElement[<i>tag</i>,{<i>attr</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] represents an element in symbolic XML.

---

XMLObject
XMLObject["<i>type</i>"] represents the head of an XML object in symbolic XML.

---

XMLTemplate
XMLTemplate["<i>string</i>"] yields a TemplateObject that represents an XML template to be applied using functions like TemplateApply.

XMLTemplate[<i>src</i>] uses File[…], URL[…], or CloudObject[…] as the source for the string template.

XMLTemplate[<i>form</i>,<i>args</i>] yields a TemplateObject with arguments, suitable for cloud deployment or other evaluation.

---

Xnor
Xnor[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is the logical XNOR (not XOR) function. It gives True if an even number of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are True, and the rest are False. It gives False if an odd number of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are True, and the rest are False. 

---

Xor
Xor[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…] is the logical XOR (exclusive OR) function. It gives True if an odd number of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are True, and the rest are False. It gives False if an even number of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are True, and the rest are False. 

---

XYZColor
XYZColor[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>] represents a color in the XYZ color space with tristimulus values <i>x</i>, <i>y</i> and <i>z</i>.

XYZColor[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,<i>z</i>,<i>a</i>] specifies opacity <i>a</i>. 

XYZColor["<i>string</i>"] returns a color from an HTML color name etc.

XYZColor[<i>color</i>] returns the XYZ representation of <i>color</i>.

---

Yellow
Yellow represents the color yellow in graphics or style specifications. 

---

Yesterday
Yesterday gives a DateObject representing the previous day.

---

YuleDissimilarity
YuleDissimilarity[<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>] gives the Yule dissimilarity between Boolean vectors <i>u</i> and <i>v</i>.

---

ZernikeR
ZernikeR[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>,<i>r</i>] gives the radial Zernike polynomial R<sub>n</sub><sup>m</sup>(r).

---

ZeroSymmetric
ZeroSymmetric[{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>s</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents the symmetry of a zero tensor in the slots <i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

ZeroTest
ZeroTest is an option to various linear algebra functions that gives a function to use in testing whether symbolic expressions should be treated as zero.

---

ZeroWidthTimes
ZeroWidthTimes is an option for selections that specifies whether blank spaces representing multiplication are explicitly shown.

---

Zeta
Zeta[<i>s</i>] gives the Riemann zeta function ζ(s). 

Zeta[<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>] gives the generalized Riemann zeta function ζ(s,a). 

---

ZetaZero
ZetaZero[<i>k</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero of the Riemann zeta function on the critical line.

ZetaZero[<i>k</i>,<i>t</i>] represents the <i>k</i><sup>th</sup> zero with imaginary part greater than <i>t</i>.

---

ZIPCodeData
ZIPCodeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>] gives the value of the specified <i>property</i> for the ZIP code <i>entity</i>.

ZIPCodeData[{<i>entity</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>entity</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>property</i>] gives a list of property values for the specified ZIP code entities.

ZIPCodeData[<i>entity</i>,<i>property</i>,<i>annotation</i>] gives the specified <i>annotation</i> associated with the given <i>property</i>.

---

ZipfDistribution
ZipfDistribution[ρ] represents a zeta distribution with parameter ρ.

ZipfDistribution[<i>n</i>,ρ] represents a Zipf distribution with range <i>n</i>.

---

ZTransform
ZTransform[<i>expr</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>z</i>] gives the Z transform of <i>expr</i>. 

ZTransform[<i>expr</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>m</i></sub>},{<i>z</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>z</i><sub>m</sub>}] gives the multidimensional Z transform of <i>expr</i>.

---

AcyclicGraphQ
AcyclicGraphQ[<i>g</i>] yields True if the graph <i>g</i> is an acyclic graph and False otherwise.

---

AllMatch
AllMatch[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] yields True if <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> matches the pattern <i>form</i> for all of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AllMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

AllMatch[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of AllMatch that can be applied to an expression.

---

AllSameBy
AllSameBy[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>f</i>] tests whether all the <i>f</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>] are the same.

AllSameBy[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of AllSameBy that can be applied to an expression.

---

AnyMatch
AnyMatch[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] yields True if <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> matches the pattern <i>form</i> for any of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

AnyMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

AnyMatch[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of AnyMatch that can be applied to an expression.

---

AppellF2
AppellF2[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is the Appell hypergeometric function of two variables F<sub>2</sub>(a;b<sub>1</sub>,b<sub>2</sub>;c<sub>1</sub>,c<sub>2</sub>;x,y). 

---

AppellF3
AppellF3[<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>b</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>c</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is the Appell hypergeometric function of two variables F<sub>3</sub>(a;b<sub>1</sub>,b<sub>2</sub>;c<sub>1</sub>,c<sub>2</sub>;x,y). 

---

AppellF4
AppellF4[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>c</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>c</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] is the Appell hypergeometric function of two variables F<sub>4</sub>(a;b;c<sub>1</sub>,c<sub>2</sub>;x,y). 

---

ArcCosDegrees
ArcCosDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cosine in degrees of the complex number z.

---

ArcCotDegrees
ArcCotDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cotangent in degrees of the complex number z.

---

ArcCscDegrees
ArcCscDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc cosecant in degrees of the complex number z. 

---

ArcSecDegrees
ArcSecDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc secant in degrees of the complex number z. 

---

ArcSinDegrees
ArcSinDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc sine in degrees of the complex number z.

---

ArcTanDegrees
ArcTanDegrees[<i>z</i>] gives the arc tangent in degrees of the complex number z.

---

ArrayDot
ArrayDot[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>k</i>] computes the product of arrays <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> obtained by summing up products of terms over the last <i>k</i> dimensions of <i>a</i> and the first <i>k</i> dimensions of <i>b</i>.

ArrayDot[<i>a</i>,<i>b</i>,{{<i>s</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>},{<i>s</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>t</i><sub>2</sub>},…}] computes the product of arrays <i>a</i> and <i>b</i> obtained by summing up products of terms over the pairs {<i>s</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,<i>t</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>} of dimensions.

---

ArraySymbol
ArraySymbol[<i>a</i>] represents an array with name <i>a</i>.
