ArraySymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array.

ArraySymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>] represents an array with elements in the domain <i>dom</i>.

ArraySymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>dom</i>, <i>sym</i>] represents an array with the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

BitFlip
BitFlip[<i>n</i>,<i>k</i>] flips the bit corresponding to the coefficient of 2<sup>k</sup> in the integer <i>n</i>. 

---

BlockDiagonalMatrix
BlockDiagonalMatrix[{<i>d</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>d</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents the block diagonal matrix with diagonal blocks <i>d</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as a structured array.

BlockDiagonalMatrix[<i>mat</i>] converts the block diagonal matrix <i>mat</i> to a structured array.

---

BlockLowerTriangularMatrix
BlockLowerTriangularMatrix[<i>lmat</i>] represents the block lower triangular matrix <i>lmat</i> as a structured array.

---

BlockUpperTriangularMatrix
BlockUpperTriangularMatrix[<i>umat</i>] represents the block upper triangular matrix <i>umat</i> as a structured array.

---

BuckyballGraph
BuckyballGraph[] gives the buckyball graph.

BuckyballGraph[<i>n</i>] gives the order‐<i>n</i> buckyball graph.

BuckyballGraph[<i>n,"class"</i>] gives the order‐<i>n</i> buckyball graph of class "<i>class</i>".

---

BuildCompiledComponent
BuildCompiledComponent[<i>comp</i>] builds the compiled component <i>comp</i>.

BuildCompiledComponent[<i>comp</i>,<i>dest</i>] builds the compiled component <i>comp</i>, placing the result in <i>dest</i>.

---

CaputoD
CaputoD[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,α}] gives the Caputo fractional differintegral <sup>C</sup><sub>0</sub>D<sub>x</sub><sup>α</sup>f(x) of the function f(x).

---

Cast
Cast[<i>val</i>,<i>type</i>] converts <i>val</i> to the type <i>type</i>, for use in compiled code.

Cast[<i>val</i>,<i>type</i>,<i>method</i>] uses the specified casting method.

---

CauchyMatrix
CauchyMatrix[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>] represents the Cauchy matrix given by the generating vectors <i>x</i> and <i>y</i> as a structured array.

CauchyMatrix[<i>x</i>] is equivalent to CauchyMatrix[<i>x</i>,<i>x</i>].

CauchyMatrix[<i>cmat</i>] converts a Cauchy matrix <i>cmat</i> to a structured array. 

---

CircularArcThrough
CircularArcThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a circular arc passing through the points <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CircularArcThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>q</i>] represents a circular arc with center <i>q</i>.

CircularArcThrough[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>q</i>,<i>r</i>] represents a circular arc with radius <i>r</i>.

---

CircumscribedBall
CircumscribedBall[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives a ball with minimal radius that encloses the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>p</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

Comap
Comap[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>x</i>] gives {<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>x</i>],<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>x</i>],…}.

Comap[<i>fs</i>,<i>x</i>,<i>levelspec</i>] applies parts of <i>fs</i> specified by <i>levelspec</i> to <i>x</i>.

Comap[<i>fs</i>] represents an operator form of Comap that can be applied to an expression.

---

ComapApply
ComapApply[{<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] gives {Apply[<i>f</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>expr</i>],Apply[<i>f</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>expr</i>],…}.

ComapApply[<i>fs</i>] represents an operator form of ComapApply that can be applied to an expression.

---

ConformDates
ConformDates[<i>dates</i>] returns a list of dates where all dates are made to have conforming properties, including calendar, time zone and granularity.

ConformDates[<i>dates</i>,<i>rdate</i>] returns all dates in a form consistent with the reference date <i>rdate</i>.

---

ContourIntegrate
ContourIntegrate[<i>f</i>,<i>z∈cont</i>] gives the integral of <i>f</i> along the contour defined by <i>cont</i> in the complex plane.

---

CosDegrees
CosDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the cosine of θ degrees. 

---

CotDegrees
CotDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the cotangent of θ degrees. 

---

CreateSemanticSearchIndex
CreateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>source</i>] creates a search index from the data in <i>source</i>.

CreateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>{</i><i>source<sub>1</sub></i><i>,</i>…<i>}</i>] creates a search index with a collection of sources <i>source</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CreateSemanticSearchIndex[{<i>source</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] associates the source <i>source</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to the value <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

CreateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>data</i>,"<i>name</i>"] gives the search index the specified name.

---

CreateTypeInstance
CreateTypeInstance[<i>type</i>,<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] creates an instance of a type in compiled code.

CreateTypeInstance[<i>productType</i>,<i>field</i><sub>1</sub><i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>field</i><sub>2</sub><i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>] creates an instance of a product type and initializes its fields.

---

CscDegrees
CscDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the cosecant of θ degrees. 

---

CumulativeFeatureImpactPlot
CumulativeFeatureImpactPlot[<i>model</i>,<i>data</i>] plots the cumulative impact of the value of each feature in <i>data</i> on the result of <i>model</i>.

CumulativeFeatureImpactPlot[<i>model</i>] estimates the feature impacts using synthetic data.

CumulativeFeatureImpactPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i>,…] plots only the impact of the specified feature <i>fname</i>.

CumulativeFeatureImpactPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i><i>class</i>,…] plots only the impact on the classification <i>class</i>.

---

DateDistribution
DateDistribution[<i>dist</i>,<i>dunit</i>,<i>dorig</i>] represents a distribution <i>dist</i> of dates with date scale unit <i>dunit</i> and date origin <i>dorig</i>. 

---

DateGranularity
DateGranularity is an option that determines the calendar granularity of generated dates.

---

Decimal
Decimal is a setting for the ColumnAlignments option of GridBox which states that numbers should align along the decimal place.

---

DeclareCompiledComponent
DeclareCompiledComponent["<i>name</i>",<i>decls</i>] adds declarations <i>decls</i> to compiled component <i>"name"</i>.

DeclareCompiledComponent["<i>name</i>",<i>field</i><i>spec</i>] adds the specification <i>spec</i> to the specified field in the compiled component <i>"name"</i>.

---

DeleteAdjacentDuplicates
DeleteAdjacentDuplicates[<i>list</i>] deletes all duplicates in runs of identical elements in <i>list</i>.

DeleteAdjacentDuplicates[<i>list</i>,<i>test</i>] applies <i>test</i> to pairs of consecutive elements to determine whether they should be considered duplicates.

---

DeleteElements
DeleteElements[<i>list</i>,{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes all instances of elements <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>list</i>.

DeleteElements[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes up to <i>n</i> instances of each <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>list</i>.

DeleteElements[<i>list</i>,{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] removes up to <i>n</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> instances of <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> from <i>list</i>.

---

DFixedPoints
DFixedPoints[<i>eqn</i>,<i>x</i>[<i>t</i>],<i>t</i>] gives the fixed points for a differential equation.

DFixedPoints[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>t</i>],<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>t</i>],…},<i>t</i>] gives the fixed points for a system of differential equations.

---

Diff
Diff[<i>first</i>,<i>second</i>] returns a representation of the diffs between <i>first</i> and <i>second</i>.

Diff[<i>first</i>,<i>second</i>,<i>format</i>] represents the diffs in the indicated format.

---

Diff3
Diff3[<i>ancestor</i>,<i>first</i>,<i>second</i>] returns a representation of the three-way diff between <i>ancestor</i> and two independently changed versions of <i>ancestor</i>.

Diff3[<i>ancestor</i>,<i>first</i>,<i>second</i>,<i>format</i>] represents the diffs in the indicated format.

---

DiffApply
DiffApply[<i>diffobj</i>,<i>expr</i>] returns the result of applying the given DiffObject to the expression <i>expr</i>.

DiffApply[<i>diffobj</i>,<i>expr</i>,File["<i>file</i>"]] writes the result of changing <i>expr</i> to <i>file</i>.

---

DiffGranularity
DiffGranularity is an option to Diff and related functions that indicates with what granularity to compare the given expressions.

---

DiffIgnore
DiffIgnore is an option to Diff and related functions that specifies what elements to ignore when computing diffs.

---

DiffIncludeMatches
DiffIncludeMatches is an option for Diff and related functions that specifies whether to include matching data in the resulting DiffObject.

---

DiffInputFunction
DiffInputFunction is an option for Diff and related functions that specifies how the input expressions should be preprocessed.

---

DiffObject
DiffObject[<i>v</i>, <i>type</i>, <i>data</i>] represents a sequence of diffs for transforming objects of the indicated type.

---

DigitSum
DigitSum[<i>n</i>] gives the sum of the decimal digits in the integer <i>n</i>.

DigitSum[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>] gives the sum of the base <i>b</i> digits in the integer <i>n</i>.

DigitSum[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,<i>k</i>] gives the sum of the first <i>k</i> base <i>b</i> digits in the integer <i>n</i>.

DigitSum[<i>n</i>,<i>b</i>,-<i>k</i>] gives the sum of the last <i>k</i> base <i>b</i> digits in the integer <i>n</i>.

DigitSum[<i>n</i>,MixedRadix[<i>blist</i>]] uses the mixed radix with list of bases <i>blist</i>.

---

DiscreteInputOutputModel
DiscreteInputOutputModel[{<i>g</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>n-1</i></sub>},<i>u</i>] represents a discrete-time model with input <i>u</i> and output y=g<sub>i</sub>(u) at sampling instant <i>i</i>.

DiscreteInputOutputModel[{<i>g</i><sub>0</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>g</i><sub><i>n-1</i></sub>},<i>u</i>,<i>y</i>] can be used to specify outputs g<sub>i</sub>(u,y) that also depend on the output variables <i>y</i>.

DiscreteInputOutputModel[…,{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,{…,<i>u</i><sub>10</sub>}},…},{{<i>y</i><sub>1</sub>,{…,<i>y</i><sub>10</sub>}},…}] specifies input and output values for each signal for instants <i>k</i><=0.

---

DownValuesFunction
DownValuesFunction[<i>sym</i>] represents a function that uses definitions attached to <i>sym</i> when compiling.

---

DSolveChangeVariables
DSolveChangeVariables[<i>dsolve</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>t</i>,<i>trans</i>] changes the solution function in <i>dsolve</i> to u(t) using the transformation <i>trans</i>.

DSolveChangeVariables[<i>dsolve</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>u</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>t</i>,<i>trans</i>] changes the solution functions in the system to {u<sub>1</sub>(t),…,u<sub>n</sub>(t)}.

DSolveChangeVariables[<i>dsolve</i>,<i>u</i>,{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>t</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>trans</i>] changes the solution function in the partial differential equation to u(t<sub>1</sub>,…,t<sub>n</sub>).

---

DStabilityConditions
DStabilityConditions[<i>eqn</i>,<i>x</i>[<i>t</i>],<i>t</i>] gives the fixed points and stability conditions for a differential equation.

DStabilityConditions[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>t</i>],<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>t</i>],…},<i>t</i>] gives the fixed points and stability conditions for a system of differential equations.

DStabilityConditions[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>t</i>],<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>t</i>],…},<i>t</i>,{<i>pnt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pnt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the stability conditions for the given fixed points.

---

ElectricCurrentDensityValue
ElectricCurrentDensityValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents a current density boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

ElectricCurrentDensityValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents a current density boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

ElectricCurrentPDEComponent
ElectricCurrentPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields an electric current PDE term with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

ElectricFluxDensityValue
ElectricFluxDensityValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents an electric flux density boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

ElectricFluxDensityValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents an electric flux density boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

ElectricPotentialCondition
ElectricPotentialCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents an electric potential surface boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

ElectricPotentialCondition[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents an electric potential surface boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

ElectricSymmetryValue
ElectricSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] represents an electric symmetry boundary condition for PDEs with predicate <i>pred</i> indicating where it applies, with model variables <i>vars</i> and global parameters <i>pars</i>.

ElectricSymmetryValue[<i>pred</i>,<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>,<i>lkey</i>] represents an electric symmetry boundary condition with local parameters specified in <i>pars[lkey]</i>.

---

ElectrostaticPDEComponent
ElectrostaticPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields an electrostatic PDE term with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

EntityType
EntityType["<i>type</i>"] represents an entity type with the specified name.

EntityType["<i>type</i>"<i>child</i><sub>1</sub><i>child</i><sub>2</sub>…] represents a child entity type of "<i>type</i>".

---

EstimatedPointNormals
EstimatedPointNormals[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] estimates normal vectors for the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,….

EstimatedPointNormals[<i>mreg</i>] estimates normals vectors for the vertices of the mesh region <i>mreg</i>.

---

ExternalOperation
ExternalOperation["Eval","<i>code</i>"] represents an external evaluation of "<i>code</i>".

ExternalOperation["Eval","<i>code</i>",<i>assoc</i>] represents an external evaluation of "<i>code</i>" with parameters given by <i>assoc</i>.

ExternalOperation["Call",<i>func</i>,<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] calls the function <i>func</i> with the given arguments <i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

ExternalOperation["GetAttribute",<i>obj</i>,"<i>attr</i>"] gets the attribute "<i>attr</i>" of <i>obj</i>.

ExternalOperation["SetAttribute",<i>obj</i>,"<i>attr</i>",<i>val</i>] sets the attribute "<i>attr</i>" of <i>obj</i> to the given value <i>val</i>.

ExternalOperation["Cast",<i>obj</i>,"<i>type</i>"] casts <i>obj</i> to the given "<i>type</i>".

ExternalOperation["<i>op</i>", <i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] represents the external operation named "<i>op</i>" using arguments <i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>, <i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>, ….

---

FeatureValueDependencyPlot
FeatureValueDependencyPlot[<i>model</i>,<i>data</i>] plots the dependency of the result of <i>model</i> on the value of a particular feature in <i>data</i>.

FeatureValueDependencyPlot[<i>model</i>] estimates the feature value dependency using synthetic data.

FeatureValueDependencyPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i>,…] plots only the dependency on the specified feature <i>fname</i>.

FeatureValueDependencyPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i><i>class</i>,…] plots only the dependency on the classification <i>class</i>.

---

FeatureValueImpactPlot
FeatureValueImpactPlot[<i>model</i>,<i>data</i>] plots the impact of the value of a given feature in <i>data</i> on the result of <i>model</i>.

FeatureValueImpactPlot[<i>model</i>] estimates the feature value impact using synthetic data.

FeatureValueImpactPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i>,…] plots only the impact of the specified feature <i>fname</i>.

FeatureValueImpactPlot[<i>model</i><i>fname</i><i>class</i>,…] plots only the impact on the classification <i>class</i>.

---

FiniteField
FiniteField[<i>p</i>,<i>d</i>] gives a finite field with p<sup>d</sup> elements.

FiniteField[<i>p</i>,<i>f</i>] gives the finite field <sub>p</sub>[α]/〈f(α)〉, where <i>f</i>(<i>α</i>) is an irreducible polynomial in <sub>p</sub>[α].

FiniteField[<i>p</i>,<i>…</i>,<i>rep</i>] uses field element representation <i>rep</i>, either "Polynomial" or "Exponential".

---

FiniteFieldElementPrimitiveQ
FiniteFieldElementPrimitiveQ[<i>a</i>] tests whether <i>a</i> is a primitive element of its ambient field.

---

FiniteFieldEmbedding
FiniteFieldEmbedding[<i>ff</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ff</i><sub>2</sub>] gives an embedding of the finite field <i>ff</i><sub>1</sub> in the finite field <i>ff</i><sub>2</sub>.

FiniteFieldEmbedding[<i>e</i><sub>1</sub><i>e</i><sub>2</sub>] represents the embedding of the ambient field of <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> in the ambient field of <i>e</i><sub>2</sub>, which maps <i>e</i><sub>1</sub> to <i>e</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

FiniteFieldIndex
FiniteFieldIndex[<i>u</i>] gives the index of the FiniteFieldElement object <i>u</i>.

---

FluidFlowPDEComponent
FluidFlowPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a flow PDE term with variables <i>vars</i> and parameters <i>pars</i>.

---

ForAllType
ForAllType[<i>x</i>,<i>type</i>] represents a type parameterized by <i>x</i>.

ForAllType[<i>x</i>,<i>cond</i>,<i>type</i>] represents a type satisfying <i>cond</i>.

ForAllType[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,…},<i>cond</i>,<i>type</i>] represents a type with multiple parameters.

---

ForeignCallback
ForeignCallback[…] represents a foreign callback that can be called from external libraries.

---

ForeignFunction
ForeignFunction[<i>args</i>] represents a function that has been loaded from a library.

---

ForeignFunctionLoad
ForeignFunctionLoad[<i>lib</i>,<i>fun</i>,{<i>argtype</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>argtype</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>rettype</i>] loads the function <i>fun</i> with the specified argument and output types from the library <i>lib</i>.

ForeignFunctionLoad[<i>ptr</i>,{<i>argtype</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>argtype</i><sub>2</sub>,…}<i>rettype</i>] creates a foreign function from the function pointer <i>ptr</i>.

---

ForeignPointerLookup
ForeignPointerLookup[<i>lib</i>,<i>fun</i>] returns the pointer to the function <i>fun</i> in the library <i>lib</i>.

---

FromFiniteField
FromFiniteField[<i>a</i>,<i>ff</i>] converts the element <i>a</i> of the prime subfield of the finite field <i>ff</i> to an integer.

FromFiniteField[<i>expr</i>,<i>ff</i>,<i>t</i>] converts the elements of the finite field <i>ff</i> in the coefficients of the rational expression <i>expr</i> to polynomials in <i>t</i>, where <i>t</i> represents the field generator.

---

FromFiniteFieldIndex
FromFiniteFieldIndex[<i>ind</i>,<i>ff</i>] gives the element of the finite field <i>ff</i> with index <i>ind</i>.

---

FromLunationNumber
FromLunationNumber[<i>ln</i>] returns the date corresponding to the lunation number <i>ln</i>.

FromLunationNumber[<i>scheme</i>,<i>ln</i>] returns the date corresponding to the lunation number in the given counting <i>scheme</i>.

---

FromRawPointer
FromRawPointer[<i>p</i>] returns the value referred to by the pointer <i>p</i> for use in compiled code.

FromRawPointer[<i>array</i>,<i>offset</i>] returns the value of a C array at an offset. 

---

FullMoon
FullMoon[] gives the date of the next full moon.

FullMoon[<i>date</i>] gives the date of the first full moon after the given <i>date</i>.

---

GraphJoin
GraphJoin[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph join of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

GraphProduct
GraphProduct[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the Cartesian product of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

GraphProduct[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>,"<i>op</i>"] gives the product of type "<i>op</i>" for the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>

---

GraphSum
GraphSum[<i>g</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>g</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the graph sum of the graphs <i>g</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>g</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

GraphTriangleCount
GraphTriangleCount[<i>g</i>] gives the number of triangles in the graph <i>g</i>.

---

Haloing
Haloing[] is a two‐dimensional directive specifying that graphics objects are to be drawn with a halo.

Haloing[<i>col</i>] uses the specified color <i>col</i> for the halo.

Haloing[<i>col</i>,<i>w</i>] uses the specified width <i>w</i> for the halo.

Haloing[<i>col</i>,<i>w</i>,<i>r</i>] applies a blur effect with radius <i>r</i> to the halo.

---

HermitianMatrix
HermitianMatrix[<i>hmat</i>] converts the Hermitian matrix <i>hmat</i> to a structured array.

---

InertEvaluate
InertEvaluate[<i>inertExpr</i>] evaluates an "InertExpression", returning a new "InertExpression" in compiled code.

---

InertExpression
InertExpression[<i>expr</i>] creates an inert expression in compiled code.

---

InscribedBall
InscribedBall[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the largest ball that lies inside the convex hull of the points <i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

IntegrateChangeVariables
IntegrateChangeVariables[<i>integral</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>trans</i>] changes the variable in <i>integral</i> to the new variable <i>u</i> using the transformation <i>trans</i>. 

IntegrateChangeVariables[<i>integral</i>,{<i>u</i>,<i>v</i>,…},<i>trans</i>] changes the variables to the new variables <i>u</i>, <i>v</i>, ….

---

IntermediateTest
IntermediateTest[<i>input</i>] creates an intermediate test to determine whether <i>input</i> evaluates to True.

IntermediateTest[<i>input</i>,<i>expected</i>] creates an intermediate test to determine whether <i>input</i> evaluates to <i>expected</i>.

IntermediateTest[<i>input</i>,<i>expected</i>,<i>messages</i>] creates an intermediate test that is expected to generate the list of message names <i>messages</i>.

---

LayeredGraph
LayeredGraph[<i>g</i>] creates a graph with vertices and edges from the graph <i>g</i> represented as a layered plot.

LayeredGraph[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> represented as a layered plot.

LayeredGraph[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] creates a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LayeredGraph[…,<i>v</i><i>pos</i>] places the dominant vertex <i>v</i> in the plot at position <i>pos</i>.

---

LayeredGraph3D
LayeredGraph3D[<i>g</i>] creates a graph with vertices and edges from the graph <i>g</i> represented as a 3D layered plot.

LayeredGraph3D[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>j</i></sub> represented as a 3D layered plot.

LayeredGraph3D[{…,<i>w</i>[<i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>],…}] creates a graph with edges <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with features defined by the symbolic wrapper <i>w</i>.

LayeredGraph3D[…,<i>v</i><i>pos</i>] places the dominant vertex <i>v</i> in the plot at position <i>pos</i>.

---

LibraryFunctionDeclaration
LibraryFunctionDeclaration["<i>extName</i>",<i>lib</i>,<i>type</i>] represents a function declaration that exposes the library function <i>extName</i> with the type <i>type</i> from the library <i>lib</i>, for use in compiled code.

LibraryFunctionDeclaration[<i>name</i>->"<i>extName</i>",<i>lib</i>,<i>type</i>] aliases the function with <i>name</i> in compiled code.

LibraryFunctionDeclaration[<i>nameSpec</i>,<i>type</i>] assumes that the library will be loaded by the time the function is compiled.

---

LineIntegrate
LineIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>curve</i>] computes the scalar line integral of the function <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] over the <i>curve</i>.

LineIntegrate[{<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>curve</i>] computes the vector line integral of the vector function {<i>p</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>q</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…}.

---

LiteralType
LiteralType[<i>x</i>] represents a literal value <i>x</i> for use as a type.

---

LLMConfiguration
LLMConfiguration[…] represents a configuration for an LLM.

LLMConfiguration[<i>prop</i><i>val</i>] creates a configuration based on $LLMEvaluator with the specified property set to <i>val</i>.

LLMConfiguration[<|<i>prop</i><sub>1</sub>-><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prop</i><sub>2</sub>-><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,...|>] specifies several properties and values.

LLMConfiguration[LLMConfiguration[…],<i>propspec</i>] creates a configuration based on an existing configuration.

---

LLMEvaluator
LLMEvaluator is an option for functions such as LLMSynthesize that specifies the LLM configuration.

---

LLMExampleFunction
LLMExampleFunction[{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub><i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>in</i><sub>2</sub><i>out</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] creates an LLMFunction from few-shot examples.

LLMExampleFunction[{<i>in</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>in</i><sub>2</sub>,…}{<i>out</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>out</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] generates the same result.

LLMExampleFunction[{<i>header</i>,<i>training</i>}] prefaces the prompt with <i>header</i>.

LLMExampleFunction[<i>prompting</i>,<i>form</i>] includes the interpreter <i>form</i> to apply to the response.

---

LLMFunction
LLMFunction[<i>prompt</i>] represents a template for a large language model (LLM) prompt.

LLMFunction[{<i>prompt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>prompt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a combination of multiple prompts.

LLMFunction[<i>prompt</i>,<i>form</i>] includes the interpreter <i>form</i> to apply to the response.

LLMFunction[…][<i>params</i>] give the LLM service response for <i>prompt</i> applied to parameters <i>params</i>.

---

LLMPrompt
LLMPrompt["<i>name</i>"] gives the TemplateObject for the specified large language model prompt.

LLMPrompt[<i>resource</i>] retrieves the TemplateObject for the specified <i>resource</i>.

LLMPrompt[…,<i>params</i>] gives the TemplateObject with slots filled in by <i>params</i>.

LLMPrompt[…][<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>p</i><sub>2</sub>,…] applies a template with numbered slots to parameter values <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LLMPrompt[…][<i>key</i><sub>1</sub><i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>key</i><sub>2</sub><i>p</i><sub>2</sub>] applies a template with named slots to parameter data.

---

LLMPromptGenerator
LLMPromptGenerator[<i>f</i>] represents a prompt generator that uses the function <i>f</i>.

LLMPromptGenerator[<i>f</i>,<i>inputspec</i>] provides the specified <i>inputspec</i> to <i>f</i>.

---

LLMResourceFunction
LLMResourceFunction["<i>name</i>"] retrieves an LLMFunction with the specified name.

LLMResourceFunction[<i>loc</i>] imports an LLMFunction from the specified location.

LLMResourceFunction[…][<i>params</i>] applies the specified LLMFunction to the parameters <i>params</i>.

---

LLMSynthesize
LLMSynthesize[<i>prompt</i>] generates text according to the input <i>prompt</i>.

LLMSynthesize[{<i>prompt</i><sub>1</sub>,…}] combines multiple <i>prompt</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> together.

LLMSynthesize[…,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property of the generated text.

---

LoadCompiledComponent
LoadCompiledComponent[<i>comp</i>] loads a compiled component <i>comp</i>.

LoadCompiledComponent[<i>comp</i>,<i>target</i>] loads a compiled component <i>comp</i> from the target location.

---

LocalEvaluate
LocalEvaluate[<i>expr</i>] gives the result of evaluating <i>expr</i> using your current default local Wolfram Language kernel.

LocalEvaluate[<i>ker, expr</i>] gives the result of evaluating <i>expr</i> using the kernel specified by <i>ker</i>.

LocalEvaluate[{<i>ker</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ker</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>expr</i>] gives a list of the results of evaluating <i>expr</i> using each of the kernels <i>ker</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

LocalEvaluate[<i>ker</i>,<i>expr</i>,<i>h</i>] wraps the head <i>h</i> around the result produced before returning it.

---

LowerTriangularMatrix
LowerTriangularMatrix[<i>lmat</i>] converts the lower triangular matrix <i>lmat</i> to a structured array.

---

LunationNumber
LunationNumber[] returns the number of new moons since the first new moon of the year 2000.

LunationNumber[<i>date</i>] returns the number of new moons since the given <i>date</i>.

LunationNumber[<i>scheme</i>,<i>date</i>] returns the number of new moons since the zeroth new moon of the given counting <i>scheme</i>.

---

MapApply
<i>f</i>@@@<i>expr</i> or MapApply[<i>f</i>,<i>expr</i>] replaces heads at level 1 of <i>expr</i> by <i>f</i>.

MapApply[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of MapApply that can be applied to an expression.

---

MatrixSymbol
MatrixSymbol[<i>a</i>] represents a matrix with name <i>a</i>.

MatrixSymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>}] represents an <i>m</i><i>n</i> matrix.

MatrixSymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>},<i>dom</i>] represents a matrix with elements in the domain <i>dom</i>.

MatrixSymbol[<i>a</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>},<i>dom</i>, <i>sym</i>] represents a matrix with the symmetry <i>sym</i>.

---

MaxRoots
MaxRoots is an option for NSolve and related functions that specifies the maximum number of roots that should be returned in the solution for a system of algebraic or transcendental equations.

---

MinSize
MinSize is an option of certain BoxForm primitives.

---

ModelPredictiveController
ModelPredictiveController[<i>sspec</i>,<i>cost</i>,<i>cons</i>] computes the model predictive controller for the system specification <i>sspec</i> that minimizes the cost function <i>cost</i> and satisfies the constraints <i>cons</i>.

ModelPredictiveController[…,"<i>prop</i>"] returns the value of the property "<i>prop</i>".

---

MoonPhaseDate
MoonPhaseDate[] returns the date of the next new moon.

MoonPhaseDate[<i>phase</i>] returns the date of the next instance of the given <i>phase</i> of the Moon.

MoonPhaseDate[<i>date</i>,<i>phase</i>] returns the date for the first instance of the given <i>phase</i> after <i>date</i>.

---

NCaputoD
NCaputoD[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,α},<i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub></i>] gives a numerical approximation to the Caputo fractional derivative <sup>C</sup><sub>0</sub>D<sub>x</sub><sup>α</sup>f(x) of order α of the function <i>f</i> at the point <i><i>x</i><sub>0</sub></i>.

---

NContourIntegrate
NContourIntegrate[<i>f</i>,<i>z∈cont</i>] gives the numerical integral of <i>f</i> along the contour defined by <i>cont</i> in the complex plane.

---

NetExternalObject
NetExternalObject[…] represents a net model in an external framework format.

---

NewMoon
NewMoon[] gives the date of the next new moon.

NewMoon[<i>date</i>] gives the date of the first new moon after the given <i>date</i>.

---

NLineIntegrate
NLineIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>curve</i>] computes the numerical scalar line integral of the function <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] over the <i>curve</i>.

NLineIntegrate[{<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>curve</i>] computes the numerical vector line integral of the vector function {<i>p</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>q</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…}.

---

NominalScale
NominalScale[{<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cat</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a set of unordered categories <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>. 

NominalScale[<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub><i>lab</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>lab</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>|>] also associates the category <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with the labels <i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NominalScale[…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…|>] uses <i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to represent <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in plots.

NominalScale[Automatic] automatically determines the categories.

---

NoneMatch
NoneMatch[{<i>e</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>e</i><sub>2</sub>,…},<i>form</i>] yields True if <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> does not match the pattern <i>form</i> for any of the <i>e</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

NoneMatch[<i>expr</i>,<i>form</i>,<i>level</i>] tests parts of <i>expr</i> at level <i>level</i>.

NoneMatch[<i>form</i>] represents an operator form of NoneMatch that can be applied to an expression.

---

NonThreadable
NonThreadable is an attribute that can be assigned to a symbol <i>f</i> to indicate that <i>f</i> and f[<i>arg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>arg</i><sub>2</sub>,…] should not combine with other list arguments in arithmetic and many other functions that work with lists.

---

NSurfaceIntegrate
NSurfaceIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>surface</i>] computes the numerical scalar surface integral of the function <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] over the <i>surface</i>.

NSurfaceIntegrate[{<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>surface</i>] computes the numerical vector surface integral of the vector field {<i>p</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>q</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…}.

---

NullRawPointerQ
NullRawPointerQ[<i>ptr</i>] gives True if <i>ptr</i> is a null pointer, and False otherwise.

---

OpaqueRawPointer
OpaqueRawPointer[<i>addr</i>] represents an untyped pointer to the memory address <i>addr</i>.

---

OperationDeclaration
OperationDeclaration[<i>type</i>,<i>op</i>,<i>typedfun</i>] declares a typed function to be used for the operation <i>op</i> of <i>type</i>.

---

OrdinalScale
OrdinalScale[{<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>cat</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] represents a set of ordered categories <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with order <i>cat</i><sub>1</sub><<i>cat</i><sub>2</sub><…<<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>.

OrdinalScale[{<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] associates the category <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with the numeric value <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

OrdinalScale[<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub><i>val</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>|>] also associates the category <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> with the numeric value <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

OrdinalScale[<i>{<i>cat</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}</i>,<i>vals</i>,{<i>lab</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>lab</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] displays the category <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> as the corresponding <i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> when used as a label in plots etc.

OrdinalScale[…,<i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub><i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>,…|>] uses <i>lab</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to represent <i>cat</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> in plots.

---

OrthogonalMatrix
OrthogonalMatrix[<i>omat</i>] converts the orthogonal matrix <i>omat</i> to a structured array.

---

PairwiseDensityHistogram
PairwiseDensityHistogram[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] creates an array of density histograms by plotting the data columns against each other in pairs.

PairwiseDensityHistogram[<i>data</i>,<i>bpsec</i>] plots density histograms with bins specified by <i>bspec</i>.

---

PairwiseListPlot
PairwiseListPlot[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] creates an array of scatter plots by plotting the data columns against each other in pairs.

PairwiseListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots multiple sets of data in each plot panel.

---

PairwiseProbabilityPlot
PairwiseProbabilityPlot[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] plots a CDF of columns in the data against each other.

---

PairwiseQuantilePlot
PairwiseQuantilePlot[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] creates an array of quantile plots by plotting the quantiles of the columns against each other.

---

PairwiseSmoothDensityHistogram
PairwiseSmoothDensityHistogram[{{<i>y</i><sub>11</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub>1<i>n</i></sub>},…,{<i>y</i><sub><i>m</i>1</sub>,…,<i>y</i><sub><i>mn</i></sub>}}] creates an array of smooth density histograms by plotting the data columns against each other in pairs.

---

ParentEdgeLabel
ParentEdgeLabel is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies what labels should be used for edges.

---

ParentEdgeLabelFunction
ParentEdgeLabelFunction is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies functions to use to generate edge labels.

---

ParentEdgeShapeFunction
ParentEdgeShapeFunction is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies a function to use to generate primitives for rendering edges.

---

PascalBinomial
PascalBinomial[<i>n</i>,<i>m</i>] gives the binomial coefficient (�) that preserves Pascal's identity.

---

PermutationMatrix
PermutationMatrix[<i>permv</i>] represents the permutation matrix given by permutation vector <i>permv</i> as a structured array.

PermutationMatrix[<i>pmat</i>] converts a permutation matrix <i>pmat</i> to a structured array. 

---

PhongShading
PhongShading[] is a three‐dimensional graphics directive that specifies that faces of polygons and other filled graphics objects are to be drawn to reflect as a smooth surface using a normal‐vector interpolation shading.

PhongShading[<i>d</i>] uses the attenuation factor <i>d</i> for the diffuse light.

PhongShading[<i>d</i>,<i>s</i>] uses the attenuation factor <i>s</i> for the specular light.

PhongShading[<i>d</i>,<i>s</i>,<i>a</i>] uses the attenuation factor <i>a</i> for the ambient light.

---

PlotHighlighting
PlotHighlighting is an option to Plot, ListPlot and related visualization functions that specifies how points and curves should be highlighted. 

---

PolarCurve
PolarCurve[<i>r</i>,{θ,θ<sub><i>min</i></sub>,θ<sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a polar curve with radius <i>r</i> as a function of angle θ.

---

PositionLargest
PositionLargest[<i>list</i>] gives the positions of the numerically largest value in <i>list</i>.

PositionLargest[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the first <i>n</i> largest values.

PositionLargest[<i>list,n,orderfun</i>] gives the positions of the <i>n</i> largest values in <i>list</i> as determined by <i>orderfun</i>.

---

PositionSmallest
PositionSmallest[<i>list</i>] gives the positions of the numerically smallest value in <i>list</i>.

PositionSmallest[<i>list</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the positions of the first <i>n</i> smallest values.

PositionSmallest[<i>list,n,orderfun</i>] gives the positions of the <i>n</i> smallest values in <i>list</i> as determined by <i>orderfun</i>.

---

PropagateAborts
PropagateAborts is an option to CheckAbort to control whether a handled abort propagates to the enclosing function.

---

QuestionGenerator
QuestionGenerator[<|<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>:><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>2</sub>:><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,…|>, <i>genfunc</i>] represents a QuestionObject generated by applying <i>genfunc</i> to <i>name</i><sub>1</sub>:><i>val</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>name</i><sub>1</sub>:><i>val</i><sub>2</sub>,….

QuestionGenerator[CloudObject[…]] represents a cloud-deployed question generator.

---

QuestionSelector
QuestionSelector[{<i>qo</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>qo</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents a list of questions from which one of the question objects <i>qo</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> can be randomly selected.

QuestionSelector[CloudObject[…]] represents a cloud-deployed question selector.

---

RandomDate
RandomDate[] gives a pseudorandom date in the current calendar year.

RandomDate[{<i>date</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>date</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom date between the dates <i><i>date</i><sub><i>min</i></sub></i> and <i><i>date</i><sub><i>max</i></sub></i>.

RandomDate[<i>date</i>] gives a pseudorandom date between the start and end of the calendar period <i>date</i>.

RandomDate[<i>quantity</i>] gives a pseudorandom date between now and the time <i>quantity</i> duration from now.

RandomDate[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom dates.

---

RandomTime
RandomTime[] gives a pseudorandom time of day.

RandomTime[{<i>time</i><sub><i>min</i></sub>,<i>time</i><sub><i>max</i></sub>}] gives a pseudorandom time between the times <i>time<sub><i>min</i></sub></i> and <i>time<sub><i>max</i></sub></i>.

RandomTime[<i>time</i>] gives a pseudorandom times between the start and end of the time period <i>time</i>.

RandomTime[<i>quantity</i>] gives a pseudorandom time between now and the time <i>quantity</i> duration from now.

RandomTime[<i>range</i>,<i>n</i>] gives a list of <i>n</i> pseudorandom times.

---

RawMemoryAllocate
RawMemoryAllocate[<i>type</i>] allocates enough raw memory to store a binary representation of the specified type.

RawMemoryAllocate[<i>type</i>,<i>len</i>] allocates memory for <i>len</i> objects.

---

RawMemoryExport
RawMemoryExport[<i>expr</i>] exports a raw memory representation of <i>expr</i>.

RawMemoryExport[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>] uses the specified element type when returning an array.

---

RawMemoryFree
RawMemoryFree[<i>ptr</i>] frees the raw memory at a pointer <i>ptr</i>.

---

RawMemoryImport
RawMemoryImport[<i>ptr</i>,<i>format</i>] imports raw memory from the pointer <i>ptr</i> with the specified format.

RawMemoryImport[<i>format</i>] represents an operator form of RawMemoryImport that can be applied to an expression.

---

RawMemoryRead
RawMemoryRead[<i>ptr</i>] reads raw memory from the pointer <i>ptr</i>.

RawMemoryRead[<i>ptr</i>,<i>offset</i>] reads from an offset pointer.

---

RawMemoryWrite
RawMemoryWrite[<i>ptr</i>,<i>val</i>] writes a binary representation of <i>val</i> to the raw memory at the pointer <i>ptr</i>.

RawMemoryWrite[<i>ptr</i>,<i>val</i>,<i>offset</i>] writes to an offset pointer.

---

RawPointer
RawPointer[<i>addr</i>,<i>type</i>] represents a raw pointer to the specified <i>type</i> at the memory address <i>addr</i>.

---

RealValuedNumberQ
RealValuedNumberQ[<i>expr</i>] returns True if <i>expr</i> is a number with a real value and False otherwise.

---

RealValuedNumericQ
RealValuedNumericQ[<i>expr</i>] gives True if <i>expr</i> is a real-valued numeric quantity, and False otherwise.

---

ReapVideo
ReapVideo[<i>expr</i>] gives a video whose frames are the expressions to which SowVideo has been applied during its evaluation.

---

ReconstructionMesh
ReconstructionMesh[{<i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] reconstructs a mesh from a set of points <i>pt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pt</i><sub>2</sub>,….

---

RegionFarthestDistance
RegionFarthestDistance[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the farthest distance between points in the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

RegionHausdorffDistance
RegionHausdorffDistance[<i>reg</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>] gives the Hausdorff distance between the regions <i>reg</i><sub>1</sub> and <i>reg</i><sub>2</sub>.

---

ReplaceAt
ReplaceAt[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,<i>n</i>] transforms <i>expr</i> by replacing the <i>n</i><sup>th</sup> element using <i>rules</i>.

ReplaceAt[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,{<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}] replaces the part of <i>expr</i> at position {<i>i</i>,<i>j</i>,…}.

ReplaceAt[<i>expr</i>,<i>rules</i>,{{<i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,…},{<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…},…}] replaces parts at several positions.

ReplaceAt[<i>rules</i>,<i>pos</i>] represents an operator form of ReplaceAt that can be applied to an expression.

---

ResidueSum
ResidueSum[<i>f</i>,<i>z</i>] finds the sum of residues of the meromorphic function <i>f</i> with the variable <i>z</i>.

ResidueSum[{<i>f</i>,<i>cons</i>},<i>z</i>] finds the sum of residues of <i>f</i> within the solution set of the constraints <i>cons</i>. 

---

RFixedPoints
RFixedPoints[<i>eqn</i>,<i>a</i>[<i>n</i>],<i>n</i>] gives the fixed points for a recurrence equation.

RFixedPoints[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>n</i>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>n</i>],…},<i>n</i>] gives the fixed points for a system of recurrence equations.

---

RootTree
RootTree[<i>tree</i>] returns the root node of <i>tree</i> as a Tree object.

RootTree[<i>tree</i>,<i>n</i>] returns a Tree object containing the nodes of <i>tree</i> down to level <i>n</i>.

---

RStabilityConditions
RStabilityConditions[<i>eqn</i>,<i>a</i>[<i>n</i>],<i>n</i>] gives the fixed points and stability conditions for a recurrence equation.

RStabilityConditions[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>n</i>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>n</i>],…},<i>n</i>] gives the fixed points and stability conditions for a system of recurrence equations.

RStabilityConditions[{<i>eqn</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>eqn</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{<i>a</i><sub>1</sub>[<i>n</i>],<i>a</i><sub>2</sub>[<i>n</i>],…},<i>n</i>,{<i>pnt</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>pnt</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives stability conditions only for the given fixed points.

---

SameAs
SameAs[<i>y</i>] is an operator form that yields <i>x</i>===<i>y</i> when applied to an expression <i>x</i>.

---

SamplerModel
SamplerModel[] represents the single-input, single-output model of a sampler.

SamplerModel[<i>specs</i>] represents a sampler with specification <i>specs</i>.

---

SchrodingerPDEComponent
SchrodingerPDEComponent[<i>vars</i>,<i>pars</i>] yields a Schrödinger PDE term with model variables <i>vars</i> and model parameters <i>pars</i>. 

---

SecDegrees
SecDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the secant of θ degrees. 

---

SemanticSearch
SemanticSearch[<i>index</i>,<i>query</i>] finds the items similar to <i>query</i> inside <i>index</i>.

SemanticSearch[<i>index</i>,<i>query</i>-><i>f</i>] filters the results using the function <i>f</i>.

SemanticSearch[<i>index</i>,<i>query</i>,<i>prop</i>] returns the specified property <i>prop</i>.

---

SemanticSearchIndex
SemanticSearchIndex[…] represents a semantic search index object.

SemanticSearchIndex[<i>source</i>] attempts to recreate a SemanticSearchIndex from <i>source</i>.

---

SemanticSearchIndices
SemanticSearchIndices[] returns a list with all the known instances of SemanticSearchIndex.

SemanticSearchIndices[<i>patt</i>] returns a list of indices with the name matching the pattern <i>patt</i>.

---

SequenceType
SequenceType[<i>var</i>] represents a type parameterized by <i>var</i> that refers to a sequence of zero or more types.

---

ShowContents
ShowContents is an option for selections that specifies whether an object represented by a StyleBox should be displayed on the screen or replaced by blank space.

---

SinDegrees
SinDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the sine of θ degrees. 

---

SowVideo
SowVideo[<i>frame</i>] specifies that <i>frame</i> should be collected by the nearest enclosing ReapVideo.

SowVideo[<i>frame</i>,<i>n</i>] repeats frame <i>n</i> times when reaped.

---

SpellingOptions
SpellingOptions is an option for notebooks that specifies settings for spellchecking.

---

SphericalAngle
SphericalAngle[<i>{θ<sub>0</sub>,ϕ<sub>0</sub>}</i>{{θ<sub>1</sub>,ϕ<sub>1</sub>},{θ<sub>2</sub>,ϕ<sub>2</sub>}}] gives the signed angle in radians between the great circles through point <i>{θ<sub>0</sub>,ϕ<sub>0</sub>}</i> and points <i>{θ<sub>1</sub>,ϕ<sub>1</sub>}</i> and <i>{θ<sub>2</sub>,ϕ<sub>2</sub>}</i>.

SphericalAngle[<i>p</i>{<i>q</i>,<i>r</i>}] gives the unsigned angle for points <i>p</i>, <i>q</i>, <i>r</i> of the form {θ<sub>1</sub>,θ<sub>2</sub>,…,θ<sub><i>n-1</i></sub>,ϕ} on an <i>n</i>-dimensional hypersphere.

SphericalAngle[<i>p</i>{{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>q</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] gives a list of angles between the great circles from point <i>p</i> through points <i>q</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

SphericalAngle[{<i>p</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>p</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}{{<i>q</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>r</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>q</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>r</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] gives a list of angles between the great circles from point <i>p</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> through points <i>q</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> and <i>r</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SphericalDistance
SphericalDistance[{θ<sub>1</sub>,ϕ<sub>1</sub>},{θ<sub>2</sub>,ϕ<sub>2</sub>}] returns the great-circle distance between points {θ<sub>1</sub>,ϕ<sub>1</sub>} and {θ<sub>2</sub>,ϕ<sub>2</sub>} on the surface of a unit sphere. 

SphericalDistance[{θ<sub>1,1</sub>,θ<sub>1,2</sub>,…,ϕ<sub>1</sub>},{θ<sub>2,1</sub>,θ<sub>2,2</sub>,…,ϕ<sub>2</sub>}] returns the geodesic distance between arbitrary-dimensional points on the surface of a unit hypersphere. 

---

Squiggled
Squiggled[<i>expr</i>] displays <i>expr</i> with text underlined with a squiggly red underline.

Squiggled[<i>expr</i>,<i>color</i>] displays squiggly using the specified color.

---

StatusArea
StatusArea[<i>expr</i>,<i>string</i>] displays <i>string</i> in the status area of the current notebook when the mouse pointer is in the region where <i>expr</i> appears. 

---

StringApply
StringApply[<i>f</i>,<i>string</i>] applies <i>f</i> to the code points in <i>string</i>.

StringApply[<i>f</i>] represents an operator form of StringApply that can be applied to an expression.

---

Struckthrough
Struckthrough represents a font with a strike-through line.

---

SurdForm
SurdForm is an option to RadicalBox and SqrtBox that indicates whether the radical represents a Surd expression.

---

SurfaceIntegrate
SurfaceIntegrate[<i>f</i>,{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>surface</i>] computes the scalar surface integral of the function <i>f</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…] over the <i>surface</i>.

SurfaceIntegrate[{<i>p</i>,<i>q</i>,…},{<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…}∈<i>surface</i>] computes the vector surface integral of the vector field {<i>p</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],<i>q</i>[<i>x</i>,<i>y</i>,…],…}.

---

SymbolicDeltaProductArray
SymbolicDeltaProductArray[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…},{{<i>j</i><sub>1,1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>1,2</sub>,…},{<i>j</i><sub>2,1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2,2</sub>,…},…}] represents an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array with elements <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…</sub> equal to 1 if all <i>i</i><sub><i>j</i><sub>p,1</sub></sub><i>i</i><sub><i>j</i><sub>p,2</sub></sub>…, and 0 otherwise.

---

SymbolicIdentityArray
SymbolicIdentityArray[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×…×<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array with elements <i>a</i><sub><i>i</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>i</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>j</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>j</i><sub>2</sub>,…</sub> equal to 1 if all <i>i</i><sub><i>k</i></sub><i>j</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>, and 0 otherwise.

---

SymbolicOnesArray
SymbolicOnesArray[] represents an array of ones with unspecified dimensions.

SymbolicOnesArray[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of ones.

---

SymbolicZerosArray
SymbolicZerosArray[] represents an array of zeros with unspecified dimensions.

SymbolicZerosArray[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] represents an <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×… array of zeros.

---

SymmetricDifference
SymmetricDifference[<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…] gives the symmetric difference of the lists <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

SymmetricMatrix
SymmetricMatrix[<i>smat</i>] converts the symmetric matrix <i>smat</i> to a structured array.

---

TanDegrees
TanDegrees[<i>θ</i>] gives the tangent of θ degrees. 

---

TargetStructure
TargetStructure is an option for linear algebra functions that specifies the representation of the result produced by the function.

---

TerminatedEvaluation
TerminatedEvaluation["<i>reason</i>"] represents an expression whose evaluation overran global kernel session limits and was terminated.

---

TernaryListPlot
TernaryListPlot[{{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>v</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>w</i><sub>1</sub>},…,{<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>v</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>,<i>w</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}}] plots a list of points with specified <i>u</i>, <i>v</i> and <i>w</i> coordinates in a barycentric coordinate system.

TernaryListPlot[{<i>data</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>data</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] plots a ternary plot with several datasets <i>data</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

TernaryPlotCorners
TernaryPlotCorners is an option for TernaryListPlot that determines how the triangle and axes are positioned.

---

Threaded
Threaded[<i>list</i>] is an object whose elements will automatically be threaded into the lowest level of an array when used in a listable operation such as Plus.

<i>a</i>+Threaded[<i>b</i>] adds elements of an array <i>b</i> to elements of an array <i>a</i> at the lowest possible level.

<i>a</i>+Threaded[<i>b</i>,<i>alev</i>] adds elements at level <i>alev</i> of <i>a</i>.

<i>a</i>+Threaded[<i>b</i>,<i>blev</i><i>alev</i>] adds elements at level <i>alev</i> in <i>a</i> to level <i>blev</i> in <i>b</i>.

<i>f</i>[<i>a</i>,Threaded[<i>b</i>,…]] combines elements for a function <i>f</i> with the attribute Listable.

---

TimeDistribution
TimeDistribution[<i>dist</i>,<i>tunit</i>] represents a linear distribution of time of day according to <i>dist</i> with time scale unit <i>tunit</i> originating at midnight.

TimeDistribution[<i>dist</i>, <i>tunit</i>, <i>torig</i>] represents a linear distribution of time of day with time origin at <i>torig</i>.

---

ToFiniteField
ToFiniteField[<i>k</i>,<i>ff</i>] converts the integer <i>k</i> to an element of the prime subfield of the finite field <i>ff</i>.

ToFiniteField[<i>expr</i>,<i>ff</i>] converts the coefficients of the rational expression <i>expr</i> to elements of the finite field <i>ff</i>.

ToFiniteField[<i>expr</i><i>,</i><i>ff</i>,<i>t</i>] converts the coefficients of the rational expression <i>expr</i> to elements of the finite field <i>ff</i>, with <i>t</i> representing the field generator.

---

ToRawPointer
ToRawPointer[] creates a new pointer object in compiled code, suitable for use with external libraries.

ToRawPointer[<i>val</i>] creates a new object pointing to the initial value <i>val</i>.

ToRawPointer[<i>p</i>,<i>val</i>] stores <i>val</i> in the pointer <i>p</i>.

ToRawPointer[<i>array</i>,<i>offset</i>,<i>val</i>] stores <i>val</i> in the "CArray" <i>array</i> at the given offset.

---

TorusGraph
TorusGraph[{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub>}] gives the <i>k</i>-dimensional torus graph with <i>n</i><sub>1</sub>×<i>n</i><sub>2</sub>×…×<i>n</i><sub><i>k</i></sub> vertices.

---

Tour3DVideo
Tour3DVideo[<i>g</i>] generates a video giving a standard tour around a 3D object <i>g</i>. 

Tour3DVideo[<i>g</i>,<i>tour</i>] generates the named video <i>tour</i>.

Tour3DVideo[<i>g</i>,<i>steps</i>] generates a video tour from <i>steps</i>. 

---

TreeElementCoordinates
TreeElementCoordinates is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies the coordinates to use to place the center of subtree elements.

---

TreeElementLabelFunction
TreeElementLabelFunction is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies functions to use to generate subtree element labels.

---

TreeElementShape
TreeElementShape is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies what graphics should be used for subtree elements.

---

TreeElementShapeFunction
TreeElementShapeFunction is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies a function to use to generate primitives for rendering subtree elements.

---

TreeElementSize
TreeElementSize is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies what size should be used for subtree elements.

---

TreeElementSizeFunction
TreeElementSizeFunction is an option for Tree and related functions that specifies a function to use to generate sizes for subtree elements.

---

TreeLeafCount
TreeLeafCount[<i>tree</i>] gives the number of leaves of <i>tree</i>.

---

TruncateSum
TruncateSum[<i>sexpr</i>,<i>n</i>] truncates each Sum in <i>sexpr</i> to have at most <i>n</i> terms. 

TruncateSum[<i>sexpr</i>,{<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,…}] truncates each multiple Sum in <i>sexpr</i> using the iterative specification {<i>m</i>,<i>n</i>,…}.

---

TypeEvaluate
TypeEvaluate[<i>expr</i>] represents a type created by evaluating <i>expr</i>.

---

TypeHint
TypeHint[<i>expr</i>,<i>type</i>] represents an expression of a specified type when compiled and gives <i>expr</i> when evaluated.

---

TypeOf
TypeOf[<i>expr</i>] gives the type of <i>expr</i> without evaluating it.

TypeOf[<i>expr</i>,Typed[<i>x</i>,<i>ty</i>]] assumes that instances of <i>x</i> in <i>expr</i> have type <i>ty</i>.

TypeOf[<i>expr</i>,{Typed[<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>ty</i><sub>1</sub>],Typed[<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,<i>ty</i><sub>2</sub>],…}] assumes that <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> has type <i>ty</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

TypeOf[<i>expr</i>,<i>decls</i>] uses declarations <i>decls</i>.

---

UnilateralConvolve
UnilateralConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>u</i>,<i>t</i>] gives the unilateral convolution with respect to <i>u</i> of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>.

UnilateralConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>u</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>u</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},{<i>t</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>t</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional unilateral convolution.

---

UnilateralDiscreteConvolve
UnilateralDiscreteConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,<i>k</i>,<i>n</i>] gives the unilateral discrete convolution with respect to <i>k</i> of the expressions <i>f</i> and <i>g</i>.

UnilateralDiscreteConvolve[<i>f</i>,<i>g</i>,{<i>k</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>k</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>},{<i>n</i><sub>1</sub>,…,<i>n</i><sub><i>p</i></sub>}] gives the multidimensional unilateral discrete convolution.

---

UniqueElements
UniqueElements[{<i>list</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>list</i><sub>2</sub>,…}] gives the elements for each <i>list</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> that are not in any other list.

UniqueElements[<i>lists</i>,<i>test</i>] uses <i>test</i> to determine whether pairs of elements should be considered equivalent.

---

UnitaryMatrix
UnitaryMatrix[<i>umat</i>] converts the unitary matrix <i>umat</i> to a structured array.

---

UnlabeledTree
UnlabeledTree[<i>tree</i>] returns a tree of the same shape as <i>tree</i> in which the nodes and edges are displayed without labels.

---

UnmanageObject
UnmanageObject[<i>man</i>] takes ownership of memory wrapped in a managed object.

---

Until
Until[<i>test</i>,<i>body</i>] evaluates <i>body</i> and then <i>test</i>, repetitively, until <i>test</i> first gives True.

---

UpdateSemanticSearchIndex
UpdateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>index</i>,<i>source</i>] updates the SemanticSearchIndex[…] <i>index</i> with the data in <i>source</i>.

UpdateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>index</i>,{<i>source</i><sub>1</sub>, …}] updates the SemanticSearchIndex[…] <i>index</i> with the collection of sources <i>source</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

UpdateSemanticSearchIndex[<i>index</i>,{<i>source</i><sub>1</sub>  <i>val</i><sub>1</sub>, …}] associates the new source <i>source</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> to the value <i>val</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

---

UpperTriangularMatrix
UpperTriangularMatrix[<i>umat</i>] converts the upper triangular matrix <i>umat</i> to a structured array.

---

VandermondeMatrix
VandermondeMatrix[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>}] gives an <i>n</i>×<i>n</i> Vandermonde matrix corresponding to the nodes <i>x</i><sub><i>i</i></sub>.

VandermondeMatrix[{<i>x</i><sub>1</sub>,<i>x</i><sub>2</sub>,…,<i>x</i><sub><i>n</i></sub>},<i>k</i>] gives an <i>n</i>×<i>k</i> Vandermonde matrix.

VandermondeMatrix[<i>vmat</i>] converts a Vandermonde matrix <i>vmat</i> to a structured array. 

---

VectorSymbol
VectorSymbol[<i>v</i>] represents a vector with name <i>v</i>.

VectorSymbol[<i>v</i>,<i>d</i>] represents a vector of length <i>d</i>.

VectorSymbol[<i>v</i>,<i>d</i>,<i>dom</i>] represents a vector with elements in the domain <i>dom</i>.

---

VideoExtractTracks
VideoExtractTracks[<i>video</i>] returns a list of video, audio and subtitle tracks of <i>video</i>.

VideoExtractTracks[<i>video</i>,"<i>type</i>"] returns tracks from <i>video</i> of a given "<i>type</i>".

VideoExtractTracks[<i>video</i>,<i>trackspec</i>] returns tracks specified by <i>trackspec</i>.

---

VideoFrameFold
VideoFrameFold[<i>f</i>,<i>img<sub>0</sub></i>,<i>video</i>] gives a video whose frames are {<i>f</i>[<i>img<sub>0</sub></i>,<i>img</i><sub>1</sub>], <i>f</i>[<i>f</i>[<i>img<sub>0</sub></i>,<i>img</i><sub>1</sub>],<i>img</i><sub>2</sub>],…}, where <i>img</i><sub><i>i</i></sub> are frames of <i>video</i>.

VideoFrameFold[<i>f</i>,<i>video</i>] assumes the first frame to be the initial frame.

VideoFrameFold[<i>f</i>,<i>img<sub>0</sub></i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>] uses partitions of <i>n</i> frames of the video for each step.

VideoFrameFold[<i>f</i>,<i>img<sub>0</sub></i>,<i>video</i>,<i>n</i>,<i>d</i>] uses partitions of <i>n</i> frames with offset of <i>d</i> frames for each step.

---

VideoPadding
VideoPadding is an option for GridVideo and other video functions to specify how to pad video frames when input videos have different durations.

---

VideoSummaryPlot
VideoSummaryPlot[<i>video</i>] plots a summary of video and audio tracks of <i>video</i>.

VideoSummaryPlot[<i>video</i>,<i>layout</i>] lays out the video frames according to the provided <i>layout</i>.

---

VideoTranscribe
VideoTranscribe[<i>video</i>] recognizes speech in an audio track and adds it to <i>video</i> as a subtitle track.
